description:
Great, great steakhouse!! It was my friends birthday  dinner and he selected Ruth Chris steakhouse. Since there was 13 of us, we had a prix fix menu and contract. We needed a minimum amount to spend. This of course is done for large groups. My friend selected a menu from the options given. 

When we sat down, we were served with cheese and fruit platter, then soup/salad, appetisers and your main course with side options. There was so much food, a lot of us could not finish our meal. Including alcohol and gratuity, it was about  $170 per person. Considering the cost and amount of food, this was a great option and everyone agreed. 

The fruits and cheese platter were fresh, crisp and cheese was flavourful. I opted for the lobster bisque instead of salad. My soup was creamy and great. A friend had the salad and her only complaint was too much dressing.

The appetisers were crab cakes and shrimp. The crab cakes were delicious chunks of crab  and prepared unlike any other crab cakes I've had. Very flavourful and minimal (not sure if any) bread crumbs. The  shrimp platter was also amazing. The shrimp must have been jumbo, since they were so huge. Seared ahi tuna was great and seasoned perfectly! 

Onto the main plates! I opted for the filet mignon, which came out piping hot and medium rare. Outside was nice dark,  crispy, caramelised colour, while inside was nice pinkish and juicy.  I had it without any sauce and the taste was flavourful. Others opted for surf and turf, which came with two good sized lobster tails and smaller cut of filet. Done with gargantuan appetite, had the cowboy cut steak.....which in itself is a monstrous piece of steak. Salmon filet dinner also looked delicious. 

Our side dishes included mashed potatoes and asparagus. Both were very delicious. 

DESSERT was amazing!!!! I had chocolate molten lava cakes which was intense, rich dark chocolate (recommend with coffee) and others had the crème brûlée!

Restaurant has a full bar, drinks are delicious and reasonably priced. 

Ambiance is classy, upscale steakhouse with fun, relaxed atmosphere. Interior walls are wood and have that "old San Francisco" feel. Staff was super nice and very attentive! It is a nicer restaurant, so business casual attire at a minimum is suggested. 

Parking is street parking with meters, however valet is offered. I suggest if you're near in SF to take taxi or ride share. 

Definitely a place for a great time with friends/family.
author: Albie E.

description:
I was really excited to try this steakhouse after all the positive things I've heard about it, but it didn't live up to any expectations. 

To start off, we ordered the Caesar Salad and wow, that salad was DRENCHED in sauce. This may be a personal preference kind of thing but if you like your salads on the less dressy side, don't get the Caesar.

The steak, however, was my main heartache. I ordered my 6oz. filet medium rare and it was basically a medium-well. There was a tiny thin line of pink in the very middle of the steak and very well done on all the edges. Going back, I'm reading a lot of other Yelpers experience the same thing. I feel like a steakhouse like Ruth Chris should be able to execute their steaks flawlessly and something like temperature control should be a given. 

TIP: My bf ordered his filet Rare Plus and in my opinion that was more of a Medium Rare. Definitely going with that if there is a next time. 

Price-wise this place isn't bad. We ordered the combo meal which was a pretty good deal ( $60 gets you a steak, salad, side, and dessert ). The sides were yummy,the dessert was okay, and the service was attentive. Overall, probably not coming again but sending hopes that this place might get better.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Solid meal, can't really go wrong with their course option. We got a Caesar salad, fillet + lobster with a side of garlic mash, and a dessert option. We also got the lobster mac and cheese to share. For drinks we shared the founders flight which comes with a cab and a pinot. 

-B
author: Brandon G.

description:
We dined here for our anniversary. Everything else's good. We had 6 oz filet and shrimp with sides of mashed potatoes. Seasoned and cooked very well. That Cesar salad was good. I love a good salad. 

Our waitress was great and they set our table up with cute roses before we got there. This was our first time here and it was a great choice of restaurant. 

We will definitely be back.
author: LaToya G.

description:
First time here and very excited to try it! They were very understanding that we were going to run late when called ahead. Once there, seating was speedy and the service was excellent. Our waiter was helpful, knowledgeable, and pleasant. The manager came by to see how our meal was and he was also very pleasant. 
We ordered the kenwood merlot, rib eye, stuffed chicken breast, and lobster Mac n cheese. Everything was delicious and perfectly portioned, enough to fill us. If you have never been there, each entree (meat/chicken/seafood) is served by itself. You must order sides for more food. The sides are large enough to share with 1-3 people. It's very pricey, but worth it for any special occasion.
author: Deniece B.

description: Such a great place to celebrate our wedding anniversary! The service was impeccable from the hostess desk to the last crumb being swept away from our rose petals strewn table. The food exceeded our expectations. The steaks were expertly cooked as requested (nothing like the sin of overcooking a beautiful steak). The lobster mac & cheese went perfectly with the roasted brussel sprouts. I loved the dirty martinis that they hand shook at our table! The creme brûlée was a great end to this memorable dining experience with the personal note in chocolate. Thank you for making our anniversary so special!
author: Michi M.

description: Just wow! Food was amazing and service was great. My boyfriend and I celebrated our 2 year anniversary and they made it very special, from the presentation to the interactions with our server. My steak was delicious except I still think the cream spinach at house of prime is still better in my opinion. It was really romantic and we're planning to go back just for a weekend dinner.
author: Michelle H.

description: I absolutely love this place. Food,  service and atmosphere great. My favs are sweet potatoe casserole, cream spinach and lobster mac and cheese
author: Tricia D.

description: We love this steakhouse, and have driven up to SF for special occasions. Recently we went with a large party of friends to celebrate an anniversary.The set price meal was a bonus and there were absolutely NO complaints. Just wish they were a bit closer to us so we could visit more. :) Ruth's Chris Steak House remains a favorite for us.
author: Arlene W.

description: Bad customer service and just because u get gratuity doesn't mean we don't need to be checked on. Not 1 time did they ask us for refills on anything or anyone checked on us hmm. Maybe we were the wrong skin tone I don't recommend this place to anyone with or without a big party. All money spends the same
author: John D.

description:
This place can admittedly be hit or miss, but when they're on, it's incredible. 

My last dinner here started with the crabmeat stuffed mushrooms, which were decent. They're pretty much exactly what you'd expect: crab stuffed in some mushrooms. But they're good!

The Ruth's Steak House Salad was next, and is a good, clean tasting start to the meal. The balsamic vinaigrette is tangy, but not overly acidic like they are at some places. Otherwise, it's a fairly simple salad just to get you pumped for what's to come.

Then came what I was there for: the 12 oz ribeye. It came out on a sizzling hot plate in a small pool of butter. The steak was incredibly tender and was well marbled with a really good amount of delicious, melt-in-your-mouth fat. This ribeye was literally the kind of tender where you could cut it with a fork. The meat was cooked a perfect medium rare with a good beefy flavor without being overly intense. It isn't a very salty steak, so if you prefer your steaks saltier like I do, you might be a little thrown. But it is still delicious as it is. And it doesn't come with a serious sear, but there's so much fat marbled into the meat that it's not lacking for flavor in the least.

As for sides, the steamed broccoli is exactly that: steamed broccoli. The garlic mashed potatoes are okay, but not amazing. I like more butter flavor in my potatoes, but it's possible that I wasn't tasting butter in them because I was overwhelmed by the fat in the steak. 

But the best side of all is the sweet potato casserole with a pecan crust. It's just some creamy extremely sweet sweet potatoes with candied crunchy pecans on top. It's pretty simple, but it is just so good. Even if I didn't get a steak, I would probably be happy coming here if I could just eat bowls and bowls of this sweet potato casserole. 

Surprisingly, I still did dessert, which was the cheesecake with fresh berries. It was a light, fluffy cheesecake with the berries actually inside of it which was surprising. But it was a perfect wrap-up to a delicious meal.

This past experience was absolutely incredible, but I have been here before with some less than stellar results. Usually the issues have been with underseasoning and overcooking the meat, which can definitely ruin your experience at a steakhouse. Especially since they don't really reinvent the wheel with their food, it's a let down if they can't get it exactly perfect. But if you catch them on a good day, it is truly an amazing experience!
author: Eric Y.

description:
The place isn't as busy on a Sunday night as House of Prime Ribs down the street.  Probably not the best steak I've had, but is still quite tasty and juicy, overall I give the steak at 3.5/5

We were told the sides were large enough for 2 people, now I don't know what type of people eats here, but the mashed potatoes was definitely a serving of one in my appetites standard.  As far as the taste, it was quite good but the flavor of the steak overpowers it.

The calamari is a must. One of my favorites now possibly. This is what brought my ratings to a 4. I would come back here just for the calamari tbh.
author: James R.

description:
We celebrated my husbands 35th birthday here last week and damn was it good! 
The service was great, they decorated our large table with some happy birthday confetti and we did the thing we neva eva do; sit on the same side (corrrrny, BUT romantic) 
We both ordered our filet medium rare. Mine came with truffles and a parmesan crust. The steak was so tender and juicy I wanted to devour it whole but acted like a lady on her first date and only finished most of it (more than half, almost all) 
We got the garlic mashed potatoes and the lobster mac and cheese -order this! 
They brought out a delicious complementary dessert which was some sort of lemon bar? We didn't ask we just tore it up cus it was so yummy. 
We'll be back!
author: Veronica S.

description:
This was my first time at this location and we were out celebrating a friend's birthday. We were a party of 11 with a reservation for 8pm on a Saturday.

We were seated within 15 minutes of our reservation time.

The staff was nice, knowledgeable, and very professional dealing with a large party. The weekly specials were great prices and quality of food and service was good as ever.

I ordered the 12 oz ribeye done medium plus with mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. Fantastic. I was so surprised at how soft and tender the meat was the following day after it being refrigerated and microwaved. I was expecting a rubbery chew and was delighted it had the same texture as the night previous.
author: Justina V.

description:
Booked a reservation for my partners birthday about a month in advance & we were both super excited to dine here since It was our first time.

Reservation was for 9:30pm & shortly after we arrived we were seated. Menus were explained as well as how the food is served. Our waiter was very thorough, which I appreciate.

We both chose off the 3 course dinner. I got the filet with shrimp. Plus we each got to choose 1 side dish. We figured the servings would be small so we ordered a few extra sides. 

All in all, the side dishes we got- creamy spinach, garlic mash potoates, lobster mac& chz & crispy string fries, were not all that great. For the most part they were all kind of plain. 

As for the filet mignon & shrimp- it had to of been about the best tasting steak I've ever had. It cut so smooth & the butter was the best tasting. 

Overall, service was great & I would definately come back for an amazing steak craving.
author: Ashley J.

description:
Finally made reservations here and enjoyed our meal!
Girls night out was a success because we finally got to experience Ruths Chris SF.  Drinks were yummy, appetizers was amazing! I'm guessing that Spicy crispy shrimp is new on the menu.  Our main course was cooked to perfection and worth every penny.  This restaurant looks pretty small from the outside, but it's pretty spacious.  And the bar was packed, so we couldn't really grab drinks while we waited.
author: Vana A.

description:
I've come to expect great things from Steakhouses, especially chains like Ruth's Chris, Mastro's, Morton's, Fleming's, and Smith & Wollensky.  Unfortunately, my experience was less than at this location of Ruth's Chris, and in many aspects.

Location specific: San Francisco, CA
============================
1.  The Bar: small, more modern than I would have liked -- not classic.  To make matters worse, the one bartender was inexperienced.

2.  Small location: 50% of restaurant space was filled with casual clientele from, what appeared to be, a hip-hop convention.  Jeans, sweatshirts, sweatpants, caps, gold chains.  Is there no dress codes, or standards?

Nice:
====
1.  The menu has all the usual suspects, but they had a $59 special with a few entree choices, a side, and dessert.  Sign me up!

2.  Faust cab $26 glass is steep, but I couldn't resist one of my favorites.

Less than good:
=============
1.  The server had zero personality, and described nothing.  I'm used to a little delivery of specialties, cooking principles, perhaps shown cuts of meat -- nothing at all.

2.  I ordered the Filet, 11oz was slightly off-tasting.  I didn't finish but half.

3.  Garlic Mashed, my side was garlic-less, and what little there was tasted if it was from a Costco jar of minced.

4.  Crumbs were not scraped from my table after my meal, and before dessert.

5.  Bread should have been served with my salad, and was not.

6.  I added $15 for 6 large shrimp, take it or leave it.  Not great at all -- they tasted steamed.

Overall:
======
Very disappointed.  I won't be going back to this location.
author: Randy B.

description:
Always a joy and a wonderful treat every time I come here. Service is great, food is great, valet and pricing is affordable and I would really recommend making RESERVATIONS even if it doesn't seem busy. 

I came here for an anniversary dinner and I love all the small details like roses on the table, the servers noting our special day etc. 

Food quality is always on point. No complaints here. 

Drinks? I would suggest sticking to wines and their signature cocktails because our old fashion was not good. 

The server also presented a variety of knives since we ordered a special, but for some who don't know how to choose a knife I would like a suggestion. Since no suggestions were given we choose knives that did not work as well as the standard steak knife that everyone else had. 

I always try for dessert here but the portions are generous and I can never make it to the end. 

Overall: I would definitely recommend this steak house if you're looking for something fancy and delicious, but won't kill your wallet.
author: Daw M.

description:
I had never been here, but my boyfriend had and he was craving meat so why not. We made a reservation for 8:15 PM online, and we were pretty much seated right away when we arrived at 8 PM. I decided to get the Ruth Classic with the Cesar salad, garlic mashed potatoes, the 6 oz filet with shrimp, and then the dessert duo of the apple cheesecake and Haagen Dazs vanilla ice cream. My boyfriend ordered the squash bisque, the creamy spinach, the 11 oz filet, and the same dessert duo. They also give you a roll of bread with butter and I ate almost all of it. It was so crunchy and the butter just melted on the hot roll.

The ceasar salad was standard but it was still delicious. I'm not that big of a fan of the cheese they used so I didn't eat that. The bisque was pretty tasty even though I don't like pumpkin.

Oh the filets were THE best part of the meal. It cut really easily and even the meat was super tender. You only had to take a few bites before you had to swallow it. The shrimp was alright. We wanted to save room for dessert so we didn't finish the filets and I asked for a to-go box. I KNOW I had 3 shrimp left but when I checked at home, I had only gotten 2 of my shrimp. I was a little bummed. 

The dessert was pretty good too. The crust on top of the cheesecake was crunchy. Apple cheesecake was a combo of my favorite desserts, apple pie and cheesecake. Vanilla ice cream helped the dense cheesecake go down.

Overall the food was really great. The service was alright. I guess it was busy since our server also had to make drinks. I still miss my one shrimp.
author: Allyson L.

description:
I had a fantastic time celebrating my 26th Birthday with my family. I made reservations in advance so we were seated within 5 minutes. We started with some drinks, mushrooms stuffed with crab meat, and shoestring fries which were great to share. The fries looked like a bouquet of flowers, but instead it is filled with lots of perfectly thin and crispy fries haha.

I ordered the Cowboy Ribeye cooked "medium rare plus" which is right between medium rare and medium. I'm so glad the waitress informed me about this option because it came out exactly the way I wanted it to and it tasted fantastic! The steak came out on a hot plate with lots of butter to keep it super juicy and flavorful. I read that some people don't like all the butter, but this is steak and if you wanted a lean healthy dry steak, there are other places for that. I'm pretty active and healthy, but when I eat my steak I like to indulge. Every bite was amazingly tender and flavorful and purely delicious! 

We complimented our entrees with creamed spinach, mashed potatoes and roasted brussels sprouts. Oh man, these brussels sprouts are next level since they're made with honey butter and bacon bits. These sweetness and savoriness was amazing. Highly Recommend!

At the end, we shared their white chocolate bread pudding and a complimentary birthday apple turnover with vanilla ice cream which was awesome. Thanks for making my birthday so memorable and for having some of the best steak I've tasted in the Bay Area. I can't wait to come back.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Good steak house I sometimes opt for the stuffed chicken which is amazingly good and juicy. Always experienced good service. I would rate a 5 star but their mashed potatoes taste like it comes from the box. My go to sides are and apps;
Sweet potato 
Mushroom 
Creamed spinach
Wedge salad
Calamari 

Definitely worth a try for a nice dinner
author: Love L.

description:
I was here during one of the evacuations of the North Bay Wildfires, tired and worn out, but figured my friend, Mike, had done a lot for me to get us out of the area and we had moved into and out of several hotels and friend's places. 

Paul Donohue was our waiter and his service was superb. Sharp, knowledgeable, and gave the absolute best service!! 

My First time here: I started with a Plymouth Gin Martini and Mike had a Makers Mark Manhattan - both excellent. We both started with a Caesar Salad and it was delicious. I used to make these tableside and this was perfect for my taste. 

Dinner - me 6oz Filet Mignon, side of Creamed Spinach, Mike 12 Ribeye, side of Crab Rice

Paul & Christie, the staff brought out a special plate for my recent birthday of an Apple Tarte with candles and Mike had the decadent Molten Chocolate Cake with Chocolate Mousse. 

During the meal we had a couple glasses of white wine, and a bottle of the Daou Cabernet from Paso - the perfect accompaniment for the steaks, highly recommended by Paul. 

After this Exquisite experience, I Highly recommend Ruth's Chris, it was better than most local steakhouses and absolutely everything was perfect. Even the manager took care of us. I am sincerely thankful that we got out of the hotel and had this meal.
author: Rew C.

description:
I was invited for dinner at Ruth Chris for a birthday celebration.  We had reservations on a Saturday evening and were greeted and seated in a booth.  The booths surrounded large rows of tables that accommodated larger parties in the middle of the restaurant. We were seated at 6:00 pm and the restaurant was pretty empty when we first arrived.

So, our young girl server came to our table and seemed so nervous.  OMG, she was like Bambi in front of the headlights ..... I kid you not.  To make the matter worse, she had the personality of a door knob.  She asked us if we had ever dined with them before which we answered "Yes".  Then she states that the steaks are severed a la carte and she would be back with some bread and will take our drink orders.  WTH?  It's funny now that I"m recalling my experience but I wasn't laughing at the time.  Since it was a b-day celebration, I just held my tongue and went with the flow.  

Our young lady server returned and the service just went downhill.  We ordered:

(1)  Cocktails

(2)  Appetizers:
Calamari, Veal Ravioli, Crab Cakes, Lobster Tempura & Lobster Bisque.   

So, my lobster bisque was served in a huge bowl.  I wanted to share my soup with my friend and asked for a cup from the bus-girl who served our appetizers.  The bus-girl argued with me and told me that they have no small cups.  WTH?  She brought out a small dipping sauce cup so that I could share my bisque .... really?  The way she was talking to me was so offensive.  I was afraid to ask her to split my bisque in fear of what she would do to my soup.  I was looking for our server to complain but she was no where to be found.

(3)  Main Entrees:
Bone in Filet Mignon, Cowboy Ribeye with Blue Cheese Crust & a Lobster Tail, New York Steak & a Filet Mignon. 

I ordered by cowboy ribeye medium rare and it was cooked "medium".  Again, I did not want to ruin the celebration dinner and did not return my steak.  But, really?  I'm at a steakhouse and they don't know how to cook a steak at medium rare?  

(4)  Sides:
Lobster Mac & Cheese, Mashed Potatoes & Corn

The food was "Ehh" and I've had better prepared entrees at other Ruth Chris locations.  The problem with this Ruth Chris was the service.  The only time we saw our server was when she took our order and when she delivered the check.  She never checked on us, never delivered any of our dishes.  I had to flag down other servers/bus boys for water, etc.  Plus, the bus people who delivered our entrees were not professional.

This is the surprising part of my experience .... ready?  OMG, the larger parties that were seated in the middle of the room were so loud and rowdy.  I felt like I was dining at the local Bar and Grill.  The only thing missing were the large mounted tv's on the walls.  I was so surprised that management did not ask them to keep their noise level down.  I was shouting at the person in front of me in order to have a decent conversation.  

I have dined at many steak houses including other Ruth Chris' in Southern CA and I have never experienced such poor service.  In addition, I have never dined in a fine steak house restaurant where I felt like I was at a frat house party.  I was just speechless which was a good thing because no one in my party of four could hear me with all of the out of control loud voices surrounding us, lol.  Maybe I should host my son's B-Day dinner at the restaurant when he turns 21 and all of his friends can drink and be rowdy at the restaurant ..... I'll just pick up the check, lol.

The service and dining atmosphere was horrific which made the food forgettable.  If I wasn't an invited guest, I would had walked out.  A very disappointing dinner experience especially when it was a b-day celebration.  Shame on you Ruth Chris .... Most people dine at your establishment for special occasions and management short staffed the patrons which resulted in awful service. Also, I was so appalled that your patrons were allowed to be SO loud and rowdy which ruined your other customers dining experience.  I won't be back ..... 1 Star!
author: Maite H.

description:
Eh.

I was going to leave the review to just that, but maybe that wouldn't be super helpful to everyone haha.

So this place is known for their steaks, and I'm all for that. The trouble is, it's extremely pricy and although the steak is good, I'm not sure if it's worth it (unless you have an expense account then by all means.) Basically, for this kind of money, you can get Michelin-star tasting menus which are multiple courses, really unique, and fantastic.

For such a pricy place, I'm disappointed by the ambiance of this location. Construction on the outside, the "bad kind" of dark, people wearing shorts, and almost feels like a semi-abandoned tourist trap. Whatever, we're here for steaks.

(Also keep in mind they will only seat you if the entire party is present.)

I went with the Tomahawk steak with bone-in, medium rare. We also got the spinach, the scalloped potatoes, and the Brussels sprouts. Everything was pretty good for a steakhouse, though nothing unique to write about.

The plates are extremely hot though - like you will burn you finger if you touch it. They also stay very hot (super neat concept for those who like their food warm throughout the meal, though I can see some people who like their food rare not being a fan.). So that's new to me.

Overall, a decent place for a business dinner (if you need to play it safe), but there are so many other options in SF that your taste buds (and tummy) will thank you for!
author: Greg G.

description: I took my husband here for his 44th birthday dinner. Table was decorated with confetti for his bday which was a nice touch. The waiter, Joe, came over to take our order and since neither of us are drinkers we both ordered water. I think the waiter was hoping we would order drinks because he asked us again in the same conversation what we would like from the bar and again we both said just water. After he took our order we barely saw him again, at least not at our table. Our water glasses went empty during dinner and we had to track someone else down to get them filled. I saw him visit other tables several times and the difference seemed to be those tables were spending a lot more money than we were. Granted for 2 our bill came to $144 which is to me is a LOT of money but to these waiters it's nothing. There was also a leaky light fixture right where you enter the dining room and mgmt was trying to fix it and it kept getting worse and dripping more and more. This was very distracting to me as I could clearly see it and it made the venue seem far less classy. The steak and potatoes we ordered were good but the corn was not what we expected or would ever order again. They brought my husband a complimentary dessert for his bday which was nice but overall I was NOT impressed with the restaurant, especially not with the service we received. I would not eat there again - way over priced for what we got.
author: Erica M.

description:
Had a very nice dinner.... I have eaten at a few Ruth Chris restaurants and this one, by far, is the classist establishment.  Their wood decor, various sections so the noise is not overwhelming like their other restaurants. Steaks were outstanding as expected at that price level.

Service was very good... I would valet park and save yourself heartache. $14 up front to valet, they are efficient, quick, and friendly.

Make reservations.. you can do it thru Yelp.

It is very pricey, but we knew that going in. $500 for 4 (we scrimped on the wine for a $75 bottle... our favorite was Justin wine but we are not paying $150 when we buy for less at their wine club). We all had a cocktail and ordered 2 sides to share.  

I still lean toward Jocko's steaks in Nipomo (Santa Maria) and Morton's & Fleming's are thicker steaks...but Ruth Chris's butter infused hot plate steak is very good once and a while.
author: Ralph S.

description: **** I HOPE MANAGEMENT READS THESE****!!!!Literally the worse customer service I've ever experienced on the phone; a young female answered the phone at 6:09pm at the Van Ness location. After automatically putting me on hold twice and me having to call back she said "sorry we are busy" instead of asking if I could hold; after requesting a manager I was told to hold; which turned out to be a disconnected call. Whomever is running this hostess stand needs some serious training on phone etiquette; because this is the worse customer service I've ever received! And here I was excited to take my significant other to a nice dinner this coming Friday; instead was quickly ruined by an immature, inadequate, rude, and selfish hostess; I will take my business elsewhere in a heartbeat. Shame on you!!!!****
author: Fernando D.

description: I've been to Ruth's Chris a handful of times and never had a bad experience. They always go above and beyond to make you sure you have a true fine dining experience here. I took my girl here for her birthday and we both loved it. I got the ribeye, she got the petite filets with shrimp. With lobster Mac n cheese and creamed spinach for sides. If your steak isn't cooked to perfection they will happily take it back and prepare it correctly for you. I love this place. Steak so tender you could eat it with a spoon! Rose pedals on the table made my woman very happy. Highly recommend!
author: Manny R.

description:
really disappointed with the experience at ruth chris in sf.  first of all the food was average, nothing like the exceptional meals i have had in the past at ruth chris.  the steaks were not cooked properly.  we had filet mignon's and each had three different temperatures per steak.  for example, mine was cooked medium well on the ends, medium towards the center and rare in the center.  the salads were lackluster and the desserts dated and tasteless.  the sides were ok- we had the potatoes, which were nice, the creamed spinach and the cauliflower.  

this ruth chris does not compare to any of the other ones.  i frequent the one in sacramento and never have had a meal this bad there.  

the service is great and jose, the bartender makes the place bright and cheery.  he is definitely an asset to this restaurant.  will be taking a long break from this place.
author: Samantha B.

description: Steak so great the Rib eye. The cow boy rib eye so great plus the very good service of Jackie. So nice a place I would love to go back always in San Francisco.
author: Tommery M.

description: The steak was the worst I had. It was so hard, greasy and full of thick fat. I asked if they can split my steak on two plates since I cannot eat it all, I wanted to share it with a friend. They brought it out on ugliest small plate covered with grease. I only had one bite out of it, it wasn't edible. I didn't enjoy the steak here. But the sides were tasty. Waitstaff was fine. I'll go to House of Prime Rib next time without thinking twice.
author: Betsy E.

description: Ruth Chris has the best steak anywhere. They use butter to cook the steak and the plate come out hot, so if you want medium rare, order medium rare rare so the plate kind like cooking it when it come out. Steak is very tender and tasty. I been there many times and every time it is consistent.
author: Allen L.

description: Your typical experience here. Dana was our server and she was delightful. Food was consistent like always and they topped it off with a happy birthday desert to my girl. Overall good times as expected
author: Eddie C.

description:
I took my friend here for her birthday dinner and she loved it. I made a reservation through OpenTable and left a little note that said it was my friend's birthday. The restaurant was kind enough to sprinkle our table with happy birthday and cake confetti. I loved that little touch. 

Our server was Robert. He was very fast and attentive and also answered all our questions. The three of us all got sodas, and they were constantly refilled without asking. I maybe had to ask once. 

Birthday girl Rachel and I ended up getting the ribeye and we both wanted it cooked medium rare. It was delicious, very juicy. The plate the steak was set on stayed hot until the end of our meal. We also ordered a side of creamed spinach, shoestring fries, and a baked potato. All were good, but I thought nothing too outstanding. My other friend Erik ended up ordering from 'Ruth's classic' and he liked what he ordered too. However, we didn't receive the dessert part of his meal and we didn't realize until we left the restaurant. 

I love Ruth Chris steakhouse and I will definitely be returning.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Simply amazing !!! The staff is so friendly. And the food is beyond delish. Their calamari was unforgettable. We went there for parents anniversary dinner. They made whole experience very special. With free desert and decorations...
author: Vika S.

description:
Okay now I can leave a review for proper service! After our horrible experience at the walnut creek location, we were invited back to give Ruth's chris a second chance. 

So we agreed but to go to the San Francisco location instead. This time we had our 2 daughters with us so I'm glad we received great service this time. I'm actually just happy overall that we could enjoy our night with out any issues!

If you come to this location and you get to have Thomas as your waiter, then you're lucky! He was great! I would definitely want to be served by him again :) All the staff was very friendly and our food was good also. So needless to say, Our experience was much better this time around! I would definitely come back to this location
author: Karina M.

description: Had the best time at Ruth Chris San Francisco, my son's19th birthday/ graduation dinner. Server was very knowledgeable and all staff was just wonderful thank you guys.
author: David G.

description: Pleasant and respectable environment (occasional noisy clientele notwithstanding) but overpriced...$150 for two small combination meals with beverages (and a fair tip) just seems a bit on the high side given the overall quality.  The Ceasar salad is good but request dressing on the side unless you don't mind your lettuce drowned.  The stuffed chicken breast is tasty but heavy on the butter and quite rich...I don't recommend that this selection be paired with the garlic mashed potatoes.  The 11-oz filet is outright bland and well beneath what I expected from a steakhouse of this reputation.
author: J. S.

description:
Ruth Chris wasn't amazing. I expected a lot more considering I've heard such a huge buzz about this place. 

I decided to take my dad here to celebrate his retirement. My dad was super excited cause he's a huge steak guy but one thing to note is that all of their items are al a carte. 

I ordered the ribeye with potatoes and Brussels sprouts on the side and my dad and brother both opted for larger versions of the same ribeye. 

The flavor of the ribeye was alright. I requested medium rare and received medium well. They forgot about our Brussel sprouts until halfway through our meal and I was extremely full by the time our sprouts came

Overall, I will say that service is good, everyone is pretty attentive but for the price of $35-50 per steak, it wasn't entirely worth it in my opinion. Glad I tried it though.
author: Shelly W.

description: WARNING! Racist pricks works at this restaurant! To give you a gist, my wife and I am korean/chinese americans. We are quite well off. We own a rare single family house outright in Nob Hill and make a good living. It was our anniversary when we went to Ruth Chris. It was unplanned and spontaneous visit. We first went to the superior House of Prime Rib but it was full as usual and the wait was over an hour. So we walked over to Ruth Chris. I thought it would be a good experience as it was my first time at the chain. We went in and it was very empty. Let me remind you that this was an impromptu outing and we were quite underdressed. There was this white waiter who looked at us up and down and annoyingly while unenthusiastically greeted us. He proceeded to sit us at the bar table without asking us if it was ok. At first I did not realize it was a bar area until I went to the restroom and saw people enjoying their meal at the proper dining area. I was pissed. I confronted the dude and his reply was, "you asked for it!". WTF. Why would we ask for a shabby bar table with a loud TV noise above our heads on our anniversary! It was a shocking accusation. We promptly left this god forsaken place and called them a racist on our way out. What a disaster. We will NEVER go to Ruths including all of its chain thanks to this horrible experience.
author: jay o.

description:
This location used to be my one of favorite steakhouses.  Sooooo disappointing this night.   I expect amazing like the last time I was here but I experienced continuous disappointments.  

The place is not well organized.  We had a reservation and it was not busy, but still had to wait to be seated.  Lots of staff were standing talking and laughing or moving around.  The dim light and decor were cool and hip.  Service was poor.  Servers were not attentive and rude.  

Complimentary rolls were surprisingly cold.   The salad was nothing spectacular, the dressing was rather bland.  The seared Ahi Tuna and Chilean Sea Bass were delicious.  Who'd know that the fish here would taste so good.  My 12oz ribeye was well done so I sent it back and got another disappointing piece.  Luckily I got full from the fish so I decided to take my steak home for my kitty Mimi!   Haha. 

The creamed spinach and Cremini mushrooms were salty and tasteless--the worst I've ever had. Mashed potatoes with garlic was yummy.  The chocolate sin cake is yummy. 

My advice is NOT to come here and make the same mistake I did.  Go to Lolinda, Harris, 5A5, Kokkari or Bobo for steaks 

I wouldn't go back and hope others don't have to endure my suffering dining experience. Servers at a place like this need to be the best you've ever had and if they aren't, either the management needs to hire new ones or train them well.  

Sadly, my rating is mostly for service and the experience I had here tonite.
author: Ivory B.

description:
My boyfriend took me here before our trip to MOIC. Reservations were a breeze on OpenTable. Parking is a little bit tricky as you have to park in the residential streets with very limited parking. They do offer valet here if you choose to do that instead.

The ambiance was romantic and dimly-lit. I would definitely take a date here. It's definitely not a place where you have to worry too much about your attire. The service here was great and well-timed. The timing between each dish that was brought out was strategic and our server was polite and helpful.

We both each ordered the ruth's classics meal, which includes a starter, entree, side dish, and dessert. We also ordered the lobster mac n cheese (which was good, but we could've skipped on this as it was really rich and heavy). I would definitely recommend going the ruth's classics meal route if you want to try a little bit of everything. For the starter, a steak house salad which was enormous for a starter but delicious! All of the ingredients seemed really fresh and it was the perfect start to my meatlicoius meal. For the entree, you know I had to order the filet mignon and the shrimp. The filet was delicious - unadulterated from any other ingredient that would mask its true flavor. The shrimp was meh though. For a side dish, I would definitely recommend the sweet corn succotash if you're a corn lover like I am! It complimented my filet really nicely. The dessert which was an apple pastry with vanilla ice cream was yummy as well! 

Overall, I was pretty impressed with my dining experience here and would definitely come back again!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
My husband and I were visiting from LA to see my brother for the weekend and we decided to make this our dinner spot the night we arrived. Upon entrance, the hostess with the short hair wasn't welcoming or friendly. But the other girl at the stand was really really sweet, I think her name started with a C. It's horrible, I know. I even read her name tag so I could remember but clearly, I didn't! The rest of the staff however, was fab! One guy in particular stood out to me because he was just so sweet, so friendly, an absolute gentleman with the biggest smile on his face while he walked around with an iPad. 

Jack (I believe) was our server. Super patient, very sweet, humorous, and friendly. A bit disappointed with our food because our bread was burnt, we all ordered the petite filet with lobster tail and there were actually pieces of the shell in my mouth as I ate. Our filet was slightly dry and overdone for medium-well. I know they're much better than that, it was probably just our luck. 

Not sure if we will be back, but if we do, I'd hope for a better experience.
author: Sapna G.

description: Foods are amazing here. We ordered the cowboy ribeye and seafood tower. It makes us super full. The seafood tower is good. The ribeye is so yummy but omg the butter is dripping.
author: L D.

description:
05/04/2017 - Another pharma dinner, another positive dining experience. I love the consistency of this place.

Pros:
+ Medium rare steak perfection every single time
+ Great service
- Consistency in food and service

Cons:
- Can be a bit noisy despite being in a private room

Recommendations:
- Petite Filet Mignon 8oz (huge!)
- Mashed potatoes
- Caesar Salad (a bit too drenched but still yummy)

Skip:
- Bread pudding (major meh!)

I love this steakhouse because they never mess up a medium rare steak. It's nice to know I can go somewhere and get exactly what I want. Plates come out super hot, so don't go touching it!

Will come back on my own dime for celebrations and steak cravings!
author: Fanny W.

description:
We came here for the first time in December. Our waiter was Arturo i believe and he was absolutely amazing! We sat next to the bar at a booth. 

Everyone in the restaurant was so delightful! We told them it was our anniversary of being engaged for 1 year & they surprised us with rose petals on the table. What a sweet touch! About 5 people came up to us to wish us a happy anniversary and that alone made our experience so special! Their attention to detail is what we loved. 

The food was amazing. We got a salad to share and each had a steak. We split 3 sides and it was more than enough. We ended dinner with a bread pudding & it was so good! Pictures attached.
author: Jillian S.

description:
If you are looking for a classy steak place, this is not it.  The food is average.  Meat is not bad, but why are the plates 55 degrees?  The potatoes au gratin side was amatuerish at best.  Drinks were watery.

The dining room is way too crowded.   No ambience.

But the biggest issue was the clientele.  Lots of T-shirts, sloppy jeans and baseball hats.   Lots of people on their phones.   Too many trashy people pretending they are at a nice restaurant.  Lady next to us refused to pay her bill, saying it was her birthday and her meal should be "on the house".
It's not Denny's.

Harris' is the place to go for good steaks, ambience and classier guests.
author: Lewis F.

description:
Even though this is a chain restraunt, I really like coming here for steak. Always consistent and solid. Appetizers are always appetizing (lol). Desserts are good.

The clientele is mixed. There are some people who come dressed up (probably what was expected back in the day) and some who come pretty casual. 

Service is usually good all around. This time we had Joseph (if there's more than one, we had the the buff one) who was really good to us.
author: Rich L.

description:
solid steaks.  nice flavor, but ive had better. 

we recently came here in celebration of one of my best friend's birthday. we all ordered steaks of different kinds. 

My ribeye was good! got it medium well and it was definitely closer to medium rare than it was well. another person in my party ordered the exact same thing and hers was pretty much well done....  inconsistency at its finest. 

i had a little taste of one of my girlfriend's filet mignon and it tasted exactly like id expected.  very tender.  the new york steak i tried was surprisingly more tender than my ribeye, which i found to be a little strange.  

why i took off stars: 
1. service was attentive, however we mentioned twice that we were celebrating a birthday and both times fell on deaf ears.  we did not get the birthday dessert for my girlfriend as expected.  
2. way too cramped in there.  a few servers actually ran into me while rushing off to their destinations and i had to squeeze past people making my way to the restroom in their narrow walkways.  there almost was no walking space for more than a person. i felt a little suffocated from the time i waited in the waiting area through my dining experience.
author: Abby Q.

description:
Steakhouse for the win with wine is always a pleasure in my book on fine dining!

Had reservations and they don't usually seat the party until everyone has arrived.  I requested to be seated before my dining partner came since he informed me that he was running late.  The hostess was accommodating and I got seated first.  To keep in the back of my mind, patience is a virtue.  Practice it because I get agitated.  Sometimes, I just need to learn how to breathe and take a step back.  That's where dining helps on letting me reflect a bit and enjoy the fruits of labor.  

They know their recommendations on wine and the Prisoner, Napa Valley red Cabernet, was well unique to the palate.  We ended up getting a Pinot Noir since both of us like Pinots. 

When looking over the menu, it tells you how Ruth's Steakhouse came about and I find it not only admirable, but awe inspiring on risking one's own home mortgage to start this business, despite many liabilities, risks and setbacks. I'm impressed on how it became a chain and it hit a soft spot for me.

I love the juicy cowboy ribeye steak! Medium rare is a must!  Mushrooms and the creamed spinach is to order up!  Crab cakes are a must for appetizer!  They put all plates in an ultimate heated oven and when served up on the dining table, it is sizzling.  Yum!  One can hear the sounds of that sizzle and it's music to my ears.  I love my food fresh and piping hot - especially that steak on the bone!

Lobster tail was of buttery goodness and complimented well with all the other dishes. 

Service came checking in, accordingly.

I like this steakhouse for all occasions.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Okay, I've always felt that there were far more superior steak houses in the city, and other Ruth's Chris locations that I'd prefer to go to than the one in SF. However, I just went there last night, and I really need to get this review off my chest, and I can't stop thinking about my bone in filet mignon.

I went here with the wife to celebrate and early Valentine's Day dinner, and upon walking towards our table they had decorated it with shiny heart confetti. Looks like they also placed rose petals on a couple's table that was celebrating their anniversary. Talk about attention to detail right?

Anyhow,I brought my own bottle of wine,  a 2004 Caymus Special Selection.  The waitress, looked at the bottle and I mentioned it may have sediment, and she ever so gently opened the bottle to ensure the cork did not break, placed the bottle down got a decanter and strained out any sediment and the night started off from there!  I love a steakhouse where the waiters know how to handle a bottle of wine.

My wife got the petite filet mignon, I ordered the bone-in filet mignon (both medium rare).  For an appetizer we shared the seared ahi-tuna which came with pickled cucumbers and ginger.  Yum!

Oh, I almost forgot, they provide you with warm bread with butter whipped to perfection.

Our sizzling steaks came out with our sides of the shoe strings potatoes and cremini mushrooms.  The mushrooms are a must. The little gravy it is served in actually somewhat enhanced the steak which is always drenched in parsley butter.

Now, back to my bone in filet mignon, this was the most amazing 16 ounces of steak I have ever eaten. I would say even above Marinus' Wagyu.  Honestly, I was blown away with the first two bites, and getting to the center was another level I didn't think even existed.  It was hands down the best steak I've ever had.  From the beautiful crust on the steak to the texture that just melts in your mouth to the actual flavors.  It was harmonious.  By the because of the cut I was given the option to select a special knife out of a wooden box!

The petite filet mignon was delicious too, but if you've never had a bone-in filet mignon put it on your bucket list!

For dessert we ordered the chocolate molten cake and that also blew me away.  I live in the South Bay and sometimes going to Flemings makes it a no brainer because of distance, but after tonight's experience, I'll be making the treck back up to Ruth's Chris again as the annoying city traffic is absolutely worth it.

This place is outstanding!
author: Angeline Z.

description: My boyfriend and I came to celebrate for his 30th birthday. Everything was amazing. The ambiance was perfect, the service by Juan V was impeccable. He was so attentive. We never had to look for him. Our drinks were always filled. He brought us champagne from a tasting they were doing in another room. He made our first time there very memorable. The food was amazing from our appetizers all the way to the birthday cheesecake they brought out to him. Best steak I've ever had! Juicy, sizzling and the temperature was perfect. Will definitely be coming back here again!
author: Raquel M.

description: Dark, quiet, with perfect attentive service by Juan V. By far the best NY steak, spicy shrimp and lobster tail I've ever had. All the food was fresh, with great flavor. Obviously the price will reflect all of the above but if you're looking for a impressive restaurant and food, this is your place.
author: Walther T.

description:
Great steaks, great sides, intimate setting with a wide range of seating, and amazing prices. Their service is legit too! Big ups to my boy Arturo, the bartender/server who has amazing customer service. 

I started with their creamy mashed potatoes which was fluffy and buttery. That explains it all. It doesn't need gravy so just have it the way it is. Their lobster mac n cheese is off the hook! For $20 this mac n cheese is creamy, smoky, and has hints of pimento. They don't skimp on the lobster meat either; it's chunky and full of meat. 

I ended up ordering their 8oz medium rare steak with two lobster tails for $60!! That's an incredible price especially coming from a high end steak joint like this. The steak was delicious and had a nice pink center with that blood still dripping! Just how I like it. The lobsters are meaty and came with a lemon & small cup of hot melted butter. 

I'd definitely love to come back!
author: Allister D.

description:
my wife and I went there for our anniversary . wonderful service from start to finish . the lobster bisque was amazing and we had the blue crab cakes,  OMG SO GOOD !
the bone in fillets were outstanding , especially with the lobster tail add on , a very good option by the way. They totally took care of us on our desert , yummy moose and chocolate cake thing.  our waitress , India was awesome ! 
the only thing we didn't enjoy was the kids at the table next to us . Not the restaurants fault "PARENTS IT'S 10 PM PUT YOUR KIDS TO BED ALREADY "
author: Shawn P.

description: Ruth's classic meals are very good deals! $45 or $55 meal deals serve you from salad to main course and finally dessert! 6oz filet mignon and lobster is bomb dignity! I love it so much! Probably the softest steak I have ever had in my whole life! I have tried LB steak, Outback, Alexander Steak House and I would say filet mignon here at Ruth is so far the best of the best!
author: Jenny N.

description:
This Ruth's Chris is NICE. 

Ruth's Chris feels more homey compared to some of the new, prissy steak spots in SF.

Caesar salad was a model start. The ideal Caesar prototype. This Caesar is what all Caesars should aspire to be. Everyone knows the salad dressing can make or break it. Their anchovy, acidic dressing, bright little cherry tomatoes, fresh croutons, and good parmesan set it off! 

Hubby and I ordered identical mains: 16 oz ribeyes and lobster tails. Just thinking about that hot, buttery, marbled ribeye makes my mouth water. The ribeye was SO tender and juicy. Paired nicely with a petite sirah we brought. 

The lobster tails were small but delicious. Fresh, hot and well seasoned. I could have eaten three of those and been a happy little kid. :)

We went with the classic mashed potatoes and creamed spinach sides. Happiness! Simple, executed well, done right.

Lastly, we ended our meal with the most delectable bread pudding I've had in years. Came with a boozey framboise white chocolate sauce that was warm, fuzzy and out of this world!! Don't skip this absolutely necessary dessert. 

It pleases me when both mine and my hubby's dinners turn out picture-perfect when we're out to a nice joint. 

All I can say is, here, the food is consistently good. It's comforting to expect certain features every time. 

Atmosphere, service, quality of food and preparation are damn near flawless. And the booths are comfortable.

Service feels personal. From the host, to your main server -- everyone is distinguished. Even the crumb catcher feels right. 

Pro Tip 1: Valet parking 

Pro Tip 2: $15 Corkage fee though I believe they comped our first bottle. Nice job!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
I'll start it out by saying I was a mess here. I was celebrating a promotion I recently got with my boyfriend, and the idea of leaving the team I was working with now made me want to cry. 

In fact i did cry. At the table twice. LOL. 

 Paul was our server and he was just awesome. All through the night he gave us excellent detailed apps and steak recommendations and wonderful wine pairings.  He gave space when needed (like when I was crying like a woman child) , and was always there at the most appropriate times. If he thought we were crazy he never showed it. And that's awesome. 

We're huge eaters but we had a salad and the seafood platter as an app to share and barely ended up finishing the steak we opted to share.  The seafood tower was by far my favorite and the dipping sauces were great. Loved the creamy spicy thousand island dip for the platter. 

Nickolas the floor manager at the time was very observant and attentive. He came to check in on us during and at the end of our meal to see if everything was going good (we were in good hands with Paul, but maybe he thought my tears were about the food? Lol). 

He chatted, was super personable, and even if the food tasted horrible (which it didn't, it was awesome) the night would have still been great because of the service. Overall my boyfriend and I had a great time and will be back. Paul and Nickolas made us feel comfortable and right at home.
author: Sierra B.

description:
Valet $14 or street metered parking up front- if you can find it. 

With a 6 pple party RSVP @ 6pm, it took about 15 min for the table to be set up. (Which was fine). The host was well mannered and welcoming. 

The room has a dark romantic feel to it. The booths look cozy for couples. It looked like they were able to accommodate a large party of 24+ pple at one of the tables, which is nice. 

They have a Ruths chris classic which includes a salad, entree option, & dessert. It's a good deal. 

We had the lobster bisque- pretty good. Wish it came out hotter in temp
Balsamic vinegar on steak salad. Very good
Cesar salad. This is even better than the steak salad. 
6 oz filet mignon medium rare- ok
5oz Lobster tail- very good
16 oz Ribeye- better than the filet mignon. Has a better marbling to it. 
Salmon- my MIL really liked it. Spicy sauce, on the side. It looked ok. 
Calamari- has a sweet & sour sauce on it. It was ok 
Stuffed mushroom- pretty good. 
Baked potato- very large. Good flavor
Mashed potatoes- good. Very buttery
Crab fried rice- didn't like. Has too strong of a garlic flavor that was over powering. I kept biting into pieces of ginger, which tastes awful. 
Cream of spinach- was ok. 
The service bread came out hot & fresh. 
The bowls of butter was soft. Was great. 

Our server was very nice. But as the night went on, I think the server was spread way too thin. He started off very attentive, Then it became very hard to flag him down. We could find the busboy, but he couldn't do much & would tell us he would find the server. Getting the server took a loonng time. Not his fault, he was covering wayyy too many tables & parties. 

Would I come back again? No. The entire experience was underwhelming. The food was ok. The service itself has room for improvement. It was overpriced for what we paid for.
author: Andrea K.

description: This place is great for birthdays (they give you pie and ice cream).  All of the steaks are good and I recommend the ravioli appetizer and the lamb chops. Service can be slow at times but the martinis are good. The location can be a little stuffy and note that there is a dress code here. Overall, a real solid 4!!!
author: Andrew S.

description: Cam here for a birthday dinner, man was this place awesome. Great service, delicious food and some of the nicest people that work there. Everyone was so polite and the overall decor of the place is like something you would see in a castle. Nice wood craftsmanship and tile combo. I love this place, too bad it's pretty costly to eat here.
author: Ryan H.

description:
I came here to celebrate my boyfriends recent work promotion. We made reservations and got there little early, but were seated right away. 
We shared the shrimp cocktail appetizer, which was really fresh & great portion. We then ordered the Porterhouse for two w/ French fries...all was delicious, but the only thing was that our steak came out first and we had to wait about 5 minutes and even get our waitress attention to let her know our side dish never arrived. All in all a good meal to celebrate a great accomplishment!
author: Nicole A.

description: Amazing food, great company, and excellent service. Told them it was our anniversary and they put rose pedals on our table. Only complaint was we were seated next to a big party and it was kinda loud.
author: Annie Y.

description:
Had my birthday dinner reservation today at 6:15. Found a metered parking one block away (you don't have to pay after 6 pm.) Came in with my husband and our 6 yr old daughter. Was not greeted at all, probably a good 3 to 5 minutes, front hostess was too busy with her computer,side chattin with her co-workers and I just stood up and told the front hostess that I have a reservation for 6:15 pm, checked us in, waited about 10 minutes more and finally they sat us. 

The ambiance is dark but not overly dark, the seats are kind of cramped together but it's cool.

Had the blueberry mojito to start (too minty), we ordered the Ruth Chris classic's; 6 oz filet and lobster tail for me, 12 oz ribeye and addt'l lobster tail for the hubz, roast chicken and French fries for our baby girl. The Caesar salad that cake with the entree was bomb! And the lobster bisque was delectable all three of us finished it, scooping the sourdough bread with it too!

The steaks and seafood came in (be aware of the sizzling hot plates, the server just told me to be careful and not touch it, but me being a rebel, ohh I got a lil burned by a slight touch so do not touch it!); the steaks were cooked medium rare to perfection and it was really flavorful. The lobster was probably a teeny tiny bit over cooked but not trippin cuz ya birthday gurl was hungraaay!!! The sides were creamy corn and mashed potatoes (we thought we ordered creamed spinach but they gave that, it was still good!) Our daughter's chicken was pretty good the only thing is that it kind of looked like a quail?!? Lol it was really small but it is pretty good too.

There was a complimentary birthday dessert. There was bread pudding, vanilla ice cream and some kind of chocolate bar with coconut flakes.

The bill was about $175.00 plus tip for the three of us including the drinks. Not bad, we paid more than $250 at the other steak establishments.

What made it better were the servers inside. They were really friendly,polite,patient and they are really attentive. So 5 stars for that. We'll come back!
author: Nikki V.

description:
This review is for the San Francisco location only.  I have been to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse in other locations.  This location did not measure up on several points.  Although we indicated upon making the reservation that it was a birthday celebration, this was not recognized at all during the course of our evening.  The service was very mediocre as our waitperson seemed to disappear after our food was served and was not attentive.  
Although I understand the environment here is supposed to reflect an old school steakhouse, it was definitely run down and shabby looking.  Even though the website states there is a dress code, most people were in jeans and tee shirts as though dining at a burger joint.  
The food was just average in taste especially for the high price you pay.
I would not recommend this location.
author: Peg T.

description:
First - I'll open with the fact that even with this email that I wrote to the general manager (see below); her and I had what I thought was a productive phone conversation with her and she was "allegedly" apologetic for her manager and her restaurants performance, and assured she would be sending an apology in the mail....

THAT NEVER HAPPENED!!! Which now has cause an even worse reputation for her restaurant than before. Here is the abbreviated email for the dismal experience at this "alleged" great restaurant.

"It was my first time at any Ruth's Chris restaurant, we visited on 9/3/17, and have only heard about the fabulous and empeccable service there is. Sadly your manager, Brian, this evening was lacking.

To begin, we had ordered beverages from the bar that took an excessive 20 minutes, for three cocktails. Upon receiving those, our server Chelsea took our order. The night progressed at a dismal speed as we waited 40 minutes for our hot food to arrive. We were informed by Chelsea that she was informing your manager, Brian, that the normal ticket time is 20 minutes for food, yet ours was double the wait time. 

Following him coming and greeting our table, he assured us that ours was the next order out and simply apologized for this excessive wait period. Ours was clearly NOT the next order as we watched an order leave the kitchen that wasn't ours. 

You'd think that would've been the last of the nights issues; however, it was not. In my experience in the serving business for 10+ years myself, it was always the practice of the managerial staff to not only bring the late food out to the table, but frequent checks thereafter. When we finally got our food, which was delivered by two individuals we'd never seen, the manager had to inform us that your kitchen was out of mashed potatoes. The kitchen staff had not even informed our server, so she was unaware as well. Which if our food had come out at the appropriate time we may have been able to have our garlic mashed potatoes.

Poor etiquette and poorly run kitchen line. 

I asked Brian for your contact number to make this phone call, which also took him an excessive amount of time. 

The restaurant was not busy by my observation, which can usually cause long ticket times etc. as I said, I've been in the business and understand the logistics of it all. Which is also why I am writing this email. 

The evening ended and Brian brought the bill over and had comped the drinks and took off $50 from the whole bill. While I realize he did recognize there was a serious issue, he should have definitely informed of us of any accommodations and comps he was going to do for us at dinner, to make the experience more enjoyable that he sincerely cared about the poor service. Rather by not letting us know until the end, we sat angry about the situation and how he handled it with a simple "I'm sorry for the inconvenience." "

THAT IS ALL! If there were an option to give no stars they'd have it on all accounts
author: Kala B.

description: My wife brought me here as a surprise for my birthday and the staff immediately made the evening special. Birthday confetti was sprinkled on our table when we got there and I was presented with a personalized menu. Our server was amazing and attentive. The steaks were so tender and buttery. One of the most delicious steaks that I've had in years! The sides were tasty and had enough for a couple more dinners. Such a great night! Thank you, Pat and staff for making this a lovely birthday!!!
author: Janet B.

description: I would love to try this restaurant, but, discovered it had a dress code! This wasn't pointed out on Facebook, when they were advertising! I'm not dressing up on the weekend! Especially, to come try a restaurant, and pay for hospitality with my money...no ma'am! If I'm Ruth-Chris I'd change that policy. Thank goodness I did some researching before visiting I canceled the reservation. I'm sure customers patronizing a restaurant know how to dress.
author: Butch F.

description:
The wait staff checked in every few minutes to the point of harassment, which is usually a red flag of a history of poor performance.

I wasn't wrong. I could have cooked a better steak and sides. It was overpriced, chewy, overcooked, lacked flavor, and had no sear. What a $100+ disappointment!

Avoid at all costs!
author: Chris B.

description:
My favorite steak place in the city. The staff are attentive, and the food is great. The petit filet is wonderful.

I once went to the bar at Ruth's Chris and ordered just a baked potato, fully loaded. It was one of the beat meals I've ever had
author: Michael O.

description:
They are terrible!
So I've been in SF since I was 5 years old and I consider myself born and raised in SF went St. Stephens and Mercy for school.

I love house of prime rib and even if they are not as good now there's a place in my heart for them.

I first tried Ruth Chris when I was in my early twenties. I hated them then ; they are overpriced and snooty and salty and still are! Ok not so salty.

20 years later...I took my three well be-haved girls (8, 10, 13) and hubby during dine about or SF restaurant week. I think they are the are just as bad!

Our waiter was snooty and inpatient!  We were debating between the Ruth Chris classic or the dine about price fix. So they don't substitute which i can understand and I wanted the Caesar Saks but the chocolate dessert. So while we were ordering I asked my 10 year old if she will switch desserts with me. And she paused even though I sighed and was inpatient so did the waiter which was very rude!

I'll admit I can tell a great piece of steak/meat but I can't really tell a bad or old piece of meat; 

The meat tasted like it was a week old and someone used a mallet to beat it to death.

The only thing good or worth was the warm bread and whipped unsalted butter.

All the salads has way too much dressing and tasted like it was sitting in the kitchen pre-made 20-30 minutes at least worse then in weddings!

If you want a good steak don't go here ! It's just another franchise worse then sizzler!
author: Customer R.

description: Made reservations for 8pm on a Saturday night and I was expecting to wait a little bit but was sat right on time . Food was amazing and the service was great . I had originally wanted to see what the fuss was about this place but now I know and the price was well worth it . Lobster Mac & Cheese was delicious and the apple cheesecake was even better ! Can't wait for another date night here.
author: Hazel C.

description: The service here was sensational as they are very accommodating. The drinks were pretty good and the bread was tasty. I ordered petite fillets and shrimp, medium rare and it was so delicious. It is definitely pricey but it is a great restaurant. I would definitely go back and I would recommend it for any special occasions.
author: Marcia C.

description: How could you Actually give this place a bad review? From the staff, to the manager and valet guys to the atmosphere. The friendliness you receive when you walk in is exactly what you expect. I love everything that they have to eat here or drink lol.
author: Gia G.

description: Went there in my fancy clothes only to find most dressed down in jeans- mostly tourists. Big steaks are drenched in butter, so skip the steak sauce. I preferred the rib eye over the New York for that reason. The service was classy, as if they were serving the Queen - my favorite part of the experience (shout out to D).
author: Rochelle B.

description:
It's all about the MEAT!  I'm a huge steak fan, and I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious my petite filet was.  The butter was sizzling and bubbling up around the bottom of my steak, making me wish I was eating it right now.  :)
We had a delightful server, Philip.  He was attentive, and very easy going.
Cocktails were on point, creamy spinach was done correctly-not too creamy or soggy.
Things not to miss here:
1-Obviously, the steaks.
2-EXCLUSIVE to SF: Hash browns-fully loaded
This is one of the only locations in the Bay Area to serve this dish-don't miss out because it's not on the menu! Just ask for it. 
3-Spicy shrimp-so tasty, just enough of a good kick in the back of your throat.
The restaurant needs to be updated inside (some chairs have been redone and were comfortable to sit in for several hours, but the booths and decor need a refresh).  Our asparagus was also over done, but those are the only 2 misses in my opinion.
At 9:21pm I hit a wall, and almost needed to be carried from my chair.  I had a great experience, and definitely plan to visit again.
As my hubby says "That sh*t was delicious"! :)
author: Annika L.

description: We live down the street so while it's convenient, we come so often because Arturo H at the bar treats us like royalty. He is attentive, super fast, always has a good recommendation and knows the kind of wine I would want before I even know what I should order! Love having a place that treats us like regulars! So special!
author: Tara H.

description:
I've been eating at this Ruth Chris location since 2001, Ruth Chris steakhouse is one of my favorite places to enjoy a great dining experience.
Hostess/Ambiance/customer service: We are greeted promptly by the valet and by the Hostesses. Years ago, I'd mistakenly made reservations at the Sacramento location (not SF, like I thought), and they found a way to seat my friend and I at a pretty nice table. They never made it seem like it was an issue. 

Cocktails: Ruth Chris makes a great cocktail, whether it's something exotic or a bourbon neat, Ruth Chris takes the time to formulate a standout cocktail. And for those who enjoy a nice glass of wine, this is just the spot for a Merlot or Pinot noir or an juicy berry-forward Shiraz, their wine list is extensive. 

Appetizers: Ruth Chris has a stellar selection to chose from, my favorite is the Crab Stack, the crab is tender, juicy and refreshingly sweet.

Salads: The Ruth Chris' Chopped Salad is so good, I would come here every day, just to have the salad, (and a steak). The Chopped has three different kinds of lettuce ( iceberg lettuce, baby spinach and radicchio) for the ultimate combination of crispy and tender textures, paired with red onions, mushrooms, green olives, bacon, eggs, hearts of palm, croutons, bleu cheese and a lemon basil dressing, topped with crispy onions for that special crunchy kick. 

Main: Ruth's has a number of steaks I love, but my top two are the Ribeye and Filet Mignon, both have superior flavor and tenderness, served on a sea of buttery sizzling goodness and cooked just the way I like it (MR+). If you're a seafood fan, try the Chilean Sea Bass, it's perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection.
 
Dessert: If you have room, and you dare risk cardiac arrest and an elevated cholesterol, their creme brûlée and N.Y. cheesecake are delicious, rich and creamy, each and every satisfying bite.

It is obvious the staff at Ruth Chris San Francisco take great pride in their work, and take care to ensure customers enjoy a lovely experience from start to finish. 
I have enjoyed visiting this restaurant for 17 years; each time I walk in the door, it feels like I am greeting old friends. If you love excellent service and a superior steak, come see why Ruth Chris is our favorite.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Came here last night for the second time. I was able to get a last minute reservation on open table. We arrived about 10 minutes early and were seated right around the time of our reservation. 

Adam was our server and he was very polite and attentive but not in the annoying way. I got the filet oscar style and my husband got the filet with a blue cheese crust. Everything was soooooo good and cooked perfectly from the bread and butter to the side and steaks. He gave me a free dessert just for being preggy and even gave us some extra yummy butter to take home. 

Will definitely be back!
author: Marissa M.

description: Not the best steak house I ate. I wanted rare, they gave me too cook, more than medium. Bread is not made in a good rules, it's hot but not good. Butter is as a cream and very good.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: Celebrated our 8th anniversary in SF for the weekend and we're so glad we chose to have dinner here! BEST steak I've ever had in my life! My husband made reservations and we arrived with rose petals on our table topped with a cute desert plate. Everything was perfect and our waiter was excellent! Will definitely come back again!
author: Cherlyn C.

description: When there's a special celebration we have Ruth's Chris as one of our go to restaurants. We come here not for the whole experience because service here could be a hit or miss, rather we come here for the food itself. Their steaks are tender and juicy. Always cooked to the desired temperature. A very important aspect when serving a steak. Unlike most steak houses in San Francisco it is not outrageously expensive. I would say its reasonably priced. 4 stars because the service is not always on point. Consistency is key, if we've come here for more than a couple of times and see something lacking every now and then, it's hard not to notice. Nevertheless I would still come back because the food doesn't fail. Parking can be difficult, valet is available at night.
author: Alex G.

description: We love Ruth's Chris and yesterdays experience was subpar to say the least. We could have gotten better service at Chilis. We dined at this locations yesterday for our 1 year wedding anniversary. Our problem was with our waitress Jackie! We waited about 15 minutes to order which was annoying because we wanted to order drinks. When she finally came to take our order we had ordered 2 crab mac n cheeses, mashed potatoes, and au gratin potatoes and asked if we had been to Ruth's chris before because we had ordered a 2 crab mad n cheese sides. We said yes and that we didn't mind having extra to take home. As we continued to order she kept telling us how much food we had ordered. And we told her again that's fine we would like left overs. After we ordered I had tried to call Jackie over to our table because I wanted to change my drink and she gestured shell be over in a minute. She came with the drinks and asked what I needed I said I didnt like my drink and had wanted a different one to which she replied with ohhh. Our food was brought out by servers who were great! Our waitress never came back over to the table to see if we needed anything, to see if we wanted another drink, or to ask if I wanted to switch out my drink in which I had told her I didnt like. The service by our waitress Jackie was terrible! Why would you not come back to the table to see if we needed anything else? You dont expect that kind of service from this kind of establishment. My one regret is that I didnt speak to the manager. We will not be back to this location.
author: Amrita V.

description: I haven't been to Ruth's Chris in I don't know how many years. I just never cared for it and honestly preferred Fleming's. Went for Father's Day lunch and it was not crowded. I had the medium rare ribeye special - totally worth the price! And awesome! Hubby had the cheese stuffed chicken and it was good! The fried lobster app is totally giving Fleming's a run for their money. Lava cake not as good as Fleming's. Glad we tried it again. Will probably be back bc for $59 I got an app, 12 oz ribeye, side + dessert. Super good!!
author: Tinnetta T.

description:
Was here last night with my friends around 8:00pm-10:30pm. Food was okay nothing special.

What really concerned me was that When we arrived we saw a drunk couple come out of the restaurant yelling "THIS PLACE SUCKS" and the valet actually gave the drunk couple the keys to their car.

Then as we were leaving we saw another conflict outside with the valet. The man was yelling out that he paid the guy to not move or touch his car and there was a valet guy sitting in the driver seat playing around in his car. The guys were both not apologetic and actually smiling as he was angry. They didn't even give him his money back! Then the manager of the valet guy comes out and tells the customer to not disrespect his employees. He didn't even apologize!

Anyways for an upscale restaurant they seem to have the worst customer service. Hope no one valets here.
author: Lea H.

description: This is a San Francisco chain of a restaurant that has been at the VanNess location for over 30 years. The appetizers, entrees and desserts are marvelous.  Very consistent from visit to visit.  Bring lots of cash or your high limit credit card.  It's worth the money once in awhile. Valet Parking available.
author: Andy I.

description: Service is really attentive and all but the steaks are not on par with other famous shops around the city.  We came here for restaurant week but the menu was not attractive so we ordered off the regular  items and choices.
author: Shelton F.

description: At Ruth Chris in SF Bread wasn't cut like we was supposed to tear it apart like animals....WTF Lorenzo.We ordered stuffed chicken and Lorenzo took our order went to the back and came to tell us that the chicken is sold out (as if he was clueless). My daughters and I were like,"okayyyy???" Of course I was upset but decided to order something else. T bone steak ( I settled) Lorenzo began to explain how my steak wouldn't be perfect.
