Look..... if I pay $250+ for some food it better melt in my mouth, be close to perfection because you pay for what you get. Poor service. Do I smell internalized racism? I give this place one star but u are not going to ruin my family night out. Sorry Lorenzo but you made a name for Ruth Chris and it's not a nice name.
author: Tiana B.

description:
Love love love the food, service, and ambience here. It's a bit small but makes it even cozier with the company you're with. We shared the classic which one of the menu options that they had that comes with one of the set menu items for about $53 plus appetizer, side, and dessert! 

Food:
-the ribeye cooked medium rare is absolutely the richest thing there. Its saucy rich and just melts in your mouth with every bite so YES YES YES, highly recommend.

-corn chowder soup-not a big fan of it because it came out sweet than it was savory. It came with tomatoes and mushrooms too but the sweet killed it for me. They had limited options for the soup anyways so..

-creamed spinach- MAJOR PASS. I dont know what it was but it was so gross with every bite, you could feel the texture of the spinach which is rough on the tongue with a bit of bitterness. Good thing it came in a small portion!

-lobster mac n cheese: gooey, flavorful, loads of carbs but AMAZING! Highly recommend getting here and you get alot too but I say it serves about 2 people only. 

-key lime cheesecake for our dessert and yes! We shared it with two people and it was enough for us. Super sweet with a hint of tart in each bite with icecream to it too! Thanks for personalizing it for our special day :)

-Service was impeccable hands down. They're able to split things for us already so it made our time even experience much more awesome.
author: Jia Qi F.

description: I have been "invited" to Ruth's Chris Steak House by a scam organization. It's called "Decker Retirement Strategies" or something like: Decker... i want your money, inc. They took my name off my deed (electronically), deciding beforehand I was sitting on a $1M piece of property like a clueless elderly person (that I'm not). I RSVP'd and they balked when I refused to give them my email address. I was forced to call an 801 area code number (scams out of Salt Lake City are well known and warnings pop up if you... never mind). Either Ruth's Chris is in on this or not. I understand they don't let you see their "week's menu" without a lot of protestations. So who knows?" Either Ruth and Christ are bogus, or not.
author: Peggy M.

description:
I came here with my wife last night to celebrate my 30th birthday. It was not my first time dining at a Ruth's location, and it certainly won't be my last.

We showed up a tad early for our reservation and had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated. It was definitely worth the wait.

We started off with some fresh bread and whipped butter. It really doesn't compare to Mastro's bread basket, but it was still quite good even still.

We had the osso bucco ravioli for our appetizer and it was absolutely amazing-- perfectly seasoned and very garlicky.

We each got a ribeye for our entree with the blue cheese crust and extra butter, cooked medium. It was absolutely phenomenal. I make sure to eat at a fine dining steakhouse 4-5 times a year, and this steak was on par with the best I've ever had. It was cooked and seasoned absolutely perfectly. I wouldn't have changed a thing.

We got au gratin potatoes for our side dish, which were also excellent. And for dessert we had the cheesecake, which was equally delicious. In total, this was one of the best dining experiences of my entire life. 

Our only gripe was that they charged us for the dessert, which is normally comped when we dine at a fine restaurant for a special occasion. Even still, with the $10 extra for dessert, I can't help but give this a 5/5 star review.
author: Alexander C.

description:
Our first time at Ruth's we had an incredible experience. The steak, atmosphere, and service was great so we had high expectations for our second visit. 

Unfortunately our second experience was no where near as good as our first. The atmosphere and service was nice as usual, but the steak was a complete let down.

We were raving to our friends and family about how good the steak was, but became really disappointed when our steak arrived.

It came out sizzling and smelled delicious -- We ordered the Bone-In Filet medium rare. However, when we cut into it, red was no where to be seen. The steak came out over cooked extremely well done. We notified our server and he was shocked and exclaimed "that's definitely not a medium rare" and immediately returned it to the kitchen.

Several minutes passed and the server brought out another bone-in filet. It looked great on the outside and smelled better than the first one. This time, however, when we cut into it, it was disgustingly red. Like very raw undercooked red that was inedible. 

We neglected to send it back a second time, so we tried our best to eat around it. It wasn't happening. Our server came in to check on us again and saw the look on our faces.. he knew that we didn't want to eat it anymore.

We ended up tipping well because the service was great, but not sure if we would come back because we ended up taking the steak home to recook it ourselves. This is unacceptable for an establishment which prides themselves on high quality steak.
author: Telsa K.

description:
Could have been 5 stars but no. Should have gone to Johns Grill instead. Sure, the food is good but so what? SF is full of good food.

First, I made a reservation for two, a birthday, weeks in advance. The day of, Feb. 2 (for 7PM)  phoned and spoke to someone, reminding them it was for a birthday.

We were on time, waited a bit. Dressed snazzy.

We were lead to the Z-LIST ROOM way-way in the back. What tha? I of course, rejected that! My birthday guest got to pick out their seat -in the main room, which should have happened from the beginning!

One of the servers told a lie said the champagne I bought was $90 but it was $130 on the bill!

Of course I tipped the waiter approx 25%, he was ok but I will NEVER take a birthday guest to Ruth's Chris again.
author: Mrs L.

description: I've been to the Walnut Creek location and it is much better in terms of customer service than this location in the city. First thing is first, the valet here was anything but nice, and he almost forgot to give us our ticket for the car. We reserved a table on open table and arrived early. When we got there it took them an additional 20-25 minutes to seat us. The most I am waited at the Walnut Creek location was 2-5 minutes if that. Our server took forever to come around to take our drink order, so when we saw her again, we ordered everything at once. This was towards the closing hours, so it I wasn't busy so there was no reason as to why the service quality should have been so bad. As for the food, thankfully this is the only thing that went right. It tasted just right and cooked the way we ordered it. Overall, I would not be back to this location and will definitely be sticking to the Walnut Creek location from now on.
author: Anne R.

description: Very un happy they ruined my birthday after hour and a half of driving to get here for them to say no tomahawk cut . Very wack . Then the mng said next time I will get u a perfect cut .wow that sucks he could of at least say look I'm going to give you desert or a soda . Wack customer service.
author: Nasser P.

description: I went here to celebrate my boyfriend's bday and it was such a great experience!  The food was great and so was the service!  Bartender was great and so was the host!  Big shout out to our server Thomas for suggesting my now favorite wine, Daou Cabernet Sauvignon from Paso Robles!! Yaaas!  And also bringing out the birthday cake and candle low key cause my boyfriend gets a little shy!?  We were well taken care of!  Thanks to the staff again!!  Definitely recommend to come here for a fun and romantic celebration!
author: Crystal C.

description:
Interesting that SF's prominent steakhouses are all located in the same neighborhood... thankfully there are ample parking lots nearby, so you can roll into your car in the same block after a hefty steak meal. 

0. Bread | Looks like unpretentious white bread, but it had a magical balance of a crispy crust and fluffy soft interior.

1. Salad | Mmm several items in this salad made it stand out from generic salads. Vinaigrette and sweet onions are among my least favorite salad items, but they turned out to be the highlights here--the vinaigrette was sour in a delightful and refined way, and the onions were sweet and juicy. The garlic croutons another highlight, with nice garlicky flavors and a texture that was just firm enough for a mild crunch without being soggy.

2. Petite filet & shrimp | I asked for medium well filet mignon, and it was pretty close to perfection: succulent and tender with a thin roasty exterior, boasting rich beef flavors accentuated with butter and pepper. The grilled shrimp were surprisingly delicious as well, juicy and robustly flavorful, though a bit too salty.

3. Sides | I didn't care much for the mashed potatoes or creamed spinach. There was nothing special except that the small sprinkle of parsley on the potatoes. As for the spinach, I found it way too limp and gloopy, so creamy that it seemed closer to dessert than vegetable.

4. Dessert Duo | Shaped like a cupcake and tasting like fudge, it lacked dimension and was too dense and sweet. I would pass on dessert; more steak is a much better use of your stomach space

5. Cocktails | Pricey-ish at $14, but the alcohol is strong and their mixed drinks are well crafted. My Aviation was excellent, balanced yet bold. 

The verdict? In my opinion the steak quality and cooking technique are superior to House of Prime Rib, while the overall dining experience is shy of the more memorable details at HOPR with its flamboyant steak cart, branded plates, and tastier dessert. Also, Ruth Chris's presentation is quite underwhelming, although steak is not the most photogenic foods.
author: Edna C.

description: I made reservations for a birthday via the Yelp app and they had everything prepared with "Happy birthday decorations. The streak was excellent and the service was prefect.
author: Joe R.

description: Always wonderful. How do they do it. I have to say the lump crab salad is so yummy. I like everything. Service is always with a smile.
author: Mia K.

description:
Born and raised in San Francisco I've never had the chance to try this place. I had the opportunity tonight before attending the symphony. I'm glad I was given the chance because the food and service did not disappoint. The servers were friendly and suggested options. The prix-fixe menu was delicious and so filling that there wasn't time to even have dessert.  I had to take my dessert to go. 

This was a beautiful evening at a wonderful restaurant.

Immediately got home and suddenly found room for that dessert.  ;-)
author: O ..

description:
Came to this Dining place last night. Very Impressed with the Service. Jessica by par has a very knowledgable about the Menu. Patienly Explained in Details what they Offer. My Guest was very Pleased with the Classy way they served the meals. 

Would Definitely Bring friends from out of the country to sample the very best Dining experience...
author: Donovan L.

description: We went to Ruth's Chris 10-7-18 for a birthday celebration. We live in SF and this was our first visit. We've heard good things and decided to try it. For a high end steak house, it really wasn't anything special. The fillets and rib eyes we ordered were good but not spectacular. The 5 sides we ordered were good but we ordered shoestring potatoes and when they arrived, they were actually SOGGY and LUKE WARM rather than hot and crispy! One person in our party commented it looked like leftovers from a previously served meal.  How does this happen at a premium steak house?! They remade them, but by the time they arrived, we had almost finished our dinner.  Our steaks were ordered medium rare and were medium to medium well when they arrived at our table. The service was good but our server could have come by sooner after our entrees arrived to ask how our meals were. For us, Harris', Osso Steak House, or House of Prime Rib (all where we have previously dined) provided a much better dining experience. A restaurant like this should be spot on in service and food...this fell short
author: Art J.

description: Celebrated our first wedding anniversary and it was all magical. From the moment that we came in the restaurant, the hostess greet us "Happy Anniversary" and all the people waiting in the lobby congratulated us as well. When we got in our table, it was a very lovely table with rose petals on it. Our server is really good, very humble, very accommodating and very pleasant. The steaks are beyond perfection. I had the Filet and my husband got the rib eye. It was love at first bite. Very tender, very buttery, very tasty. It was BEYOND perfection. I usually don't give compliments to the chef but this one deserves it. We got a very special dessert too tailored for our anniversary. Street parking is available and valet parking as well for convenience. Will come back again. Absolutely!!!
author: Jm V.

description:
My boyfriend was craving steak, so I decided to make reservations for us to try Ruth's. We came on a Friday night at 7PM and were seated promptly. 

We were asked what kind of water we wanted (sparkling, bottled, still), and I noticed that every time the lady asked any table she never mentions regular tap water as an option - just an FYI, but we got regular. We were also given a nice warm loaf of bread and butter to start.

As we looked at the menu, we decided to each get something from Ruth's Classic section, which comes with a starter, entree, side, and dessert. 

I ordered the Filet Mignon ($55.95) and chose the caesar salad starter and mashed potato side. My boyfriend ordered the 16oz. ribeye (+$4 to the $55.95) and also chose the caesar salad starter and creamed spinach side. I also ordered a side of Shoestring Fries ($10), and a Rasberry Rosemary Cosmo ($14).

The caesar salad came out first. They put a lot of shaved parmesan on the salad but I'm not complaining. 

Then our entrees came, the steak comes out on a sizzzzzzling hot plate so be careful not to touch it. My favorite part of the meal was my filet mignon. It was so tender and juicy! I ordered mine medium and it had just the right amount of pink and seasoning to make every bite delicious - totally would recommend. 

From the pictures, I had thought the side dishes would come out in a bigger portion. Maybe if you get it outside of the Classic selection, it does. Anyways, my boyfriend and I both agreed that the creamed spinach was just okay. I thought that it would taste better, but it is what it is - creamed spinach. The mashed potatoes were good though and had a garlic flavor which I liked. 

The shoestring fries we ordered were very overly seasoned with salt/pepper and my boyfriend complained (to me) that it wasn't as crispy as he expected it to be. Once we got past the top layer of the fries, however, it wasn't as heavily seasoned. Maybe they should shake the fries more to spread out the salt/pepper before serving it. 

We didn't finish our entrees, and by the time dessert came out were both really full. We each got a dessert as a part of our meal; a cheesecake and chocolate pieces (bark). We decided to just split one of them at dinner and then take the other to go. 

Overall, I enjoyed my meal and am glad that we came to try.

On a side note, prior to coming, I had wanted to see what the menu (+prices) looked like but could only find a picture of 1 page of the menu outside of all the DAT menus people took pictures of so I took pics of the entire menu in case anyone ever has the same need as I did ;)
author: Michelle C.

description:
Easily made a reservation for restaurant week deal. It didn't actually make that big of a difference since the Ruth's Classic deals were nearly just as good. 

Steak house salad - typical salad, some veggie pieces were a bit frozen/icy

Clam chowder - my gf thought it was ok, but I liked it, lots of clams, not too salty

Barbecued shrimp - pretty good, juicy/plump shrimps, sauce was light w/ decent flavor

12 oz ribeye - its ok, cooked well, but it did not taste like a quality cut, i've had better

Mashed potatoes, creamed spinach - they were ok, nothing special

Cheesecake - typical, small

Service was good, ambiance was nice/quiet. Great for a date, but food was just ok. There are better steakhouses out there. The value is there though. Nice to try once
author: Tim H.

description:
Excellent, excellent, excellent on all counts. The food was great. The service was professional. The ambience was definitely amazing. And they accommodated for extra people we invited on one of the busiest days of the year. I guess it goes to show you get what you pay for. It's not a place you can go for a casual bite unless you're a millionaire. It's definitely for special occasions only. I mean it's anywhere between $45-100 per plate. With that said, we kept our group relatively small but it still cost over $500 for the final bill. 

I have to say it was one of my favorite birthday dinners with fam. I loved the food I ordered. For apps, we ordered the calamari. It was delicious!!!! Best tasting calamari I've ever had! And for $18 it better be lol. For the entree, I ordered Chris's classic which included the 6oz. filet mignon and shrimp with a side of creamed spinach & dessert! Yummm!!!!! All worth the price tag, just need to make sure I don't eat here on the daily or I might break the bank.
author: Brittany D.

description:
Hubby had been wanting to check out this restaurant and we both had high expectations coming in as we both love love meat and steak!!!

Making a reservation was easy via open table, lots of open tables unlike the neighboring House of Prime Rib! We were greeted promptly and got seated towards the back area of the restaurant. Unfortunately, there were "drunk" loud girls sitting on the next booth... they must be having too much fun on ladies night out or something... we could hear them chatting about their bad dates whatsoever very clearly despite the "echo" and somewhat loud restaurant. 

Service was very friendly and courteous. The hostess sprinkled flower petals across the table as I noted on the reservation that it was for our anniversary date... a very nice touch!

We opted for the Ruth Chris Classic menu as it's the more bang for your bucks and we both opted for the larger cut of Ribeye, medium rare.

The SALAD that came with the RC Classis menu WAS HUGE!!!!! One could easy split one salad!!! or actually you would be full by the time you finished eating the salad, yikes!!! 

Steak came out in the famously HOT plate..I liked that the plate kept the meat warm however, I disliked the sizzles and SPLATTERS...watch out for your clothes...!!!! I covered my top with napkins to shield the splatters.. yikes!!! It did die down after a while but it was not very pleasant and I felt that the whole table also got dirty from the splash and splatters from the sizzles.

My mistake was, I cut into my steak way too quickly.. apparently they did not rest the steak in the kitchen... so my steak kinda bled out, *sobs!! Unfortunately also... the steak was kinda BLAH and BLAND... I had to add salt to the steak, which was ok BUT when I go to the restaurant, I prefer the "chef" to season my food that me having to do it myself. The flavor of the steak itself was not better than Black Angus... since I paid more than double the price... the steak at RC was not very impressive to me.

The mashed potatoes was very creamy and delicious and so was the cream spinach (you got to pick 2 sides with the RC Classic menu).

So I will say, I give 4 stars for the sides and salad... and about 2.5-3 for the steak..

The dessert course (also came with the RC Classic menu) was delicious and rich. They gave us a scoop of sorbet and wrote "happy anniversary" on one of the dessert plates (we each got one of the same dessert with the RC classic menu).

There were lines out the door when we finished dinner.

Overall.. it was just an "ok" place for steak... certainly, not worth paying the price and driving all the way to the city for the food... sorry..
author: Yun C.

description:
With SF restaurant week, I was finally able to give Ruth's a try. Ended up ordering from the regular menu because the variance in price was minor and we had more flexibility in ordering other items on the set menu. 

Ambiance was nice - we had a booth seat and they decorated our table with rose pedals for our anniversary :) 

The bf and I opted for the classic set meals for ~$55 pp
We ended up trying:

* Caesar Salad - Classic and great! I loved how they add lots of cheese and the croutons were super crunchy.
* Apple Walnut Salad - SO GOOD. Came with blue cheese and the dressing was apple cider? Nonetheless, I really enjoyed this salad! :)
* Filet Mignon - Melts in your mouth! Soooo yumm...
* Shrimp and Filet - Not as soft as the Filet Mignon... I def recommend the Mignon over this dish. 
* Fries - My bf and I were craving fried but these fries were mediocre because they weren't crispy. Not recommended.
* Potato Au Gratin - LOVED this side dishhh! It was super cheesy and baked to perfection! Must order!!
* Cheesecake - Pretty good but we couldn't finish because we were SO STUFFED..

I must say we were both satisfied with our experience here - prices were reasonable, portions were HUGE (esp the salad), food was great! I definitely wouldn't mind coming back on another occasion :)
author: Leilani Y.

description:
This is my family's first time here and it was a wonderful experience. Thank you to our server Phil, he was very patient with us and answered all our questions about the menu. 

You start off with their warm bread with their whipped butter. So delicious! For out appetizer to share we had the crab cakes that were full of big crab meat. My brother had their kale and apple salad which was hands down the best salad I have ever had. Thr lobstet bisque that my mother had was very creamy. 

For our entrees, we had the filet mignon and the ribeye steak along with a lobster tail. The lobster tail is served  with butter sauce and a lemon. Phil helped remove the shell from the meat for us. It was delicious. Now those steaks though. The filet mignon were perfectly salted and peppered. The butter sauce that the steak was sitting on was the best. The meat was nice and tender. My brother could not stop complimenting about his ribeye.

The sides that we ordered were brussel sprouts, mash potatoes, and cream spinach. I loved the brussel sprouts. They were perfectly carmelized and the bacon added a nice touch. The mashed potatoes were delicious and creamy. It wasnt too dry. The cream spinach was good but house of  prime ribs cream spinach is better. 

And finally, we ended our meal with an espresso cake with fresh berries and cream and a creme brulee. My family liked tge expresso cake more than the creme brulee. But I loved both of them. 

One recommendation is definitely make reservations because it helped us get seated right away and it was  full night for Saturday. When you do get a chance to try this place out, definitely order their brussel sprouts for a side and the apple and kale salad to start. I dont think you can go wrong with any of their steaks. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water. L
author: Anna L.

description:
Stars: 2.5

To my disappointment, my experience at Ruth's Chris was extremely underwhelming :(

We came on Valentine's Day for a double date dinner. We made reservations a month back so we were seated within 10 minutes in a booth tucked away from the rest of the restaurant. 

The complimentary bread and butter was so delicious. I had to stop myself from filling up on it. We all ordered the Ruth's Classic for $56 each. It includes your choice of meat, starter, side, and dessert.  

The caesar salad with garlic croutons was super good but filling. The mac and cheese side had a subtle jalapeno kick to it. It reminded me of Homeroom's mac and cheese, yum! I tried my boyfriend's mashed potatoes, but it was just whatever.

As for my meat, I got the 12 oz Ribeye medium rare. When it arrived, it was drowning in grease and butter... Don't get me wrong, if I'm eating out, I like my food unhealthy and buttery but this was just too much. It also tasted too salty and peppery, rather than flavorful.

Coming into the meal, all 3 of my friends, who have previously been to Ruth's Chris, were really excited to have Ruth's Chris again because they assured me that it was really good. But turns out they all said that their steaks did not live up to their previous experiences. What's going on!

The dessert, chocolate cheesecake with dark chocolate cranberry bars was good, but way too sweet. To sub for a different dessert, it costs $4. One of my friends, who doesn't like chocolate (what kind of girl doesn't like chocolate!?), was able to sub for a vanilla ice cream, free of charge. I tried some of her ice cream with my dessert and it tasted much better.

I felt service was mediocre for a somewhat high end steak house. Our waiter wasn't rude or unaccommodating or anything, but it just felt like the warm and welcoming feeling was missing.

I'm not sure if we just came on a bad day or whether it's this specific location, but I don't think I'll be back.
author: Lincy H.

description:
I've always wanted to try Ruth's Chris, and I decided to bring my boyfriend here for his 25th birthday. Boy oh boy, am I glad I did! It was super last minute when I made a reservation. I booked online around 3:30pm for a 7:00pm reservation. 

When we arrived around 6:30, it wasn't too hard to find parking surprisingly. The ambiance of the restaurant is pretty fancy..dim lighting, champagne and water glasses, etc..good for a romantic dinner. 

I ordered the 12oz ribeye and my bf ordered the filet mignon (his fav). When our waitress brought them out, OMG...just the smell is amazing alone. Mind you, a good steak does not need A1 or any sauces. This my friend, is a good steak. I can definitely say this is my favorite steak house so far. Would always love to come back during a special occasion. Also, our waitress was very sweet and always checked up on us. MUST TRY!
author: Tracy P.

description: I'm speechless. First of all we originally had an 8:15 reservation, called around 5:30 and got it rescheduled to 6:30 no problem. Got to the restaurant, seated kinda by ourselves with rose petals on the table, the waiter said happy anniversary, excellent service and food, fee anniversary dessert. Totally didn't expect it! When I made the reservation online I just put why we were going, didn't expect that, it was perfect.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Just wonderful the manager seems to really enjoy what he does for a living he kept walking around smiling and being very happy to be there. I went on an evening outing so maybe it wasnt like the first time but still wonderful. the only reason no 5 stars is because children eat there and some child spilled soap right before i washed my hands and got it on my brand new dress. they cant chase away children but this place is OBVIOUSLY for adults.
anyway the steak was delicious i was so full and the nice apple pie alomode they gave us as a courtesy was nice. Will be back again soon :-)
author: Eyez V.

description:
My boyfriend and I had a double date here right after his birthday during Restaurant Week in January. We were seated immediately at a table covered in Happy Birthday confetti (cute). As a group we ordered two petite filets medium rare, one 12 oz ribeye and a salmon. I additionally ordered the SIX large shrimp, the dipping sauce and (stupidly) I tried the creamed spinach while everyone else got the mashed potatoes. I even specifically asked the waitress if the creamed spinach was something she would get, and she said yes, she liked it here. 

Bread: amazing, hot, with delicious butter. I already stuffed my face while the rest of my party was just testing the temperature with their fingertips. 

Salad: "Steak house salad" doesn't have any steak in it, but it was still the most delicious salad. I loved it. The dressing was perfect and tangy/tasty, and all the ingredients were nice and fresh. 

There was a bit of downtime while we waited for our entrees after the salad. But that's okay, we had a drama couple next to us, so we covertly watched their (non)interaction during our conversation. 

Our entrees arrived! My filet looks and tastes perfect. It was definitely cooked with enough butter and salt/pepper. But, wait- why do I only have 3 shrimp? (I wanted to share with the table), and they were actually positioned to look like only 2 scrawny shrimp. And they were pretty tiny. and not that flavorful. I asked the busboy who brought them, and he said that it was only three. I was kinda upset, but decided to deal with it with the waitress at the bill time (I took a picture, as proof!) 

My boyfriend's ribeye was pretty tough, so he didn't finish it. The salmon seemed fine, my friend didn't complain. the creamed spinach was downright terrible. Ugh, I will never try it again! Dipping sauce was fun, but I still felt that was overpriced. 

Dessert was this slightly deconstructed carrot cake. Too sweet, and after all the face-stuffing I did, I didn't really finish much of it. At least it came with a candle for my boyfriend. :D 

When we got the bill, I noticed they billed me $15 for 3 shrimp. So I just got up and found the waitress (you don't understand, we see her like once every thirty minutes!) and asked her to please change it. She agreed that it was supposed to be 6 shrimp and offered to give me the three extra shrimp now. Hah. No woman, I don't want those three shrimp, after I've already eaten- thank you. So she charged me half for it. Reasonable, but not exactly satisfying. ($7.50 for three tiny shrimp, not exactly what they seem to be advertising in all their luscious pictures). 

Good: the petite filet, the salad, and the BREAD 
Not-so-good: the carrot cake
Bad: ribeye and shrimp. Don't get them. stick to the filet!
author: Tiffany W.

description: My experience in this establishment was absoulelty disappointing!!! I can not believe they brought my beer out in a chipped glass that could have cut my lip if I didn't notice it! Secondly they sat us next to a screaming baby that was trying to be breast fed at the table! I then ordered my food,  ten min later they come back to tell me they are out of chicken! Excuse me how can this "fantastic" restaurant be out of chicken? To make matters worst,  everyone who came after us was served before us!!!! Did they feel because we are all tatted up that we did not derseve the same service as the "others"? I then ask to speak to the manager,   Tony who only could say I'm sorry it's a busy night,  then offer me a better hospitality! I went back to my table very disappointed! Finally the food came for us to receive  cold potatoes and Brussel sprouts l. we then had to send them back! Can you say check please! Jesus let's not mention that there was 2 milestone birthdays in my party this evening that didn't even get a happy birthday! Very very disappointing! Never will I go there again nor recommend this place to a single soul. My social media will also be notified of this.  #ruthcrap
author: Melissa M.

description:
Favorite Ribeye, if you like it with hella butter.
Not really worth going for restaurant week so just go there anytime you want. 

It was SF restaurant week, brought my nephew here for the first time since he is on his quest to find the best ribeye. He has tried Roys, Porterhouse, Harris... So trying to be the cool auntie, i wanted to share my favorite with him and show him how good it is here and to have a good time. We also asked the waitress if she can do something nice to celebrate this moment. The waiter then asked her manager but they said No, nothing for first timers. Such a bummer. 

I supposed they only celebrate birthdays/anniversaries since there were 2 bday celebrants next to us who got a complimentary dessert.  I shoulda just said it's my bday since it is coming up in a few days.
author: Mari A.

description:
The sizzle of the filet mignon when it arrives is just one of the many aspects and factors that will, quite rightly, trick your brain into thinking everything tastes better than it does. Now let me be clear, it does taste good. However, atmosphere, sight, and sound play a large role in the perception of taste.

Perhaps it is in this area that Ruth's Chris steak house (horrible name - please change it) excels above others. For the food is as good as elsewhere but not better.
author: Andrew R.

description:
Can't beat that sizzling steak on a 500 degree plate. I touched it once and will never do it again.
Tip: re-position the plate with the butts of your fork and knife.
Ribeye is so fatty and flavorful while filet mignon is so tender. 
Knocked a star because I think the sides could be better. Stick with any of the potatoes or creamed spinach.
FYI you can upgrade any part of the Ruth's classic to full size (appetizer, side, or dessert) for an additional $4.
$15 corkage.
author: J C.

description:
I came for my birthday. My experience was great! My server Obabiah was awesome and took very good care of us. The food was seasoned to perfection!! Ok my chicken was a tab bit salty BUT it was bearable and tasted great! My steak was mouth watering and had that nice char burnt crust on it...YUMMY!!!! I also ordered an extra dry martini. BEST DRY MARTINI I HAVE EVER HAD!!!! I thought because I came to dine around 9pm that my food would be rushed and not so good but it was great! I will be returning. Oh yeah the whole staff was courteous as well. 

Visited on 12-23-2016
Lobster Mac and cheese was watery and the scallop potatoes hard as a rock. They better keep it together. Food is stating not to be up to par.
author: Tamu V.

description: I love Ruth's Chris. It is quite simply my all-time favorite steak house. Actually, it's so much more with so many favorite things to choose from:  Lamb chops, petite ribeye, petite filet. All delicious.  Love the salads, too:  BLT, chopped, soooo yummy. And the sides:  Garlic mashed (nobody does it better), creamed spinach (OMG!!!).  1st course:  Sizzling blue crab cakes and seafood tower are my favs. This is one of my all-time favorite restaurants. So many great memories of this place. Service was amazing. Everything at Ruth's Chris is simply perfection.
author: Ashley W.

description:
I've been putting off going to Ruth's Chris for all these years because I thought it was on par with a restaurant like sizzler's or an outback steak house. when my friends told me that their favorite steak house was Ruth's Chris, i just gave them a blank stare. So when my boyfriend said he wanted steak at an affordable steak house, I was like, let's go to Ruth's Chris, thinking it was ghetto AF.

However, when we got the restaurant, i was pleasantly surprised. I want to start off by saying that the service is REMARKABLE. we said it was our anniversary and they laid the tables with rose pedals. each server came by and said happy anniversary which i was pretty nice. 

Now onto the food - we ordered the 22 oz cowboy steak, salad and shoe string fries. i don't personally eat steak, so we shared the 22 oz. i ate like 4 bites, and thought it was good. the butter they drenched it in was amazing. The shoe string fries were a little hard to eat. a little too stringy. we devoured it though. the server even told us that we're the first couple to finish the fries - we love fries. 

at the end, they gave us complimentary dessert because of the special occasion. not some cheap ice cream either, legit dessert that we could ordered off the menu. the taste of the food and service were top notch.

HOWEVER, the reason i'm not giving more stars is because 12 hours later, my boyfriend got extreme food poisoning. Since i only ate 4 bites, i had a bad stomachache but it quickly passed. my boyfriend was throwing up his food the next day. maybe my instincts were right and Ruth's is ghetto AF.
author: Andy H.

description:
The first time I was here, the server inflated our check by about 20%, perhaps thinking we wouldn't notice. That was a huge turnoff. 

Because I am such a loyal fan of Ruth Chris, I decided to give it another try. Everything was spot on.

This particular restaurant is in the middle of San Francisco, so you can't expect much in terms of the car or elegance. But the food West everything you would expect at Ruth's Chris. The steakhouse salad was bountiful and fresh, the mashed potatoes and au gratin potatoes were amazing. The ribeye steak was cooked to perfection, in the desert phenomenal.

Love Ruth's Chris coffee!
author: Jaime J.

description:
Ruth Fertel's story and the history behind Ruth's Chris is impressive. 
My steak was not as impressive.

We went with the 3 course menu.
Caesar Salad:
Sometimes I just crave a salty Caesar salad with croutons and creamy dressing. The shaved parmesan was good. Romaine lettuce lettuce had a lot of dressing, a little too much. The one cherry tomato was halved, and seemed more like an afterthought than a topping.

Petite Filet and Shrimp:
Apparently Ruth perfected the 1800 degree Fahrenheit broiler, but the execution was not so perfect. It was overcooked. Since it is served on a 500 degree buttered plate, it keeps the meat cooking much longer after the steak is removed from the broiler. I would have liked it medium rare with some pink in the center and flowing meat juices, but it was more cooked through.
I wasn't expecting the steak to be topped with shrimp. It looked interesting, but I would have liked them separately. The shrimp seemed to have some Cajun rub on them and almost took over the flavor of the steak. The shrimp themselves were good and were cooked well.

Filet & Lobster:
This filet was also overcooked and a little dry. The outer part of the steak had a chalky texture, which was just odd. The lobster tail was a little tough, but the flavor was okay and the clarified butter helped.

The sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes were okay, but could have used a little more flavor.

Chocolate Cheesecake:
The miniature round cheesecake was served with a single scoop of vanilla ice cream drizzled with raspberry sauce, and accompanied with a few berries dusted in powdered sugar over a custard-y sauce. It made for an okay dessert. I'm not a big fan of cheesecake, as it was a little dense for me. The ice cream and fruit were not bad. The plate was nicely decorated in chocolate sauce for our special occasion. 

Overall, the food was alright. Plating was a little messy at times. The steak was just too chalky and a little too well-done for my preferences. I was a little distracted from the steak and enticed by the seafood pairings. Perhaps I would have liked my steak better sans shrimp.

Service was pretty good. After we checked in for our reservation, we were taken to a booth with a small lamp on the table. It was about $50/person, which is not a bad price for the amount of food. It just wouldn't be my first choice since there are better options on Steakhouse Street.
author: Joy W.

description:
Came in with party of 6 people.  Waited about 10 minutes despite having a reservation from opentable, and the restaurant was only about 10% full when we came in at 5:15.  When we arrived at the table, it was missing two menus and one table setting despite the wait.

Appetizers

- blue crab stack: 4/5  it was really good.  good amount of delicious crab with avocado, cucumber and mango.  it could have been stacked better as we had avocado and cucumber clumped together, otherwise it is a solid 5/5.
- fried calamari: 5/5  everyone loved this dish.  i loved the addition of chopped jalapenos and roasted red bell pepper.

Side dishes

- lobster mac and cheese: 4/5  the lobster was fresh and tasty.  mac and cheese underneath looked a little stale (?) but the taste was ok.
- mashed potatoes: 4/5  texture was a little loose but overall very good
- mushrooms: 2/5  very salty and the mushrooms were not rendered well
- french fries: 2/5  soggy and tasteless
- creamed spinach: 4/5  it was good.  creamy, but not mushy

Steaks

Here's where it fell apart.  We had 5 steaks ordered, 3 medium well, 1 medium and 1 medium rare.  Three came out with incorrect temperature.  Two were sent back, waited 10 minutes, and came out with still incorrect temperature.  I have ordered 16 oz ribeye with temperature medium rare.  It came out medium / medium well the first time.  The replacement was more like rare.  My friend's medium well came out as well done the first time.  The replacement was a medium rare.

As for the quality of the steak, despite the claim of being USDA Prime cut, my ribeye steak was extremely sinewy and tough, even at rare temperature.  The rating for the steaks are 2/5 overall.  I've had steaks much better prepared at Alexander's, Michael Mina's, Forbes Mills, and even McNamaras.  The experience we had was no better than Black Angus steakhouse.  I won't be coming back.
author: J L.

description:
Ruth's Chris has always been a special place for us. Birthdays or Anniversaries, they have always made them very special for us. Last Saturday, we had our anniversary dinner. The restaurant was crowded but well managed.  It did not take them more than several minutes for us to be seated. Our server was very attentive and friendly. The steaks were cooked the way we loved.  
The valets made our experience with the restaurant even better as we did not worry about parking and safety of our car.  
We will definitely be back again.
author: Kateryna T.

description:
The service is great but your food needs to be improved 
and iam not talking about the steaks .. appetizer not good 
ill come back but i have to be super drunk
author: hassan balot b.

description: Ruth's Chris, yumm... it's like a mini Morton's to be honest. Just as expensive, lol... but delicious! They have several delightful sides. Go hungry so you can fully enjoy! I personally order and love the filet mignon, I enjoy cutting right into the meat and not have to worry about cutting around the fat which some may enjoy that part, lol, I don't... their cream spinach is a must! Street parking is your best bet unless you Uber there.
author: Dee G.

description: Been here a few times. Honestly not the best steak house of steak houses. Yet still good. I not a fan of there sides. Pretty bland in flavor. But the steaks are good. Service of course is good. They are really good at up selling. If you are eating a steak make sure it's atleast Medium. You can't fully taste the flavor in a well steak.
author: Alex L.

description:
Made a reservation for Restaurant Week after watching Cirque du Soleil - Luzia, still had to wait a little bit but not too bad. 

I had been to 2 other locations in San Diego before & enjoyed those a lot more, probably due to the breathtaking views they have there. But the food itself was still on point!

House steak salad, creamy spinach & 12oz ribeye on that sizzling plate always do the trick. Bread was good, red wine was better & servers were attentive. 

Wish they validate parking though!
author: Roger D.

description: My second time here but first time writing a review for Ruth Chris.  We decided to do our yearly family Christmas get together here.  It was a busy night because of holiday parties.  Our reservation was at 7:45 but our table was ready at 7:40.  Our server India was really friendly and answered all our questions about the menu.  My wife made a mistake with her order and India corrected it right away.  I ordered the Ruth Classic 6oz filet with shrimp.  It melted in my mouth with every bite.  Last time I was here I ordered the 12oz and it was a little too much meat.  This time around I ordered the 6oz and it was perfect.  My wife and I loves coming here we will definitely be back.
author: Mark R.

description:
I just had a wonderful bday dinner here. My fiancé and I had crab cakes and salad for appetizers which were pretty standard. We then ordered the signature Tomahawk steak and split it between the two of us.  It was outstanding and one of the best steaks I have had in a long time. We ordered the side of sauces which we shouldn't have as the steak spoke for itself.  We also had the mashed potatoes and asparagus which were also were also standard. Another thing that was outstanding was the service. Nikki our server and Juan our busser were amazing making sure our every need was met and more. We really enjoyed our special evening dinner here and sure to return. 


01/15/2017 at 11:59 p.m.
author: Mike K.

description: Had the tomahawk ribeye and tuna everything was amazing nice and fresh. A little F.Y.I the sides are huge we couldn't finish are dinner.
author: Reynol M.

description:
Surf and Turf with a 6 ounce was my order. Excellent Whiskey Sour. Awesome blue cheese wedge salad with extra dressing. Soft fresh out of the oven bread. Asparagus with hollandaise sauce. Dessert was a chocolate martini for me. Excellent service from our waiter 12/9/16.
I don't like waiting a half our for my table when I have reservations and I'm on time but I get it, it was a Friday night with people hanging out after dinner. I had a nice time.
author: Cecilia D.

description:
I am so disappointed to write this review.  This WAS my favorite restaurant.  I have been to many steakhouses.  Morton's, Fleming's, Dominick's, Alexander's, Stark's, etc., but the southern style of Ruth's Chris was always what I fell back on.  I've eaten at a few other locations including, San Diego, Thousand Oaks, Irvine, and Sacramento.  I've hosted private events in the San Francisco location for birthdays and have celebrated several birthdays there as well, over the years. 

I'm not sure what has happened.  The last couple of times I visited, I experienced poor service.  I took my mom for one of her birthdays and the server completely neglected us.  The manager at the time offered to comp our meals but I declined because I was such a fan of the company that I knew it was a fluke.  Unfortunately the following attempts at redemption were a complete failure.  

Only speaking to my last experience, I took my gf there in September to celebrate a special occasion.  The server did not explain anything about the way the steaks were prepared or served, something that is consistently done at every meal in every location.  The food came out plated terribly, and the plates were not even warm, let alone 500 degrees, like they should be.  I have high expectations of Ruth's Chris and pay a premium because the consistency is what holds a place like that together.  At every turn I was disappointed.  I made reservations in advance and we had to wait.  Our table was in a very awkward position and I requested a booth, but our server said there was nothing she could do about it.  The food, like I mentioned, was absolutely sub par.  Overall a very poor experience.

This time I decided to contact the manager and explain the situation in hopes of gaining a better understanding of what has changed over the years.  I spoke with B****** G***, the general manager, who responded back to my initial email around a week later, apologizing for the delay.  I kid you not, she sounded medicated.  She was speaking very slowly and sounded very scripted.  I confirmed what my initial email had explained and she verified that the server should have explained all of the standard stuff, and other accommodations could have been made.  She was polite and offered to send me a $100 gift card.  I have spent thousands at this place, and like anyone else that frequents there knows, you could barely get away with $100 for one person.  I spent $220 on the night of the last poor experience.  I expressed my discontent, but decided if that was the best she could do to bring me back maybe I would give it ANOTHER try.  A week later, still no card, so I attempted to reach her again, this time explaining the amount of money I had spent there over the years and that I should be able to retry the last experience, at least.  No response.  I have written back 3 more times, attaching each previous email.  No responses to any of them.  No gift card, no contact whatsoever.  I know it is just a restaurant, but when you have a tradition, or any emotional attachment to a place, it's much harder to want to change that.  I will literally never support this business again. I am beyond disappointed.
author: J J.

description:
For $55.95 each, we all decided to order the "Ruth's Classic Dinner".  Not one person finished their dinner!  The size of the filets were enormous--we all took home a baggie.

"Ruth's Classic Dinner"  gives you a choice of starters, entrees, sides and desserts.

I opted to start with the Apple, Walnut and Blue Cheese salad.  It was tossed with a tasty vinaigrette but I added blue cheese dressing too--it was a huge, crispy and cold salad. Excellent seasonings.

I chose a filet mignon for my main entree.  I asked for it to be cooked medium and it came to the table perfectly seasoned and reddish pink inside.  The portion size surprised me--I was not expecting such a large filet.  It sat in butter and parsley and was incredibly juicy.

For my side, I ordered the mac 'n cheese.  This was just ok--nothing special.

Dessert was a moist, chocolate cheesecake with a pecan topping.  

Service was excellent but it was obvious that they are taught to up-sell!  
"For only $4.00 more you can upgrade your side, your dessert, your entree"...etc
That was the mantra all evening.

It was a wonderful dinner.

Valet parking is $10.00.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Honestly, not my fav. The ambiance was ok. It was too dark and dismal for my liking but I know most steakhouses are like that. 

The food was fine. I didn't find it as good as Alexanders to be honest. 

The service was great though. Ok to check out once but if you want the full package I think Alexander's is better.
author: Lucky N.

description: You can never go wrong with Ruth's. The service is always exceptional, the food is divine. The lighting is excellent, low and romantic even with a hint of privacy given off by it. We both love the filet, it comes with an amazing buttery sauce on a smokin hot plate that smells sooooo good! The mash potatoes and baked potato are both excellent sides. We eat gluten free and they always accommodate if necessary but the filet and potato options are naturally gluten free. We split a raspberry sorbet to top it off and it is always superb! Great drinks and excellent service, shout out to Jack at the San Fran location for treating us extremely well!
author: Aj L.

description: My girlfriends and i tried this place out for my birthday dinner this weekend. We booked whatever rsvp was open(valentines weekend) and had good reviews. I'm glad it was Ruth's!! Love the atmosphere, service, and the food! The fact that steak comes out sizzling and on a 500 degree plate, made it even more worth while. The lobster Mac and cheese is a must, they are generous with the lobster. I got the New York strip steak, medium rare, which was very flavorful. I think this is my new fav steak place and I'm dragging my bf here.
author: Linda l.

description:
My bf brought me here for my birthday dinner. Before I begin I want to clarify that my review is based only on this San Francisco location. 
So, the dining area we ate dinner is so small we could literally wrap our arms around the people next to us. The tables are so close together. I could hear our neighbors conversation. 
 We noticed a few others who arrived after us were served their dinner way before us. Mind you, we were the only people of color. That was extremely upsetting as we have been waiting so long for our food to arrive so I'm not sure what the case was for us to get served last after everyone in the room had their food. A couple waiters and waitresses continued to give us looks like there was an issue. We patiently waited for our food. Once food arrived I arrived I devoured my food which was delicious! Thank you. My bf was so pissed he didn't eat his food at all.. untouched. 
Over all this was the worst birthday dinner it all began with customer service. 
They seem to put certain people first who knows.
We will never return here and continue to share our experience with friends. 
Horrible horrible
author: April T.

description: My appetite said "Steak"! This is my 4th visit to Ruth's, didn't disappoint! Had t-bone very rare! Steak was tender, juicy, and full flavored.  For dessert, key lime pie, umm ummm!! H
author: Jim B.

description:
This place is fantastic! NOMS. NOMS all day long. Not only was my steak cooked to absolute perfection, the mashed potatoes were fluffy and delightful! My drink was perfectly made and delicious. My dessert - a cheesecake - was so good and tasty I'm glad I ordered it despite being a bit full. Worth it. Worth every single penny.

The restaurant is very nice and clean. Very classy joint. The staff? Helpful and very nice. If you are a steak person, I'd definitely say go try this place out. It's amazing. It's probably the best meal I have ever had, hands down.
author: Tricia R.

description: Not as good as the one from San Diego in Carmel Valley. This San Francisco establishment does not give you the same treatment. food is also lacking - I ordered ribeye and it has an after taste. Everything is a disappointment because I love the one from SD but this one is a total yikes!
author: Kane K.

description: Delicious food and great service. It was like no other restaurant I have been to when it comes to their service. They really take care of you and make sure everything is going good with your visit to their establishment. Be sure to Uber or Lyft there, so you don't have to worry about parking.
author: Angela M.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here for the first time for my bday. I really tried hard to enjoy it, but the most I can say is that it was decent but somewhat disappointing. We ordered our food and it came out pretty fast. Service was great. Our waitress was amazing.
The salad steak and dessert were great. What was disappointing was the garlic mashed potatoes. I didn't taste any garlic in it. It actually had no taste to it. It was so bland that my bf and I had to add salt and pepper to it. We also wanted to order drinks. They were already out of a lot of the beers and only had a limited selection in which my bf didn't feel like any of em. Keep in mind our reservation was at 7:15 so it's not like they were closing. The I tried to order a bottle of moscato and nope. They were sold out of that too. So we basically has water with our food. It was a disappointing bday meal that I was looking forward to
author: A S.

description: We came back and had a decent meal. Still the service is kind of lacking. But the food was A-OK.
author: Allen S.

description:
Dang! $64 for a steak??!!! Yup!! It was worth it! I had the Cowboy Steak and is was so good!! The meat was so tender! I'm planning to go back once I pass probation for work! This place will be my reward to go to! 
And G Money was our great consummate server!!
Thanks G Money!!
author: Rikou C.

description: Do not eat here!! Food was expensive and not even close to being worth it. The server Michael was great, but the Cowboy Steak had no flavor. The shrimp were super skimpy for $15!! I've been to many other steak houses and this one was the worst so far. Do not waste your money here.
author: Miguel H.

description: This Ruth Chris is wonderful! Obviously it's expensive but for a special occasion or a "treat yo self" kind of night it's perfect! The service was great and the food was AMAZING!! My girlfriend and I got a porter house for two, lobster Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, and asparagus (yes it was a lot of food, left overs for the win) and all of it was soooo good!! Honestly I wish I could eat it all over again. Once I save up enough I will definitely go back :)
author: Jorgen A.

description:
That bread is so damn good, I would come back here and just eat unlimited loaves of bread if Ruth Chris management allowed me too. 

I have been here twice within the same week period, once with friends and the other time with family. You can't go wrong with the three-course dinner special. You pick a salad, side and an entree and the prices range from ($45-60). Strawberry shortcake also arrives at the end of your meal. 

Both times I chose the filet & lobster and it was amazing throughout. Caesar salad was very fresh and probably the best caesar salad I have ever eaten. I love you Ruth Chris, and I can't wait to see you again! Your wait staff is the best!
author: Philip M.

description: My husband has been working crazy days and hours for almost 2 years now. So I had him take this weekend off for date night. A coworker told me of this place and decided to have dinner here. Michael and Arturo the bartenders were awesome! Irene and Arturo were as well. The food was perfect! For appetizer we had the crab cakes... and for main dish my husband had the lamb chops and I had the seared ahi tuna. I highly recommend this place. Nice atmosphere good employees
author: Wendy M.

description:
5 Stars except for some decor issues. When a bill for each table of 2 comes to an average of $250, you need to budget to make repairs to restrooms, carpets and front doors. You simply must. 
With that out of the way, the dining experience was lovely. The steak was rare but sizzling which is just so fabulous. Salads were fresh and flavorful. The creme brulee was perfection. There was light music and dim lighting. Romantic. The space wasn't overly loud and the vibe was good. Service was on point! We look forward to our next visit.
author: Disco B.

description: If you ever get the opportunity to go to the Van Ness location, request Chelsea! She is incredible! My boyfriend and I went for the fist time for his birthday in early November. I was completely blown away with her service and professionalism. She really made me feel like she cared about our experience, which was so special. To top it off, the meat is fantastic. I have never tried meat that way they cook it...you have to go to experience it for yourself. I will be returning for another evening in the future. Thank you!
author: Christine R.

description: After a Long weekend of hard work I figured I would treat myself to a nice dinner so I heard a lot about Ruth's Chris steakhouse so I said OK I will give it a try soon as I walked in The host was so polite escorted me to my table I thought right away wow what a fancy place The service was outstanding I had the ribeye steak cooked medium and it was absolutely delicious it was a wonderful experience I would definitely recommend it if you want to treat yourself for a nice dinner I also ordered the sweet potato casserole the best I've ever had for sure I hope this review was helpful to you steak lovers enjoy
author: Robert S.

description:
3/4, table for two were checked in at 630pm, seating was fast.
After tea and soda were severed, we found out the Signature Tomahawk Steak was out.
Hard to believe a famous steakhouse can't serve its "signature steaks", and we still get charged $12 for tea and soda that were untouched.
Ridiculous!
author: Osama H.

description:
We came here for an 8pm reservation and was a little late because we couldn't find parking but we still got seated right as we arrived. Btw, we still were unable to find parking and had to park at the parking lot nearby.. 

Anyways, we ordered the filet mignon and the petite filet for me because I know I won't finish the regular size, lol I actually barely even finished the petite! My bf had to help me out lol. I got mine medium well because I don't really like it bloody, but it turned out a bit over cooked and seemed more like it was cooked well-done :/ I will probably just get medium next time to account for the extra time they cooked it when I ordered it medium well. It was still really good though! Very juicy and flavorful :) we also ordered the roasted Brussel sprouts and the shoestring fries. The Brussel sprouts were very flavorful and yummy! The shoestring fries however, I will pass on next time. The fries were a little bit too thin for me and kind of hard to eat and lacked some taste :/ pretty disappointed in the fries :( next time I would like to try the mashed potatoes and the clam chowder and get the petite filet again! 

The ambiance was pretty nice, pretty dim lighting and cozy feeling. I was kind of disappointed that we did not have any candles on our table though, but there were candles on every other table around us. Maybe they just forgot about us :( I would definitely recommend this place tho, it's a nice place for a dinner date :)
author: Bailey L.

description:
This place really lives up all the hype. The food was DELICIOUS! The ambiance is nice, tables a little close together for my liking, but somehow not as loud as you would think. My boyfriend and I went there for Valentines Day and it was our first time dining there. We each opted for the special 4 in 1 deal which in life's a starter, an entree, a shareable side and a dessert. I started with the caesar salad which was really good but a little heavy on the dressing. He got the acorn bisque which smelled so sweet and tasted delicious. Next was the main course. I opted for the Filet as I always do and him the ribeye. First off, they are served on plates that are 500 degrees and sizzling hot. DO NOT TOUCH. However, this keeps the steak hot the entire time you are eating it which I thought was a really nice touch. The flavor on his ribeye steak was to die for. Both our meats cooked perfectly. The filet was tender and you barely needed to chew it. We chose the broccolini and garlic mashed potatoes as sides, both great. For dessert we upgraded to the berries and cream and the crime brûlée. Both very sweet but that's what desserts are about right!? Side note, the bread and butter, though plain, was REALLY good and we had to tell ourselves to stop eating it. 
The waiter was great. We are both avid beer drinkers and not wine drinkers so it's safe to say we were a little out of our element but the server knew every bottled beer they had which I was impressed with. Our drinks were never empty and our table always cleared which is a small thing I love is having a clean, cleared table. Since it was Valentine's Day, there were rose pedals on every table, the manager or owner was going around to every table and handing out gift cards and the ladies received a rose when the check came. These were all nice touches the restaurant did that I enjoyed and will definitely be coming back again!
author: Allison H.

description: Excellent steaks! My husband and I had the 16oz ribeye steaks and they came out to perfection. We ordered as sides the creamed spinach and mashed potatoes and they were delicious, creamy, and so flavorful. We were lucky in that we didn't have a reservation on a Saturday night, but we found an open table at the bar. The drinks were great. The ambiance was cozy and the staff was friendly and attentive. I would make reservations next time since it got really busy as the night progressed. I would definitely dine here again.
author: Tania C.

description: We have been sampling steak houses all over coastal oc. I wasn't expecting something crazy but boy was I wrong. The entire meal was perfection. Amazing attentive service. Can't wait to go back.
author: Perry C.

description: Birthday celebration was a night to remember! Christie was our server, she was phenomenal! She knew the menu like the back of her hand. She made us feel very comfortable. She was real and easy to connect with, at the same time being a top notch server! The food was decadent! If you don't like your steak spruced up with a lot of oil and herbs then just ask. The mashed sweet potato side is like heaven in your mouth. The decor, lighting, music, is dreamy. Keep it up Ruth's Chris! Keep it up Christie! Thank you for making our night special!
author: Connor K.

description: Took my son here for his birthday. First time for both of us at this chain. I knew that it would be expensive, but $200 for a very modest meal just isn't worth it. The steaks were okay, but not amazing. The sides weren't very special. Baked potato wasn't even cooked well. Mushy and had clearly been overcooked. Our waiter neglected us at times (had to ask for water twice). I think others were there for their birthdays, and they seemed to get some special treatment, but none for my son. They sat us in a weird spot, too. Overall, a huge disappointment. I won't be going back to Ruth's Chris again. I honestly don't understand why this place has such a good reputation. Maybe if you like Olive Gardens this place will be up your alley.
author: Casey C.

description:
Great service and great food.  I will give them 5 stars for their customer service.  I had a dinner reservation for 6:45 this past Saturday but were running late.  I called them explaining that i would be arriving a bit later than my scheduled time slot.  They went above and beyond and were able to hold our table until we all arrived.  They were also very attentive as were seated,  filled our drinks, and even gave an extra side because they goofed on their end,  

I would def come back here
author: A L.

description: Very delicious, not too overly seasoned. Price is a bit high, but the quality is what your paying for. A store bought steak has a lot of fat on it, but there was so much tenderness to their steak. Also not much chewy fat. The lobster tail was nice, but not phenomenal. Nice warm bread, smooth rich butter, and huge sides.
author: Thanh N.

description: I have eaten at every top steakhouse in SF over the past 25 years, and as controversial as this maybe to some, it is objectively the best steak in SF.  This Ruth's also brings out your steak on a sizzling plate which some Ruth's will not do.  The customer service is VIP.  The manager always comes by when my wife and I eat here and talks to us.  Jose and Arturo in the bar are 5 star all the way and always give us VIP treatment.  As for the steaks, throw a dart at the menu.  They are all top notch.  I.prefer the ribeye but also do the tbone.  Sides are excellent.  Better sides than Bobos or Alexander's or Bourbon steak etc.
author: Bryan V.

description: It was a little dark to see the menu but ambiance was nice. The food was good, cooked to perfection and they were on point with every wine pairing suggested. I would totally come back again.
author: Melody R.

description: Why you you post any negative comments? This restaurant is amazing!!! Love the food, the atmosphere, staff...EVERYTHING!!!
author: Sparkle G.

description: Good stuff. Expensive bit not outrageous.  Get the Mac and cheese as a side.  Filet was cooked perfect.
author: Andy C.

description:
My experience here was amazing! I took my partner here for a late birthday dinner and we were about 10 mins late for our reservations. We walked in and were greeted with a smile & positive vibes by everyone there. They greeted my partner a belated bday as soon as they met us which was sweet! (I forgot I had mentioned it when I made the reservation but glad they remembered!) 

Jason was our server and he made the night extra special!! He was very accommodating to our needs and questions. He recommended a wine to go well with the steak my partner ordered and with how he explained why, you know he was well knowledgeable of wines. He wasn't BS-ing any of it as the wine was perfect! When I had a chance to request for him to lit a candle when we order dessert, he had actually already planned to arrange it. 

Everyone there were so sweet! 

I have actually made 3 reservations in the past to take my partner here for his birthday the past years but somehow cancelled because we ended up going out of town. The wait was so worth it! Oh, to add; the food were delicious!!!! You can actually taste the love it was made with. Already want to return!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Their main dishes (steak and salmon) were prepared well but their side dishes tasted frozen/from the box (creamed spinach and mashed potatoes). I have definitely had better, and you can probably find better in the immediate area.

Aside from the food, our waitress was great.
author: Anette B.

description: I've been here before and rated it a 4 star. We had a party of 13 that was booked well in advance. They were horribly understaffed. Most steaks were good. But some were definitely too well done. Some sides were forgotten. The vegetables came after our meal was done. One of the guest had a bug on her side order when it was served to her. There was only 1 bartender so it took over 20 minutes to pay a tab before our guest could come to the table. This was a birthday celebration for my 2 adult children. We just wanted to leave so I took our cake back home. We also had to ask for our dessert for those that ordered to the meal. We had to ask for the check too and that took awhile. Perhaps someone called in sick or our waiter went home. Too much money spent for this type of service.
author: Kelly J.

description: Everyone I know love this place! I notice they eat items other than the steak. I am a vegetarian, I enjoyed the apple salad without bacon and cranberries. They could use new fresh soup selection. That would have made them a 5 star.
author: Tippy T.

description: Always a great dining experience here with exceptional customer service. Seared ahi tuna, calamari, chop salad, creamed spinach, lobster mac & cheese, french fries, porterhouse for two, creme brûlée, key lime pie won't disappoint. Ruth's Chris is actually the only place that I enjoy Key Lime Pie. Their key lime has the perfect "tartness" to my liking. On a friday evening at 4:30pm, was able to make a reservation for 5 people at 7pm that night.
author: Sarina A.

description:
Surprised my boyfriend here for his birthday this past weekend. We arrived a little early for our reservations but they were able to seat us right away. At 7, the restaurant was pretty darn empty...

This was our first time here and I thought you needed to be somewhat nicely dressed but I guess not if you have people coming in polos and jeans. 

Anyway, our server was nice but felt a bit condescending/had an air of arrogance about him. I much prefer the service at House of Prime Rib where the servers are much more genuine and energetic. 

I didn't like that our appetizers and entrees came all at the same time. All the other tables around us had apps first before their entrees were brought out. Bad timing on the kitchen's part I suppose. 

On to the food:
Lobster Mac N Cheese - a MUST order, this was delicious. The hint of green pepper in the dish was perfect. 
Hash browns - the boyfriend loves hash browns so when our server mentioned this as a unique to the SF Ruth Chris, we though why not. Completely underwhelming and was not worth ordering. We wish we had gone with the shoestring fries or ahi tuna instead. 
Raspberry Rosemary Cosmo - I may have gotten the name wrong for this, but it was good. 
Filet Mignon - boyfriend absolutely loved this. I had a bite and it was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. 
Lamb chops - also perfection. The mint jelly was also great with this. 

I'd certainly come back for the food here, but I wish the service was a bit less stuffy. And if you're going to be so stuffy, at least enforce a basic dress code.
author: Doris K.

description: This was such a disappointment.  The steak  lacked flavor, the salad was mostly hard bitter greens  and lacked flavor. I wondered why house of prime rib was so much busier, now I know.. The quality was not commensurate with the taste. Next time we'll plan ahead and make a reservation at House of Prime Rib.
author: vicki M.

description:
Happiness is... seeing my mother smile.
Came here to celebrate Mother's Day for my Mom and Sister.  

First, I want to start off by acknowledging their service.  I had made reservations a week in advanced.  Come the day of, I kept calling them to make minor changes to accommodate my sister's family.  If I were on the line with me, I would've been irritated but they were very understanding and friendly.

A few of us got the Ruth Chris Classic which includes salad, entree, side, and dessert.  Very worth it for the price.  We upgraded the sides ($4 charge) to share with the whole party, family style.

Complimentary Bread - I use to LOVE the bread here and would request for a fresh loaf to go but it doesn't taste like it use to =(
Caesar Salad - I love caesar salad and this was good but they went a little overboard with the dressing
Filet Mignon - Medium rare, perfectly executed.  It was a lot bigger than I pictured it (that's what she said)
Creamed Spinach - Not as good as I remembered.  Pass on this
Mashed Potatoes - Can't go wrong with mash
Shoestring Fries - Large portion, thin, crispy, not too salty
Brussell Sprouts - Cooked perfectly and the bacon added flavor

Among the 5 of us, all the upgraded sides were unnecessary.  We were pretty stuffed but the good thing with leftovers is that it makes a great lunch.

Happy Mother's Day~
author: Linda N.

description: Had the Best Birthday Party for Canadian relatives which was amazing in a beautiful private dining room. We were all impressed by the Seafood Tower, the Tomahawk steaks and salads were the best! We got the total royal treatment service!  Call Anita for special private parties, Darrell or Crystal to make your reservations.
author: Pam H.

description:
I'm going to be moving soon and one of the things I'll miss most is coming to this Ruth's on the reg! This has been my neighborhood joint for months now (yes, it is a very expensive neighborhood), and I always sit at the bar. The bartenders are consistently FANTASTIC (Jose, Arturo, Brian) - going to miss them as much, if not more, than the food.

On that note, the filet is absolutely melt-in-your-mouth and the Caesar salad may be the best I've ever had. Nothing makes me happier than a garlicky dressing to go with some crisp romaine.

I know there will be other Ruth's in my future, but I'm sure none will provide such a perfect experience - I'll miss you!!!
author: Jessica M.

description:
We somehow felt our server kind of forced us to pay the tip she wanted us to pay. 

We were there on Jan 6th 2017 for dinner.  The food was great.  We are very easygoing people.  We usually don't pick on stuff.  But, this time, some of the  services were a bit off.   For example, they seated people who just walked-in first instead of people with a reservation.   That was fine with us.

But the main thing that made me feel uncomfortable was that I somehow felt our server kind of forced us to pay the tip she wanted us to pay.  Here is what happened: when we were paying  for the dinner, our server took a hand-held credit card machine to the table and I put the credit card into the machine, and punched the percentage of the tip I would like to tip, and handed it to her.  She took a look at it , and then swiped my card again and had the machine printing out a paper receipt saying something like the previous transaction didn't go through, and then she pulled out her iphone, putting it on the table in front of us, and calculated the tip with the percentage she wanted  for me to put on the receipt.    I am not sure  whether she was  just trying to help or not.   I just felt very uncomfortable when I realized what happened!
author: TY H.

description: Okay but over priced. Hot sizzling plates of steaks with lots of butter. Not mind blowing for the price but decent experience and cool chain
author: Mason L.

description:
came here for a special occasion, made reservations for a Saturday night and there was no wait! we got seated promptly, it wasn't super busy but had a good ambiance. nice, romantic setting albeit a bit dim in the dining room. both my dining companion and I ordered from the "Ruth's Classics" (?) section where you get a salad, choice of entree with side dish, and dessert. I had:
- Caesars Salad : not sure why but this simple salad was delicious, i usually don't finish the salad appetizers at restaurants but I gobbled this up!
- Fingerling potatoes: THESE POTATOES ARE CRACK POTATOES. so delicious, seasoned so well with lots of garlic and spices. 
- Filet mignon with jumbo shrimp: The shrimp was seasoned well, the filet mignon was a tad bit on the salty side. 
- Dessert was chocolate berry cake, the chocolate was rich and filling.

Overall its a good value. If I had to compare to House of Prime Rib, Ruth Chris isn't as exciting with the presentation (how can you beat a meat cart from HOPR), but they seat you promptly vs. 1 hour wait even wth reservations at HOPR. More variety in the menu here. Would come back in the future if I had a special occasion.
author: Wendy L.

description: We had reservations for 6:30, got seated at 7, but waited patiently because it was Thanksgiving. Got seated in the bar area where people that did not have reservations sat, and it was pretty bad. Didn't get water until 30 minutes after we were seated. Got to order food an hour after we were seated. There were people seated there that came in without reservations after we came I. That were seated before us and were done dining before we got our opportunity to order. Once we got our food, our steaks were cooked incorrectly, but there was nobody to tell about it because rhe service at the bar was subpar. We've dined at several Ruth's Chris locations i n the past, this is the only one we can say with certainty we will never go back to.
author: Jackeline L.

description: Very low quality service, it seemed like one our waitress was on something. And when I called to complain to the manager the manager said he will return my call back and he never did. So this says a lot about their customer service
author: Muska B.

description:
I've recently found my old account for Yelp and I'm in the midst of transferring over my reviews. The rating and the review are exactly the same so their overall review didn't change as I've deleted my reviews from my old account and it's not inactive. Reposting the old reviews with my previous ratings was the only way I can transfer these over unfortunately.

Review date: 1/20/2011 
I've heard mix reviews about Ruth's Chris, some says its the best steak house and some says its just another pricey chain restaurant. Hmm.. I'm honestly not a huge steak fan so I can't necessarily say what's the best. I did order a tiny steak that was part of a 3 course meal. It came with gumbo soup which I thought was a tad salty and a dessert which was very yummy! I also ordered a side of shoe string fries and seasoned string beans, both was absolutely amazing! Luckily there is valet parking but there is also metered parking around. The bill came out to be $200 including tip for two people, steep? Not really considering my boyfriend was really satisfied ;]
author: Yvonne L.

description:
I made a rsvp for two but I showed up with an extra person and they didn't decline to take my extra guest. They was gladly to sit us down. Great attitude and service. 

Lobster Mac n cheese - So gooey and so much flavor. Cheesy and lip smacking 

Filet - cooked to perfection. I like my meat well done. No red at all. It was mouth watering
