Whole lobster - we left them to leave the whole body including the fat on there. It was so sweet and tender. It wasn't over cooked. 

All the entree was just marvelous!
author: Stephanie N.

description: I'll say this - the steak was great. But at these prices it should be, and there shouldn't be any disappointments. Unfortunately there were. The waiter gushed enthusiastically over the "fantastic home fries," talking me into what turned out to be not home fries at all but an 8" disk of unflavored (except for salt) deep fried shredded potato. My wife's brussels sprouts weren't much tastier, even with bacon, unless you consider melted butter a seasoning. I took home the bread pudding dessert from my three course "Ruth's Classics" dinner (a good deal), but they left out the sauce. For over $140 for two with no alcohol I expect better.
author: Walt B.

description:
It had been a while since our last visit. I remembered it as an upscale steak house with delicious food. Sadly this has changed. 
The service was friendly and professional but the food was mediocre. Three of our four steaks were overdone and looked nothing like those shown on the website. The prices were about $85 a person including a starter and dessert. This was a poor value. As an added insult the room was freezing cold with the AC on full force. They did correct that.     You can do much better in SF.

12.7.17 Addition.  This poor experience continues to annoy me.  I'm so sorry that I didn't complain at the time.  However, it was a birthday celebration and I didn't want to "ruin" the dinner getting steaks redone etc.  But it's still in my "craw" and I'm hoping that another edition of this negative review will help me forget.  If not, I'll put another addition on this review.  :-))
author: Rusty B.

description: i went to Ruth's Chris in San Francisco tonight, and this time is most worse experience. I went to Ruth's Chris many time is Orlando. I like the steak very much and bring friends to eat, because i got the temperature alway right. But this time i brought my friend's family to eat, so three order's rib's eye medium only one order is ok, two are overcook. when i talk to the server, and the server said one was right temperature and he can redo another one. i don't want to argue with him and my friend's daughter take the over cook one and she just eat a few bits. i feel so sorry for her. the manager was nice and taking care of us, and finally i got right temperature steak and give us big discount, but still i felt disappoint for my favor steak house and get worst steak with my friend's family fist time dinner.
author: allen j.

description:
My boyfriend's dad invited us to their company holiday dinner, all expenses paid. We had 3 bottles of cab, all excellent. The service was amazing, our server was patient and extremely accommodating. His recommendations were spot on. We decided to order some appetizers and sides to share 

FOOD:
-lobster Mac n cheese: nothing too special about the Mac n cheese, the flavor was a bit bland. 
-stuffed mushroom: not bad but I wouldn't order again. 
-calamari: not a fan. 
-jumbo shrimp: great dish to wet your appetites. 
-asparagus: seasoned perfectly but a bit oily. 
-garlic mashed potatoes: I loooove mashed potatoes and definitely loved Ruth's. 
-filet, shrimp, & lobster tail: I thought the filet was a bit dry, wished it was a bit more rare. The shrimp and lobster tail melted in my mouth. Amazingness!
-raspberry sorbet: refreshing but I was already stuffed beyond belief to finish. 
-chocolate trio: not the biggest fan of chocolate so I thought it was too sweet, but my bf's sweet tooth thought it was perfectly delicious. 

Overall, I had a GREAT meal with spectacular service! Definitely making the boyfriend take me back for more hehe.
author: Jessica C.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary on a Monday night with reservations at 6pm. We were seated almost immediately at a booth. The lighting was dim, which is perfect for a romantic meal. Our server was very nice and talked us through the meal and suggested that we order from the Ruth's Classic because it's the best deal. 

We both decided to order from the prix fixed option, which comes with a starter, entree, side dish, and dessert. We both got Caesar salads for our starter. He ordered a 16 oz. Ribeye (for an addition $4) and I got a Filet Mignon, medium rare. For the side dishes, we ordered Mashed Potatoes and Creamed Spinach. For dessert, we opted to just get the Chocolate Turtle Cheesecake w/ Cranberry-Pecan Chocolate Bark. We also brought our own wine ($15 corkage fee), which I definitely suggest doing because the price for a glass of wine is ridiculous. 

Five minutes after we place our order, our waitress comes back and tells us that they are out of Creamed Spinach. I was really surprised because I know Ruth's Chris is known for their creamed spinach and to be out of it after an hour of opening for the day is pretty absurd. Nevertheless, we replaced the creamed spinach with sauteed mushrooms. I was a little disappointed, but I just brushed it off because it was our anniversary after all. 

When our food came out, my filet mignon was so tough to chew and overcooked. To make the meal worst, the table behind us received creamed spinach, even though they ordered after us. Our dessert came out with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate, which was nice. Overall, I was actually really disappointed in my meal.
author: Melanie H.

description:
What an amazing experience. Made reservations here Thursday night as a surprise for my girlfriend's birthday and we were blown away. 

Got there around 15 mins early, checked in, and took a peek at their menu. When they brought us to the table there were "happy birthday" confetti all around the table. It was a nice touch and my girl really enjoyed that. We were served by Jessica and Justin. They were both extremely friendly and knowledgeable about what was served at the restaurant. 

Felt like the entire restaurant was working to make sure we had a good time. Never had to worry about our waters going empty or if we needed anything they were there to help us with it. 

We both went for the Ruth's classic which was a great value. Came with appetizer, entree, small side and dessert. I believe $50ish/per person. 

I got the corn chowder and she got the strawberry almond salad I believe. Both were great. We both ordered the 12oz ribeye and I picked creamed spinach while she picked the mash potatoes. 

 The ribeye was phenomenal. It came out sizzling hot and the meat itself was extremely tender and delicious and cooked perfectly medium rare. The size of the ribeye was more than I had expected. I don't remember the last time I couldn't finish a nice piece of steak, but that day, I just couldn't. Glad I didn't upgrade to the 16oz! Everything was absolutely delicious! Although the spinach was okay to me. 

Overall, this was a great experience for my girlfriend and I.

Would I be back? Definitely.
author: Michael T.

description:
Ruth Chris was phenomenal. I was a little hesitant because it's a chain but I wanted a steakhouse and something close to the Kabuki theater on Valentine's Day so I made my reservation over a month in advance (I'm a planner). Due to my drinking one too many beers while doing my makeup, we were 10 mins late for our reservation (shout out to our Lyft driver who drove like I was 10 months pregnant with L&D set as my destination tho). I thought they would honestly just send us away. But they didn't even guilt trip us! They said we'd just have to wait about 5-10 and that was just about exactly how long we waited. 

We stood by the bar and watched this awkward encounter happen between this lady trying to order to-go from the frazzled bartender and that made for decent entertainment during the brief wait. 

Our server was phenomenal. Full disclosure: I gave her my number like a creep cuz I wanted to have a dog play date but she never called me :( she probably thought I was just on MDMA but I  was rly just high on love and passion for my grossly attractive date. We think her name was Nikki but I gotta check my records at home. Yes I said "check my records". 

The food was incredible. I ordered a Caesar salad and it had A LOT of dressing on it so I was scared. But I finished the whole thing, it was SO good! The croutons are insane. I told our server how much we liked them and she brought us a little bowl of them to snack on!  

I ordered the petite filet, cooked black and blue. It was the best steak I have ever had in my life. The outside was seared and flavorful and the inside was raw, succulent and juicy, just how my freaky self likes it. It was served on a 500 degree plate swimming in butter. Side note everything should be served on a 500 degree plate swimming in butter TBH. The fact that the steak was so rare yet the plate was so hot was incredible because normally rare juicy steak is not going to be super warm, since you are undercooking and then letting the meat rest. The effect this hot ass plate had on my dining experience was magical. That butter tho. I never knew how much a steak wanted to be drenched in melted butter, it's the right thing to do. The creamed spinach was amazing, I barely renember it because I inhaled it. 

I can't talk to you about the bread pudding because I don't want to get emotional or start crying. It was so good. So good. I opted for the Grand Marnier sauce which was incredible and reminded me of the Grand Marnier soufflé at La Gare in Santa Rosa. Omg. 

Go here.
author: Emma H.

description: If you are looking for a solid piece of steak for dinner, this is a good place . I definitely appreciated it the fact that they had a 6 ounce filet for those of us that can't finish a 10-14 ounce steak. Service was very good too. Overall, would recommend!
author: Jane F.

description:
I decided to take my boyfriend here for his birthday since he loves steak. We enjoyed the experience, but I was debating between giving 3 or 4 stars, and here's why:

Pros:
- Staff is very attentive. Since it was our first time here, our server made recommendations, was patient with us while we ordered, and was quick whenever we needed service. While waiting for our food, I noticed that other servers tended to their tables quickly and frequently too.

- They have a good variety on their menu. Tons of appetizers - we decided on calamari, and it was delicious! You also have many options of steaks, cuts, and sides. We went with the creamed spinach & mashed potatoes.

- I liked the ambience. The restaurant was dimly lit & classy.

- Complimentary dessert!

Cons:
- I wish I knew that their plates came out hot. I ordered my steak medium rare, and the plate cooked the steak til it was medium well. My boyfriend, who loves his steak very very rare, ended up with a steak that would've been better suited for my liking.

- My steak wasn't as tender as I hoped for. The flavors were alright. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't anything AMAZING or too memorable.

- Parking can be difficult. There are parking lots around the area. Luckily, we found street parking 3 blocks away which isn't bad at all, but if you want to avoid the walk or being late, there's always valet.

Overall, it was a good experience, we had fun trying Ruth's Chris!
author: Diana X.

description: Went here for a friend's birthday. We had a party of 10. When we arrived there they had put little happy birthday confetti on the table which was a nice touch. The service here was amazing. The staff was very attentive. The steak was delish very soft and moist.
author: Adele C.

description: I love Ruth Chris' steaks. By far the best steak I've ever eaten. Everyone here seemed so well put together. Food was great pricey to be expected by this restaurant but overall enjoyed it!! I ordered a 6 oz even though it wasn't on the menu. It was just enough along with the sweet potato casserole. And for dessert I helped myself to a key lime pie. Perfection!!
author: Jai S.

description: I had expected more. For the price we paid of almost a 1000$ for a dinner for 6 people, the service was atrocious. I don't know how you have repeat service. Everything was late or cold or over cooked and nothing was comped nor did a server or manager offer to fix the problem. It was the worst steak dinner I've had in SF and I will not be back EVER. Just wow! How do you sleep at night?
author: Gregory F.

description:
Me and my boyfriend decided to come here for our 5 year anniversary. We heard really good reviews about this place so we decided to try it out. Our waiter was wonderful, he walked us through the menu and recommended a few things for us! And also at the end of the meal, he got us a complimentary dessert that says "Happy Anniversary" which made me really happy! 

The food came really fast, I didn't have to wait that long, I also think because it was a Sunday? 
We ordered: Crab stuffed mushrooms, Lobster Mac & Cheese, Sautéed spinach and Mashed potatoes. I totally forgot what entrees we ordered but it was delicious! 

For sure going to come back here, this place is great!
author: Josephine H.

description:
Ruth's Crist Steak House has been an institution  with me since 1972-44 years. It was and is a venue with great class, superior service, and superb food. Last Sunday night I took my wife to the San Francisco restaurant for a celebration. My wife is a frugal and careful person with money. We elected to use the Restsurant Week program to lower the normal cost that is in the range of $250.00 for us.

We had a reservstion and were promptly taken to our table. When the waitress saw that we were on the Restaurant Week program we got the feeling that we were being treated like second-class citizens. We ordered drinks and they were quite nice. Our salads were made with old lettuce and could have been better. I ordered shrimp with my filet. The meat and shrimp were quite decent. My wife had another dish that was acceptable. We had a tiny dessert and coffe. The bill was still in excess of $150.00.  We feel that we did not get value for money. We will not return any time soon.
author: Jack W.

description:
Ruth's Chris had a reputation that always Delivers it doesn't matter witch city you go and try them they will always meet or exceed expectations. 
This was my second time coming here, the bartender Arturo immediately recognize me from last week and greeted me then asked back for more? I said yes back for that steak you talked so well about - Even do it's Super Bowl week and the place is Packed my appetizers and Food come out in Record time and Exactly as ordered. 
The Steak Was amazing, it was everything I've been craving the whole week - the lobster was full of taste and the shrimp where perfectly cooked -
I would recommend Ruth's Chris to any Local or Tourist that wants good service and great food in the the city of San Francisco 
I will with out a doubt come back!
author: Hector G.

description:
We were there on Thursday night.  After we got bumped out from House of Prime Rib!!!
I loved third Ruth's Chris steak house. A third time visit within past few years !!! My husband took me there when we were dating !!  I always think place is a little Pricy.  
Services Great ! My filet was a bit Salty ! The creamy spinach was excellent ! And the cheese cake mmmm....
author: Kitty C.

description:
I'm going to keep this short and sweet. My boyfriend insisted we come and try this place out for our half anniversary, so we made reservations and were seated right away when we arrived!

I love their presentation with everything. When we were seated in this dimly lit restaurant, our server gently scattered beautiful rose petals and warmly welcomed us. My boyfriend ordered a blueberry mojito (which quite frankly just tasted like a normal mojito) and I ordered some grapefruit cocktail which was super tasty! We also ordered crab cakes and a pair of steaks. The crab cakes were excellent and our steaks were even better! I ordered the prime rib. LOVED IT. I cut into the steak effortlessly with my knife. The meat was well marbled and it just melted in my mouth. So good!!

Definitely a great place for a romantic date. Would love to return here again!
author: Stacey C.

description: Hands down the best stake house, with consistent quality of food and excellent service. It is a good value for the money too. I have been a patron since 1993 and absolutely love the food here. I hope it never changes!
author: K Z.

description: This is my worst ever steakhouse experience. Waste of money & time... We ordered the Cowboy Steak and side order of asparagus and lobster Mac & cheese. The only thing that was kind of ok was the side of asparagus! Lobster Mac & cheese was so tasteless and flavorless. The steak was swimming in butter! The worst part was the fact that we were seated in bar area where all the servers come and pick up their drinks and have a chat in the mean time. ( even though we had a reservation and the restaurant seemed like they had many unoccupied tables in dining rooms.) It was so loud and noisy we couldn't even enjoy our conversation. I asked the host for why they'd seated us in the bar area when they had so many other tables for us and he went to ask his manager and came back with a "sorry I didn't do your seat assignments" ! the manager or whoever he went to talk to didn't bother to come and talk to us. I normally don't write any bad reviews unless it's really bad and that really was the last thing that made me write this review. I hope this helps people have an idea of this place and the restaurant to change some things...
author: Meral K.

description: Few of us went for dinner this past weekend. We've heard so much about this place, and one of the other's had actually been to the one in Texas. Well this place was more hype than anything else. The service was great, but I've had better tasting steaks with flavor, and my lobster was slightly under cooked. The Moscato and Long Islands....:) :) :) Best part of the dinning experience!! Too many other steak houses in the area for me to return back to this place for dinner.
author: Mika D.

description:
Their participation in "SF Restaurant Week", or what we all know as Dine About Town, brought me in to this steakhouse chain a second time. The restaurant was buzzing and every table had seated diners.

We wanted to upgrade the petite filet to the ribeye and the waiter kindly recommended ordering their prix fixe menu off their regular menu to save a dollar (literally $1). It also had more starters and sides to choose from. Gumbo is great but a bit heavy when a big slab of red meat is on it's way. The caesar salad was classic and a large portion! Ribeye was a nice medium and luxuriously covered in sizzling butter. Mashed potatoes and mushrooms were okay. The real gem was the dessert. Upgraded to the Cheesecake and Chocolate Lava cake. I prefer Roy's for lava cake but the cheesecake was SO GOOD. It wasn't too sweet and the plate is decorated with just a few berries and raspberry sauce. 

Service was really friendly. I was pleasantly surprised by my whole experience and would be happy to come back!
author: Samantha L.

description: I wanted to make my Mom's birthday extra special by bringing her here for a late lunch/early dinner.  I didn't think not having a reservation was going to be a problem.  The restaurant opens at 4:30, we pulled up at 4:25 and saw people sitting inside so we went in.  The girl at the front desk was on the phone and had her back to me.  She got off the phone and kept her back to me, I am pretty sure she knew we were there since my husband had to walk past her to go to the restroom.  When she turned around I asked if I could put my name on the list for a table of 3?  Her response was, we don't open until 4:30.  I looked at the time and it was 4:27, I replied it's 4:27, you want me to stand right here and come back to the desk at 4:30.  She said again, we don't open until 4:30.  Well okay.  I asked my husband to put our name in at 4:30 because they weren't open yet while I used the restroom.  At 4:30 when he tried to put his name in he was asked if we had a reservation, which we did not.  He was told they were full and our only option was the bar.  I am really not sure why we couldn't have been told this at 4:27.  There were other people sitting and waiting, I am assuming for their reserved time.  But did they get to check in prior to 4:30???  And the people sitting in the bar, did they just go to the bar area on their own free will?  Or were they told they needed a reservation as well?  I don't mind sitting in the bar.  What I mind is a business having their doors open if they don't want to help their patrons, especially given the price you pay to eat there.
author: Tabodie C.

description: My partner and I made reservations at this place for 9:30 PM. We were 10 minutes late, however I called in advance and they said it was fine. Once we got there, we were seated after 5 minutes. The service was really fantastic. They were very attentive and polite. Food wise, it was pretty good.  I got the surf and turf. The lobster was cooked to perfection and my steak was indeed medium well. The dessert which was apple cheesecake with vanilla ice cream was light and very creamy. I also tried their creme brûlée, which was amazing. Will come back!
author: Lorraine J.

description: My wife and I came a while back and I left kind of underwhelmed and unimpressed with this establishment.  The food was very unremarkable.  The ribeye I had was just not very good and tasted too buttery for my liking while the filet my wife had was a little better.  I had chosen asparagus, which I don't know why exactly I was expecting, but tasted like just grilled asparagus which lacked seasoning if any sort.  We also had the creamed spinach which was my favorite dish of the night, as well as the tasty mashed potatoes.  The salads we had were pretty standard salad so that's nothing to really write home about.  Service was pretty slow but decently attentive.  I wasn't sure if they were torn between giving us privacy or just not noticing us since we were seated basically in a corner, but I felt that service could have been better seeing as how that was part of the experience.  I can't foresee coming back anytime soon unless we were in a pinch but it's definitely not the worst experience I've had at a decently priced restaurant.
author: Charles H.

description: Parking is mainly the reason why I knocked off one star off this business. It was a bit inconvenient that it took almost 20-30 minutes circling around finding a spot which left me hangry.  I came in with a table filled with small heart shaped cutouts sprinkled all over the table. I did enjoy my stay at Ruth because of its 16oz steak - Two or three bites, I was already stuffed! Let alone, the bread and appetizers that came along with it. I ordered Ruth's classics which came with an appetizer (mashed potatoes), main dish (16oz rib eye), and dessert (cheesecake). I also had a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon that compliments well with my order. I definitely left with satisfaction! Thank you to our waitress who warned me about the hot plate (literally it burns when you touch it!).
author: Christina B.

description: Service was fantastic! Our serve was super nice and explained how the dining experience went very well and consistently checked on us to see how we were doing. He was really sweet and brought out a dessert for us on the house for our anniversary. The food was fantastic and super filling. When they say the sides are family sized enough to share believe them. I got the one in filet while my family got the lamb chops. The meat was tender and flavorful. Definitely would come back for special occasions
author: Laura T.

description:
I haven't been this uncomfortable since my dad's 30 minute speech at my Bar Mitzvah.

First of all, Ruth's Chris is one of my favorite businesses of all time.  Even though the steaks come out drenched, showered, and splattered with butter, Ruth's Chris just knows how to make steak.  Call it a chain, sure, but this is still the best steakhouse in San Francisco, period. On this particular night, they were serving the Bone In Filet - which is freaking perfect. 

It is evident that they spent a lot of time on the customer experience.  From the always friendly and professional host/hostess, to politely escorting you to your table, to the extremely attentive and over-qualified wait staff, Ruth Chris understands the customer experience, or they did, at least.

After another stellar, perfect performance, it was time to pay the bill.  Our waiter dropped off the check, and then promptly showed up with one of those janky, ugly, bright, large, archaic mobile credit card machines.   My friend and I were enjoying our conversation as we wrapped up an amazing meal, and the 12 minute awkward interruption began.  I was handed the device and instructed to swipe my credit card, at the table, over white table cloth.   After inserting my chip, I had to choose the tip amount (right there, while the waiter was looking over me).  I noticed that the device accepted Apple Pay, so I instead took out my phone and to pay via iPhone. While the transaction was processing, the waiter informed me that if I use Apple Pay, I will be unable to tip for some reason.  At this point any positive vibe was broken, and both the waiter and I wanted this process to wrap up asap.  I then had to start over, insert my chip, wait for the VERY SLOW machine to process it, click the TIP button (which would have been easy to miss), insert the tip amount, and then wait for the machine to process the transaction again.  After all this, the waiter handed the device to my friend and the whole process started over!  

A long-time Ruth's Chris superfan, I went away dissatisfied and annoyed -- it didn't feel high end anymore and definitely reflects on the brand.  RC higher ups-- can we talk about this?Over steak perhaps?
author: Don T.

description: Great steak as usual  ! This is my 3rd time at this location and I have always been pleased.
author: Anga B.

description:
The food at Ruth's Chris was pretty good, but I probably wouldn't come back for a return visit, given the other delicious steak options in San Francisco.

Came here for a friend's birthday with a large group. Service was good, but our area was surprisingly crowded, considering the restaurant was pretty much empty!

I opted for the Ruth's Classic, which added a starter, side, and dessert to your selection of meat. I got the 12 oz Ribeye, which was tender, and cooked to the perfect medium rare.

Though the meal was good, the price tag did not fit. Try Alexander's for steak or HOPR for Prime Rib instead!
author: Michelle L.

description:
We had a 6:30 reservation but ended up showing up 1/2 hour early. I was happy we didn't have to wait long to be seated. Had the Tuna for appetizer and it was delicious. The ribeye was tasty and tender. Server was knowledgeable and attentive.
Can't wait to go back
author: Monica D.

description:
My boyfriend and I dined here during Valentines Day. This review is kinda late lol

Service was great, loved the ambiance, and roses they were giving away.
Surf n Turf - meat was delicious and lobster tasted fresh. 
Seared Ahi Tuna- This was so tasty! Definitely set up high expectation as it came as our appetizer.
Cheesecake- We requested to have Happy Valentines written on our dessert plate but our server said that that's not going to happen as everyone in the kitchen is so busy. That makes no sense as it doesn't take 10 minutes to write that message.

Anyways, I will definitely come back here again and recommend this place to everyone.
author: Jennifer B.

description: The food was amazing as usual. The fact we had to wait for seating even though we made reservations a week early and we were seated in the bar area was a major disappointment!! It was a birthday dinner and we didnt want to sit there but that's what we got. The crab cakes were amazing and the cowboy ribeye and filet were great cuts. The martini and our Moscow mules were made perfectly!!!
author: Player L.

description: Decent steakhouse with good service at very expensive prices.  Service is good but food presentation is odd with serving in small plates.  You really can't screw up steak I suppose so it's a matter of salt and pepper and making sure you get the temperature correct.  If you love meat and have the money then it's good enough to come back.
author: Joel M.

description:
Wait Time: Make a reservation, otherwise you will most likely be seated at the bar.

Unique Factor: 3/5 - Ruth Chris is a steakhouse serving USDA Prime steaks (under 2% of all US beef) on 500° plates. Their special Farmer's Market Salad had "croutons" that were chunks of bacon! Definitely a dinner followed with a food coma. This is definitely not your weekly dinner spot, not for your waistline or wallet. 

Service: Matches the experience.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
We came here to celebrate a birthday party. We had a reservation and were seated promptly.

What we swallowed:

STEAK HOUSE SALAD:

FILET AND LOBSTER TAIL: I read the reviews that said they overcook it so I made note. I like my meat medium well so I ordered a medium and It came out a perfect medium well. So order a rare size up so that you get the right cooked meat. Maybe it 'cuz it's sitting on a 500 degree plate and it makes it cook longer than it needs to but nevertheless go with a shorter cut and you'll be pleased. It was a very tasty filet and the lobster was just as delicious

PINEAPPLE MACADAMIA NUT UPSIDE DOWN CAKE: This cake had all the components of everything we love:macadamia nuts AND pineapple but something just wasn't good here. It just had an off taste and we both really didn't care for this dish. 

CHOCOLATE SIN CAKE: This cake is no joke about being sinfully decadent. Super moist and thick, if you love chocolate then you will love this cake. The strawberries were even great to cut into the chocolate. 

Our server was nice but he made us feel hurried and rushed and then left us alone for long periods of time without checking on us (I needed a drink!). Then when I wanted to ask him something, he would hurry by, lift up his finger at me and say "I'll be with you in a minute." like i was bothering Him.

How can you not love the butter topped pieces of carnage? Food was great but the service was less than desirable.
author: Vivian A.

description: We came here to celebrate our 7th anniversary and the visit was a COMPLETE waste of time and money...such a disappointment. Although noted on our reservation, we did not get rose petals on our table like they said we would when making the reservation and it took at least 10 min for a server to greet us at the table. While we were waiting to be greeted by our server, all we could hear was loud rap music blaring from the back party room (don't get me wrong, I like rap music but a bit inappropriate at an expensing steakhouse). Once our server finally greeted us, we placed our order for app's and those took 25 min to get to the table. When they arrived, our server apologized and informed us the Oakland Raiders were in the large dining room and that the kitchen was backed up (the rap music now made sense). We immediately placed our orders for our entrees and sides and those took another 25 min to come with the steaks being luke warm, the sauce trio messed up and the sides barely edible. We had to motion someone to come over everytime we needed water and our server did not check on us until we told him to clear the table. I would've thought that looking at a table where items are barely touched, a waiter may ask if everything was ok--he did not. The dessert we ordered (creme brûlée and cheesecake) were by far the best part of the night. Almost $300 later, we walked out annoyed and extremely disappointed and probably will not return again with the amount of other options there are to try. Spend your money elsewhere!
author: Kimberly S.

description: Bomb food! The New York steak was completely worth it. As well as the shoelace fries. The employees were very friendly as well.
author: Paola A.

description: The staff here are literally jerks , with a nasty side of prejudice. Valet is a joke.
author: Dante D.

description: Had a full course dinner: appetizer, steak, dessert, wine. My review is solely on the steak as that's what this restaurant is known for. Underwhelming for the hype and lacked complexity in flavor. Over salted, over buttered. Your basic steak that you could probably buy from Safeway and replicate at home. Will not be returning.
author: Christine D.

description: I have been to multiple Ruth's Chris including the flagship NOLA location and never experienced such bad service in any bar/restaurant in my life. I am visiting San Fran  and figured it'd be a great spot for happy hour. After asking for the menu was told there wasn't one and I just ordered a drink and did work on the computer.. within 5 minutes of ordering my drink I was brought my receipt in a glass cup without a word.. I think it is extremely rude to not ask someone if they want to order anything else after such a short amount of time at a bar.. I guess they wanted me out of there! I put my card down while watching the bartender ask all the other middle age men sitting there (I'm mid 20's and female) how they were and there names.. this man didn't even ask me if I wanted to close the bill before I even half finished my drink! On top of that, my card sat beside my bill for more than 20 mins before I finally had to put it on top of  the cup to get his attention. Which means he wasn't even looking in my direction, He then gave me my receipt back with my card without acknowledging me at all and Without saying anything! This is extremely rude and terrible customer service. I will never come back to this location again and wouldn't  recommend it based on my experience.. regardless of age or gender you should provide everyone with the same service!
author: Stacey K.

description:
Ruth's Chris management:  Brian, Breanna & Nico

Express Parking: Amen
 

Terrible service, ruined wife's 50th birthday and Ruth's Chris Valet damaged our car. Thank you for a abysmal night out.  

I made 7pm reservations for four for my wife's 50th birthday via the web.  We arrived at exactly 7pm and gave the keys for my car with brand new rims/tires to your valet attendant from Express Parking.  Valet was $14, I gave him $20 and asked him to take care of my car.  He said thank you, and pulled it forward while we waited in the front area.  My wife checked in and was told to have a seat.  We waited about 5-10 minutes prior to being seated.   

This is where our experience degraded:

* Hadji, our server, did a brief into and then disappeared.
* We had to ask three times for more bread - I asked random waitstaff as ours was nowhere to be found
* We had to ask multiple times for drinks and water as our waitstaff was missing
* Our mixed drinks took 20+ minutes to arrive. 
* My Goose and 7 tasted like water as the ice melted by the time we received them
* We waited 35+ minutes to have our order taken.  
* Hadji was very rushed each time he did come to our table.  I interacted with the other waitstaff more than our dedicated server.
* Hadji told us the mashed potatoes that come with my sons surf and turf was small, so we ordered a separate order.  Turns out it was near full sized.  So we had more potatoes that we needed.
* We had to flag down random people to top off our water and ask for more bread.  
* This was my wife's 50th birthday dinner.  No mention of her birthday other than the sprinkled birthday glitter on the table.  I don't know what Ruth's Chris policy is, but I recall on my birthday I was given a small tart or some desert with a birthday wish on it.  Perhaps that was another steakhouse. 
* While it is exciting to see pro athletes, we noticed the difference in service he and his family received next table down from us.  Waitstaff wishing them a happy birthday, etc.  This did not go over well with my wife.  We've seen the nice birthday wish other people receive.  
* Getting our check took longer than normal.  And, surprising to me, I had to waive my bill holder with my card around in the air to flag down someone other than our waiter to make payment.  
* Almost two hours to eat dinner without appetizers and without desert.   Most of that time was spent waiting.

At this point I have a $278 bill, a pissed off wife on her 50th birthday, and I'm trying to figure out why I went out of my way to take her to your restaurant.  We headed out front to get my car, which had been backed up about 50ft to make room for your other valet customers.  The attendant was rude to my wife when she simply said "the Tesla over there" pointing to my car.  He rudely said "oh, I have another one in the garage, do you want that one instead?"   I was shocked at his curtness and totally unprofessional response.  I told him I'd take my car, thank you.  

When he pulled it up he parked it at an odd angle, and was unfriendly and brief giving me the key.  I knew something was wrong but sadly, failed to inspect my entire car.  
We we returned home and my flood light turned on I found the rim damage.  The right rear rim has been curb-rashed the entire circumference.  Its beyond me how someone runs the entire rim along a curb.  Anyone who has ever driven a car would STOP when they first made contact with the curb.  

After calling you directly four time and leaving messages as you happen to always be busy.  Too busy to call me back.  I'm left writing this review and making sure anyone I do business with knows how we feel about our night with you and the total lack of followup.

Your horrid valet service seems to operate the same way you do; total silence and denial.  They deny they damaged my car and will not even work with my insurance company to work out liability.   I wonder if they even have insurance.  

The only comfort I have is knowing that business Karma catches up with everyone.  It always does.  You both will have terrible experiences and I'm very sure you'll be treated as you have treated my family; total lack of respect and professionalism.  When that happens, take a moment to reflect on how you have handled this situation, and know I'm smiling somewhere else enjoying properly prepared food, respectful service and someone parked my car that knows how to drive and how to own up to their errors.
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: This place used to be good. Take your business somewhere else. Service was inattentive, starting with the women at the podium. The waiter had no personality, just a robot taking orders. He asked if I wanted medium-raw. I'm just hoping I don't get food poisoning. Be forewarned.
author: Diana d.

description: Reservations for 7:45 on a Saturday night - same night at the Chinese Festival made this a very busy restaurant. Amazing service, great food, not that great of a view/location and kinda stuffy (temperature wise). The martinis are stiff and the steak is soft, like melt jn your mouth status. Make a reservation and get yourself some meat !
author: Isabel S.

description:
Alright, I'll admit, that I came back to Ruth's Chris because of Dine About Town. But, what I found was that their standard has remained the same while my taste and steakhouses around the city have gone up in quality, taste and value for money.

For starters, I was not impressed with their DAT menu; there were only two items on that menu that was on the regular menu. My girlfriend ordered from the DAT menu, consisting of the house salad (no choice), the 6oz Filet and the chef choice dessert (again, no choice). I opted from their more expensive prix fixe menu, consisting of the Caesar salad (1 of 3 choices), the 12oz Ribeye (1 of 5 choices) and the bread pudding (no choice).

I have nothing to complain about the salads, both of them were full portion and tasty. The steaks were well portioned also and initially they were done properly. However, since they serve their steaks on a VERY hot plate, the steak will continue to cook throughout the meal! My medium rear steak ended up being medium well before I got to the final 1/3! And, I know I shouldn't complain about getting a lean steak, but Ribeyes normally have some marbling giving it some tenderness, mine felt more like a tenderloin than a ribeye. I had a side of mushroom with my steak and they were very flavorful.

Both of the desserts were just OK. The chef choice dessert turned out to be just a chocolate cupcake with a dollop of icing on top and red sauce swirled around it. The pineapple coconut bread pudding was just so so, nothing to write home about.  

Service was kind of inconsistent. Our waitress was very patient with us initially while we were trying to decide whether to go with the DAT, prix fixe or a la carte menu. Then, she pretty much was a no show the rest of the night. Our water man refilled our glasses 3X. The manager did stop by to ask if everything was perfect. But, the slow service made our 3 course dinner last more than 2 hours! At $110 for the two of us, it was a very expensive and barely enjoyable evening.
author: Tony L.

description:
Best bar with the best view in town. Truly awesome. 

Do not forget to look at the bar only happy hour menu. A steak sandwich to die for. A best deal in this town and far beyond. 

Wonderful Russian bartender mixes the best drinks in town. 

Enjoy the sunset of the White House view.
author: P- A.

description: Yum yum, would definitely recommend this restaurant to out-of-Towners and locals alike. The food was exactly to order, and the steak & lamb chops were melt in your mouth good.. Oh did I mention the people at the table next to us were Raiders players? Nice.
author: Candise H.

description: A good steak house. Service is really good: appropriately attentive, friendly, and not pretentious at all. Generous pour for the cocktails. Ahi tuna appetizer is delicious. Salads were a bit heavy on the dressing, and cheese. My steak was tasty, but overdone so that's why I'm giving a 3 versus a 4 star review (I requested medium on the rib eye and it came out well done). Because of the great service I'll give Ruth's SF another chance.
author: Neil X.

description:
Love this location of Ruth's Chris! Have been coming for at least a decade. On this occasion, I came with my friend for her birthday dinner. We both went with "Ruth's Classic dinner". We started with the yellow tomato bisque soup (SO GOOD), I also ordered the crab mushrooms, which were amazing, too. For our main course, we both had filets, I ordered mine with lobster tail, her filet was 11oz!( it was huge). She had the creamed spinach as her side, I the mashed potatoes. Nicole was our server and she was attentive, knowledgable, and friendly, (she even threw Happy Birthday confetti on the table upon arrival!) 

I will definitely go again when in SF!
author: SpottieMatic X.

description:
Trust me.. as a big fan of steak, I would suggest this place more than anything. Since my trip to Cancun, I've praised the steaks made here... but not only do they serve steaks... they are very versatile with chicken and seafood as well. Do yourself a favor man... go up to SF and get yourself a reservation at this place if you ever have the time.

It's worth the money, and it's definitely worth the time. Don't take my word for it though... it's just a suggestion. Try it though, and I doubt you'll be disappointed.
author: Steve N.

description:
Had a good time last night, we went for their 1965 Cocktail Dinner Party which was excellent. Laura Karaliute (General Manager) is really really  amazing, she is very accommodating, making sure everyone is having a good time, making sure food is served properly.

The food is excellent, we had a pretty good size scallop, shrimp and perfectly cooked Filet Mignon, we have a 5 course prix dinner with paring of different booze, the price is very reasonable...

I highly recommend to anyone to try their event, it's worth what you are paying for.

Amazing and I'm looking forward in attending Ruth Chris other event or hosting.
author: Marie R.

description:
Every time I read the airline magazine, I drooled over the picture of a perfectly cooked thick piece of filet from the Ruth's Chris' ad. This year we decided to celebrate our anniversary here which happens to fall on a weekday; we even pre-paid for parking at the garage right around the corner, didn't realize the valet parking at Ruth's only costs $10. 

Arriving early to avoid traffic (before 6pm), the place was almost empty, we had our pick on where to sit, since the more formal area by the window was not open until 6:30, we chose to sit in the bar area close to the front. 

Service was very attentive and friendly from the start with the rose petals sprinkled on the table. A glass of Merlot for each to start; hubby ordered his NY 16 oz medium rare with an appetizer of crab stuffed mushrooms while I had the 3 course prefix with house salad, filet and lobster and dessert; in addition we ordered the lobster mac N cheese to share. 

The appetizers came within minutes, salad was good, liked the taste of arugula,  stuffed mushrooms were OK, not bad but not great either. 
The winners were the NY steak, perfectly seared, tender, juicy and super tasty, I had a little taste and the rest was inhaled by a happy hubby. The quality of meat really stood out and was well worth the price. The mac N cheese was also wonderful, rich, cheesy flavorful topped with chunks of lobsters. it had certainly lived up to it's reputation, although not normally a fan of mac  n cheese, I must say it's one of the best .  My filet / lobster combo was good but the steak didn't not look like the ad :) ... it was pretty good but did not blow me away. 

We had candle and ice cream added to the dessert (course #3) and they made it look really nice,  we were also given 2 extra desserts to go as anniversary gift?

Overall we enjoyed Ruth Chris quite a lot, the atmosphere was a little more casual then I anticipated with is a good thing; the cut of steaks are definitely premium and cooked right. We will be back.
author: Julie W.

description:
I've reviewed this Ruth's before, and always love it - five stars. But last night disappointed.
Why? The food was consistent and excellent as always. We love the chopped salad, filet steak, lobster mac n cheese, spinach au gratin, and the cheesecake. Wonderful. Mike was our server- he's great. 

What sort of messed up the evening was seeing a number of young men, maybe around 20 years old, coming into the restaurant, totally showing their butts, in underpants, with the pants and belt far below. 

I was really surprised to see guys wearing this "look" coming in for dinner - with their pants clearly below their butt cheeks.

Ewww! What an inappropriate look to wear at Ruth's Chris. 

IMHO, management needs to make a corporate decision: that allowing guests with their pants sagging is not allowed. Other diners do not want to see this in a fine restaurant.
author: Richard T.

description: I know it's a chain, but this location in SF is the first Ruth's Chris I've ever been to and it's amazing! I was skeptical about their claim of having only the top selection of beef in the country, but the steak was seriously impressive. It's served on sizzling hot plates with melted butter, which can't be beat. Favorite cuts are the NY strip and filet. Highly recommend getting the trio of dipping sauces on the side - the teriyaki is my personal favorite, but mushroom and truffle butter are also solid. After sampling a variety of appetizers, our faves are the creamed spinach and potatoes au gratin. Only issue we ever had is when we ordered the brussel sprouts and they were barely even cooked, but the servers were nice and didn't have a problem with us returning the dish. Cocktails were a little strong for my taste, but you definitely get your money's worth! I usually stick to wine, and they have a TON of options, especially if you're getting a bottle. Dessert is also solid, if you're not already stuffed from the meal. Recommend the créme brûlée or white chocolate bread pudding, which comes with your choice of creme anglaise (raspberry is my favorite). Excellent service from start to finish!
author: Roxie B.

description:
We came here for valentines day. My lucky bf surprised me and of course, he made reservations on the VERY LAST MINUTE. I guess someone didn't show up for their reservation. The wait wasn't very long. And of course they had the lights lovely dimmed. They handed me a yellow rose when we were seated. Just a comment but I guess they had those roses out of water for a while because they were pretty wilted. But it was a really lovely complimentary gift they handed out.

They had cute little red heart confetti sprinkled all over the table. They of course brought out some warm bread and butter. I found it unusual that the butter wasnt warm temp or whipped. Not complaining but for a real nice place, you'd think they would have thought about that. 

I ordered the prefix dinner. The beet, goat cheese salad was divine. It had walnuts and such light dressing! We shared the salad so I wouldn't get too full and it was a nice serving. I ordered rib eye medium rare. It came on a hot plate and their idea is so that every bite is as hot as the first. I definitely recommend medium rare for that reason because it will cook more on the plate. We always wondered what 50$ steak tastes like and oh my god, it was worth every penny. They only use salt and pepper since its such high quality steak they don't want to deter from its original flavor. It didn't need much. It came with buttery mash potatoes. I loved everything it came with. We also shared the dessert which was some sort of chocolate fudge. It was so rich and delicious. It came with fresh fruit and cream sauce. Of my god, I loved it. It wasn't even that chocolatey. 

We also shared the lemon drop. It was a bit strong but we didn't get tipsy off it of course. My bf ordered a rib eye and 2 lobster tails. He ordered medium rare but it came medium sadly. The lobster tails were also a bit overdone. Definitely don't order the lobster tails.

I'd say we will definitely come back once more time. It was really romantic and delicious.
author: Lynn C.

description: The steaks are honestly some of the best in California, they're so fresh and just juicy on another level.
author: Alice M.

description:
Making a reservation a week in advanced and coming 15 minutes before the time scheduled is not enough, they will still make you wait 45 minutes to seat you. I checked in 6:58 and wasn't seated till 7:44pm. It wasn't until I complained to the hostess as I was about to walk out when we were finally seated. I'm pretty sure the kitchen that night were either under staffed or incompetent because we waited 30 mins for our appetizers and another 25 mins for the steaks then 5 mins afterwards for the sides. The only positive aspect about our visit was our waitress. She was prompt and paid attention to our every need. She was fully aware that the kitchen was backed up and kept apologizing to us about the delay. The quality of the food was spot-on but the timing was horrible.

In summary, don't come here on the weekends because the hostesses don't care how long you wait. Kudos to our server for making the dreadful night somewhat tolerable.
author: Julian T.

description: I would not recommend this location Walnut Creek Ruth Chris's is much better and cleaner not only was every member of the staff rude the food was not the way we ordered it and the rudeness of the stuff from the waiter to the bartender to the hostess was horrible but the biggest concern of it all while we were eating we Saw an  extremely large rat problem under the table I am surprise they are not shut down by now the health department needs to inspect this restaurant I would not recommend to eat to this establishment for your health and your concern if you want the true experience and good food and good people go to the one in Walnut Creek
author: Victoria A.

description: They always say there is a first time for everything. Well, today is my first time sitting down to have Ruth's Chris. The wait time to be seated was only about ten minutes. The price is pretty steep though. Be prepared to spend any where from 60 to 129 dollars on a single meal. I went with the Ruth's classics. I'll say the service is good, but nothing distinguishes this place from anywhere else. I'll be honest. Overall, I'm not that impre
author: Ramsey A.

description:
Went here last Thursday for a 30th Birthday Party. We were a party of eight and found our table set very nicely with 30th confetti. We had gotten drinks at the bar and the hostess asked if we would like to add them to the tab, yes. As we arrived at the table two people were missing, the bartender insisted that one of the guests, the wife of our host and her daughter, stay and pay up.  They are from Sweden and very polite, so she stayed to pay. Yikes!
We ordered and started a long wait. Finally after about a half hour the food came. THREE steaks were overcooked. Should have been  2 medium rare, and 1 rare. They were all well done.  We pointed it out and someone came out with a flashlight to examine them. How rude. They were sent back and another 20 minutes passed. Our host's wife ate her potato and I ate my shrimp. It was embarrassing to say the least.  I was here in the 80's and loved it, expensive, but worth it. This time it was not a good experience. I won't return, but I have my memories of the good ol' days.
author: Diane H.

description:
Disappointed in the service and food. Came here for a birthday celebration. Our server wasn't really on top of his game. We had early reservations so it wasn't even super busy when we were there. You would think the service would be extra good considering they knew we were celebrating something special. We even mentioned to the server neither of us had been there before. He kept thinking it was my birthday even though we told him repeatedly it was my boyfriends birthday. When the food came out we were really disappointed by the quality of the side dishes. The lobster Mac n cheese was super low quality. Not creamy. Severely lacking in flavor all around. Wish we hadn't ordered that. The Brussel sprouts didn't seem cooked well. They were very bitter, oily, and hard. The scalloped potatoes were the best tasting side dish, but it wasn't hot when we were served. It was barely warm. Cheese was barely melted on top. It definitely needed more cooking. Not to mention we actually were brought the wrong side dishes at first and not what we ordered. In addition, My boyfriend ordered the surf and turf and they brought out the steak but not the lobster. When we asked, the waiter said he had forgotten to place that order so it would be awhile. He ate his steak which was super undercooked for how he ordered it. He ate the edges of the steak but inside was way too undercooked. By the time the lobster came out we had already been eating other food and didn't have an appetite for much else. Took it to-go but lobster isn't really good reheated. It was a waste. We ordered dessert and I ordered a coffee with it which was never brought out to me. When we received the bill the waiter mentioned he forgot to bring my coffee. He offered to bring it but we had already finished dessert and we're ready to leave. Was looking to have a superb time and expected stellar service, received the opposite. Disappointed, don't think I'll be back. Lots of other nicer steak places with good service. 

The pros would be the table we had was probably in my opinion the best table in the house. Nice corner location in the back of the room. More private and quiet. Less people walking around us. The confetti on the table was a nice touch for the birthday dinner. Wedge salad was good.

This place isn't on my recommendation list.
author: Christal G.

description:
We had reservations, for two couples celebrating their anniversary, for 5:00pm on a Saturday night.

We arrived in SF about 4:30pm and decided to head over the the restaurant, so we could get parked and sat at our table.

Upon arrival, we could not locate the valet parking, which was all that was offered.

We drove around the restaurant, came around and noticed there were cars parked in the area where the valet parking should be.

There was no one out front, but numerous employees, coming inside and outside of the restaurant.

We figured maybe they no longer offered the valet parking, so we had to drive around the corner and park in the parking garage, on a slight hill.

(Slight hill is a problem, if you have someone with a walking disability, which we did)

Upon walking into the restaurant, we were greeted and told they don't open until 5:00pm but we could sit and wait.

The hostess mentioned it was completely booked through 9:00pm and it's a good thing we were early, so we could be sat first.

We asked about the valet parking and she said it is from 5:00pm. We mentioned how we thought that was a little strange if our reservation was at 5, because you would be slightly late, if you just started getting valeted at 5pm.

We mentioned we had to park around the corner in the garage and wondered if we could have valet take care of it, so when we were leaving, the car could be brought around, as it was clear that our friend was disabled. She just said no, they do not do that, and that the garage is expensive. (That was obvious, when we parked in it) 

She said that is just how they do it. We then noticed someone getting ready to take care of valet.

When we were sitting in the waiting area, we could not help but notice that the glass and mirrors, were in need of cleaning, floors were very dirty. The light shone on the underside of a bench and you could see where it was swept or mopped in certain areas under the bench, but not thorough. 

The restrooms were not as clean as I felt they should be for this type of establishment. The bathrooms were not close to being Disney standard and I feel that Ruth's Chris should top Disney.

We just felt there was no attention to detail, as there is in other Ruth's Chris restaurants.

We then noticed someone off the street, with a skateboard, come in and ask to use the bathroom. (We're not snobs, but this is not a Mc Donald's, for someone off the street to come in and just use the bathroom) The hostess told him it was towards the back.

The man went to the bathroom, I guess, and then came through the waiting room, hopped on his skateboard and left.

We did not get sat at our table until 5:00pm, on the dot, and valet was still not out.

Once we were sat, our waiter came and introduced himself. He was VERY good! His name is Kenneth.

He was on the ball and took care of us very well.

The food was very good. Everything was good, but my filet was excellent!

I was slightly disappointed about the whole parking issue, as it's not fun having your disabled friend have to walk down a street, that is on a hill, even though the garage had disabled parking, which we used.

If they took care of the parking and cleaning issues, it would really help this restaurant become the restaurant that fit into the Ruth Chris family.

All in all its a three star experience with a five star price. Not good.
author: Juan H.

description:
A nice dining experience.  We started with
The calamari appetizer which I didn't care for. It was too sweet. 
All of us had the 3 course prix fixe.
The gumbo was very good. 3 of us had the filet mignon with lobster tail. The lobster was dry. The filet was tender and tasty in butter.  Sides of mushrooms were good as well as the shoestring potatoes and creamed spinach. BBF had a steak and it looked good.  I didn't like the strawberry shortcake.
author: Ry T.

description: I'm so disappointed the food here is too poor to deserve a rating higher than 2 stars although the service was good and friendly. I had a $170 meal for one person including tip and the food was miserable. The 16 ounce bone in filet mignon although cooked to medium rare temperature wasn't great was it the meat? The lobster tail was the frozen supermarket type and was salty and chewy. The fully loaded baked potato was just gross and the toppings were watery and not flavorful. I decided early tonight to either go to Osso Steakhouse or here and I wasted all that money for bad food. I'm so upset.
author: N A.

description:
YUMMMM. Best steak that I've eaten in the city. Hands down.

I ordered the filet mignon, and wow it was literally a party in my mouth when I took the first bite. Entire time, my taste buds were like oomph or oOo la la, and jumping around in excitement, wanting for more.

Wow ... I just drooled on my keyboard .... that has never happened before.

It comes on a 500 degree plate, and you can literally hear it simmering and sizzling as you cut into the steak. I always like my meats medium rare, and they cooked it perfectly. Beautiful pink color but not too pink, very moist, very flavorful, great texture. 

We also ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese and loaded hash browns, and oh my goodness they taste absolutely delicious. Very sophisticated flavors, perfect balance of acidity and richness, and I'm literally at a lost for words.

For dessert, I got the cheesecake, and oh my, best cheesecake I ever tasted. Yes, it's even better than Cheesecake Factory. It's creamy, it's super fluffy and soft that melts in your mouth, great balance of sweetness and tanginess, and the crust was crunchy.

Fantastic service! The waiter kept checking up on us to make sure we're good. Oh yeah, I'm definitely coming back.
author: Xin W.

description:
Valet is $12
We arrived about 15 minutes earlier than our reservations but it was not an issue and they seated us within minutes of arriving.
There's no real dress code for Ruths Chris, but I would recommend business casual or casual dressy. 

Our waiter, Phil, was very friendly and attentive. He definitely made our experience at Ruth's Chris that much more pleasant.

We ordered from Ruth's Classic menu. Which comes with your choice of starters, entrees, sides and dessert for under $56/ person.

Starters
Caesar salad, was a basic Caesar with fresh Parmesan, this would be my choice again when we go back
White Bean & Chorizo soup, was decent, it tasted more like tomato than chorizo or bean. 
House Salad, was okay, the dressing was not spread out evenly, so at times I was just eating lettuce lol

Entrees
Sordfish was perfectly cooked, and it was a perfect sized portion 
Ribeye was ordered medium rare, it was juicy and had so much flavor. It was served on 500 degree buttered plate. The size of the steaks were pretty large, we didn't finish them and felt stuffed. 
shrimp and filet, both the filet and shrimp were cooked just right, of course the filet is smaller portion but with the shrimp it is beyond filling. 

Sides
Southwestern mac n cheese, was a little spicier than  I expected. I like spicy foods and it wasnt bad, but I could have done without all the jalapeno. My boyfriend on the other hand loved it. He said it was one of the best mac n cheese he's tried. If you don't mind spicy food I would definitely give them a try. 
Mashed potatoes were soft and good, I didn't think they tasted any different than any other mashed potatoes you would get at any other restaurant.

Drinks
Classic Absolut Mule, made with Absolut Vodka, Stoli Ginger Beer, Fresh Lime Juice and a ginger candy garnish. It wasn't strong and made just right.

Blackberry Sidecar, made with Remy Martin VSOP Cognac, Cointreau, Freshly Squeezed Lemon Juice, Muddled Blackberries, Dash of Plum Bitters, Topped with Plump Blackberries, with a Sugar Rim. It was really sweet and yummy.

Dessert
And lastly we all ate the Chocolate Turtle Cheesecake with a side of Cranberry-Pecan Bark.
The chocolate Turtle Cheesecake was rich and tastey, The cranberry pecan bark is made with dark chocolate and satisfied our sweet tooth but after the entre, sides and drinks I didn't have much room left for either of them.
author: Andrea M.

description: I split the spicy lobster appetizer and Cesar to start. Then devoured the veal osso bucco ravioli. Finished my dining experience with their bread pudding!!! Everything, including the bread was divine!!!
author: Alexis C.

description:
Took my woman here for her birthday (first time) and she loved it, has a nice calm romantic setting to it. I believe Anthony was helping us, very informative, helped us out a lot, very patient.

The food was a1 like always, went with the New York strip (my gf too) wish she coulda got medium instead of well done (she's pregnant) also got the crab stuffed mushrooms as an appetizers also pretty damn good.

The only thing I didn't really like was at the booths we were placed at didn't have too much leg room at all.. Me and my woman's feet kept touching, not too bad but yeah. Overall pretty good experience, I'm used to the Ruth's Chris in Walnut creek.
author: Travis W.

description:
This place is amazing. The filet was tender and melt in your mouth delicious. The chop salad was to heavenly and the berry and cream dessert was unforgettable. You have to go to this place at least once and you will be hooked. 
Tried other locations in Seattle, San Diego, San Francisco and outside the USA.  San Francisco chef makes the difference. Not all are as good as this location. I was sorry they let go of the banana cream pie but hopefully they will bring it back at some point. Different than usual and 10 steps above the rest ( I don't even like banana cream pie but I love theirs)
author: Pierre M.

description:
I just got back 5 minutes ago from my dinner and just needed to write this review fresh from my memory. 

Parking: I parked in the public parking structures for $5 an hour that was a little past the actual restaurant-I think it was 1700 California? and that seemed easier than going to valet. 

We had a reservation for 7:30 P.M. and though we got there at 7:15, we were immediately seated and Mike was our server. He was GREAT. He gave really helpful insight into the menu and was extremely friendly. 

Ordered the: calamari, the cowboy ribeye (rare), and the Ruth's classic with caesar salad, creamed spinach, 6 oz filet & shrimp, and got a complimentary dessert: chocolate explosion!

Calamari: absolutely delicious. I love that it wasn't totally enrobed in some frying batter. Lightly fried and tossed around in a sauce that tasted like grapefruit, vinegar, cilantro, lemon (I'm probably totally all wrong, but this is what I got from the sauce. and it was great.) It is a pretty big appetizer. 

Caesar: I'm never one to order this type of salad, but after looking through reviews, I decided to give it a try! It's a little dressing-heavy, which I don't mind, but if you don't like that much, then you should ask for dressing on the side or light dressing. It is covered in freshly sliced parmesan that is just so great. 

Cowboy ribeye: YUM. You can see the meat quality, and it was definitely cooked to perfection. 

Creamed spinach: it was okay.. a little too creamy and not salty enough so I packed on that salt. 

6 oz Filet & Shrimp: For me, it is the perfect size. It is a cute little filet topped with 3 grilled shrimp. Shrimp is tender, juicy, and fat, and the steak was also a deliciously tender. A little butter heavy, but that is the Ruth's Chris signature and Mike warned me at the beginning of the meal.

Chocolate Explosion: Perfect end to this meal. Warm, gooey chocolatey goodness topped with cold velvety vanilla ice cream and drizzled in caramel. A win in my book. 

Overall, Mike's service really made this meal outstanding and enjoyable. I am definitely glad to have chosen this steak house and will be back here soon.
author: Shelley K.

description:
Butter lovers paradise. 

I've been to Ruth Chris many many times in the DC area. Back then, it was considered a VERY VERY fancy restaurant because well, I was in college and anything was more fancy than McDonald's (but for real, I still love McDonald's). 

My boyfriend has never been to Ruth Chris so I told him I'd take him only because it was restaurant week. Ruth Chris isn't my favorite so I personally don't want to pay full price for it. 

There was a man who came to check on us every now and then and refilled our waters. He was very pleasant and warm. The main server lady was interesting. I asked her for the restaurant week menu and she said something along the lines of how they hide the menu and don't bring it out unless people exclusively ask for it. She said it in a tone that made me seem less of a human because I wanted the restaurant week menu and that Ruth Chris was THE GOD OF RESTAURANTS. 

Listen, lady. To me, Ruth Chris is literally just ok but it definitely isn't THE BEST, MOST EXPENSIVE, MOST FANCY restaurant so please get off ya high horse and give me the restaurant week menu. 

I ordered off the restaurant week menu but my boyfriend didn't because he wanted a bigger piece of meat. 

The bread is good. The water is good. The salad is good. The bottle of wine we got was fine. 

We ordered the lobster tail mac and cheese. Apparently, the one they were making for us sat in the oven for too long and got burnt so they made us a new one. I appreciated the honesty and the re-do. When it came out, it was very watery and I was not impressed. Do.not.get.the.lobster.mac. Please. 

Mashed potatoes: it literally looked like someone took 2 cups of melted butter and poured it in the bowl, put the mashed potatoes in, and then poured more butter on top. I thought it was mashed potatoes and gravy, not mashed potatoes and butter. Barf. 

Steak: Yeah, it was real juicy and buttery. The steak was so flavorful, probably because of the butter. Half way through the meal, I saw a 4mm layer of solidified butter on my plate. I kid you not. 

I felt really disgusting after the meal. I walked 2 miles home to try to make myself feel better and drank a detox tea before bed. My insides felt very greasy the whole weekend. This is def not a light meal and I def would not go again. My boyfriend felt the same way but at least he can say he's been to Ruth Chris before.
author: Esther C.

description:
I'm writing this review with a little bit of disappointment. My bf was really excited to eat here so he made reservations about a week in advance for Thursday at 7 pm. I'm not much of a steak eater but I was down to try Ruth's Chris. 

Service: Everyone was super friendly and sweet! (I almost feel guilty giving them 3 stars because everyone there was so nice!) They explained the different steak options and came around frequently enough to check up on us/refill water/refill bread. 

Food: We ordered the lobster mac and cheese and the 3 course special with the ribeye steak. We opted for the Cesar salad as our starter. The Cesar salad was yummy - super cheesy (I love cheese), crunchy, and tasty. The lobster mac and cheese however, looks better in photos than it tastes :( I'm not a fan of the little mac and cheese pasta noodle which is what they used and the cheese was a bit too liquidy. 

The ribeye was really rich. My bf thought it was alright but didn't care to eat there again.
author: Kayla O.

description: Been to several Ruth's through the years.  I've been to this location two other times and had the same experiences.  They've all been great Service including this place.  Food was at spec for Ruth and this location.
author: Paul F.

description: Can't go wrong with Ruth's Chris!  Ordered the Ribeye, lobster Mac n' Cheese, corn, mashed potatoes and had the iceberg wedge for appetizer.  The staff was top notch.  The meal was prepared perfectly!  Our drinks were never empty.  Can't really beat the service or quality of the food.  I would say that only thing that could have improved was the timeliness of our bill.  We sat for quite a while before receiving our check to settle up.  That was a tad annoying to say the least!  Other than that, expected a great meal and Ruth's Chris delivered!
author: Brian H.

description: The hostess and waitstaff were very attentive.  The chopped salad and cocktail I had were delicious.  However, we ordered the $57 seafood tower and the lobster on the tower was frozen solid. It was inedible but it was Christmas so we decided to take it to go instead of making a fuss. The meal was saved by the chocolate duo we had for dessert.
author: Stacey B.

description: Wow! My first experience was an amazing enjoyment with some of my close friends. Everything from our service to our food was perfect! We all had medium rare Cowboy Robert streaks!
author: Alyssa S.

description:
This location is really great. It has sort of an old world decor, that we like in a steak restaurant. New, trendy, artsy steakhouses turn me off - I want consistent tried and true steak on a sizzling platter.

Ruth's Chris is a New Orleans institution that carries a few New Orleans recipes on their menu world wide. The N.O. BBQ Shrimp is the best around, and even rivals Mr. B's in New Orleans...they beat Pascal's Manale by a bit, and Manale's claims to be the originator of the dish!

Service was top notch, we were seated exactly on time, and the wine the waiter suggested was just right. We suggest that you get a lobster mac-n-cheese side. That, and a steak is plenty to eat.

Our last visit to a Ruth Chris was in Hong Kong!! It was just as good, but as you can imagine, it was double the price.

I doubt you would find a better steak in SFO, and if you said you did, I might argue with you over it!
author: Ken K.

description: Steaks cooked perfectly every time we dine here.  Delicious side dishes and great service.  This continues to be my favorite place for a great steak dinner.
author: Peggy K.

description:
+ THE FOOD
The food was amazing here! I didn't enjoy my first time at Ruth's Chris at a different location but it was a lot better at the SF location. I ordered the Ruth's classic, consisting of the steak salad, 12 oz ribeye, creamed spinach, and a dessert. The steak salad was perfect and wasn't too filling- definitely have to try the champagne vinaigrette!! The ribeye was amazing! I had it prepared medium rare and it was perfectly juicy and the flavors were so good. I was a bit hesitant ordering this at first because the last time I had the ribeye at another Ruth's Chris, it was underseasoned, but I definitely made the right choice. The creamed spinach was a bit bland this time and it was just okay. For the dessert, I upgraded to the creme brulee for an additional $4 and it was perfect. The creme brulee is a big portion and the custard is amazing!!
author: Cindy C.

description: I forgot to write a review for here. I came for SF restaurant week a few months ago. I don't recommend making a special trip out here just for restaurant week. They do have a special restaurant week menu but the prix fixe dinner they offer every day is very similar. So I ended up getting the restaurant week special which was the house salad, petite filet with creamed spinach and a carrot cake dessert. Mainly because it came with a dessert and the prix fixe did not. My friends got the prixe fixe and it comes with shrimp and steak (surf and turf) along with a salad and side (we tried the mac & cheese and the corn). My steak was nicely cooked and tender. And I liked all the sides we had except for the mac & cheese since it had a slight kick to it (from jalapenos?) and I'm not a fan of spicy. I also don't think that that was how it was advertised on the menu. It was about a $50 meal. Service was good. We made a reservation on open table, I think and they seated us promptly when we all arrived. Parking in the city is a pain but lots of paid garages around. It's not really around BART or that would be way more convenient.
author: Alison W.

description:
Came here on a weekday and the place was completely empty!

- Caesars salad - I dunno what it is about this salad but I actually loved this. We all cleared our plates out! Fresh cracked pepper on top really made it one of the best I've had.

- Filet - seriously such a great cut of meat. It has that buttery and velvety taste that you long for in a filet but they made my portion just a tad too salty compared to my friend's filet, which they had done perfectly.

- Lobster tail - Good but doesn't taste fresh, so I'll prob come back only for the steaks.

- Lobster mac n cheese - Ok, this was my go-to dish all night! So glad we upgraded the sizing on this. You get chunks of whole lobster in here and the flavoring was done perfectly, not too cheesy or salty.

- Mashed potato - Standard, not great.

- Potato au gratin - Pretty cheesy and quite buttery. It started forming a layer of grease on top and it didn't look appetizing after 20 min of sitting there so we skipped this.

- Creamed spinach - It's good but the ratio is a bit off; I would have liked more spinach. 

- Chocolate duo - Actually found that this wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. Not bad with an extra scoop of vanilla ice cream!

It's a three star experience. As long as the steak is good, I'm okay with the restaurant, but the sides don't have me coming back for another experience.
author: Sally C.

description:
went here the other night with a couple coworkers to celebrate our birthdays.
we all ordered the deal that came with starter, entree, side, and dessert.
for an extra $4 you could upgrade your dessert.
we all did that and because we were all celebrating out birthdays the waiter didnt charge for the upgrade.  its the simple things like that that make people happy.
we will be back!
plus the steak is awweesssooommmeeee.
author: beth m.

description:
Sister came to visit, so taking her to Ruth Chris was a plan. We made a reservation but ended up being a little late due to traffic. I called in to inform them about the late arrival, and the hostess was so flexible about it. We got seated right after we arrived, and out server Jessica was so nice and informative. We both have the Ruth Classic with ribeyes and we shared mashed potatoes and creamy spinach.... Oh wait, I forgot about the corn chowder with crumbled bacon on top. It was huge and super tasty. The meat was sizzling on a hot plate, and it was scrumptious... Mashed potatoes was great but I slightly liked the creamy spinach better. We were full after that, then come the key lime cheesecake... Ending the dinner with lime flavor was brilliant idea. It was so rich in flavor yet but doesn't make you feel super full.... In fact you probably can't stop after first bite...

I'm very pleased with the food and services here. Definitely a spot to take my loved ones out for a great treat.
author: Zisele N.

description:
I only come here for the SF restaurant week formerly known as Dine About Town. It cost about $35 dollars a person for a 3 course meal.

First course: house salad which is ok since I don't like to get too full from the salad. It's a good sized portion

Main course: 6oz filet mignon with cream of spinach. OMG the filet mignon is probably the best I've had. The meat was so tender and the garlic butter that i was cooked in makes the filet mignon even juicier. It's so good that there was once we couldn't finish our steak and took it home reheated it and it still tasted just as fresh. Yes, it was that good!

Dessert: chocolate cupcake. Yummy chocolately goodness

Overall, its pretty pricey to come here when it's not SF restaurant week but I definitely take advantage of the deal each January and June!

A must try for SF Restaurant week. It definitely does not disappoint!
