author: Joanne K.

description: Wonderful food, great service and everyone went out of their way to help me celebrate my husband's birthday. Highly recommended and a special thank you to Jack, our waiter
author: Pieter J.

description:
Haven't been to a Ruth Chris in years but my friend from Chicago was craving steak and potatoes. We went in on a Friday night around 7:15pm but the earliest table we could get was 9:15pm- so make reservations! 

The bar has a great atmosphere and is filled with locals which creates some good conversation. 

We also celebrated my friends birthday that evening. The servers were very thoughtful and brought out some birthday confetti and for dessert (cheesecake and ice cream). The service was great- I will be back!
author: Elaine Tiffany P.

description: OMG!!!! The best service I've ever received the food was delicious not 1 thing wasn't to drool over! The girl that showed us to our table put down HAPPY birthday confetti and brought out 2 desserts. I have absolutly nothing but good things to think of and I highly recommend the chicken. Best I've ever had even though they r known for there steaks. Mmmmmmmmmmm craving it again! AMAZING
author: Caroline J.

description:
Coming from Dallas where we have hundreds of restaurants that participate in Restaurant Week, it was a little sad to see the meager attempt of SF Restaurant Week. Nonetheless, I wanted to give one of the restaurants a try and I've heard many good things about the Ruth's Chris chain so we chose this place as our one stop.

Coming in late on a Sunday night, we were surprised to see so many empty tables. Admittedly, the place is pretty big so even 3/4ths of the place being full is a lot of people but considering 8:45pm was the only reservation we were offered... We were just confused. ANYWAYS, that thought was wiped away once we sat down and our server came over. I wish I could remember his name (it's been a while) but this guy was so friendly and so well-versed on the menu. A+ for that.

We told him we were here for Restaurant Week and he let us in on the option that their prix-fixe menu was less than $5 more with way more options. Okay, convinced. For the salad, I ordered a Caesar salad which is what I always get but I forgot to ask for dressing on the side so it was drowning in dressing as usual. For my entree, I got scallops which were huge, delicious, and probably the best scallops I've ever had. The sides were a light cream of spinach and dank mashed potatoes - seriously, I could've eaten 5 of them. I also wanted to order every potato option as there were quite a few and they ALL sounded so good but luckily my dude said no. For dessert (which I only had room for one bite) was Key Lime Pie. No, I'm not talking about a small to large slice that I've usually seen... I'm talking a whole mini (but not that mini) pie that was heavy and ridiculous.

I immediately went to sleep when I got home, which probably wasn't the best idea... but it was awesome.
author: Kat C.

description:
I actually really like this place!
the only negative thing I can say is that the Mac and cheese that comes with lobster ehh.
the lobster seems a little bit chewy like a rubber but at the same time I don't really eat lobster so maybe it's just me as a first timer not liking it. People say this place is expensive but I say you only live once enjoy yourself the food was amazing the steaks are amazing! I am a regular customer just haven't wrote a review in a long time.
author: Lei S.

description: Much improved menu although they just are too heavy on the salt. The salt levels are extremely high. Nick our server a nice guy but severely shy and sheepish and perhaps needs some training. Oddly contrived sincerity. He seems unhappy. I suggest the ribeye. And the lobster. Creamed spinach is great. Corn is really great.
author: Tertiary D.

description:
Amazing amazing. Came here a second time and this time was to celebrate our anniversary. They had the table ready and covered with rose petals. What a nice gesture. 

Started with the calamari appetizer. Every time I come, I would choose their Petite cut and creamed spinach. They also recommended a nice bottle of wine for us to celebrate. Superb service! Will definitely be back.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
I was born in Texas and know how a steak should taste. This place does not disappoint...ever.
I always get the ribeye off the classics menu because it's the best bang for your buck. I've been to some terrible steak houses in the bay and this one always gets it right.  Flavor, flavor, flavor is the key word here. Well done, keep it up!
author: Neil R.

description:
FU Ruth Chris!!! You guys STOLE my bone in ribeye steak I didn't even get to touch cause my baby was acting up at the restaurant.
 I asked for it to go only realizing the next day it wasn't packed in my doggy bag. I called them the next several days, got the run around and finally got to the bottom of my problem. The manager at the time we'll call him Nikki Minaj (you know who you are) treated my as if I were lying about my issue and said he had his teams back on this one and assured me the steak was packed!? Well it WASN'T AHOLE.
 I also called the corporate office of Ruth Chris, once again got the run around and no result. Once one of my favorite places to dine to now I will boycott every location in the world.

And for the guy who bagged my steak I hope you enjoyed my untouched bone in ribeye with the blue cheese crust. I mean how do you miss packing that!?
author: Nader F.

description: Had a reservation weeks in advance for a Father's Day Dinner, called back to tell them that we had a baby with us, rep that picked up the phone was not accommodating at all. Told me they can not accommodate me, left me no choice but to cancel my reservation.
author: Little K.

description: Perfect. Hub's birthday, 12th Anniversary and early Valentine's day, absolutely wonderful. The staff was so warm, friendly, prompt and so accommodating. Thank you for the satisfying and joyful experience.
author: elizabeth c.

description: Amazing food , definitely lives up to the hype. Very courteous and professional staff waiting on you hand and foot. The stuffed mushrooms were divine and so was the crab stack. Sadly they ran out of the chilled seafood platter but they made up for it with the delicious steaks and dessert. Everyone should treat themselves to this gem, you will not be disappointed.
author: Ron S.

description:
Everything about this place was average. I've been to a good amount of steak houses and this one is ok. For the money and name, I did expect more. Let me just break down what we ate:

1. Bread with butter (bread was very soft and very warm.)

2. Caesar salad (expect a lot of cheese and dressing. order light on these items if you don't like a lot of either on your salads. The plate was very cold but the actual salad was a bit warm, so that was disappointing.)

3. Filet cooked medium (it was tender and  perfectly cooked. Had 3 shrimp on top of it. the flavor was average. Same as any other steak house in this price range.)

4. Asparagus (grilled and Charcoaled- average) had better at home. They need to add seasoning. Didn't even finish this between the 2 of us.)

5.  Mashed potatoes (also lackluster - basic with lots of butter melted on them.)

6. Chocolate molten cake- which is my favorite dessert. It was good, not hot like other places serve it. Had to order a la mode to get a scoop of vanilla ice cream. They serve it with a chocolate heavy cream and whip that are good too. I would eat Flemings over this one any day of the week. Or dominick's if given the choice. It was good, just not as good as other places that serve it.

The service was as expected. the table we sat at was very close to the date occurring at the table
On the side or us, directly in front of the window.  The was some elbow to elbow action and we heard the weird conversation the other couple was having. I wish the food was better and they didn't place people so close together in some of the seating.
author: Lacey G.

description:
Ultra friendly, professional and welcoming staff. All had great attitudes.

The food was tasty, however, I expected a bit more for the $200+ meal for two. Sweet and sour calamari was stellar as was the perfectly al dente grilled asparagus with delicate hollandaise sauce. Baked potatoe with fixin's was devoured. 

The Caesar salad, though very tasty with a generous shaving of parmesan seemed either over dressed and gloppy or wilted, but not sure or maybe it was both. It seemed like it was more chopped salad style which I detest. Again, it was tasty but not crisp, airy and lightly dressed. It sat flat on the plate weighed down. The croutons were too tiny not really giving you a nice crunch, but became sodden by too much dressing. This style of preparation seemed out of place for this establishment where quality is expected.

Ill timing interrupted our salads and appetizer with our main entrees so we had to push them aside causing what was left of them to get cold, more wilted and abandoned.

The medium rare t-bone arrived sizzling on the ultra hot plate with beefy aromas wafting in the air. The tenderloin on the steak was really quite small as if half was missing, so I felt a bit cheated there. The flavor was okay, but for $58 for prime, it actually seemed a bit bland and tough with extra bits of tough sinew as well. Something was amiss here. I cringe at saying this, but I've had better flavored, tender steaks from the meat counter at Safeway and the tenderloins are bigger. I just feel horrible saying that. I am truly surprised by this since this place has always had rave reviews. 

Would I come back? Only if someone paid my way again.

They greeted my birthday meal with birthday sprinkles on the table. Nice touch. They also brought out a scoop of ice cream, a mini key lime cheese cake and pieces of chocolate bark with embedded salted nuts on an artfully designed plate spelling happy birthday. Unctious and delicious with a lit candle to boot.  Wow - did not have to order dessert. 

Mixed experience.
author: Billious H.

description:
Awesome service here! Came here for a birthday and while we only ordered two meals that included desserts, and didn't order any more dessert, the waitress came with four desserts, one for everybody so no one would be left out! 

The birthday boy's dessert also came with a personalized "Happy birthday" message and candle so he could make a wish. It was a really nice attention to detail. When we were seated, they also had 'happy birthday' confetti all over the table. 

Their food is great as usual. I ordered scallops and they were decent, not the most amazing but since Ruth's Chris is known for their steaks I wasn't surprised. The creamed spinach tastes delicious as always, and their steaks are flavourful and juicy!
author: Theresa L.

description: More than we usually pay for a meal, but worth every cent. The service was excellent, and the food was even better. My steak was perfectly cooked and the chocolate duo desert was almost too good. I recommend sharing a side dish between two, as they give very generous servings.
author: Jason G.

description: Took my wife here one night good customer service nice place to take ur family not really for kids more like adults and couple etc nice juicy steaks deliscous sides nice atmosphere classy place
author: Sam A.

description: It's about a 3.5....I've been wanting to try this place or Prime, but when it came to making a reservation Ruths had more time slots available. The occasion was for the boyfriend's birthday, which I noted on the reservation as well. We got there about 15 minutes early, but we were seated within a few minutes. There were a good amount of open tables from the time we got there to the time we finished. We were then greeted by our waiter, explained the menu to us, and started our orders. We both went with the Ruths Classic, which includes a starter, entrée, side, and dessert. I had the filet mignon and the boyfriend had the ribeye, which were both pretty good. Also, I enjoyed the tomatoe bisque soup and caesar salad. I prefer the mash over creamy spinach. Dessert was on the sweeter side even though I definitely have a sweet tooth. The food didn't take the longest time, but it could've been quicker. Before the food came out the waiter placed happy birthday decorations on the table. The reason for my stars isn't because I didn't enjoy my meal, but I guess I just had higher expectations. For what we paid for, I was hoping that there was going to be more of a special feel and I think a big part was that we didn't feel a connection or something with our waiter. Im not saying we had to be like bffs, but you just know when your waiter/waitress is hands down the best compared to having mediocre service. Sometimes, I feel like we just look young so we're treated differently but that's just my opinion. Before even making a reservation I went through reviews, so i had expectations. Also, i know that you can pay a mini fee to substitute some things. When it was time for dessert our waiter asked if we were ready for dessert, which we answered yes but I thought he'd at least ask if we'd like to switch things up or go with the deasert that went along with our prix fixe meal. It wasnt a big deal because i guess we didnt ask, but i only knew from reviews and he mentioned substituting items briefly when we were ordering in the beginning, but im sure not everyone is aware of that option. Overall, my experience was alright...
author: Maggie W.

description: I brought my wife here for her birthday. It was something we had been looking forward to for a long time. We were going to a symphony so we were dressed classily enough to eat here. My wife's crab cakes were phenomenal however I ordered the bone-in filet medium rare. It came in a timely manner but as I tucked into it it was quickly apparent that the center was ice cold and the surface was extremely overcooked. I let Patrick, whose service was impeccable by the way, know the issues with my steak as I had chewed and spit out a bite onto my plate. He took it back to the kitchen and then the service manager brought back not a new steak but a further cooked steak that I had sent back complete with the bite that I had chewed up and spit out! I then told them that I would not pay for it as the steak was completely inedible. I then ordered the petite ribeye which ended up being much better however they charged me full price for the new steak. I had places to be otherwise I would have made a scene. I will never again eat at Ruth's Chris at this location. Completely unsatisfactory.
author: Kristofer B.

description: I love a good steak and a glass of red wine. They definitely met my expectations and lived up to other similar steakhouses. They are a little more pricey than the others and I wouldn't deem it to be necessary.
author: Shanta M.

description:
I've been to a few Ruth Chris Steak Houses and this is one I would personally never return to. Waiting for nearly an hour even though we had made a reservation a few months ago was just no bueno. The food was good. The wait staff was ok, although I didn't get what I ordered and the sides were cold. 

The front of house staff was mediocre at best. Zero customer service skills were demonstrated when - towards the end of the evening I complained about the wait. From there, the front of house staff person managed to throw another employee under the bus for making our reservation saying, "a reservation for a party of 19 should have never been taken in the first place." Really?? Do you think this is what I want to hear after just dropping $1400? Wow.

No apologies for the wait were EVER rendered. No offer of even a round of drinks for our guests who stood inside and outside because there was really no room to stand around. It was terribly poor planning on their part not to seat us immediately, or make amends for being completely unprepared.

To make matters even worse, besides paying with a AMEX gold card, we had two Ruth Chris gift cards as part of the payment. The person taking our money (not our server) came back and announced that the cards were "no good." Wow. My husband insisted he run them again and he did and got one of them to work.  Nothing like being made to feel like an asshole at your own party as if we were trying to pass off BAD Ruth Chris gift cards! 

Suffice to say - the staff at this location all need customer service training. Even our server who was a nice enough guy, but when I asked him about who to talk to about the long wait I got a speech in a big loud voice ( it left me feeling like he was yelling at me for asking who to talk to)  about how it was "out of his pay grade to address this situation."  So basically NO ONE bothered to really address it!! Excuses of all kinds were made. Other employees thrown under the bus. The whole situation left me embarrassed in front of our family and friends.

I will never again return to this restaurant.
author: Vee B.

description:
This is my 1st time at this location. First, let me start off by saying the staff is amazing. We had a waiter named Patrick and he was simply awesome. Great customer service and very attentive. Also. I was running late for my reservation due to traffic and the ladies at the front desk were very accommodating even though I showed up after the grace period. 
For food, I ordered the ruths classic with a medium well rib eye, Caesar salad, and creamed spinach. I also got a baked potato and a lobster tail on the side. Skip the lobster tail. It's not worth the price. I even found a hair on mine so I had to send it back. The steak was a little overdone, but it was OK. The salad was also ok. I chose this restaurant because the others were booked and it was familiar. I will come back, but hopefully the food is better.
P.s. order the blackberry sidecar, it's delicious.
author: Jae L.

description: Back again came out to enjoy a nice birthday dinner and I must say they haven't skipped a beat still great quality food with lots of flavor and good prices our waitress's name was Jessica she was cool attentive and made my birthday dinner special she brought out my birthday desert along with roses pur fume and a birthday card all planned by her and my man thanks Jessica u did a good job I really enjoy the Ruth Chris experience they take good care of u it's on my list of top steakhouses to dine great food ambience and service
author: Sac M.

description: I am a regular at this restaurant but not this location. I was in town for business, I sat at the bar with a co worker. And the guy was that sat down after us had his order taken before us. And he was sitting RIGHT next to us. I finally asked the waiter can we place our order. I ordered my steak medium well, it came super well done. I could taste the burnt from the steak, and it was dry on the inside. I usually enjoy my meals at Ruth Chris but not this time.
author: Britt G.

description:
When I mention Ruth's Chris to friends, I usually get a response that goes like this: "it's a chain, BUT, the steaks are sooo good!"

Alrighty then!  The bf and I planned a low-key New Year's eve with just dinner and no crazy parties. (hmm...grandma and granpa status!) We also had a $75 gift card to spend and that helped greatly with the bill!

I purposely starved myself before coming here and of course as soon as we sat down, warm bread arrived.  Slathered on some buttah (ok, a lot of butter!) and I was happy.  The mushroom caps stuffed with crabmeat is awesome with a sprinkling of Romano cheese on top. 

Cocktails arrived soon after and I have to say I am NOT impressed. I still downed my nola reviver (too much on the lemon juice!) and the bf liked his old fashioned because it was clearly heavy on Maker's Mark. But, why do most places make this with cherries and big orange slices?! I digress...

Our entrees were put down with care onto our table (very hot!) and we haven't eaten at a steak house in awhile, so we savored every bite in silence. My filet mignon was perfectly pink in the center at medium rare and the lobster that came with it didn't need additional butter!  That combo was at a very affordable $46.95! Bf's ribeye was amazing.  How amazing did the meats turn out? Ruth's Chris cooks their meat in BUTTER. (now, you know the secret!) 

Fantastic service, relaxing ambiance and great value.
author: Janice C.

description:
Ate here for the first time last night. It was a last minute choice and I was able to make a same-say Saturday night reservation. 

Strangely, although the only reservations available online were for 5:45pm and 6:45pm, the restaurant was largely empty when we arrived ~15 minutes ahead of our 5:45pm reservation time. Not complaining about that exactly; now I know where to go on Saturday night if we've craving steak and a walk-in table.

We ordered:

1. A caesar salad to share, at the recommendation of our waiter when I asked whether he'd recommend the caesar or the wedge salad. It was largely forgettable and I couldn't taste any anchovy flavors. Came with plenty of cheese, and oddly, half slices of grape tomatoes. Not traditional. I've had some of the most iconic caesar salads in the world and can make a better one than 99.9% of most restaurants, so I'm very picky on that front. 2/5. 

2. The BBQ shrimp appetizer. This was delicious, but overpriced ($17 for five pieces of shrimp???). To make it worth your while, make sure they don't take the plate away even after you eat all the shrimp (admittedly quite delicious and perfectly cooked). The remaining sauce is delectable. Dip your bread in the sauce, maybe even your meat. And protect the plate from being carried away until and unless you've satisfactorily sopped away as much as possible. 4/5 (would be 5/5 if the pricing wasn't crazy). 

3. A couple of drinks: a hurricane and either a lime drop or a daiquiri (I forget which but they're basically the same drink except the former uses vodka as the spirit; the latter, rum). 

The hurricane was tasty in its way but odd. Used regular ice instead of the more pebble-y ice I associate with hurricanes. The second drink was fine but forgettable. Both drinks were $15 each and thus way over-priced. 1.75/5 (and this feels generous, TBH). Ruth's Chris originated in New Orleans; they should have a fantastic hurricane (its birthplace). They don't. Or at least not at the SF location. 

4. The petite filet mignon (8oz), ordered medium rare and was served exactly so. 

Damn. 

Now THAT was delicious. I'm normally a NY Steak or flatiron steak (the latter when I'm being cheap) gal, and usually consider filter mignon to be boring (albeit tender). The quality and flavor of this particular filet was outstanding; and in fact, exceeded expectations. 

Easily a 6/5. No fat, no gristle, just tender, tender steak and surprisingly beefy tasting for filet mignon. I have a petite appetite so I wasn't able to finish it on my own, but my partner very much appreciated the slices I cut off and deposited onto his plate :D. 

[Side note: Ruth's Chris's schtick is cooking steak at 1,800 degrees and serving them on 500 degree plates. Worked for me. Sizzle, sizzle]. 

5. My partner ordered a much larger piece of meat. I think it was either a porterhouse or T-bone (not sure the difference?). He went in intending to order the NY steak but spotted a bigger steak on the menu and went with that instead (he has a rather....large...appetite). He noted that it was a bit fatty and gristly, and had to cut off pieces to make it edible. I didn't taste it, but based on his description and how much it cost, I'm guessing it was a 2/5 or 3/5. A bummer, as it looked to be a very costly hunk of meat based on size alone. 

6. The sweet potato casserole. Delicious and sweet enough to be a dessert. A standout side and way, WAY better than most steakhouse sides (I've never met a creamed spinach that I would wax euphorically re:). But yes, very sweet, to the point of being cloying (but I still loved it). We were too stuffed to eat the whole thing but took it home as a leftover. Spectacular, but don't order if you're diabetic or on the verge of becoming so. 5/5.

In sum, the service was fine. Some aspects of our meal were mediocre but others were amazing. I don't feel like giving them three stars is fair, but I also don't quite feel like they earned four stars either. I hovered repeatedly over both ratings (A-OK (3 stars) vs. Yay, I'm a fan! (4 stars)) and in the end, went with four stars. We'll be back again based on the highlights but will order differently next time. Needle nudged in 4-star direction for that reason alone.

Final notes: the free bread is just decent but the butter is amazing (whipped, light as air). And you can request garlic butter -- even better! -- but keep in mind that the garlic is probably raw (which I love; my partner doesn't).  

Took photos of all the food but none of them came out that well hence I'm not posting any -- we were in a dark corner (but no complaints there; it set the mood :D).
author: Maya B.

description:
Come here a few times a year when we come to the city for a play or concert.  Steaks have always been good and the combo dinners have been a great value.  I always order the ribeye, rare and it has always been perfect, rested properly, no lost juices and covered in their herb butter...sooo good.  Love their creamed spinach.  SO always orders the filet and shrimp, medium rare, both cooked perfectly.  As noted in the previous review, the pineapple/coconut bread pudding was ok, not great, a bit dense for my liking.  The server was great, attentive but not hovering, was happy to over tip her this night.

Parking on Sundays is free on the street and wasn't hard to find.  Any other day, I would also suggest using the valet.  Will definitely come back.
author: Bob N.

description: My wife and I celebrated our 26th wedding anniversary here and we certainly enjoyed every moment of our experience. We made a dinner reservation earlier and were promptly seated upon arrival. In addition the table was sprinkled with rose petals, and the lighting was dim, which added to the romantic atmosphere. Our server was very attentive, but not too attentive. I rather like when servers are aware of the conversations of guests and allow for privacy until a moment arrives to ask if anything is needed or even when simply called upon. She was just the right combination for the occasion. We ordered calamari and salads to start and were very pleased with both choices. The calamari was not dry and had just the right seasoning so as to enhance the flavor.  We both ordered the filet mignon with lobster and shrimp and were not disappointed when the entrees arrived. As is their custom the steaks are cooked right not he plate so they were sizzling and made to perfection. It was a rather delightful meal, and an even better atmosphere. We were both so satisfied to even order desert, but our server graciously presented us with a small desert to commemorate the special occasion. We were extremely satisfied with our evening and will definitely be back soon.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
We're here for a birthday dinner.

We ordered petite felit, surf & turf with au gratin potato and sauteed mushroom. Key Lime pie to finish the dinner.

When I ate my filet, I noticed that there is a wood chuckle in the meat. The waitress immediately took it away for a new one, and the manager came out to expain the situation. In the meantime, the manager gave us more wine, and did not charge us for the dessert.

Overall, great restaurant and a very nice evening. The wait staff was very friendly.
author: Sterling H.

description:
Went for a group Christmas dinner. Let me preface that the host is a private orthopaedic surgeon who happens to be African American. Reservations were for 5 pm and Van Ness is a hell hole around that time, so it was stop-go until we finally arrived at 5:16 pm. Host and his wife were sitting at the bar and told us that the maître d' told him they were "...(A)bout to cancel my reservation." (Strike 1) Then when we were seated, one person from our party couldn't make it so it was four instead of five. The waitress begins to remove plate, flatware and stemware AND THE CHAIR. Huh? I asked if she could leave the chair so that the women could place their purses there. She did.

The host then tells us that while he and his wife were at the bar, they ordered drinks, but the bartender never came back to their end of the bar. (Strike 2) Waiter was very courteous and attentive. We ordered and also ordered cocktails. For the gin and tonic the options he gave were, "Bombay Sapphire or Tanqueray?" Um, I haven't had Bombay Sapphire in 10 years and this is not a Snoop Dogg video. Hell no, I don't want Tanqueray. Y'all charge $52 for a steak, Tanqueray should only be used to fuel the grill! "Do you have Hendrick's?" Oh, magically Hendrick's is an option.

Got our cocktails. Two people have Hendrick's & Tonic, one had Hendrick's on the rocks and the other had a Hendrick's Martini. Three sips. Tonic was flat --absolutely no fizz. "Hendrick's" was barely noticeable. The person who had Hendrick's on the rocks immediately says, "This is watered down." (Strike 3)

Two of us got the Ruthe's Classic and the other the "Surf & Turf." 

For starters, two of us started with the white bean soup with chorizo. I didn't quite know what to make of the soup... When it came, it was in a tomato(?) broth with julienned basil (why?) and cut up pieces of chorizo. I don't know why I was thinking it would be a creamy broth with ground chorizo and a bitter green like kale, but it wasn't. It wasn't bad, it just threw me off. My mistake for not asking for clarification. The other guest said the soup was not hot enough. 

According to one guest,the lobster tails that came with the surf & turf were mushy and tasted like they just boiled the lobster in plain water until it was mushy. Yuck.

The person who got the arugula salad with walnuts and apples said it was very good.

HUGE BROWNIE POINTS: Steaks were magnificent! Everyone loved their steaks!

The steaks were seasoned with just salt and pepper, and were the perfect shade of pink. They were flavorful, juicy and tender.

Here's the whomp-whomp-whooooomp part. The sides came five minutes after the sizzling steaks. We also ordered a bottle of wine for the table. The waiter didn't present the wine list until the host asked. So we couldn't get the tonic spritzer taste out of our mouth until halfway through the meal. 

The creme brulee was INCREDIBLE, as was the bread pudding. I asked for coffee and another guest asked for espresso. Both came when we were halfway through our dessert. 

There was enough food that I brought the rest of mine home.

Circling back to the "We're going to 'cancel' your reservations" b.s. Three different tables with parties of 4+ ALL HAD PEOPLE WHO CAME LATER!! 

There were plenty of kids and parents at the restaurant, so maybe that's a draw for them, but I've been treated crappily in better steakhouses than this one. There's valet parking and the valets were awesome for not noticing that my car looked like a "Mad Max: Fury Road" prop. 

I was disappointed in this place, especially by it being on Van Ness Avenue in San Francisco. They seemed genuinely confused by African Americans. The host never threw his credentials or title in their face, but I kind of wish he had because their maître d' and staff need to have a clue that you treat customers as well as you'd like to be treated, and to stop creating micro-aggressions and static environments for certain customers. Also, the wait staff need to work on their food service skills and time the service better. 

I'm pretty sure that I won't be back and would never recommend this amateurish restaurant to any of my family, friends or co-workers.
author: Adrienne A.

description:
This was my first visit to a Ruth's Chris and it did not disappoint.  My steak was perfectly cooked and delivered in a shallow pool of melted butter (be still my waistline!)  The shoe string potatoes were very crispy so if that's what you're in to, that's the side for you.  We also had the corn with chiles which was immensely tasty.  The corn tasted very fresh, we were wondering where you can get good sweet corn in February in San Francisco.

Some low points that knocked a star off the experience: I ordered a gin martini that arrived with lots of ice chunks floating in it.  This means the martini was shaken.  There's a reason why James Bond specifies that his martinis be made shaken, it's because that's not the default preparation.  I (unlike James) prefer a stirred martini.  I suppose I should have specified, but I didn't think that I had to since that's the norm.  Alas, it was a passable martini, but I feel like an old-school steak house should have nailed it.

Also the decor seemed a bit stodgy and dated.  To be sure, traditional steak houses never have avant garde, innovative interiors, but this one seemed a bit more unpleasantly "weird old basement" than should be expected for a nice restaurant in SF.

We were way too full for dessert, so I can't speak to it, but I did see a miniature cheesecake walk by and it looked delightful.  (By miniature, I mean smaller than a normal cheesecake, but make no mistake, it was giant.  Seemed way larger than a typical slice of cheesecake)

Overall it was quality dining and attentive service.
author: Rachel S.

description: The server was really engaging but not attentive. We were given a moment to look at the menu when we weren't ready but we were never checked upon afterwards to at least place in our drink order. The wait was long enough that we were staring around. By the time she came we had to place our appetizers, drinks, entree, and side orders. it was annoying to have to go through that long of a list because we weren't attended to enough. Wine came first, than the bread, followed by the calamari. Half of our wine, half of the bread and all of the calamari was gone by the time our food even came out. We were on the cusp of getting full and our server was no where in sight to check up on us and when she did, it was to take our orders again. She obviously forgot about us and apologized once she realized we were  existing patrons. Our food finally came out and it was delicious. Too bad the specialty knives that we were supposed to use wasn't given to us from the beginning. Midway through the dinner I realized that my wine had a bubble in it, shined the flashlight from my phone and it was a fruit fly! Our server offered another glass but by that time, we were ready to pack our steaks to go because we were full. However she did take off the wine from our check as I requested. Overall, food was amazing, server was engaging but her attentiveness was few and far in between. I couldn't tip her the way I wanted to because Ruth Chris's has a mobile card swipe system that generates a receipt that the server holds. So it was awkward placing the tip with the server holding it. We definitely can't bring ourselves to coming here again because of our experience. We felt like prisoners to the restaurant far outweighed the positives we had from the quality of food they served. We were there for nearly 2.5 hours. 2.5 hours for dinner, all I can say is smh.
author: Randy P.

description: Came here for SF Restaurant Week. First time at this location but have been to other Ruth's Chris locations in California. I ordered their filet mignon and it's probably one of the best I've ever had. Their house salad, mashed potatoes, and creamed spinach was pretty good but definitely the highlight was the steak. Just coming here and ordered their steak is totally worth it.
author: Bobby C.

description: Had a special date night and the food was excellent my petite filet was prepared exactly how I requested. The sweet potato casserole is a must try. It was perfect for a special date. The service was awesome the server forgot my shrimp so he brought us a cheesecake on the house without us asking at all. I felt he went the extra mile to keep us happy.
author: Silvia Grace D.

description:
Went here for me and my boyfriend's 2 year anniversary! I didn't want him to tell me so we walked up here and I was like yay I've always wanted to try this place!

It was pretty cute. We even got greeted happy anniversary as they led us to our seats and there were some rose petals with "happy anniversary" confetti on our table. (He told them ahead of time so do so next time too if you have an anniversary or a special occasion!)

Our server (Kurt I think.. not sure but he was great!) was very friendly and welcoming too. We ended up getting: lobster bisque, creamed spinach, lobster mac n cheese along with a 16oz ribeye (me) and 16oz new york strip (him). 

Soup was good but only one small chunk of lobster. Creamed spinach was good too but not the best I've had. Lobster mac n cheese was great!! I love mac n cheese and they had a generous portion of lobster in it too. 

The steaks were both amazing. So they only season it with salt and pepper and then after cooking it, they finish it by broiling it in (I think) a 1800 degree oven. So the plates are super hot so they emphasize on not touching it (I did move my plate closer to me but by using my jacket sleeves and I could feel the heat through them). The sizes of the steak were great and it was super tender. SO GOOD!! 

Honestly one of the best meals I've ever had. We basically only finished half of our meal so we took the leftovers (and I had a great lunch the next day haha). Great service and amazing food.

It is on the pricier side (about $50 and above per steak) with appetizers/sides being $10 and above so be prepared. Bathrooms were nice too.
author: Samy L.

description: For a person who does not and cannot eat steak I would definitely return for more! Everything was delicious from the martinis to the stuffed chicken. The staff was great, our server Ashley was very attentive, knowledgeable about the menu and beverages to pair with your food choices. I can't think of anything bad to say about Ruth Chris Steak House and we will be back!
author: Shana S.

description:
Amazing. I have not one single thing to even slightly complain about. Let me list all the amazing things about this place!
- I made a reservation online for 6:00 pm New Years day. They seated us right on the dot. 
- When making a reservation it asks you if you have any additional requests. I asked them to please write "Congratulations" on my dates plate if he orders dessert. I was SHOCKED that they actually did it without me having to remind them when I was there. 
- The food was perfect. Best cesar salad i've had, best steak for sure, shrimp was bomb, and the cheesecake was sooo rich.
- Our waiter Phil was the best. 
- It is expensive, but I can't even complain about that because it was worth it. You definitely get what you pay for at this place. 

I'd recommend ordering from Ruth's Classic Menu. It gives you two options, one more expensive than the other (about $45-$55). But with that you get a starter, entree, side, and dessert. It's more than enough food and surprisnigly cheaper than most single items on the menu.
author: Courtney C.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here for our anniversary because I had been wanting to eat here for months. My friends have raved about their juicy steaks, but mine had every drop of juicy life squeezed out of it :( 

I asked for my ribeye medium rare and it came out well-done. I didn't even eat half of it because it was so dry. Why didn't I send it back? Because our waiter (Clarke?) was even harder to deal with than the steak -____-

We had a reservation so we were seated quickly, but we waited 20 minutes before we were even greeted by our waiter. It was 8pm on a Tuesday so there were maybe 3-4 other parties in the dining room. When he finally showed up, he was pleasant, but no apologies were offered. We ordered our drinks and that took ANOTHER 20 minutes to get. The whole time he was NO WHERE TO BE FOUND. We were hungry, we wanted to order. Eventually we caught a glimpse of him at the bar (outside of our dining room) and he appeared to just be standing there waiting for our drinks to be ready. At least come take our order while you're waiting! Finally, he returned with our drinks and we were able to order. 

The food came out after in a decent amount of time, but it was brought out by other people. Again, our waiter had completely disappeared! My boyfriend's steak was done appropriately (also medium rare), but mine was dry and I didn't send it back. I don't ever send food back, but I may have in this situation because of where we were at. This is supposed to be a high-quality steakhouse. However, with the waiter no where to be found, it was pretty much impossible anyway. The dinner dragged over hours -- more waiting to ask for the bill, waiting for him to bring the bill, waiting for him to collect the bill, and waiting to sign the darn bill. It was ridiculous. 

Other thing that was kind of disappointing is that people were dressed in hoodies, basketball shorts, and other super casual attire. Halfway through our meal, a group of guys dressed in hoodies and who reeked of weed were seated in the booth next to us. They were loud and it further ruined the experience. 

For the price we paid and their reputation, I expected a lot more. I was really excited about this place, but now I'm never coming back. I might try other locations though.
author: Chloe T.

description:
You can easily get a little wine happy here (great selection of wines), hence my seriously lacking review.  The steak was 100, you have to get it medium rare - juicy, tender, juicy, and did I mention juicy?  Even the side of sweet potato casserole was a star.  

Good for both small and large parties.  My family got a private room for a party of 20+ and was very well accommodating to our needs.  They were flexible about serving us pasta and other entrees family style. They even had a corner table with fruit, cheeses, and crackers for us. YUM!

Would definitely come back!  I would not compare this place to House of Prime rib simply because they are two totally different styles of culinary experiences.  I recommend going to both!
author: Alyssaaa S.

description: Very disappointed. My daughter and son-in-law had reservations for their belated 1st anniversary dinner since my daughter was 8 1/2 months pregnant on their anniversary.  We had given them a Ruth Chris gift card for their anniversary and had given them a Ruth Chris gift card for their honeymoon. I wanted to order a bottle of wine as a surprise for their dinner. When I called the restaurant and explained what I would like to do I was told that I couldn't order and pay for the wine upfront. Online orders can only be done in the bar. Didn't ask who the reservation was for, offer any alternatives. Just no. Too bad since my husband and I spent close to $400 for our anniversary dinner last May. I guess we will no longer be going to Ruth Chris for our special occasions. Nor will I be giving my daughter and son-in-law gift cards to Ruth Chris for their special occasions.
author: Laurie C.

description:
Enjoyed my Birthday Dinner here last night and they really impressed me. first we arrived and they had "happy birthday" confetti scattered over our table which definitely made me feel special. they really listen to their customers and pay attention to the "comments" section in the reservation requests. 

we ordered the filet mignon special which came with an appetizer, main course + a side and a dessert. everything was super tasty!! the only comment I'll make is that I feel my steak was a little overcooked (I ordered a MEDIUM, but it was more like a MEDIUM WELL) the butter and seasoning on the 500° plate made up for the difference though!!!

the dessert was awesome and they even threw in a little scoop of ice cream for my birthday. the plate had "happy birthday" written in chocolate syrup which was another special little touch that I appreciated. 

overall, I had a great experience and would definitely like to start coming here more often for date nights or other special occasions. 

also, our waiter was awesome. super attentive and very polite. he was always around and checked in frequently which I appreciated. the restaurant also offers valet service for those that worry about driving and not finding a parking spot. 

I will be recommending this place to all of my friends for all of their special occasions. oh yeah, the manager (I think) also checked in to ensure we were receiving great service. (this doesn't happen in most places)
author: Mike C.

description: we were at the restaurant on  4/9/18  a Monday night  for a birthday party ..   you name it , everything went wrong .. starting with the waiter  asking me what a Crown Royal Manhattan is !     and  then downhill from there .    The manager  had to be called  twice to the table to resolve problems .   It was very disappointing .      Our waiter had  major attitude and   did not explain the menu,  and  made no  attempts to correct the problems ..    the table next to us .. also had problems  returning food  for not being cooked enough.   That table had a different waitress .     This usually is not the case  in this restaurant .    They sure blew it tonight .        Last friday night we were in  House of prime Rib   where is was  PACKED to the hilt ..  over  500 people ..   and our  dinner was  excellent ..    its shocking  Ruth Chris was dead as a door nail on  Monday night  and still seemed to  Ruin everything .        ON one good point  the manager did  help the situation  quiet  a bit  and were thank full for that .      The ceaser salad  came  drenched in dressing ,    they  changed the wedge salad ,  didnt tell us ..  when does a wedge salad  come  with  CORN on it .. and  Green goodess dressing .     Come on  who  has ever heard of a Wedge salad with Green goddess dressing  and  CORN ..       next  the Birthday  person ordered  medium rare  filet ..  came out  well done ..   then last but not least   the waiter throws  3 deserts on the table with out asking  if  we wanted to upgrade them   since  ONE of us is  allergic to  NUTS .      I have to ask myself is it me or the  restaurant.  !     please feel free to tell me if Im wrong . thanks            lets not forget .. nothing from the waiter saying  happy b day ..  just throw the  plates on table and walked off ..   SHAME .. we still left a  20 % tip .. !
author: Mark E.

description:
After calling numerous restaurants to see if they can host a graduation dinner for underprivileged youths, only 1 restaurant answered back with enthusiasm. Thank you Ruth Chris for the amazing communication setting up the dinner and for being accommodating with those students with food allergies.

The entire team at Ruth Chris exemplified what great customer is to our students. Thank you for the amazing experience and the delicious meal.

Great customer service + Great food = 100% Returning customer 

Thank you!
author: David S.

description: Went here with some friends for my boyfriends 40th. We ordered a bunch of different items. Everything was delicious!! Our server India was awesome, attentive and very friendly. Will definitely be coming back to this location!
author: Mischel F.

description: I came here with my family to celebrate my birthday early and this is seriously one of the best birthday meals I've ever had.  As soon as we sat down, the servers delivered plentiful amounts of their complimentary freshly baked french rolls with whipped butter and they were so delicious when freshly out of the oven.  I probably ate more than I should have but I couldn't help it and the servers were constantly refilling our basket.  We all ordered the Ruth's classic, which is an appetizer (salads, soup), an entree (ribeye, filet, salmon, etc), and a dessert (fixed).  I ordered the Caesar salad and was pleasantly surprised by how large it was.  It was tossed well in the dressing and came loaded with lots of parmesan shavings.  I thought it was delicious, albeit a little heavy/salty with all of the dressing and cheese.  Next came my 16 oz ribeye cooked a perfect medium rare on a 500 degree plate.  I'd never had my steak served on a hot plate before but wow does it make a difference.  Each bite of my food was perfectly warm and it helped bring out the flavor of the beef.  My ribeye was seasoned very well and had a good meat to fat ratio.  I got the creamed spinach as a side and I thought it was rich and tasty, although I can see why it might not be for everyone due to the strong spinach flavor.  For dessert, I had the chocolate espresso torte with a side of creme anglaise and mixed berries.  The torte had a rich chocolate flavor, although I didn't taste the espresso much.  The berries and cream were a nice side component to lighten up the dessert and helped keep it from being too overwhelmingly sweet.  The service here was fantastic and we had no less than 3 servers at a time constantly checking up on us, refilling water & bread, and delivering food.  They were all very friendly and welcoming, making our dining experience very pleasant.  Overall, we had an excellent experience here and I would definitely come back!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
LOVE. I've been here a million times and I've always left happy and content. I love that they offer the Ruth's Chris Classics, which is basically a 3 course meal for $40 or so. Petite filet and shrimp are my fav. Along with their cheesecakes, which is sadly, off the menu. However a waiter informed me that you can call in, while making a reservation, to request it 2 days in advance. Amazing! 

Service is always great. Steak is cooked perfectly every time. I just LOVE my steak!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
It was my first time at a Ruth's Chris, and it lived up to  my high expectations of steakhouse excellence in service, food and atmosphere.

Our party of 4 were seated promptly upon our arrival for our 6pm reservations.  We sat in a cozy booth under dimly lit lighting making the ambiance very cozy with the smooth jazz tunes playing softly in the background.

We all decided to have our first tomahawk ribeye -one between the couples.  This ultimate carnivore's  delight arrived with a bone approximately 12" long!  -quite the spectacle!  They cut the meat off for us in our presence, and we ladies opted to give our men the bone for etiquette's sake.  My honey was kind enough to hold it in my direction for me to unleash my refined savagery intermittently though.  The meat was cooked perfectly with simple salt, pepper and some butter.  We were given options of steak knives out of a formal wooden box.  The German knife was serrated and larger - more appropriate for the men.  We ladies chose the smaller, more delicate, sleeker looking French knife.  Either one did the job of slicing succulent morsels of ribeye.  With our steaks, we couldn't pass up the lobster mac and cheese.  I could have easily over dosed on this.  The roasted Brussel sprouts with bacon and honey were just as tasty as the asparagus with hollandaise sauce.  We washed our food down with a bottle of Stag's Leap Artemis cab- perfect steak pairing.

We usually don't do dessert, but the temptation was too much.  That creme brulee was one of the best if not the best we'd ever had.  The sweet custard below was rich and contrasted perfectly with the crispy caramel top.  The berries were a perfect accessory to this decadent dessert.  

All of us were at max capacity but extremely satisfied with the whole experience.  Water glasses stayed full.  Dishes were cleared quickly.  Staff was warm, and friendly.   It was a huge splurge but well worth it!  I would undoubtedly visit this Ruth's Chris again or any other location in the future!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Ruth's Chris Steak House is probably one of the better steak houses in San Francisco.

The steaks have amazing flavor, a wonderful sear and the sides are dellliiiiicous. 

I would come here over House of Prime Rib anyday!! I feel that it's also a lot better value and higher quality meat.

Make a reservation and enjoy your dinner :)
author: Selina W.

description:
Amazing food and service. 
Our host was India, has wonderful suggestions and hospitality. 
We ordered spicy shrimp and t-rib with a side of mashed potatoes, both were delicious and novel. The stirrer to the cappuccino was my personal favorite. 
Delicious in all. Definitely recommend coming here.
author: Dipinti K.

description:
After all these years living in SF and the Bay Area, I finally ate at Ruth's Chris Steak House (RCSH).  On a typical cold San Franciscan Summer afternoon after work in the middle of the week, we stepped in and felt the warmth of a very sincere and friendly greeter.

We both were handed a menu that was heavier than the ten commandments.  One eating menu. And volume two the cocktail menu.

It was "Dine-About-Town" night (woo-hoo), so that meant for two, we'd get excellent quality, upscale food at Denny's prices.

Well, not so fast.

Let's face it, the "DAT" menu lacked anything appealing.  Four courses, but not enough meat.

So what ended up happening  was we ordered from the overpriced option instead (scam!).

Before I talk about the dishes, let's describe the interior.  It's like a Rembrandt painting.  So darkly lit that when you check you cell phone for texts, you're blinded.  I guess that's part of the SF goth charm.  The seating seemed a bit disappointing.  With reservations, we didn't have a booth, but a half booth.  I didn't appreciate that.  Where I sat, I sunk.  To make matters worst, the neighboring tables were too close which means you're forced to hear the arrogant chatter of others and if you're really unlucky, you're seated next to loud boisterous know-it-alls.

So, I guess you could say I didn't find the ambiance here to be that appealing.

Aside from two other things, I've summed up the negatives of RCSH.

Our server was super friendly and cool.  She politely and sincerely cued us in that the DAT menu more-or-less sucked and that we should just order from combination specials they sold at regular price (about $12-$16 more per person than the DAT menu).

I tried the 12 oz prime rib which came with a tortellini chicken soup, a cauliflower dish, and a bread pudding dessert.  I also ordered a glass of Malbec (Alamos 2012, from Mendoza wine region).  All in all, pretty decent.

In all honesty, I might come again if I'm in a steak mood.  This is because the service was pretty good and the portion size just about right.
author: Tony U.

description:
Ahem. I, as a man and American, love steak. So heading to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse with my wife for Valentine's dinner seemed to be a no brainer...and believe me, it was. 

When we arrived we checked in for our reservation and headed to the bar for a drink. They told us to just let them know when we were ready to be seated. We enjoyed our drinks and then headed to our seat. We sat in the front window at a table for two. 

Our waiter, Steve, was more than helpful and did a fantastic job making us feel special all while handling what appeared to be a 20-top party. 

The ambiance was great. Dimly lit, quiet conversation, and clean decor made for a great experience. 

And lastly the food. What an incredible amount and quality of food for our money. We started with Calamari and for our entrees I enjoyed a Filet, Oscar Style while my wife had a Surf and Turf of Filet with 2   Lobster tails and we shared Potatoes Au Gratin. Then for dessert we shared some cheesecake and my wife enjoyed a coffee. The steaks were cooked perfectly medium-rare, seasoned extremely well, and the accoutrements were simply fantastic. (Sorry for the lack of food photos, we kinda ate it all.

Overall we had a great dining experience that was reasonably priced for the quality of food we received. 

Don't be afraid to come here and spend a few bucks, it is definitely worth it.
author: David M.

description: This is the best steak house I've been to! I've had many others including the best ones rated here on yelp. We ordered the Porter house , potaotes au gratin,  and creamed spinach. Let me start with the Porter house, it was served cut into healthy portions served sizzling then the waiter placed a piece on a plate of hot garlic butter. The meat was cooked perfectly and crispy on outside yet melts in your mouth. The creamed spinach was fresh and delightful. The potatoes au gratin was the best I've tasted.this place is well worth the money. I will definitely go try the walnut Creek location since it's closer to home.
author: Jenny G.

description: Had the best experience here last night. It was my very first time coming to this steak house and I was very excited to say the least. Our server assistant Mauricio was such a gem and always helpful when we needed it. I definitely had my heart set on the Porterhouse, but as soon as our server Anthony told us about the Tomahawk Ribeye, it was GAME OVER. Absolutely, hands down, the MOST deliciously season and seared Rare steak I've ever eaten. If I weren't from Los Angeles you'd bet I'd be coming back very often. Had such a wonderful time, great service and delicious food. It was the greatest Birthday I could have ever asked for.
author: Barbie K.

description: I came here on a Monday night with a group of friends and we didn't have to wait at all to secure a table for 6. Ruth Chris' menu feels overwhelming to House of Prime Rib down the street, so I was glad I came here with my friend who was a steak expert. They don't have prime rib here, but they do have any other cut of steak that you could possibly ask for. I ended up getting the cowboy ribeye - bone in, fat marbled throughout, and it was simple, yet delicious. Butter, salt, and pepper was all the prep needed for this steak. My steak was perfectly cooked when I requested medium rare, and every bite was juicy and tender. In terms of sides, I cannot recommend the lobster mac and cheese enough. Great service, great food. I'm coming back for sure.
author: Austin W.

description:
This was my second time at this restaurant. We had to stop by as part of SF Restaurant Week. However, we ended up ordering off the regular menu instead because of better options. I had the gumbo, 12oz rib eye combo with mash potatoes. Our party also shared lobster mac+cheese. We paired it with the Seven Trees merlot.

The food was excellent. My medium-rare steak was cooked perfectly. Although the gumbo was good, it was a bit on the heavier side thus I could not finish my steak. The wine mixed perfectly with our meal. The dessert was chocolate cake with bark. It was a bit on the sweeter side but a good ender to the evening.

We had reservations at 7:15pm and were promptly seated. Our server, Chelsea, was helpful during ordering. However, water was very, very slow to be refilled. We had to ask her to refill it to her astonishment. 

There is valet parking out front, which is probably recommended. It is located on a busy part of Van Ness so it may be tough to find any street parking. I would recommend Lyft/Uber or valet.

All in all, it was a great experience and I will definitely be returning at some point to celebrate something, i.e. birthday, anniversary, etc.
author: Jimmy D.

description:
Visits: 10+
Rating: 4*
Service: Excellent
Dishes: Ribeye; NY; Filet; Petit Filet; T-Bone; Crab Cakes; Veal Ravioli; Bread Pudding; Chocolate Sin Cake

Been going here several times a year, for many years. I guess it sort of became a family tradition on the wifey's side. Birthdays, Father's Day, Dine About Town or what have you; any excuse for them to come out & devour some steak.

¤ They have a good selection of steak & we've tried them all. Each has its own flavor & personality. If it's one thing they do right, it's steak. Always cooked the way you want it. Consistency, gotta love it. Oh & they're served swimming in a bath of bubbling Butter. What more can you ask for? Although my wife & her family consider Ruth's a 5* due to their love of steak, I'm not so much of a steak person. But when I do crave steak (once in a blue moon), I prefer mine charbroiled with a good crust. They don't have a good enough of a crust for me here but it's still good enough for 4*.

¤ Crab Cakes (2*). A lot of crab meat but also a little too much breading. The flavor is ok. So have to skip it from now on.

¤ Bread Pudding w/Whiskey Sauce (5*). One of the best bread pudding you'll ever have. Love the brown caramelized top. So good. And the inside has a texture of softness similar to braised peaches mixed in with soft moist bread. Love the texture. It comes with chocolate squares & sits atop a white creamy sauce of deliciousness. This is how bread pudding should be done.

¤ Chocolate Sin Cake (4*). Moist, warm & chocolatey. Delicious. A great finish after some heavy steak.

¤ Veal Osso Buco Ravioli (3.5*). The ravioli is al dente, just how we all like. The veal filling is flavorful & the sauce is cheesy without being thick. Pretty good.
author: Daniel T.

description:
I've been to the Ruth's Chris in Vegas a few times which was nothing short of amazing and this place was well, just short. Made a reservation about a week in advance via Opentable. It was for an early dinner on a Wednesday but for some reason they sat us at one of the two tables right next to the bar. Not exactly my idea of a fine dining experience to hear bar patrons being obnoxious. I will say the service was excellent which saved it from a one-star rating. Our waiter was attentive and polite. There were two young ladies at the other table and they were obviously inexperienced, ordering things like "the best steak" and asking for it very well done. Their server was very polite to them, helping them with their order and was not at all pretentious or condescending. 

The food was another story. We went with their 3 course special because it seemed like a great value and their choices seemed good. Salads were a bit boring. My spinach, strawberry, and goat cheese salad was bland and my partner's Cesar was equally as boring. 

My main dish was the ribeye which I ordered medium-rare, but arrived closer to medium-well. The quality of the steak was not great. It had a bit too much chew to it, possibly because it was a bit overcooked, but I think it had to do more with the quality. I am no conspiracy theorist, but I have a feeling that they have "Choice" instead of "Prime" steaks reserved for folks who order the special because it did not seem as nearly as marbled or tender as a Prime cut should be. Believe me, I know my steaks and this was not a Prime cut.

The scallops that my partner ordered were even more disappointing as they were overcooked. This is to be expected at places like TGI Fridays, Red Lobster or other chains of that caliber, but we were not expecting to get rubbery scallops from Ruth's Chris. 

Dessert was o.k. I had the creme brulee which is difficult to screw up but the key lime cheesecake was a little too sweet, lacking the tartness of the lime, and the texture was not at all like cheesecake, but rather some odd rubbery jello...or better yet, overcooked scallops. 

As mentioned before, my experience at other Ruth's Chris establishments have all been great but this one left a bad taste in my mouth, literally.
author: quiahuiteuh a.

description: It's always a safe place to bring friends. Food and service is always spot on.
author: Amy H.

description:
I was a bit disappointed.

Staff was very nice, but not very good at serving.
--brought me someone elses appetizer
--forgot to bring out wine (ordered 2 for us, only 1 showed up)
--forgot to bring water when asked
--baked potato was severely dry, which is a feat
--we ordered filets, medium-rare.  One came out reasonably within that parameter, though a bit overdone, the other was strange -- one side was well-done, the other was blood-rare.

Theme of the night "forgot" and "I'm so sorry"

Will say that the Crab Stack appetizer was great, once it came out.

2 people, appetizers, wines, filets, sides -- $195 not including tax + tip.
author: Larry C.

description: Decided to choose Ruth's Chris for my first steak house experience since moving to SF. Thought it was alright. I ordered the porterhouse for 2 medium rare with an oscar finish. The strip portion was pretty standard but the filet stole the show. Hands the best bone in filet I've had. Every steak house I've been to always serves lobster mac and it's usually a side staple. Ruth's was pretty terrible. My roommate says its usually good but this one was comparable to easy mac. This place has potential and I think it can be great if the food and service was a little better.
author: Kevin L.

description: Wonderful restaurant.  Lots of great service and fabulous martinis.  Best steaks in the country!
author: Lynda H.

description:
I've been here 3 times already (twice to this location and once to the Walnut Creek location). Parking in the city could be challenging as usual - so make sure you factor in parking time, or be prepared to pay for the valet (which is $12)

We came most recently for a valentines day lunch (learned that they normally open at 5pm only, but make exceptions for Valentines and Mothers day to also open for the lunch session).
I got the rib eye from the ruths classic menu (16 ounce) and my boyfriend got the surf n turf valentines special (filet mignon + 2 lobster tails). I personally liked the filet mignon better than the ribeye (but that is the case for me at every restaurant..)

The steak was cooked perfectly, the food was all delicious, and the staff were all very friendly. Prices are also very reasonable. 
In 2016, they also had a promotion where they gave you a $25 certificate off your future meal if you dined with them on Valentines day.

Their food comes on piping hot plates, so be careful not to touch them when they first come out. The waiters will make sure to warn you as well.

Overall, a great steakhouse! I would definitely come back!
author: linda y.

description:
Celebrated my 10 year wedding anniversary here :) We arrived a little early, but we were seated right on time. Our table was decorated with candles and red rose petals, which was nice and I loved how they seated us in a more quiet area so we can enjoy a little privacy. I don't even have to say much about the food except that it was PERFECT. I had the Surf and Turf and Mr. Co had the bone-in rib eye steak, both cooked to perfection, paired with a glass of Cabernet. As sides, we had Asparagus with hollandaise sauce and tempura onion rings with a sweet sauce which I wasn't a huge fan of. I hardly could finish my plate, but devoured the lobster. My mouth is watering just thinking about it, ha! For dessert, they presented these petite hor d'oeuvres of mousse-like cakes on a platter with the words "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate. 

The wonderful service, the ambience, and the excellent food is what sets this place apart. It definitely ranks at the top of my list for the best fine dining experiences.
author: Dahlia C.

description:
I heard a lot about this place in my travels, so I thought I'd finally try it out.  I ordered the 12oz ribeye with a side of brussel sprouts.  It took forever but didn't mind.  The place had presentation and two very darling honey's as hostess that greeted me well.  

As for the food, TOTAL DISSAPOINTMENT.  The steak tasted like burnt herbs and spices, that bitter charcoal taste was in every one of the 3 bites I took before giving up.   The texture was nice, cooked medium and very juicy.  But unfortunately it had no love put into it.  Very bland as if  it were food at an old folks home.  Nothing tasty about it.  

As for the brussel sprouts,  they were overcooked on the outside and undercooked on the inside... again NO FLAVOR.  It felt like I was biting into raw broccoli, very rigid sprouts.

Despite only taking three bites I still had to pay for the miserable piece of meat which I later got some pleasure tossing it into the middle of the street where it belongs with all the other road kill.  Very gross, yuk.  I am convinced that the only people who actually think Ruths Chris makes good steak are people who don't know what a good steak tastes like.

Do yourself a favor and NEVER go here, it's seriously the "McDonalds" in steakhouses.
author: Tommy M.

description:
BEWARE!!!

I have been to Ruth Chris Palm Springs and Beverly Hills. Both were great experiences but after my visit to the SF location, never again.

We went on a Saturday night and dined at the bar. The service was bad at best. We had to ask the bartender several times to take our drink order and food orders. There were some very sketchy people helping themselves to the olives and cherries that the bartenders used in the cocktails which was incredibly unsanitary. You would think someone on the staff would have said something but they were off in their own world despite the fact that this was happening for several minutes. Then we go to leave and realize my purse had been STOLEN off the back of my chair. You would think the manager would be mortified? No, they looked at us like this was a common occurrence and made no apologies. They told us to walk around the restaurant to see if someone "picked it up by accident" (I was already getting fraud alerts from American Express so no one had taken it by accident). They had no security cameras and did nothing to offer help.

Worst $3,000 steak dinner of my life.
author: Susan A.

description: This was my first time and I was not impressed. The server was friendly in the beginning but disappeared half way thru our dinner service. We waited almost 30 minutes after we finished our appetizers before the server returned to take our dinner order. There was one manger that we noticed but she was too busy talking to regulars that she didn't pay attention to us. The steaks came out perfect but unfortunately the crab cake tasted very fishy. Not sure if I'd return anytime soon.
author: Gil M.

description:
Honestly, Ruth's Chris Steak House at any location is absolutely incredible.  I came here with my brother and cousin last weekend and really enjoyed our experience.  

The steak comes out on a hot buttery plate that keeps the steak cooking while you eat it.  That truly sets this place apart from other steak houses.  I ordered the filet, and it really just melts in your mouth like butter.  I probably could have cut it using a fork it was that tender.  My steak was perfectly cooked (I ordered medium and it was red in the center and completely pink inside).

My only downside to this steak house is that sides do not come with the meals, you have to order them separately.  We ordered a serving of the mashed potatoes and that was the perfect amount for the 3 of us (however we had to pay extra for it).  

All in all, this was a great experience that helped make our trip memorable.  We left being incredibly satisfied and stuffed.  Best steak I'll probably have in awhile.
author: Kate U.

description:
I went to Ruth's Chris' special Cocktail dinner with clients. We were placed in a side room where an alcohol specialist from Florida described the different cocktails that we would drink throughout the night. It was the first time they hosted such an event, and I think it was well planned, but poorly executed.

What I mean by that is that people made reservations for the cocktail not, and many did not show. From my experience from many events hosted by other places like Chase Insider, all people are required to pay prior to coming. Because they did not have to pay, half did not show up, which made the event look weak for my clients (they were wondering why it was half empty).

The meal overall was tasty. The steak was good - on par with other Ruth Chris restaurants I have attended. The shrimp cocktail for an app was probably the best. They were very kind to replace the steak with salmon for those in our party who could not eat the meat.

The service was on par. Nothing spectacular since the room was set-up awkwardly (they had to pass us the plates and we had to take them mid-air). Again, first time planning the event.

I would come back here for another event. The GM also came out to welcome everybody, which was a very nice touch.
author: Albert K.

description: Clark was a great server, he gave us a lot of wine recommendations. Also told us about the specials for the night. The service was great, Clark and Juan were very attentive and fast! We got the three course meal which was filling and a great deal for $55 per person starters my boyfriend got the gumbo, it was very delicious. I got the Caesar salad, they give a great portion. For entrees i got the lobster tail and filet! It was very juicy and flavorful. My boyfriend got the 12 oz steak! It also came with one side, we got the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach! We were so full after our entrees, so we asked for the desserts Togo :)
author: Christina T.

description:
SALT, SALT, and more SALT + poorly cooked steak! 

Service: 5 star

Steak: 1 star.... salty and cooked wrong twice (I ended up eating my sides for dinner and returned the steak the second time that came out charred to death! 

Cesar salad: 3 star 
Salty and soggy 

Sides: 4 star 
baked potato, shoe string fries, creamed spinach, mushrooms. 

Au Poivre sauce: -5 stars 
So salty that it made me sick to my stomach 

Dessert: 3 stars
Chocolate cake and strawberry shortcake 
It was OK but to me it wasn't a home run, it tasted cheap/generic to me. 

Cocktail: 5 starssss! 
Fantastic fresh berry Cosmo 

Will I go back? Nope, it's wasn't my cup of tea... I was expecting a lot more from RCH and was quite disappointed with the food flavor/quality especially the steak.
author: Shell S.

description: 5 anniversary date here,late roses on table but Had a very informal &Sweet server Jessica. Melt in your mouth Sirloin Steak &Stuffed Chicken was Amazing!!
author: Angelina O.

description:
I have never heard of not being able to split a check or running multiple cards. Especially when you have a party of 11 and a $800 bill. One person was made to put the whole charge on their card. That is absurd!!
As for the food it was good but the whole check fiasco left a bad taste in my mouth. The strawberry short cake dessert was cheap and dry. I would have upgraded if I would have know that  
All and all it was a nice experience. I should have listened to my friends when they said it wasn't as good as expected. 
My raspberry lemon drops were the best party!
author: Chanelle M.

description: Ok, it's a chain and sometimes chains aren't as creative and special as a single restaurant venue. But if you can get past the chain part, they do a really good job. We had a 7:30 reservation on Friday 7/28 and the only negative is that we had to wait about five minutes to be seated. I'm always impressed when a host or hostess takes you directly to your table at arrival, but that didn't happen. Only a small negative. The best value on the menu are the price fix items on the left hand side of the menu. Salad, entree, a side and dessert for only $45 or $55 depending on the entree. Everything was prepared perfectly and waiter Chris (not related to Ruth) was friendly and good at his job. What I also like is that this restaurant does not add a 4% employee benefit tax to the bill.  I avoid most of these extra tax restaurants, which greatly limits my dinning choices in San Francisco.
author: Jim A.

description: Love the consistency and quality at any location.  You can't beat the dinner special!  We have enough for two great  meals!  Only issue was one steak was too rare for my daughter and needed to be sent back.  Came back overcooked but she was ok with it.  Ashley did a great job of taking care of us.
author: Jeff E.

description:
We ordered the Ruth's classic which comes with a starter, entree, side, and dessert. I'm not a fan of salads, but the steakhouse salad was very delicious. The ranch dressing on it was insanely creamy and tasty. For the sides we got the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach, which were both good, but not great. We also got the mac and cheese however, which was tasty and easily the best of the three sides. 
The steak was one of the best I've ever eaten. I got the 16 oz. ribeye steak which came swimming in a puddle of hot butter, and it was seasoned and cooked perfectly. 
The service here was excellent. All of the employees were friendly, and our server, Jessica, was attentive, polite, and informative. They really go the extra mile if you're celebrating a certain occasion, which is nice.
Overall, a very great experience
author: David T.

description: I really enjoyed my meal here. I had the petite filet, asparagus with hollondaise sauce and the potatoes au gratin. It was so delicious. The servers were friendly but also formal and professional. I also loved the music (older stuff like Ella Fitzgerald) and the lighting was perfect, dim enough to be cozy but not dark. I would definitely eat here again. Oh! And we had the seared tuna appetizer and it was perfect! The sauce and the little salad that came on the side was delicious!
author: Robin M.

description:
Ruth & Chris, whoever they are - came through!! After reading some of the reviews.. I had my doubts and honestly even thought about going elsewhere for our dinner of celebratory proportions of 5 ppl... Luckily, I was convinced to keep the reservation and I must grudingly admit that I was impressed...well, maybe I'm just not needy enough..? To that I say, the place was expensive.. and of solid quality. Ruth Chris seems truthful in it's advertising.. combining hearty midwestern steak and potatoes fare with fine dining service.. not overdone.. a little pricey, but they came through. 

Let's get to it, you came for the beef right? 

Petit Filet - Medium well minus a couple degrees.. yes they can do that.. and with a 1200 degree oven/broiler, they better be able to do that, because from my calculations.. you can time just about any temp you want on a measured cut of beef with a high and even oven temp. The petit filet was melt in your mouth good. I enjoy a good wood grill flavor on my steaks, but I did not miss it here and the beef flavors were pristinely distilled due to the searing temps and lack of other flavoring agents.

Veal Chop - Medium rare... I'm not gonna lie even though I am a die hard Mid Rare gal, I shoulda gone a little more well done. It came out the proper temperature and looked at me divinely all glistening with it's buttery garlic and parsley topping..mmmm. It was tasty, the veal was delicious and tender.

The Porterhouse - the ultimate man steak.. It was, as the man at the table described it "the best steak all year," now granted it's only February.. but he did love it.

Lobster Mac and Cheese - What say you? Lobster in the mac?! Yes, indeedily! It was described as the best mac and cheese and only second to Angeline's in Berkeley (coming from a harsh 16 year old palate).. but with the addition of lobster, and flavors of jalepeno.. in my opinion, this mac and cheese can't be beat.

Dessert was a spectacle and I dare not describe the foolish flingings of forks at the table, lest I insult your civility.

I would further describe the meal.. but you would think me a lush and glutton, to which I admit nothing..
author: Sara F.

description:
I love Ruth's Chris almost as much as I love netflix. And I love the shit out of netflix.
