The only problem is it's pretty expensive for a chain. But the food is always on. The drinks are great and the service is exquisite. For San Francisco that means a lot. If you don't realize that, that means a lot. You shouldn't go here because you probably suck


But anyways. Decent wine list. Nothing extensive bit good parings. Good martinis. You DO NOT get your own shaker like a lot of steakhouses. But the deserts are yummy. Just stay away from the coconut bread pudding. Not yummy. 

#ruthachriswedneadays?  I wish. 

But ways great ways dependable and easy to get a reservation. 

Bar scene is meh at best. But that's not why you go. 

Meat is good.
author: Dakin G.

description:
Wow, I was really surprised by how great this place was...I got the Filet Mignon and enjoyed the perfectly seasoned meat that was very tender and very flavorful.  The side dishes were also very good.

I will definitely hit this spot again...especially for being a chain restaurant, this was great!
author: Ken G.

description: I've been to this Ruth's Chris location several times and is always is consistent with quality of food and service. Valet is great, too, or after 6pm you can try street parking which I have done on occasion. I usually get the filet mignon and always cooked to perfection. Typical dark wood steakhouse ambience and lively bar area. Very attentive service and staff are always courteous at this location. Definitely will continue to return. Recommended to make a reservation they can get pretty busy.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Love it love it love it! 

As suggested by other reviews, we ordered our steaks one level less cooked. My friend had a medium 12oz ribeye and it was perfectly medium-well. I had a medium 6oz filet, but it was almost like well-done after I've worked on 1/3 of it. So the getaway for me is to order two levels less cooked when ordering a 6oz.
author: Shia L.

description: I LOVE STEAK! I've been here twice and was very satisfied with the food and service. Both times my steaks were cooked just the way I like. Their creamed spinach is a nice compliment to add to your main dish. I also really appreciate the fact that they bring the steak out on a hot plate so as to keep the steak warm. Just sad I can't eat steak everyday.
author: Yuxuan N.

description:
I really wish I could have given them a better review as most of the meal was excellent. I've dined at many other Ruth's Chris locations and was really looking forward to making this location a regular as we recently moved to the city but I was left feeling very disappointed. 

My husband has a dairy intolerance and allergy and we notified our server of this before ordering. He was very accommodating and said he'd notify the kitchen staff. 

We ordered the crab stack appetizer which was nice.

We then ordered a filet and the lamb chops which were excellent and matched what we expect from Ruth's Chris. We also ordered a side of fries. The fries tasted weird. Like old oil mixed with burnt onion. I notified the waiter and he quickly replaced the fries. The new fries tasted exactly the same. I brought this to his attention and he said there's not much else they can do and they'll remove this item from our check. Which they did. 

The disappointing part comes in when we got home. My husband was terribly sick as soon as we got home. He knew that it was a dairy reaction. I immediately called the restaurant and spoke to the manager on duty. I explained the situation and he was very understanding as he too suffers from a dairy allergy and he could relate to what I was explaining. He said he was going to look into the issue and speak with the kitchen staff and would get back to me. I never heard back from him. It's safe to say we will not be going back.
author: Candice M.

description: The service was awesome our server was friendly, always checked in to see how we were doing. The intimate setting is great. The food, well where do I start the drinks were good not weak. The appetizers were delicious we had the calamari definitely not ur average with sauce on the side, this one had a sweet n sour sauce on top. The cowboy ribeye was so buttery and delicious you didn't a knife to cut it, the lobster mac n cheese was scrumptious. The New York steak was also cooked to perfection. For desert the bread pudding with the orange sauce was delicious not overly sweet and the bread pudding with pineapple coconut was awesome also. I will definitely return, wonderful place for a special occasion. Highly recommend it, make sure you get valet parking much easier.
author: Sonia T.

description: We drove from Hayward to SF in Sunday bay bridge traffic to make it to the restaurant at 9:31pm and the hostess and another employee refused to sit us saying that that kitchen had closed. We were highly disappointed in the lack of customer service that was displayed towards us. We are regulars here and have never walked out so disappointed before.
author: B R.

description:
Maybe I'm not a "wine and dine" type of gal, but I really don't enjoy these types of establishments. However, I do believe that once in a while, people have to treat themselves, so when my parents told me that they wanted to eat at Ruth's Chris for their anniversary dinner, I had no choice but to go along. I made a reservation for 5 on a Monday night at 8:30pm through open table and lucky for us, the Dine About Town promotion was going on.

The valet staff gets pretty busy around dinner time, so be very patient! It helps to have your payment ready ($10) so you can save yourself from going through your purse/wallet. We were promptly seated and our server, Nicolas, informed us about the whole process about how they cook their steaks etc and seemed to know a lot about the menu. He brought us the requested Dine About Town menus, but also informed us that there was an section on their regular menu that gave us more options to choose from. My sisters and I ordered off of the Dine About Town menu while my parents ordered off of the regular menu. The Dine About Town menu comes with a house salad, a choice of either the Petit Filet, Fish, or Shrimp, a side dish, and a dessert. The dinner that my mom and dad chose came with a choice of salad, a choice of 2 entrees, a side dish, and 3 desserts.

Petit Filet with Mashed Potatoes - Served on a 500 degree plate to ensure that the customer enjoys every bite hot, my Medium Well Petit Filet was seasoned with just salt and pepper and placed on a plate that was lightly coated with butter. The steak was divine and so delicious. It was definitely one of the best steaks I've had. The mashed potatoes, however, were very watery and tasted very bland. I'd skip on the potatoes and order the creamed spinach, as mentioned and suggested by other reviewers.

Chocolate dessert - Good, but definitely something you can get at a local bake shop.

Overall, I thought it was a great 2 hour experience and the service was great. I was a little bit disappointed with the Dine About Town options, but I do recommend paying the extra $10 to get more options from the regular menu!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Another impromptu dinner with the sis and our friend here last night... another awesome experience!

We were all dressed WAY under (I was wearing my running shoes) and our friend was wearing yoga outfit but they still accommodated us without any questions.  

Service was still friendly... my petite filet mignon was delish especially with broiled tomatoes with a side of Silver Oaks Chardonnay - perfect evening with the ladies.
author: Cath M.

description:
Yes just like everyone else I came here for DAT (Dine About Town). 3 course meal for $34.95 at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse... seemed like a deal to me!

Corner of Van Ness and California. There's Valet up front for $10 or parking garage on California that's about $6 an hour I think. We just found street parking around the corner.

Boyfriend and I made a reservation at 8 PM on a Tuesday and we waited for 15 minutes. We were starving, 8 PM, random Tuesday night, and we have to wait another 15 minutes?? What's the point of making a reservation then?! The hostess also said "thanks for waiting" rather than "sorry for the wait" which I would have much preferred. Minus one star.

Other than that, everything else was great. Food, wine, server (Tim) were excellent.  I'm not even a steak person and I enjoyed it! 

I got the salad (actually this was a little bland), 8 oz petite filet, and dessert. [http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fLF1VHagoZ_sNtrsjCJoTA/l.jpg]
Boyfriend asked our server he wanted the 16 oz ribeye upgrade for $15, but Tim suggested just ordering from the regular menu because it would also be $50 but he would have more choices for salad, dessert, and side dish.  Great suggestion, but what a sneaky way of converting to the regular menu Ruth!

Tim explained to us that the steak here is the second best steak in the nation (don't quote me on that) and he went on about how great this prime steak is. So we got it and he was right! I don't usually like steaks because of the chewiness to it, but filet was juicy, tender, and declicious! I ordered medium rare and it seemed a bit on the rare side, but it came in such a hot, sizzling plate that I just dabbed a piece onto the plate and it cooked! Haha. 

Anyway, this was such a big meal that by the time the dessert came, we were already full and plans on doing something after dinner were shut down. 

Worth the money. 
Worth the fine dining experience.
Worth coming for some excellent steaks (even if you're not a steak person ;)
author: Raquel Y.

description:
The beef was awesome! 
Great service, candle light dinner, nice settings, food was awesome! The only thing I would say is, they need better steak knives if you are cutting a rare piece of meet. But other then that, everything was perfect. We are here for our anniversary and even got a complimentary dessert to end our night.
author: Mona Lisa L.

description:
Another GREAT meal at Ruth's, I've been to several different restaurants and they are always very good. Tonight in San Francisco was no exception, great food and awesome service. Our waitress, Jessica was so attentive. She really took great care of us. 

The filet mignon was cooked perfectly. The cheesecake is definitely a good choice for dessert.
author: D L.

description:
The only reason I would give ONE star is because the food is pretty good , besides that the service is TERRIBLE !!!! Filled with a bunch of miserable jealous waiters/servers who are FAR from warming !

Went in a couple weeks ago for a pricey meal (around $200) . When we got home we noticed the rest of the leftovers we got to go either wasn't ours , or was missing food ! This was a huge disappointment and had to throw out the rest . Not to mention the steak didn't look anything like the one I had , and was covered in mashed potatoes which I didn't mix on my plate . 

Called to discuss this with the manager named "Friola" or "Friolo" , which he went on to tell me "his bus boy doesn't make mistakes , and I'm not getting a free steak" which I didn't even ask for , because I wouldn't even go eat in this place again anyways !!!! I have had MUCH better service at Applebee's and Texas Roadhouse sadly ! 

These people are not very professional and do not value their customers . Very rude and disappointing . Wouldn't recommend wasting your time and money at this overrated/over priced place . If you want a GOOD steak dinner , head across the street to The House Of Prime Rib . Better food and professional people not rude morons .
author: Sasha F.

description: I love Ruth's Chris restaurant. This is the second time I have been there and been more than pleasantly pleased. The first time I went there the service was exceptional. The food was extraordinary. And the intimate dining setting that was provided was perfect. The second time I went there I selected a special occasion while making the reservation online. Upon arrival and being seated the perfect table there was rose petals decorating the perfectly set tablecloth. This is the second anniversary I have spent at Ruth's Chris and there will certainly be another in the future. Aside from the exceptional customer service it was the juiciest most flavorful bone-in rib-eye steak I've ever had in my life. 5 stars - Ruth's
author: Broc J.

description:
Been wanting to try here for a while and finally got the opportunity some weeks ago for my birthday.

$10 valet, which was convenient for an area where parking is difficult to find. We were seated at the time of our reservation. Service was welcoming, although we got seated extremely closely to a very full table where their waiter kept leaning into my boyfriend's space to serve them and to our annoyance did not notice once. 

Steak was great, the most tender I've ever cut into. They have this thing called "rare plus," which our server told us about after we requested our meat to be "medium rare but closer to the rare side," something we ask for every steak house we go to. We ordered sides of their corn and mashed potatoes, the former of which had too much kick and the latter a little too bland. The steak lived up to the hype, and still tasted good as leftovers the next day.
author: Cammi Z.

description: Always an amazing time when we visit, our steaks were cooked perfectly, and the customer service was great! We did use a Lyft to get there from our hotel and had one pick us up aswell, at which point the Valet was a little aggressive to our driver for picking us up right there....
author: Jordyn E.

description: Outstanding food and great experience. Ribeye was so juicy and flavorful. They even put rose petals on the table because it was a special occasion. What a nice touch. Service was prompt and very helpful. Valet was easy rather than finding street parking. We will be back! Yum.
author: Daisy S.

description: Great, speedy service. We had reservations and were seated upon arrival. The service and temperature of food on arrival was great, and the food arrived to our table very swiftly. I ordered a medium well steak, while my bf ordered well done. My only hiccup was that they gave me his plate and he had mines lol no biggie. I thought my steak seemed a bit "overcooked" but the food was so good we realized we had the wrong plates a little too late since we'd already scarfed down the plates halfway Lol but outside of this it was a great visit, the ambiance is nice and they also have valet parking. The best thing for me was the lobster mac n cheese. Good Lord that stuff is GOOOOOOD!!! IT'S EXCELLENT! Very flavorful. I find myself craving it at times, so we definitely will be back!
author: S K.

description:
1 year anniversary with the boyfriend. We had the choice of driving all the way to Carmel and dining at Pacific's Edge, or making the shorter trip to San Francisco. We chose SF. And obviously, Ruth's Chris.

I'm not very good with the geography of SF, so I can't tell you much about the location. Good luck finding street parking though! We were running a bit late to our reservation so we were forced to do valet for $10. Which was worth it because it was extremely cold and I probably would have been blown away by the wind if I had to walk to the restaurant.

My boyfriend and I walk in. No one at the host stand. So we waited around 5 minutes. The hostess finally walks up, welcomes us, and seats us at our table. We forgot to mention in our OpenTable reservation that it was our anniversary, so when she asked if there was a special occasion, I told her what was up. She congratulated us and walked away... then came back with 3 rose petals and threw them on our table whilst giggling and congratulating us again, LOL! What a nice touch.

Our server was whatever. She was neither engaging nor friendly. All she did was take our order... and after she was seated with larger parties, she seemed to forget about me and my boyfriend altogether. I would say all the work was done by a busboy/food runner who was actually attentive and took care of us. Thank you, angel whose name I do not know!

And the food? We ordered the:

- Crunchy spicy lobster (too salty, but okay overall)
- Ribeyes (both medium, but mine was more medium-well)
- Creamed spinach (okay)
- Potatoes au gratin (okay)
- Caramelized banana cream pie (best part of the meal)

My steak was such a disappointment! They do serve your steak on a 500 degree plate, so my steak might have cooked on it a little. I don't know. All I know is that it definitely wasn't medium. I wasn't really a fan of my steak swimming in a pool of butter either. The sides were just alright; nothing was memorable. The banana cream pie, however, was beautifully presented and delicious! We also received a complimentary "happy anniversary" dessert plate, which came with a key lime pie, vanilla ice cream drizzled with raspberry sauce, and dark chocolate brittle, and it was good.

Overall, the food was just average for a $150 bill. Service would have been subpar if it hadn't been for the busser/food runner. Ruth's Chris, you can do better than that!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Kinda disappointed with my experience here on Thanksgiving night. In San Diego, Ruth Chris is considered a high end, amazing service, best-bet-for-a-fancy-night-out, mouthwatering meal but this place was no where close. First of all everything was super casual which is fine, that's not the restaurants fault...kinda. It was very dim and slightly crowded between all the tables that were crammed in. We had reservations for 9:00pm because everything else was booked, ok fine. But we get there and we sit around for 40 minutes waiting! (-1 star) What was the point of a reservation? Not quite sure. At this point we were all starved since we hadn't eaten since lunch around 2:30. We're finally seated and the waitress tells us not to feel "rushed or anything but the kitchen closed 30 minutes ago"....Ok...how is this my problem if your restaurant took us 40 minutes late? Second, if they close at 9, then why take reservations at 9? It was complete bologna. Anyways, we get the bread and butter first which was alright, not bad not the best either. We decided to order the Thanksgiving meal since it was Thanksgiving and I completely regret it. This meal came with an started (salad or soup), main course (turnkey, stuffing, some kind of sauce on top, cranberry sauce, and a choice of yams, mashed potatoes, and cream of spinach) and finally a dessert (pumpkin cheese cake and ice cream). The soup, according to my parents was good but the steak salad my and my sister got was just a bunch of rotting green leaves. Next, we got our main course. First of all, the all of our meals were cold. The only thing that was actually warm/hot was the middle of the stuffing mountain and the bottom of the casseroles. Honestly the entire meal was super basic for it to be in Ruth Chris. I can't even tell you how to fix it. The stuffing was boring, the turkey and sauce was boring, and the cranberry sauce tasted like it came from a can. The cream of spinach I got was ok, needed salt. Mashed potatoes were basic. The yam casserole was so sweet it could pass for dessert. (-2 stars) Finally dessert. Pumpkin cheese cake and ice cream? Couldn't we stick with traditional pumpkin pie and ice cream? The waitress was nice enough to just give me two scoops of chocolate ice cream and my parents tried the cheese cake, ditched it, and went for the ice cream. (+1 star)

On the plus side! The soda was fizzy! (+1 star)

Super sad Thanksgiving dinner was a complete fail but we made up for it in some local spots. Will not be back to any Ruth Chris locations in San Fran (sorry!).
author: Salina A.

description: I would for sure go back! The food was superb! We ordered the seafood tower - which was super impressive, fresh, and delicious! My husband ordered the prime rib with crab cake on top on his steak- he literally said it was the best steak he ever had! Juicy and cooked to perfection! I ordered the lobster and the fillet mignon. It was so good! The lobster and butter dipping sauce was my favorite. The best lobster I have had ever! The staff was very friendly and polite. We celebrated our wedding anniversary that night and they sprinkled roses on our table and provided complimentary dessert! My only complaint - which is really nothing - is that other folks did not adhere to the dress code. I noticed other folks in shorts/flip flops, etc. They mentioned the dress code is business causal and that takes away from ambiance when you see others in their beach wear. Other than that- I would for sure go again! Loved it! Great restaurant! They also have a valet for parking or you can use parking garage kitty corner to the restaurant. Parking would otherwise would have been impossible.
author: linda l.

description: My family was seated immediately when we arrived.  Food was prepared perfectly and tasty. RC really knows how to cook meat perfectly.  Service was excellent... very attentive.
author: Kmaintl L.

description:
For the longest time, I avoided this place because of its status as a national chain. I had seen so many other higher end franchises deteriorate as they start to offer inconsistent flavor and quality that I couldn't bring myself to visit Ruth's Chris. And plus, we had Alexander's, Harris' and 5A5 as superior alternatives.

UNTIL I DID. And then again. And again.

As of now, I've been to this Ruth's Chris (and only this one) five times (often with guests from abroad), and each time.. the Filet Mignon has been perfectly cooked to a pink medium-rare. The flavor has always been on point with the quality of the meat being the actual star and not overpowered by sauces. And the texture? Well, each time it has been so tender I wonder if I even really needed a knife to cut through it. 

The sides are so rich and delicious, you can't stop eating them. Especially the Potatoes Au Gratin and Creamed Spinach. I've also tried some other soups, sides, shrimp, and desserts. Everything was very tasty and perfectly cooked.

Alexander's and 5A5 remain personal favorites, but when you're just looking at just the filet mignon, Ruth's Chris is a strong contender and often has competitive offers (like the 3-course meals for $39.99) that can make it the significantly more affordable option.

NOTE: I haven't tried much of the rest of their extensive menu.
author: Asha S.

description:
Last night, my husband took me here got my birthday. When we got to the door, they opened the door and greeted us. The front desk staff was also friendly. They took us to our table and gently threw happy birthday confetti on the table. I thought that was very thoughtful of them.

Service: The waiter came by and was quick to provide us with water and bread. He was friendly and had a smile on his face. He made sure we enjoyed our meal.

Food: the steaks are pricey, but it is worth it! I ordered the filet medium and it was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  It just melted in your mouth, yum! We ordered lobster Mac and cheese and boy was it delicious! I love Mac and cheese so when they have Mac and cheese at any restaurant, I must have it. It was hot, cheesy, and had a good amount of lobster. I was full, but just couldn't stop eating it! Even though it is a side dish, you can certainly share it. 

I enjoyed this place and if we were in the city and was carving for steak, this is the place to go.
author: Chan Chan T.

description:
Awesome place to eat.  It's obviously a bit pricey, but the service is A+.  Nick was our server and he was personable but not to the point where you can tell its fake.  He did an excellent job.  The chef I think overcooked our first steaks, but my wife and I were having such an enjoyable evening on our anniversary weekend we didn't care.  Nick brought out a comp tuna ahi though while we waited which we didnt even need or request.  The manager also came over and talked with us, you can tell they want everyones experience there to be great.  

My advice is to order the specials they offer, usually about $52.95 and you get 3 courses including a side dish with your entree.

My wife really enjoyed the cheesecake they brought us for dessert.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Mmmmm the minestrone soup was delicious! 

My second time here was for my boyfriend and I celebrating valentines day. 

He was suggested the bone in filet and he ended up ordering that with a side of mashed potatoes. 

I ordered the filet and also a side of mashed potatoes. (Since my boyfriend loves them). 

For dessert we had the chocolate explosion which is pretty much a lava cake! Yummy!

Great service by James (front waiter) and Zach (assistant sever)

Zach talked to us mostly, and had a good attitude!

Thank you gentlemen.
author: Marissa H.

description:
Came here for Thanksgiving dinner, and Ruth's Chris hit it  out of the park. It would be nice if they would state and enforce a dress code.  This isn't Outback Steakhouse or Benihana's.  20-somethings should not be seated in hoodies, sneakers, and the like. Most patrons were dressed in accordance with the ambience, but several weren't, including some who are old enough to know better.

I realize it's San Francisco and not New York or Boston, but some of you diners out there need to step it up. Don't show up here dressed for Applebee's or Lark Creek.

The food was exceptional. We shared the mashed potatoes (superb!) and the creamed spinach between us. My steak (surf and turf of a sort--two huge shrimps curled up on top) was perfectly cooked to medium rare. Perfectly.  The beef was tender from first bite to last--no dry spots. The apple walnut bleu cheese salad appetizer was also delicious, and that autumn spiced cider or whatever it was, was splendid. Had it been served hot, it would have been heavenly.  

My friend had ordered her steak well-done, and it became a little too pink for her about halfway through. Our waiter graciously offered to have it cooked further, and discreetly whisked the plate away, and returned it 15 minutes or so later.

The pumpkin cheesecake with ice cream was okay, but not memorable. Perhaps dessert is not their strong suit.

All in all, I'd place Ruth's Chris above Prime Rib (also very good, but not exceptional!)

The staff is wonderful, from the host who seated us to the (different) host we passed on our way out. EVERYone made eye contact, spoke to us, and wished us a happy holiday. Granted, we went on a festive night, so I don't know if the staff is always like this. We'll be back to check and I'll update!
author: L.E. W.

description:
Not sure what the hype is all about. It's a steak house but they can't cook steak. I ordered my ribeye medium, it came well done. They made me another and it came practically still alive. I ask them to cook it to medium but bring it out without the 500 degree plate and it came rare. Then they offered to put it on the 500 degree plate so it cooks a bit more to medium. It finally was medium. It should not be this complicated. 

Our server Lindsay was friendly. Can't blame her for the kitchen mess ups. She even told us she will ask her manager to do something for us to make up for all of what we were put through but I guess her manager didn't care. Nothing was offered to us and the bill was not adjusted in any way.

We were really disappointed with our experience.
author: Andy W.

description:
Even though this is a chain restaurant, Ruth Chris was really good and is one of my favorite steak houses! Ruth's Chris Steak House is located on Van Ness Ave. We had thought parking would be hard to find that night; however, we were able to find one about one block away really quickly. Otherwise, there is also valet parking available. We had reservations for the birthday boy and we were seated right away in a booth area. The hostess sprinkled happy birthday confettis on the table as we were being seated. Super cute and different from other restaurants I've experienced. 

Food:
Complimentary Bread: Nothing too special, but I did use the bread to tip it into my Roasted Tomato and Crab Soup.

Steak House Salad: Nothing too special. Veggies looked fresh tho!

Roasted Tomato and Crab Soup: There were pieces of crab meat inside and soup was made out of tomato based. But, nothing too memorable!

Sauteed Mushroom: Birthday boy really liked this! I, on the other hand, am not a big fan of mushrooms. 

Mashed Potatoes: I really like mashed potatoes so this was a plus for me!

Creamed Spinach: Birthday boy thought this was good; however, I was meh.

6 oz. Filet and Shrimp: MEDIUM RARE = SOOOO GOOD. This was served sizzling on a 500 degree plate. Cooked and seasoned perfectly! It was very flavorful and tender. Every bite melted in my mouth. Shrimp was ok though, but the filet was AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS.

12 oz. Ribeye: This also came on a very hot, sizzling plate! I got to try a small piece of this, boy, was this delicious and amazing also!!! Medium rare, cooked and seasoned perfectly again! 

Dessert Duo Pairing of Strawberry Chocolate Cheesecake and Toasted Almond & Dark Chocolate Clusters: By the time, dessert arrived, I was already super full and couldn't eat anymore. I didn't even finish my filet. I ended up only eating the cheesecake and took the clusters home. It was super sweet, but a good way to end up the night!

Service was excellent and professional the whole night. Our waiter kept checking up on us to make sure everything went well. Would I come back to Ruth Chris? Without a doubt, I will definitely be back!
author: Philana C.

description: Very attentive, helpful with the menu and wine selection.... #AmazingDateNight recommend porterhouse with crusted blue chz manager and waiter amazing!!
author: Anna R.

description: The wine and food was outstanding. The service was a bit overwhelming...and the managers that stand like statues. Kind of cool to have had our picture taken and developed in time for dessert. The follow up email from the manager was also nice. Great place to have a nice fancy dinner.
author: Enjoying Each Momen T.

description:
Came her with the in-laws for a CNY celebration and while they enjoyed everything, I was a bit disappointed with our server.  

First off, I'm a Chinese and we love carbs!  The bread was nicely toasted so we scarfed everything down in a nano second so I kindly asked our server if we could have more. Two reminders later and still no sight of the bread refills.  Of course she was super friendly with the table next to us and even comped them an appetizer while she chatted away with them and totally neglecting us.  We gave up since our entrees arrived 30 minutes later.  The food was fine.  

What I was displeased with is the fact that the server was either lacking in knowledge or trying to be shady when we were trying to order desserts.  She told us there is a $3.00 upgrade if we didn't like the cheesecake so we did the upgrade for the 2 desserts out of the 3 as we ordered the Ruth Chris Special. When the bill came, it was $4.00 for the upgrade and she charged for 3 upgrades when one of the dessert was the set cheesecake but she claimed it was a different cheesecake??  When I asked her on it, she said "oh" I guess it is $4.00 and not $3.00 for the dessert upgrade. Are you serious?  Not only did you tell me a different price and even charged me an extra $4.00 upgrade for something we didn't asked for with no shame and walked away.  Wow!

Mind you our bill was $340 for 4 adults and one child with 4 drinks so it is not a cheap dinner and I am not a penny pincher!   I even gave her an 18% tip despite that.

I appreciate spending my hard earned $$$ at places that value their customers and not trying to cheat me a few $$ just to up her tab. 

Management, you need to train your servers better!

Sorry, not a fan!!! I'll go down the block for real steaks and quality service!
author: Amy L.

description:
Delicious filet mignon and ribeye cooked rare. Filet was incredibly tender and juicy. Mashed potatoes were a bit dry. Key lime pie was great but could use more whipped cream.

Service was great except the waiters did not refill water (me and date had completely empty water cups for quite a while before someone came over).

I would give 3.5 stars.
author: J L.

description: We've been to many Ruth Chris' and this one was by far the best so far. Our server Phil was very professional and personable. And the food was better than all the Ruth Chris' we've been too. Including, Hawii, Vegas and numerous ones in the LA area we frequent. I am so impressed by the food, cocktails and service. So the manager Froylen even came to our table to check on us. WOW! It's happened before a Mgr coming to check on us but he seemed very sincere and he sealed the deal on the best experience at a Ruth Chris yet.
author: Julian M.

description: Very elegant and graceful place to dine at. We called in reservations a week before, but it wasn't very packed when we arrived anyways. Prices are a little high but the quality of the food is well worth it. I ordered the stuffed chicken breast and tried some of the petite filet. Both were equally good in texture and presentation. I also ordered the creme brûlée at the end and it was delicious. Would recommend this place to anyone who's a good steak lover.
author: Gloriane T.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant. I just love this place. 

The calamari is just amazing. It has a unique taste but you shouldn't finish it because the steak here is just the best. I always order filet mignon with mashed potato and spinach. The doneness was just perfection and the taste is mouth watering. 

We often end our dinner with a creme brûlée. I find that this place is better than the walnut creek one. Looking forward in coming back.
author: Harold E.

description:
Dine About Town got me here, but we didn't order from the DAT menu. The bf and I came here for my (early) birthday celebration and since I put that down on the little notes section on OpenTable, they sprinkled our table with little "HappyBirthday" confetti! It was so cute! Simple and classy things make me happy :)
Here is a list of the things I ordered:

Orange Citrus Mojito - Tasty!

Seared Ahi Tuna - Came with a mustardy-soy sauce? It was perfect!

Watermelon Summer Salad (something like that) - Watermelon, spinach, lettuce, croutons with bleu cheese and a vinaigrette. It was SO GOOD.

Filet (medium rare) and Shrimp - Delicious! The shrimp was actually better than the steak, in my opinion. I don't normally eat shrimp because I only like to eat REALLY GOOD shrimp that's already peeled. Very hard to find. And they have really good shrimp! The filet was good too (although may be more on the medium than rare side), but I couldn't eat much of it because it was just SO fatty! With the butter and the fat already in the meat, it was too much for me. I would need to be in Pre-Hybernation-Bear-Mode. Wait, bears don't eat steaks? Whatever.

Green Beans - These were okay, not the best but not the worst. Butter and salt.

Strawberry Shortcake and Nut Truffle? - Eh. I wish I ordered something else. This came with a scoop of ice cream and candle for me. Meh. Couldn't finish it.

The bf ordered some chilled crab soup which tasted like salsa. His meal came with Potato Fingerlings and THOSE were Delicious!! It actually comes in a honey mustard sauce and it was just soooo good. And fatty of course. 

Overall, everything was good. Ambiance and service was great. Sat here and talked for a while after dinner and never felt rushed or anything.
author: Athena L.

description:
I love me some Ruth's Chris. I love me some lobster. I was craving lobster while on my trip, and my friend suggested RC as she is not a seafood fan, but she loves a good filet. I have never had lobster at RC before, but I figured it would be amazing, like everything else I have ever tried.

Our waiter was kind of weird, and stuffy, and just...weird. LOL, I don't know, but he didn't do it for me.

We ordered the calamari to start, which was delicious, just as good as any other RC that I have ever been to. I went with the lobster and filet.

The filet was perfect, as usual, but the lobster was kind if dry. I was bummed. I don't know if it is normally like that, or if they just overcooked it, but I was not too impressed with the lobster. Bummer. 

Not much else I can say, Ruth's Chris is a great restaurant, but this particular location wasn't as great to me as the ones I have been to back home.
author: Randi B.

description: I'm in love with this. Hands down my favorite restaurant. I can't rate the steak, since I don't eat steak. What I do get here is the chicken. OMG. It's mouth watering. It's a stuffed cheese chicken- it's to die for. I promise you. My husband always gets a steak and he's always happy. Than the mashed potatoes and the creamed spinach to add. Yum!!! It's the best. I've gone here with a party of two and a private party of 20. It's lovely and always is a crowd pleaser.
author: Dee F.

description: I've only been to the location in Hawaii until last night. I was pleasantly surprised about how delicious everything was. My filet was cooked to perfection. The lobster Mac and cheese was delicious. The service was fantastic. The ambiance was quiet and romantic. I came with my family and look forward to coming back.
author: Leilani B.

description:
Been a frequent diner here for awhile and coming every few months.  Nothing much has changed. Superb steaks, good wines, nice atmosphere, and awesome desserts.  Shout out to Ashley, a very polite, nice, and attentive server!

Filet or ribeye are my go-to entree, but don't forget the berries and cream for dessert.  And hash browns here are the way hash browns should be made.
author: Hien D.

description:
I had the petite filet, and it was very filling, buttery, and perfecly seasoned.  The ambiance is pretty good for a steak house.  The steak and shrimp combo were also very tasty.  Their portions are huge, and you order sides separately (unless you get the prix fix menu).  I indulged myself on steamed broccoli to balance out the buttery goodness of the steak.  Their bread was also nice and warm, and their whipped butter was very rich.

I thought that the service was just okay.  They could have been a little bit more attentive (I had to flag the waiter down).  Personally, I like Harris (which is very close) a little bit better.  However, Harris has a jazz band on the weekends, and I wanted a nice, quiet dinner.  Ruth's Chris gets 4.5 for food, 3.5 for service, and 4 for ambiance.
author: Katherine G.

description: Staff was kind. Sprinkled birthday confetti on the table. Food was not good overall. Calamari was way over sauced. Steaks were too charred. Tasted like charcoal. Potatoes were great. Again, staff was amazing. Just a mediocre food night.
author: Sara W.

description: We have been to Ruth's Chris steakhouse in Beverly Hills which was pretty good, but in San Francisco the filet was absolutely exquisite!
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Yes. Omg Yes. Thank you Dine About Town! Came here with D and his family and honestly, best choice ever. Everything from the creamed spinach to the stuffed chicken was delicious. The shrimp had about 10 jumbo sized shrimp, all of which were delicious. The petite fillet was tiny, but definitely had a good amount of flavor. The stuffed chicken was to die for. The creamed spinach was also delicious, and much better than the mashed potatoes in my opinion.

All in all. Im coming back. Regardless of Dine About Town.
author: Jessica H.

description: This was my first experience with Ruth Chris. My meal was AMAZING & full of flavor. I was afraid the butter & herbs would overpower the salmon, but that was so not the case. Paul, our server was a great. His smile was warm & welcoming. He was on top of his duties. I strongly recommend this location & please ask for Paul!
author: Chase' J.

description: Here for dinner they let me keep my reservation excited to bring in my birthday properly
author: Brittany M.

description:
Definitely had a 5-star experience while dining here. We had the pleasure of having Steve as our server, and we had the best dinner we've had in a while.

Starters:

Lobster Mac & Cheese: creamy, melt-in-your mouth. Not overpowering, just the right amount of flavor, and chunks of lobster.

Veal Osso Buco Ravioli: delectable! 

Entree:

Bone-in Rib Eye: cooked to perfection (medium-rare); served on a HOT plate. Lovely marbleized texture, tender, juicy.

Sides:

Potatoes au Gratin: one of two dishes I didn't really like. It was okay, but I'm not a fan of this style, so my opinion is most definitely biased.

Spinach au Gratin: the second one I wasn't too fond of. It's creamed, and was a bit bland IMO.

Broccoli au Gratin: very nice. Went well with my entree.

Mashed Potatoes: lovely. Not too buttery, just the right amount of garlic. Paired well with my entree as well.

Dessert:

Chocolate Lava Cake: what more do I need to say? With the vanilla bean ice cream, it was heaven.

The service & ambiance was exceptional, and the manager visiting our table was a nice touch. 

Cannot wait for our next visit.
author: Mary S.

description:
Butter, butter and more butter.  Butter on everything.  Butter seems to make things taste stellar when things are smothered and fried in it.  That is what I need to say about my filet mignon topped with asparagus and a crab cake I had here, when my pal took me out for a birthday nite.  Oh, and don't forget the bernaise sauce on that as well! Crab tasted like it was soaked in butter before cooking.
It was delicious.  The creamed spinach was really good too.

The prices were a little less expensive than my fav steak place, Harris's.  I enjoyed my meal though.  I take one star off for I had the chicken and sausage gumbo as well, and I make mine better.  I was taught by a cajun....mine rules.  I should open a store.

I will be back here if the situation warrants it. 
Beware of all the butter girls and boys...take some aspirin.
author: Lisa M.

description:
The food here is yummy, with great service and ambiance. However, I was kind of underwhelmed by the freshness and flavors of the food. I had a Caesar salad, which which was kind of run-of-the-mill, my boyfriend and I shared the lobster appetizer, which was fine, I had a ribeye steak, which was good (sitting in a pond of butter - yum), and creamed spinach -pretty good too. Interestingly, I found the bread and wine (Uppercut, Cabernet Sauvignon, forgot the year) top-notch...everything else was fine (not extraordinarily good like I was expecting). 

More specifically, I rate the food a 3.5 and the overall dining experience a 4.
author: Stacie S.

description:
I was happy with my medium-rare "Cowboy" bone-in ribeye (the other ribeyes are boneless). The fat wasn't very evenly distributed though...it was kind of only on the edges. My bf's T-bone steak, was soooo dry. Maybe it's because he had it cooked medium, but maybe it was just dry, I don't know. And note that even though the Cowboy bone-in ribeye is 22 oz or whatever and is supposed to be huge, it's actually not that huge...maybe the bone counts as part of the weight. The steaks are very buttery.

Our server made it seem like the caesar salad would be sooo enormous and suggested that we split it so we could fit our entrees, so we took her advice. When it arrived it was the size of an appetizer salad...LOL. It was DRENCHED in heavy, heavy caesar dressing. The dressing was tasty, but there is nothing more annoying than salads that are 80% dressing. Gosh. 

The fries are very, very average and bland. The fries are equally as important as the steak to me, so it was disappointing. The mashed potatoes are very typical. The steamed broccoli is a really good side dish to get though - the plump, fresh broccoli is generously doled out, perfect amount for two.

The fresh bread is the standard crispy-thin-crust warm-supersoft-white-inside steakhouse bread with whipped butter on the side...so delicious.

We brought our own wine for a $15 corkage fee - totally worth it.

On a side note, I give props to our server for being a great BS-er...telling us that "julienne" is a type of sauce (it's really when you cut food into long, thin strips). The service was good overall though.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Treated my wife to the best birthday dinner ever! The staff & crew did an excellent job, they took customer service to another level. The steaks are truly the best in town. Melts in your mouth like butter Baby! The staff made a special day even more amazing. A well managed team led by Nicolas Rivera. Thanks again Nic, we are enjoying our leftovers ;-) & thank you Pat! always nice to have a Bar tender take care of you before an excellent meal. You all do a great job. 

- This is how it's Done
author: Mark H.

description:
NO juicy pink center? BOOOOO!!!

Although I'm not very keen on chain restaurants, Ruth Chris has been on my list of to-gos for the past ummm, 5+ years. Normally, I'm not a huge fan of DAT either because the items I would normally order (i.e. Foie Gras, Filet, Lamb Chops) are rarely on the menu and you're normally just getting a free soup/salad OR dessert which is not a spectacular deal. If I'm going to have a nice dinner, I rather pay for specific items I want on the menu. However, my friend suggested we try RC during DAT since it was both on our list and it seemed like a good deal. Since the filet was already $35, you're getting a free salad, side AND dessert!

On Sunday, January 30th, my friend promptly arrived for our 5:30 PM reservation. I, on the other hand, was late trying to find parking but they were able to be seated first. 

F O O D:
I'm currently on the HCG 500-calorie limited diet, so in addition to ordering the DAT menu ($35) I ordered a side of steamed veggies since substitutions were obviously not allowed.

*STEAKHOUSE SALAD: OK. 

An array of lettuce with one cherry tomato (halved), thinly sliced red onions, croutons topped with balsamic vinaigrette. Leave it up to me to forget to tell the waiter to hold the croutons and to put the dressing on the side. :X The veggies were fresh and crisp, but the balsamic vinaigrette was too oily for my taste and lacked a sweet tang. 

*8 OZ. FILET MIGNON: OK, BUT OVERCOOKED.

RC cooks their steaks at 1,800 degrees and serves it on a 500 degree sizzling platter with an ounce of butter. A restaurant that specializes in something should be able to prepare those dishes flawlessly. I think there was a timing issue and our steaks were probably sitting on the sizzling platter too long which resulted in all of our steaks being overcooked. 

I had requested my steak medium-rare, but it was medium-well to well-done as there was only a very small hint of pink in the center. See pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Kxwc8PIKy2JsegNwgBjAtA?select=V_85uja94fEA1g4sdjv72Q 

The filet was somewhat tender but a bit chewy, and definitely lacked the buttery and juiciness that a rarer steak would have. The filet was well-seasoned though considering I ordered it without butter. 

*CREAMED SPINACH: I didn't try it and took it home to give away, but my friend said it was good. 
 
*FRESH ASPARAGUS ($10): MEH!

I ordered the asparagus sans the hollandaise sauce in addition to the DAT menu since I couldn't eat the creamed spinach or mash potatoes. 

The steamed asparagus was overcooked, which was evident by the dull green color and limpness. It wasn't seasoned at all and completely tasteless which may be because I told our waiter I was on a strict diet? Regardless of this, "healthy" food shouldn't mean boring and bland food. 

*DESSERT: SYMPHONY DUO - PETITE CHOCOLATE MOUSSE & YOGURT WITH BERRIES

Again, I didn't try it and took it home. However, my friend said the mousse was too rich and if it weren't for the accompanying yogurt, the dessert would have been overwhelmingly sweet. 

S E R V I C E:
EXCELLENT! Our waiter was very friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Our order was promptly taken, our food was brought out in a timely fashion, our water glasses were always refilled and we were checked on several times.

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R:
Classy and simplistic, but dated with little personality; wooden interior and fixtures, clean and crisp white linen draped tables and dim lighting. 

Despite it being busy, it was easy to maintain a conversation which makes it a good place for a date or an "occasion" dinner.

P A R K I N G:
Situated near the residential area of Pac Heights, finding nearby parking is difficult on the weekends. Valet parking is available for $10. 

Overall, I doubt I would return to RC. I know my dietary restrictions made it difficult to judge RC in its entirety but as an upscale "steakhouse" it's hard to justify serving an overcooked steak and borderline mushy asparagus. The issue may have been timing/sizzling platters, however, after being in the business for over 45 years, a restaurant of this caliber should be able to operate like a fine oiled machine.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: One of the best fine dining steak resto I've ever been. More so now because we were treated so good the last time we were there. In was June 7 of this year, my hubby's bday. I called few hours before our reservation for dinner. I requested to put some small design or something for his dessert since it's his birthday. Staff went above & beyond. As we get to our table, there were "happy birthday" confetti spread all over our table. Our server Steve were excellent & really made our night very special. The manager & rest of the staff on duty were very friendly. Steak, lamb, & desserts were delicious.
author: Marygail S.

description: My hubby and I had dinner last night at this Ruth's Chris.  We scored and found street parking but they do have valet parking.  Notifying the restaurant that we'd be late they accommodated us when we arrived.  We both had the 3 course dinner with the filet and lobster tail for $55 and my hubby added a blue cheese crust.  I upgraded my dessert to the delicious not too sweet cheese cake and we both had a cocktail. $160 later we were delightfully full!  I will say of all the Ruth's locations I've ate at, this lives up to the name.
author: Janee' A.

description:
My wife and I were celebrating our 14th Anniversary and were looking for a place to celebrated at aside from our regular hang out, The Crab House, in San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf.

I looked through here for advice and suggestions and found that many of my real life fiends along with my Yelp friends dined here before. So, I suggested to the wife that we dine here to celebrate.

We made the reservation at 9:15 PM (Called at 8:30 PM). They asked if we were celebrating any special events and told them it was our anniversary.We arrived there early and checked in at the front counter. We were seated within 5 min in the back room. Kind of cozy but was crowded as they were seating all their customers in the back room even though the front was almost empty.

To our surprise, we were seated at a table with Rose pedals on the tables. (I guess this is their way of knowing who is celebrating what). Then, we were introduced to Nicholas, our server. He was funny and patience. He explained the menu thoroughly, and we decided to go with 

Appetizers: Calamari, Seared Ahi Tuna, and Spicy Lobster. 
Entree: Ribeye (Well done) and Filet 
Desert: Key Lime Pie

Lets talk about 

Calamari .. Both wife and I love Calamari. No matter where we go, we order Calamari (If available) 90% of the time. We though Ok .. just another Calamari. We were proven wrong. The Calamari that Ruth Chris offers is not just a plain jane (and who came up with the term plain jane anyway) calamari like other restaurants offer. It was sweat, and semi spicy and very delicious. (Towards the end, it was getting sweeter and sweeter that we had to down it with water).

Seared Ahi Tuna .. Wow .. Nice and fresh. This is one of the best and fresh Tuna I had. I am not too much of a Fish fan, so only ate a few and was good. Only issue was that wasabi sauce (Which I do not like)  were all over the Tuna.

Spicy Lobster Tail .. Must have .. Especially with the cucumber salad. It is fried with mild Habanero sauce mixed with sweet substance ( I am very sure the chef wold not want me to know what he is using). I was in Food Heaven at this time. I don't remember sharing the lobsters as I was too busy enjoying it.

Ribeye .. Just make sure to order lightly butter as they use butter to cook the meat. I am glad that someone from here put that as a tip and made sure my waiter, Nicholas, wrote down lightly butter on both Ribeye and filet. In my opinion, it was perfectly cooked (for me). Some what charred out side but juicy inside. Only complain was that the Rubeye we got came with 50% fat and 50% meat. 

Filet .. What can go wrong with eating great Filet. Tender yet juicy. When ever you cut, juices were flowing. WOW .. WOW .. WOW ..

Key Lime Pie .. Awesome. Very tangy and it over power some of the sweetness. 

Experience

5 STARS for Nicholas who was very attentive, and very accommodating. 

4 STARS for seating many many customers in a small room where we felt people were listening in on other's conversations, and lost touch of the "Special Event" feeling. In this may be 800 square foot room, I counted at least 20 people.

4 STARS for Food .. Seared Ahi Tuna with plenty of Wasabi Sauce all over around the Tuna, and 50% fat on Ribeye .

Overall Experience: 4 Stars
author: Bruce L.

description:
I'm conflicted. Ruth Chris is one of those places that you go to and expect to have a really good steak. Especially when you get all dressed up to go out to a nice dinner, prepared for spending a little money to get the quality of a fine steakhouse, not Hungry Hunter.

The quality should be consistent, but it doesn't always work out that way. We ordered from the Dine about Town menu, I ordered the Filet Mignon, which was a perfect size 6 oz. I ordered it Rare and it cooked on my plate.

He ordered the 12 oz. Rib Eye, which was fatty and had strings of tendon through making it difficult to cut. We should have really sent the steak back, because it was almost 1/4 of the steak. 

We mentioned this to our waiter and he didn't do anything about it. It was pretty disappointing and I felt awful for recommending that we go there. I really wanted to impress for the price you pay to come here.

This used to be my favorite steakhouse, but it has lost it for me. I'm really sad to have to say it - but we are over. :'(
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Dinner was very good the steaks were perfect.  The lobster mac n cheese. 

My steak was a bit under cooked for my liking and within seconds the manager showed up with a hot plate to make it right. I didn't feel rushed, and was treated very well. Food was good and I really liked the setting
author: Shakeel T.

description:
Dine About Town review!

To celebrate my girl's birthday, we pursued her favorite food: steak. I made reservations two weeks in advance for 2 at 8:15 on a Saturday evening. We arrived at 7:45 and were seated promptly because this restaurant is huge!

Our waitress Lena presented us with the $36.95 prix fixe DAT menu. The dinner includes a Steak House Salad, your choice of a steak, chicken, or shrimp entree (http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Q_W-4PSEnotoIsbhCeKepw/l.jpg), a side of either Creamed Spinach or Mashed Potatoes, and the Chef's Daily Selection dessert. Lena also pointed out the regular prix fixe called "Ruth's Classics," which is $42.95 and offers more choices of course options.

The complimentary bread was brought out bundled in a napkin--I cannot describe the beauty that is warm, soft bread, even if it's plain white bread. The accompanying pat of light, fluffy butter did its duty in clogging up my arteries. Another loaf was brought out to tide us over from appetizer to entree, which meant I ended up eating two entire loaves myself (thanks Nance). I'm appreciative that I didn't have to ask for a bread refill though :') Service is fast and prompt with water refills and plate clearing.

After we selected our DAT entrees, our STEAK HOUSE SALAD came out super fast (http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/PuPa7ULeIej_mh6pAGrYgg/l.jpg). It's a tasty but unmemorable plate of iceberg, romaine, and baby lettuces with cherry tomatoes, garlic croutons and red onions, served with balsamic vinaigrette.

We both ordered the 6 OZ. PETIT FILET of corn-fed Midwestern beef, which was just the right size for the both of us! She ordered hers medium (http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FbJB4IJMmSAnBvJLNlwUKQ/l.jpg). When she cut into her steak, there were a few red parts. However, the steaks are served on hot plates, so she just let it sit on her plate so that the red became pink and the pink became brown. I, on the other hand, got a nice chunk of medium-rare. The middle was so red, it was breathtaking (http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/M-nVkQr1aRvUgktkEIVvEA/l.jpg). Perhaps it's better called medium-rare-rare? In any case, the filet was moist, tender, and chewy. It didn't melt, but it came pretty darn close. And yes, the steaks are served in a pool of butter, but both of us LOVED it. Paired with the seasoning (salt, pepper, parsley, and probably crack), the butter lent a rich, savory flavor to the filet mignon. This may sound gross, but I was literally mopping up the butter with pieces of steak. That being said, if you are on a low-butter diet, don't come here. And if you like touching plates that your steak is served on, I wouldn't come here either :/ 

Both of us chose the CREAMED SPINACH (http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bfcPtpvryhKo_5pCSaAFgg/l.jpg). I've never had creamed spinach before, and the creaminess of it took me aback. I could barely taste the usual bitterness of the spinach, and the texture was so mushy you could have mistaken it for baby food. Their reserved use of salt was appreciated as well. I was curious about the recipe, and I was surprised to find that they use whole milk in place of cream! (http://www.food.com/recipe/ruths-chris-steak-house-creamed-spinach-31045) But they definitely were generous with that butter ;)

Our dessert was the Chef's Daily Selection, and the chef did not make a good selection...a chocolate cake with vanilla cream, a raspberry, and plated raspberry sauce (http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gOT9d0ankvsbTFOODqviJA/l.jpg). The cake was moist, the chocolate flavor light, the vanilla cream not too overpowering. It was okay, but I could have gotten it at Safeway.

Oh, and if you let it be known while making your reservation that you're celebrating someone's birthday, they decorate your table with "Happy Birthday" confetti and bring out a complimentary 3-scoop sorbet dessert, complete with a candle, at the end of your meal. Unfortunately, I didn't think to do that for my girl :( But the table next to us served as my evidence haha.

All in all, it was a hearty meal in a great setting (think 1980s ambiance, with jazz playing in the background). I prefer DAT lunches over DAT dinners because I like picking my own desserts, and they're priced better. But I enjoyed my first experience at the Ruth Chris chain, and their steak is superb. Happy birthday Nance!

UPDATE: Looking at Ruth's Chris versus House of Prime Rib, each is marvelous in its own rights. Ruth's Chris focuses more on the butter seasoning of the steak, whereas HPR showcases the steak itself. Ruth's Chris has creamier creamed spinach, whereas HPR distinguishes their house salad with beets and egg dressing. Also, HPR includes cornbread and Yorkshire pudding with your meal. The ambiance in HPR is homey and cozy, whereas Ruth's Chris is classier and dimmer.
author: Adele F.

description:
I usually don't like chain restaurants because I find them cheap and tend to associate them low quality food (high volume, low cost, etc).... BUT this Ruth's Chris steahouse is definitely impressive. I was biased this whole time because the RC in HK tastes like shit (what do Asians know about steak, right?), yet SF RC dismissed all biases.

I ordered the ribeye rare. It was sizzling on the plate and flavorful. What I especially like about this dish was the hot place. If I find my steak too rare or the fatty parts too "stringy," I can just sear the meat myself on the hot plate... and that is just awesome :D

Their banana cream pie with carmelized scalloped bananas were slightly on the sweet side.... but SO DELICIOUS.... THE SWEETER THE BETTER FOR ME THANKS!
author: Betty T.

description:
This was our first trip to Ruth Chris Steakhouse and we had an unbelievable experience.
*Valentine's Night and seated right on time for our reservations
*Instantly greeted and served ice water and specials were recommended
*Bottle of wine was perfectly chilled and poured
Bread was straight from the oven and just melted in your mouth
*The NY Strip was perfectly seasoned and cooked to absolute perfection (Only sad thing was that I couldnt finish the large 16oz. steak)
*The General Manager even went by every table and talked with each guest to see how the night was going and if there was anything they needed

*THE HIGHLIGHT: BEST SERVICE WE HAVE EVER HAD IN ANY CITY.  OUR SERVER, STEVE, WENT OVER AND BEYOND TO MAKE THE NIGHT SPECIAL.
author: Dylan E.

description:
My wife and I had dinner here to celebrate our 15 year wedding anniversary.  We arrived prior to our scheduled reservation time, and the hostess had no issues with seating us early.  Upon arriving at our table, we immediately noticed that the staff had placed multiple small "Happy Anniversary" banners to welcome us.  Nice touch!  Our server Trevor was an absolute gentleman!  He was extremely attentive and graciously answered all of our questions.  Ruth's Chris offers 2 "Classic" tiered meal options that include a starter, entrée, 1 side dish and a dessert.  We went with the second (more expensive) option and chose both filet mignon and ribeye steaks.  Both were absolutely delicious!  My corn chowder starter was also amazing.  To top it off, the kitchen staff also wrote "Happy Anniversary" on my desert plate.  Unbelievable attention to detail - we were impressed!

I brought in a mailed advertisement stating a special price of $43.95 for the aforementioned Classic meal option.  This document did not specify which Classic tier was included, so I assumed both.  I explained this to Trevor, and a manager named Tom came over to discuss further.  Tom did the right thing and honored the written offer price for our meal.  I would encourage the Ruth's Chris corporate office to improve the clarity of their mailings and specifically state any exclusions in writing going forward.

Great job Ruth's Chris team!!!
author: Jon W.

description: I went there yesterday. It was good. The food tasted good my only complaint is that the clam chowder I got was cold and I had to send it back.
author: Leticia C.

description:
I have been to Ruth's Chris' all across the country as my wife and I LOVE this place. The San Francisco  location is SOLID! Easily in the top 3 of the country and quite possibly the best that I've experienced. 

The service was amazing from our server Colin. If only we could have Colin at every restaurant; life would be exponentially better! I hope the top dogs at Ruth's Chris read this and give that guy a high five (or a cruise) for being awesome!

The Filet was perfect and Colin even brought extra butter on our plate. (A very nice touch!) The chop salad is a MUST, and they even picked out the black and blue berries from our berries and cream. I think it was quite possibly the best meal ever...

As a reference, I came in in a T-Shirt and sneakers... They could have easily dismissed me and moved us through, but instead they treated me like I had pulled up in a Bentley wearing a custom suit and wiped my nose with Benjamin's. 

San Fran has been phenomenal, I will absolutely be back my next time through town!
author: Brad B.

description:
Let me say that my favorite steak houses are Harris' and A-5 in SF and Peter Lugers in Brooklyn.  Only went to Ruth's Chris (RC) because my GF's daughter & son-in-law gave us a gift card for Xmas to eat there.  Didn't have a preconceived notion of what RC would be like but didn't have high expectations.  Turns out my lowered expectations were met.

Since we had a gift card for a good amount of money and since I was paying for any extras, I decided to treat it like a splurge.  Ordered a Blue Sapphire Martini (which was very good) and a bottle of Stags Leap cab (which was about 2x retail) that the gift card barely covered.  Wanted the wine to "breathe" a little and asked for a decanter.  The waiter could not find a large decanter, so he brought us 2 small ones.  A minor quibble.

I ordered a NY Strip steak.  It didn't seem that large. Forget what the advertised weight was but it was probably around 12 oz.  My GF ordered the filet mignon (6oz) and lobster tail (2 of them) combo. I also ordered the lobster mac & cheese to share.

 I like my steaks rare and, in my experience, very few restaurants actually believe that you want a truly RARE steak or are simply incapable of cooking a steak rare.  Rare in the trade means COLD in the middle. RC was no exception to my experience in this regard.  

The steak was less than 1" thick (probably around 3/4"), which is difficult to grill rare to begin with, and was on a sizzling hot platter, which makes for a good presentation but continues to cook the steak.  So, that if you order rare, what you get is medium rare instead.  

I made a point of telling that waiter that I indeed wanted a truly RARE steak and he promised that it would be so.  However, it was NOT.  What I got was a very tasty medium rare steak but it was NOT rare.  I decided not to make a fuss about it and just ate it because it did taste good but I mentioned the "problem" to the waiter, who initially tried to blow it off but later informed us that we'd get a free desert on the house because of it.

My GF likes her steaks medium and she was not disappointed.  I didn't taste her steak but I did try some of the lobster tail which seemed overcooked and a little rubbery to me.  Ok but not great.  The lobster mac & cheese was ok when it was hot but as it cooled it started to congeal and was difficult for me to digest.  So, I didn't eat much of it.  

For our "free" desert, we ordered the Key Lime pie which the waiter highly   recommended.  The pie was pretty large but it was very thick and gummy (too much gelatin)  -- not light and fluffy as it should be -- and lacked key lime flavor.  I was glad we didn't have to pay for it.  The restaurant wasn't busy, so we spent a couple hours chatting and drinking the wine until it was all gone.  The servers just left us alone which was good of them.

So, overall, I think RC is just ok.  The food was so-so and the service was acceptable.  As mentioned previously, if you're looking for a good steak in SF, I think you can do better than RC but, if you've got a gift card to eat there, I think you'll be happy enough with your eating experience there as long as you don't set your sights too high.
author: Martin C.

description: Service is far below the usual  for a ruth chris probably needs a management overhaul. The waiters spend a lot of time apologizing for the quality of service and the kitchen challenges I would personally avoid this place. The brand Is why people come here but trust me this kitchen is bad.
author: Trevelyn O.

description: Came here for dinner to celebrate my birthday. Like always I was not disappointed. The steaks are cooked perfectly and the sides orders are delicious. The only drawer back is the place seems disorganized, we had a reservation and the girls where trying to figure out where to sit us for like 15 mins. Our waiter was very nice, but he seemed to be missing for long periods of times.
author: Stella S.

description:
Been wanting to try this place for about 3 years now and I finally had the opportunity. The Dine About Town (DAT) menu consisted of: Steak House Salad, choice of 3 protein choices, and the Duo Symphony dessert for $34.95. The DAT menu is not that much different from their usual Prix Fixe menu which has a similar set-up but a little more variety for $39.95. I just stuck to the DAT menu since I only wanted Steak and could care-less about the other things. 

I upgraded to the 16 fl oz Angus Beef Ribeye for $10, which was probably the best decision I made that day (other than going to Ruth's Chris of course). The waitress always tells you that the plates are served at 500 degrees and that's how the steak stays warm the entire meal. Regardless if true or not, the steak was heaven. I enjoyed every single bite and was sad to fine myself done. I could probably have eaten another 8 fl oz but that may because I extend my stomach when I'm eating good meat. The mashed potatoes were decent. The Duo Symphony Dessert was a petite custard with mixed berries and chocolate mousse in a chocolate shell. The dessert was a good way to end the dinner.

Overall i would come back for a special occasion or if I was craving steak and willing to make the dent in my bank account. This isn't necessary a "romantic" restaurant as it isn't candle-lit. There was a family and just a group of friends hanging out. Just make sure you keep it classy if you decide to drink. There is no need to scream and shout to have the manager come have a drink with you. This ain't no bar; go to the bar outside and let me eat my steak in peace.
author: Kathy W.

description: Just had my rib eye steak. Cooked medium rare plus. Outstanding. I would recommend this place. Melt in your mouth steak. Order dessert is a must. Stuffed.
author: Harold Y.

description: WARNING!!! THINGS HAVE CHANGED!!Ruth Chris was my favorite steakhouse until last night. I've alway's loved their ribeyes and swore that this was it for me. Last night I took a couple there that I haven't seen in 6 years. It was the my buddies wife's birthday, and I thought, what a treat to bring them there and have a great dinner! Well, I have to say that Ruth Chris dropped the ball. Our steak tasted like leather, like maybe it was thawed and cooked. I was a little embarassed and didn't want to make a stink about it there. We had the white chocolate bread pudding for desert, and it tasted like paste. My friend also ordered it and he couldn't eat but about 1/4 of it. I just paid the bill and decided to call them today and let the manager know what happened. I spoke with exavior, who sounded polite, but didn't seem to care about the call. He said he would speak with the head chef and stayed quiet. He didn't ask me for a number to get back to me, but thanked me for letting him know about our experience. Not to professional. I'll be speaking with the general manager hopefully tomorrow if they call me back.  So sad that my favorite place let me down.
author: Ted M.

description:
Came here for SF Restaurant Week.  Hand's down the filet is fabulous.  They have a ton of people working the dinning room, and it was hard to tell who our waiter was as so many different waiters/bussers showed up at the table.  Almost to the point of making conversation difficult because we were interrupted so many times.

Maybe I''m unclear as to the goals of SF Restaurant Week.  If it's to drive new customers and full seats, Ruth's succeeded. If it's to turn those customers into return customers, they blew it.

While the meat was very good, the rest of the meal was a major disappointment.   Lackluster salad.  Powered mashed potatoes.  And desert that I would guess had spent some time in a Sysco truck.
author: EC N.

description:
On the days I work in SF this is my go to spot at the end of a long day. I can always count on great service, amazing food and a relaxed comfortable atmosphere. Just make sure to bring your coat, they keep it pretty chilly in here. 

My favorite things to order here are the sweet potato casserole, lamb chops, steak house salad and the steamed broccoli. Also if the salmon or hash browns are on the specials make sure not to miss those.
author: Mark L.

description: Enjoyed every part of my dinner. Celebrated my 39th b day with my lovely guy. From the valet parking to the doggy bags the experience was beyond my expectations. The wait staff was amazing. Patrick was easy going, engaging, and informative. He recommend the crab stuff mushrooms over the lump blue crab. Also volunteered to changed my wine with no problem.  (I like Pinot not to sweet or bitter) . Wished me Happy Bday in a sincere manner. The whole staff was great!!!. Gave us complimentary dessert and champagne, decorated the tabel as well. The food was decadent. The atmosphere was warm n friendly with a touch of classy to it. I highly recommend Ruth's Chris in S.F. and look forward to returning for many more wonderful dining experiences.
author: Lennette G.

description: Celebrated my sister birthday there they were so awesome had confetti all over the table saying happy birthday the good was amazing and our server G was very helpful definitely will be coming back
author: Mariam B.

description: We always come to this restaurant and normally love it. On any other occasion I would have said 5 stars but this time my steak was way over cooked and when I requested a new steak to be made the waiter looked at me like I was an alien, but I stood my ground I wanted a properly cooked steak! It took another 32 minutes!! My gosh and after all of that the waiter forgot my dessert and brang out everyone else's!  It was my birthday! Happy birthday to me huh! I probably won't go back since I was treated so poorly! Sad sad sad. I will start to go to the house of prime rib, and get treated with a little more respect.
author: Danielle M.

description: One of the best steaks I've eaten. The lobster was cooked to perfection. Highly recommended!
author: Matt S.

description: I've been dining here for decades between LA, San Diego and SF... and specific to SF I ave always had a really nice visits.  Naturally I enjoy the particular way they serve on a sizzling hot platter - and I prefer their sides and prices over the comparable alternatives I've had the pleasure of sampling.  So why not grant 5 stars if I'm such a long duration enthusiast?  Well - I am starting to shift my methodology to reserve tat 5th star for the truly superb and exceptional experiences.  Otherwise I would drop a 5th star here.  Give it a go - and you won't be disappointed I say....
author: Tom G.

description:
I had a higher expectation because I heard about this place so many times.
Their steak, sides, salad were all mediocre and I've had better elsewhere.
Service wasn't very attentive, but they were friendly and did what they need to do.
I don't think I will come back.
author: Hyemin J.

description: I've loved this place since day 1. I've been here with friends and family and I've never had a bad experience. The first few times I went, I was sure to order quite a few things just so I could get a feel for the entire menu over time. I generally order the New York strip or medallions with prawns on top, along with 1-2 other things on the side. The only thing I've every despised on the menu is that giant hashbrown thing. It's horrible. Look at the Yelp pictures or Google it and you'll see how ridiculously huge it is. It's pretty gross. My bf and I still  talk about it every once in a while and even get a good laugh out of it. But overall, I love Ruth's Chris. We come back every year for our birthdays, if we can wait that long.
author: Alisha T.

description:
We've been here three times now so I think we've tried this spot enough to be able to give it a decent and honest review.  We came here once as a couple, once with my bf's aunt who was born and raised here, and lastly with my parents (they are pretty ethnic).

The server treated us very differently when we went with my ethnic family - the server's name was Troy.  I mean, compared to the service the first two times, it was really apparent.  If you have parents who might not speak perfect English, ask for another server.  I took this review down a star because of him.  We went for my mom's b-day on a whim and it was just not a great experience.  For example, I ordered the Petit Filet as Medium Rare Plus which is what the server on our second visit said to do, and of course whatshisface Troy gave me so much shit about how I was ordering it wrong.  So awkward!  Why are you trying to argue with me when I just want to have a happy dinner?  And believe me there was more...I still feel bad about taking the parents here now and don't even want to fill up this whole review with that shitty experience with him as a server.  

In terms of food - delish. We order the same thing every single time.  Petit Filet, loaded baked potato, lobster mac and cheese, a bottle of wine (Tigre or something) and a couple of desserts. Portions are huge.  The barbecued shrimp and mashed potatoes are also yummy.  Creamed spinach - eh not so much.  Crab cakes are tasty.  And their salad with the blue cheese hits the spot.     

The hostesses are sweet and accommodating whether you have a reservation or not, and the food comes out quickly which is awesome.
author: Sumeena B.

description: Came here at 8:10 and we were seated immediately, our waitress Nikki was very kind and knowledgable. We got two lamb chops, one filet mignon, one petite ribeye, a side of their classic mash potato and creamy spinach. All was cooked to perfection!!! I was very impressed and for our dessert I got creme brulee the bill total was $236! Overall excellent service and food! Thank you for an amazing night Ruth Chris!
author: Tina C.

description:
4 stars for the steak!!
3 stars for the sides and service 

Dine About Town brought us to Ruth's Chris but we also ordered a number of items off the regular menu. 

First off, the steak: i had the DAT order of a 6oz petit fillet while by bf ordered the rib eye off the regular menu. Both steaks were amazing, came out on a sizzling hot plate and cooked to a good med-rare. The petit fillet was seriously the softest steak i have ever had and the rib eye was also very tender and both seasoned very well. 

Sides: we had the steak fries and mashed potatoes (nothing special) so overall very average sides but the portions were larger than expected and each side order is definitely enough to serve two. 

Appetizer: we ordered the crab cakes which came out on a sizzling plate, two pieces per order and fairly large. plenty of crab and pretty good. 

Service: decent, had both a server and server's assistant help us out. We overheard the server give the 30second steak 'pitch' to selective tables (ie. how the steak is prepared, served, etc) but didnt give it to us, it would've been a nice touch since it was our first time at the restaurant. There were brief moments where we were waiting on our server but nothing too extraordinary. Also forgot to give us our bagged leftovers when we were having desert and paying the bill, we had to come back for it. 

overall, it's a steak house and i enjoyed the steak... i guess that's the important part.
author: michelle l.

description: We ate here tonight for my sons birthday with a party of 8 and it was absolutely amazing. The steak was delicious, we got 2 of the "porterhouses for 2", 1 petite filet,  along with other dishes. Chelsea, one of our servers was a friendly, accommodating, and a delightful waitress. We had a nice night.
author: Jason B.

description:
Honestly, this is the best place for a STEAK in the city. If you think you can top it, I'd love to hear where.

Also, I would give an extra star if I could to this particular Ruths Chris location.
