I've dined in many other Ruths (LA, Vegas, Seattle, Atlanta) and they all seem to always miss the mark somehow. Either the waitstaff, or the food, or the ambience of the restaurant itself. Well, not in SF. Seriously, I've had a perfect meal there everytime. Every one of the waiters has been remarkable in their own way. Hell, one guy who helped us ONCE  in SF recognized me and my girlfriend in Seattle (he had recently relocated there himself). 

Listen to me now and thank me later.
Just go to Ruths Chris if you want a steak in the city. Don't even think about anything else.
author: L B.

description: I really wanted to give Ruth Chris another chance. My boyfriend has never been here and I wanted him to try it. I tried to call to make a reservation and Alex answered, he is possible the rudest person I have ever spoke to on the phone. I simply asked what the earliest reservation was and I was told not he could not read the entire book to me. Really disgusting how Alex is so unhappy and rude.
author: Dee D.

description:
First off... You can get a very good deal here. ~$56 for a starter, entree, side, and dessert. A normal entree alone is already around $55. 

I got an apple kale salad and it was SO refreshing. I thoroughly enjoyed it. It was very refreshing... My 12 oz ribeye really wasn't all that amazing. I got it medium rare and it came closer to rare but slowly cooked on my super hot plate... that was pretty cool. Three of us got the 12 oz ribeye and each slice looked different: smaller, thicker, fattier, flatter, etc. It really wasn't consistent. A friend who got the 12 oz too had a really nice cut. It had a good proportion of fat to meat. Mine was less fattier. i think because of this, as I slowly worked away at it the texture started getting worse and worse. My first bite was: melt in your mouth because I started where the fat was. The fiance got filet mignon and he really liked it. It was a very big cut too. We were all a little surprised it rivaled our 12 oz ribeye in size. The creamed spinach was really good. Our friend said the mashed potatoes were good too, but I didn't try it. The espresso torte was really strong and heavy. (Server told us for $4 more we could pick another dessert on their menu.)

Our server Thomas was amazing and super friendly. The woman helping him was another case though... She skipped filling my cup because the person across from me said no thank you, even though I clearly wanted water. My fiance kind of stared/glared at her as she made her round around the room and she even made eye contact with him. Eventually when she came back to fill our waters again, it felt like she deliberately skipped him. Mind you, both times the cups were half empty. 

This place is definitely a good alternative to to House of Prime Rib if you're looking for a place more low key and less snooty on Van Ness. There's no prime rib here though... which made me sad but at least I didn't feel like our server was judging us. 

Our booth was super cramped. I kept kicking the people on the other side...even when I was consciously trying to keep to my side. The restroom was super clean (which is to be expected).

Although yelp says this place is dressy, we saw people in sweatshirts here.
author: Bonnie C.

description: I remember excellent service, tender, buttery rib eye steak. I remember sipping my coffee & half way thru I wanted more hot coffee so I can heat my half warm  cup. It was like slow motion. I turned around and there he comes to pour me some more coffee. Love the service. Thank you for having great waiters
author: Wolfie M.

description:
I know most people go to steak houses to eat steaks, but I'm not a huge steak fan.  I only came here to treat my boyfriend out to celebrate the beginning of 2013 because he's a steak lover.  

I ended up ordering from their Specialty Entree category of the menu which included: Chilean Sea Bass dish that is cooked in a tangy lemon buttery sauce with lumps of crabs on top.  It also comes with an appetizer (I chose some sort of salad with pecans in it), a side dish (Brussel Sprouts Roasted w/ Bacon), and a dessert dish (paid $4 extra to get a Banana Liquer filled Pie Crust and we also asked for a scoop of vanilla ice cream to pair with the pie).  

We also ordered a Spicy Lobster and Veal Ravioli as our appetizers.  My boyfriend ordered a Cowboy Steak and both potato sides.  I can't speak so much for his steak although it was massive looking, but everything I ate (which was mostly seafood) tasted AMAZING!

There are 3 things I'd definitely go back for:
- Spicy Lobster Appetizer (had just the right amount of spice and tanginess to it)
- Chilean Sea Bass w/ Lumps of Crab (the chunk of fish itself seemed like a giant lump of crab because of the way it peeled when I used my fork)
- Brussel Sprouts roasted w/ Bacon (probably the best roasted veggies I've ever had)

The service there, of course...was also amazing.

My mouth is watering just talking about those 3 dishes.

I didn't order any wine here because every glass seemed over-priced for what it was.  But hey...when you're at a fancy steakhouse, what do you expect....?

Expect to spend at least $100 per person here.
author: Wendy T.

description:
I came here recently and it was my second time. My steak wasn't as good as it was the first time mainly because I wanted to try their chef special/suggestion, which was the bone-in filet, but I was better off with the ribeye. That's what I had the first time and thought it was very juicy and delicious out of all the steakhouses I've tried (i.e. Alexander's, Gary Danko's, Harris, and Bobo's). And my friend had ordered the ribeye this recent time so I got to try a little bit of his and wish I had that instead of the bone in filet. So that's the only reason why I took away one star, wasn't as pleased with my food as the first time around. However, for dessert I definitely loved their cheesecake.

  As for service; I do want to admit and compliment that my service was excellent! 5/5 stars! My server was Clark and he informed of us the daily specials and checked up on us occasionally. I regret not tipping higher than I should of (gave roughly 18%, but should've gave at least 20-25% tip), but I had to prioritize my funds. So I felt the least thing I could do is write a yelp review and praise Clark for his excellent service. It's servers like him that give great customer service and represent the company well.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
The place to go whenever I'm craving for steak.  Love their filet mignon and their mashed potatoes.
A bit pricey but not too bad if I'm just here once in a while.  And the place is just a tad too dark, even with the lamp on the table.
author: Karen L.

description: Nope nope and nope. This is probably the 2nd worst RC location I have been too. Way too small and crowded. Parking sucks. Staff was lackluster and not outgoing nor welcoming to my family. Seating was tight and uncomfortable next to other tables. Our waiter (Scott?) was blah. Not genuine, not helpful, not welcoming, overall he sucked. Our dinner was brought after a lengthy wait. Started with salad that was DRENCHED and I mean DRENCHED in salad dressing - if it wasn't drenched it would have actually been good. The filet was good and juicy and tender.... however  30-45 min after eating everything we all left with belly aches. The creme brûlée was "off" ......quite runny. Not the usual we expect from RC. Overall I do love RC but this SF location is not for me and wouldn't recommend nor would we bother to come back.
author: Heather M.

description:
Never Fails! :)

This is my second time here and the experience is always exceptional. Food is delicious and service is always amazing. 

I don't eat beef but my friends do. So my options are lamb, chicken and seafood. This steakhouse makes the BEST chicken EVER. Seriously, who would eat chicken at a steakhouse right? 

Stuffed Chicken: Chicken is very tasty, moist and well seasoned.
Sizzlin Blue Crab Cakes: tasty and there are chunks of real crab meat in the crab cake
Moscato, Terra Andina: It was okay, I didn't expect much. The moscato was rather dry.

Finished off with the classic crème brulee.

Service was on point. Our server Patrick was super nice and very attentive. The manager on duty also did a check around the tables, introduced himself and wished us to enjoy our meals. 

Overall experience was on point. Honestly, one of the best steakhouses in the bay area!
author: Ro K.

description:
Tonight was a good night, we arrived 2 minutes before our reservation and we were seated immediately. My gf ordered a filet mignon and finished the whole thing which is a very rare thing since she's not much of a steak eater. I had the 16oz ribeye steak which came out perfectly but I wasn't able to finish it because it was just too much. 

For side dishes we ordered lobster mac n cheese (which was ok but nothing to brag about), potatoes au gratin, and creamed spinach.

We got our food in less than 20 minutes after we placed our order which was really impressive, and we were able to eat dinner and leave in just a little over an hour. They get an "A" for not having us spend our night waiting for food.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Took my son here after his "white coat" ceremony at UCSF.  Had reservations but arrived a little early and they were able to seat us.  It was a Friday night and very busy.  Service was wonderful as was the food.  I had the petite filet and it was cooked perfectly!  My son had the lobster and filet and he said it was the best ever.  A friend who was with us had the ribeye and said it was the best.  They started off with the corn chowder and I had Caesar salad.  Both were delicious.  
The only negative thing I can say is that I think $10 plus a tip is a little steep for parking!
author: Cathy W.

description: I came to Ruth Chris for my birthday and of course it was a lovely experience as usual. It was my families first time here - Kenneth made the experience amazing- we all loved him. The food was super good, and the service was bomb. Kenneth was super attentive and personable. This seems to be the theme to come here for birthdays and I don't see that stopping anytime soon!!!
author: Jenise K.

description:
I ate the 16 ounce Ribeye steak for the main course and the white chocolate bread pudding for dessert.
The steak was perfect! I think it's the best I have ever had.
The sides were generous and tasty and the dessert was very good.
The service was also very good.
I would recommend this place if you want a good steak.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
First time there.
Got there on time for reservation and got seated.

First observation, tables are put too close to each other, leave very few space.

Water, bread and appetizer were served very quickly.
Bread was OK and butter was really good.

Then, waited at least 25 minutes for the T-bone.
Meanwhile, I have to ask TWICE for my drink. The waitress completely forgot about it.

To be honest, the steak was good though, juicy and tasty.

After finish the steak, we told the waitress that we were ready for our desert. Until then, the waitress said they were out of the materials. WHAT!? Don't you know that before we order?

Last but not the least, they charge $11 for each of the sides we ordered for the steak ($11 for mushrooms and $11 for mushed potatoes.

I went there because of the four stars on Yelp.com and hoping to enjoy a pleasant dinner.
Well, like the two stars I'm giving here:
"
Meh. I've experienced better.
"
author: Haizhou W.

description:
Went to Ruth's for my hubby's last birthday before our daughter arrives! We sat by the bar and of course had wonderful service. As we were deciding what to order we got piping hot fresh bread! My hubby and I both ordered the Classic prefix menu. I got the lobster bisque, stuffed chicken, and the creme brûlée (paid a little extra for this dessert cuz it's not part of the prefix). And my husband ordered the Caesar salad, ribeye, and because it was his birthday he got the key lime for dessert without having to pay for the upgrade. 

The bisque and salad starters were right on the mark! We swapped dishes so we could both try each other's. The bisque had pieces of lobster and the croutons  and dressing in and on the salad were exactly what I expected. My chicken was awesome! It was moist tender and had really good flavor! My husband's ribeye was cooked perfectly and he killed the whole thing. Oh almost forgot, our sides were sautéed mushrooms and cream spinach. And I wanted a side of the shoe string potatoes. All the sides were incredible and complimented our dinners very well. Last but not least were the desserts.  All I have to say is if I could lick the plate I would've!

Again great food and great service!
author: Sayuri I.

description:
Great steak, great staff.  Ambiance was amazing.  Wine selection is good.  

Prices are a little high, but you know what your getting into then you walk it :)
author: Jason C.

description:
Was super expensive for above average meat and lobster. I got a, I think 8oz filet mignon with lobster, and both were just above average. The lobster  was covered with melted butter, and just incase if that's not enough, they gave you more butter on the side. Because there was so much fat on the dish, it looked really sloppy and not presentable. Actually looks like it's straight from Apple Bees. I also got a appetizer that I remember I did not like and do not remember what it was because it was not memorable. 

I don't mind coming back here again and giving them another chance.
author: Elaine N.

description:
There's steakhouses and then there's supersteakhouses. This is the latter.

Pro's:
Nice place, very formal atmosphere. One of those places you might go twice a year for special occasions.
Knowledgeable waitstaff for steak-noobies.
Obscenely good steak (my brother and I shared the Porterhouse for two). I suspect they cook it twice... once in a broiler and again on a plate in an oven.
Don't have their own parking (paid parking garage is right next-door though).

Con's:
High prices (but you do get what you pay for (except for seafood)).
Seafood entrees are pretty lacking for what they charge. My wife got some shrimp platter and she was still hungry after.

For white meat, I recommend their stuffed chicken breast and whipped potatoes.
author: Pratik H.

description: Went to Ruth Chris on Jan 1 for a new year feast with my best friend...everything was amazing..had the calamari, chop salad with vinaigrette, ribeye, hash browns and bread pudding to top it off!!! They have the most delectable food in town!!! A must go!! Save your pennies!!!
author: Gina D.

description:
SHADY PRICING.
Love the food here.  Not my first time.  Service was also attentive and friendly.
HOWEVER, the pricing seemed a bit shady in two instances.  First of all, $16.25 for a Manhattan seems excessive.  Secondly, we ordered off the prefix menu at the beginning, and when the waiter came for our dessert order (part of the pre-fixed) we both ordered.  It was only after the bill came that we were told that the desserts were not part of that menu.  That should have been told to us upfront when we ordered them.  A partial adjustment was made, but the whole thing seemed a bit shady.
author: Tony V.

description:
O.M.G. The New York Strip steak in medium was friggin' delicious! So glad I picked it.

Came here last night for an early Valentine's Day dinner with my boyfriend. Why 4 stars?

The woman at the front didn't look very nice or cheerful, I felt a bit offended and our waitress didn't come back to refill my water glass until I asked.

But the food was definitely awesome. We got the blue crab cakes for appetizer, I got the New York Strip and he got the ribeye, both steaks were supposed to be cooked to medium, but my boyfriend said that his was a more like medium well (he likes his steaks medium), and we got shoestring potatoes and broccoli au gratin as sides.

Definitely coming back!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Yummy steaks! 
The only thing I don't like is the way reservation dept works-tried to make reservation online-no space available-ended up calling them-they never called me back.
Eventually we were able to get it, but I have a problem w/their reservation dept not calling me back.
author: Natalya V.

description: Recently came here for my girlfriends birthday dinner. Let me say the food here is not the same from the last time i came here. Customer service was good but the food was nothing special. This time I order the chef special salmon w/ shrimp. Salmon was tasteless to me even squirting lemon didn't really help. We also order the lobster mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts, and fries. Really disappointed in the food. From the last time I remembered the lobster Mac and cheese was to die for but this time it was mediocre. My friends had the cheese stuff chicken breast and the rest of them had steak. Now I saw all of them drench their plates with Tabasco sauce and that's when I knew it wasn't just me saying the food was not up to par that day. Don't think I would be coming back I mean there's tons of steak houses in San Francisco.
author: Mylan C.

description: Ruth's Chris is always a solid choice.  I've been coming here for 20 years almost and every meal has been great.  Service is consistently excellent.  I'd recommend the crab cake, calamari app and rib eye.  There's valet parking and a parking lot right around the corner if street parking is scarce.
author: Stanley W.

description:
WOW - most expensive meal EVER! As a special treat for my husband's birthday, I took him and our daughter to Ruth Chris. Our meals were DELICIOUS. The meat and lobster were perfectly cooked and our sides were out of this world.

On the down side, we were seated by the kitchen in a corner table. Sadly, that wasn't as bad as be seated next to an obnoxious table with "trashy" speaking diners. We were quite surprised that they were able to afford such exorbitant prices. Regardless, this did not weigh in on the three star rating.

The reason why we did not give them more stars is:

CONS:
Although delicious, $300 bill for 3 entrees with 2 glasses of wine and 1 dessert is probably a once in a lifetime experience for us. Not sure a "chain" restaurant should be charging such crazy prices.

Our waiter, never explain Ruth Chris' concept behind their menus. For examples, sides are meant to be shared. I'm sure this was written somewhere but at those prices, we should be catered and treated as first time customers. 

The presentation was not appealing and did not lend itself to the high prices. The plate consisted of ONLY the protein. The side dishes seemed like they were under a "heat lamp" too long. Basically, the dishes arrived cafeteria style.

PROS: Food was delicious! 

Sorry, but the next time we have money to splurge....we'll head to House of Prime Rib.
author: TJ C.

description:
I don't visit chain steakhouses often, perhaps due to my unjustified and misconceived notion that they are somehow of lesser quality than other steakhouses.  We live close by so at the end of a very long and busy work week, I suggested to the bubs that we try Ruth's Chris (RC).  Day of reservations were easy to make and we were seated promptly.

The service thereafter was a bit slow, but might have been because of the two big parties seated in our area.  After scanning the Dine About Town (DAT) menu, we decided to go with the regular menu.  The DAT menu was not that much better than their usual offerings, which included better, bigger, and more diverse prix fixe menus.  The bf picked the 12 oz rib-eye and 2 lobster tail combo (upper $50s) while I selected the filet a la carte (about 11 oz for mid $40s).  We also ordered the lobster mac n cheese.

I ordered my filet rare, and surely my steak arrived with a bright red center.  It was also covered with a wonderfully flavorful seasoning.  My bf's medium rare rib-eye was also good, although compared to my filet, seemed average.  Which makes it official - I have switched over to the rare side.  His lobster tails were too salty for me though he seemed to enjoy them.  Finally, the lobster mac n cheese was deliciously cheesy, although the lobster pieces could have been mixed in with the cheese rather than baked on top.  That way, the mac n cheese might be better infused with the lobster flavor.  Still, the dish was very satisfying and generous.
author: Linh V.

description:
April 30, 2015:  Caymus Wine Dinner.  Outstanding, but keep in mind that these locations are in fact not equal.  Please see my review with regard to the Walnut Creek dump (maybe folks in Contra Costa County just expect to pay more for less than those of us in San Francisco, Sacramento, and other places).

After the Caymus Wine Dinner, the experience at the San Francisco location was so incredible (as had our Veuve Cliquot experience been, and at least five other dinners at the San Francisco, Roseville, and Sacramento locations) that we readily signed up for the 50th Anniversary Dinner; first at San Francisco, but later moved to Walnut Creek so we could join two friends.

The San Francisco location continues to shine (unlike Walnut Creek); blows Morton's out of the water.  Food cooked to order, steaks perfect, wine pours about 6 ounces ("cork?  Let me get you a fresh glass"), and staff who recognized us and made us feel welcome.  This is a well-managed location.  But, following the terrible Walnut Creek experience, I have serious misgivings about returning to any Ruth's Chris.
author: Russell R.

description: This is my second visit to Ruth Chris's and this time I came for the Dine About the Town deal. I have been to a lot of steakhouses and I would have to say Ruth Chris has the best bang for buck deal. It is still pricey for steak, but for the fine dining ambiance in order to impress your lady friend, it is totally worth it. Everything is a la carte, but for us it was included because of the dine about the town deal. Total damage for a 3 course meal per couple was around $80.
author: Owie N.

description:
IM BIASED. so there now that we all know that, lets get into the real content

There is a saying that "the only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." by Julia Child. So i just starved for twenty minutes.

Honestly, you don't know nothing about love or if you think love doesn't exist, then i found it for you and it is here. It affects you in some type of way that I can't even describe... I used to hate fish but after taking my first bite into their swordfish steak ( Chef Special ) I am a true believer now. Love exists my friends, you are not alone.

My girlfriend got their signature petite filet; small, juicy, but at the same time well cooked ( a bit too cooked for her ) but it looks bloody red enough to me. 

TIP: 
the menu says this too but their plates are heated up to 500 degree and my waiter warned me about it too. so don't touch it. 
but my dumbass touched the plate. excuse my language. 
but hey love hurts right? so does my fingers too, got me holding on to my water cup and my girlfriend's water cup. 

total price? $180 

worth it? yeah i know how it feels to be burned by love.
author: Jason Ping T.

description:
Took my girlfriend here for her birthday (her favorite restaurant) and came away thinking it was money well spent (which, is rare when leaving fancy restaurants because I usually don't think the food/services are worth the $60-$100 apiece meals).

Called in to make a reservation and let them know it was a birthday celebration and they did a few little things to make the night a special one (walked in to see a small amount of happy birthday confetti on the table). Also asked for a table in a quiet area of the restaurant and they gave us that without having to ask again once I was there. Mat add was very nice/professional, and the steaks were .

*I'd recommend the filet mignon. Practically melts in your mouth!
author: Joey B.

description: The dinner was perfect but the hostess had a really bad attitude, which totally ruined the night.
author: Jocelyn H.

description:
My expectations were low, considering this is a chain restaurant. Plus I read all the reviews decrying the long wait time and poor service (especially given the prices). 

Well, folks, the Yelpers were right. Service wasn't appallingly bad by any means, but the staff was not what I'd call gracious. We also were forced to wait around 5 minutes to be seated, despite the fact that there were empty tables everywhere. I would chalk this up to being a one-time thing, if not for all the other reviews making this same observation.

One of the first warning signs that this meal would not be good-value was the very sub-par complimentary bread. I mean, this tasted like sweet and soft supermarket dough you buy off the shelves. None of that rustic goodness you'd find at most other San Francisco establishments.

But whatever. I didn't want to fill up on bread anyway, right? And I was super excited to discover that we could add a BLUE CHEESE CRUST on our steaks for an additional $4.

I was considering the Petite Filet, but went for the Filet since it was just $6 more for a much larger portion (bringing it to a total of $46 + $4 for the cheese crust). Sucky thing is you have to order the sides a la carte. I really wanted to try the lobster mac & cheese but opted for the creamed spinach instead.

The creamed spinach is good, though I personally prefer the one at House of Prime Rib. 

I will concede that the steak is really, really good. It's USDA Prime served on a 500 degree plate, so that the meat is still cooking as you eat it. (But that means you must eat with caution -- do not under any circumstances touch the plate!) If you're a fan of blue cheese, the crust is also phenomenal.

As for dessert -- even if you think you have no stomach room left, get the creme brulee. It's quite creamy and delicious, and not overly sweet.

So all in all, I have mixed feelings on the place. Good meat, mediocre everything else. Not sure if it's worth going to, unless your parents are footing the bill.
author: Tiffany W.

description: This steakhouse is the best there ever is one the planet! Their steak tastes really juicy and I really love the interior look of the place! I hope I take my love interest from my high school known as Maia here next year in September or some time soon and we'll go out on a romantic date together!
author: Asher D.

description: Good steak but small portion. It gets packed right away so go to the bar or make a reservation. Also perfect spot for happy hour and a little pricey but what the heck. Enjoy and get drunk at the bar.
author: Wally A.

description:
I really enjoy my experience with this restaurant , the BEST STEAK IN TOWN!!! 

Quality and service is well beyond
author: Paul J.

description: Lobster Mac n Cheese. That is all I have to say to get any sane person to run here... Oh and their meat....
author: Kelly T.

description: Reservation doesn't count for much here. The waiting area was terrible with wait staff sweezing through constantly. Seated late by an hour. Steak was decent but expensive, came to about $120 per head, so it was over priced in my opinion.
author: James P.

description:
High class dining experience, hinted to the person seating us it was an anniversary dinner, she returned with rose petals spread on the table. The drinks from the bar where we'll made, ordered the calamari which was different as far as seasoning goes,but pretty good. I had the ribeye oscar style ( asparagus topped with a crab cake, and smothered in burnaise sauce)
Cooked perfectly,and served on a sizzling plate of butter. My wife had the 2 petite fillets topped with prawns! Both were worth the high price for a good steak.
The server brought us a complimentary desert for our anniversary. We had a great time, great service and I would recommend coming for special occasions
author: John M.

description: After 4 years of not visiting a Ruth This place did not disappoint. The service was great the steak was amazing and we walked away feeling like we had paid for what we received. The only complaint I had was that the brussels sprouts where a bit soggy and could have been baked a bit more. None the less still a great meal for the price.
author: Ted M.

description: Meat.  Serious meat.  I know it's a bit pricey, but really, there is no better option for beef in the city.  They are experts at what they do and the experience is as good as the food.  The very best around.
author: Scarlett O.

description:
This review is based on my second dining experience at Ruth's Chris. This place is a solid 3.5 stars. 

Ate at Ruth's Chris last weekend. My boyfriend and I were seated right away at a table by the restaurant's front window. Service from Jose was great. He was genuinely warm and polite making both the boyfriend and I feel comfortable and welcome. 

To drink we had the Cucumber Collins and Strawberry Basil Gimlet..kudos to the bartender both drinks were on point. 

On to the food...

We started off with the fried calamari. The calamari was tossed in a sweet chili sauce, which tasted very good...However, made the calamari really soggy. I thought it was strange that literally less than 5 minutes after placing an order of the calamari it had arrived at our table...not hot...but warm. =(

I had the petite filet and lobster dinner while the bf had the petite filet..both steaks cooked medium. Everything LOOKED delicious and was served on a sizzling plate...

The steak was juicy and tender...But overall did not blow my mind. For some reason the BF's steak tasted better than mine. My steak had a strange rancid taste of blood =(

The lobster was also pretty disappointing from the texture to the taste of the lobster. I'm assuming it wasn't fresh. 

We also had a side of mashed potatoes and creamed spinach, which were both good.

Our bill came out to about $200 including tip. We left Ruth's Chris feeling satisfied..but both agreed that aside from the cocktails and service, the food was just ok.
author: Desiree B.

description:
I really thought that this was just so so. Clearly a chain and not up to the standards of the city's great steakhouses like Bobos or Harris or even Izzy's.

The service was very mass market, pushing things like the high margin wine (I fell for it and it was very not OK) and without any sense that there were any regulars here at all. I almost expected the waitress to come out wearing Pieces of Flair at some point!

The food was OK, but not great. The ambiance was very loud.

It seemed to be a hit for the conventioneers, so I guess that is their market. Oh and a bachelor party.

For years I've wondered what to expect here, seeing it in so many ads and the like, and I don't wonder any more. And I won't be back.
author: Jason H.

description:
Most important piece of advice: Come here for Dine About Town! Do it. You will not regret it.

The $34.95 prix fix DAT menu includes: a Steak House Salad, an 8oz Petite Filet, a side of either Creamed Spinach or Mashed Potatoes, and dessert. In case you don't understand how great a deal this it, let me break it down for you: On a normal day/menu the salad would cost $7.50, the steak would cost $36, the side would cost $9, and the dessert would cost...I dunno, how about $8 (I made up the dessert cost since I don't actually know). Overall, you get a $60 meal for $35. That's Groupon-status right there. And, if Petite Filets aren't your thing, you can upgrade to a 16oz Rib-Eye for $15 dollars. According to the menu, the regular ribeye cost is only $9 more than petite filets,  but even so, overall the meal is still much cheaper than it would be otherwise.

However, a good deal is only worth it if the food is good, so how was the food? Absolutely EXCELLENT. My petite filet was full of flavor, perfectly cooked, and just overall delicious. My date upgraded to the Rib-Eye and was really happy he did. It was insanely buttery and delicious. The creamed spinach was pretty unremarkable, but who goes to a steak house for spinach anyways? For dessert they served a little chocolate cake topped with a raspberry reduction and some other sugary goodness. We both devoured ours extremely quickly, if that gives any indication of how good it was.

We also chose a bottle of $40 Italian wine that our waitress helped us choose. She was extremely helpful and patience, I was very impressed at how much of her time and knowledge she bestowed upon us.  

Definitely put this place top on your list of restaurants for Dine About Town and make a reservations early!
author: Talia G.

description:
This was my first visit to a RCSH and it was for my GFs birthday...she loves the place.

I was hesitant at first because in my experience the higher the prices the smaller the portions...

But that is not the case at RCSH. We ordered off of their Ruth's Classics menu (3-course meal) and boy was it worth it in every way. We each got a 16oz rib eye (SO BIG!), she got the creamed spinach, I got the mashed potatoes and for our soup we had the corn chowder. 

The chowder was good, real subtle, and although there was supposed to be bacon sprinkled on top there was almost no bacon flavor, sad. The bread was good too, and the butter was soft enough to spread, but we're not here for bread...

The steaks come out and I ordered mine med-rare and it was PERFECT, she got hers med well and it was...med well...(sacrilege!). They say the plates are 500 degrees! How do they just hold it with a napkin? I didn't touch it with my hands but I had to position it using my forks because of how it was placed in front of me...then I stuck my forks in the two bread rolls and did a little dance on the table with 'em (what movie is that from? jk didn't do that).

The steak was fantastic and worth it in my opinion. It was seasoned only with salt and pepper; the only true way to eat a steak. The juices and flavor were phenomenal. Her steak was...med well hahah...but it was ok. I prefer my steak to moo a little when I cut it.

So then we also had our spinach and mashed potatoes. The spinach needed salt and the mashed needed pepper, and the two eaten together were amazing! All in all, they're sides, nothing too fancy, but I found them pretty yum-tastic.

So then, because it was OUR birthday (mine is a week after hers but we were there on hers) they let us get desserts of our choice. She got the creme brulee and I the Super Chocolate explosion cake of dooooooooooom. My cake rocked  the party and her creme was not what we were expecting in terms of previous bru-hahas we've had before and so my cake won which meant she ate a lot of it. But totally get the cake. 

I would totally recommend this RCSH. Ashley and Brodie were great servers and the place, although way too dark, was really nice. For the price I feel as though the food was great, and I will be going to (a) RCSH again. Thanks RCSH!
author: Mason H.

description:
i had the petite filet-im no steak eater, so this size is perfect for me! it was nicely cooked.
Sauteed Mushrooms-tender and juicy, light and tasty!
Brussels Sprouts in Bacon-super delicious! i'd order again! sweet and not too oily even with the bacon.
service-excellent! very attentive.
overall, i had a good experience.
author: Ru C.

description: Service was great. The waitress put rose petals on the table when she found out it was our anniversary. Started with calamari appetizer. It was delish and I'm not a big calamari fan. Salads were huge and also delish. I had the Caesar and my husband had house salad. For the main course I had the 12 oz rib eye (from the classics menu) and my husband had the filet and lobster tail. We shared garlic green beans, lobster mac n cheese, and mashed potatoes as sides. The sides were exceptional but the lobster mac n cheese was sooooo delectable !!! I can't wait to go back just for that! All in all everything was delish. The service was awesome. The manager came over and wished us happy anniversary and hoped we would come back next year but trust me I'll be back before that. It was a romantic setting and perfect for the occasion. We spent $200 including tip but it was worth every penny.
author: Aisha T.

description: OMG. I have been here for 10 minutes and this is already the highest maintenance restaurant I have been to in years. First I have a reservation and I arrived at reservation time. The restaurant is empty.  Yet they won't seat me until the 4th person in our party is here. Then, when I sit down with my bag-which contains 3 laptops with confidential info, they demand that I check my bag, citing danger to their servers. Really?  The walkways are 5 feet wide. Already an awful experience. Waitress and ALL staff  except the Bartender were arrogant!  Will never go here again. Scratch this off the list of Holiday Xmas party options.
author: Rick M.

description: Pleasantly surprised! Some friends from out of town were visiting and took us out here. I usually steer away from chains in favor of local flavor but we had a great meal and experience. My husband and I arrived to meet two other couples for a 7:30 reservation on a Saturday. I was a little put off at first by lack of service in the bar area while we waited for our table and when we arrived the hostess told us not everyone in our party had arrived yet so she did not plan to seat us even though we arrived right on time for our reservation and it turned out we were the last to arrive. We went back to tell the hostess we were in fact all there and got seated after a short wait. We all enjoyed our steaks, sides, salads, drinks and desserts and left stuffed. The waiter service was very good and the environment was certainly enjoyable. About $500 pre tip for 2 drinks each and dinners for 6.
author: B S.

description: Wow! This place was amazing with a capital A. My only regret was not taking a picture of my amazing food. I ordered the bone in T-bone steak, medium rare, and they nailed it! Cooked to perfection and served on a 500 degree plate. I also ordered a Cesar salad which was amazing. Side of mashed potatoes and shoe-string fries. The side of mashed potatoes were good, the fries were not my cup of tea. Also ordered a cheesecake which was also rated in my top 5 best cheesecakes of all times. I will be back for sure!
author: CeCe l.

description: I just love this place. It's a bit cheesy, but it's a chain, so to be expected. You can't beat the food here. The steak is just amazing. I love how they serve it sizzling. While not cheap (about $50 for just the meat), you get high quality. The sides are not cheap either, but plenty to share. If you are a steak lover, this is the place to go!
author: Hugh L.

description:
Went just last night. Tried the bone-in filet and the ribeye. I'm pretty partial to ribeye so I enjoyed that more, though my girlfriend liked the filet more. If you know steak, you probably already know what you want. 

Really enjoyed the food, though I think what needs to be said has already been said in tons of reviews. If you're curious, they season their steaks with salt, pepper, butter, and parsley. Simple stuff but delicious.
author: Jim K.

description:
I came here recently for my dad's birthday, and the Bone-In steak was huge but not how I remembered. I asked for Medium-rare, but it seemed like it was still rare. I asked them to heat it up a bit more, and they were MORE THAN HAPPY to cook it again. They kept on apologizing, they felt awful. After it was done, they had me try it before they left. Also, the manager stopped by my table later that evening and asked how my steak was. They also gave us a free side dish to top it off! I couldn't believe how great the service was. 

Banana cream pies were also different from what I remember, but still delicious (and $10 for an individual one). 

Service = improved a whole lot
Food = still delicious
Prices = more expensive

Only come here when you get those free gift cards from Chase Freedom!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Food was ok but not great. While we waited 30 minutes for our check I kept seeing our server take shots behind the bar with the bartender on duty. I was beyond annoyed and it was very unprofessional.
author: Meghan B.

description: I recommend to make reservations. We were seated right away.  About the food: Yum. Ribeye steak was delicious!  Very nice restaurant.  Our waiter was nice. It's been a while so I can't remember all the details.
author: Deb M.

description:
I've been to R'sC many times over the years, and it used to be above par, so I went there last week to re-visit mainly because we felt like steak and it was the only one still open.

Over the years since I last visited, the dining landscape has changed in SF, and their food has not. This is either wonderful if you want the same experience you've always had, or dreary and hackneyed if you were expecting a bright fresh menu. Time moves on, and truly wonderful meats are now available at a number of restaurants that source local grass-fed beef, and that use the whole animal in fresh and inventive ways. Still, sometimes you just want that greasy old burger you had as a kid, so I approached RC as if I were visiting it for the first time with today's SF palette.

From that perspective, it's pretty poor. The lobster bisque was nothing of the sort, it was just a roux-based cream soup with lobster stock, and the corn chowder had TONS of sugar and salt in it, almost inedible. My steak was quite undercooked, (seared when I ordered M-R), and it was still raw on the inside. To be fair, if I'd read the done-ness levels carefully I would've noticed that M-R said "warm pink center", which means uncooked in R's C's parlance. Personally I think "warm pink center" means that the muscle fibers have started to form, and are not the gelatinous blob of raw meat. I'd stick to the tried and true descriptions and call M-R a 125°F pull, and then fine-tune from there.

We had traditional potatoes au gratin (way too salty) and creamed spinach (way too salty). Did I mention how salty everything is?

And then there was the clientele, which has changed over the years. Let's leave it at we felt like we were in a rap video. Apparently a patron was arrested there awhile back, the cops got a tip he was dining there and swarmed in. Lovely, and enough said on that topic.

If I were looking for that traditional salty undercooked meal, then RC delivers in spades, but I feel my tastes have moved on and there are better steak dining alternatives, Alexander's for example.

YMMV
author: Rob C.

description: Hellllllla good steak. (Coming from a person that diets eating top sirloin every day) amazing experience. Dim setting with quality music. Servers were quick and prices were definitely reasonable for the Ruth classics.
author: Andre D.

description: They don't serve oysters on the half shell, what's up with that? Also for some reason, maybe simply because it's a chain, when I go here I don't feel all that fancy. Shouldn't you feel fancy when you go to a steak house? That said, their filet mignon is one of the most consistently well prepared and tender filets in the city (tip: always ask for no butter on the steak). The super hot plate they serve it on keeps your meat at the perfect temperature, again a little cheesy, but actually quite practical - just don't burn your fingers. Service has always been reasonable and you can get a table most nights with little effort (presumably because SF has some really fantastic competition in this category).
author: Jeremy S.

description: Just had Christmas dinner at Ruth's Chris.  The food and drinks were EXCELLENT.  The quality of service was great.  Our waiter was attentive and extremely helpful.  I've eaten at other Ruth's Chris (Walnut Creek and Austin Texas) and the San Francisco establishment is by far the best.  Thank you Ruth's Chris for making our Christmas dinner fabulous!
author: Sheila T.

description:
Perfect place to take someone out on a nice little date. Went here for valentines day so my review is a little late. I made a reservation for two and upon arrival, the host gave my girlfriend a flower (totally stole my spotlight). We were guided to our table and the table was decorated with little bits of heart confetti on it which made for a nice valentines day decoration. The lighting is very dim so it gives the restaurant a romantic atmosphere. 

Our server took our orders and I had the Cowboy Ribeye cooked medium rare. The girlfriend had the filet mignon also cooked medium rare We had the creamed spinach and mashed potaderz to compliment our steaks. I read in other reviews that the creamed spinach is amazing, but my taste buds were not impressed. The mashed potatoes, however, was simply amazing. My ribeye steak tasted very tender and "melt in your mouth." It had a buttery flavor to it and was cooked perfectly to medium rare. Next time I'll ask for extra butter!

I'd definitely come back here if I don't feel like going to mah all time fav steakhouse, Forbes. This place is on the top of my list for steakhouses.
author: David H.

description:
Ruth's Chris is a chain, but there is something special about this one. I've been to Ruth's Chris in San Diego, NY, Washington...  nothing is quite like the Ruth's Chris in SF.

this is my favorite steakhouse, easily trouncing fancier places where I've spent twice as much.  not that Ruth's Chris is cheap by any measure, but I have never regretted a dollar spent here. (I can't say the same about Ruth's Chris in other cities)

medium rare ribeye on a searing hot plate of boiling butter. yes. grilled shrimp on top. yes. filet mignon with a blue cheese crust. yes. pair with Krupps Brothers Syrah. yes. lobster bisque to start. yes.

service is excellent.  very friendly staff that is attentive without being annoying.

the sides are just okay. as are the desserts.  atmosphere is refined but unoriginal. lots of dark wood paneling. but who cares. you're here for the meat, aren't you?
author: Jimming C.

description: This place is off the hook, never disappoints. We went for a business dinner and I had the tomahawk steak with all the fixings (cream of spinach, mac and cheese, onion rings, mash potatoes) and ordered a bottle of cabernet.
author: Mar S.

description:
Have you seen my Hula-Hoop? Did the Cuban Missile Crisis just happen? Doesn't Jackie Kennedy wear the nicest dresses? I have to admit that Ruth's Chris Steak House was not my first choice for Dine Around Town this year, but I was so late in making up my mind that it ended up being pretty much the only choice left on Open Table if I didn't want to eat close to midnight. Well, when I perused their menu, I thought I went into the Time Tunnel and landed somewhere in the early 1960's. Creamed Spinach? Potatoes Lyonnaise? Gee, I felt like I was in that episode of "Leave It to Beaver" where Beaver stuffed the Brussels sprouts in his pocket. 

The entryway was packed with so many drooling meat-eaters that I was surprised the prim hostess was not holding up a chair to back us off. When Jamie W. and I were finally seated, we were pleased to get a roomy booth and a solicitous waiter who didn't get on our nerves. It honestly felt like a restaurant that my dad would have taken us to if we were really good. I would 've been six-years old and wearing a suit jacket, a red bow-tie, and matching shorts. I wasn't as well dressed this time, but I felt small anyway. "Small" meaning I didn't feel like I quite belong there. 

We both went for the $34.95 Dine Around Town menu but upgraded from the filet mignon to the ribeye for $8 more. We also added an appetizer, the $13 Mushrooms Stuffed with Crabmeat (see photo). Instead of using portabellos, the obvious choice for stuffing, they went with four giant button mushrooms and put a combination of lump crabmeat and romano cheese in them. Good enough but then they decided to oversalt them. Too bad. This was followed by the Steakhouse Salad (see photo), as generic a pile of greens as you could imagine with a ladle of balsamic vinaigrette on top. 

The Ribeye followed on a 500-degree plate with butter sizzling on the side. It's their idea of a carnivorous spectacle, but I have to tell you there was nothing extraordinary about the cut being served. Medium rare gives you a steak that's pink on the inside but severely charred on the outside, the contrast a bit too stark for my taste. The sides were very old-school heavy - milky Creamed Spinach and buttery Mashed Potatoes (see photos). A dairy-palooza. The meal ended with a duet dessert - a Chocolate Mousse in a Chocolate Cup and a square of Carrot Cake (see photo). A Betty Crocker double-header.

We had to get doggy bags for our leftover ribeyes, and then our time warp felt complete. It was time to jump forward to the year 2010 when doctors were to prove that such heavy, cardiac-arrest-inducing meals kill you. Otherwise I would have lit up a Salem Light and had a snifter of brandy while listening to Jerry Vale on the muzak. 

FOOD - 3 stars...a great meal...during the Kennedy administration...man, you could cut those calories with a dull butter knife 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nice booth in a relatively quiet spot 
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...great waiter, the only part of the experience with whom I didn't mind being stuck in the sixties 
TOTAL - 3 stars...honestly prefer Alfred's to Ruth's for a traditional steakhouse meal
author: Ed U.

description:
To be honest, the meat here are just too salty for my taste. It's their thing to cook all their meats in parsley and butter, but the taste is almost too overpowering for the meat. This could possibly be because I ordered a 16oz rib-eye instead of a filet. I imagine with a filet, you wont have too much of the buttery taste and it would be just enough to satiate your appetite. the meat itself tasted good though and was super tender so I can't complain about that.

Don't get the cauliflower au-gratin. it was barely cheesy and too liquid-y. The creamed spinach tasted more spinach-y than other places, but i liked it because of this.

The salads are HUGE. I was almost getting negative utility trying to finish my caesar so I wasn't wasting food. Definitely worth it if you like salad. It's pretty much a meal in itself. 

The blue cheese in the salad was good, and I believe the blue cheese in itself is good, but the blue cheese crust I got on my ribeye didnt add much. It wasn't even a crust really as it was more just panko and blue cheese dumped on one side of my steak. I sorta expected it to be around the edges of my steak and to stick there like a bread crust or something. Misleading symantics.

The bread was awful. It tastes like the dinner roll you get on an airplane. It's super soft and they just give you a load of butter to spread on it. Now, I could be a bit biased coming from SF, but almost all other steakhouses or fancy restaurants in SF give you some awesome sourdough or fancy branded bakery bread, but this bread was just not up to par. I know I shouldn't be judging a restaurant on their bread, but I love bread and the bread was awful enough to warrant a sizeable chunk of my review.
author: Courtney Q.

description:
We had friends visiting from Paris and wanted to take them to the most American restaurant we could think of...

The staff was friendly and accommodating. The tables around us were extremely loud however..

We ordered:

- Mushroom stuffed crab: It was swimming in butter and a little too salty. 

- Green beans + mash potato side dishes were a solid 5. 

- Everyone ordered a petite fillet mignon...which apparently in Paris is considered a "large." It's about 8oz and some of us couldn't finish it. 


I'm happy to say that everyone left satisfied and it was a joyful experience.
author: Momo M.

description: It was a fine place to go just so i could say "I've been there!" lol... But honestly  it wasn't any better then most "Filet Mignon's" I've had at other specialty steak spots. I give 4 Stars because the drinks were great; beautiful ambiance... but the LOBSTER MAC was so good, it'd make you want to rob a bank just to pay for it! Just saying....
author: Clee W.

description:
(This should be backdated to Dec. 14th, when this happened)

Apparently, this location doesn't honor your reservations if you're with a group of Asians who aren't all wearing suits. The standards are very different if you were, say, not a minority. 

I wish I could tell you something about the food (have had RC in other cities and loved it), but I can't, because we stood by the door and waited for 75 minutes while group after group with reservations after us streamed in. 

I won't be back, and the whole chain loses my business now. There are other steakhouses.
author: Ryan K.

description: Their food is absolutely delicious.. God damn I can still taste the fried calamari, steak and dessert I had there. The wait is so worth it. 5/5 stars y'all.
author: Crystal X.

description: Not sure if you have ever used the Ruth Chris' Gift Card online service....wow, it is absolutely horrendous how they have to put every single charge through their lengthy "Verification" process....took over 2 hours and still couldn't use any of my credit cards (through completely different banks) just to buy a $300 gift card.  I could have driven to SF personally and purchased a Gift Card over the counter in less time.    Just a horrible way to drive away customers.  I've never even heard of a process that needs to ask the personal questions they did, on more than one phone call for more than one Visa card, just to allow you to use their site.    I'd rather cross the street and go to House of Prime (same street, Van Ness) than EVER put myself through that grueling interrogation again.  In the end, they were no help on their "Customer Support" line either.   I would fire that service in a minute, Ruth Chris.  They are hurting your business more than you could ever imagine.
author: Audrey F.

description: great dinner, but that post about all that food for 34.95 is not true. A petite filet is now 43.00 and you pay ala carte' for each side. Potatoes start at 11.00 and your veggie or salad will run you about 14.00. Drinks are 14.00 each also.
author: Nick H.

description: Brought my wife here for her birthday. Was so surprised how we loved  everything . we're a family of 4 so we got to try a few items. We got a couple appetizers spicy lobster and calamari they were outstanding.. I had the stuffed chicken breast and a side of lobster mac and cheese .my wife had small petite steak and Cesar salad  which she said was the best she ever had. Daughter had rib eye and lobster she also said it was amazing ... our son had the cowboy rib eye and au gratin potatoes. He said steak was cooked to perfection. Told server it was my wife's birthday he gave her a free dessert  Which by the way was soooo good and looks so Cute. Over all great meal. Will be back soon. Worth every penny.
author: Michele R.

description:
We had the best steak in a long time! Side dishes were just as delicious!
The service was friendly and very attentive.

I highly recommend you try it.
Shahrzad P.
author: Shahrzad P.

description:
I was very much looking forward to coming back here with friends and family after not having been for a couple years. It was my dad's 80th birthday-- obviously a very special occasion for all of us. Unfortunately, this place has gone drastically downhill. It used to be one of the very best with the most delicious steaks I ever had. 

Starting at the bar, the bartender failed to put ginger slices in all of the otherwise delicious coconut ginger lemon drop martinis (didn't know this until the server brought one to the table the correct way). Now, the server... Pleasant enough, but the service was grossly under par; it took almost an HOUR for us to even order our meals, had to ask for bread three times, no one came to fill our waters, and the waiter came only ONCE to ask how everything was! When he did, I didn't get a chance to respond before he whisped away. My ribeye was so full of fat and gristle, only one third was edible and even that was overcooked. My dad's filet was overcooked and only so-so. The crab stuffed shrooms were fishy, as was mom's sea bass. The creamed spinach was the only dish that wasn't disappointing. Getting the desserts and the check took a painstakingly long time also, well over 20 minutes for each, and waiting for the change almost as long again. Knowing it was someone's 80th birthday, consideration should have been made not to extend the dining experience into a late hour! It was not particularly busy this Thursday eve and were plenty of servers in the room. 

To their credit, the manager came over and agreed my steak was unacceptable (the plate was piled with a wasteland of inedible crap). It was taken off the bill and the desserts comped. Only this warrants an extra star for my rating. 

I regret to this day that I chose Ruth's Chris as the venue for such a special night. It ruined the entire occasion for us, and I'm not exaggerating. Disappointing is an understatement. I'm very sad I don't have the confidence in the quality of service or food to return here again-- particularly for the price! Should have just gone to Marin Joe's. :(
author: Mick E.

description:
Some might ding Ruth Chris because it's a chain but it truly is more than an "eating good in your neighborhood" dining experience.   

I think a special shout out to the staff for friendly and attentive service is due. Everyone from the greeters to the servers were on point and made sure you were enjoying your meal. And it's not a hard meal to enjoy. All our steaks were cooked perfectly. My fillet mignon was perfectly medium rare and the warmed plate help maintain the right temperature. It was just a well seasoned and juicy steak to enjoy. I think the sides were forgettable (I wish I could have just spinach without the cream but when in a steakhouse I guess) but the steaks truly shine. 

Dine about town is a good time to stop by Ruth Chris for a good old-fashoned steak dinner with the sides and all for a good price but otherwise,  it truly is a good steak house with amazing service. Request a booth on your next reservation - it makes the experience much more intimate.
author: Jon L.

description: The place was dark and super small.... Food was just ok the drinks were just ok...there is better steak places out there...way to pricy for the quality of the food...you are pay for the name for sure.
author: Elvia P.

description:
The steak is cooked perfectly to your liking. Just be careful of the scalding hot plate! (Steakhouses will do this to keep the meat at the right temperature while you're eating.)

I brought my boyfriend here for a special  birthday dinner. 

What we ordered:
Calamari App
Petite Filet with a bleu cheese crust
Regular Filet with a brandy pepper sauce
Fresh Broccoli
Sautéed Mushrooms

All of these were delicious, but the steak was definitely the star of the entire dinner. As it should be! 

We didn't go crazy on the extra dishes because we typically eat healthy, but a lot of people here order the baked potato (with butter, cheese, sour cream, onion and bacon fixings) and the creamed spinach. Both of which looked amazing when I saw other customers order it. 

Lastly, I just want to say our server Lena Joy was perfect throughout the night. She really does bring the joy.
author: Alice H.

description:
We missed our cruise departure and we ended up here. Even though I was pretty disappointed at first, I can't complain about dining here because I'm a huge carnivore when it comes to steaks! I ordered the filet mignon with mushrooms as the side and it was impeccable! I love mine extra bloody and as soon as my fork dug into the steak, the juices were seeping out. Love it! My friend had the steak and lobster and the lobster was buttery and tender.. The best I've had yet! 

Service was on point as expected. Our waitress helped me find a great bottle of wine that went perfectly well with our entrees. We were there for over two hours and she was patient with us the entire time. I can't expect any less .. This place is a must!
author: Kathleen N.

description: Delicious meal, portion was completely perfect. Perfectly cooked, taste was spot on. I would definitely recommend to friends and family.
author: Evelyn N.

description: My meal was delicious, but the lobster was not the best I've had. The service is amazing.
author: Audrey W.

description:
I made reservations last Saturday at 8pm to celebrate my boyfriend's promotion! We arrived early as parking was a little hard to find. We were seated closer to our reservation time. The hostess seated us at a booth that was right by the bar. It felt pretty casual and I am pretty sure we were in the cocktail lounge instead of the main dining room. As I walked to the bathroom I realized that that's where the main dining room was, a bit quieter too. Nonetheless we had a great experience from beginning to end. 

We both ordered Ruth's classic dinner. I started off with butter lettuce BLT, if you love blue cheese then this salad is amazing. I planned on only eating half to save room for the steak but I basically finished all of my salad :). My boyfriend ordered the Caesar salad and the dressing was pretty good. We both decided on the ribeye because it's our favorite cut of steak with the right ratio of fat and meat! MmM! Thinking about it makes my mouth water. You also get to choose a side each, we chose green beans and garlic mashed potatoes. Omg the steak was so good and stayed hot for pretty long. It was very tender, I felt like it melted in my mouth and it had so much flavor from the butter and salt & pepper. Hands down the best steak I've ever had! I was sad I filled myself up on bread and salad that I didn't finish my steak. It was great for lunch leftovers the next day though :P. My boyfriend was pretty amazed by the quality of the steak as well, he said it's comparable to flemings where he had the best steak of his life! Lol. We love steak and glad we tried ruth Chris.

I upgraded my dessert to the molten chocolate cake and it was delicious! Perfect ending to a great meal. Can't wait to come back!
author: Camery V.

description:
Affordable place to come for Dine About Town!
$34.95 for 8 oz filet mignon, mashed potatoes, and chocolate cupcake dessert.
Happy tummy and happy wallet!
author: Christine C.

description:
Food was fine, but nothing memorable. Service was spotty, needed to constantly flag down waiter to refill water and wine. 

-calamari- good flavors but pretty greasy
-seared ahi tuna- perfection, would recommend
-mushroom stuffed with crabmeat- pretty disappointing, too much mayonnaise mixed in with the crabmeat

-lobster bisque- was expecting some bits of lobster, but no such luck

-filet mignon- got mine medium rare, and was prepared practically rare- meat was cold inside. Little flavor with the exception of the plate of melted butter it sat on. 

-creamed spinach- too much mayonnaise, overrated
-sweet potato casserole- best thing I had all night. I would literally come back just for this. 
-mashed potato- meh
-asparagus, brocolli- tasted like frozen vegetables that were microwaved with no taste.
author: Peggy L.

description: Always a pleasure to eat here. They have great staff (Anthony always has great suggestions) great food (have never been disappointed) and drinks. On special dates they do a pre fix dinner with drinks. We've done 3 and love finding out new things each time. Really a great spot for great tender juicy steaks.
author: Angelica T.

description: I was hesitant to come here because it's a cliche chain and I live in San Francisco. I liked it a lot. What did I like most: thought it was a good value and that the portions were kind of small (but appropriate) actually. Life isn't changed - but every meal doesn't have to be about that.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Managements customer service sucks at Ruth's Chris.  Two of us went to dinner tonight and because my date's steak was so under cooked, we had to send it back. By the time they brought her steak back it was 15 or 20 minutes later and I ate by myself for the whole dinner.   The manager came up and thought he was doing me a favor by offering to pay for a $10 dessert.   Here I take my date to what is supposed to be a five-star restaurant and he insults me that way. Instead of sucking it up, sincerely apologizing and doing us right, which would have shown us they take full accountability,  it took a significant discussion before he owned up appropriately for me eating by myself. 

We had a great waiter, Thomas, who fully understood what occurred and did everything he could to help us.  Kudos to him.  

Based upon how the management handled the situation, I will not be going back there and suggest that all of you try one of the other great steak restaurants in the city such as Bobos, Harris', House of Prime Rib  and other locations where the management knows what they're doing and how to properly treat customers.
author: Peter E.

description:
First off we got seated at the tables. There was a bug crawling around the table... OK got rid of it no problem. Next we got the some empty plates passed around the table, the first thing I noticed was the plates was all dirty... have some debris on them. No problem I just wipe it off. Next got our order taken, we all got medium rare 16oz   rib eye steak which was over cooked for the price I found that was unacceptable  but rather deal with it than to send it back. The whole experience I had with service was great. For quality an time I would go else where for the perfection of steak to be cooked properly. There should be a wow factor when you first bite into your steak. The food might be inconsistency but I would not know until I try again. 



This was a review for the walnut creek one not this one.
author: Matthew S.

description:
3.5 stars.

First, they need to figure out what their reservations system for parties over 6 ought to be.  First time I called while driving, the hostess said I needed to fax or email my credit card and my driver's license to complete the reservation.  Since I was driving, I got off the phone and was going to call back to get their fax number or email address.  A week later when I called back, I was able to make reservations for 8 people without providing my credit card or driver's license.  OK...more convenient, but that's the real policy?

Most of the people in my party ordered from their classic dinner special and added items to our dish.  My filet was very tender and cooked perfectly, as expected in this type of steakhouse.  I added on a lobster tail with my entree.  Literally a 3 biter, and that's how small the lobster tail was.  It was a bit rubbery too. The salad that came will the special was pathetic looking.  A decent variety of greens and butter garlicky croutons, but the vinaigrette dressing was slapped on - not even a simple toss.  Come on!  This is Ruth's Chris, not Denny's!  Our dessert was carrot cake which was very good.

Service was OK.  Our waiter was good when he could be found.  We had to ask for refill of our water couple of times, fresh cracked pepper with our salad and entree, more bread, etc.  The mandatory service fee of 18% (well over $100) was already expected, but we sure did not receive over $100 worth of service.
author: L C.

description:
Boyfriend and I came here for the Dine About Town menu. We had waited at the bar, which was very nice. We got to our table and our server was sweet. We started with some salads that were good. We had the stuffed mushrooms with crabmeat as appetizers. These were good and a great portion. For entrees I got the petite filet while he opted for a Rib-eye (which was an extra charge). Our steaks were cooked perfectly and oh-so buttery! The flavor of the butter was really good. The steak almost melt in my mouth. We had shared the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach which were good but nothing too special.

We shared a bottle of wine our lovely server picked for us and oh did she hit the spot! Overall we had a wonderful experience and I cannot wait to have another steak here again.
author: Katherine L.

description: OMG I didn't think it was going to be as good as it was, I am speechless on just how good the steak was. We went with friends there was 4 of us our bill came to $260.00 lol but it was worth every penny! Service was great, food was Fabulous I'll definitely be back again.
author: C. M.

description:
I gave high ratings for Alexander's Steak House due to its romantic feel, fantastic service, and good quality food. But Ruth's Chris will always have a special place in my heart. Sorry Alexander's...but I'm team Ruth's Chris!

This is definitely my favorite steak spot to date. We had made reservations for a Saturday night and arrived about 15 minutes early. Unfortunately we did not get seated for almost an hour even though we had reservations, due to an accident on the bridge that had delayed other customers as well. The unprofessional hosts with somewhat snobby attitudes did not help either. Nonetheless the restaurant made up for the inconvenience by offering those who waited a while with complimentary dessert or appetizers. 

We usually start off with the Caesar salad, which is good, but nothing out of the ordinary or amazing.

My boyfriend is a Ribeye kind of guy while I usually go for the New York Strip. Both are absolutely juicy and melt in your mouth, especially the Ribeye. I have to say that the heaping amounts of butter they put on their steak contributes to the juiciness as well...which in this case my health conscious self doesn't mind.

These are the different side dishes we've tried as well as my ratings:

Sweet Potato Casserole: Incredibly sweet! I love sweet and savory so I didn't mind this dish, but it is a bit too sweet for someone who wants something more savory with their steak. This dish is more of a dessert than a side dish to accompany your steak. 

Macaroni and Cheese: I love macaroni and cheese, and I do enjoy Ruth's Chris mac and cheese. But I have to say that it is average and nothing special. 

Creamed Spinach: LOVE! My boyfriend isn't too much of a fan due to the richness, but I thought it was very creamy and hearty. I loved combining this side dish with my steak.

Potatoes au Gratin: Now I had this dish in Anaheim and I have to say that I wasn't impressed. Potatoes au Gratin is always delicious and hearty, but this dish was bland and tasteless. I'm willing to try this again in the San Francisco location because I love a good Potatoes au Gratin. 

Now for dessert...obviously the best part! We decided to choose dessert for our complimentary dish, and I'm sure glad we did. I'm just upset that I ate so much because by the time we got to the dessert, I was absolutely stuffed. We ordered the Chocolate Sin Cake, and I highly recommend it. This dessert is essentially a Molten Lava Cake topped with vanilla ice cream, and comes with a side of berries drizzled in chocolate sauce. I couldn't get enough of it...even though I was stuffed like no other. 

Can't wait to keep coming back here for more yummy food and memories!
author: Tara S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, but my experience here was awful. My friends and I had dinner reservations at 8. We weren't seated until about 915 and didn't get any apologies for the long wait. Luckily, my friends and I hadn't seen each other in a while so we killed time catching up at the bar. Once seated, we ordered 2 bottles of wine which we didn't get for 25 mins. We checked with the waiter, and she proceeded to give us attitude for asking. I was hoping the steak would make up for it, but it was.. blah. The first 2 bites were good, but every bite after that seemed to get more and more flavorless. Not to mention, I ordered medium rare and got medium. My friend ordered medium rare as well and practically got a live cow on her plate. The sides were just ok too. The best thing I had that night was the complimentary dessert my bf got for his bday. 

Overall, it was a true disappointment. Maybe it's just this location, but I'll stick to Fleming's in Walnut Creek.
author: Kay M.

description:
My first time here was about a couple nights ago. 
The food was good. I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because of the Lobster Mac & cheese which was prob the best experience there. Other than that. The service wasn't all that.
When we were done eating I found a baby bug on the table. Who knows where it came from but I caught it in a wine glass& told I believe was a manager.
Without saying anything she grabbed the wine glass and went to the back and didn't come back to apologize or anything. 

Pricey& Fancy place like this I didn't expect to have an experience anything like that
author: Joanna A.

description: FINALLY, after months of wanting to come here my boyfriend and I came on Christmas Day to enjoy some steaks for dinner. Let me tell you, we were NOT disappointed. First off, the service was amazing. Refilling our waters without asking, ordering our drinks quickly, and food came out at a decent time. I ordered a Cesar salad to start, and it was one of the best Cesar salads I have ever had. Not kidding. I also ordered a petit filet + shrimp, it was divine. My boyfriend ordered the cowboy steak, and was very happy about the flavor! We will be coming back. For dessert, we both shared the cheesecake (big enough for two people!) and it was AMAZING. We were both satisfied with our meals- you get what you pay for. Quality food and service. By the way, their cocktails are yummy! I recommend the Raspberry Rosemary Cosmo!
author: Krystal S.

description: This restaurant gave my family very good experience for steak and we order tomahawk, 40oz for 4 person which is enough very good and the nice man Anthony give us very good recommendations and service ! Thank you so much!
author: Momoko S.

description: Absolutely amazing food. My steak was melt in your mouth tender. Caesar salad was perfect. Calamari Appetizer was cooked perfect. Great evening & service was top notch as usual.
author: Gigi R.

description:
Hella Good Dinner.

Blueberry Mojito - Really Good.
Ruth's Chop Salad - Awesome Cylinder Salad
Sweet Potato Casserole - Good Lord There's More?...
Cowboy Ribeye - Orgazzzmic!
Caramelized Banana Cream Pie - Daaamn!

Cable Car ride to the BART train home.
author: Eric H.

description: ordered the petite filet with shrimp, asked for med. rare and got well done :(
author: Melanie T.

description:
We checked the Ruth Chris web site to make sure that they had a happy hour menu on Friday evening.  Assured there were less expensive choices available we took a cab from our hotel to the restaurant.  Upon arrival we were told there was no happy hour at the Van Ness location.  the manager said it was "confusing" because several other locations did have a happy hour menu.

We decided to stay for dinner because we were unfamiliar with the area & we do enjoy Ruth Chris.  As always, our dinner was excellent & our server Jordan was great.  

When I returned to our hotel I double checked the web site information & it specifically referred to the restaurant on Van Ness as having "happy hour" menu selections.
author: Beth H.

description:
Well my girlfriend and I have been to other Ruth Chris locations and decided to give this one a go.  We were going to dinner for my girlfriends birthday because she loves this place. 

At first we were seated quickly and the server assistant quickly greeted us and filled out up our water.  Our table had birthday decorations which was nice.  We thought this evening was going to be great.  
Our bread can out quickly and we then ordered our food at the same time as the table next to us. 

This is where it all went bad.  Took over an hour to get our meal (1hour 20 minutes).  The steak was eh. I was even more pissed when some couple sat down behind us (must be regulars) and they kissed their asses and had their steak out before our appetizers.  

Then I brought it up to the server and the manager. Said they want us to have a 2 hour experience....wow bs. I dun want crappy service for 2 hours.   They thoight they would do us a favor and comp us a second dessert.  We declined and left a 0% tip and left a note on the reciept saying "you only have one bday a year, hope urs isnt as shitty as this on"

Hands down I will stick to Forbes Mill in Los Gatos.    They are still family owned and significantly better quality and service.  

One star for the birthday drcorations.
author: Anthony L.

description:
We regularly visit Ruth's Chris, and we usually really enjoy our evening.  Our last visit will be our last visit EVER.  We had a reservation for 6 people on 10/18/13 to celebrate my wife's birthday.  I can't criticize the food or the service.  The food was great, and our server was very good.  After racking up a $800 bill, we went outside to pick up our vehicle from Ruth's Chris' curbside valet, and the valet said, "I have some bad news."  He proceeded to take me to my vehicle and told me that he didn't realize that I had ski racks, and they were torn off when he drove into the parking garage.  Not to mention the fact that my recently detailed vehicle was completely covered in the insulation from the ceiling.  The valet felt bad and offered to pay for the damage out of his pocket, however, I didn't think that was right.  

The next day, I brought my vehicle back to my auto detailer and had him re-detail it ($160.00).  I then paid an auto repair company another $250.00 to fix the scratches in the paint from where the ski racks fell onto the top of my car.  I then had to purchase new ski racks (~ $650.00).  

After this was all said and done I decided to call Ruth's Chris and talk to a manager to let them know what happened.  The manager told me that she would contact the owner of the valet company and have him contact me.  My intention was not to get reimbursed for the damage but to let him know what had happened to me so that he could have a talk with the valet.

Needless to say, the owner of the valet company never called...... 

If you visit Ruth's Chris, I would skip the valet service.  Since parking is a joke, you might want to visit another of the city's excellent steak houses (Alexander's, House of Prime Rib, etc....).  Perhaps their valet takes some responsibility when they damage a customer's vehicle.
author: David C.

description: Amazing place.. I loved the barbeque shrimp- entree.. Will definitely come again before saying goodbye to SFO...
author: Antara P.

description: Overall the food and service were very nice. The food comes out quickly and is well done, the wine list is expansive and the server was very attentive. The only downside is some of the other patrons were kinda scary. Like pants sagging, neck tattoo scary.  Weird.
author: Marisa L.

description: Absolutely a great place to dine.  Food was exceptional along with the service.  Our group of 7 had a great time
author: David D.

description:
Went here for a Birthday dinner with 6 friends in Feb 2016. It was a Monday night and the restaurant was somewhat slow. All the better for great service. And indeed the service was perfect. Appetizers included seafood platter that was simply huge. I didn't try that but my friends said it was delicious. Main course for me was a sirloin steak. It was perfectly cooked medium rare. Their beef is grain fed, not grass fed. Though the idea of a feedlot-factory farm is somewhat disappointing, most top steakhouses serve the grain fed as the beef is more tender and flavorful.
