It is indeed. The steak was divine. Though it was a large cut, I could have eaten two! When I go for steak, I want the bomb. This was one of the best I've had in SF, though not as good as some I had in Argentina last December (hard to beat those).
I'm struggling with the four or five stars but alas, the potatoes were what lost them the perfect score. The mashed were just o.k. and not stellar as they should be for the prices you're paying. What I really loved is the total lack of Hipster pretension and another bare "fake reclaimed wood" table that is so evident in this city. And how can you go wrong with linen tablecloths? Come here for the beautiful dining experience, not the poseur vibe.
Summary: Yes its a chain but their reputation is well deserved. If you love a good steak Ruth's is a solid choice. Recommended.
author: Andreas M.

description:
SADLY GOING DOWNHILL FAST

I really like Ruth's Chris.  I recently went to a Ruth's Chris in San Diego and the food was great and the service impeccable.  This is what I've come to expect at a Ruth's Chris.   Sadly I can no longer say the same for the SF restaurant.  I went to the SF Ruth's Chris twice in November and both times were disappointing.  The first time my medium rare filet was cooked medium to medium well.  This happens but I had finished my side before anyone came to check on my steak which isn't particularly good service.  To the managers credit, he seemed genuinely concerned and apologetic, and they quickly got me a perfectly cooked steak.  Thus, I was willing to try again.

The second visit was fairly awful and it was especially disappointing because we were there for a special occasion dinner for two.  It was the night before Thanksgiving and the dining room was practically empty.  All but one table was empty and booths on an adjacent wall were also empty.  We were enjoying our wine and salads when they inexplicably sat a family with two rambunctious kids in the booth right behind us.  I realize kids are going to be kids especially when they're young and these kids were approximately 3 and 5 years old.  So why would they seat young kids behind a couple having a romantic dinner when they had an abundance of empty tables and booths???  

The food was also a bit disappointing.  My filet wasn't overcooked which was a plus but about 3oz of it was heavily marbled/fatty (see uploaded image).  I order filet because I prefer lean steak.  The service was also disappointing.  The waiter, and other restaurant staff personnel, were running around trying to locate crayons for the kids.  First they managed to locate two crayons so those were brought to booth  with the promise of searching for more, better crayons.  During the crayon search, our water glasses sat empty and worse yet - my wine glass sat empty.  Considering the poor seating arrangements, the least they could have done was made sure I could order plenty of wine.  

Instead of enjoying great conversation our adult 'indoor' voices were overshadowed (e.g., NO!  WE DO NOT climb over the booth.  NO!  WE DO NOT climb up on the ledge.  NO. You cannot have bread because you need to eat your dinner.  STOP SHRIEKING!  Do you have a hearing problem? You need to learn to use your indoor voice.  NO!  You CANNOT get up.  The last time you and your sister ran around the restaurant and really embarrassed me.  NO.  YOU NEED TO STOP THAT.   This is why daddy doesn't like to eat at restaurants with us.  And on and on and on.)  The father even joked with our waiter that at least the restaurant wasn't packed.

Instead of savoring a great meal we ate and left as soon as possible.  On the way out we let the manager, a blonde woman, know that we were disappointed and perplexed about their seating choices.  She gave us a very insincere apology and told us they didn't know when people would arrive so they just sat the tables in order as people came in.  At that point we really wished we had gone to Alexander's, and next time we will.  There are too many great steakhouses and restaurants in SF to go to such disappointing ones.
author: Cantik E.

description: We have two Ruth's classic, one is filet & shrimp, one is rib eye. I really like filet and media rare taste so fresh. But dessert chocolate cheesecake is a little disappointing.
author: Qiao L.

description:
FOOD
Steak! Pretty good!! I really liked it.

SERVICE
Great.

ATMOSPHERE:
Steak house atmosphere, more casual than I had imagined it would be. But still overall nice. 

11.26.13
author: Angela L.

description:
Chicago approved.
I made reservation a week in advance. This place is very popular. 

Chicago (He)  really loves steak and we didn't have a good experience at Alexander's. He is from Chicago and is really critical about steaks. I was super excited for a fancy dinner. After he read the steaks were from midwestern corn fed cows he was optimistic our beef would be good. Our beef was more than good, it was fantastics.
Both of us left very happy.

We had 6:45pm reservations. We arrived at 6:25pm and were seated at 6:44. We got water and bread when we sat down. We had excellent service. They checked in with us every 10 mins or so. I think it was 8:30pm when we finished.

We were both starving. I had the house salad, ribeye 12oz, cream spinach side, and the flour-less chocolate cake with fresh berries. It was part of Ruth's classic meal, (only about $10 more than the steak by itself, so $54 (?)). He had Cesar salad, filet mignon, raspberry sorbet and some champagne. We both did not share and were just way too full by the end of it. 

The steak was awesome, and it should be with all the butter!
 All that food came to about $150+$30 tip. Mostly because he ordered everything ala cart.

There was so much more I wanted to try and I think maybe surf and turf next time. No sides and no salad.

We probably will come back again and again.
author: Annie P.

description: Food was great good customer service ! Awkward when there atm machine is a handheld and they have to bring it to your table and enter the chip and you have to enter the tip amount infront of the server
author: Barbara P.

description:
This place is really good if you're looking for a flavorful steak. their signature sizzling butter isn't for everyone but it is definitely for me.

If you're looking for the best texture in a steak hit up House of Prime Rib. If you're looking for flavor here is where you go!

I ordered the Cowboy Rib-eye. Personally gents....if you don't order a bone in steak you have no business in steak house. Or ordering steak. Or anything that rhymes with steak. It came out perfect. I prefer my steaks medium with a bit of extra cooking on the edges. I got exactly what I wanted.

The sides are a bit lacking. We ordered the mushrooms, the french fries and a few others. None of them dazzled me. They were actually very plain.

UNTIL THE SWEET POTATO CASSEROLE.

MOTHER. OF. GOD. That was heaven. I would write more and more about it but I am still speechless. It almost made up for the lack of other sides. Almost. If they get their other sides up to par with the sweet potato casserole....this place would be a 5 star.
author: Alexander L.

description: My girlfriend and I tried here for a first weekend "anniversary(so she said.)" and was solely great. Rib eye, filet, lobster and list goes on,, we went out so full, ended up getting home straight to the bed.
author: Hiroki W.

description:
This is a super late review but I didn't have the time to write it before back in November lol. 

My bf took me here for my 22nd birthday. He made a reservation but we still had to wait about 10 minutes for them to prepare the table so we went to the bar and got a drink. Because it was my birthday, the bartender said he would make me anything I wanted, even if it wasn't on the menu :). I just went for a strawberry mojito cause I didn't want to be drunk during my dinner. 

When we were seated, it took forever for someone to acknowledge us. It was my birthday, I was hungry, and I was already buzzed from my drink so I got really frustrated. Our server finally came and apologized but I just felt like someone else could have helped her out and at least offer us some water. The other servers literally just stared at us and walked away. Our menus were closed and we made eye contact.. Doesn't that mean something??

Moving onto the food, we ordered:

Ribeye steak: medium rare, perfectly cooked with a nice texture!
Creamed spinach: my first time trying and it was super delicious!! 
Mashed potatoes: nothing too special but I do love mashed potatoes :D
And lobster Mac n cheese: this was the best part!! HUGE chunks of lobster which was great! The only downside was that there was so much oil so I felt really fat afterwards....

Even though we shared everything, we still had tons of leftovers! I'm pretty small so I can't really eat much in one sitting but my Asian side just wanted to order different things and try them all LOL

Overall, I had an okay experience because the food was good but I had to give it 3 stars for the poor service.
author: Stephanie N.

description: The Olive Garden of steak houses. Yes, steaks were good and well prepared but servers were below zero. A tribe of machines could sell more and make patrons feel better. No care about food, no care about wine. How fast can we turn you over? Who cares if you ACTUALLY enjoy anything. Fake and old.... It's like 1959 without the class.
author: Alex L.

description: First time in this kind of ambiance. Food was delicious. The entire night was awesome. EXPENSIVE
author: Ruth P.

description:
I would have to say this is one of my new favorite place to have my steak fix.

Making reservation was easy and they were friendly at that. I have never been to this place so when I had a $100 giftcard, this was my opportunity to try it out.  I took my BF for a no reason no special occasion fancy dinner in the city.  We got dressed up and went out for the night.

Reservation was at 7:30, and we were seated promptly.  I have to LOL but never did I mentioned anything when making reservation.  No special requests whatsoever.  So when we were seated, there were rose petals throughout our table.  Our waiter greeted us with "Happy Anniversary".   That made my night.

Like with any other restaurant, they brought out a sweet french loaf of bread.  They were warm and so good.  I had a cocktail while my BF had a red glass of wine. We both decided to gett the prix fix menu which basically included: a salad to start. the main entree; mainly steak and a dessert to share.  Keep in mind, they thought it was our anniversary, so our dessert was quite special.  It was very thoughtful. 

The ambience is very romantic and classy.  Great place to have an intimate dinner with that special someone or a special occasion.  Their services is outstanding.  I can't complain.  Pricey but worth the time and money.
author: Angela L.

description:
Excellent service! Before being seated my date and I went to the bar both having a glass of wine, not even a long wait because before we knew it we were already being seated and we hadn't even finished our glasses of wine yet. Our server greeted us and was very friendly and also informative about the menu options. 

The filet mignon was on point! 

Enough said, no wonder this place is such a hit! The potatoes we're so good and buttery, and the asparagus we're cooked perfectly! The meal and the experience was great. Will be coming back soon!!!
author: Rosh E.

description: Steak was alright for the price. You can get a better steak at house of prime rib for less, and I gauranteed the service would be better too. I spent roughly 200 on dinner for three. It took a total of 2 hours. The steak sauce never brought out steak sauce we requested. Dessert took ages, we were contemplating taking it To go. Go to House of prime rib. Faster, much better service and juicier tender meat.
author: Nathan H.

description:
Disrespectful and unapologetic staff (esp the general manager) Very disappointed and embarrassed by my experience. If you believe that good service means unbiased warmth and friendliness, please read below and do to go to this particular Ruth's Chris.

 My friends and I decided to come to this location for some nice steak and wine. We had been to several other locations in the past and were pleased with the food, but the attitude of the general manager at this particular one was terrible. 

While having a harmless argument with my friend about who would pay the check (he wanted to cover the whole meal!) we were escorted out of the main dining area to have a word with the manager. He refused to have the bill split after it had been charged and told us to grab our things and leave the restaurant. My friend was there with his family and was extremely embarrassed in front of them - what was supposed to be an evening of good conversation and memories was quickly ruined by Josh who felt it was more necessary to force probably the only international party (we are from South Asia) of out of the restaurant. It was as if our money and company was not good enough. We were treated as if we were not welcome there anymore, only after having paid the bill, of course, and having a generous tip automatically added. For a party of 4!

I will never go back to a Ruth's Chris. For the money they charge, you can get a MUCH better steak, at MUCH better service without the feel of a chain. But do yourself a favor and don't go to this one, in particular, at least not until the manager is replaced! There are plenty of far better and more deserving options.
author: Ali C.

description: Absolutely Amazing Valentine's Day at this restaurant..My husband and I really enjoyed the food and service...Chelsea is a great waitress...She was very attentive and quick...I would personally request her in the event that we returned...
author: Heather C.

description: I love going here.  When I craving a steak, Ruth's Chris is always a great choice.  They normally have a fixed menu option where you can get a 3 course for $40 and up I believe.  I always get a filet and shrimp with a salad and dessert.  Delicious!  And this place is very accommodating.  If you wanna swap something out from the fixed menu, they do it for a small upgrade fee.  And have I mentioned their buttery crab cakes?!  Sooo good!  My mouth is watering right now just thinking of it!  Hurry and come to Ruth's Chris!
author: Elena N.

description:
Probably one of, if not the top chain steak houses out there, or so they say. They haven't all been to Texas, and I won't hold that against them. I'm no one's asshole, just a fat kid looking for a tasty meal.

Anywho, my server Scott was knowledgeable, had excellent pace, made good recommendations, and had great personality. 5-star. If I had a daughter and didn't suspect you were smoking Buddha sess, I'd allow you to hit on her in presence. 

World-renowned wine list.  No need to really go into detail here. That's not even supposed to happen at a chain place. 

 Get the Pepperland.  You'll thank me later. 5-star.

Salad was a little heavy on dressing, but the dried cherries and roasted pecans gave it great texture. Did I taste a little anise in there? You fancy little bastards, you. 4-star.

Steak was seared perfectly, cooked to temperature(rare motherf*ckers, this is America), had great texture, but was a little butter-heavy. I'd recommend asking for light butter. 4.5-stars.

Dessert was a nice touch. Carrot cake was solid.  Little late harvest port to enhance the touch of cinnamon? Why the eff not? 4 stars.

Ambiance - Romantic, wine bottles all around just beckoning you to indulge, muted lighting (take it easy on the powder, ladies), etc. Not a 1st date restaurant, but definitely a 3rd date one if you knowwhatimsayin'. 4.5 stars.

Pricing was really good for the quality of steak.  Some of the wines were slightly overpriced(champagnes/bubbles mostly), but there were also some absolute steals(14$ for the J.Rose IIRC? Crazy stuff).  

Overall? Good restaurant. I dug it.
author: Chris J.

description:
I liked Ruth's Chris but really didn't love it. I have no compelling reason to return. I was very excited by the atmosphere as it has a very "San Francisco" feel. I was actually pretty enchanted.

Not as enchanted with the food. I had the steak and lobster. The steak was medium rather then medium rare. Getting tired of this and thought they would get it right. They didn't. You might wonder why I didn't send it back. I don't like the idea of criticizing the chef and then letting them have access to my food.

The lobster was about the size of my first engagement ring. And like the ring, very disappointing. Sides faired better. We shared spinach and mashed potatoes. Both were okay but far from memorable. 

The dessert was small and boring. Custard, berries and a few chocolates. Teeny tiny servings. Very dull dessert menu to begin with...I have to point out that as much as I like things to stay the same, some things benefit from change.
author: Diane W.

description:
My wife took me here for our anniversary.  The rib-eye is probably the best I have ever had.  Buttery, tender, moist and full of flavor.  The creamed spinach was exceptional, even though the sides are to share, I gobbled it up.  The scotch and wine list are superb and the waiter was knowledgeable about the wines.  

My wife got the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was creamy and flavorful, with big chunks of lobster in it.  

I would recommend this restaurant for anyone who loves fine dining and loves beef.
author: Bud F.

description:
Great quality steakhouse.  I have sampled almost all of the premium steakhouses in Boston and this is one of my favorites.

I could write a very long review on this one but it really isn't necessary cuz they aren't paying me to do it:

-Great Service
-Quality steak (I had the ribeye).  Obviously it was a great cut and cooked to perfection.  I think the real reason it taste so good is b/c they melt a stick of butter on the steak (jk not that much, but still enough where I could taste it and I love a lot of butter)
-Sides were also tasty

If I am going to spend a pretty penny on a steak, it has to meet a lot of value requirements, and this place does a great job.  Recommended for dinner dates, business meetings, or just to eat good food.
author: Peter T.

description:
Went to Ruth's Chris last night and ordered the rib eye. According to Ruth's website, "an outstanding example USDA Prime at it's best.  Well marbled for peak flavor, deliciously juicy at it's best".
Not quite, the chef did the cooking right, medium rare, but the meat was not "marbled and Juicy" as advertised. IMO, more like USDA Select and Choice at best. It was tough and dry and that was because the meat was not prime as stated. 
Asked to speak to the manger and showed him the meat. He was uncooperative and  insisted it is prime grade.
I disagree. Maybe we should request a USDA supervisor to verify what they are selling at Ruth's.
author: George C.

description:
Mediocre experience.  

We had a reservation.  We had a hard time finding parking so we were about 10 minutes late and I called to let them know that.  They said it was fine.  When we got there, we still had to wait another 15 minutes until we got seated.  Was annoyed to see a ton of empty tables while our party and a ton of other people were waiting to get seated.

I am a steak and potatoes and red wine kind of gal.  So of course that is what I ordered during the Dine About Town (DAT) this year.  The petite filet came on a sizzling plate so that was nice.  Overall the food was good, but I've had better.  Thank god I didn't get sick like the last time I dined at Ruth Chris.  I asked for a recommendation on wine and a few options were offered.  However, every other fine dining establishment I've been to would have give me tastes of the two wines that I preferred and that was not offered here.  At one point, one of the waiters reached clear across the table to pour water into his glass.  I didn't think anything of it, but my boyfriend was pretty appalled that his armpit was over our food :X  

In conclusion, it was an unimpressive meal and there are lot of better places for a steak in the city.
author: Chantal T.

description: I definitely enjoyed my meal. The filet mignon with a side of lobster mac n cheese was absolutely delicious. We didn't make any reservations, but was able to get a seat right away. Definitely look toward to coming back here.
author: Callme T.

description:
We came in on a relatively quiet Monday night. We were seated immediately in a very nice booth, but then were given very poor service. Even though the waitstaff (3 of them) were in the room serving other customers, we waited a good 15-20 minutes to get any attention from the waiter. We were very thirsty, and I thought about getting up and leaving, but I really wanted to experience the food. 

The waiter came and was polite enough. We ordered a bottle of water and it came relatively soon. He kept saying "I'll send so-and-so over with ...." when we would ask for something, as if it was beneath him to do it himself, or ??? Why else say anything about it. Just get it to the table. Customers don't care who brings it. His service to our table continued in the same lackluster, sluggish manner while the table next to us got a lot of attention. 

We ordered the prix fix meal that comes with an appetizer, side dish, main dish and dessert. 

The Caesar salad was fine. Unremarkable. 

The filet was very good. 

The lobster tail was just okay.Seasoning was good.  It was obviously frozen and well, there just isn't much you can do to remedy the texture that freezing does to shellfish.

 The side of mushrooms was terrible. It was four big limp-looking big brown mushrooms that were obviously canned. Why canned when we grow some of the best wild mushrooms here in Cali that can be had? If I order sauteed mushrooms in a restaurant of this caliber in California, I expect fresh mushrooms. 

The side of mashed potatoes had no discernible flavor of any kind. Unremarkable.

The creme brulee was very good! It came with a walnut chocolate cookie that was just "meh". 

Even with the prix fix price, I'd think twice about spending this amount of $$ here again when there are so many great options in the SF Bay Area.
author: Lisa F.

description: Absolutely delicious. Beautiful ambiance. Our waiter Patrick was very attentive and very professional and knowledgeable about the menu. Valet only and expensive very worth it. One of the best steaks I've had in my life
author: Kenya W.

description:
Best steaks ever! I've been here 3 times and to Ruth's Chris around the country. The tastiest most savory steaks, service to match and the sweet potato side dish a meal in it self to die for.. If you want to treat yourself and spend some bucks go here. A Costco Prime on the BQ is great but
 these are a cut above !
author: Michael R.

description: firstly our server Nicholas was amazing. !!! 10 stars for him. I will definitely come back to see him. secondly!!! get the creme brûlée!!!!!!!! melt in ur mouth goodness. the key lime pie was delicious too, it was a chef special. I got the filet with the brussel sprouts and it was cooked perfectly. bacon was too sweet for me they really go all out for ur birthday. I'll be back. ;) and thank u Nicholas for outstanding service, above and beyond and ur excellent recommendations.
author: Gessa C.

description: Not a big fan of steak so i just ordered a shrimp dish. Found a parking right in front of the restaurant too. Woohoo!
author: Mimi S.

description:
We went in the day after Valentines day.

We were seated promptly, even after arriving about 10 minutes later then our reservation time. They were pretty busy with a couple of other larger tables, which also made the atmosphere a little loud.

The tables have linen table cloths, and were set for a fine dining experience. Most people were dressed business casual, though we had dressed up for the occasion and did not feel out of place.

Our server, Juan, approached us and was very welcoming. He came to the table at perfect intervals and was a great server.

The food... was fantastic. 

We ordered off of the Classic menu, which was around $55 each and included a choice of starter (salad or soup), entree, side, and dessert. Upgrades (substitutions) were $4. 

We ordered the caesar salad, and the walnut/apple/blue cheese salad. The caesar was a hit, but the walnut salad was missing a little something (just not my thing).

The steaks were heaven on a plate, both cooked to perfection. She ordered the filet, medium. She is very picky about how her steak is cooked, and marveled at how perfect it was. She cut it, and just started at it in bewilderment. I ordered the rib eye, medium rare with a blue cheese/garlic/panco topping. Both steaks came out sizzling on a hot plate, with a good amount of butter. Fantastic. 

The best steak I have ever had.

We also had mac and cheese, which was some of the best I have ever had. She upgraded her side to sauteed mushrooms, which we both enjoyed.

Overall this was a fantastic experience. Service was great, wonderful atmosphere, and outstanding food!
author: Bradly B.

description:
Friday night it's 9:30 already and we are starving and on a quest to find a good restaurant that is open at this time of night . Lucky us we came across this steakhouse and I couldn't be any happier 
We ordered the porterhouse steak and mmmmm speechless as for what I can describe it . The mash potato / sweet potato was like eating a dream . Never before I came across a dish like that 
Servers were excellent and everyone were nice 
I loved it !!!
author: Jhony L.

description: My first time at Ruth's Chris was in Irvine and that experience left something to be desired. However, this time around our porterhouse was cooked perfectly and was an amazing experience.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Really yummy steak. I like that it's soaked in just the right amount of butter where the meat comes out super tender and FULL OF FLAVOR. I saw a few reviews saying that the steak might be TOO buttery, but I honestly didn't think it was bad at all. They give the option of no butter or extra butter, but I just got it as is and it was GOOD. I was afraid the hot plates would over cook my medium rare, but it was perfect! The hot plate keeps the steak fairly hot till the last bite. I hate when my steak comes out dry so I thought this was great. Mashed potatoes and creamed spinach was just okay in my opinion.. but definitely will be back for the filet mignon since this has just become one of my favorite steakhouses.

The only reason I didn't give this place a 5/5 stars is because I came here to celebrate my bf's bday and I was hoping for it to be really special with the small bday cake/dessert at the end or at least something with a candle where he can make a wish or just anything that says happy birthday. This was something I specifically asked for it in my notes when I made reservations.. Our waiter (not sure her name, but she had short hair with bangs that cut straight across) knew it was my bf's bday, but she came up to us when we were finishing up our food and ASKED if we wanted the bday dessert. I thought that was weird cuz other restaurants I've eaten at don't ASK since they usually just bring it out if it's someone's  bday. I even saw the other waiters just bring out bday desserts to the other tables. My bf, of course said no cuz he was full, but I still wanted him to get SOMETHING for his bday and I thought it was whack that she had asked and killed the moment instead of just making it a nice little surprise. Whatever. Good thing the steak was good.
author: Jenn N.

description:
What's better than sitting in front of one of my favorite cuts of beef (the ribeye topped with blue cheese crust) and creamed spinach along with a modestly priced bottle of wine with the mister in one of our fave restaurants? Truly nothing was better than that and I honestly wish we could do it more often! And when we do....Ruth's Chris is how we do it! 

Service was excellent! The dimmed lights and romantic atmosphere always gives a nice ambiance and the portions are incredible.
author: La C.

description: It was my boyfriend's birthday weekend and he really really wanted to come here. He was looking forward to it all week so we got all dressed up and headed over (so lucky our hotel was right across the street). The place is cute, pretty simple, and it was pretty much empty at 5:30p which was fine by us. We were greeted by a friendly waitress who seated us in a private area which was romantic. It's dimly lit, but not so much so that it's uncomfortable. She offered tap or sparkling water, and was pretty attentive to our needs. He ordered a rather large steak (by the way this place is PRICEY but the portions are HUGE) and I ordered their stuffed chicken. We also ordered lobster macaroni and cheese, asparagus, and dessert. The steak wasn't cooked to how he asked but he killed it anyway (I had a bite and it was pretty good). My stuffed chicken was overwhelmingly seasoned (the stuffing anyway), the chicken itself was fine. It's stuffed with this herb concoction that had a strange texture. I'm typically not that picky about food but if I'm paying $30 for chicken it'd better blow my mind. Again, the portion was HUGE though. The lobster macaroni and cheese is rich and delicious and the asparagus was cooked to perfection. The cool thing about this place is we shared our sides and it was perfect for the two of us so it didn't bother us that you have to order everything separately. They even had him choose a steak knife out of this really cool box of knives from different countries which was such a nice touch he didn't even know how to act. We ordered their creme brulee which is my favorite dessert and they made it PERFECT! The dessert is so big we could've shared it only they brought him dessert for his birthday (which we didn't know they did) and I've never seen him so happy to see dessert HA it was such a beautifully plated dessert he was like WOW! We've been going on about this place to everyone. Can't wait to go back!
author: Irene S.

description:
My 15 year old son is a definite carnivore so we decided to step up his steakhouse game for his birthday. And of course they exceeded expectations. The service was good the drinks were great and the steaks were exceptional!
 I can't say enough about how accommodating they were. Luckily we were able to make a reservation that afternoon for 730 that evening for a party of 6, after a long day of walking around the city shopping we ended up there an hour early for our reservation. So we decided to go to the bar and order drinks. By the time my brother and I ordered everybody drinks and and sat down to enjoy them the hostess came over and had our table ready. When we got to our table they had happy birthday confetti spread out the table which I thought was very nice and thoughtful. My son my brother and myself had the cowboy ribeye, my daughter had a 2 pound lobster that took up the whole plate and my mother in law and wife had crab cakes and a filet mignon. Everything was cooked to perfection the lobster was great and the steaks melted in our mouth! Thank you for making my sons 15th birthday a memorable one and showing him what that Next Level Steakhouse is all about. #GreatXperience
author: Sancho M.

description: For a skinny girl, I have a mans appetite. The Bf took me here for my birthday couple days ago. He knows me well. The BBQ shrimp appetizer didn't taste anything as expected, however, was srill delicious. Great wine selection. My steak was cooked perfectly and the appetizers were also good. They surprised me with a little dessert which was alright but filling. Great service.
author: Ankita T.

description:
Love the food here and not all that expensive, at least for a steak house. The filet was amazing and buttery, the potatoes au grotton  were the best I've ever had and the asparagus was delicious. So cheesy!!! We also got the ravioli which could have also been a delicious main course. 

Service was great as they were all super polite, knowledgeable and made fantastic suggestions for wine pairing. The only complaint is we had a table across from us that was extremely loud, possibly drunk which was a bit annoying.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
I seldom eat red meat, but when I do, Ruth's Chris is where I go to unleash the carnivore in me.

While it's not cheap, prices aren't exorbitant either. The classic, 3-course option will run you between $43 - $53 per person (before tax and tip) and includes a starter, entree, side dish, and dessert. I like the surf and turf filet and lobster combo or the 12 oz. ribeye. I always order my meat with a garlic blue cheese crust and extra butter. I get my salad to-go so that I have room to finish my steak, which makes for a nice light lunch the next day, especially after chowing down on so much fat and protein the evening prior. I've never met a side dish I didn't like and desserts are generally pretty decent, though my appetite is rarely strong enough to power through to the very end.

Entrees served on sizzling, 500-degree plates ensure that your meal will be hot and juicy down to the very last bite, unlike some places where your medium-rare meat will end up a cold, gelatinous mess halfway through dinner.

Finally, in my experience, every member of the Ruth's Chris staff have always gone out of their way to treat their diners like valued guests. Service is consistently warm, friendly, efficient, and attentive.

There's nothing bad I can say about Ruth's Chris. It's always a pleasure to dine here which keeps us coming back again and again. Absolutely my first choice for steakhouses.
author: Catherine P.

description: Worth ever dollar! Had an excellent petite filet mignon , cooked to perfection! the BBQ Shrimp (a must try) was phenomenal! All around satisfied!  Our server -jessica- was absolutely amazing as well! We live far away but will be back next time forsure! What a great place!
author: Amber W.

description: Just OK. I was way more impressed with the Honolulu location. Doubt I'll chose this steakhouse over the many other options in SF. The Filet ordered medium was very rare and very chewy. I'm used to a pretty buttery no fat Filet. Sides were just OK as well.
author: Melisa P.

description: Not only was the food delicious, but our server Ashley gave us the best customer service I have ever received in San Francisco. It's hard to find in this city that is always changing. We recently got married and she made us feel like the only people on earth. She was attentive and knowledgable about wine and food and made the dining experience very enjoyable! Can't wait to come back!
author: Beau H.

description:
I love Ruth Chris and to this date, their rib eye is my favorite steak in the world.  Everything they do they do well, and the service typically is amazing.  

That said this negative review is for the experience I had last night at the bar.  I am taking some medication for allergies that do not mix well with alcohol, so when I was at the bar last night, I asked the bartender what would be good without any alcohol.  He responded to me with an answer that he only had Sprite and that was it and walked away.  For 20 minutes he never came back.  He did manage to clean some glasses, and serve everyone else in the bar.  My uncle who was with me also wanted to order some wine, and he never served him or anyone else in our party of 5.  I felt like he deliberately avoided us because I wasn't drinking and that is horrible service that is not typical of Ruth Chris.

Later at dinner, when our waitress took our orders I asked her for a fun non alcoholic mixed drink, and she came back with a delicious virgin blueberry mojitto which I loved and enjoyed.  I think it came to the same bar, and the same bartender but somehow when I asked he only had Sprite.

I will never order drinks from him again (not that he would serve me apparently and if I had more time  I would let the restaurant know formally.  For now this will have to do.
author: Denise B.

description: Outside of the great steak meals, Ruth Chris is even dog friendly or maybe just service dog friendly
author: Marlo M.

description: Really one of the best steak houses in the city.  I think because it is a chain that the food will some how be less, but let me tell you we had an outstanding meal.  The service was perfect, our waitress knew when to leave us alone and when to help!  We had the Porterhouse for two medium rare, on the hot plates with the butter, wow!  We also had the lynnaise potato and creamed spinach which were both excellent.  This place tops Harris, Bobo's, and Mortons.
author: Pam M.

description: Thanks for the review.  It was helpful.  Having my wife cancel our anniversary dinner in a few weeks.  Going back to House of Prime Rib.  You should give that place a try.  Very good, but you need to schedule reservation days, or even weeks in advance.
author: Young L.

description:
I will keep this review shorts since i need to write another 20 reviews after this, but the place is a great steakhouse. The place is the standard for premium steaks and sets the bar that ever other place has to follow. 

Look to spend about a $100 to enjoy yourself. I recommend the ribeye. The only thing i would change is that they put this butter sauce on op to all their steaks. Its a little much for me, but a lot of other love that kind of stuff.
author: Ryan R.

description:
We came into this chain restaurant expecting chain-like settings, chain-like service, and chain-like employees. During the Dine About Town promotion, there was a special menu, so we decided to try it since it was for a good cause. The area is notorious for parking (but so is almost every commercial area approaching the Golden Gate Bridge), so park in the lots nearby, take a taxi, or even take MUNI unless you're lucky enough to get a spot.

8 and 16 ounce steaks, one petite fillet and one ribeye filet. The desserts were small, but this is the Dine About Town menu, so we didn't expect too much as the main courses for more than filling.

The setting of this restaurant is fairly quiet, where everyone can chat without too much noise. The decor is pretty decent, with wood decorations that are different yet pleasant, though we're here for the food, not the views.

Our server Jack was professional and courteous to our requests, so thank you sir!
author: Rob L.

description:
I was really excited to see Ruth's Chris on the Dine about Town list. My bf and I were really looking forward to coming here but it was a bit of a let down. Don't get me wrong, nothing was wrong in particular but we were both expecting more.

We both got the prix fix with the salad, petite filet (8oz) and the chocolate cupcake. The bread was really good, salad was ok, and the dessert was something you could pick up from Safeway. Now onto the star of the meal: the filet! It was good, just nothing special. I remember eating at a Ruth's Chris in Maui a few years back and thinking to myself "Wow! This is the BEST filet I have ever had". No such luck this time. Since it's not exactly cheap, not sure that it was really worth it. The service was excellent, our waiter was really attentive without being pushy. They also have valet parking for 10$ which can be handy.
author: Irina S.

description: $thirty-four.ninety-five dine about town...a $five discount from regular complete dinner pricing...rib eye upgrade for $ten extra and taking..bottles of wine sharing...medium-rare steak waiting...hot plate delivered...steak sizzling....pretty and buttery...a cut and taste...finding taste of butter and meat...quite a rich handsome steak..but, too much butter flavors masking steak...
author: Hen A.

description: I have been waiting to try this place for a while. I'm always hesitant to try chain restaurants but I heard great things about RC. I had the petit filet and it was perfect, however, when they say that they put butter on the steak, they really put a lot. It was bathing in butter. The fries I had were really yummy too, and our server was so awesome and friendly. Overall, it's a great steakhouse and I'm coming back for sure.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
I came here Friday night for the "Dine About Town" dinner. 

Once you're seated, they will bring you a regular menu. You need to ASK for the dine about town menu. 

The bread is soft and warm, and it comes with whipped/spreadable/dip-able butter. I'm guessing it comes straight from the oven because it takes awhile for them to bring it to you request more.

The steaks come on a HOT A S S, SIZZLING plate. My mouth waters every time I watch the video I took of my butter-bubbling, medium-rare, 16 oz ribeye. Do NOT forget to NOT touch it. If you are wearing long sleeves or nice garments, be careful for oil splatters. The ribeye was cooked and seasoned to delicious perfection. The buttery flavor melts in your mouth. Mm mm mmm.

For sides, both the mashed potatoes and spinach are tasty. I think both are necessary, so share with someone. Again...it's the butterrrrr ^___^. 

Dessert was also delectable. I left a request on my reservation via OpenTable to include a "Congratulations" message on my bf's dessert for his graduation. I was worried that they would forget, but I'm happy to say that they followed through. My bf was very pleased. :)

There was a table right next to us that caused quite a scene in the restaurant. It was rather ridiculous and theatrical to observe someone trying so damn hard to get comped. I understand that the entire staff, including our server, was occupied trying to deal with this crazy lady, but that doesn't make it okay to forget EVERY OTHER CUSTOMER in the restaurant. We paid $140 including tip for 2 people, even for a "discounted" menu, so we expected exceptional service. We waited for our water glasses to be filled for well over 20 minutes, but our server never came back around. We had to ask the restaurant manager in vicinity for our check, and then we had to ask another server to take payment. 

A high-end restaurant like Ruth's Chris should be capable of upholding their professionalism. They should not allow all of their attention to be diverted to rude/obnoxious customers. Bad vibe for good customers. 

Needless to say that the service was not on par that night. But the food was good, so I'll be back again. Hopefully there will not be another ratchet cheapo next time to nearly ruin everyone's dining experience.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Everything about this place makes coming back again and again a special experience. Yes, I know San Fran has other steak houses that are good so I read, but Ruth Chris has never given me a reason not to come back. 

Our server was Paul, a delightful, attentive server who did everything right. From the food to the service I couldn't ask for anything better. Crab cakes were almost 100% crab, very little fillers if any. Stuffed mushroom were small mouthfuls of deliciousness. So good. Harvest salad was creative and delightful. Ahhhhmazing steaks. We had the filet mignon with the bone in and the cowboy ribeye, which is the ribeye with the bone in-- the best way to get the most taste from your meat. Easily the best I've ever had, it seemed like my steak was improving in taste as I ate it. We capped it off with the chocolate explosion, which was an overdose of chocolate. What more can you ask for from a steak restaurant? I simply do not know, it was divine.
author: Paul B.

description:
I've had better food in less pricier places. My husband wanted to take me somewhere nice with really good food for dinner. Since we couldn't get a table at House of Prime Rib, we decided to try Ruth Chris down the street. 

We were both disappointed from start (appetizers) to finish (dessert). Wouldn't come back here again.
author: November C.

description:
I had read a lot about Ruth's Chris, but had never been to one. As a steak lover, I had my chance on a business trip to San Francisco. My coworker and I were seated promptly and courteously. A basket of warm bread was provided while we looked at the menu, but the bread was rather tasteless.

Both of us selected the fixed price dinners, me with a 10-ounce ribeye and she with the (6oz?)filet+shrimp. Both of us had the strawberry, almond and blue cheese salad as a starter, and it was quite large and very tasty.

Our entrees were served on the trademark sizzling platter. But I was disappointed in the ribeye - while it was done properly, I found it lacking in flavor (other than salt) and I've had better ribeyes from the grocery store. My coworker's filet and shrimp was "just ok", she said. She had the "Fingerling potatoes" as a side dish, and I had the green beans with garlic. The portions were much larger than I expected. The potatoes were in a spiced sauce that was rich and tasty, but there was a lot of it! Neither of us finished the side dishes.

I'm a sucker for Key Lime Pie, so when I saw that on the regular dessert menu I asked if I could upgrade to that from the included cheesecake. Indeed I could for $4. Again, the portion size was very large - enough for two. The pie itself was better than I've seen some places, but the crust was soft rather than crunchy and the filling didn't have the tartness I like. Then again, when I make this at home, I double the key lime juice content.

The service was excellent and we were very comfortable there. The fixed-price dinners were a good value, all things considered, but I expected the beef to be better than it was. I still ended up spending $70 (not including tip), and that's a lot of money for a mediocre steak dinner.

I'm glad I tried Ruth's Chris, but won't be eager to return.
author: Steve L.

description:
We stumbled in on a RANDOM tuesday night. Place was packed! Sure sign of good food I'd say. This is my second Ruth's Chris experience and I looooved it. I had a terrible first time experience at the Anaheim location. Not sure if it was the steak I ordered or if it was the company.. but I came to Ruths Chris so sure it would be just the same. It is a chain restaurant, so I couldnt bring myself to think highly of it, and besides I just had an amazing steak dinner at Alexanders. We ordered the 45oz Porter House Medium Rare. It was Nucking Futz! Sooooooooooooooooo delicious. Maybe the best meal I've ever EVER had. They brought it out on a sizzling hot plate covered in the most decadent butter sauce. They had the giant steak precut and served for us. It just melts in your mouth (literally) so tender I could safely say there is no chewing involved! When you do bite down there are bursts of steak juicy goodness that pops in your mouth. We couldnt finish the 45oz so we brought it home.. and it was STILL delicious the next day even after being in the microwave. AMAZAZZZING!!!!

5 stars for food, ambiance, and service. Complete win.
I can't wait to come back here again.. ..
Oh juicy steak I want to masticate with you in public.
(and my hubby is completely okay with that)

So here is the break down:

Ruth Cris Steak house- golden for STEAKS
Alexanders- golden for SIDES
HOPR- best prime rib
Ruth Cris Steak house- golden for STEAKS (oh yea I already said that)
author: Grace H.

description:
I have a particular group of girlfriends who always meet up at Ruth's Chris to celebrate each other's birthdays. So we probably head here 4x a year. The funny thing is none of us are big, red-meat eaters, but this is our exception.

Every time we come here, we have excellent food, service and a great time. I think the last time I was here I met some NFL football players, and last Saturday we enjoyed the company of our waiting staff, who took pictures with us.

I ordered steak and lobster, we shared the creamed spinach, the amazing sweet potato casserole and a bunch of other things. I usually get a cocktail or two as well. I forget which one I ordered, but the bottom line is, you can't go wrong here, everything is excellent. 

And I'm not just saying it because Fabolous rapped about it! ;)
author: Mischa ..

description:
Mmm. This is the good stuff. Their steaks are of the top 2% of beef in the US. The filet at medium rare literally melts in your mouth, not to mention the savory taste of the steak dipped in sizzling butter on a 500 degree plate. Simple goodness. This is why I cannot be a vegetarian, because I just can't give up beef... Sad but true. :(

I had made a reservation online stating that it was my boyfriend's birthday and when we got to our table, there was birthday confetti on it. That was too cute! 

This is for sure my favorite steakhouse and a great place for special occasions.
author: Kat K.

description:
This place is simply fantastic.  We had gone to celebrate my partners birthday and simply wanted a delicious meal.  Everything was as good as it can get.  The server, Michael, was funny, attentive, extremely knowledgeable about the menu, and just a great guy.

The food was simply mouth watering scrumptious.  We started off with seared ahi tuna, NOM.  We had filet and rib-eye with a side of lobster tail for dinner, NOM NOM.  For his birthday Michael had brought us some cheesecake (seriously THE BEST I've ever had) and some creme brule.

Yes, the menu is pricey, but when you're looking for something special, this is definitely the place.  If you want to add excitement, its literally across the street from the end of the California cable car line.
author: tony p.

description: Magnifico! Had a bussiness  lunch here and with clients. Service was on point. Steaks were cooked to perfection and sides were delish and portioned very well. Never had such deliciously sauteed mushrooms. The food was so good I absolutely love this place! Great for a first date too.
author: Linda M.

description: The food was amazing, I had the ruth classic. It come with a 6oz filet mignon with shrimp on the top. Also a caesar salad, garlic mashed potatoes and a dessert. I was full as a tick, our waitress was very attentive and friendly. Until next time
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Came here for a congratulatory dinner and our server made us feel very welcomed! He took the time to explain the restaurant's concept to us, which was pretty nice of him. 

I ordered the fixed 3 course meal with filet mignon. With the melted butter on my hot plate of medium rare steak, my first bite was absolutely wonderful - juicy and tender and perfectly cooked. BUT, the plate was so hot it ended up searing my steak up to a medium by the second bite! I think that's definitely something the server should've warned us about before we ordered. By the end, my steak was over-cooked and wasn't feeling the butter madness anymore.

I would've given 3 stars because the latter half of my meal was less-satisfying, but the first bite was just that awesome, and the server took a lot of time with us. Maybe next time I can just order a raw steak...
author: Carol C.

description:
My family went here for our Mom's 55th Birthday. Totally worth the money and experience. The only reason for the minus one star was that I felt that the food took a bit too long to come around. But we busied ourselves with taking photos. 

The steaks were on point, really juicy and the sides were also delicious. I had the halibut which totally satisfied my cravings. For dessert, I had a helping of two thanks to my brother. 

The service was great, they were really friendly and courteous. Even with such a large party plus a young child they were very kind to us. They even had confetti set out on the table and a little bit of decoration since they knew it was a birthday dinner!
author: K Nicole D.

description:
Spotty to weak service.  Overcrowded. Flustered staff - rushed service detracted from what is overpriced ordinary to lousy food drenched in butter. Food was overpriced and not Prime Quality, with super prime prices. the wine list is silly and by the glass should be described as 3 carefully measured ounces served in whatever was available. 
My guests had hockey pucks for $ 64 each !! for 6 oz.......sent back 2 times and all they wanted was medium....!!! This restaurant lives on hype.  It is not deserving of my business.  I would not place it on the "Top 10 steak places".  Even the Valet service is lousy and overpriced for what you get.  I guess one has to look at it as extortion penalty for having a car in a spot you must have one.
author: tom c.

description: I am tossed between 3.5 and 4 stars.  We were there on Thanksgiving for a 5 pm reservation.  The place was packed and our seating time was not too far off the mark.  As far as service is concerned it was excellent.  Obidiah (sp) was our waiter...very friendly, efficient, etc.  My husband and I shared the chop salad, asparagus w hollandaise sauce and potatoes au gratin.  He had the T-bone and I had the surf and turf.  My husband loved all of the food - bread too.  I liked the food.  We had a small pumpkin cheesecake and vanilla ice cream to end the mean that came w my meal...for me the best part of the dinner.  I knew the prices before coming here so shame on me but for the cost, the food was not good enough for me to return.  I got sick on the way home...sicker than I have been for at least 10 years...not sure why...don't want to say the food bc it did not taste bad in that way.
author: H. D.

description:
We have been going to Ruth Chris Steak House on Van Ness for over 20 years.

Sometimes the service was not great but the steaks were always good. So we kept coming back on special occasions.

This time was different.  We went the night before Valentines to avoid the crowds and craziness. 

The service was 5 star.  The side dishes were 5 star. 

But the steak sucked and it ruined the meal and the experience.

Both my wife and I had a petite fillet ordered medium plus.  

Mine came out more than well done.  It was gray inside.   It  had no flavor and was dried out.  When we sent it back, the server came back to tell me the grill master agreed.

My wife's steak came out where most of it was medium and OK to eat but some sections were blood red rare.

While waiting for a new steak to be cooked, I helped my wife with hers.  

By the time the replacement steak arrived I was full and done eating.

The replacement steak had no flavor.  My dog might have liked it.

They really should have taken my steak off the bill.  This was a $200+ dinner for two.

Then, on the way out the door, a group of young gang bangers showed up.  This was a bit disconcerting.  It happened last time as well.  They pulled up in a big black Cadillac Escalade literally reeking of drugs.  I was glad we were leaving.

Maybe I am getting old fashioned.  Ruth Chris was typically an upscale place where people in business suits enjoyed martinis and had great steaks. 

But now it's a place for gang bangers and drug dealers as well.

Based on advice of some locals we will be trying other steak houses in San Francisco.  Ruth Chris is better off  left for past memories.
author: Michael R.

description:
Absolutely fabulous!! Service was great, Molly was attentive and personable. The food was amazing, steak was perfectly cooked and sides were tasty. 

Since everything is al la carte it can get a pricy but if you are looking for an amazing meal then this is the place for you.
author: Christina D.

description:
Came here for a birthday and the server was great!! I ordered the petite filet with shrimp and it tasted great!! We also ordered the Ribeye which is amazing!! 

We also had the sweet potato casserole with vanilla ice cream for dessert. This is a definite try if you want to eat something sweet but with less calories than the other desserts. 

But if you come here for a birthday/anniversary they will give you free dessert (if birthday will have a candle) so next time around I would hold off on the ordering another dessert. 

The wine selection is also extensive so you'll have plenty to choose from.

Overall a great restaurant if you want some great steak!
author: Leonela S.

description: The experience and food at this location was on point.  For a party of 4 all the steaks were well cooked and the side dishes were good. My husband had the Bone in Filet which was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The only thing I didn't care for was the Hash Brown side that my friend ordered because it seemed like a McDonald's Hash Brown which you would eat with breakfast and not with my $50.00 steak! Overall 5 star meal would love to return. This renewed my faith in Ruth Chris Steakhouse!
author: Brandie T.

description: Seriously their rib eye is the best I love steak and their mashed potatoes are also on point may I also add the service is always friendly and caring
author: Misty A.

description:
If it wasn't for dine about town, I wouldn't have come here. At $35 for a 3 course meal here, that is a decent bargain for this place. My husband is a big meat eater, and he really enjoyed his perfectly cooked, medium rare steak. Of course, when it is bathed in butter, what's not to love? 

Bread basket was wonderbread with whipped butter; don't waste your stomach...

I had the vegetarian plate ($21 for 3 sides)-- and enjoyed steamed broccoli (the most boring item on the menu), sauteed spinach which also comes in a pool of butter, and a 1-lb baked potato. The husband had creamed spinach which was everything it should be. Dessert was something chocolate, which was relatively unmemorable (meaning, I can't remember what it was, so it couldn't have been very good). 

Definitely a nice atmosphere; reminded us of Peter Luger in Brooklyn. Dark, like a smoking room. Quick and attentive service. 

Also, we came in business casual attire, but there were certainly others around wearing jeans with rips and sweatshirts. I doubt the "dress code" is enforced.

May come back for next year's dine about town, hah....
author: Debora L.

description:
I had a good time. Food is delicious, Service was superb. I regret that I am leaving 3 stars. 

My husband and I went there for dinner. I was excited to try this restaurant. After an hour I left the restaurant, I got stomachache. When my husband woke up next morning, he got a stomachache. We did not have anything to eat before or after the dinner. So it is something from the food we got there. We spent over $100 and got sick. The server girls was so nice, she gave me extra side dish since she brought a wrong one. Water was refilled without asking. Don't get me wrong, I had a good time. BUT, I got sick. Is the kitchen sanitized and cleaned properly? Is everyone washing hands?? I looked over reviews here, I don't know if the owner/manager from the store checking this yelp page. I hope noone else got sick from last night.

I would love to come back, if they don't get us sick again.
author: Market C.

description:
I really liked Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. It is hard to find a good steak after having one in Texas. Honestly. But, I decided to treat my boyfriend for our anniversary dinner.

I called immediately at 5. I quickly landed a reservation for the time requested. All is well.

Phil, our waiter and the rest of the staff who helped prepare/serve our food were great. He was very helpful, clear and concise when it came to letting us know what was on the menu etc... I also saw him converse with other patrons who asked him very direct questions. He handled that well.

Anyway, the bread was SO delicious and to pair it with the spicy lobster. Wow, it tasted like a fresh roll Vietnamese sandwich (but with an american spin to it).

Food came out quickly. Yum, yum. They also carry A-1 sauce. I didn't need it but liked the fact that I had the option.

Will be back again


---- EDIT.
Reading some of the reviews below me, "it looked like a rap video". Yesterday during dinner, I mentioned to my boyfriend that I liked this establishment because it seemed to have an eclectic taste in customers/staff. It makes a comfortable feel for someone who may not frequent expensive steakhouses. We all come here willing to pay for the same service, food so I find it rude that the yelper a few posts below would kind of call it a guest in that way. WE KNOW WHAT YOU ARE REALLY TRYING TO SAY.
author: Sweets N.

description:
Dine About Town Meal #1:

$34.95 for a 3-course dinner at Ruth's Chris?! How can I say no?!?!

I had my eyes set on the 12oz. ribeye. It was spectacular! Maybe it was the smaller size or that it wasn't drenched in butter, either way I loved it! Seared to perfection, soooo flavorful and bloodyyy. MmmmMmmmm =D

On the other hand, the boy ordered the petite filet with the blue cheese crust. Definitely a more sophisticated choice. The crust gives it a nice kick to the steak. Not overpowering at all! The filet was tender and juicyyy! Delish!

The salad was decent. Mashed potatoes & creamed spinach were good. Although I prefer my spinach more creamy than leafy. The bread pudding & key lime pie were surprisingly light and tasty. Perfect ending for such an indulgent meal!

Minus one star for making me feel like a fat greaseball after the meal.

Photos: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Kxwc8PIKy2JsegNwgBjAtA?select=YYfVPD_M5kgmOu6TVNoNQg
author: Marti L.

description: You get what you pay for; excellent steaks, seafood, and wines with a conservative atmosphere. Our party had a lovely evening here last week. The real stand-outs of the night were the cocktails and the desserts though. The Manhattan East Side cocktail is like the offspring of a Manhattan and a Zombie -- drinkable and potent. The Cucumber Gimlet was great too. A few glasses of port with their cheesecake was definitely the perfect end to the evening.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: We went to have a birthday dinner. Everything went nicely. Food tasted good. However, three of four in our dining party got sick immediately after. We're not sure what it was but clearly something in the food from Ruth Chris since we all came from different places earlier. We reported the incident to the management. They were friendly enough and called us back. Nevertheless, when you spend $509, you don't want to get sick.
author: Joe B.

description: Took my kids there to celebrate my daughters 18th birthday. From the time we walked in, the hostess wishing her a happy birthday upon her arrival, to the time we left, the entire experience was a pleasant one. The service was great, the food was excellent. They even gave my daughter a special dessert plate and drizzled "happy birthday" in chocolate. I will definitely return soon. :)
author: Danielle F.

description:
Ok. Finally tried Ruth's Chris Steak House after wanting to try it. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT. First, we didn't have a reservation when we called from the road. 
The Maître d' who answered told my girlfriend that the wait, since we didn't have a reservation would be a 30-40 minute wait. 

She asked what time would be the next available, and he quickly asked "Well What time would you like to come here?" - Mind you this is at 7:45.
She replied "8:00" and he said "Ok." - Really? What happened to the 40 minute wait?

We found a space right away  and checked in, around 8. We sat there and waited around for 20 minutes,  while everyone else was seated, but what was worst was that the restaurant was half full...umm..okay?

Now to the real review:
We were waited on by a strange Waiter named Edward. Every time I would ask him about recommendations or order an item, he kept giving me long blank stares....(?).
My GF and I both ordered our steaks Medium. 
The steaks came out bloody, and more on the Medium-Rare side. I'm okay with it, but my GF was freaked out, and didn't have much of an appetite for it. 
Send it back, right?
That would have been fine, except our Waiter, Edward was not to be seen for the rest of the meal. As a matter of fact, there were several occasions where he walked past and gave me his signature blank stare, and kept walking even though I made eye contact. 
Hello? whatever happened to: "How is everything?" "Did you need another glass of wine?" "How is the food?" etc. 

The next time I saw our friend was when he brought us the check..pretty weak, right? Maybe since there were only two of us, Eddy decided a larger party was more worth his while..who knows. 

Only thing I can say is, that for the prices they are charging in this economy, they really should treat their customers better - again, there is a reason why the restaurant was half full.

Won't be back and don't recommend, unfortunately since the food was pretty good besides the bloody steak.
author: Darren J W.

description:
My friend made reservations for a small group of friends, which happened to fall into the Dine About Town promotion.

The table was ready as a few of us arrived early and  seated us even though we weren't all present. The Dine About Town promotion is not listed in the menu, you have to specifically ask for it, which we did. The waiter informed us that their daily pre-fix specials are better value than the Dine About Town.

As a result, the 6 of us ordered from their pre-fix specials. I got an 8oz steak, finger potatoes, house salad, and the chocolate truffle with strawberry shortcake. 

I think in the future I'll stick with medium done steak. I said medium-well and it was too done. The finger potatoes were sprinkled with bacon bits, they were yummy but a bit on the greasy side. The house salad was drenched with dressing, maybe a bit too much. The dessert was super yummy. The chocolate truffles melted in my mouth. I was in pure bliss, but then again I do have a sweet tooth.

All in all, the service was great, food was great, atmosphere was great, I'd definitely come back again!
author: Jean L.

description:
It is as good as it gets. My wife always get the 16 ounces ribeye steak and i always get

the 11 ounces filet mignon, both dishes were just excellent, they recently changed some of the veggie side dish, we got fire roasted corn and brussels sprouts...............we enjoyed

We go to ruth's on regular bases, usually on mondays, and we love to eat in the lounge area, 

our server Arturo was great, he is knowledgeable about meat, wine and he brings good vibes to the table

GREAT JOB
author: Giu G.

description:
This is just the 2nd Ruth's Chris Steak House I've ever been to, with the 1st having been in San Diego (& Yelp reviewed on 2/6/2010). The girlfriend & I were here during the Dine About Town promo. Our reservations were for fairly early in the evening, so we luckily managed to park on the street only a block away.

Arriving a few minutes early, we were seated immediately after we got around a disorganized mob of tourists who did not have reservations. Decor at this Ruth's Chris is stately but the layout is a little labyrinthine & confined compared to the openness & panorama of the San Diego Ruth's Chris. Service was friendly & mostly attentive, with a hiccup or 2. After a quick peek at the menu for comparison, we both decided to pick from their Dine About Town options. In hindsight, I would not make the same decision. The girlfriend got the Petite Filet & I upgraded to the 16 oz. Ribeye.

For our Dine About Town orders, we each got a salad, our designated steak (I ordered mine rare & the girlfriend ordered hers medium rare) w/ a side of mashed potatoes  & a dessert. Bread & salad came out before long. Steaks followed at a good interval after. There is certainly no issue with the food here. The bread & salad were very good. Both my Ribeye & the girlfriend's Petite Filet were divine & cooked exactly to specification. The mashed potatoes were supremely creamy. The dessert, though not grand in any way, was nice.

Where there was an issue, I suppose, was the value of the Dine About Town offering vs. the Ruth's Classic prix fixe on the menu. Initially, the Dine About Town deal was a few $ less, but that difference disappeared after the markup for my Ribeye upgrade. The Ruth's Classic prix fixe has better options. This was basically what I ordered at my previous Ruth's Chris dining experience in San Diego & that felt like a fuller, more well-rounded meal than the Dine About Town dinner. It's simply better bang for the buck & that is actually a good thing. Instead of trying to get into Ruth's Chris on the cheap during Dine About Town, just go whenever the mood strikes & order their prix fixe deal.
author: John M.

description:
To celebrate my girlfriend's promotion, we came here on a whim. This was our 2nd time coming to a Ruth's Chris but our first time was in Walnut Creek. Our experience in Walnut Creek was one of the best we have had at a steakhouse. 

B R I E F  S U M M A R Y
-- I recommend reservations & if you're celebrating something, they'll remember
-- Parking can be horrible but there's valet for $10
-- Meters end at 6pm so if you can get lucky like we did, it's FREE
-- Ambience felt very city-ish and slightly different than WC
-- Service wasn't very attentive specifically our server
-- Almost all of our food was great
-- House bread was warmed up french bread = average
-- Lobster Bisque = great choice for soup
-- Ribeye was juicy and flavorful just like it's supposed to be
-- Petit Filet has great flavor 
-- Lobster tail was fresh and delicious
-- Definitely get the potatoes au gratin = cheesy & yummy!
-- Asparagus is nice and fresh
-- Chocolate Explosion (dessert) was surprisingly light for a chocolate cake
-- Creme Brulee was enjoyed
-- Banana Cream pie was a mix of reg banana cream pie & creme brulee = MUST TRY

Walnut Creek left this great impression, a memory my GF and I thoroughly enjoyed. We regard Ruth's Chris in WC to be the best steakhouse in the area. Unfortunately we don't feel the same about the San Francisco location. 

Everyone and everything but our server seemed to be up-to-par. We got great parking right in front and didn't have to pay. The ambience was nice and relaxing. It felt a bit city-ish and dark but that's normal in steakhouses. Our glasses were always full. The food was amazing and satisifying. 

We (me, my GF and her Mom) weren't checked on much by our server once a larger table was sat in his section. We were hungry and finished the house bread and we received no offer of more. It just didn't feel like he cared once the bigger party came. My GF's Mom said she just didn't feel welcomed or like she was being paid attention to. My GF and I absolutely agreed, especially after having such a memorable experience in Walnut Creek.

Overall I rounded down to 3 stars but felt the food was 4 stars. It's hard to overlook our lack of service. With service like this, it's doubtful that we'll be back. Our expectations are probably just too high from such an amazing time at the Walnut Creek location...
author: Daniel D.

description: Great food, great ambiance, and even better service. These guys have it figured out. Took my wife, mother, and father here to celebrate my mothers birthday. Definitely coming back! Very pricey, but extremely worth every penny!
author: Martin M.

description:
This is very unfortunate. :(

From the service to the atmosphere to the valet staff, nothing was up to the traditional Ruth Chris standards. 

The food itself was fine (not great, fine) if you compared them to all the other Ruth Chris they are probably on par (+- daily variance), so my grade of 2 stars goes directly to the staff here and nothing else. Of course if i was served above average Ruth Chris items I'm sure that would have helped. 

So the Staff was inattentive, the valet reminded us that they work solely off tips which was rude and basically their way of demanding a tip (which is always awkward). Then our server was probably a junior staff member, could not get our orders straight, she came back twice to verify what we ordered or didn't order. then she forgot about us for 20 full minutes and then couldn't remember to refill our drink orders. 

Nothing went right at this restaurant and it was just a bad experience all around.
author: Tomo K.

description:
Their service was the definition of perfection!  they really know how to make you feel like a queen/king!

I ordered the combo, and we ordered appetizers to share

Summer Salad:
- fresh greens and they served the heart of the watermelon!  sooo yummy
- if you are not a fan of raw onions or feta cheese i recommend you ask the server to take it out or choose a different starter

Filet:
- cooked to juicy perfection even though it was much leaner than the rib eye, topped off with butter and some garlic, making the steak even tastier!
- the plate kept almost every bite surprisingly piping hot!  it makes the steak just melt in your mouth
**would recommend filet over the rib eye because they served the rib eyes with large portions of fat, which my friends did not approve of**

Lobster:
- chewy meat, nicely doused with melted butter and some garlic
- easy to crack shell
- i would probably choose shrimp over lobster

Garlic Mashed Potatoes:
- buttery, mushy, and warm
- perfectly executed

Potatos Au Gratin:
- firm fresh potatos
- melty cheese
- buttery
- the textures and tastes were more interesting than the garlic mashed potatoes, i would recommend getting this as an appetizer

Calamari:
- fried to crispy perfection 
- tastes like they drizzled butter on top of the batter after it was fried...or that they deep fried it in butter...
- spicy sweet asian sauce (same as that filipino sauce you use for lumpia)
- don't let that calamari sit around to soak up the sauce and become soggy, it's best when it's fresh out the kitchen
**would highly recommend - it was the best calamari i have ever had!**

Totally expensive but totally worth it in the end!   you only live once, so eat and enjoy!
author: Tina A.

description:
A steak house that serves it's meat in a dish of butter is my kind of steak house.  I've heard rumors about the amount of butter used per steak - some say half a stick, most say a whole stick but I figure you're going there for a gluttonous dinner anyhow. Suck it up and take it as you asked for it.

The steaks are cooked to perfection and if they're not - send it back and request a new one.  After all you are paying for a perfect $45(minimum)+ piece of beef so it should be done right the first time... not the second, or even third.  Ruth's does strive for the perfect temperature, just the way you've asked for it, so hopefully it's done right every time.

Start off with Ruth's Jumbo Chop Salad (ask to split for two) dig into a Petite Filet (Trust me - it's a lot of food) and grab a side of the Au Gratin potatoes.  You can thank me later.  Don't forget to tip accordingly - although you're paying for a hefty meal, you should be provide with stellar service to boot.
author: Kevin J.

description:
My out of town company arrived yesterday. Good friends Shirley & Bob are from Wyoming.  They are staying with me till Monday. They are a lot of fun & foodies too.

I know most people go to steak houses to eat steak but I am not a big steak fan. But that's okay cuz Ruth Chris happens to be my friends favorite restaurant (they arent new to SF they even lived here over 25 yrs ago).

They made 6:00 dinner reservations couple weeks ago, for last night. The restaurant itself looked classy, dark wood, dim lighting. They ordered cocktails and I had a diet coke (which was fine cuz I was the DD). For apps we each ordered the Shrimp Cocktail (not the spicy) and Wow was it BIG and very delicious! For our main, I had the lamb chops (there was 3 of those suckers, I had to brown bag one home) they were phenomenal. Seriously excellent tasting and very juicy. My friends ordered the Porterhouse for Two and they just RAVED about how good it was. For sides we ordered potatoes au gratin (which I really liked!) and sauteed mushrooms (to die for!) and creamed spinach (did not like at all!). We all forced ourselves to order Cream Brulee for dessert (it was AMAZING!). Our server was very friendly & Shirley & Bob liked her. She sort of ignored me after I asked for another diet coke. Hmmmm. Anyway the food was great, everything came out hot & very presentable.

Not sure its worth going back to (for me), unless you have out of town guests footing the bill. Pricey.
author: Janet T.

description:
My fiance and I enjoyed a wonderful, romantic meal here for Valentine's Day! Warning - this is a long, detailed review, but I have to give them the credit they deserve.

The ambiance was sophisticated. Definitely felt classy eating at this fancy schmancy restaurant. Dim lighting, professional service, and no noisy kids... it was just great :)

More bang for your buck - go with the Ruth's Classics menu, which gives you a selection on an appetizer, entree, side, and dessert. Depending on what entree you choose, it'll come out to about $40 or $50/person, which is not bad at all, considering the amount of food you'll be getting. That's what we did.

My order:

Caesar salad - honestly, it was all about the CROUTONS!!! Buttery, garlicky, cheesy goodness!

Filet mignon with bleu cheese/garlic/panko bread crumb crust (additional $3) - Meat was perfect, tender, juicy... placed on a plate of deliciously browned butter, and the crust on top just added another layer of flavor. I'm not a big fan of the pungent flavors of bleu cheese, but the bleu cheese topping was recommended by a friend of mine, and I'm glad I listened. It was worth it!

Creamed spinach - it was good, but forgettable.

Chocolate explosion (additional $3) - YUM! This wasn't part of the Ruth's Classic menu items for dessert, but I'm a chocolate lover so this was up my alley and totally worth the extra $3. It's chocolate molten cake with warm chocloate fudge, caramel, and vanilla ice cream.

His order:

Steak salad with Italian dressing - he ate every nite of it, need I say more?

Ribeye with peppercorn sauce (additional $3) - Tasty meat, cooked perfectly, also served on a plate of browned butter with the sauce on top - it was very flavorful! The sauce was good, but I prefer the bleu cheese crust.

Mashed potatoes - buttery, creamy, and very good... better than the creamed spinach, in my opinion.

Cheesecake & chocolate bark with walnuts - this dessert came with the classic menu. The cheesecake was very unique - at first bite, you can really taste the tang of the cheese and then you taste the subtle sweetness in the end. The chocolate bark was good, too - sea salt was sprinkled on top and I think we tasted some type of chili in there. 

We were served some french bread at the beginning of our meal with whipped butter. The bread reminded me of banh mi (Vietnamese sandwich) bread - it was warm, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside... the whipped butter just made it even better. Although we could have had another serving of bread, we opted not to because we had so much food lined up ahead of us.

Our waiter recommended the calamari, so we ordered that, too. Perfectly cooked - the batter was light & crispy, the meat was tender. There was also a light sweet & sour sauce drizzled over it. I apprecited that their halved lemons had a mesh cloth tied around it to keep the seeds inside - loved the attention to detail :)

Our left overs consisted of half of the steaks, most of the sides, and half of my chocolate explosion dessert.

It was such a great experience, I cant' wait until we visit again!
author: Janis A.

description: Our server was so friendly and attentive. The spicy lobster was superb. Ribeye medium rare was nicely done. My bf got the new york strip but thought my rib eye was way better. Definitely the meat is firmer like the menu suggested. The strawberry gimlet was eh but later I got the coconut ginger martini which was sooooo yummy!
