We ended up ordering two because my bf thought it was yummy too.
author: Wendy L.

description:
STEAK LOVERS (like myself) PARADISE!

Been here countless times at several different locations in both CA and HI and I just cant get enough.

Their steaks are done to perfection.

My favorite entrees are the Porter House for 2 and COWBOY RIBEYE. Your steak arrives on a piping hot buttery plate so its warm to the last bite! Sometimes I ask for rock salt and sprinkle just a little on each piece right before devouring.

I also LOVE the crab cakes. They're fluffy, crispy, buttery and loaded with chunks of crab. I have never eaten here without ordering the crab cakes as an appetizer.

Stuffed Mushrooms are also really good and something I occasionally get depending on my appetite.

Sides: Theres nothing special to them. I only suggest ordering sides if you need something to accompany your steak. 

Do Not Order: Lobster Tails. We added a whole lobster tails to each of our entrees and was sadly disappointed. It was ... DRY :(

I got engaged last year so naturally the fiance took me to Ruths Chris to celebrate. The hostess and our waiter made us feel really special. At the end of the dinner they even comped our champagne and dessert! Thank you Ruth's Chris Steakhouse!
author: Charisa N.

description:
Aside from the infamous House of Prime Rib in San Francisco, I kept hearing about Ruth Chris Steakhouse when the topic of steak comes up. I came here on a Saturday night for table of 6. Upon entering, the restaurant was dimly lit, was filled with rustic decors and smelled buttery and meaty. 

I ordered the economy meal from their menu, which I get the choice of salad or soup, choice of an entree, and a chocolate cheesecake. I decided on a spinach gorgonzola salad and a filet mignon from corn fed Midwestern beef with vegetable. 

The food at Ruth Chris was exactly like how I described the restaurant. The food lacked colors since everything was either grilled with loads of butter or covered in cream. Our waiter even warned us that the hot plate is covered with butter, and then more butter was poured over the steak when served...because everything taste better with BUTTER! I tried to be healthy and ordered vegetable side, but I failed because the veggie was covered in oil also.

The food was delicious since it was overly greased. My filet mignon was thick and super juicy and tender. But I was done after eating half of it since it was quite heavy.
After I was bloated, the chocolate cheesecake arrived! It was thick, richy and creamy. As 
full as I was, I ended up eating half of that cheesecake because it was delicious! The fruit with the belvarian cream was a nice balance.

Overall, the experience was great. Our waiter was nice and helpful. The food was heavy but delicious, but I would think twice before I ever go back since it was just too much food and grease for me.
author: Mandy C.

description: I love Ruth's Chris's rib-eye. It's the best I've ever had so far. It's buttery, juicy, and full of flavor. I also love their mac-n-cheese, creamed spinach, shoe string potatoes and even their sauteed mushrooms are good. I took off a star because the previous time I dined here, our waitress didn't give us the option verbally that we could upgrade our appetizers and desserts. When I tried to hunt her down to ask her if we could see the dessert menu to upgrade, but by the time we found her she was already bringing us the nasty desserts that came with the set-menu. Ugh. She also forgot about us midway through dinner after a large party had arrived. I don't think you should forget about your customers just because you have a larger party to assist. Anyway, I should be taking off 2 stars but their rib-eye is that good.
author: Laura T.

description: This place is amazing. I went here for a late Valentines dinner with my boyfriend. I got the rib eye steak and lobster and loved it ! The steak really melted in my mouth and the lobster had a perfect texture and flavor to it . It was prepared and cooked perfectly. The service was beyond great. Our server was very nice and attentive but not in a annoying way where he disrupted our dinner.  I will be back soon !
author: Cee T.

description:
3.5 stars!

Finally came for the steak that's drenched and sizzling in butter for Diane about Town! Essentially,  you are getting a free appetizer and dessert because the cost of the steak alone was about the DAT dinner price. Not bad. They make a really solid steak here but it appeared that all of our steaks were over cooked. The steak I ordered was supposed to be rare and it came back medium rare. Aside from that mishap it was tender, juicy and had great flavor and seasoning. The steak is literally still sizzling hot and cooking as it arrives to your table! Poor baby was cooking for too long *sigh* 

The service was impeccable. After walking 2 long blocks in the cold weather in my dress to Ruth Chris I was freezing my butt off. When we got seated I realized I was still cold and didnt want to take off my coat. I didnt get all dolled up to wear my coat while fine dining. I asked our waiter to turn on the heat and he came back and said it should be  toasty in about 15 minutes. Then another gentleman helped me check in our coats when I asked. Through out the night,  the staff was friendly, personable and attentive. 5 stars for the service alone!

The ambiance is what you would expect. They restaurant is sectioned in about 3-4 areas and it seemed like they really catered to large parties. The only con is that the lighting was too dim. I had to use my cell phone back ligting to read the menu.

First Course
Steak House Salad With Balsamic Vinaigrette - Pretty large salad, over dressed but very fresh ingredients. Nothing special.

Second Course
8 oz. Petite filet with a side of creamed spinach- One solid steak! Delish, just not served rare like I asked (read description above). The creamed spinach was yummy.

Third Course
Ruth's Symphony: Duo of chef's daily selections- Chocolate over load! Its good the first two bites but it tends to be way to rich. It was a chocolate mousse wrapped in a hard chocolate shell with a side of yogurt and fresh berries. If you didnt pair the two up it would be overwhelmingly sweet.

The bread- Yes this gets its own category! I might have been just plain hungry but they have really good fluffy warm hard roll white bread with the perfect amount of crunch in every bite.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
I've eaten at Ruth's chris's in about 7 different cities/states now & this location has been marked on my favorites list! Our waiter was AMAZING! She was polite, and very prompt! She checked in on us enough to where we felt we were getting A-1 service!

The food was great as always and the sweet potatoe casserole left us in food heaven! it was GREAT!
author: Nelly C.

description: This is not a great steakhouse.  My husband's steak was way underdone and had to be sent back.  The wine the waitress recommended - without being asked - was mediocre and overpriced.  Sides were good.  Ambience was poor.  Basically an overpriced chain.  Go to Harris's or Bobo's.
author: Julie H.

description: We had some special circumstances this evening which required us to move seats. We initially started at a high top at the bar, and about 30-40 mins, we (I) needed to move to a different location. The hostess, Mandy, was so very accommodating, kind, patient, and considerate. Not to mention, she got me seated at another table right away with no delay. They transferred my order to the new table, my initial server was wonderful and came over to check on us and ensure that it was a smooth transfer. They really really really helped make the best of an uncomfortable situation for me (no fault of theirs). Thank you, Mandy, and our initial server (sorry forgot his name)! You guys were so wonderful in taking care of my special needs right away! We drive all the way from Hayward to come to this specific location vs Walnut Creek, and we will continue to come back here for your consistently delicious food and exceptional service. THANK YOU!!
author: Noj N.

description: Ruth's is my go to place for a good ribeye. You have to go with the bone-in-ribeye with the blue-cheese crust. It is simple phenomenal. The place is a little pricey, but it's worth it to get a good cut of beef.
author: Chris R.

description: 4 stars because there was a customer service issue we noted yesterday that had to be resolved by managers. Once resolved we had a great dinner, all of the ladies in the end were happy with the dishes they ordered.  I liked how eventually accommodating the restaurant was, and how much effort was put out to make sure my party had a good experience--it is because of such personal touches I could see returning. I liked the chocolate explosion dish best of all, but then the entire dessert menu looked great.
author: L L.

description:
Visiting from LA, came for dinner on Feb 18.  Place was packed! Waited 15 min past our reservation, and we were there 15 min early, so 30 min total. But we understood, it was packed, it's all good.

I started off with the Harvest Salad.. Best salad I ever had! The butter for the complimentary bread was so tasty and the bread was super soft.  I Had the Rib-eye Steak cooked "well."  I had been wanting to try their steaks for some time now.... It was well worth the wait! Tastiess steak I've ever had.. No A1 needed, it would only take away from the amazing taste. 

Wife had the house salad with ranch dressing. The ranch dressing was amazing, very tasty!  Her entree was a steak and lobster.  The lobster was seasoned incredibly!  And her steak was tasty as well.

The side dishes serve 2 people.  We ordered the asparagus that comes with hollondaise sauce (yummy)!  We also ordered the potatoes Au' gratin.  If you love cheese and creamy sauces then you will love these, we sure did.  Missed out on the popular creamy spinach :/

Creme brule was great.

I didn't have any issues that other Yelpers have had.. Our server Courtney was cool.
Only complaint would be the tables are kind of small....enjoy!
author: Steve M.

description:
This fancy steak house is one of my favorite restaurants. Food is incredible, great service and atmosphere everything I've ever had is great except the gumbo is not so good, my favorite steak is the veal cut with sweet and hot peppers if you ever go there trust me on this please order it, its the best steak they have in the house the fillet Mignon does not come even close to the veal and mash potatoes, their stuffed chicken is also good not to mention any of their dessert selection is also outstanding. 

The steaks are grilled very well, and the beef is of excellent quality. Unfortunately, the steaks don't come with any sides. You have to order a soup, salad, and/or potato separately. If you want something crispy, get the shoestring potatoes - they are my favorite.
author: Bella B.

description:
Very expensive, but OH so worth it. If you want to have one of the best steaks of your life, this is where you should go.

All the meat is aged till perfection and cooked exactly to order. In terms of entrees, each portion is excellent. The filet is very tender and juicy, the t-bone gives you the best of the filet and the ny strip, the rib-eye is great for a very hearty meal (goes perfectly with any side of potatoes) and the new york strip is mouth-watering. The lamb chops are phenomenal, hands down best lamb I've ever had. I cannot stress this enough, if you want good meat, go to this restaurant.

Surprisingly, even the appetizers are EXCELLENT. The mahi-mahi tuna fillets were the best tuna I've had, I can't even imagine how they prepare it so well.

Great wine and drinks list, and the desserts are all very large portions but delicious and extremely rich.

The waitstaff is friendly, prompt and super professional.
author: Landon E.

description:
So... I've eaten at some really good steak houses before and this BY FAR is the best I've ever had! I had the salad for starters which had organic vegetables and the most buttery croutons EVER! Then I had the 16 oz. rib eye with Peppercorn sauce on the side. The steak came sizzling in butter!! Smelled and tasted so good! I wasn't a big fan of the pepper corn sauce. I did try my friend's rib eye which he ordered with blue cheese crust - THE BEST! I'd recommend getting the blue cheese crust! I had a side of creamed spinach but enjoyed the mashed potatoes more.


Not only was the food good but we didn't have to wait at all - be sure to make a reservation though. And our waitress/server was very nice and rooted me on to finish my steak since I can never finish a meal. I actually finished my meal this time - thats how good this place is!

I love love LOVE this place :)
author: Sarah A.

description:
The highlights of Ruth's Chris: the filet mignon (of course), the extremely hot plates, and the butter.  

I have been here twice now and my taste buds have thanked me both times (even though my heart did not).

The Scoop on...

The filet mignon:  Very tender and and seasoned to perfection.  Don't hesitate, just order it.   

The extremely hot plates:  The steaks are served on plates that are 150 degrees or so  in order to keep your steak hot for the whole meal.  
       Tip: if you are debating to get your steak medium-rare or medium...get it medium-rare and the plate can literally cook your meat more to your liking. 

The butter: Oh, where do I start...the filet comes surrounded in butter.  You can dip your meat in it, your veggies in it, your bread in it, the list goes on and on.  As stated by Gérard Depardieu, "the secret to life is butter".

Surprisingly, it's not very difficult to make reservations at this place, although on both my visits, they didn't seat us for about 10-15min after our reservation time, which isn't really a big deal.  


If you want to get buttered up (who doesn't), eat at Ruth's.
author: Juliana K.

description: My first Ruth Chris experience was very disappointing. The interior, while striving for an old time steakhouse vibe, just felt tired. The service was good which helped but the food was below average at best. The bone in ribeye had a decent flavor but was tough and chewy. The creamed spinach was lukewarm and lacked any real flavor. The hash browns was like eating a potato cake without any flavor. Oh yeah, it's not cheap. My first Ruth Chris experience will be my last
author: Michael M.

description:
Yes, this is a chain but as chains go this is one of the best. Of course there are other quality places to get a steak in SF. (HOPR, Harris'...)

Yes, it's more expensive than other places but this IS still a steakhouse that uses quality cuts of meat. Two grassfed 8 oz filets do not come cheap, even straight from the butcher!

Yes, there are more original steakhouses in SF but when a man offers to take you here on a date always say yes :)

Yes, it's borderline in a sketchy part of town but it is close to the opera and they have valet parking.

Yes, Ruth is possessive of Chris. I have no idea why.
author: Sara P.

description:
The ambiance is kinda ghetto.  

The staff wear super big name tags. In size 40 font. 

The rib eye was divine! The choco peanut butter cupcake was perfect.
author: Jacquee P.

description: We had dinner at Ruth Chris to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This is a no-nonsense steakhouse were the main star is beef. I had a rib-eye and it was cooked perfectly. No condiments added; the steak was very delicious. The steak is moist, juicy, and succulent. It is the first time I have heard of wet-aging steaks but I guess it works well that's why Ruth Chris does it. The cream spinach was yummy, the rest were forgettable but their steaks were fantastic. And the ambiance was very conducive to celebrate any romantic occasion to boot.
author: Paul V.

description: ....it is A ok overall...I am not a big fan...it is very expensive...the filet I had was good but not great...had a hard time getting up from table because a table piled high with dirty dishes was blocking narrow isle...it almost got knocked over...there were other service short comings that you don't expect in a high priced eatery...the cheese cake desert was no-where...
author: jim b.

description:
In preparation of attending this establishment for it's fine meats and extensive wine collection, I collaborated with my inner "Bourdain," imaginging the white linen table cloth, freshly polished silveware, and marvelously clear, spotless wine glasses and finely aged and marbled meats.

At least they got the 3 out of the 5.

I've been to Ruth Chris' several times, however not in San Francisco.  Located in a corner lot on busy Van Ess, I was excited and more than willing to brave the cold nights that San Francisco has to offer to make a valiant attempt to have some fine cut meats as I have had in the past in Ruth Chris locations in Texas.  Alas, the San Francisco establishment failed.  

I thought to myself, "Perhaps I simply should not write this review with the fear of causing severe ire amonst my fellow Yelpers that would skin me alive for tearing apart their beloved establishment, step by step."

Nahhhh.

I entered this busy restaurant with my girlfriend - small, quaint, packed.  I would say "about right" for San Francisco.  

Our table wasn't quite ready, so we waited at the bar.  After standing and standing, the bartender, Arturo, finally took notice from his break neck speed of pouring beverages to ask if he could help me.

What happened next shocked me.  And I think set the tone for the rest of the night.  Upon asking me what I would like to drink, before I could even utter, "Yes, I woud like....." - HE WALKED OFF TO OTHER END OF THE BAR.

Wow.  You're asking me to pay $17 for beer and you WALK OFF??!!

Jose, another bartender, was kind enough to ask me if I needed anything and at this point, Arturo had returned to the cash register which I promptly announced, "No Jose, I think I'll wait for Arturo as I'd like to give him a piece of my mind."  Needless to say, I said that with a grin and was joking (not really, but I certainly was not going to cause a scene or embarrass anyone) and asked if I could have a beer and a Moscato.  Arturo, maybe because I shook him without really trying, reached up for the wine glasses on the rack and proceeded to shatter one, the lonely stem hanging up top, inverted, separated from the body.  

I took our drinks, paid the man, with a tip mind you, and we were all seated.

Our severs were Lena Joy and Hugo - Lena had little to no emotion in serving, even giving off a slightly irritated hint to her demeanor.  Hugo on the other hand, was excellent.

We were at a table of 10 and most of us ordered some varying cut of meat.  I ordered the Cowboy Ribeye - being from Texas, that's all I wanted - medium rare, on the bone, with a little blood pooling on the side (sorry to the Vegans for the visual).  The ribeye was supposedly aged in order to get that particular, marbling that good steaks should have.  

The steak came out on piping hot plate, very hot - I would not touch it if I were you.  I grabbed my knife and gently poked a side of the steak with my fork.  Here's my test - the knife test - I laid the knife on top and gently starting cutting, not applying too much pressure, watching the steak come apart.  I intentionally went after the portion with a tiny bit of grisle.  Unfortunately, I had to apply even more pressure as the meat simply was not separating.  Then  a little more.  By this time, trickles of the juices mixed with a tiny bit of blood began seeping against my knife, steam rising from the fresh cut.

My mouth watering, I began to chew.  

Then I realized it...this meat had NOT been aged OR marbled.  If it HAD been aged, it was pulled and cut prematurely.  THIS WAS THE WORST STEAK I HAD EVER HAD FROM RUTH CHRIS.  I was utterly deflated.  The steak tasted as if I could have gotten the same thing from Safeway - hell, this wasn't even butcher quality.   I finished what I could and quietly sat in silence while the rest of our table finished up.

What happened?  What did I just miss?  Why was this not what I thought.  A steak house that purchases steak cuts from Sysco or US Foods, but not grain fed meats.  No Kobe, not Wagyu....nothing "high-end" other than the prices.   

It was a flat steak.  

Unfortunately, mabye I caught the cooks, and the house, on a bad day.  Perhaps I'll try them again in the future.  But in another city.  Even another state.

But for all of you meat afficcionados, I recommend thinking twice about eating at Ruth Chris.  I assure you, I can cook you a better cut of meat from Costco.  And I would even serve it with a smile.
author: Marvin J.

description: Food was excellent but they wanted to move us along.  Served our drinks and asked to take our order at same time.  I said I did not want to order until I enjoyed my drink and conversation.  Otherwise it was great.  One final comment, why can't they keep your coffee refilled without asking, after dinner?
author: Fred S.

description:
Without a doubt one of my favorite steak houses in San Francisco. 

I know it's a chain but it's quite good. I actually preferred it to Harris' which is more expensive (though very good) and down the street. 

It wasn't particularly intimate so I wouldn't recommend it a date place (not that you should do a huge steak dinner on a date) but it is certainly a great place to eat.
author: Carlos A.

description: I was pleasantly surprised at how good this place was. Definitely 5 stars for the filet mignon. Well spiced and perfectly cooked
author: Carrie T.

description:
While they honor your special occasion and have extremely attentive service, the food is average at best.  The steak is melt in your mouth because of the marbling, which is to say "fat" in the steak and the extreme temperature at which they cook the steak and bring it to the table.   I don't particularly like my steak swimming in it's fat on the plate they present to you.  The steak is cooked at 1400 degrees and brought to your table on a 500 degree plate.  The sides however come in typical oval bowls for community sharing and by no means maintain a temperature conducive to eating, i.e. cold.  There is an extreme contrast between the steak and vegetables in temperature presentation.  They did reheat our vegetables when asked, and promptly, but still devolved to cold compared to the steak.  The sides are nothing to speak of either, very average at best.  We had the bacon, honey brussel sprouts which could have stood cutting out the stem in many of them rather than just sliing them in half.  They absorbed, slightly, the honey bacon flavor, but I have had them pan fried without breading at other restaurants that really enhanced the flavor and were 100% better than these.  The fingerling potatoes had run out just an hour into their service and they consider this one of their specialties.  So, we had mashed potatoes instead which were runny, or not stiff as you would expect whipped mash to be.  Again they were average or below at best.
Then there were the charges:  I love a good ribeye, and they had varying levels of price from $49-119.  There were five different types you could have: petite, 16oz, cowboy and tomahawk, the latter two being bone in.  Of course they have a full gamit of other steaks as well at varying prices.  My pet peeve at a place that has inflated prices is not giving you options, but letting you muddle through on your own.  The waiter, knowing it was our first time did not give us any guidance, nor did the bus/waterboy.  They give you a choice of sparkling or still water, and not thinking about it, I thought I would be given plain water(when asking for "still"), but should have thought about it more and known when they give you this choice they are going to give you an inflated charge for it at $8.50 instead of informing you that you could have iced water from a pitcher, that is standard at most upscale restaurants, for free.
Parking )$5/hr is limited on the street, but there is a garage attached in the back that has a secret passageway to walk that opens on the sidewalk right next to the front door of the restaurant.  Expect a minimum of 2 hours at the restaurant.
The restrooms were not cleaned regularly throughout the night.  There were two stalls and an extra handicapped one in the female side.  My husband said there was only one stall in the mens.  Two sinks with soap dispensers that was only present at one just an hour into their seating.  There were only two seat covers left in my stall that had not been flushed prior to my using it fortunately it was only just stuffed with toilet paper.  There were expensive super soaker paper towels on the counter for wiping wet hands.  The restrooms were set off with an impermanent divider, so those sitting next to it did not feel as though they were.
author: Susan C.

description: Absolutely incredible. Best Steak I've ever had, and I have had a lot of good steak. Amazing service, our server was so nice and helpful! The sides were also really good, but large so be aware of that. Just amazing, can't wait to go again.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Fathers Day with the fam bam!

I didn't know steak could taste this good! From the bread to the dessert, this experience was perfection. My sister and I shared the mean where you get an appetizer, entree, side and dessert. So we shared the salad and roasted tomato and crab soup. I got the 12oz ribeye, then we shared the cream spinach and mashed potatoes and EVERYTHING was amazing. 

Waitor was on top of it and explained everything really well. I would definitely come back here...on a payday because its pretty expensive. Make reservations! I rarely give 5 stars to any place, but Ruth's Chris deserves it!
author: Marvin T.

description:
Pretty good! But Alexander's is more my style.

Ruth Chris is my 2nd favorite steakhouse in SF. They have a good traditional steak menu (while I like Alexander's variety) and love the hot plates! They really keep the steak nice and warm as you work through the meal. 

The ambience is a bit too dark and we got seated in a corner seat which felt really tight. Not the best dining experience. Overall a solid choice for traditional steak.
author: John C.

description:
We were invited to have dinner here over the holidays.  A 5:30 pm reservation for 4 got us to our table on time in the back room with several tables already occupied.  Service was prompt but wait person was hammy with flairs for selling.  Only wine was ordered, and decisions on what each one wanted were given promptly with seemingly helpful suggestion on how to change certain items in three prix fixed classic dinner order at a minimal extra cost of $3-4.  This was repeated a few times during the ordering process.  The 4th person in our party ordered surf and turf, and a la carte.  My partner & I didn't enjoyed the dinner at all.  It was our first time at this venue as well as it was for one of our hosts.  It was the second time for the other.  He decided to come here for the baked potato.  I shaded why we didn't go to HoPR, Morton, Harris, Issy's Osso or elsewhere.  I believe all of us have been to nearly all of the SF steak houses.  I have not gone here due to the not so favorable comments from family and friends who have patronized this place. 
I had the gumbo while my friends all ordered Caesar's Salad.  The gumbo was flavorful but you would think it was soup fit for seniors who forgot their dentures.  I admit that I am a senior but I do need some chewable bits of okra!  The others were enjoying their salad, that came with generous anchovies fillets on top.  Next came the steaks and the surf & turf when two of us had finished our first.  The third quickly finished his while the fourth being talkative expounding some Russian history and current event was just about half through his salad.  The waiter just had the BB cleared the table while trying to hint that the fourth gives his salad.  The wait person  should have suggested to him to set the unfinished salad to the side and have as a side, just as some Europeans do.  I even verbalized it but through the din the WP may be hard of hearing.  He just took it away when the diner was eating fast.
Here come the steaks and the surf and turf.  The steaks all look black, perhaps it is the lighting of the room, but not.  The steaks were served in very hot plates but we were warned.  Unfortunately due to his salad taken away so ceremoniously by the wait person, his being scorched by a hot plate didn't help.  He remained stoic!  His steaks and mine were still cooking when they were served, sizzling due to the solid sutter or beef lard added after the steaks were done with no grilled marks.  They were ebony steaks.  When we cut into them they were no longer medium rare.  Quality was below average and quite gristly!
Our dinners came with desserts, we didn't upgrade them.  While the a la carte Host didn't want any and wanted to share the dessert of his co-host, the waiter instead decided to bring him another one instead.  We two didn't know whether this extra dessert was complimentary.  We didn't have to pay, our hosts did.  We do appreciate their generous hospitality.  No thanks to the aggressiveness and the thoughtlessness of our wait person and the overcooked steaks made our experience a most unmemorable one during the holidays.  Our hosts left with a nearly whole uneaten steak and dessert doggie bag to bring whole.  And I did hear that our host who had the surf(lobster) was overdone and was okay with the fillet.  At least one host was marginally pleased. Happy New Year!!
author: John L.

description: WOW what a racist and prejudice place! if you're not white don't bother coming in here. i made reservations and when we get here to check in they look at us up and down. the girl had a table ready for us and here comes the manager telling us that we sctually have to wait. then asked us if we can wait OUTSIDE???? wth?????
author: Jenny P.

description:
Wife: Are you taking me to Ruth's Chris for our Anniversary?
Me: No!  Oh you fancy huh?

I heard about this place on the radio a few times and wondered if it lived up to it's name.  Could it really be the best steak?

I ordered the best of the best - (Ribeye - medium rare) with some red wine.
I have never had a juicier more flavorful steak in my life. There was more flavor in that steak than mustaches at a security convention.  Wow! Now I can die with no regrets. It tasted crispy on the outside and buttery on the inside.  I really believe this cow was part butter.

My wife ordered the Fillet Minion - Not as tasty as the Ribeye. (nuff said)

We also ordered the hash browns with the extras. (the cheese melted and it was difficult to spread onto the hash browns.  We could've done without the extras)

I checked out the bathroom and was also impressed.  Fancy and clean.  The paper towels for drying your hands are thick and probably expensive.  (stuffed some in my pockets.  I could only fit 2 or 3 though).  The only thing they were missing in there was a bathroom attendant, but I'm cool with that, cuz I always feel weird like they're watching me take paper towels.  Mint anyone?

The lighting was a nice candle lit feel.  The atmosphere was a nice and cozy.

The prices were really high.  I'm used to Red robin and IHOP, so... for 2 people our bill came out to $200.  Worth it!

The wife was impressed with the service and the atmosphere.  And my Ribeye Steak =P

Overall 5/5.  When you want the best, you'll have to pay for it, but you get your money's worth.
author: Philip J.

description:
Ok, this is an overdue review, but I still want to write one.

I came here with my boyfriend to celebrate our anniversary. He called in to make a reservation and mentioned that it was an anniversary dinner. I got dressed up for the occasion, but I'm glad I did because inside is very dimly light and sophisticated, and I didn't want to appear too casual. Although I don't think it's that bad to go in with jeans and a nice shirt.

Anyways, so the host brought us to our table and I was surprised to see rose petals scattered around the table. I thought my boyfriend was so romantic to do something this creative, but it turns out it was out of the courtesy of the restaurant (so minus one star off my boyfriend). The waiter started off by introducing himself and mentioned he was honored to celebrate the occasion with us and I thought that was really nice.

My boyfriend ordered the lamb chops and I had the petite filet with shrimp. Both of our dishes were wonderful. I don't like lamb chops, but my boyfriend finished every single bite of it. My filet was so tender and it just melts in my mouth and the shrimp were cooked perfectly where it has a bit of that gummy and crunchy texture. Our meals also came with sides, I got the mushrooms and I can't remember what my boyfriend got. Overall, the meal was awesome and we were stuffed.

While we were rubbing our bellies and ready to go, the waiter came out with the desserts with a candle in it. I forgot desserts were included in the meal! These people really do know how to add that extra gesture to make our celebration that much more special. So we slowly enjoyed our desserts and the bill came to around $150 something? My boyfriend paid so one star added back on, LOL. It definitely wasn't the type of restaurant we can enjoy every Friday night, but the staff were patient, friendly, and gave a little bit more effort to make us (the customers) to feel special. Along with the great food, I think that deserves the first 5 star review I ever gave up to this point.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Went there a few years back and it was pretty good....but this time ..not so good

Went there for a dinner with my bf, mom and dad. Wanted to treat them to something nice and good. Boy was I wrong. All four of us didn't like our steak. Something about the texture just wasn't good. It was very chewy. I was so sad to have disappointed my mom. =T I wanted her  to have a yummy steak.

It is on the pricey side. But I dont mind paying if its good..sadly..it wasn't.

I wish they would improve on the quality of their food. 

Service was pretty good.

Btw, I paid $350 for our meal, we left hungry and cooked a ramen at home. =(
author: Tammy F.

description:
Wow... I get the same thing every time and Its always flawless

Dirty Vodka Martinis from the time I walk in until I leave
Filet with Blue cheese crust + Lobster tail.
Side of thick cut fries.

Service is amazing as always... I continue to try and find reasons to celebrate and come back.
author: Scott G.

description:
Background: I made a reservation for my bf's bday dinner! it was a special dinner and they threw little "Happy Birthday" confetti all over the table for this occassion which I thought was cute.  I'd been here previously for Dine About Town and it really is more worth it to do the DAT prix fix menu. Anyhow, I digress..
Service: Immaculate. Superb. On point. that's pretty much to be expected with the prices they're charging.  
Food: while the meat was well cooked, the seafood was way too heavy handed on the salt. It was almost unbearably salty. The sides were generous but nothing special at all; basic stuff you could make a home for less than a fraction of the cost they were charging (which was about $10/plate). 
Oh! they were sweet in giving the Birthday Boy a free desert with a candle too! that was nice and a fine point, great way to end a bday dinner! also, the wine we had was quite good. they have a fine selection of wines. Lots of options.
Overall, a good experience but probably not worth the full price. I'd wait around for DAT to come here; super awesome DAT spot. I blew over $200 (and under $300) on an all-out dinner for two with wine and dessert. We felt like exploding at the end of the meal because we were that stuffed. Moderation, folks. That's the key and good luck being moderate here..all ya fancy cats!
author: Tu L.

description:
Torn between giving Ruth's Chris a 3 or a 4 star right now. I've been here about four times total now, and the first three times were just absolutely amazing. Good service, steaks, sides, everything was delicious, and service was great.

But...

I had dinner there with my boyfriend last night. It was his first time there, so I did want him to enjoy it since it was my suggestion. We decided to start with the sizzlin' blue crab cakes ($20). I ordered the Ruth's Classics prix fixe menu, in which I chose the Caesar Salad, 6 oz. filet mignon with 3 shrimps, sauteed mushrooms as my side, and dessert ($42.95). He ordered the Cowboy Ribeye.

The crab cakes were delicious, as usual. This is actually the only place that I've ever enjoyed crab cakes from, because they are actually chock full of lump crab meat! Most other places are like batter with a side of crab.

The caesar salad was quite good, probably better than most other places. Only tidbit was that it was overdressed.

Boyfriend's Cowboy Ribeye was cooked to a perfect medium-rare, as requested. However, it wasn't as tender as I've come accustomed to with ribeyes. It is possible that that is due to the bone, though. Not sure on that one. It was really juicy though =)

For my filet, it was definitely over-cooked. I requested medium-rare as well. I mean, c'mon, you DON'T order filet cooked anything above medium-rare. It definitely came out a solid medium, hardly any pink left in the center. I felt like such a wonderful cut of meat was being wasted =( The shrimps and sauteed mushrooms that came with, however, were delicious as always. Perfectly cooked.

For dessert we decided to have the Chocolate Explosion, essentially a molten lava cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top, and the Creme Brulee. Both desserts were delicious, I think I enjoyed dessert more than my steak haha.

Now, for the reason why this is only a 3-star, since the food sounds so great, right? It took forever for our food to come out, it felt like! I've never had this issue before. There was quite a while when we were eating our bread and butter, til when the crab cakes came out. At least refill our bread, if our appetizer is not ready yet? The pauses between each dish were just too long for the supposed standard of such a fine restaurant as Ruth's Chris. Also, the fact that my filet was overcooked left me a little bitter =/
author: Munnie T.

description: This place is the most amazing steakhouse in the world. I love the ribeye served on a 500 degree platter sizzling with garlic butter. Their corkage fee is only $15( it says $25 online) and the service has always been fantastic. The dinner duo soup or salad, one side, one entree and dessert all for $50! I got a salad, side of creamed spinach, ribeye and dessert all for $50! The steak alone is $45! Sides a la cart are $15. This place is great but I recommend making reservations. They get packed from 7-11pm.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
This is the 3rd Ruth's Chris I've been to in 3 years- 1st was in Troy, MI and by far the best experience, 2nd was in Boston, MA- food was good but the waiter 'forgot the bread' until after our food came- who forgets the bread? He seemed to be more focused on other tables than ours- and this location doesn't have booths- buzz kill.  

I realized that clearly, I had been spoiled by my 1st visit to Ruth's Chris in Troy. Our server and the others that worked with her were fantastic!  She was professional/friendly. A gentleman would come around a brush crumbs off our table on the regular, the water glasses were always full, and the food was sizzling hot.  Any and all requests were obliged- meaning,  I don't like stuff drenched in butter/oil, she listened and communicated it to the chef- therefore the food came out perfect.

Ok, enough about my favorite location, now onto my visit to San Francisco on Saturday 2/16/13.  My boyfriend and I had a 5pm reservation- we were seated promptly in a booth- which was requested- but that's about where it takes a turn as far as 'taking care of the customer'.  Our server  was m.i.a  for long periods of time.  He showed up on the scene to take our order and then seemed to leave the rest up to the nice guy who brought our bread and refilled my water.  This guy was the one clearing the table and such- while the server was chatting at the bar with other employees.  

My boyfriend and I ordered from the Ruth's Classics wherein you get a salad, entree, side, and dessert.  I told the server that I don't like a salad that is drenched in dressing and he assured me that the apple, walnut, and blue cheese salad wasn't and that he would ask them to go 'light' on the dressing. I asked for it on the side but he said that it would be fine.  Ummm, hello- not sure what his idea of light dressing is but that wasn't the case. It was grossly over dressed- so oily that the plate was soaked- that's gross and not to mention- unhealthy.  The server was m.i.a so I flagged down the nice guy mentioned above and told him I couldn't eat it- he took care of it and brought me exactly what I wanted.  The salmon with steamed spinach and green beans were good although once again, the green beans were swimming in oil- I was very clear that I don't like butter or oil but once again it was as if the server couldn't be bothered with my preferences/request.  I'm paying a lot of $$$$ for this and I should get it how I want it.  Troy, MI and Boston, MA (for the most part) got it right.  Won't return to this location- perhaps Sacramento will be better.
author: Kristi O.

description: This was my first time at Ruth Chris and the food was amazing, especially the Caesar salad, the service was good, I had a blast for my friend birthday I will definitely come back.
author: Epiphany R.

description: Came here last night for a nice dinner and it turned into a disaster. The service was bad, the employees have an attitude, took forever to get food, my steak was over cooked and my lobster was chewy. I'd rather take my money to a different steak house like Alexander's.
author: Bianca R.

description: My boyfriend treated me to Ruth's Chris for my birthday weekend. It was Saturday night we had a 9:00 reservation. Parking is a mess over there please do yourself a favor and pay for the valet parking!!!! Lol $10. I loved the ambiance of the restraint the lighting was dim and it was very romantic.When we arrived to our table it was decorated with happy birthday confetti which was a nice touch! Who takes a vegetarian to a steakhouse lol apparently my bf. I had to try the steak though I ordered the New York strip and it arrived to my sizzling and I must say it was delicious!!! My boyfriend ordered the lobster Mac n cheese and that was awesome! I also enjoyed the mash potatoes. The service was also great! Overall a really good experience.
author: Nitajo A.

description: Came here for Dine About Town (on the first day it started, so there were quite a lot of people dining in ordering from that menu).. there were a few items to choose from, but I wanted to have steak, so I ended up getting the 8 oz. petite fillet (medium) and it comes with a salad with vinaigrette and your choice of mashed potatoes or creamed spinach, and I got the mashed potatoes. Service was friendly and efficient..  the restaurant itself has that darker side to it... makes me sleepy, especially after I eat and I am all full. The steak itself comes out on a hot hot plate and the butter sizzles and goes up to your nose and you smell that buttery goodness.. I couldn't wait for it to cool down and also didn't really want it to cook anymore cause it was cooked perfectly. So let me tell you about steak cooked in butter!! It is DELICIOUS! Nicely seasoned and cooked to perfection.. very tender too. The mashed potatoes were good too.. and the salad was mehhh.... OH, and it also comes with dessert... and sadly it was chef's choice and it was a raspberry cupcake with butter cream and it was just okay.... tasted like a Safeway cupcake.... totally could have been something better... but then again didn't really expect much for the dine about town thing.. The whole experience was good to have, and the steak was good, but I think it's kind of one of those places just to try and be able to Yelp about it..
author: Tiff C.

description:
I had dinner here this past Saturday for a friend's birthday. I'm not a steak eater, so I was concerned that there wouldn't be many options for me (and I'd be forced to overdose on bread). But I need not have worried, there are a sufficient number of options for the non beef eaters. 

I ordered the bbq shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes. There was some sauce that turned what could have been a simple dish of grilled shrimp and mashed potatoes into something quite exquisite. I also ordered the sweet potato casserole. It was more like a desert than a side. We ordered the hash brown casserole for the table, but my fork didn't deviate from the sweet potato casserole to my mouth, so I didn't taste it. The sweet potato was like sweet morsels of heaven on my fork, why would I stray away??!!! Everyone said the hash brown thing was good, though.

The service was great, and our waiter was attentive. She didn't hover over us, but she always seemed to be around when we needed her. It was perfect!
author: Rae A.

description:
Went here for Dine About Town over the weekend, and the majority of the demographic are senior citizens. Targeting an elderly group, those who have worked many years, are retired, and can afford Ruth Chris come and dine here. So tell me why is the lighting so dim!?!?! I'm not even near that demo yet, and I could hardly read the menu, 

After a few minutes reading our menu (squinting, and no, it's not because I'm Asian), I ordered the cold soup with crab meat, the steak with shrimp and a side of creamed spinach, and for dessert, the strawberry shortcake. 

The soup was okay, it was very tomato based, nothing too special. I really did enjoy the steak, so simply dressed with just salt and pepper and cooked to the perfect tenderness and juiciness. Hands down, being a steakhouse, they mastered that dish. I also really liked the cream of spinach, I wish the portion was larger though! Dessert was actually quite a disappointment, it was dried, crumbly, felt like I was eating a store bought pastry. 

Definitely glad I came for Dine about town to utilize the pre fixe dinner deal, and highly recommend everyone to at least try their steak.
author: Minette C.

description:
I wish I could afford to eat here more often but it really is a top notch and top price place. Good thing there is Dine About TOwn so people like me can afford to eat a meal like this from time to time. 

Three of us dined here and we chose filet, filet, and grilled salmon. The three course meal at Dine About Town is $36.95 and we had an add-on of shrimp for $14. The meal starts with a nice salad but not up to par with the rest of the food in the place. I would have docked the rating a star for this salad, but it really wasn't an important part of hte meal. The filets and the salmon were cooked perfectly and came with mashed potatoes or creamed spinach. We tried both and they were both great. The ending of the meal was the real star-dropper here as they served a dry cupcake that was kind of chocolatey and had almost a garnish. Definitely not the perfect ending.

During the meal, we had 2 glasses of wine each (two adults had wine, teenager had roy rogers). The wine was overpriced at $16-$24 per glass, but hey, it's the big city and we knew even with Dine about Town that we were going to throw some money on the  table.

Total bill with wine was $250 including tip.
author: Dave K.

description: The food here was amazing! I took my boyfriend for his bday and he loves steak (rib eye)! I would definitely come back again. The only downsides would be the lack of parking and the price of the food. Other than that, the quality was wonderful.
author: Natalie K.

description: We had a great dinner here. Colin was our server and did an excellent job throughout the whole service. Everything came out on time and was delicious. The desserts were great as was the dinner. We had an excellent time and would gladly come here again. Great food and service! Give it a try next time you're in SF.
author: Harris E.

description:
Thought it would be a good place to go celebrate a friends birthday. 
1.  They canceled our reservation. Finally got us a table after 45 minutes of waiting. 
2. Took about 30 minutes to get our dinner on the table. 
3. Ordered mine medium well and got it well medium. Sent it back once and it came back well done. Sent it back again and got a new steak that was crispy on the outside and medium on the inside. 

Such a waste of a steakhouse. Why would I go back again and spend $45 dollars on a steak only to send it back and get a crunchy one instead. They might be good in other locations but the one in SF is super touristy which is prob why they don't care about customer service. All of my friends finished their dinner while I ate my side of garlic mashed potatoes while waiting for my steak. Only plus was the garlic mashed potatoes and tortilla soup was great. Other than that, a very overpriced, terribly serviced restaurant. Not going back.
author: Rach K.

description: The wife and I were up in Sonoma when we decided steak was on the menu for dinner. I specifically chose Ruth's Chris because we've been to other locations but never the one in SF. The steak was fantastic (as expected) and I love the 500 degree plates they're served on! So tender and delicious. The steak was accompanied by the classic duo of mashed potatoes and asparagus, both wonderful additions. Molly was very attentive but not intrusive, and the whole meal was exactly what we'd hoped it would be. Save some room for key lime pie!
author: Jeff S.

description: Omg. The best steak of my life! I got the 16oz ribeye made medium which is served on a 500 degree plate, really delicious with a side of horseradish. I also got their chopped salad, it was impeccable! Soooooo good! I also got their sidecar, I usually don't like sweet drinks but this one was just right. Yeah, it's expensive, but I think it's perfect to go with someone you love.
author: Jason S.

description:
I don't or probably have'nt given out a 5star review yet but this one is definitely legit. But I do have to confess that my visit at this establishment was fully paid by my close friend who I had not seen in years and he's rich. He invited me and a few girl friends of mine for a nice dinner out in SF. We limo'd in and first ended up at HOPR and was really dettered to the fact that they made us wait over an hour over at the bar. That was ridiculous and decided not to get drunk over there and not eat. My friend said lets go and walk over a block up across the street to Ruth Chris and he'll get us seated there, no problem. And that he did! We were seated as soon as we hit the front door and was eagerly greeted with a friendly staff that catered to our party no problem. We has drinks table-side while we did'nt have to wait long for our appetizers to come at the table. salads and what-nots were excellent! Then came our special entree's. My friend ordered "off the menu", he said he had done it before. Yes, it was a tad pricey to get what he wanted but man that was awesome food! Each one of us got a nice steak (any cut we wanted) and lobster tails all around the table. Served with all the sides that we wanted. OMG! As much food as it was we all even ate dessert and that was awesome! 
The bill was probably was upwards of a thousand dollars plus a nice hefty tip (he showed me)
If I ever come back here I'd definitely put out all the stops too if I was paying.
Ruth Chris is insanely awesome and I look forward to having a meal over in Anaheim one of these days, soon, at Disneyland.
author: Eric N.

description: A wonderful dining experience as always with Ruth's Chris. The lobster mac and cheese was particularly good. Very fresh lobster and just a hint of green chili in the dish. Steak was cooked to perfection but was perhaps a bit too strong in the pepper.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
I came here during Dine About Town to try famous Ruth's. The restaurant is set up with several dining rooms with an atmosphere like an old Italian joint where old mob Dons would go do business over steaks. Lots of men in suits and women in pearls.

Our meal was 3 courses, each one delicious. Even their complimentary bread and butter (whipped butter!) was good. You know you're going to eat well when even the free bread is good. Our steaks came sizzling hot. Seriously, don't touch it. Or eat it right away, you'll burn your mouth. They came floating in hot, heavenly, browned butter. Everything was cooked and season PERFECTLY. I cannot stress about how often I don't usually order steaks because I know they won't get it right. Well, you can trust Ruth's to get everyone's steak order right.

Accompanied with the steaks was creamed spinach. Nothing special, although it was pretty good. For dessert we had chocolate cupcakes, which I thought was kind of boring, but this was a prix fixed meal. Overall service was really great. The waitress was very friendly and informative for our first time being there. The wait staff never left us with an empty glass of water, bread, or (more) whipped butter than we could handle.
author: Michelle N.

description:
I went here for my 2 year anniversary with my boyfriend. They were pretty prompt on seating us according to our reservations. Our server was great and the staff was friendly.

We got the Ruth's Chris chopped salad. It was delicious, but I wouldn't recommend getting this if you're not a fan of blue cheese. I looooooove blue chesse so it was a plus for me. 

I got the filet mignon and it was cooked perfectly.  The filet was very flavorful; I suggest you get this cut if you want flavor =] My boyfriend got the ribeye cooked to his desire. It had less flavor but it was more juicy. 

For sides, we got the broccoli au gratin and mashed potatoes. The broccoli au gratin is basically broccoli with sharp cheddar on top. The broccoli wasn't over cooked, it was actually al dente. It went well with the cheese. The mashed potatoes was a little on the safe side. It was just mashed potatoes....nothing really special about it. I mixed the broccoli au gratin with the mashed potatoes....give it a shot =}

I would've made room for dessert this trip, but I was stuffed by the end of my steak.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Came here with my BF for the first time ever and loved it.. I loved the food, the atmosphere, as well as the the staff. We had a waitress named Chelsea, she was very nice, attentive, and helpful. (Even when I was being one of those super annoying customers and my boyfriend was being kind of rude..) it's hard to find service like that especially if SF. Great dinner, great night!
author: Madison K.

description: I came here for my birthday two years ago? Long overdue review! I believe I made a reservation to try this place out because it was SF Restaurant Week. Coming here, I thought they would have some good prix fixed menu items. When we were seated the server explained that it was actually a better deal to order off the menu. I had the steak medium well and we had the spinach and mashed potatoes as our sides. I honestly thought the presentation of the steak was rather ugly. It seemed like it was just cooked and slathered on to a small white plate. I was not impressed since I was in a fancy dining atmosphere. Maybe that is why we haven't been back since.
author: Alice Z.

description:
LA has a reputation of the city of Valet Parking. Still, I was not shocked to see that SF has it too. I mean, these cities are only 400 miles away from each other which when you look at it, is far in the 1820's but now they're next door neighbors. I still have yet to answer the question whether LA steak is better than SF steak but for now, I will describe my fantastic dinner at Ruth's Chris. 

We were escorted to our seats which was a booth. Most of the time, I like booths but I can sit on anything (except for sizzling 500 degree plates.) The people who made these booths though forgot that people can be taller than 5 ft. We had to switch and although it took a few minutes, the waitress was extremely polite about it and always smiled. There are almost no tables in this restaurant except for big groups of people. All smaller groups sit in booths. Hopefully those smaller groups have smaller legs too or there will be a 12 hour long line for a table. 

As you can imagine, I was not too pleased with Ruth's Chris so far. Then they served the bread which was freshly cooked (like everything here.) It was not milque toast, it was tropical fruit drink toast. I had a few pieces. The appetizer was definitely stopped me from giving Ruth's Chris one star. I ordered the barbecued shrimp and it blew my mind. The sauce and the shrimp blended together to create this wonderful dish. 

Then along came my medium ribeye steak. I have tasted better steak before but this was still really good. It was definitely cooked correctly, no problems with being too rare or too well. Some people though will not eat it unless cooked perfectly. Fortunately at Ruth's Chris, you can ask the waiter or waitress to put your steak back in four times until it is cooked correctly and the waiter or waitress will not grumble or even frown. I personally believe you get what you get but some people have to have steak a certain way. 

Also, I had some lyonaise potatoes with my steak and I at first worried they had no flavor. As always though, onions make everything taste better (and made me cry of joy here,) because they definitely made the potatoes have more texture. Also, our fantastic waitress gave us spinach au grotto on the house which is spinach with cheese. Now everyone knows that spinach has the stereotype of tasting badly. This is Ruth's Chris however so the spinach and the cheese definitely went well together although I preferred having the more cheesier parts. 

For dessert, we had cheesecake. I'll admit I am a cheesecake stickler because we make cheesecake at home all the time but I liked the cheesecake at Ruth's Chris. It was not lemony at all (if it were, the cheesecake would immediately fall below three stars,) but it did have almonds on the sides and I am not a fan of putting nuts along a cheesecake. 

Overall. Ruth's Chris had good steak, good potatoes, good spinach au grotto, barbecued shrimp TO DIE FOR but I would recommend that they either make bigger booths or have more table options. The booth is what prevented this from becoming a five star review.
author: Alec W.

description:
Dinner conversation:

Lily R: Geez, I've been eating way to much red meat lately. NO more after this. I'm going Veggie delite for a few months after this meal. 

Petite Filet Mignon steak arrives, perfectly medium rare. 

Lily R: F*** this. Scratch the veggie idea, I can't live with out red meat! 

Yes, folks...a steak that good will make you change your plans. Only thing is, I wasn't jumping for joy over the rib eye. It was good, not delicious like the filet. 

Why 4 stars? The DAT menu isn't really worth it. They do have a new set up which allows you to make your meal like DAT. I ended up paying the same price after a bottle of wine and ordering creme brule. 

Our server Daria was very good. She boxed up our DAT cake with berries which was the perfect late night munchie dessert.
author: Lily M.

description: What can I say?  It's Ruth's Chris!!!  Best filet mignon, baked potato, and lettuce wedge out there!!  Ambience is great, servers are nice, and the wait times are actually decent.  I never can wait until the next time I go.
author: Raj L.

description: Ruth Chris is hands down one of my favorite steak houses.  This location is just sub par.  The steaks came out under cooked and overall the service just wasn't to the Ruth Chris standard that I'm used to.  Go the the Walnut Creek location as they are amazing (no I don't work there)
author: Denise C.

description: Made a reservation for my love's birthday!  Very good food and great portions. We were full yet not overstuffed! The steaks were great!  LOVED the shrimp and the butter sauce it was in. The only con I would say is where we were seated. It was an older crowd and they were extremely loud/noisy. It kind of made us want to leave sooner. But overall, we had a great experience at Ruths Chris. My boyfriend had a great birthday dinner and that's what mattered! We will definitely be going back soon. Great place to have a romantic dinner outing once in a while!
author: Fee K.

description:
My absolute favorite steak place and the one that I compare all others to.  It's on the pricier side so I can't afford to go there every week, but I would if I could!  The steaks are always cooked perfectly and come out sizzling hot.  The sweet potato casserole is to die for.  Plan on spending a good bit of time and money, but leaving very happy.

Reservations recommended.  Parking in SF sucks so plan ahead to allow for a little time although they're always accommodating if you're running late.
author: Myke O.

description:
Come on we all know your steaks are unmatched. Buttered up melt in your mouth glory that it'd make the likes of Julia Child and/or Paula Deen do the Nutty Professor's 'Hercules Clap' in excitement (like me, inside)

So I ask; Why the small dinky plates in comparison to your grandeur house salad and/or special occasion dessert plates?? IMHO, a little would go a long way in presenting your fabulous steaks on a bigger (more presentable even) plates.. most especially with your steak and lobster entree, which we ordered. It just looked uninspired and very crowded in the small plate it arrived in.... 

Also, would have loved to be seated in a booth considering we only had a party of 2 celebrating our anniversary instead of in the middle of a near empty dining area on a table of 4.. guess its something I'll have to request if we do come back. 

We had:
- Calamari
- Steak & Lobster
- Petite Filet
- Mushrooms
- Creamed Spinach

Could have done without the latter two of the dinner, nothing worth remembering about these particular sides. The Calamari however was an impressive take, hints of sweet with a little spice, and light/crispy all around. 

In conclusion dinner was satisfying, service was impeccable, our server Christy was very accomodating. We were lucky enough to find FREE (after 6pm) metered parking right in front. My only two gripes would probably be that the house salad was not fresh and for the price we're paying -- presentation of your star dish (steaks) could be better.
author: Av A.

description: One of my favorite steak houses in the city. My favorite cut of steak is a rib eye. They cook it perfect every single time. Always Tender, juicy topped with melted butter and seasoned just right! The side dishes are just as addicting, creamy mash potatoes, shoe string fries, sweet potato casserole just to name a few, are things I always get when im there. Ruth's has a great atmosphere. Service is always courteous and professional and makes it that much better of a steakhouse when u combine great food and great service.
author: Roger P.

description:
I recently had the pleasure of dining here for the first time and I had an awesome experience. Jessica was our server, and she was fantastic! She was funny and very helpful throughout our meal. The crab stuffed mushrooms were great, but my favorite appetizer was the spicy lobster, lightly fried. The outside is slightly crunchy and the sauce was only mildly spicy, not overpowering to the scrumptious, delicate lobster. Now for the entrees,  I'm not a steak person **GASP** I know, I know. But I tried a bite of hubby's filet mignon and it was delicious, it really does melt in your mouth! I had the sea bass and added a lobster tail which was also delish. I was actually glad I couldn't finish it all, so that I can enjoy it again later for a late night snack :) 
We were too full to make it to dessert, but next time, I'll stay away from that pesky but delicious bread, and hopefully have enough room to have dessert. Thanks once again Jessica for making our experience here an amazing one, I'm sure we will be back soon.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
This was seriously the best meal I've ever had!

We were two people, and went there only because they had creme brulee on the menu. We started with some kind of shrimp cocktail, which was nothing special. 

But the main course! Oh. My. God. We got the New york steak and the lobster&filet mignon. It was incredible how good the lobster tasted with the butter on the side, and the filet mignon was also amazing. Same with the steak. 

The main reason why we went there; the creme brulee, barely went down after eating and eating of that delicious meat. But it was really good too :)
author: Diana G.

description:
Amazing steak that's done spot on.  My bf and I both asked for Medium Rare, and that's how it came out.  He got the Rib Eye while I got the Petit Filet and we both thought they were perfect.  He said he would get Petit Filet next time though, since it was so good :)

Minus one star for our disappointing sides and appetizer.  We got the Hash Browns which were highly recommended by the server and Asparagus w/ Hollandaise which is favorited on the menu.  The hash browns were burnt on the outside and soft on the inside.  Like an oversized croquet, but really burnt.  The asparagus were limp and over-steamed, and there was a side of hollandaise.  It is exactly as it sounds like...12 or so steamed spears of asparagus for $10. I really could have done that at home.

The biggest disappointment was the Spicy Lobster. I love lobster and proooobably should have known better than to order it as an appetizer, but somehow I expected more from Ruth's Chris.  I take a bite out of it, and it tastes just like Walnut Shrimp that you get from Chinese restaurants.  Lightly fried, slightly sweet.  Not shrimpy, not lobster-y either. On any other occasion it would be decent, but at Ruth Chris for $17....not so much.

Ruth's Chris serves excellent steak, no doubt about it.  Not so sure about the other things on the menu. My ideal plan is to eat the appetizers at Harris across the street and have my steak at Ruth Chris.
author: Erica D.

description: Everything was delicious! Came here as a pre starwars viewing celebration haha. The lobster tail was perfectly seasoned. The t-bone was so tender and delicious! Rib eye was a tad tough though. Their brussel sprouts were delicious as well - cooked with bacon yums! The mushroom sauce complimented the meat well. I was in such a good food coma. The steak's portion size was huge!
author: Kim P.

description:
My fiancé and I went here one Friday night just to try this place out. I'm so glad he made a reservation because there was a long wait if he would not have made it. We were seated right away and got offered some water. Our server was Lena Joy who was very sweet. We ordered the rib eye steak and sides of Potatoes au Gratin and Fresh Asparagus with Hollandaise. The steak was served on a sizzling hot plate and cooked just the way I liked (medium well), the potatoes were cooked to perfection and the asparagus was perfect with hollandaise sauce. 

Lena Joy checked on us numerous times and asked if we needed anything else. Also their manager that night checked on us if we were enjoying our dinner. I thought that was nice. 

The atmosphere was cute and comfy. The only thing I didn't like is how close you sit to other people. The couple who were sitting next to couldn't stop staring at our meal since we got served first. Kinda awkward lol other than that, the food and customer service was excellent.
author: Reichelle C.

description:
We came here on a Saturday evening, 11/21, with an 8:00 reservation for a party of 8.  Several from our party arrived a bit early and had checked in with the host and was told that our table was not ready and that everyone from our party has not arrived yet so it will be approximately 10-12 minutes.  Fair enough.  By 8:05 PM everyone has arrived and the host was informed that our party is all present and was again informed 10-12 minutes.  We go to the bar and had several drinks and approximately 25 minutes has lapsed.  The person whose name the reservation was under, inquired again regarding the progress of our table and was told that they knew we were there and it will be ready shortly.  Long story short, we were not seated until over an hour after our party had arrived!  Then what good is a reservation?!  Furthermore, what kind of reply is the host's response of 'we know you're here' to a patron?

Finally we were seated well past 9:00.  We order and our food comes.  The steaks were cooked well and were very good.  The side of brussels sprouts were excellent but the creamed spinach and mashed potatoes were subpar.  The creamed spinach were bland and lacked seasoning.  The mashed potatoes were dense and bland.  Normally, it would not have been that big of a deal since the meat would have made up for it.  At Ruth's Chris the meat does not come with any sides so they are ordered separately at $10 per side dish.  At the price for the sides, I expect a spectacular dish cooked to perfection which in Ruth's Chris' case, it was not.  It may be possible that the sides were frozen and reheated, acceptable if included with the meal, but at $10 per item, no thanks.

The service from our server was good enough.  He forgot to enter an order for the scalloped potatoes and he made sure we were not charged for it.  If the spinach and mashed potatoes were any indication, perhaps he did us a favor.

In short, at the price range Ruth's Chris charges, the dining experience should have been exceptional.  Instead it left something to be desired after.  I don't mind paying for quality going by the old saying, 'you get what you pay for', but in this case one couldn't help feeling a little bit taken advantage of.
author: Jay C.

description:
A classic American steakhouse. I ordered the New York, medium, with creamed spinach. The steak was cooked perfectly medium- warm pink, on a ridiculously hot plate of sizzling butter. I think the butter (which I think is a trademark of the chain) is a bit excessive, but steak itself is excessive, and it's the holidays, so what the heck!

Our group of four also ordered a bottle of red. Aaah- carnivore heaven. Not the most innovative or ultra-top quality steakhouse around (that award goes to Alexander's), but a good, solid choice.
author: Terry N.

description:
Mixed feelings about this place. Got the Porterhouse for two, and absolutely loved it. The mashed potatoes were amazing as well, and the bread was killer. However, when we arrived we were told it would be about a fifteen minute wait. An hour later, we were finally seated, and while I understand that it's not easy to predict times, being 45 minutes off makes me think it was deliberately lowballed. Though service was prompt to begin with, our server Edward was somewhat awkward, and towards the end of the service stopped coming to our table altogether. Waited a ridiculously long time to get the dessert menu, then the check, then for him to pick up the check.

Call ahead to see if they're running behind.

Would recommend in hopes that whoever I recommended it to gets a different server.
author: Atli T.

description:
My favorite chain steak house!  Plus, we live above the restaurant ;)

Always love their steaks, their pre-fixed menu, bread, drinks, and butter on the steaks!!  Yep, they are not Harris' but this is a place that will satisfy your craving for some nice juicy steak without breaking your bank.  Service is mainly good.  This place can get crowded though.  

Just one complaint, we park our car in the building garage, and sometimes Ruth's Chris' valet parkers are just plain dangerous!  They always seem to be in a hurry and speed in the garage.  They should be told to be careful, one day they can hit somebody.
author: Meiko S.

description:
what is going on with service nowadays?  don't people understand that there are thousands of people out there who would love your job and do it so much better?  sigh.  i hate docking restaurants because of service...but lately, it has been an awful trend...and i expect more especially from restaurants such as ruth's chris.  

our server was pretty frustrating...he was all talk in the beginning and then he just disappeared.  he was super lucky to have people bussing for him and bringing out his food.  on that note, i don't know why he couldn't have been more attentive to his tables.  we asked him for some bread...and we got NO bread.  he didn't really engage himself into our dinner...it was just hit or miss.  all he focused on were the sales and not the actual customer service aspect of the meal.  these restaurants thrive on above average customer service...and frankly, i get better service at ihop.  

anyhoo, we all decided to order off the prix fix menu...2 of us started off with the crab and corn chowder while the other 2 got the steak house salad.  the crab and corn chowder was tasty...a good crab to corn ratio...the salad was kinda plain and looked like it had been thrown onto a plate.  i've had better blue cheese dressing although the menu states that they make all of their dressings at the restaurant. 

for our entrees, we all ordered either the ribeye or the filet.  we got a whole lesson in the beginning when our server was promising...they season their steaks with salt and pepper and throw them into a super 1000+ degree broiler...afterwards, the put your steak onto a sizzling hot 500 degree plate, throw on some butter...and the plate gets served to your table.  i accidentally brushed my hand against the plate and it was super HOT.  i have to say that the steak is AMAZING!!!  perfectly cooked...huge portioning size...and the flavor was super pure...probably one of the best steaks i have ever had.

and then the downfall...their sides were just meh.  we all shared garlic mashed potatoes(which weren't very garlicky at all), creamed spinach(nothing special), and some mixed squash dish.  nothing memorable.

the dessert was just ok...we had a caramel flan with fresh fruit.  the fruit was super sweet and so much better than the flan.  the flan's consistency was off...it was more like a chewy jello than a flan.  not so impressed at all.  

the coffee was really burnt...to the point where it just wasn't drinkable.  there's a difference between strong and burnt...and this was definitely burnt.  

i had high hopes for this place...an improvement of the service would've definitely brought this restaurant up to 4 stars...but it was unfortunately disappointing.  the happy birthday confetti on the table was cute though!
author: Jen W.

description:
The only pitfall to this place is the price.  Keep in mind that your $48.00 steak is only that - a steak on a plate. Every side, every salad, is an additional charge.  My fiance and I went here for our anniversary, and for a two person dinner this is what our bill looked like, not including tip or valet services:  

$236.00 for a two person dinner.
This included:
1 appetizer
2 cocktails 
2 salads
2 steaks (one petite, the least expensive)
2 glasses of wine (with dinner)
1 side of sauteed mushrooms
1 baked potato 
2 coffees

And they comped us dessert. Which was great and we appreciated. 
Service was great.  The meal was above average.  Just be aware that if you are interested in having a basic dinner like the two of us did, including tip you're going to spend about $250.00 at least.  Valet is another $10 (again, without tip).

Also, they knew it was our anniversary date, yet seated us next to a very loud and raucous party of 8.  The place is big enough to group couples together for a romantic dinner, and house the larger louder parties in a designated area.

Anyway, we had a great time enjoying each others company on our date.  Just be aware of the $$$ you are spending for the meal you are enjoying at this place!
author: Marielle Z.

description:
I took my boyfriend out to celebrate his birthday at Ruth's Chris. This was my first time ever at this steak house and my boyfriend had been to another one of their locations.

Even though I made an reservation through OpenTable for 8:00 p.m. on a Saturday night, we still had to wait about 30 mins. until our table was ready (MINUS 1 star). The bar area is a little cramped so it made waiting for our table a little annoying, not to mention we were starving!

Once we were seated, our server mentioned the chef specials offered that night but the boyfriend and I decided to both have the Ruth's Classic dinner ($40-49) which comes with a starter salad, an entree with a side, and dessert.

We ordered:
-Steak House salad: just a basic, mixed salad; I chose creamy vinaigrette dressing. The salad was crisp and fresh.
-Caesar salad: standard caesar salad and the boyfriend said it was fresh.
-Filet: I'm not sure what size filet I ordered, since it didn't specify, but it had to be either an 8 or 10 oz. filet. It was so juicy and had tons of flavor! I had it prepared medium-rare and it was absolutely perfect.
-Lobster tail and filet: the boyfriend said the lobster tail was amazing and was really juicy! He prefers it without the cheese on top but said that it was still great. He really enjoyed the filet too!
-Creamed spinach: I really liked the creamed spinach but the boyfriend didn't care for it very much. It definitely was creamy, maybe a little too much, but I thought it was good.
-Garlic Mashed potatoes: SO GOOD! The garlic flavor  was really subtle and the potatoes were buttery. Definitely the best side out of the two!

For dessert we had the chocolate symphony that came with the Ruth's Classic dinner but our server talked us into getting the New Orleans style bread pudding. I didn't really care for the chocolate symphony, which was a chocolate cake with fresh fruit, but I LOVED the bread pudding! The whiskey sauce was not overly sweet and you could taste hints of whiskey. The bread pudding was sweet and had tons of flavor. 

Ruth's Chris definitely lived up to my expectations food-wise, everything was delicious, but the service could have been better. Overall, I would definitely come back; although it's pricey, it is totally worth it!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
My friends told me the steaks here are really good, so I decided to give it a try. 

I realized that I should not have told them it was my first time... because my waiter started this long story about where the steak came from, and how it is made, and why it is soooo much better.... I wasn't really interested at all... i just wanted to look at my menu and order my food.

I got a medium rare filet mignon. The inside was really tender... but the outside was a bit hard.... and chewy.... it tasted really yummy in the beginning... but after half of it was gone i was getting tired of the outside chewy part and it was just whatever... I should have just ordered the petite one.

we also order the potatoe with the cheese on top and that was really good. but i think the creamed spinach was just alright....

the chocolate explosion was really good though.
author: Alicia W.

description:
This review is for the food alone.
Steakhouses, for the most part, are all the same. You order a slab of meat and some sides containing very creamy potatoes, spinach, etc. Ruth's Chris does this, but they do it pretty well. I usually don't eat meat, but I enjoyed mine here.
