On the other hand, the service is SLOW and they take an unnecessarily long time to serve you (even if you have a reservation). So if you're willing to put up with that & blasting A/C, you'll like this.
author: Veronica L.

description: Love this place so much, it never fails to satisfy! Fav is the Porterhouse for two w/ my regular side of Calamari and Potato Au Gratin
author: Sarah C.

description: I went there with some girlfriends. It was my first time. The waitress was really sweet. The food was really good. Do not overlook the chefs deal on the left side of the menu. Especially if it's your first time. It's just a really good deal because for x amount of money you can have a little bit of everything. A starter. Soup or salad. Entre. And a decedent dessert. It's kinda odd actually... Because if you opt for ordering a la carte, it cost so much more. But believe it or not there were plenty of people ordering a la cart. Portions are pretty generous and all the steaks are lathered in butter!!! Please do not skip the butter. Why would you! Sides are big enough to share family style. You can dress casual or you can totally dress up...either way no will look at you funny.
author: vannet c.

description:
Ruth's Chris Steak House is a big chain in every major city you can think of (but, not in the McDonald's sense), managing to keep food quality, service and ambiance to a very high level, just like the temperature of their ovens and plates. 

Plan to spend $ 75.00 - $ 100.00 a person if each orders an entree, side, maybe a salad and a drink, and more $ with wine.  They do have a "seasonal menu" selection for $ 40, which is very reasonable for the quality (I am usually out of season, so this option does not work for me), and they participate in the "dine about town" food frenzy" (since I am not into frenzy's, I don't know what they provide for this option). I don't do DAT.

Personal favorites: 

Rib-eye (medium rare) - perfection on a plate, prepared to a true medium rare.....tasty & tender. The Filet is my 2nd favorite, tender tender tender.

1lb baked potatoe (don't want to know what chemicals are used to get that tater to 1lb), while never ever finish it... it is something to behold. 

Creamed spinach (not trying to be Popeye the sailor man) but this is a really tasty rendition of spinach which eliminates some of the guilt of having a "creamed" vegetable. (I can argue that pop corn is a vegetable) 

The valet parking is a blessing (while not religious it is still great), although not necessary if you ride your bike to the "dine about town" thing. Now I wonder, would they valet park someones bike?
author: Matsuo U.

description: Everything about this place is 5 stars. The service was excellent.  The steaks were delicious. We are definitely coming back.
author: Brenda M.

description: Great time here. I had a waiter by the name of Jack and he was excellent! The food was great, and you could the steak with a butter knife!
author: Kristi F.

description:
If I visit this place my favorite will always be Lamb chops and New York Strip, and boyfriend favorite were Filet Mignon, creamy spinach Au gratin, Yeah he never try anything else I guess. Surprised one time order oyster, I think they didn't have it but yeahhhh they have, that made me so happy.
Wish I live a couple block away from this place then I can have yummy meal more often. The price range you choose what is fit your wallet !!!
author: The Bischof B.

description: Great  place, awesome food, best service. However the valets sucks, drives your car like a drunkard and hackles you for money and tips. Fire them...!
author: Timothy T.

description:
Loved their rib eye and petite filet served on their Sizzling Hot Plate... melts in your mouth! 

side dishes are big enough for 2-3 so share.
author: Arlynn A.

description:
I came here for dinner because my boyfriend loves this place. We didn't know where to go for dinner and were just driving around and he suggested we come here to try the amazing steak served on a sizzling plate! I checked OpenTable and easily got a reservation. We found parking at a meter (it was after 6 so it was free) and when we entered the restaurant, we realized Dine About Town is going on and Ruth's Chris was having a $36 special! SCORE! Their normal set menus are a good deal too for $42-50-something dollars, but this was even better. It came with a salad, a choice of petit filet, grilled chicken, or shrimp, a choice of mashed potatoes or creamed spinach, and a small chocolate cake dessert. 

Everything was delicious. Is everything smothered in butter? YES. Is this a dinner you will regret? NO. The steaks are perfectly seared, the potatoes were everything that they should be, but better and the chocolate cake was super chocolatey and made me wish every place that had chocolate cake was as good as Ruth's Chris. We also ordered an additional dessert of the Banana Cream Pie, which has beautifully done banana coins with a caramelized sugar crust. The crowd here was more of a touristy kind who wanted to go to some place nice while on their trip, but this was definitely reliably good and I could see myself returning when I want an amazing steak and great, friendly service.
author: Victoria J.

description:
There are so many pluses and minuses at this place. I would give 5 plus stars for our waiter. He was great! Very helpful, super attentive, and knowledgable. He picked a great glass of Pinor Noir for me and he made the experience fabulous. Unfortuantely, the food was not the best I've had. I ordered a filet and while is was ok, it was covered in butter! That wasn't neeccasary to improve it's flavor and made me super sick later that evening. The salad was sub-par and the mashed potatoes had no flavor. I was excited to taste my dessert and it was a let down.

I wish this wasn't the case! I was so excited to go.
author: Tina C.

description:
- Food, 4 stars - 
The bf and I decided to try the pre fixe menu because apparently, you get an salad and a dessert for either a couple more dollars or no cost at all instead of the steak itself.  And the steak itself stays the same, unlike some restaurants that give you a smaller portion. 

I got a pear salad, the signature filet, and chef's choice of dessert.  The pear salad was tangy and refreshing.  Not something I'd try again, but I can see some people would like it.  The signature filet was huge, but Ruth's Chris cooked it to medium well when I asked for medium.  Regardless, the steak was still yummy.  The dessert was a chocolate cake with berries and sweet cream.  Although a big fan of desserts of any kind, this was actually just ordinary for a eatery like this.  

The bf got a caesar salad, which had too much dressing in my opinion.  For entree, he got the rib-eye steak, which basically filled up the plate it was on.  As someone who loves steak and has a big appetite, he was not able to finish it.  

Honestly, we were full after the salad and dreading the steak to arrive.  That's how big the portions were.

- Service, 5 stars - 
Service was very good.  We arrived 20 min late to our reservation and thought we had already lost our table, but they still managed to get us passed the line of walk-ins (i think?) and secured a table within 10 minutes after we arrived. 

The waiter was very friendly in explaining the menu etc to us, as we were both baffled by the strange pricing of the entree-only versus the pre fixe. 

- Atmosphere 4 stars  - 
We ran into 8+ groups around us, so the atmosphere was very lively.  It was my first time there so I wasn't sure how the atmosphere was supposed to be.  I thought the liveliness was acceptable, except the group next to us would try to talk over each other and I was not able to hold a normal-volume conversation with my boyfriend until they left.  

- Price 5 stars - 
Because of the pre fixe menu, it was actually much cheaper than I expected and I would definitely recommend this place for anyone who craves for some quality steak with a smaller budget.
author: Emily W.

description:
I was super excited to eat here, I think it's been over 10 years. Dinner for four $320...not bad since we had drinks too. Started off w a dirty good martini at the bar before we sat down...I must say they are super generous w their pour. :)  We had Cobb salad (yummy) I likes the fried onion on top! We shared mushrooms, asparagus, and their famous hashbrown. My steak of choice...petite filet w blue cheese (medium rare) BUT it was more RARE when I got my steak.

Here comes why I gave this place a 2 star...I threw up 6 times when I got home! I dunno what I ate but it did not sit well. It could had been a bad steak...I don't know. My other 3 friends were fine, it was just me!!!! I have to assume it was the beef! Bad beef!!

Sorry Ruth, u prob won't see me coming back for another 10 years!
author: Sandy L.

description:
Steak cooked in butter? Ummm... YES PLEASE.

It was 6:30 pm, and my girlfriend had to call a rain check on our dinner date because of an emergency, so I called up my foodie friend who's always down to have dinner, and he made some last minute reservations here. Parking was fine (albeit, I'm sure it's much worse on the weekends), we were seated right away, and service was quick. 

I ordered an ice tea with my meal, and our server was nice enough to always bring me a full glass when the one I was working on was running low. It's really nice when you don't have to ask for something over and over again. I think the guy's name was Jack. He was great! 

The food was really amazing. I get my steaks medium (don't judge me), and sometimes, it can be a little dry. Not so. It was cooked to perfection. I got the filet + lobster tail, and it was amazing. It came with drawn butter for the lobster. 

Mood was good. Not too stuffy, but just nice enough to let you know that this isn't just a regular restaurant. We were able to have some great conversations without feeling like we had to be quiet as to not offend those around us. All in all, if you want to have some good steak without having to wear a dinner jacket, this is the place to go!
author: Jeani L.

description:
If I could have this steak's baby and eat all the baby steaks, I would. THE BEST steak I've ever had in my entire life. It even trumps the prime rib at House of Prime Rib. I KNOW! they're different! but Ruth's Chris is just...better. I come here at least once during dine about town every year and I haven't been disappointed yet. 

I dont know what they do to their cows back there (maybe deep tissue massages daily?)...but this is seriously MELT IN YOUR MOUTH steak. The quality, the texture, the consistency...what more can i say? And i think season their steak with some drugs in there because after eating this steak, you'll be happy, relaxed, and sleepy (the wine doesn't help either). And the BUTTER! OH, THE BUTTER!!! if you still have leftover melted butter on your plate after you're done...you did not properly pay homage to the meat.

The service has been good each time i've been there too...not Gary Danko good...but still up there. The wait staff is very knowledgeable about wines too so if you are a novice, they can help pick out a perfect wine to go with your steak.

Their medium rare is a little more rare than i like but if it's not perfect for you, they'll be more than happy to throw that baby back on the grill so it comes to you exactly the way you want it. Plate sizzling and all. 

I'm drooling just thinking about it. I just went there last week and I'm going again this coming weekend. Can't get enough.
author: Cecilia B.

description:
Ruth's Chris is synonymous with fine steakhouses.  They're world reknown.  To be honest, I didn't think their steaks were all that great.  

I went here for a business dinner and ordered the rib-eye.  It was a nice cut of beef.  Prime of course.  But, it was not seasoned and lacked flavor.  For a good cut of beef, I don't like to mess around with it either.  Pepper and salt is all I need and throw it on the grill for a nice char.  I didn't get that here.  I also ordered medium rare.  I got medium.  

Overall, not very memorable.
author: Long D.

description:
I love the Rib Eye steak! The couple of time I've been to Ruth Chris my steak has been juicy!! I can never end up finishing it. Ruth Chris is pricey but worth it. Everyone is very attentive and consistent. The only thing that sucks it's hard to find parking and the steak does not come with sides. You have to order the sides separately and that's where it can get pricey. If you want to try out Ruth Chris and don't want to drive out to SF, they also are located in Walnut Creek, CA 

I usually order for Appetizers: Calamari, the Crab Cakes or Ruth's Chop Salad 

Main and always: Cowboy Rib eye steak 

Sides: I love the Creamed Spinach 
Fresh Asparagus 
Fresh Broccoli 

Dessert: Chocolate Sin Cake
author: Kathy V.

description:
Its my first time dining here and i've heard many different things about this place, Many of the responses were that it was just okay in comparison to other steak houses.  Oddly enough, it seems like we had a different experience because every dish ordered was absolutely delicious. From the crab cakes and ahi tuna to the steak and lobster, i had no complaints whatsoever in terms of taste. As for presentation, it was a bit lackluster. It is an expensive restaurant to dine at, and i was expecting to see dishes that resemble something beautiful. Instead it was just a dead carcass on a plate. 

REALLY GOOD RESTAURANT! =D
author: Jerry C.

description:
Came over for DAT last Friday and I can't wait to go back!!

I was in a party of 3. Knowing how busy restaurants can be, I made a reservation days ahead. We arrived right on time, and were seated within 5 minutes. The smell of steak was intoxication, so we knew we came to the perfect place for steak and couldn't wait to get our hands on some :)

Once we sat down, bread / water / menu / wine / beer / soda all started coming in no time. Be sure to ask for the DAT menu if you are here for that, but there is a regular prix fixe menu as well - there are some good deals! The DAT set came with salad. The waitress took time to explain how the steak were aged and cooked. We ordered 3 different cuts of beef: petite filet, NY strip, and rib eye. Got the cream spinach and hash brown as sides as well.

Minutes or so later, "the steaks are here!" They came out sizzling hot and smelling great!! As we cut into them, they were just perfectly cooked - tender and juicy and tastful and de-li-cious! The hash brown was awesome too! Salad and spinach... eh, I had better... Dessert was not bad though.

For the value we got, I'll definitely be back for another hunk of beef!
author: Lois W.

description:
Delicious.

But you have to wait. Even with a reservation. I hate waiting. 
I made reservations for 8:15p but didn't get seated until 8:50 and didn't eat until like 9:15. You best believe I ate all the bread. I was starving! 

They barely apologized. Just said they were "running late". Well I was on time! Shoot, I was early. 

I had the petite fliet with the parmesean crust. SOOOO GOOD! But I'm not sure it was worth the wait. Everything else was good. 

I wish we didn't get seated next to the bar but I was so hungry from waiting I was just happy to sit down. 

Wine was kinda crappy. Should have brought my own.
author: Melissa T.

description:
What a great experience.  Before I get to the food, here were some notable highlights of the evening:

*We were there to celebrate my Mom and niece's birthdays.  When we arrived for our reservation, Ruth's had sprinkled little "Happy Birthday" confetti all over the table.  Cute.

*During the course of our meal, one of the servers was passing by and stopped when he noticed that my niece's other grandmother's coat was falling off of her chair, and pulled it up for her.  

*I can now say for certain that Steve Wozniak is fantastic at holding audiences captive.  Even when he's not talking on a stage.  He and a group of six were at the table next to us and for over an hour, all we heard was his voice.

*Despite not having enough room in our bellies to even think about dessert from the menu, we ended up getting it anyway - gratis from Ruth's!  After advising that we weren't in overeating shape, Lena Joy our lovely server, brought out two plates for the birthday girls.  I still had none, but everyone else at the table enjoyed a trio of vanillla bean ice cream, custard with fresh berries, and a little chocolate-peanut butter cake with whipped cream and caramel drizzle.  With "Happy Birthday" cursively written on the plates' rims.  They were both tickled :-)

------------------------------------  Now, onto the food...

*Veal chop, medium rare
*Petit filet with shrimp, medium well
*Lobster bisque
*Hash browns
*Steak house salad
*Spicy shrimp over mashed potatoes
*Loaded baked potato
*Winter vegetable soup w/ chorizo (SotD)

Everyone was extremely pleased with their meals, while I was just pleased.  I felt like my veal chop was under-seasoned, even though perfectly cooked.  The balsamic reduction onions were also very well cooked and added nice flavor to the chop, but when I didn't add them to a forkful of meat, I just didn't get enough flavor from the meat on its own.  I chose the veal chop because it's not a cut that I normally get.  I'll try it again and see what I get.

The hash browns arrived as a cake!  Finely shredded potatoes in a crispy, puffy cake as big as the plate, loaded with cheese, bacon, onions, and a touch of creme.  So yummy.  Perfect for a carbfest, if you're ever looking for one.  

The dining room is quite loud and it was difficult to hear over the table, especially for my 69-year old mother and 82-year old companion.  But this place is really great.
author: Tamar D.

description: My bone in filet was disappointingly fatty and gristly. Loaded hash browns were ok but kinda mushy not crisp like I expected. Apps were good, service was good just looking for more from a $60 dollar steak. Also plates were not sizzling. Had better meals here. Bummer...
author: Stephanie H.

description: Had a great experience here! Our server was super attentive and funny. I wish I could remember her name. The meat was cooked to perfection and the manager coming to the table to check on us was a nice touch. I would definitely come back again. Parking in the area sucks but its SF, so it is what it is. If you've got $10 to spare, I'd recommend valet parking.
author: Kendrea C.

description: AMAZING FOOD !!! GREAT FOR DATE NIGHT FOR LADIES NIGHT. The service was great and extremely knowledgeable being that it was my first time there. On the more expensive side as far is pricing but worth it. Dim lighting so the atmosphere was nice , great selection of wine also .
author: Tiffanie D.

description: We have been coming here about twice a month for nine years, and we still love it. The food is incredible and the service is amazing. The bartenders are really great and fun to talk to. We usually get extra food and eat it the next day for dinner. We had a party here once and that worked out really well too. Sometimes we see famous people here: Steve Wozniak, Pablo Sandoval, and the entire Raiders offensive line. Man, I wanted to get a peek at their bill. Highly recommended!
author: Amanda H.

description: I arrived in SF about three years ago so I cannot say I tried all the steakhouses in the city but so far it's the best one I have been to!
author: Julien S.

description: Amazing food with BETTER service. The Manager Nick is quite the professional and our waitress Larissa was sincere and genuine. I'll be back for sure.
author: Devin W.

description: Never come to hard rock would give a zero if I could. Literally waited an hour and a half for a table cuz they forgot to put our name in. For two btw. And wen I asked how long the wait they said they forgot to put our name In and would seat us next. Of course they lied waited another 30 min and watched other people get seated manager didn't give a s**t either. If it's that much trouble to get service I can't imagine when you actually get seated.
author: Michael E.

description:
Crabcake appetizer - excellent. I don't usually order crabcakes, but since the restaurant claims this dish as one of their most popular appetizers, I gave it a try. Definitely did not dissapoint! Sauteed mushroom side dish - yum. OH. And the bread was delicious. 

Filet Mignon - meat itself (flavor and texture) is delicious and cooked to perfection (medium rare bloodiness), however, I feel that they used too much butter and it masked the natural flavor of the meat, and i get a oily buttery aftertaste. Potatoes au gratin - nothing special, despite it being one of the more popular sides. 

Service was nice, but was asked by 3 different servers/bussers what kind of water i wanted in a span of 5 minutes. 

I would come here again, but would probably ask them to use less butter on my steak.
author: Natalie Y.

description: Better than I remember it. I've had the rib eye and the filet mignon at this restaurant and I like the filet better. It was a succulent and juicy piece of meat cooked in garlicky butter and topped with shrimp. And they made it just right, not over or under cooked.  I opted for the prix-fixe menu which came with an appetizer of salad or soup, a side dish and dessert. The soup appetizer and cream spinach was good. The chocolate cheesecake dessert was ok.
author: Ali F.

description:
When my friend suggested meeting for dinner at Ruth's Chris I was a little hesitant.  Not a huge fan of chain steakhouses.  But I was pleasantly surprised!  Ambiance was nice and quiet on a Wed night, it has that old steakhouse feeling with TV's for sports watching, and the bartender was very friendly and fast.  

We didn't have the steak but we split the stuffed chicken breast, a salad, side, and the caramelized banana cream pie.  Plenty of food for 2 people and all were tasty!  And the guy's steak next to me smelled amazing!  Next time Ruth...

Stuffed Chicken Breast - really juicy and tender.  Not overly stuffed.
Oven roasted free-range double chicken breast stuffed with garlic herb cheese and served with lemon butter.

Steak House Salad - fresh and crisp.  I felt so healthy!
Iceberg, Romaine and baby lettuces with cherry tomatoes, garlic croutons and red onions.

Caramelized Banana Cream Pie - actually friggin' awesome!
Creamy white chocolate banana custard in our flaky crust. Topped with caramelized bananas.
author: Anh D.

description: Solid steakhouse. Cowboy ribeye, medium rare, with the bleu cheese crumb topping - perfectly cooked. The barbecued shrimp with white wine,garlic,butter, spices is really tasty! Sides are decent, but not really memorable.
author: Candy C.

description:
Why wouldn't I give 4 stars? They do it right every time. Very accommodating.

I switched it up a little. Decided to indulge in the scallops. A++
author: Wayne T.

description:
Our anniversary celebration started with an amazing matinee showing of Wicked and an early dinner at Ruth's Chris. 

I made reservations here through OpenTable and noted in the comment section that we were celebrating our anniversary. When we walked to our table, it took me minutes to figure out the rose petals scattered across the table top was for our special occassion. Several of the wait staff even wished us a happy anniversary. So sweet! 
  
We looked over the menu and noticed their 39.95/49.95 special dinner menu that includes a starter, entree, a side dish and dessert. Since the bf wanted a ribeye, this was the best deal since the ribeye a la carte was $42. House salad and creamed spinach rounded out his meal, and I had the petite filet.

We also ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms - yum! I got a little creative and squeezed some lemon on top (the lemon pieces came with my ice tea). Lemon and seafood is always a great tasting combo!
I have to admit that the house salad is nothing spectacular, but their creamed spinach is one of my favorites. It has more texture than others I've had, and you can actually taste the spinach rather than a pureed creamy mess. 
 
Our meats soon came out, each on a 500-degree plate, sizzling in butter, and simply decorated with a few sprinkles of chopped parsley. But the diminished presentation did not compromise the flavors at all. Cooked medium-rare, my filet was nothing less than outstanding. I had a bite of the ribeye and the meat just melted in my mouth. I think the bf loved his meat more than me, but just for a moment. 

The special dinner meal came with a dessert duo, carrot cake and a chocolate (espresso?) mousse.  Instead of just adding a candle on top of the carrot cake and calling it a night, the waiter insisted we order another dessert, on the house. Wow! So my sweet tooth and I didn't hesitate. My bf allows me to have free range when it comes to desserts since he's not much of a sweets person and he's just in it for the ride. So I opened up the dessert menu and found heaven, also known as Chocolate Explosion - devil's food cake with chocolate center and vanilla ice cream. We decided to share (yes, I can share chocolate and ice cream!) this one at the table and take the other desserts to go. Simple and delicious. 

I would definitely recommend this place for your special occasion.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
We came here for Dine About Town menu, and was surprised to see that they offered so many upgrade options. We ordered: 

8 oz petit filet medium rare - yummy
16 oz rib eye - yummy as well, but drenched a little bit too much in butter
bbq shrimp - this surprisingly came in pretty large portions. and the mashed potato was drenched in this seasoned butter mixture that made it super delicious. 

For sides, we had cream spinach and mashed potatoes. Spinach was too creamy by this point since all the entrees were pretty heavy. 

For desserts, we had mixed berries with sweet cream (very delicious) and chocolate cake (had the gingerbread flavor). Both were good. 

Total bill was about $50/ person after tax and tip. 

Sidenote: 
1. Valet parking is $10. But you can find street parking if you take the time and are lucky
2. The upgrade option to get 1 crab cake with the Dine About Town is $14, but you get 2 crab cakes for $20 on the regular menu, so the DAT option is not that great.
author: Judy L.

description:
It's no surprise there's a dress code, but when the guy at the host podium ousts your party because somebody in it has a tank top on, I expect the ouster to happen apologetically, if at all. It didn't.  

What IS inappropriate is having a stuck-up dress code at a restaurant in San Francisco -- and a stuck-up humorless individual getting off on running people out of the restaurant. As if a company that can't even generate a dime of earnings per share per quarter needs to be running people off. 

Lack of respect = no further visits by me.
author: D.B. C.

description:
Not bad for a drink while you wait for your table:  vodka soda - $8 

Area is sort of hard to find parking but they provide $10 valet if that suits your fancy!

Beware: keep your jacket on because their  AC is blasting and chilling to the bones. Such a contrast to their flaming hot, burn-your-fingers-if-you-touch ceramic plates! 

I did the dine about town special $35  - which offered a 8oz petite filet, a standard salad and a offering of either mashed potatoes or creamed spinach. I went with creamed spinach which was a delicious pairing with the steak. And for dessert was a petite chocolate cake.

The bf opted for the Ruth Chris prefix -around $43 and definitely a good price for the amount of food you get - included a 16oz ribeye, a choice of salad which I'd recommend :arugula mandarin and prosciutto salad, and a choice of a side; garlic broccolini. Finished off with a flourless chocolate cake with berries! Surely rich and sweet enough to keep you satisfied!

Their steaks come out with a nice buttery aroma. Good - I guess my personal disappointment was that this steak house didn't have the option of grass-fed beef, or 
note on the menu whether these are hormone treated or irradiated.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Why do they tout their corn fed beef so much? It's not really impressive. I'd be impressed if they had 100% grass fed free-range beef. Whatever the case, the filet was not tasty at all. No flavor. Very dry for a medium-rare. Had a chalky feel to it. Maybe if it were juicier it would have had a better mouth feel and taste. Will not be coming back here again.

Service was great though! But it doesn't save bad steak.
author: Timothy L.

description: I don't think you can go wrong at Ruth's Chris. We have been to the locations in L.A. and decided to try SF while we are in town. I would definitely recommend to anyone craving steak or seafood (the seafood tower is very good). Our server, Thomas, was great!
author: P F.

description: Im scared to try any other steakhouse because this one is so good. Spicy lobster for starters, porterhouse for two, (you will have plenty to take home) creamed spinach, and sweet potatoe's. Cocktails were awesome also (hurricane's). Service was great. I believe the san francisco facility is better than walnut creek. Won't go to walnut creek unless its spare of the moment happy hour type deal. Trust me san francisco makes a better steak. I mean if your paying $300 for a meal for two you should have no complaints.
author: R R.

description: Perfect in every way. Perfect service and perfect food, from the appetizers to the salad to the filet mignon to the desserts.
author: Jason B.

description:
It was love at first bite! Hands down our most favorite steakhouse ever. 

My husband and I spent our anniversary dinner here. Since the restaurant was alerted it was our anniversary, they placed a bunch of red flower petals around our table, to make it an extra special dinner...and it was from beginning to end. 

Our server, Joshua was very attentive and friendly, and knowledgeable about the wines and the various menu options. To top it off, our anniversary is during their Dine About Town period, which is an opportunity to eat a 3 course meal (Salad, Entree and Chef's choice dessert) for $35 a person. NOT BAD AT ALL for a higher end restaurant. We expected to pay about $150-$200 for our meal and ended up spending less than $100 (before tip). Remember how I said we get a chef's choice dessert with the Dine About Town special? Well, Joshua made sure we also got an additional chocolate dessert with "Happy Anniversary" written on it. 

For our entrees, we ordered the 16 oz. Ribeye and the 8 oz. Petite Filet, with creamy spinach and mash potatoes for our sides. Like I said, LOVE AT FIRST BITE. I like my meat dead and leathery (aka Well Done) and usually this means my meat is on the drier side. However, Ruth's Chris was able to make my meat well done, but yet still juicy and absolutely delicious. It was a PERFECT dinner (and I never have said that before on any of my reviews). 

**TIP: For all those who have not been to Ruth's Chris but want to try it someday, go during their Dine About Town periods to get the most bang for your buck. They offer Dine About Town every year during the last two weeks of January and the first two weeks of June*
author: Frances B.

description: My bf decided to take me here for the first time. Omg I was in heaven! I love steak and their rib eye is to die for. We also had their crabtini... Very very delicious! Service was great... The guy was always attentive to our needs. I love the nice romantic atmosphere of the restaurant. One of my favorite restaurants (:
author: Samantha H.

description:
We ordered the seasonal prix fixe for $49.95 which came with soup or salad, entrée and dessert. A great deal in my opinion considering entree items a la carte are $40+

I loved their tortilla soup! It was thick and creamy, really flavorful, and I just love it when there is avocado in my soups!! The arugula mandarin prosciutto salad was also SO GOOD! The prosciutto was super thin and crispy, great on the salad.
Both appetizer courses were very generous in size and delicious til the last bite. +2 stars!

For the entrée, we had a 12oz filet and a 16oz ribeye. Both medium rare. Usually I order medium but I'm glad I didn't. The medium rare was just right, their descriptions are spot on. Their steaks are pretty much broiled in butter...haha so good. Again, nice size portions. The entrée came with choice of sides. I personally did not like the creamed spinach at all (mushy, creamy...eh) but my broccolini was cooked perfectly! Too bad it was drenched in salt and butter.. so +1 star for steaks!

For dessert there was only one option - a flourless chocolate cake with fresh berries. Who can really eat two of those things, so we asked to sub vanilla ice cream for one of them. Who knew subbing to ICE CREAM would ring an additional $4 :( but it was a great choice overall because their ice cream was PERFECTLY soft, rich, creamy, vanilla-y..i could go on...yum. It also paired well with the chocolate cake. 

So overall 4 stars I guess! I wont frequent this place often because of the price, but it was worth it. Our server was a bit awkward, but very friendly and attentive.
author: bonnie y.

description:
WOW...WOW...WOW

i am yelping..FINALLY
This place was so great...the bar was calm and the bartender was a gentleman..
Felix the car valet was very very funny...he made me feel at home right away..
we waited in the bar for some of our party to show up and when they did Laura the manager sat us at a great booth.
Lena was our server and she was excellent..thee staff was running around and all of them looked to be great servers. They all had smiles which is a very unique thing in busy San Francisco restaurants.

We started with the ahi app and it was seared perfectly and the secret marinade or sauce was incredible. The ahi was so very fresh ..it was as if they harpooned it and cut it up at request. The spice rub on the outside was delicate and tasty....
we had a lobster app next..i think it was a spicy lobster and it was mouth watering goodness...I asked and they said they get their lobsters from the Caribbean and that gave me a picture in my mind that created a beautiful bite after bite after bite. I snagged the last bite away from my other dinner friends...heee heee.
Lena really knew her meat, she directed us to center cut filets and lobster tail and since I am a big guy I ordered 2 tails...
now about the sides...they were delicious and incredible but be careful cause you can get too full...WE DID... and yet we saved room for dessert.

the Hash brown side(that's right) hash brown with caramelized onions was fantastic...this place really exceeded the guests expectations and we chatted with our table next to us and they were very very happy as well...the dining rooms are spaced perfectly so it is not too loud.
Laura the manager has a wealth of wine and liquor knowledge that you often do not find even in San Francisco..it's that she knew that much and can explain many varieties of Gin and Vodka as well as knowing all her wines...we grileed her and she knew so much it was fun to learn from her......and it's truly obvious that she must have many sommelier pins and will be getting more...she was in a great mood the entire night. I was watching her as I love restaurants and love to see the managers and crew interact.

I would head back there in a minute if I could have more free nights but i love eating at home with my 3 year old daughter.

Another server Meagan stopped by and was so charming and helpful also...we met other servers and Edward was very gracious also, so you can't go wrong here.

I would say you will have a great dinner out if you decide to stop by here and I love the valet parking whenever I eat along Van Ness.

Kudos to Laura and Lena and her well trained staff...they had the knowledge and the energy to fulfill our dinner out dreams...
author: Greg P.

description:
I've been to Ruth's Chris a few times so I guess it's only proper that I grace them with a generous, well thought out, truthful review. Van Ness Blvd is a prime location for one of the best Steakhouses in San Francisco. It's San Francisco and it's going to be an all day adventure looking for parking  so just factor in $25 for valet including tip. 

Appetizers you can not go wrong with are the Tempura Onion Rings, Calamari (lightly fried and tossed with a sweet and spicy Asian chili sauce) , or the Mushrooms stuffed with crabmeat (Broiled mushroom caps with jumbo lump crab  stuffing with Romano cheese). The Caesar Salad was out of this world (fresh crisp Romaine hearts tossed with Romano cheese and a creamy Caesar dressing. Topped with shaved Parmesan cheese and fresh ground pepper). 

I made the mistake of underestimating my appetite and ordered a petite Filet when I should have originally ordered the Filet. Our server was very accommodating and replaced my petite with a full size Filet without any issues. With my Filet ready I also had a loaded one-pound baked Idaho potato with Creamed Spinach in a New Orleans style sauce. (A Ruth's favorite). My Filet was dreamy. So tender and mouth watering. The Filet was cooked to perfection and by far one of the best steaks I've ever had. The right amount of seasoning on a sizzling hot plate will make any grown man blush. The ambiance was very grown up and upscale. Very inviting with a attentive friendly wait staff. I can not say it enough, Hands down one of the best Steakhouses in San Francisco. Keep up the excellent work for I will be back soon.
author: Alastair G.

description: I've been on the search for the perfect tasting rib eye. I found something quite special here at ruth Chris steak house. I love rib eye and have been eating it my entire life. Their rib eye is salty and perfectly seasoned, the trick that makes their rib eye special is the slab of butter they add on top of it. Although the price is high, the rib eye was very satisfying. Although I had to eat two orders of rib eye and a baked potato before I was partially full, the flavor is quite tasty. I will be back.
author: Vincent T.

description: Went here the day after Valentine's Day because why would go on a day everyone was going when I could go any other day. They still offered the vday menu which I thought was very smart and thoughtful of them. I decided to for the Ruth's classic which u get to choose a starter, a side, an entree then dessert.Anyways, absolutely amazing. There Caesar salad is to die for! I have to get that recipe for the dressing! He got the surf and turf and I got the filet mignon. He said the lobster tails were one of the most amazing things he has ever tasted. My mignon cut like butter. We were both in heaven. We shared two sides. Cream spinach and the mashed potatoes. Perfect sized sides so we could share. I wouldn't change anything. Defiantly worth spending the money. I'm going to go here for every occasion!
author: Jay V.

description:
Ruth Chris steakhouse continues to rank as one of the Bay Areas fine dining spots. From the moment you step in through the doors -  the game is on. For my birthday last week - we had been wanting a nice out and felt that a visit to Ruth's Chris was a perfect opportunity. We arrived and once we let the host know we would be two not four, were seated right on time. The staff that night was plentiful welcomed us immediately. Once our over forty eyes adjusted to the lighting  - of course we didnt have our readers with us - thank god for apps!  We had to tackle the options for the night. We opted to share and appetizer and salad so went with the Sizzling crab cakes. The flavor of these were pretty out of sight - bug pieces of crab and jsut enough mix - my only comment was while well worth the price in taste - I did feel they were slightly smaller than I expected.  Next up was the Ruth chopped salad - since we were sharing it was served table side and slit for us. A nice touch and the perfect balance of textures and flavors. . For our entrees - we both went with filets  - I took mine straight up and he went with the blue cheese crust. For sides we weren't going to miss the sweet potato dish (neither should you with its crunchy topping!), the grilled tomatoes and a baked potato with all the fixen's. Each was well prepared and fit the tastes for our night. 

Over all the food was a 9/10 with the exception of the size issue I mentioned earlier. The only  item of note for the night was the speed in which we were served. The kitchen or the servers might not have been in sync - for a celebratory night - I felt that we were somewhat rushed. each course was served before the others had even been finished.  The bus staff were great that night making sure we were well attended - but our server seemed underwelmed and somewhat bored with himself - with each course not once was it noticed how fast the food was coming out - even after I joked about not having either the app or the salad by the time the meats were served. I'm willing to chalk it up to a timing glitch and not toss out the entire experience since it still rivals by far many of the local restaurants of equal food themes. 
I say a perfect special occasion, treat night - or just a quality beef night.
author: Frank S.

description:
A bit spendy at RC, but well worth the price! Everything is delicious and cooked and seasoned to perfection! Servers and bartenders are extremely attentive, friendly and professional! We love going to RC because the food and service is always, always consistently good!

My hubby loved the lobster bisque, a rich, creamy, savoy bowl of heaven ~ I always have to sneak in a few tastes just to make sure it's that good!  My favorite though is the French onion soup, with the just the right amount of cheese and crouton and served piping hot!

Hubby had the double stuffed chicken breast, filled with herb cheese, served on a sizzling hot plate, and I always must have the HUGE double cut, thick juicy, tender lamp chops served with FRESH mint sauce!  I'm still so full but already looking forward to my leftovers for lunch! Lobster MacnCheese!!!! A bowl full of creamy, cheesy goodness, and lobster you can actually see and taste! Sweet potato casserole with the pecan crust was sinfully good and the creamed spinach was perfectly creamy, not runny at all!  I think I've eaten up enough calories for the entire week!

Whether we're sitting at the bar during happy hour or in the restaurant, having a steak, seafood or chicken, RC gets things right, each and every time! Now, onward to my leftovers, and then on to the treadmill!
author: Sasha R.

description:
The family went here for Easter Dinner. We did this 4 years ago and decided it worked out so well that we made a go of it again. I made reservations on line and unfortunately the only time available was 6:30 which isn't too bad. We were running late and I called in to let them know I was behind schedule. We got there at 7:00PM and the hostess was very nice about the tardiness and we only had to wait a few minutes before they prepared us a nice table.
Parking was good since it was Sunday (no meters) and I parked about 100 yards away from the restaurant on Van Ness St. 
We ordered appetizers of the prawns (4 per order) with spicy cocktail sauce ($19,00) and two orders of the stuffed mushrooms with crab. Both appetizers were well presented and very tasty.
They bring out hot baked bread which is really good.
My entree was the 16 oz rib-eye  ($46.00) served with steak butter and comes out sizzling hot. The wife had the stuffed chicken ($26.00), the daughter had the petite fillet and the son had the crab cakes. We also ordered sides of steamed broccoli, mashed potatoes and mushrooms.
The wait was a little long for the meal but it was well worth the wait.
We shared a single order of the chocolate decadence dessert  which is warm chocolate cake with hot chocolate inside and vanilla ice cream on top which is really good. I don't know if this is a new dessert item on the menu but it's really terrific.
The server, Jeremy, was great along with all the staff. Very efficient and not overbearing.
The entire bill without tip came out to $300.00 and it helped that I had a $100.00 gift card that eased the pain a little bit.
Highly recommended.
author: jack d.

description:
PRICEY...very pricey.  I think we all know that already.

Hubby took me here the day he proposed to me.  It was a very special night indeed.  

The prime rib is melt in your mouth tender.  I love their creamed spinach.  The lobster bisque is very good (wish they give you more for the price).  Service is great! Parking is horrendous...but that's SF for you.
author: Cossette P.

description:
Always a great experience at Ruth chris'.  great service, huge portions, they paid for our appetizer, key lime pie for dessert.
  Its definitely a 'chain' but how bad could anything and everything cooked in butter be?!
  It was packed on a saturday night at 6pm- what do you expect?! its san francisco; make a reservation and grab a drink at the bar while you wait
author: Laura M.

description:
In my opinion, Ruth's Chris is THE place to go for succulent steaks.  My favorite is the cowboy ribeye - always so full of flavor and juicy.  If it weren't uncivilized to do so, I would gnaw every little morsel off the bone.

Although SF is a lot closer to where I live, I prefer the Walnut Creek location because they're more lax with the dress code and parking is so much easier.  But both locations offer the same outstanding quality.
author: Delbert A.

description:
Despite all those good reviews, I have to say I am a bit DISSAPPOINTED for my visit there this past saturday.

I went there for the Dine About Town (DAT), the waiter kept trying to get us to upgrade to their regular menu, and when we decided we want to stay with the DAT menu, our waiter's attitude changed...  And, the whole time we were there, we were being rushed, i guess because they wanted faster turn over for the tables...  we did not get to enjoy our dinner at all, and had to finished our dinner in less than an hour...

Anywayz, not that the food was enjoyable anywayz...  first, the salad was not good...  and for the main course, I ordered fish (which fish of day was salmon, and no other choice), well, the salmon was overcooked...  my friend ordered the filet, which was okay.  and the sides (Spinach and mashed potato) got cold already when they arrived the table...  we also ordered a cocktail, which, was tasteless...  then it comes to the dessert...  it was yuck!  i took one small bite, and i am totally done with it...  

During the whole time, the waiters keeps cleaning our plates away, even before we get to finish, and asked to pack our food to go, when he feels that we are not eating fast enough...  o, i feel so rushed, and so unwelcomed there...
author: IceSnow N.

description: Came here to celebrate my hubby's birthday. From the moment we entered the establishment everyone was extremely attentive. Upon being seated we met the most amazing server ever, Chelsea! The level of attention to detail was out of this world. We have frequented several other Ruth's Chris restaurants and have never been as wowed by the service and professionalism that exuded from this young lady. She is truly a gem in the industry. Our food was heavenly. I ordered the petit filet (it was pure perfection)  my hubby ordered the ribeye. Chelsea ensured that they found &a prepared the leanest one for him. We shared creamed spinach & augratin potatoes. She suggested several libations that we loved. The desert plate they prepared for him was a gorgeous sampling of deliciousness. We were there past closing time and the manager Froyled (hope I didn't butcher that too much) hailed us a taxi. Just a super evening. My husband felt extra special & we have deemed this location our new favorite.
author: Gia M.

description: Amazing steaks! Wonderful service. Since this is the steak house, we even didn't try other non-steak main food. Steaks are fabulous. We'll come back. Definitely.
author: Karyna Y.

description:
I wish I could eat here once a month (at least), but really its more like once a year. ;p
My husband and I received a $100 gc here and decided to use it on a Tuesday 5pm dinner reservation. Some helpful tips...

-Valet and parking garage next door. Either way you end up paying $10 for each in the end. Try to get street parking.
-Be prepared to spend that money. Our tiny gc card for $100, basically paid for our water. For an appetizer, some wine, salad, one side and two steaks... You're looking at about $300. 
-COWBOY RIB EYE MEDIUM RARE! SO GOOD! : ) My husband got his medium. We both agreed the medium rare was more flavorful.
-Staff and servers are nice and informative. They know their food and steaks!
-Don't feel like dressing all up, no worries! We were casually dressed and it was no big deal. Got the same treatment, food and bill like everyone else.

Best steak I had in a long time and maybe ever.  Its expensive for a reason and now I know why.
author: Marissa J.

description: I've been wanting to go here for some time now but was left with a mediocre experience. This place was always known for their steaks but my filet mignon was just ok. I feel as if the side dishes were better than the actual steak itself. It was just ok for the money spent. I wouldn't mind giving it a second chance to see if we just went on an off night with the chefs. The desserts were very delicious and plated very nicely.
author: J C.

description:
Felt very disrespected by the staff and management at this Ruth's Chris location and would highly recommend people stay away from this restaurant.  

I was taking my brother, sister, and good friend out for a meal in San Francisco over the long weekend.  We're big fans of steakhouses and have in the past had decent experiences at other Ruth's Chris locations.  The food was fine, however the waiter wasn't around very much and didn't provide much guidance on the wine menu.

The real problem really came towards the end of the meal.  I had given my credit card to the waiter ahead of the meal because I wanteld to "win" the who gets the privilege of treating the group debate that happens often at the end of meals with close friends and family.  When the bill came, my friend brother and sister, naturally, argued that they wanted to chip in, a friendly way.  

Josh, one of the managers on duty, overheard our debate and without a moment to hear us out or any sort of understanding of the situation called us outside in the hall and started  telling us in a very rude and confrontational manner that we were disturbing other guests .  I explained that we were just having a debate about who got to take whom out and that by calling us out in this manner he was treating us like children and ruining our dining experience.  He was not understanding, in fact he blew up, making several derogartory remarks to us, suggesting he didn't need people like us in his restaurant, and then suggested we leave the restaurant immediately, without even a chance to review our bill.  It was humiliating.  I was shocked at his overreaction, his remarks, his temper, and felt singled out and very disrespected as a customer and person. 

One of the other managers came out to us later and said she was sorry for what had happened.  We asked that Josh come out to apologize, she refused, although did take my name and number and said a GM would call us.  No GM called us.  My friend went the next day to express our concern and asked for an apology for being humiliated.  Josh refused.  I am not sure why the management team at this location is trying to ruin things for the rest of the Ruth's Chris franchise by promoting an environment of intolerance.  

I'd ask that other customers consider this experience when deciding where to enjoy a steak dinner with their loved ones, and take their business elsewhere until the management of this restaurant can ensure a safe and respectful experience for all people.
author: Nikhil S.

description: My boyfriend and I have been here a few times and it never disappoints. I usually always stick to a filet done medium rare. Its the perfect mix of tender and juicy. I got the surf and turf this time around. Came with 2 lobster tails! He got the T-bone. We split a caesar salad as an appetizer. Enjoyed a bottle of wine with dinner and although we ordered the sweet potato casserole with dinner it was perfect for dessert. I LOVE sweet potato. It was so creamy and the sweet and crunchy pecan topping was just the right amount of sweet without it being too sweet. Next time we will have to get it a la mode! Always look forward to going back here!
author: Amy A.

description:
Let me begin by saying I am a loyal RCSH fan! I have enjoyed dining at Ruth's Chris all over the country. I am consistently satisfied with the food quality and service. On my most recent night out indulging in some delicious buttery steak, a very upsetting incident took place....
While my friends and I were dining, the guests at the table nearby us stacked their wine glasses on top of the lit candle on the table. Now, maybe I am a stick in the mud, but in no way do I find that entertaining or  funny. When those glasses fall and shatter, isn't that glass going to be in MY food and wine? I mean think about it... how inconsiderate!!!! Well, I do appreciate that the manager PROMPTLY fixed the situation and politely asked the guests to disassemble the tower of wine glasses. Props to him for being present on the floor and being proactive in order to take care of all of the guests in the dining room.  Well, apparently these 4 guests weren't done making problems for RCSH....just a few moments later they started yelling at the TOP OF THEIR LUNGS...."NO ME YOU MOTHER F***ER!!!!" to each other in what seemed to be a dispute over the bill?? I mean once again, do these people have no care about anyone around them???? Or have any self respect?? I mean they were crazy loud, cursing and totally inappropriate. And, once again the manager was there super, super fast, asking them to please be respectful of the other guests. When they didn't and continued to make more of a commotion, he requested that he assist these guests to settle the bill out in the hallway, rather than make a huge scene in the middle of the dining room (all of us at our table as well as other tables around us stopped eating and were staring at this point.)  These guys went NUTS. They were swearing, threatening the manager and being crazy loud and disrespectful. We were right next to the hallway so we could hear/see EVERYTHING. After a few minutes of holding his ground and enduring this verbal abuse, the manager calmly asked these guests to leave and escorted them out. My overall feeling about the whole event is respect and appreciation towards RCSH, and in particular the manager, Josh (the guests kept asking and asking for his name!!). It proved that they are not tolerant of misbehavior in the dining room and want ALL of their guests to enjoy their experience. That's key to running a successful business...and of course the incredible steaks!!!!  Thanks Ruth's Chris and keep up the good work!!
author: El M.

description:
I thought I'd review Ruth's Chris before Bobo's, both of which I visited in the past month.

I made my RC reservation online, a couple of days ahead. I got the day and time I wanted (important, because this was my fiance's birthday).

When we arrived at the restaurant, I was reminded of the steakhouses I grew up eating at in Chicago (a city that has the steakhouse genre DOWN). I didn't know until we were seated that Ruth's Chris is a chain. Because it's so lovely and cozy in there, this only bugged me a teeny-tiny bit.

The host was responsive, though he had to sort out a couple of reservations. We only waited for a few minutes and then he got us on our way. 

Cute surprise: I'd said on the online reservation that this was my guy's birthday and on our table there was a sprinkling of "Happy Birthday" confetti. Somehow it wasn't gauche, just sweet.

Our server was fantastic. She checked on us often, but didn't hang around TOO much if you know what I mean. It was a very romantic evening.

DOWN TO THE FOOD!

I had the spinach/walnut/some-kind-of-dried-fruit-with cheese Official Salad of San Francisco. Can't lie, it was not good. The spinach leaves were bruised and limp.

But the steak...O M G. I had the small filet, rare (of course). I'm not kidding, it was one of the best steaks I've ever had. That 2,000 degree oven was a good move for this spot. So juicy and flavorfull, and perfectly seared on the outside, red inside. EXACTLY how I ordered it (it's kind-of amazing how many places in SF don't know "rare" from "medium").

We ordered creamed spinach, mushrooms and mashed potatoes for our sides. They are SINFUL I tell you. Delicious.

For dessert, we ordered the little chocolate cheesecakes. They added a little scoop of ice cream and put a birthday candle on my finance's. And the server winked to him and said, "Don't worry, we're not going to sing." The cheesecakes were RICH and neither of us could finish ours we were so full. 

Next time I go to Ruth's Chris I'm going to skip the appetizer/salad and just go straight in for the steak. That IS their thing, after all.
author: Holden P.

description:
Seriously.  This place is over rated.  Im not saying the quality of the food is bad,  but its such of a waste to be cook that way.  
1. Ceasar salad was okay,  but nothing special.
2. Everything was flavorless,  they do not make any special sauce,  even the horseradish is sour cream + plain horseradish.  God!   i believe i can cook better than that at home. 
3. The spicy lobster was not crisy,  tasted like walnut shrimp from a chinese restaurant but double the price with ¼ the portion.  
4. No tartar sauce for seafood,  no sauce at all.! !  Totally dry!!
5. Waitress was missing 90% of the time,  have to wait at least 15 minute for her to show up once.
6, the shoestring french fries was SOFT and greesy.. God,  even  Mc Donnal does better job than them.  
7. Even the dessert was not good.  
I came here on an anniversary because all the good reviews.   I usually go to Harris or Alexander,  but desided to try somthing else.  I seriously think this place needs retrain.  Staffs and chefs are lacking skills.  With the price I'm paying,  i would go to Harris or Alexander,  much much better.  Totally disappointed for this place.
author: Toshiko B.

description: Great place to dine. Delicious steak. You can't go wrong if you like beef. The service is excellent. There is valet parking. I've been here a few time and will go back.
author: Nixon L.

description:
Excellent food and service for a high price. 

This was the only steakhouse where the waiter was able to provide nutrition info. The steaks were excellent. The ambience could have been more romantic. Old fashioned steakhouse vibe.
author: Mo T.

description: Seemed a bit crammed with the table settings but like always a fun outing. The Surf 'n Turf V-Day special was awesome.
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: First time here ! Absolutely loved our waiter Patrick!  Super friendly and super funny !!! So glad we got him for our anniversary dinner.  Will defiantly come back and ask for him ! Thank you for making our night extra special!
author: Brandy R.

description: Yesterday me and my boyfriend went to Ruth's because we seen great reviews and it was his birthday so i wanted to take him out . So i ordered lamb chops with a side of  macaroni and lobster and my boyfriend ordered ribeye with a side of mashed potatoes because the waitress was going on talking about how good there meat is and i mean i would expect it to be, it's a steakhouse so he started eating I notice my boyfriend just kept cutting his steak and putting it to the side of the plate, his ribeye was literally 85% fat. I was so disappointed even though i wasn't eating it, i felt bad because i took him to this place which I thought would have delicious steaks especially for the price and advertising. i could of just went to sizzles if i wanted him to chew on fat nasty steaks very disappointing. The only reason i have them 2 stars and not 1 is because there macaroni macaroni and lobster was fantastic.
author: Karen A.

description: Ruth's Chris is a place that is consistent in their food.  I have liked everything I have ever ordered here.  They do a good job preparing the food here.  Awesome steakhouse.  And their desserts are awesome in taste and generous in their portions.  And I have come here dressed "down" and "up" and have always felt comfortable dressed in either jeans or a dress here.  You know how in some places you get weird looks if you're dressed in jeans at a nice place.  Having said that, I am not a big fan of the lighting in here.  Just a preference.  I'm sure most people like that the lighting is good for a romantic, intimate dinner.  Personally I think they should turn the lights up just a tad bit.
author: M. T.

description:
My mom was in town and in order to celebrate a special occasion we decided to go to Ruth's Chris Steak House. Oh Yelp, how you failed me. All the reviews are 4-stars so I thought it must be good.

Their wine selection is fabulous, their dining staff superb, the dessert was amazing! But the actual meal, not good! I'm sorry, but when I am practically selling my first born to pay for a steak, I expect that steak to be PERFECT. There is a lot of pomp and circumstance at Ruth's. They tell you how they flash broil their steaks at 1100 degrees and then serve it on a 500 degree plate; how the meat is such amazing quality they don't even need to season it with anything more than a dash of salt and pepper.  I wish that were true.

When ordering our steaks the waitress claimed that they are served on the rare side so I felt confident ordering my filet mignon medium-rare. When I got my steak it was mostly medium and tasted over-done. The sides weren't that great either. I ordered the garlic mashed potatoes, which were bland and practically blended, at first I thought that they were out of a box. The corn-bread side thing was way too sweet and had the consistency of grits. My mom and boyfriend were smart and got the sauteed mushrooms, which are kind of hard to screw up.

So if the food was so bad, why the three stars? Well, like I said earlier, the wine selection is decent and each wine that the staff recommended was actually very good. The service is amazing. Your water glass is never empty and they time bringing out the food really well. And last, but most importantly, the dessert was fabulous! Each of us got a different dessert and each one was better than the last. My favorite was the creme brulee, it was perfectly caramelized and came with fresh fruit on top. I am definitely coming back here for a glass of wine and dessert at the bar.
author: Casey S.

description: Had a horrible experience a the SF branch of this restaurant. First , they seat us by the door which is repeatedly being opened and freezing us to death. Spoke with the server and asked to be moved to a different spot , he refused eventho a whole other room was empty. We ordered 2 apps which took FOREVER! a couple who was seated after us and ordered after us had their apps..ate them..and was working on their main course by the time our apps arrived. All this wait was going on in the freezing cold. I ordered the filet and when i got it it was rare...like really really rare. I informed my server that i ordered it medium and even he admitted that my steak was clearly their rare. He offered to "put it back on the grill" for me. Smh I really dont want to think that race played a factor in the treatment that i received here but I'm believing it was. The next night i called and spoke with a manager letting him know how unsatisfied i was with our $220 meal. He said he would look into and call me back in a " couple days" well after 4 days of not hearing from him i call and he says there is nothing they can do for me. unacceptable! i have ate at a lot of nice restaurants and the customer serivice here was poor to say the least. i wouldn't recommend this location to anyone. please go to mortons or flemings or bobo's
author: mr k.

description:
Been here a few times and this place never seems to disappoint me. I took my friend here for his birthday a few weeks ago and being our little piggy selves we ordered a Caesar salad and lobster bisque to start and for the main course I ordered the petite filet ( medium rare) and the bday boy ordered the ribeye (medium rare) with potatoes au gratin and creamed spinach as our sides. I have never had such a tender and soft filet in my life and not to mention that yummy sizzling butter plate they serve it on. The ribeye was also pretty tasty and tender. For dessert we had the creme brûlée which you can never go wrong with. 

Great service, food, drinks and great company. It sure was a delightful evening. I will definitely be back! Not to mention they do dine about town as well which is a really affordable option if you don't want to spend $200+ on dinner like I did.
author: Daisy W.

description: Hands down my all time favorite restaurant! You will laugh when I tell you but i don't eat red meat! I have always gotten the amazing chicken and it's always perfection! For those that are looking for something other than steak, the chicken will blow your mind! I have heard that the steak is devine. Pricey, parking sucks, just valet. Expect an amazing meal and service that's nothing but quality.
author: Dc F.

description:
THIS RESTAURANT IS TRULY SPECTACULAR! 
This is the first and only true time where I felt that the great quality food and excellent quality service far exceeded my expectations. 
The server's name was Josh, who prepared and researched the company I was with.  In this particular case, it was with my brother Jason and Jack, both of whom happens to be famous Pancake Kings of San Franscisco. 
I'll have to write more about this but needless to say... It's worth going to, if you're into having a great dining experience.
author: Joel J.

description:
Ruth's Chris will never get it wrong.  Period.

Although I'm big on their Petit Filet, lately I've been going for their Stuffed Chicken.  Words cannot describe how delicious this entree is.  I'm willing to sell my soul to find out exactly how that stuffing is made because it's just THAT impeccable!!

My advice, go with the calamari as an appetizer.  They sprinkle crack on top because you can't seem to get enough.  Kidding, but good nevertheless.  Potatoes au gratin are a great (although fattening) side, but I usually counter it with some kind of vegetable so I don't leave the place feeling bad about myself.  

I like this location, but I have to promote the WC location because of the Saint Mary's College men's basketball themed room.  GO GAELS!
author: Angela R.

description:
I've been to this location for lunch and dinner and each time the experience was delightful. 

Star dishes worth to try:
Appetizers- Calamari, Crabtini, Mushrooms stuffed w/ Crabmeat & Crab cakes

Entrees- Filet, Porterhouse & Ribeye 

Desserts- Bread Pudding & Creme Brulee 

Service was always wonderful. There is a dress code for dinner, but for lunch it's casual wear. If you dont want to spend too much, come for lunch- you get a quality lunch for a price that wont break your bank.

But then again, it's just my opinion..
author: Christine M.

description: Wish we came here more! My husband and I have been to many Ruth's Chris locations and still this one is the best I've been to and has awesome service!
author: Regina K.

description: Really really good, but not quite as good as the last time I was there...not sure why.   Restaurant service was excellent.   However, valet parking guy was rude to my mom and didn't help her get her walker out of the car. Oh yeah, and when my mom called to make reservations they told her the only times available were 5 pm or 9 pm and when she insisted that wouldn't work, they somehow found a table at 6 pm.  I think they were just trying to get the slow spots filled.   The restaurant wasn't all that crowded at 6 when we were there.
author: neon m.

description: The food is fine and fancy. The service was so gosh darn attentive that I couldn't have a conversation. It was like there was a manager in the back of the kitchen holding someone hostage and the staff had been told to interrupt us every three minutes with an "Is everything okaaaaay? Can I getcha anythiiiiing? How's the steak?" or the little old lady would get it in the neck. Maybe I'm old-fashioned, but I like my service a little less constantly interrupting my date and my meal. And there are plenty of local steak houses I'd rather give my money and time to, so we've never gone back.
author: Anne K.

description:
I never fail to come here for Dine About Town. 
$34.95 (pre-tax&tip) for a salad, a side, steak, and dessert? 
That's a steal.
Ruths Chris is my default place to go to to enjoy some buttery ass rib eye steak. 

Here's what I recommend:
Avoid the salad
Avoid the filet mignon
Creamed spinach & mashed tots are alright -- get them if you want
Get the rib eye, cooked to your liking (I like medium)
Get the rib eye, cooked to your liking (I like medium)
Get the rib eye, cooked to your liking (I like medium)
Get the AU GRATIN POTATOES (so delicious -- both cheesy and creamy)
Get the HASH BROWNS (makes you feel like you're eating brekky)
Get the KEY LIME PIE (so tangy!)

If you consume a rib eye steak, some au gratin tots, and a key lime pie for dessert, you will be satisfied. Guaranteed!
author: Heidi C.

description:
Came here last night with a party of 5 for SF Dine About Town. They actually have their own prix fixe menu as well, that range from $39.95 to $45.95 I think for a 3-course meal, which is a great way to try this place without breaking the bank.

For the first course, I ordered the corn and crab chowder. I couldn't taste the crab, but for a corn chowder, it was thick, creamy, and comforting. A little salty though. 

I ordered off their prix fixe menu and got the 6 oz. filet + shrimp for the main course, which may look small at first glance, but really filled me up. The first bite of that steak - wow! It was hot, juicy, and tender, just as advertised. They cook the steaks at 1000+ degrees before placing it on a 500 degree plate with butter on the bottom AND on top, seasoned with some salt, pepper and an herb that I can't remember at the moment... but it was perfect. They've obviously got the seasoning and cooking down. I have to say though, once it cooled down a bit, it wasn't as "best-steak-I've-ever-had" tasting, and was actually almost a little dry, but still very good. But the shrimp! SO good. A little spicy, every bite was flavor explosion. Entrees come with choice of side, and the garlic mashed potatoes were, well, just mashed potatoes. Nothing special, except for the fact that I could see the butter/oil surrounding the potatoes, but that could be taken 2 ways -- extra decadent or extra fat... you choose.

For dessert, the duo symphony - carrot cake + chocolate mousse with fruit in a cream sauce (tasted like fancy condensed milk). Nothing spectacular, but the fruit was obviously fresh.

All in all, I'm glad I finally can say I've been to Ruth's Chris, but I doubt I'll be returning. While the steak was probably one of, if not the, best I've had, the rest of the meal just wasn't that impressive. The price, I'd say, is for the steak and the ambience. Great place to take a date if you're trying to impress, but I think that you can find a better meal (meaning, all courses are equally delicious) for the same price elsewhere.
author: Kathy L.

description: My first experience tasting high-quality steak. I got the petite filet (a perfect size which filled me just right!) which was very tender and rich in flavor. The sweet potato casserole with pecan was my favorite side dish-highly recommend it! The creamy spinach added a balance to the sweet potato casserole. Molten chocolate cake was a d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s end to a yummy meal.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Everything we ordered was super yummO!!! 
Appetizers:
Ahi tuna
Spicy lobster
Blue crab cakes
Entrees 
Surf & turf (comes with two lobster tails and ribeye steak)
Bass
Sizzling Ribeye steak
Sides:
Garlic mash potatoes 
Sautéed mushrooms 
Cream of spinach 
Dessert:
Was a little bummed that they ran out of cream brûlée so they ended up letting us ordered anything we wanted from the dessert menu on the house.
 Must try their lemon coconut martini!! 
Service was awesome. Ambience was classy and cozy. 
Will definitely be back!
author: Calee C.

description: I have been here several times and each dining experience never disappoints me. The steak is of high quality and I absolutely enjoy the creamed spinach.  The down side for me is the portion is too large but it'd be great benefit for meat lovers!!!
author: Nessa M.

description:
Yum, my first Ruth's Chris experience! As if this place needs another review... I do enjoy their super hot plates to keep the meat warm (I guess not so great if you enjoy your meat super rare). I had my filet mignon medium rare and it was great. You can really smell the butter on your plates too... could have done with a little less butter. The creamed spinach and mashed potatoes were so creamy and flavorful (and came in very generous portions)... I think I felt my arteries clogging during dinner but what does it matter! You're at Ruth's Chris! 

Very fine cocktail and wine selection. We had drinks at their bar before our reservation and our bartender was very nice and their drinks are superb. I ordered my martini extra dirty, and it was extra delicious!
author: Anna V.

description:
Came for DAT but ended up ordering off the standard menu...

Although the DAT has great options, if you compare it to the regular menu you have more options and the price is still relatively comparible (check the "classics" section).  

That aside, the food was amazing!  I prefer Ruth's over Harris' and even HOPR.  Compared to Ruth's, the others just seem stuffy... but all else being equal, Ruth's food just simply outshines the others, imho.

My bf got the walnut and pear salad, ribeye, and creamed spinach.  I had the house salad, the filet with shrimp, and walnut and butternut squash for a side.  And for dessert we had chocolate mousse cake with berries and a sweet cream sauce.  Are you drooling yet??

We each had a drink at the bar prior to being seated and brought a bottle of wine ($15 corkage) and our grand total was $140 (before gratuity).  Not bad... We'll be back!
author: Olivia D.

description:
Wes here 2 weeks ago and forgot to re-review,
What can I say, the usual spot for the non harris nights.
I love ruth and they always have the best creme brulee!
author: Peter J.

description: Service was good, however, the food was overwhelmingly bad. I had the wedge and filet. Filet was fatty, soaked in partially melted butter and close to being inedible. Salad lacked dressing, had maybe one or two bacon bits, and a bit of brown lettuce. I was at the same location a few years ago and the food was pretty good from what I remember. Not going back any time soon however.
author: Kyle S.

description: My waitress, Jessica was very warming and attentive. I ordered the surf and turf as usual. My steak was medium well with lots of flavor. Garlic mash potatoes are a must when dinning here along with the twin lobster tail. Thanks again. will be coming back!
author: Mercedes K.

description:
Overrated and not worth the price ($200 dinner for two - includes a cocktail each and an additional glass of wine for me). 

Porterhouse for two: we ordered it medium rare-  it came out rare.   When you are ordering such an expensive piece of meat, it should come out perfect every time. 

House salad: we shared the house salad, which was standard greens, mini tomatoes, croutons with vinaigrette. 

Natasha (I think that was the hostess' name) seated us in the bar area for dinner, but we had RESERVATIONS.  What's the point of making reservations a week in advance if you are going to get seated next to the bar and in front of the TV.  BIG FAIL on her part and hugely contributed to us not having a positive experience. 

Pluses of the night - 1) Arturo, our waiter rocked. He was very sweet, funny, and attentive.  His humor partially made up for being seated in the bar area. 2) The potatoes au gratin was delicious (cheesy and extremely creamy).
author: Kimya P.

description:
Holy hell.

My boyfriend decided he wanted to take me out for my birthday, so he got us a reservation for 7 o'clock on saturday evening. We were seated a bit after 7 and immediately given water and bread. Ooh, a whipping butter. Ryan, our amazing waiter(!!!) gave us 10 minutes or so to look over the menu while he got us drinks. I HIGHLY recommend the strawberry basil gimlet. After answering our questions (and suggesting the hash browns over the mashed potatoes, which was the absolute right decision) we ordered the following

Calamari appetizer
Ceasar salad
Porterhouse for 2
Hashbrowns "loaded"

The calamari was good. The sauce they toss it in is sweet with a bit of a bite, but I think it would be better if they served it on the side. It does tend to make the calamari soggy after a bit.

Ceasar salad was nothing to write home about. Standard faire. I, personally, would have ordered the tomato salad. But the bf and I were splitting it and he hates tomatoes.

I did my yelp research and read about the scalding hot plates they bring your steak out on...which continues to cook it. Ryan assured us that they chefs cook the steak just under whatever you order, so that when on the plate; it cooks to the appropriate wellness. I was skeptical...i HATE when my steak is overcooked. But, we trusted Ryan and ordered medium rare. And it was perfect. Through out the whole meal. The porterhouse consists of two sides...the "strip" side and the "filet" side. I could have done without the strip side after tasting the filet side. Hands down, the BEST filet i've ever tasted. Soft and buttery...it was like biting into the fluffiest meat pillow ever. If I go back, i'll know not to waste my time on any other cut.

The hashbrowns. Oh the hashbrowns. When Ryan said we wouldnt be disappointed, he was f*****g right. Imagine the most perfect round pancake of crispy golden brown hash browns. Then top that with cheddar cheese, bacon and sweet sauteed onions. I was incredibly full from the steak, but could not stop eating this orb of deliciousness.

My boyfriend had mentioned it was my birthday, so there was happy birthday confetti all over our table (they sprinkle rose petals on the table if its your anniversary btw) Ryan, the sweet guy he is, purchased me a dessert. I was absolutely stuffed, so i got the chocolate cake. I hate chocolate, so I made my boyfriend eat it. I did eat the vanilla ice cream on top though...also, delectable.

All in all, this place was delicious! The staff is attentive, even when the place is BUSY (I think out waiter had about 10 tables...one being a party of 12) Enough talk. Go. Go enjoy it for yourself.
author: Mary B.

description: Waited over 30 minutes reservation time. 2 out of 3 bathrooms were clogged in the women's restrooms. Paper towels every where like it wasn't attended in 2 days. Food was good. Bartender wasn't attentive. I felt the entire staff was just there to make a paycheck and not to provide an experience - little smiling. Constantly had to ask for water.
