It's a golden server rule - no water shall be half way or less in a glass. There is zero excuse for such a reservation mishap at a restaurant of this caliber.  Would have given 1 star but the food was nice hence the 2 stars. Had the petite filet mignon.
author: Zita M.

description:
This place is decently good. I personally would prefer HOPR simply because you get more bang for your buck and I love their sides and their beef is AMAZING! 

I ordered the Rib Eye (rare). It came sizzling hot and was so juicy for about 5 minutes. Then it started to cool down and tasted like any other steak. No longer was it the 2% USDA grade beef blahblah. I noticed it was very stringy with tendons and fat. About 15% of my meat was stringy tendons/membrane whatever you call it. The creamed spinach is not all that. It tasted bland and HOPR beats it hands down. 

We also ordered a side of mashed potatoes. It tasted normal but for $9 I expected something more special. We also had a regular salad. The Thousand Island dressing was very delicious.

Overall, it was a pleasant experience. Our server was friendly and enthusiastic, never pushy. But for the price, I would drive a few blocks down over to HOPR. I most likely won't be coming back to Ruth's Chris.
author: Jenny T.

description:
The best place to get a petite filet-oscar style in SF.  The meat speaks for itself...

If the wait is too long, then you can sit at the bar with the full menu.  Just don't take the window seat...you'll freeze unless you have your Northface Parka on.
author: Michelle H.

description: Came here a couple times just because the boyfriend and I felt like it. The page says "dressy" ambiance.... we came here in sweats one time--the service was just as good.  I always order my steaks medium rare; sometimes it comes out more red than it should, sometimes it's just perfect. The way they oven broil it with butter makes the steak crust so amazing and fragrant. I'm giving it a 4star just because the food quality is inconsistent, however, it never terribly disappoints me.
author: Nadeen H.

description:
The... best... freaking fish... I've ever had in my life. 

My mouth is salivating this very second as I recollect the salmon I had the pleasure of eating at Ruth's Chris. The burst of flavor in that perfectly marinated hunk of aquatic goodness! Mm! I'm not normally a big spender on food, so this was one of my priciest meals, but oh god! I so want to go back. 

And our waiter was fantastic, informative, friendly, attentive, engaging, and everything you hope for in a serving staff! 

I don't like steak, but I did try a little... and I still don't like steak, so I won't comment on the red meat. But overall great food, great service, and great company (guess that one varies hehe).
author: Grace S.

description:
Come for the Dine About Town, stay for the fantastic cocktails. If you guys don't know what the Vesper is, it's a martini coined by Ian Fleming's "Casino Royal" novel and displayed in the 007 film, "Quantum of Solace".

I am a huge 007 nerd, therefore I had it, it's dry with a hint of sweetness, not too much for a man's palatte, but not a typical vodka/gin martini. I don't even drink martini's because I always thought they were for old dudes and British Secret Service, but I had a couple of these and they were fantastic.

The food was great too, the Dine About Town brought a lot of new faces to this place. It's a bit stuffy in here, close proximity seating, quiet atmosphere, no music, as well as it being dark, to suggest that you shouldn't be too loud.

A proper ribeye steak should have a seared crust on the outside from the skillet, and then either grilled or high heat on the stovetop to get your meat up to temperature. The best steaks I've ever had were unassuming with a charred layer on the outside, but once you get that first fork of meat, before you even taste it, you'll know what the deal is. Sorry to sound incredibly pretentious, but I'm kinda on a roll here. Anyway, it checked all the right boxes, it was incredibly luxurious and enjoyable from start to end at Ruth's Chris.

The cuts of meat sit on a bed of butter, I don't personally agree with this choice, but clearly it must be a recipe that works. Tis a bit salty for me taste parts, but overall the dinner was great, food was just good.

I don't really have anything negative to say about the ambience, obviously it works for some, but we're sort of 20-something yuppies trying to have a good night in the city in a relaxing manner, parts of it worked for us, parts of it made us feel a little away from home.
author: Christopher T.

description:
I hadn't been to Ruth's for a long time, so decided it was time to treat myself to a nice dinner. Since I was alone, I opted to sit in the bar area. Big mistake!! It was 6:15p on a Wednesday, so the restaurant wasn't in full-on dinner mode yet. There were patrons about the restaurant, but it was mostly empty. There were about five people at the bar and other gentleman in the lounge area. Ok...scene set.

I was seated at a table by the window and took a look at menu. Once I had decided what I wanted for dinner, I waited for someone to serve me. And I waited, and waited, and waited. After waiting for some time, I went back to the host Alex, to let him know that I was still waiting for someone to take my order. I wasn't sure if there was a server or if the bartenders served the lounge. Many apologies were said and Alex let one of the bartenders...who I saw helping the other gentleman in the lounge...know I needed service. I don't remember the bartender's name, but he had a bald head. Excuse #1...Alex tells me the bartenders they didn't know I was there. Huh? They didn't see me walk in with the you? And on the flip side, you being the host didn't let the bartenders know that someone was seated in the lounge??

So, cocktail order and dinner order have been placed. I step away to go wash my hands and return to see that three more patrons have come to sit in the lounge area. I overhear one of the ladies say she wants to order a Strawberry Basil Gimlet, which happens to be the same drink I ordered a few minutes before. Then I notice that the bartender that took my order first brings the gimlet to the other woman. He then comes over to my table with bread and tells me my drink will be right up. Huh? Didn't I order my drink first? And right up was about five minutes later. 

My dinner arrives and was fabulous as always. The bartender comes to clear the table and I request a dessert menu. In the mean time, a few more patrons have come into the lounge and there is now a server on duty, which for some reason seems to ignore me. I figure it may be a territorial thing, since he hadn't been waiting on me to begin with. So I get his attention to ask if he could take my dessert order even though the bartender waited on me. He writes down my order and says he will let the bartender know what I want.

Dessert comes and is a winner. But the poor service really left a bad taste in my mouth and the tip I left reflected that. As I was leaving, I mentioned to the host Alex about the poor service. Excuse #2...one of the other servers/ bartenders called in sick, but they are usually pretty good servers otherwise. I would have bought that excuse if I would have received a "sorry to keep you waiting" at anytime during the time I was there. But everyone acted as their service was status quo.

Needless to say, I will not be returning to Ruth's anytime soon. If I do, I will make it a point to be seated in the main dining room as I have done in the past. Next stop, Morton's.
author: Dana W.

description: No Reservations but got seated right away + Roses all over the table for a special occasion + steaks to die for + creme brule` + impressive service = 5 stars all the way!!
author: Kim Sarah P.

description: This is my go to place in SF for a good filet mignon.  I've been here many times and every time, it's superb.  Yes, it's expensive here and everything is a la carte (meaning all the sides cost extra).  I don't know why, but I always order the filet with double butter.  I'm sure the other cuts of meat are great, but I only know the filet.  Even the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach are addictive.  I wish the sides weren't so small.  The cocktails are strong and decent.  Even my friend and sister who aren't all that crazy about steak love the steak here.  I've had excellent service here every time.  If you love steak, you have to try it here!
author: Linh H.

description:
This is probably my favorite restaurant. They cook the beef perfect to my taste and they do just as good with their sea-food. I think their creamed spinach may be the best side I've ever had. 
I've been to the one in Hawaii and it was no where near as good as this one. I have been to this location probably 5 or 6 times with my wife and have always had a 5 star experience.
author: Pete N.

description:
Let's start off by saying I've been to the Ruth's Chris in Pasadena, Ca and compared to that one....this one is like the awkward little brother =X. 

Food: 
When we come to a restaurant with $$$$ on Yelp you expect good good good good food. My filet mignon was delicious but that was expect. The lobster on the side that was served to us on the other hand was not. It was not fresh! Double ding!

Service:
Service was fairly decent. Though with reservations I don't expect to wait 10 minutes (we did). 

Environment: 
Why are people sitting so close to one another? This place felt really crowded...Is it because of the "Dine about Town" promotion? Seemed like that were a lot of college kids here. 

Price: 
It's lower than I remembered comparing it to the Pasadena location but it's pretty expensive considering I can find a steak just as good elsewhere with a better environment. And once again serving a lobster that is not fresh is not acceptable for the price I'm paying. 

Food: 3
Service: 4
Environment: 3
Price: 3
author: Sam T.

description: This is a chain of bad cut sinewy meat with waiters that no nothing about meat.  Expensive for what it is and very very very salty.
author: A J.

description:
Fancy double date night?  Ruth's Chris is the place to go.  Now, I realize this place doesn't really need my review, so I'll make it short and sweet:

The steak is amazing.  The service is fantastic.  The plates are hot.  The atmosphere is reminiscent of a classy, old school Italian, Frank Sinatra style joint.

Can't wait to go back and eat another 10 pounds of food with my friends.
author: S. F.

description: If you get the Ruth's Classics, substitutions of some sides and desserts are charged extra. They give so many Shoestring Fries. It's probably enough to serve 3-4 a fair amount. It'd probably fill up a standard rectangular to-go box. The Ribeye was great. I'd recommend getting Med-rare at most. I got Med and it was cooked correctly, but came out a tad dry in some areas.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Delicious rib eye. Soooo good. 

However....

I do not appreciate being put in the "ghetto" room when were paying $200 for dinner. Our room had a hooker in it. 

The service was ok, out waitress was very sweet but very absent. 

I wish they had more vegetables as sides or a macaroni and cheese side. I'm allergic to shellfish and don't eat veal so we couldn't get an appetizer. 

I think we might stick with Porterhouse for our next big night out.
author: Angelina M.

description: Had a really good time here the service is excellent and the food is great my wife really enjoyed her steak and so did I! The drinks were good and the atmosphere is relaxing it is a bit if noisy but that comes with any busy restaurant. If you get a booth that comes down a bit. I suggest that if you are trying to have a romantic dinner you ask for a booth and not a table and it's so busy that you will always walking by your table and at least in a booth you feel a better sense of privacy. I got the 16oz ribeye at Medium temperature and my wife got the 6oz fillet and shrimp Medium Well temperature she said she enjoyed every bite of her steak as I did!
author: Martin A.

description: Food aside, a busy place on Saturday night!, why not make a reservation?!  Apparently to Ruth Chris a reservation means you only have to wait 45 minutes!
author: Justin H.

description: I am updating my previous reviews from 1-start to 3-stars as I have since spoken with Laura, Ruth's Chris SF GM, and she responded back according to what I would expect from a manager.  She was extremely apologetic for the horrible experience and took the appropriate actions to rectify the issues at hand.  I won't go into detail what she said and did because I think all issues are handled on an individual basis so how she handled ours will not necessarily be the same with another patron.  I am only giving it a 3-star review because I still think it's unacceptable how the issue was handled to begin with.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Came here once with a friend for my birthday. This was a nice place, but hard to find parking on any weekend. So the four of us came here and ate steaks, an order of crab cakes and 2 glasses of wine. When the bill came, it was WOW!!

The service was great and the place was clean. The crab cakes and steak was cooked perfectly. Just anything special I would say no. If Black Angus or Outback pushed their customer service to be better and physically cleaned up the place, I would say it is about the same.
author: M C.

description:
RUN!!! don't walk here for Dine About Town!

House salad, 8 oz. petite filet mignon cooked to perfection w/ a side of creamy mashed potatoes, and key lime pie for dessert -- ALL FOR $34.95? YESSS.

I've been to the Sacramento location and it was deeeelicious so I knew SF would not disappoint. The salad was mediocre, but it's a steakhouse so that's fine by me. The steak... yuuuum. Just drooling thinking about it. It smells heavenly when they bring it out. The sizzling, buttery goodness. The other steak option was a 12 oz. ribeye, which was really good, but I'm glad I got the filet because it was more tender. I also got to try the creamed spinach -- both sides were yummy! Too bad they don't have the potatoes au gratin as an option, but that would be almost crazy for Ruth's Chris to offer an over the top amazing menu for DAT haha. The other dessert was bread pudding, and I liked both as well. The key lime pie was really creamy, with the right amount of tartness, and the bread pudding was well presented and gave me that home-y comfort feeling.

We also had wine -- the merlot and cabernet. Sans steak, I liked the merlot better since it had a greater depth to it but with the steak, the cabernet was a better match.

Tip: Even without the DAT special, they have a special summer menu with more options -- 3 courses for $39. I didn't opt for this because seriously, who can pass up filet mignon? And make sure you go to the gym before AND after eating here ;)
author: Miss H.

description:
Came here for a high-dollar meal.  

Harvest Salad- Mixed greens with roasted corn, dried cherries, crispy bacon and tomatoes in a white balsamic vinaigrette, topped with goat cheese and Cajun pecans.  I am not a fan of goat cheese, but the goat cheese on top of this salad was excellent.  Great salad.

Cowboy Ribeye
A huge bone-in version of this USDA Prime cut
It had a big pool of butter on the top of the steak.  The ribeye was sinfully delicious.  I finished this steak and savored every bite.
author: Brent T.

description:
This is a great place to get a great steak, I am not a picky eater, I had the petite filet Oscar style  which is a crab cake on top (but it tasted very fishy and was just not good) the au gratin potatoes were so drowned in cheese and tasteless. this means R.C didn't make an impression this time 


The Staff was great!!
author: Eva O.

description:
I'm not a huge steak person at all (in fact I think I can be vegetarian at times) but I am a big fan of Ruth's Chris. I came here for my birthday with a couple girlfriends last week and tried the DIne about Town. Our reservation was for 8:15 pm and we got there early at around 7:45 pm. Even though we had a reservation we didn't get seated until 8:45; I was nice and tipsy so I was okay with it but after my friends had a brief talk with the manager the place got us seated and they offered us free appetizers. We got complimentary calamari, seared ahi tuna, veal ravioli, and crispy lobster bites. The lobster bites were my favorite - the meat was plentiful and the sauce was very tangy. So even though we had to wait, I think the service during our meal more than made up for it. (I am a sucker for free food).

Main meal: Salad was just salad, but my entree of petite filet and shrimp was amaaaaazing. Yeah yeah everyone is hating because of butter but hey...the butter is delicious! The meat is so juicy and tender and the jumbo shrimp was equally tasty. I usually hate steak because I hate having to chew for long periods of time; the meat gets all dry an gross in my mouth. Ruth's Chris steak stays moist and flavorful. Creamed spinach was okay and I was too stuffed for the chocolate cupcake dessert but the appetizers + entree already made my day. I definitely recommend this place for a romantic date or birthday celebration. The DAT is a great deal too!
author: Joyce H.

description: For a steak house I was really disappointed in the meat. Maybe I just had a really bad cut... but it was not very tender or hot! :( The sides of creamed spinach, corn, and mashed potatoes were really good though and since it was my birthday, they gave me a HUGE key lime cheese cake that was delicious! Very disappointed by my steak though..
author: Sophia L.

description:
I'm a red meat eater so I had to try this place out. First time was several years ago. I wasn't blown away. The steak was good but it wasn't amazing as I had hoped. Thereafter, I've tried it a few more times just to make sure to give this place a fair chance. Still, I was not impressed so I've made up my mind to just stick to LB Steak since its a lot close to home. 
The stars do not reflect the service. The service was impeccable. Loved how the chef came out to the dining room to greet the customers. The waiter was very attentive and on point. Wonderful experience service-wise!
author: Khounkeo S.

description: My fav steakhouse in the bay! Went for my anniversary in January and had such a great experience, I chose to host my bday dinner there this past Saturday 6/7. Excellent server (Clark) and staff, food perfectly cooked, and great drinks! Only downside was they didnt note it was a bday and did not decorate the table...minor offense.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I came here last spring on the last day of school with my classmates to celebrate us surviving our first year of med school. We were more so celebrating the fact that no one had thrown themselves off the Golden Gate Bridge. 

I was a bit hesitant about coming to Ruth's Chris solely on the fact that my friend Nguyen once came here for a Christmas dinner and had a horrible experience. Something about a hour wait for cold steak, only to be full off of stale bread by the time food came out. Blah. I was hoping that my experience would be much better but that definitely wasn't the case. 

I was a bit disappointed when I found out there didn't have prime rib, so I settled for the petit fillet with creamed spinach and mashed potatoes. I like my steaks medium rare where it's still pink it the middle but it came out well done. (C'MON now, your a steakhouse, you should know how to cook a piece of meat) The creamed spinach and potatoes came out cold, nothing to rave about. The service was just so so, you had to practically raise your hand and keep it up to get some service. I seriously thought we were back in lecture again. 

We all gave the classmate that suggested to come here hell all night long. I would never come back here, I'd walk down the street to House of Prime Rib if I was looking for good food.
author: Ha N.

description:
My parents treated me to a post-graduation dinner. I was having a hard time picking out where I wanted to do until my dad suggested a steakhouse. I took them up on this offer. And boy did I agree with him.

This place is a classical steakhouse - not like Sizzler or Golden Corral. They treat everyone like a first class citizen. Their cuts of beef are probably the best I've ever had. The service is great. The wine and cocktail list is pretty through. 

I have their classics menu, their interpretation of a prix fixe menu. To start off, a Caesar salad. The main course was a 6oz filet and a 1/2 Maine lobster. The steak was perfect, tender and it didn't need A1. I'm a firm believer good steaks don't need steak sauce. The lobster was decadent. To finish off, a peanut butter panna cotta and homemade chocolate truffles finish off the meal. It was rich and unique - I've never had peanut butter in a panna cotta. To accompany the meal, a bottle of Syrah was split 5 ways. 

Now this place is expensive - I saw my mom drop $500 here yesterday. But it's as close to perfection as I've seen. This is definitely a once in a while indulgence. And it's surprisingly kid friendly too. We had two rugrats with us, they did their best accommodating them but the kids were begging to leave. And I saw a few babies here. Isn't this supposed to be a classy steakhouse? But still, I walked away impressed, while my mom walked away $500 lighter.
author: Navi T.

description:
This was my first time to Ruth's, I've heard mixed reviews so me and my wife had a chance to go out alone while we were in San Francisco, so we figured why not!
First we were warmly greeted at the door and immediately seated with plenty of room at the table. We were then promptly served drinks, even though I told the bus guy twice for ice water he still brought the mineral 8$ a bottle water..(whatever) 
We had a glass of wine, my wife had the Moscato, which she loved, and I had a Sonoma Oakwood Pinot Noir, it was spot on what our server recommended and paired well with our delicious steaks! The steaks were absolutely out of this world! One of the best I had ever had, easily. I had the lobster mac and cheese and it was also pretty epic.
Finally, I tried some of my wife's sweet potato pie. Before coming to this place I hated sweet potatoes, but after trying that delicious concoction- I think I may have to reconsider! Good job guys it was a great experience!
author: Matt S.

description:
An a absolutely perfect meal! 
Extraordinary and friendly service from both our server, Nicholas and the manager, Josh.
Hostesses were also very friendly and accommodating. 
My husband and I chose to dine here for our 1 year anniversary, and what a delicious and incredible experience it was!
A great wine list with many of my Sonoma, Napa and Russian River Valley favorites. 
Our appetizer, the barbecued shrimp (my husbands choice) was cooked perfectly and served over a creamy, rich sauce that was practically licked clean from the plate!  I don't usually order prawns or shrimp while out and about since they are so easily overcooked and become tough, but happily that was not at all the case here!!!
We also shared the surf 'n' turf rib eye and lobster tails which was by far, the best and most flavorful steak I have ever had! (And I am a home chef whose husband is the definition of a 'meat and potatoes guy') The tails were also cooked to perfection and seasoned just right. 
The sides ordered; Potatoes Au gratin and asparagus with hollandaise were also scrumptious. The potatoes slightly aldente, were prepared the proper way as to avoid soggy, mashed texture. 
This is an upscale, romantic experience that you won't want to miss out on! Not the place to go if you're looking for a diner quality, well done, sirloin served with A1 while watching the game. 
Overall an incredible meal was set over the top by the friendly, personable, professional and knowledgeable staff.  
You absolutely made our anniversary dining experience one that will be raved about for years to come! Thank you Ruth's Chris. 
We will most definitely be back!!
author: Sarah M.

description:
I really like this place. And while i've only eaten here once, I admit i can't attest for consistency, but my experience was surely enough to have me recommend and wanting to come back again. 

The waiter was amazing, he was both friendly and attentive. He very thoroughly described the process of how their steaks are cooked and even the exact temperature the plates are meant to be. Amazing. 

It's not a just dinner, Ruth's Chris Steak House is an experience. The food was amazing, the service was as well, and the ambiance is of course, extremely suitable for the caliber of the restaurant's food, service and name.
author: Pris S.

description:
Took the girlfriend here for her birthday dinner and I must say this place is pretty spectacular. A very high class and elegant dining experience and not to mention they decorated the table for her birthday. The service was excellent on top of great food. We ordered the crab cakes to start followed by the T-bone and ribeye, both cooked to perfection with the lobster mac and cheese and potatoes au gratin. Yes that is a lot of food and no we definitely did not finish it all, but was well worth the pricey bill. 

Pros: - Elegant and well rounded dining experience
- Great food and service
- Emphasize the little things (tell them what occasion it is and they'll do their best to acknowledge the night)
- The side dishes were like the cherry on top 

Cons: - A little dark for my taste 

In all this place was a great find especially for this type of occasion. Will definitely have to go back and try something new on the menu. Great for a special night out or for a casual dinner.
author: Nick I.

description:
Should really be 3.5 as an average. 

Lesson for the rest of the year: NEVER attempt to satisfy a craving at a well-known, high priced establishment! 

Hubby has had a huge craving for a really good piece of steak - to be specific, an awesome bone-in rib-eye. He calls me Friday and asks me what I thought about Ruth Chris.... ummm, expensive and the City were what came to mind. Was not really on my radar to try, to be honest. 

Anyway, no amount of trying to be logical was going to dissuade Hubby from his meat quest. Not the traffic that I warned him about (but still complained about), not the lights on Van Ness (which I also warned him about that, we couldn't avoid) and so on... 

Okay, overall: 

- Service - 5 stars - Salvatore was great 

- Meat (Cowboy Steak and Filet Mignon) - 4 Stars - what they tell you is that the meat is cooked in a 1800 degree grill, but keep in mind that it's not a flame broiler, so you will not get that char or any type of markings that add a boost to flavor. They are excellent cuts of meat, truly, but the preparation really doesn't inspire you to keep eating. 

- Spinach & Pear Salad - 1 Star - the salad was drenched in this dressing that I just couldn't figure out - it wasn't a raspberry dressing, so maybe cranberry? It made my salad inedible, and I love spinach and pear salad. I don't know why the pear would be sour too. 

- Shrimp cocktail - 4 stars - our daughter loved it even tho she wasn't feeling well. 

So, this w/a $120 bottle of Caymus was about $285 - expensive way to learn, but at least we can say we tried it, right?

Oh, just a quick comment on the atmosphere - felt very cliche. A lot of people we saw coming in, as we left, felt more like they were there to impress someone and were ready for a night out. Or a first date, trying to impress by buying an expensive meal.
author: V K.

description:
We used to frequent Ruth's Chris steakhouse on a pretty regular basis when the family lived in Pittsburgh, PA.  I have fond memories of it.  Last time I visited the one in SF was at least 2-3 years back ... during Dine About Town.  My friend ordered off the DAT menu, but I ordered the filet mignon which wasn't on the menu.  My bill was 2x his, but my meat was probably 3x as tender.  Fast forward to present day - for Dine About Town 2010.  I was wary ordering off the DAT menu, but this time they offered the cut I wanted.  It was delicious and just as I remembered it from dinners with my family.

I ordered the au poivre sauce ($3.00 extra) which was divine.  The peppercorns must have been cooked for hours to reach that level of tenderness.  The sauce is like concentrated love in the form of meat juice.  Our server Josh was a doll and it was a very nice meal with great friends.  Looking forward to DAT in June.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
I have been here in the past and typically its a 5 star but this last visit lowered it.

I went here to treat my friend as a x mas gift.  House of Prime rib was my first choice but it was filled till 930 so i decided to go to Ruth Chris

I made reservations online via yelp which was cool. got a slot for 730. heavy traffic so i didnt get there till 815. I actually called at 705 to move the reservation to 8.

We got seated quickly in a corner booth.

Bread water got there and then we got our server.

Not sure if it was hunger or just the attitude of our server but the rapport between paying customer and waiter was off the whole night

We ordered some wine to start off.  I know typically at places like this, they want you to dress up but some dude in a plain black tee was seated not too far away from us but our waiter andrew treated us like we were some kids that were going to share 1 plate. Like my money wasnt good.

We ordered a $38 bottle of white wine. ehhhh horrible recommendation.  When we were looking to order another bottle of wine andrew kept trying to sell us $98+ bottles. My friend who was paying for the drinks said hey my budget is around $40 what bottles can you recommend.  Andrew said not too much.  My friend is actually a bartender and learned about wines so she was trying to quiz the waiter on what to order for wine.

I think andrew got mini mad at some point so he said "none of these wines will really go well with what you already ordered"  So we got hard drinks instead.
He even told us he has been serving here for 15 years funny thing he def looked really young to be working for 15 years there.

Andrew friend came in and quarter of the night he spent talking to them. Lucky for us they got sat right behind me.

Food wise
Free bread really really good and fresh
Calamaria ehh 4/5 star
Spicy lobster def has a kick very good 5/5
white bean chorizo soup which was recommended by the waiter ehhh ok
my rib eye steak super good 5/5 i am sure the butter sauce is going to kill me later in life
the mushrooms ehhh ok i think i should have ordered mash potato
the Free desert with the set meal ehhh not too good.

You would think a party of 4 that put up a $500+ tab would get better service but i am guess this place gets like $200 a head average so we were toward the low end of their clients.  Next year going to book House of Prime Rib early
author: Justin I.

description:
Food: 4/5 - Solid but not amazing steaks - certainly not the best in SF (Harris'?). I've tried both the Filet and Rib-Eye, and they were certainly a good meal - but I've had far better steaks even at more casual places like Cattlemen's, which serves Harris Ranch beef. And yes, melted butter on a steak is pretty awesome, but I'd also say that an outstandingly aged piece of meat needs nothing else but to be cooked to perfection.

Service: 4/5 - Professional and friendly, but nothing memorable or super personable. Pretty good about coming around but it still has service that feels like what you might expect from a big chain. 

Ambiance: 4/5 - Typical steakhouse feel, a tad bit more modern than the old-school steakhouses though. It does attract some casual diners/tourists being that it is a chain, so it feels a tiny bit more casual - or at least acceptable to walk in underdressed. 

Value: 1/5 - I know it's not necessarily a fair comparison, but considering that the House of Prime Rib down the street offers a full meal for the same price or less than a single steak here ($40s and in some cases ~$50), this is in my opinion a rip. Add to that the fact that you need order salad, potatoes, vegetables, sides, for nearly $10 each, and you're spending a ton of money unless you're doing DAT, or ordering the cheapest steak and nothing else. And yes, I know steak does not = prime rib, but a rib eye here is pretty much the same meat as down the street. Also the potatoes, veggies, and salads are basically the same type of thing.
author: Kevin T.

description: Who knew great steak can be found at a premium chain? Charming atmosphere, dimly lit for old world romance. This location has multiple dining rooms with varying noise level. If you're dining in a large group, the main dining room will accommodate your needs. But for those intimate dinners, ask them to seat you in the smaller room behind the bar. It's cozy and filled with booths. Top choice here is the cowboy rib eye cooked rare plus, which is a level above rare but not quite med-rare, an invention of Ruth Chris. Why rare plus? Because the steaks are served on a sizzling hot dish so the meat continues to cook and stay warm for your palatable enjoyment. Warning: the dish is REALLY HOT!
author: Stephen Y.

description:
I came here with some friends for the Dine About Town deal- personally, I would have never came here if it wasn't for that, but I was willing to try since someone told me they are a steakhouse and I was pretty much sold at "steak-".

I am not sure if you have to dress up, because it was very dark inside so no one will really be able to tell- it is also very small, but that is OK, because I enjoy cozy settings and it helps to create a sense of intimacy. The hostess was nice and gracious enough, and we were able to sit almost immediately despite being late to our reservation. 

I ordered the Mixed greens; petite filet; mashed potatoes; and the berries with sweet cream and chocolate mousse in a chocolate shell duo. The salad is forgettable enough, and unfortunately I did not really like the steak. It was cooked medium-rare, the way I wanted to, but something about all that butter melting in the dish was a little unappetizing to me. I don't think it was very necessary, and made my steak extremely salty in the end. Also, the way in which they bring it out (sizzling in the dish, with warnings to exercise caution due to heat) was too much flair for me. The butter splashed on me and all over the table, and I was left wondering whether or not that was a little touristy. I did not care too much for the chocolate mousse (I was there for steak, after all), but the berries in sweet cream was a delightful surprise. It would not be enough for me to return, though.

Overall, the service was "Meh Ok"- our waiters paid less attention but I think it may have to do with the whole "Dine About Town" brush-off, since the table next to us who went off the regular menu had significantly better treatment. I probably wouldn't come back again (I've had better steak), but Ruth Fertel seems like a nice enough lady.
author: Jean L.

description:
It's a bit oxymoron but what the heck a "high end chain steakhouse", my second time at The RC.

On to the review we arrived on time for a reservation but were asked to wait the obligatory 15-20 minutes as the were "running behind" (why don't you throw down a few more doublooms at the bar while me make you wait). Looking at the half empty bar facing the street, the hostess offered us same service dining within the bar and got a cozy nook with a view of the street theater going on. What the heck...second time.

Everything is ala carte unless you do the pre fixe/seasonal menu. Given the seasonal menu had the meat we wanted, you're basicly paying five bucks for all the trimming rather than 30-40 more for a slightly enlarged choice menu. My last name isn't Rockefeller, I'll save my ducketts for The Alley in O-town.

The salad and soup were basic chain fare but the MEAT was MOOOO!!! Her filet was tender and meaty tasting. My ribeye was all marbled goodness, read fat is yummy, especially swimming in butter (the goes a week of Jullianne Micheals). The meat was great. Chased but the butter-fest potatoes and spinach. Sometime you gotta say "what the heck..." (extra workouts next week)

The fixed dessert was chocolate cheese cake with salted orea crust chased by vanilla ice cream...really gotta workout now.

I am not one to throw down franks like they're going outta style but sometimes you gotta say what the heck!
author: vic f.

description:
I have been to most all of the steak houses in San Francisco and the drill is pretty much the same.  They all cook up a great piece of meat but it is the sides and the service that distinguish them. Last night the sides were really good.  A lobster Mac n Cheese of very high quality.  The cheese sauce was very creamy.  No fats separated out etc. 

I understand that some people have had bad service at this place.  Ours was impeccable.  Friendly and we felt like we were her top clients of the week. 

A very extensive wine list with a lot of top quality choices.
author: Ralph M.

description:
My favorite thing about this place is the ambience. You get amazing food, great service without the loud background music or noise coming from the bar area. Love this place! T-bone is the way to go! And
Don't forget the string fries, they are delicious!
author: Anna B.

description:
My fiance and I and his parents came her on Friday night with a reservation for 6:45.  We arrived on time, but for some reason the host didn't see our reservation.  I explained that I made it on open table and was going to show her the email confirmation, but then she found it and said something about 1/2 of our party already being there, which was not true because we all arrived together.  Either way, they weren't ready for us and had us wait in the bar.  We had a drink while we waited, and shortly after got seated in a really nice corner booth.  

Of course we went a little crazy with the ordering, but everything was delicious.  We started with the crab cakes which were stuffed with crab - no other fillers, and they were really good.  A little expensive though for 2 small cakes.  My fiance and I shared the wedge salad, and his parents shared the caesar.  Both were really good - the dressing for the wedge was amazing.  Pure bleu cheese!

We ordered 4 sides, creamed spinach, potato gratin, asparagus, and sauteed mushrooms.  All were good but the asparagus seemed a little over cooked.  

My fiance and his dad both ordered the rib-eye, which was this huge steak.  I had the filet and lobster, and fiance's mom had the filet.  For some reason, our waiter messed up and brought my fiance out a lobster tail instead of his steak.  He didn't have to wait too long for her to bring the steak.  My lobster was a bit overcooked, which I'm thinking is because we were waiting for his steak to come out before eating, and they keep their plates at 500 degrees.  I shouldn't have had them take it out of the tail for me.  

Delicious food and will be back!
author: Kristen V.

description: Ever had the perfect steak that cost as much as a tank of gas? I did! Highly recommend this place to people.
author: Mark Q.

description:
I brought my wife here for her birthday dinner. We both ordered from the fixed menu, which was a really great deal. I ordered the filet medium rare. If I go back, I'll order it rare, as the plate that they serve the steak on is scalding hot and continues to cook the steak. The butter wasTheir key lime cheesecake was out of this world delicious.

The service was great, and I appreciated that they acknowledged my wife's birthday but didn't do anything embarrassing like sing, clap, or make a big scene. 

I'd definitely return.
author: Pema L.

description:
500 reviews?? Wow@that!

Oh how I love Ruth's Chris and it's reliable chain style locations.. they are in every city I want to be in and can be counted on when I can't figure out where else to go. I also love RC's blatant disregard for the cardiac health of it's patrons, and if they don't care then why should I? At least during my time spent there.. the next day however upon reflection, I have to wonder why even knowing just how bad it is for me I still ate it lol.

Anyhow, I came here on a weeknight and the place was pretty empty 'cept for a few other tables that had a couple people at them. Where the crowd that gives 500 reviews was, I dunno. Safe to say on weeknights tho, you won't need a rez. 

This Ruth's Chris had a less open feel to it and felt more like private dining. The dining room(s) were off to the back and removed from the bar area. While I liked this, I kinda didn't like not seeing the staff as much as I usually do. Still our server was very attentive. 

The food:

Lobster Bisque: one of my *have to order* things when I come here. Yummy :)

Filet W/Gorgonzola: Very tasty! And yes, I put cheese on a steak that was already riding the sizzling butter plate.. not like it was going to make it any more unhealthy! I asked for it seared and seared is what I got, very red and juicy.

Filet W/Stuffed Lobster Tail: I tried the lobster tail and it was "eh". I'm not a big fan of seafood stuffing in general. It all taste like a crab cake to me and I don't find crab cakes to be anything amazing.

My daughters Filet: LOL, it was huge! They must have given her the manly, mans cut! 

Hash Browns: In my own opinion I can sum these up with the word "EW". They were way too greasy.. yeah, yeah I know "it's Ruth's Chris, what did you expect??". But this was grease overload. I didn't like the way they looked but still tried a spoonful of them. They were like a greasier version of Denny's hash browns. Nothing special and I don't get why our server raved about them. 

Shoestring Fries: They're fries.. just fries. However, they're good if you like fries.

For sides I would recommend the Potato's Au Gratin :) However my daughter didn't want them and my friend is lactose intolerant so we ordered the other stuff. 

Mojito's here are also very good :)

In summary, Ruth's Chris is a chain and that may make the jaded roll their eyes, but it's a good chain. I myself go "pffft" at the thought of chain restaurant dining. However, Ruth's has yet to leave me anything less then satisfied, full, and of course fearing for my poor hearts health.. in a good way of course ;)
author: Kristy E.

description:
Okay so this is my Hubby and I hidden little spot, we come once or twice a year and enjoy ourselves, the service is ALWAYS top notch.
A few weeks ago we celebrated our Anniversary and we have a baby so the kids with the babysitter and we were out!
They put rose petals all over the table to say "happy Anniversary" 
The food was amazing, i actually had the Lobster instead of Steak and it was amazing!
they even sent us desserts that said Happy Anniversary.
sometimes it is the little things that people do that mean the most!
thank you
author: stephanie p.

description:
When the BF and I first got together, he promised one day, he'll take me to Ruth Chris, where the steak is awesome and you can't get in with jeans. Six birthdays later, one day came (totally not his fault - it's all me). 

My birthday fell on a Tuesday this year, so reservations were a snap. We were quickly seated and had a long discussion over the menu. Our server, Ryan, was helpful, friendly, and personable. I felt like he loved everything about the restaurant and was excited about the food, which in turn got me excited about the food. The BF gets so happy hearing the sizzle of the plates. With Ryan's help, we decided we wanted to do the deal of salad, entree, and dessert, with extra sides. Here's what we ordered:

- Seared Ahi Tuna - LOVE. This is a definite must get if you're into raw seafood. So flavorful. It seriously just melts in your mouth like butter. I think I've said that in past reviews on other things but this definitely fits the description. 

- Sizzlin Blue Crab Cakes - Nothing but pure, delicious crab. In the size of a small cake substantial cake. So much substance. So much crab. Yummy.

- Caesar Salad - Mine. I don't eat salad but it came with the deal so why not? Typical Caesar salad with tons of cheese but it was huge! I ate a third of it, yet it looked like I didn't even touch it. 

- Steak House Salad - His. He said it was okay, but that my salad tasted better. 

- Petite Filet with Shrimp - Mine. Shrimp and beef was cooked perfectly. Beef was tasty, but I felt that it was a little too salty for me. Side of creamed spinach for me. Yum.

- Ribeye - His. I liked his more. Tender and flavor was on point. Side of mashed for him. Perfect.

- Molten Chocolate cake - Mine. Came with a candle, compliments of Ryan. It was totally delicious, but I wish it had more ice cream cus it was so chocolatey and thick. And after a meal like that, I couldn't finish my cake. Sad face. But I would've taken a couple of more bites if there was more ice cream.

- Raspberry Sorbet - His. He loves raspberry and he loves sorbet. Win win for him.

Oh and the other thing that I absolutely LOVED (other than the apps, haha) was my drink: Fresh Berry Martini. Blueberry + vanilla vodka goodness. So smooth and yummy. It was perfect. I would've definitely ordered another one. I should've ordered another one. I'll order it when we come back...when one day comes around again (:
author: Sandy L.

description:
I've been a frequenteur of Ruth's Chris in the past. I've been here more than 10 times on meetings, dates, and just to hang out with friends, (I had a glowing review for this location in the past, in 2008) but I will never go to this location again. The complete lack of respect the staff had for us during our trip was simply appalling, and their complete disregard of my opinions made me realize that the owners of this chain do not care about their customers in the least. It's really sad how far this place has fallen.

They absolutely don't care about how they're reviewed, we told them since we'd been treated so poorly, we'd leave a negative review on yelp, and the manager told us they "could not care less about what someone says on yelp" about them. I guess they think that when you're a chain restaurant you can afford not to care about your customers.

If they choose not to serve paying customers with dignity and respect, we will not bring our service to them. Skip this place in favor of one of the many other steakhouses which actually care about their customers.
author: David C.

description:
me: (Open's door to Ruth's Chris)
me: *sniff*
me: ...
me: *SNIFFFFFF*
me: "Is that... BUTTER?!"

Ah, yes it was. I thought the waitress was adding mood lighting to my table, and it turns out it was butter in a bowl with a tea light underneath it to keep it warm.

The $35 DAT dinner menu at Ruth's is a great bang for your buck. 12 ounce rib eye, a side, a salad, and a dessert (to share between 2). I loved the butter soaked steak and the butter soaked mashed potatoes. My attempts to be healthy were futile as the creamed spinach was not only soaked in heavy cream, but also.. butter, ofcourse. Come to think of it, I bet the Chocolate Sin Cake was made of butter too. It LOOKS like a cake, but it tastes like a truffle (e.g. 90% butter, 10% chocolate). 

It would've easily been a 4 had I not had to cut out 4 ounces of fat from my 12 ounce steak.
author: Jess C.

description:
3.5 Star

Finally made it to Ruth Chris tonight for the Dine About Town Special with my girlfriend.

Ambiance is modern and dimmed lights that sets the mood for romantic events... very nice!

Customer Service is wonderful... seated us once we entered this restaurant and waiter was very attentive and friendly!

Bread - It was wonderful... soft and fluffy! Yummmm...

1st course: Salad with balsamic vinaigrette - this is okay... nothing special about this salad... just spring mix salad with dressing...

2nd course: 8 ounce petite filet with a side of mash potatoes - this is a really good steak but I asked for a Medium Rare and it turned into a Medium Well Steak... I think it's because they had the plate heated up with a lake of butter on it (pretty darn fatty... ask for little or no butter if you are not used to this)... it sizzles on the plate upon arrival!!! This is what Ruth Chris is known for! Unfortunately, it keeps cooking while it's on their way out to our table... If you want a Medium Rare steak at Ruth Chris... make sure you ask for Rare... it will probably be perfect by the time it gets to you! My piece of steak was still pretty tender at this point! *two thumbs up* and it was pretty tasty! Mashed potatoes was buttery and creamy! Yummy in the tummy!

3rd course: Ruth's Symphony - this is okay... Chocolate mousse inside of a chocolate shell and it was paired up with a yogurt-like dessert with berries on top... it was a great pair because it kind of balanced out the sweetness from the rich chocolate but I bet it would be great for true chocolate lovers....

Overall, I thought this was a great dining experience. The Dine About Town deal is great because the original cost of the steak alone was $35 and sides were supposedly is charged separately.. but this deal included the side and dessert!

I will definitely come back to explore the rest of the menu someday!
author: Mi H.

description: Unbelievable wait between salad and main course...ribeye really greasy. Potato was excellent as was wedge salad.
author: Summer G.

description: amazing place!!! My bake potatoes was alive steak amazing everything was just delicious from appetizers to main course and everything in between
author: Allie A.

description: Can't believe that I never reviewed this place after visiting here so many times! I think this is our go-to steak place if we feel like some real good steak! We've tried other "famous" steak places around bay but they all tasted nasty. Every time we went we never bothered trying our luck looking for parking in that area. We went straight for valet. We went there for all occasions, from b-day dinners to friends get-together. Every time we went it was great experience. We always go for porterhouse for 2. That can feed my husband and I perfectly. We tried NYC Strip before but we still like porterhouse the most. The service was very nice and fast. The stuff were warming and courteous. It was pricey especially if you oder wine but it was worth it!!!
author: Bob H.

description: Everything about the restaurant was perfect right after my boyfriend and I were greeted by a very rude hostess. She was of Asian decent and was working between the time of 5-5:30pm on Friday the 18th. We arrive to the restaurant about ten minutes early to our 5:30 reservation for our 5 year anniversary dinner and we checked in and politely asked her where the restrooms were. She told us that she will show us to the restrooms once we are seated to our table. That was fine so we sat down and patiently waited UNTIL a group of 4 older people came in who were ALSO early for their reservations, (we are 20 and 21 years old). They were talking about how they needed to use the restrooms and the hostess immediately showed them where it was and sat them down at their table BEFORE us. My boyfriend and I were very upset because this was the one little problem we had on our very special day. She made us feel like we weren't getting the service that we had expected from a Ruth's Chris Steak house as paying customers simply because of our age. It was very appalling coming from such a great restaurant. Hostess aside, the dinner was great and the rose petals on the table and surprise dessert at the end was simply icing on the cake. Also, our server, Patrick was great! All in all we had a good experience AFTER the rude hostess.
author: Vanessa T.

description: The steak was amazing. We ordered the Ruth's classics, and still ended up taking half of it home. We saved room for dessert though. The classic meal came with a cinnamon cheesecake with peach compote that was incredible. We were having dinner here to celebrate a birthday, and this definitely made it special.
author: Melanie R.

description:
First things first. I have to compliment how amaaaaazing our waiter, Jesse, was for our dinner. He was so friendly and over-the-top helpful. A bit too enthusiastic, but it made the dining experience 100x's better after our 40 minute wait (even with reservations) on a Thursday night. 

I made reservations for 7:45pm with my boyfriend for Dine About Town. Got there around 7:35 and was told they were 10-15 minutes behind schedule. Ended up being 40 minutes until we got seated. Once our grumpy selves got to our table, we were greeted by our waiter and our frowns turned upside down. He asked if it was our first time dining here. I told him I've had it in San DIego, but my boyfriend has never been so our waiter went and gave us the gist of Ruth Chris. USDA approved corn-fed beef from the top 2% of America, yadayadayada, 500degree plate don't touch, yadayada. 

We initially went there for the Dine About Town special going on this month, but we glanced over that menu and decided to go with the Ruth's Classic menu which was their version of a prix fixe menu.

BUTTER. This whole place is about how wonderfully fluffy and light their whipped butter is. Butter on the bread, butter on the steak, butter on the mashed potatoes (which is already loaded with butter). I cannot get over how amazing their butter is. I can sit there with my loaf of bread and just have butter the entire night. FATTY STATUS, but shit. Once a year? I'll take all of it.

Appetizers: 
- Seafood gumbo - It was good, nothing special about it. I wish there were bigger chunks of andouille sausages in it. The soup had shredded chicken and a hint of crab meat or something...?
- Steak salad - No steak in it. It's just called a steak salad for some reason, but it was full of arugala. I haaaate arugala!  Why did I order it? I needed some greens for a healthy diet.

Entrees:
- Filet Mignon & Shrimp - I ordered a 6oz filet and a side of 3 cajun shrimps on the side. Nothing special about the shrimps. The filet was amazingly juicy and tender. WAY TENDER. And of course, I plopped on more butter onto my already-buttered-steak. De-effin-licious. 
- Ribeye: Definitely meaty. Not just the size of the ribeye, but the taste was purely beef. If you like steak for its flavor, go with ribeye. Leave the tenderness to the filet. 

TIP: Both my boyfriend and I had the chefs prepare our steaks in between a medium rare and medium. If it was a tad on the bloody side, just let it sit on your scorching hot plate and it will continue to pink to the way you'll like it.


Sides: 
- Sauteed mushrooms - Literally just 5 pieces of mushrooms sitting in a soup. Tasted like how mushrooms should taste. 
- Potato Au Gratin - I remember this being better when I dined in SD. I guess I was so overloaded on the butter that the creaminess of the au gratin was a bit too much for me to handle.

Dessert:
- Creme Brulee - A classic. The top is yummy. The rest of yummy. Can't go wrong with that.
- Bread pudding - I kinda liked it and I kinda didn't. It was a large portion. Big enough to share, even among 3-4 people. Warning: The sauce taste straight up like Jack Daniels. Brought the rest to go.


For all this, the bill was only $125 (tip included). Definitely a steal for this amazing gourmet meal. :)
author: Rosanne L.

description: This place has a nice Atmosphere but  there were several things  I didn't like about this place. They do have vallet but it cost 10$ This Atmosphere is nice it's kind of a little bit dim in the but more of a romantic atmosphere if thats what you like now service started off good They have an absolute amazing blueberry mojito  which I very much enjoyed The main course came out and I did like it however I felt the quality entrées were super greasy just something that I did not  like  now what really upset me is the waiter went To bag our stuff up the waiter actually spilt a whole glass of water in my lap and was very non  reluctant to apologize about He also spilled water on my steak and promised me another one which was never bagged and put with our food so i ended  up with no steak i barely touched the one i had  he wasn't very upset that he spilled on me either I was not really interested in eating here again the food is very nice and it's decent but I won't come back unless my bf wants to. Oh and here's the kicker we were having a conversation were actually asked to be quieter at the table was the last thing that really was the last straw
author: Alice B.

description:
This review is long overdue. Years ago I loved this restaurant... Until the day I found a short curly hair in my strawberry of my dessert. Gross..

Apparently no one could see it but me (including the ditsy waitress) so I actually had to touch the disgusting thing and pull it out with my fingers as proof. 

Waitress offered me another one of the same dessert but nothing more. No discount no other dessert option nothing. Just the same dessert again which probably had more little hairs hiding somewhere. This is not acceptable service in my book for an incident that was so disgusting to experience especially at an expensive steakhouse. I kept my cool.

I used to bring groups here a few times a year but since then have taken my business elsewhere.

If you do decide to eat here.. I used to really enjoy a filet mignon with a blue cheese crust.
author: A. Z.

description:
We went here for my birthday - first visit.  Everything was wonderfully presented thanks to our waiter, Patrick.  There were birthday decorations on the table and I received a lovely dessert.  But first, Patrick assisted with picking out the proper wine for our tastes; our steaks were AMAZING as were the sides.  Dishes were served at a  very nice, leisurely pace throughout the dinner.
Him - 11 oz Filet, medium with the blue cheese crust
Me - Two 4 oz filets medium rare with shrimp
Shared - Lettuce wedge salad, Potatoes au Gratin, Asparagus with Hollandaise
Note - the side dishes are definitely big enough for two to share.
Pricing is on the high end but I highly recommend Ruth's for special occasions and indulgent splurges.
author: Denise V.

description:
This was my first Ruth Chris experience, so I have to say I could have done better if I knew that they cooked your steak ALL in butter and if you don't ask for butter on the side you will be sick to your stomach after the second bite. So here it is folks: STAY AWAY FROM THE BUTTER! Also, I found that getting a porterhouse was a little better (my second time, not at the same location) than a regular steak on your own plate because the plate is so hot, if you order medium rare, it becomes medium pretty quickly at the end of the meal and then you kind of lose what you paid for.

I am not recommending this place only because it's not fantastic steak and the San Francisco location is terrible, you HAVE to valet! If you must go to a Ruth's Chris, go to the Walnut Creek one, you will have a far better experience. And get the porterhouse! ... and hold the butter!
author: Lorrie M.

description: Mine and the hubby's fave "special occasion" restaurant in the world. If we are celebrating something, for sure we come here. You can't go wrong with the ribeye and mashed potatoes (ask for loaded and they will put butter, bacon, sour cream etc. ) sautéed mushrooms are scrumptious as well but always, always save room for the fresh berries and cream for dessert. I always lick the cup clean :P
author: Kate C.

description:
Another DAT experience: It was $34.95? 

Notables:

Server - Ryan. 
Loved my blue cheese crust slab of meat ($4 extra).
Corner seating
7:30pm reservations with 30 minute wait.
Chocolate cake and a side of  yogurt like syrup with blueberries, raspberries and strawberries.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Hello Yelpers first of all the side dishes were tasty and delicious and the  ribeye was incredible. It was cooked perfect and it was so juicy and tasty and tender. I recommend the ribeye. My friend Jenny took me here for dinner....your just so sweet. Thanks doll I enjoyed the food and company.
author: Fred W.

description: Large portions and very very good steak.  Had the T-bone and it was enough for two.  Service was excellent and restaurant was very clean.
author: D L.

description:
A Tale of Two Sittings.

First Sitting:
We went earlier this year for Dine about Town and the steaks were horrendous -- low grade cuts of meats with little to no flavor.
The thing is the year before we enjoyed that dinner.
The experience was so bad I e-mailed them to voice my disappointment.  No response.
What was most disconcerting was a lot of other people experience the same subpar steak dinners.

Can you say temporary boycott and less than favorable Yelp review?

Second Sitting:
We cautiously went back thanks to a gift certificate and hankering for red meat.
Dinner was definitely better this time around.
The NY Strip and Fillet Mignon, respectively, were slightly overcooked but still satisfied my wants for a succulent and juicy steak.
Here's the kicker: a couple weeks they sent me a hand written postcard which read they looked forward to my next dining visit.
Holy Moly, I never expected that -- maybe I will go back.

The Constant about both sittings:
Both times the service was above average, and the salads and side dishes are pricey but solid.

The Big Difference:
The steaks were pretty good at the second sitting.

Overall, 3.5 stars -- rounded down because it's a chain place folks and it'd have to be out of this world to get four or five stars in my book.
author: Dan B.

description:
Out of all the Valentine's dinners I've had with my boyfriend for the past four years, I think Ruth's Chris was the best. Melting Pot was the worst (read my review and know why..).

They offer valet parking at Ruth's Chris. My bf and I didn't have cash so we parked in the parking ourselves. Valet parks in the same parking lot, just that you have to pay cash up front and I guess if you don't want to walk 10 feet because the parking lot is right next to it, lol.

My boyfriend and I ordered the steak with lobster tail, filet mignon, mashed potatoes and asparagus. I believe that it was priced right. Way better than Melting Pot that makes you cook your food in broth (Makes no sense!).

The waitress wasn't lying when she said the plates were going to be hot because I felt like my plate was way too far from me so I brought it closer and it was definitely hot. My filet mignon was so hot, it was still sizzling when I got it. I'm not too much of a fan of asparagus but I do love mashed potatoes.

The atmosphere of the restaurant was good but I felt that there wasn't very much personal space. We sat between two couples so it felt awkward at first but not so much after. I don't even think the waiters/waitresses were able to get through the tables, lol. 

Our waitress was below mediocre. She wasn't attentive whatsoever. She never checked up on us or gave us refills. She pretty much didn't visit us at all. Reason why I gave only 4 stars. I mean, the doormen/valet people were more nice.

I'll most likely visit again. My bf and I went to Outback Steakhouse two days after and it could not compare! I still like Outback but after eating Ruth's Chris, there IS a difference.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Forget the steak. This is the place that confirmed that my favorite dessert is, in fact, key lime pie. When it comes to pie, Ruth's Chris does not mess around. The key lime pie is this ginormous mound of tart deliciousness. It is green, It is creamy. It is amazeballs.

As for the steak, it's very good. Mine was cooked to medium rare perfection, but my boyfriend had to send his back once because he had asked for medium rare and it came out close to well done. But, the staff was more than accommodating and the manager even came by to check on us afterward. For the record, the new steak was also amazeballs.
author: Genevieve W.

description:
I treated a couple of friends for their birthdays on Saturday night at Ruth's Chris Steak House.  Everything about the experience was wonderful, from the venue, to the service, to of course, the food.

We ordered from the Dine About Town menu, which comes with a steak salad for the appetizer, 4 choices for the main course (with a choice of creamed spinach or mashed potatoes for the side), and a chocolate cupcake with vanilla ice cream for dessert.  For the main course, I had the 8oz. steak, and my friends had the stuffed chicken and barbecued shrimp.  The best part was smelling and hearing the food sizzle when they bring it out on hot plates.

I would definitely come back here again, Dine About Town or not. Highly recommended!
author: Marlon E.

description:
My husband and I came here with another couple for the DAT (Dine Around Town) dinner menu, however, we ended up ordering from the general menu as the Ruth Chris's classic comes out to be worth the price compared to DAT menu for the type of food we wanted.  Don't get me wrong as the DAT menu is also of great value for a 3-course meal.  

This is my husband's first time to RC and he loved it.  He ordered exactly what I ordered my first time (RC's Classis-Rib Eye).  I ordered the lamb chops and it was quite delish.  Very juicy and cooked just right for medium well. I do not recommend the green jelly that comes along with the entree.  Not sure if it was a dipping sauce for the chops, but it was so distasteful to my sensory.  Other than that, my entree was yummy.

I was satisfied with my first experience and my satisfaction continues with this 2nd experience though at a different RC.
author: SuYen N.

description:
Came here on Sunday for Dine About Town. I've heard so much about Ruth Chris over the years, even when I lived in LA about the Pasadena location. I've been told good and bad things, and finally I'm trying it!
The food is a solid 3.5 stars, and our waiter was so good I bumped it up to 4 stars!
We made reservations for four at 6:30pm. My friend arrived almost 20 mins early, and asked to be seated first. The hostess made them wait and said the reservation is for 6:30 so just wait. It's odd since there are empty tables open. This happened right after my bf was telling me about how they have negative reviews on wait time even when people make reservations. They were seated right before we arrive, so it was 6:30 prompt. It was rather empty considering it's D.A.T. and a Sunday.
They also offer 3/4 course set menus at 39.99 or 49.99, the food was not very expensive. Not sure why the four $ signs, more like three to me. Our meal was a bit more pricy since we added on additionals and had a bottle of wine.
My bf and I both got the petite filet D.A.T. menu, and added on a crab cake for an additional $14. The filet was not bad, but nothing spectacular like some people raved about. Maybe if this was years ago I would have been ecstatic over the steak, but as time and my wallet has progressed over the years, so has my taste buds. Don't get me wrong, I like some chili cheese fries from fatburger or nations, and I can chow down on in-n-out & McDonalds, but when it comes to fine dining or higher end dining, I expect a little more.
Bread was warm, and it tasted ok, it actually tasted better the next day, I ate about 1/2 loaf sitting at my desk! The salad was not impressive. It was just...... salad.
Steak was not bad, crab cake was filled with crab meat, asparagus was well seasoned and the sauce was good too.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Kxwc8PIKy2JsegNwgBjAtA?select=c3mIXRZBv3bGvQTdmMHaYw
The dessert of the day was good, and the waiter was nice enough to bring out an extra one for my friend who didn't do the D.A.T. menu. I forgot what he called it, but pretty much tastes like chocolate cupcake with cream cheese frosting, and vanilla ice cream with raspberry syrup. I liked it =)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Kxwc8PIKy2JsegNwgBjAtA?select=ydbvkyFjEofESZSotwDTFg
The steak comes out on a VERY hot sizzling plate, I was busy making conversation and enjoying my cab I did't pay attention to the waiter who said the plate was VERY hot 3 times! When I saw the mashed potatoes come out I tried to move my plate to make room. BURNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN! OUCHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH! The waiter was really nice, he got me a glass of ice right away, he offered me burn spray. I had my left hand in the ice as I ate my dinner LOL. And he brought out another glass of ice half way through my meal to switch off. He is the reason why this is a FOUR star review vs. three. Too bad I can't remember his name, like I said, I wasn't paying attention. =P 
The mashed potatoes were buttery & creamy, the creamed spinach was not impressive although everyone talks about it in their reviews.
I would come back, the food is good/decent, but not impressive.
And I will never touch the steak plate again, even if I was drinking a whole bottle of cab!
author: Jenny W.

description: I gave DAT another try when my friend booked a nice dinner for a girls' night out.  I have to say, they were extremely accommodating and friendly.  They did not try to promote their own prixe fix menu whatsoever.  My girlfriends brought their own wines, and the evening was unforgettable.  Subsequently, my husband and I returned to celebrate our Valentine's dinner twice.  Ironically, we got the same waitress both times - she's awesome!  We will return soon enough.
author: Christine R.

description:
I'm always weary of chain restaurants but Ruth's Chris does not disappoint. Each time we have eaten here our steaks come out superb.

On our last visit the hubby and I each had a ribeye medium rare (along with the fully loaded hash browns). Our friends had the petite filet each and shared a baked potato. Since I've discovered good meat I never need sauce for my steaks anymore and consider it a blasphemy when I see people adding it to theirs and ruining a prime piece of meat. No sauce needed here!

On a previous visit, we shared a cowboy ribeye along with fully loaded lyonnaise potatoes. We also started off our meal with the barbecued shrimp which was extremely tasty. We have yet to try dessert here but I would like to eventually try the caramelized banana cream pie. 

I know there are other steakhouses in the city but Ruth's Chris is definitely a winner.
author: Bernadette A.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. A few friends swear by Ruth's Chris claiming that it is one of the best steakhouses in the Bay Area, with trusty reviews like that I was expecting melt in your mouth steaks. I ordered the Ruth's Chris classic menu option which came with a starter, entree and dessert.

Starter: Spinach and pear salad- it was ok tasting. The dressing reminded me of some cheap bottled dressing. The pears were really soft so I gently placed them on the side.

Entree: Ribeye done Med-Rare...Let's just say I got a whole spectrum of steak. On the  left side the steak was blue! The cow was still practically mooing. On the right side I had medium well steak. Besides the temperate being off the steak itself was horribly tough. I really did not taste like I spent 40 dollars for this steak. Another problem I faced was that the steak was served on "the surface of the sun" kinda plate. It was super hot the waiter stated that it was approximately 500 degrees. What it did was continue to cook my steak. So by the end of the night I was eating chewy shoe leather.

Dessert: With the Ruth's Chris classic came a standard chocolate cheesecake and berries. The cheesecake was really tart and lacked much needed sugar. The cheesecake was like a combination of chocolate mousse and cheesecake. The texture was all wrong. The berries did not make sense with the dish they just sat to a side, the dish was not cohesive.


Cocktail: The worst part of the meal was the cocktail. It tasted like cough syrup. It was so gross. Theoretically the idea of a Rosemary Raspberry Cosmo sounded delightful, but execution was horrendous to say the least.

I will not be back.
author: Tess R.

description:
So I guess we should have known when our cab driver (a charming 68 year old gentleman who raved all about his 26 year old girlfriend) questioned WHY we wanted to go to Ruth's Chris. Should have known.

Walked in and was told there would be a 30 minute wait for our reservation. Yes, that's right. Little apology, little explaination, and NO customer service. See i'm used to dining experiences where a wait results in some passed bread or apps to your overpacked waiting area and bar. Or perhaps a comp'd glass of wine (Celadon in napa did this for a 5 minute wait on a reservation, Spettro in Oakland does it whenever the wait is long). I mean, I recieved free garlic bread waiting at Little Star Pizza for crying out loud and they didn't take reservations at the time! So learn something. Even a hostess walking through and apologizing for the delay and checking in would have been better than the shrug you gave your guests. 45 minutes later we got to sit.

Bartenders were very friendly and accomodating, considering there were practically people hanging from the rafters the place was so packed. The waiter was also fast and friendly, which was generally appreciated. Confirmed with the staff that this was a result of Dine About Town. Of course, the only reason I, too, wanted to check this place out was the thought of getting a good steak at a rad price.

The thing is, why dontcha try not booking so many people in when DAT is going on? The bartender informed me that they had served over 400 dinners before we even arrived.

Glad I did actually because it wasn't worth as much as it would normally cost. I like "drenched in butter" as much as the next girl, but really? Nothing special at all. There are too many fine establishments in SF who treat their customers better and serve a better meal.
author: Nikki M.

description: Well well well.... Someone got it right here... Props to the staff and management here. I had one of the best cuts of meat I've ever had here. The Bison Rib-Eye with a creole mustard and basted in fresh butter. Oh lord yes. I also had someone talk the wines over with me and got recommended an amazing Chardonnay called Roccioli. We had a big group and everything was spot on. I brought 2 huge J Brut Reserve Magnum bottles and they only charged 25 each for corkage. Not bad. The A La Carte sides were also cooked properly. We probably ordered the whole damn menu behind all of us. Nothing bad.
author: Chris P.

description: My parents took me here for my 21st a few years ago.  Honestly, anything you order here is going to be nothing short of excellent.  All I remember from the drunken stupor that was my 21st birthday was that they make a mean Whiskey Sour and the food was perfect.  I took some home for leftovers, which did not depreciate!
author: Sam K.

description:
Glad that I could finally make it here (I have been steadily conquering SF's restaurant list through the years...). Amazing feat that for once, i was able to round up 8 friends to come with me... all from my community service fraternity. :)

The place is very nice. Has the typical classy steakhouse look. Dimly lit inside, dark paneling, classic ambiance - even the people matched the restaurant (older, refined groups of people). My group of friends and I, ranging in age from 23-32, definitely stood out!

Dine About Town menu ($34.95):
- Steak House Salad
- 8oz. Petite Filet (others had the 16oz. for an additional $10)
   entree complement- Au Poivre Sauce (additional $3)
- Side dish of mashed potatoes or creamed spinach
- Ruth's Sympohy dessert
- 2 bottles of wine (Penche Argentproprietary Red, Napa Valley, CA 2006, $45 each, what a steal!)

The salad was nice and simple. Dressing was not heavy; it was just right.

My medium rare petite filet was  amazing! The au poivre sauce on top was nice and spicy. I loved the peppercorns.

The creamed spinach was a-ok. I liked my friend's mashed potatoes much more.

Dessert was two cute little cups. One of them looked like some kind of chocolate mousse in a chocolate cup with garnish on top. The other was a custard-like dish (served in a ramekin, just like creme brulee) with berries in it. Soft and sweet!

BTW, our two servers Josh and Cyndi were amazing. Thank you for putting up with our slightly riff-raffish group (haha, in comparison to the other guests), and thanks for the humor you served (along with our food)  throughout the night!
author: Melissa D.

description:
My roommates and I went for a family dinner at Ruth's Chris Steak House. I haven't been in years, and it's as good as I remembered.

I got the ribeye steak Oscar style (crab cake, Bearnaise sauce and asparagus) on the side. It's definitely decadent so getting it on the side was a nice compromise. The ribeye steak was amazing - beautifully done, pink on the inside, nice and crispy on the outside. The Ruth's Chris way - fried in butter - ensures the steak is juicy and tasty.

In addition to steak, we got the potatoes au gratin and the creamed spinach. As my roommate said, the potatoes au gratin were so cheesy that they were almost like cheese au gratin - so good! The creamed spinach is good, though since it is vegetarian and lacking in bacon, it's not as good as others that I've had.

As a bonus, the corkage fee is only $15 which makes it a great deal to bring your own bottle of wine.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Yes it's a chain, which means I don't get SF cool-kid points for going to some underground food Mecca that only a select group of San Franciscans and a random warrior monk in outer Mongolia know about, but my God is Ruth's Chris' beef amazing. Sides too.

I won't take you through my entire meal, since everything is good here, but do try the ribeye as it's a particular standout. Absolutely phenomenal when cooked medium (I usually enjoy my steaks rare, but the extra cooking time lets all those fats really flow).

Our server (whose name escapes me) was quick, polite, and quite a conversationalist as well. My party had a great time, though I might not take a date here as this suave courier of meaty deliciousness might woo away my woman with his charm.
author: Leo K.

description:
Horrible food, unprofessional, poor service. Unedible crab cakes, tasted like canned crab and mush. Manager said it was fresh crab but I doubt this was true. It's crab season...for $31 bucks I expect my three crab cakes to be fresh and succulant. Petite fillet was marginal. $14 pomtini was made w/ Ocean Spray juice. Won't be back.

Go to Mortons or Harris if you want the best food, service, and drinks. 

Suprising really.
author: Banthehoodie A.

description: No doubt that the food was delicious. But, I felt it was very overpriced. Especially considering that the cows they get their beef from are corn fed (cows should not be eating corn for those who don't know). Service was okay, our waiter seemed a bit rude to us, but - oh well. The food was good, but, I feel like you could go somewhere else a lot better for the money you spend here.
author: Joy Q.

description: My boyfriend planned my birthday dinner here and I didn't know what to expect! Expect to get nice and dressed up. Had a party of 5 people. Definitely make reservations before coming in they do get booked fast. The steak was amazing and the mashed potatoes. I didn't like my appetizer it was some sort of cold soup. But next time ill have to try something else. My mom loved the green beans and her steak! Everything is like cooked with butter but it tastes so good! Definitely plan on coming back for another occasion. A little pricey but worth the expenses.
