author: Lorraine C.

description:
Hands down, this is my favorite steak house in America. It is truly a fine dining establishment, so you should be prepared to dress up. This restaurant is located in a great area and there is lots to do after dinner. After I visited this fine establishment, I headed down to the Orpheum Theater to watch the broadway play, Wicked.

The steaks are seared to perfection at 1800 degrees and then topped with fresh butter and placed on a 500 degree plate, so the steak sizzles all the way to your table. I have always ordered their filet which is the most tender cut of corn-fed Midwestern beef. With my steak, I always order a caesar salad, which has the most delicious, creamy caesar dressing on it. I also usually order au gratin potatoes (Idaho sliced potatoes with a three cheese sauce...melt in your mouth good) and creamed spinach topped with melted sharp cheddar (easily the best side dish on their menu...even friends of mine who do not like spinach love the creamed spinach).

Ruth's Chris also serves amazing flaky bread with every meal. While you are at this fine establishment, you will truly be treated like royalty. I will frequent this establishment until I die.
author: Tim P.

description: Top notch steak and good sides although definitely spendy!
author: Benjamin K.

description:
We ate here on a Friday night, celebrating an evening away from the kids. This was the second time dining here and we were very disappointed. We have dined at a couple of other Ruth Chris steakhouses and had positive experiences, but for whatever reason this location does not seem to have the same standards.

For an appetizer we had the crab cakes. I love crab cakes and usually order them when they are on the menu. These were meh at best, soggy with nothing else on the plate. For dinner we had the porterhouse for two, asparagus, and a baked potato. The steak was cooked properly and somewhat tender, but for the cost it should have been better then what I can cook at home when purchasing from Costco, and it wasn't. The asparagus what very bland. The potato, what can I say? It was a baked potato. The highlight of the meal was the coconut ginger lemon drop, maybe we should have just drank our dinner? The service was some of the worst for an upscale/pricey dinner that we have had. The server seemed nervous and uncomfortable, and in my opinion would have fit better in your local Denny's. Our water ran out on two occasions and we had to ask for more. For a cheaper meal this might not have been a big deal, but we definitely did not feel we got what we paid for, not even close
author: Nate H.

description:
So I've only been here once and I came during dine about town (for those of you who don't know, dine about town is an event where a bunch of restaurants have prie fixe menus for lunch and/or dinner. the lunch menu price is 21.95 bucks and the dinner price is 32.95). 

First, the steak. Their steaks are flash cooked in a ridiculously hot oven (~800 degrees i think?) and are brought out on the plate they were cooked on (so the plate is ~500 degrees or so). They are swimming in butter and if you get your steak rare enough, the blood that comes out gets cooked on the plate  :P (sounds gross, but its not really.) My steak was cooked at a perfect med rare (which I was happy about...I tend to order rare just because most places cook med rare wrong, but they did a good job here). Unfortunately my friend eating with me got his steak cooked med well, when he ordered med rare :\ 

So my meal consisted of the rib eye, a salad, a side (either creamed spinach or mashed potatoes), and bread pudding for dessert. Again, all of this was for 31.95, which is less than the steak alone would cost on their usual menu. The salad and sides were pretty good, but def nothing to rave about, nothing too special there. I think the rib eye cut was smaller than their usual cut (because of the dine about town menu). Still, I was stuffed by the end of the meal.

Overall, a good steak, but I wasn't blown away. Because of the price, I probably would only come back during dine about town the next time it happens. So, four stars for the dine about town menu (a good meal for a good price), three stars otherwise.

P.S. WHAT? 365 reviews of this place and theres only THREE pictures posted? what is yelp coming to. i must do something about that.
author: Christine L.

description:
The first time I was here, I loved it. The second time, not so much. 
First time we were here I ordered the crab cakes and my husband ordered one of the steaks (can't remember)
Our recent trip back last week, we got:
Calamari (appetizer) - came after 10 minutes. Flavorful, has a tangy taste. But it was very chewy. Almost too chewy that you might suspect it was precooked and heated upon ordering. 
Stuffed chicken (mine) - the cheese stuffing was good. Chicken was on the dry side. It also had a weird taste like the one you get from dark meat chicken.
author: Faith P.

description:
Om nom nom nom!

Another co-worker adventure! We were planning to go to Harris' Restaurant but it "looked" closed? so we went here instead. Free parking after 6 w00t! I've been waiting to try this place out since I was a youngster and today was my lucky day.

Once you go in, dark. I should have expected the ambiance be all high end and stuff (idk why I expected it to be casual like Outback steakhouse;;). Super dim, romantic, sophisticated, blah blah atmosphere. After being greeted, we were seated immediately. BAM! I open the menu and all I saw was $$$$. Time for some $40+ rib eye steak. We were wondering if it came with any sides like veggies and what not but it did not. Our server kindly suggested we get the set menu which has a choice of rib eye (along with other stuff that didn't catch my interest like petrale sole =p. Why you order fish in a freaking steakhouse??), an appetizer, and a set dessert. I believe one of the set menus is around $49.

I had the rib eye, medium rare with creamed spinach and the watermelon summer salad while my co-worker had the rib eye, medium rare also with string beans and garlic and the steak house salad.

Watermelon salad: Really good! There were four big ol' perfectly cubed watermelons with some spring mix, bleu or feta cheese I don't remember, almonds, onions etc. The watermelon was really sweet too so that being said I was already expecting the steak to be phenomenal. My co-worker commented his salad being good as well but I couldn't make out what was in it because A) the lighting was too dim to see and B) I was too busy making out with my delicious salad.

Rib eye: Served on what our server said 500 degree plates and that the rib eyes were cooked in a specialized 1000+ degree oven. Saywutwutwut?? First bite... I had to stop. Just seasoned with salt, pepper, and parsley? There has to be some secret to make it taste THAT flipping good. I savored that first bite for a good five minutes. Our steaks were indeed medium rare, juicy, and had nice distribution of fat. Also, it is freaking HUGE. I saved/boxed half so I could make room for dessert.

Creamed spinach: Nice compliment to the steak. Seasoned well with salt and pepper.

String beans w/ garlic: Very nice as well. The beans were cooked perfectly as they were not overdone/mushy and not raw/quickly blanched. It was tender but also had the crisp and snap! that you're supposed to get when you eat these kinda beans. It was also flavored with butter and garlic well, not too overwhelming.

Dessert: I don't even remember what it was to be honest haha; Some sponge-like cake except more dense with flavored whip cream and strawberries. It was so-so. Not too sweet which is what I like. I was honestly too busy thinking about when I'm going to come here for the ribeye again huhuhu!
author: KD M.

description:
Nothing taste better than Ruths Chris Rib-eye served medium rare on a 500 degree plate. Truly one of cows greatest gifts to mankind. 

Crab stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer for starters. That's a must get if you didn't already know. Followed by Rib-eye and mashed potatoes. 

Juicy, tender meat perfectly seasoned and topped off with butter, umm butter( I felt like Homer from the Simpson's drooling over donuts). Fresh warm bread was pleasing with butter spread. Salad with balsamic vinaigrette set the bar for an excellent meal that was about to be served. I was so excited when the steak arrived I didn't notice til half way through my meal that I was using a butter knife to cut my steak. That's how tender and juicy it was. I ordered mine medium rare because of the extra cooking that still occurs while its sitting on the plate. 

The atmosphere was great for Valentines despite the fact that some guy sitting next to me was yappin the whole time referring to himself in the 3rd person. 

Make no bones about it, if you haven't tried Ruths Chris by now you are only doing a disservice to yourself. You only live once so march down to this place, demand a seat, and place an order for the largest steak and prepare for a mouth watering life changing experience. 

Will I go back? 
Ha Ha Ha, Hell to the YEAH. 
I couldn't have it any other way...
author: Lou G.

description: This place is GREEDY! We had reservation at 8:45 and we still had to wait 45 minutes!!! Meaning they triple booked knowing that they have maxed out the place!
author: Lauren R.

description:
Came here for Dine About Town on a Thursday night and was immediately impressed.  There was a lot of parking on the street, so we got parking right away.  But they also have Valet available if you can't find a spot. 

When we got inside, we were seated promptly and I was very happy to see that at our table there was Happy Birthday confetti on the table (very subtle, not too tacky)- I had called ahead earlier to let them know it was a birthday dinner.  I was also very delighted that the waiter and hostess greeted me by my name the entire night.

They had quite a few things on the DAT menu and also a few extras.  Between us we ordered the Petite Filet, the 16oz. Ribeye for an upgrade and also a side of 6 jumbo prawns (also as an upgrade), the mashed potatoes, and the creamed spinach.  I absolutely LOVED the Petite Filet and it was cooked a perfect medium rare.  The jumbo prawns were also very good.  The mashed potatoes tasted like any other regular place, nothing special and I wasn't a fan of the creamed spinach - I would say skip it.  The dessert was a chocolate cupcake with fruit on the side, also very good.

The ambience was a little too mellow, kind of boring... definitely for couples to go to, but their awesome customer service pushed it to 5 stars for me.  WAY TO GO!!!
author: Jessica L.

description: When I want a good steak in the City for a moderate price - I will come to Ruth's Chris  from the Peninsula. Come here for their filet mignon-A juicy and buttery  steak served still sizzling on it's skillet!
author: Cora M.

description:
Considering this place is a "chain," it doesn't really feel like it when you step through the doors. The ambiance is nice and elegant and the waitstaff is friendly and attentive. 

The Ruth Chris classic is plenty of food to get me excited with a choice of salad/soup entree, side and dessert! It's like DAT all year round with the "classics" menu. 

Summer salad with watermelon, goat cheese, red onion, cucumber, slivered almonds, light vinaigrette I will have to replicate this refreshing summer delight for my next dinner party!

I ordered the 6 oz. Filet and Lobster, but the waiter recommended to sub the lobby out for shrimp because the lobby is mostly claw meat (not to be confused with the 8 oz filet & lobster which is tail meat, but I wanted the "classics" deal)

Be sure to order one level rarer than your typical temperature, so I order mine rare and then I sear it to my likeness on the piping hot plate! Another trick is to slide a few fries underneath your steak to prevent the steak from over cooking, then after you're done with your steak, you'll have a buttery French fry to finish off your last bite. We had an amazing Diseno Malbec that went perfectly with my filet.

The waiter suggested that I upgrade the dessert to the cream brulee...he didn't have to ask me twice. It was definitely worth it. I walked out a full and satisfied customer and at that price, it was an amazing value.
author: Kristina L.

description: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday and i must say we were not disappointed! We made reservations for 7:15pm and after searching for parking (no parking) we get to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse at 7:13pm checked in and got seated right at 7:15pm. The servers were very attentive, cheery and full of energy. Our server Jose (i think)  was pretty funny when we were asking about the alcohol selection. But anyways, we ordered 2 16oz ribeyes, creamed spinach, and the shoestring fries. All the food came out piping hot and fast and were great. Side note, we ordered 2 ribeyes, 1 medium and the other medium rare and both came out a lot more rare then it should've been, but still good. We were in and out of there in 1 hr and we left satisfied. Success!
author: Lily S.

description: Good food, but a bit overpriced given the quality of food surrounding it in SF.
author: Chris C.

description:
Don't know what else there is to write about this place, but here's my take.

Wifey and I frequent this place on special occasions. This way I can justify getting a bottle of wine from their extensive wine list (we don't come here that often honey!!!) Had the Cakebread Cellars (it was very good, but not sublime like the other time I tried it...  should have memorized the vintage) The crab cocktail was orgasmic, light sauces with lettuce and great honking pieces of crab mixed in...  *wiping my drool*

Oh yeah...  and the steak was good too. NY Steak for myself and Prime Rib for the lady. Cooked very well as usual though mine was a tad overcooked, I like mine to be medium rare. 

Why not 5 stars?? Because i'm a stingy punk like that.
author: Tommy B.

description:
The food was excellent. The waitstaff was great. The hostess just ok.  The bus staff a little to fast - we had our salad for about 90 seconds before they asked if they could take it. 
Overall, I think it's overrated and overpriced.  This particular Ruth's Chris was somewhat sub par compared to others.
author: B T.

description:
Typical old school steakhouse.  Food is good but not anything amazing, drinks are pretty good, but I don't think I would go back on my own.  However, they did a great job considering we were a larger party, so this might be a good spot for that.  

We went for a birthday and they actually they do deserve bonus points for properly handling the group.  They even putt "Happy Birthday" confetti on the table.  That was a really sweet attention to detail.  We had a group of 7 and ordered the calamari and stuffed mushrooms for the table.  I was not impressed with either.  My husband and I ordered the porterhouse for two, creamed spinach and mashed potatoes.  The creamed spinach was REALLY good.  The mashed potatoes were regular.  Nothing special like half the reviews said but also not bad like the other half claimed.  The steak itself was OK.  I can't quite figure out what was wrong with it, it just didn't feel very juicy, which was weird because it was not overcooked and it was swimming in butter.  I love butter on my steak and it tasted great when it just came out, but because the plates are 500 degrees, it melts really fast and I think goes from creamy to greasy which really put me off.  

Overall, service was great but the steak (which is what we came there for) was slightly disappointing.  Maybe it was the cut, so don't fully take my word for it.  But I would prefer a steak at Brazenhead or Izzy's any day and with our bill of about $100/person here, I think I will stick to my favorites.  

Dessert was AMAZING.  We had the chocolate explosion cake and it was really really good.  It was fun to check it off the list.
author: Sasha D.

description: If you want a great steak, obviously this is a good choice.  Their steaks are simple.  Salt, pepper, butter, and a small dash if parsley and that is all it needs.  The quality of meat they serve is so good, it doesn't need any fancy sauces or glazes. I have had the filet mignon and the rib eye, both medium rare, and they melted in my mouth.  Creamed spinach is a must.  Service is top notch and the atmosphere is  luxurious and romantic.
author: Sandra S.

description:
I've frequented Ruth's Chris since I could afford it as a new college grad, from Chicago, to NYC, and now to SF.  It's the only chain restaurant that continues to impress time after time!

Delicious steak done to perfection on a sizzling hot plate (don't touch!) with melted butter.  Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmm...... 

Delicious appetizers, salads, sides and a great wine list -- you can't go wrong with a dinner here.  

Compared to other steakhouses of equal caliber and price, it ranks 2nd in my book (to Del Frisco's in NYC)!
author: Heather s.

description:
Surprisingly tasty, for a chain steak house.
We went for a friend's birthday.  The service was great.  
I ordered the DAT special, ribeye, mashed potatoes and bread pudding.  All three things were delicious and the price just could not be beat.  

If I am to go again I will probably order the steak rare.  The VERY hot plate continued to cook my steak so it was really more medium than medium rare.

My dining companions ordered the Porterhouse... Wow.. it was HUGE.  and tasty... 

They were super nice and gave us a free dessert because it was my friend's birthday.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I went to Ruth Chris's on a 1st date and the food was so delicious I felt obligated to put out! Granted I was fresh out of college and usually went to Chevy's for date nights lol. 

Anywho, I ordered the herb chicken which was mind shatteringly delicious, mixed vegetables which were seasoned to perfection. I finished my meal with the sweet potato casserole which sealed the deal for how my date was going to end. I cant even express in words how wonderful this dessert was. ...I can barely remember whom I went out on a date with but the flavors of this delicious meal remains engrained in my mind!
author: Deionte R.

description:
Haven't been here for quite a while, I took my parents here for their "virgin" voyage to the Dine About Town experience. 
Memories from other visit: 

a) Steaks on a platter of butter 
b) Walking into the women's restroom - where's the sign? where are the urinals (no, I wasn't drunk) 

I called for a reservation on Wednesday and was told that 10:30 pm was the only available time. While on Open table yesterday, I clicked and booked a 5:30 pm reservation (maybe, open table is a better way to go?!). After giving my car to the valet and checking in at the hostess stand, we waited about ten minutes for our table. We were one of maybe a handful of parties either dining or waiting for their tables. After seating us in a booth, our hostess gave us the regular menus and wine list... I'm thinking, uh oh... maybe Dine About isn't in effect on weekends. Our waiter, Jessie, then handed us the special menus (whew...) and I explained them to my parents. Discussing what a nice deal this was, my dad and I did not hold back in ordering the following: 

Appetizers 

Steak House salad with Vinaigrette - fresh non-iceberg lettuce with a few halved cherry tomatoes and croutons; small portions, but good enough 
*** part of Dine About 

French Onion Soup - small crock of soup with yummy, gooey cheese baked on top; the broth was flavored well (not too salty), but the cheese had a burnt aftertaste though it was barely browned.. very odd. - $9.50 

Entrees 

5 oz. Petite Filet Mignon - served on a "500 degree plate" (warning given when we ordered, do not touch); this was very tender and perfect for my teeth sensitive parents. 

12 oz. Rib eye - hearty steak flavor, ordered medium rare, but came close to medium/medium well 

Supplement 

5 oz. Lobster tail - grilled Caribbean lobster with decent flavor, but a little on the dry side - $17.00 

Sides 

Creamed spinach - similar to House of Prime Rib's version, but a little thicker 

Mashed potatoes - did I mention, this place loves butter? That was the dominant flavor. 

Potato Au Gratin - potato slices mixed in a creamy, cheesy sauce; okay with me, but dad liked it. - $9.50 

Desserts 

Key Lime Pie - decent sized slice topped with whipped cream, lime slice and raspberry sauce on the plate for dipping. 

New Orleans Bread Pudding - think of a heated raisin snail with wine sauce. 

*** choices of one of either side dishes and either desserts 

In extrapolating the bill, the Dine About price came to $34.95 per three course menu. Considering the Petite Filet is normally $35.00 ala carte, this is a great deal. As we left, I noticed that it was a mixed crowd of locals, families, couples, and tourists. It's a little more stuffy than House of Prime Rib, but it is a more relaxed atmosphere for eating; service was good as they kept our tea pots, iced tea, and ice water glasses filled. I would come back with meat and butter lovers for the specials, but probably only for special occasions. Before leaving the restaurant, I took a big sniff and felt the butter circulating in the room. Did I forget to mention, they use butter?
author: Mike C.

description: When they advertised their steaks as the "best steak you have ever had", they weren't lying. it was the best steak i have ever had. enough said.
author: Annie Z.

description:
Came here for Valentine's Day with my sweetie.

For V-day, they were running a special where you get filet mignon and lobster for $44.99, which I thought was an okay deal. Something they don't mention on the website: the dishes are all ala carte, which I thought was a little odd but whatever!

To start with, I had the pomegranate martini and my man had a vodka soda. Oh em gee, I really enjoyed that martini. It had a sugar rimmed glass, which I love.

In addition to the filet and lobster, we ordered brussels sprouts and hash browns as sides. The sprouts were to die for! They were in a brownish buttery caramelized sauce and were accompanied by bits of bacon. The hash browns were like meh, they didn't really match the meal but it's what the dude wanted.

The lobster... was totally meh. I'm not sure what happened here. Maybe it was a little overcooked? Don't get the lobster! It was edible, but disappointing.

The filet mignon was definitely the star of the show. Buttery and flavorful. My man's rib eye was good, but the filet mignon was the bee's knees. If you're coming here, do yourself a favor and get the filet. I wish I had forgone the lobster and just gotten a fat piece of filet mignon.

Topped it off with a delicious creme brûlée with berries. Yum!

The service was pretty good, but I was a little disappointed that they weren't doing anything special for people for Valentine's. Most fancy restaurants will give you a rose, or a little gift chocolate or, you know, Something. Oh well.
author: Rachel H.

description: This has to be the most awful place to even think about dining at... Me and my girl friend come too eat here thinking we're about too sit down while the host tells us we can't be seated cause we smell like pot. And we can't eat there. Keep in mind im Latin my gf black and she white of course. This place it rude racist and i would never recommend it or come there again... Their ratings should be a 2 star...
author: Jorvina M.

description:
There isn't really a better way for me to describe their delicious steaks except by quoting Pauly D, "Aw yeah, steak, yeah!"

My steak was cooked to perfection and I had no qualms with the quality of the food.  The only reason I gave this place 4 stars and not 5 is the amount of vegetables I got.  I know it's a steak place and that should be the main centre of the meal, but I really like me some vegetables and I felt I got short-changed on that part.

Although we had around 12 people in our party, the serving staff was very courteous and prompt and the food came out in a timely manner, keeping the quality of the food high.
author: Mark H.

description: The food is great here. Everything is served on a extra hot plate that keeps your food warm. A little outside of central downtown but worth a try.
author: Farid N.

description:
This place was so great! We drove right up to the entrance and were greeted by a friendly valet guy, $10 for valet, not bad. We had reservations so we didn't have to wait too long. The place was very nice, cozy, and friendly service. 

I ordered a 6 oz. filet with shrimp and their mashed potato's. The filet was so tender, I cut it with my fork and it melted in my mouth. My hubby's rib eye was very good as well. The service was great, our waitress was super friendly. 

I can't wait to go back :o)
author: Audra M.

description:
Always a wonderful dining experience. 
We were entertaining friends from Japan who were visiting for a few days. I wanted to treat them to a nice steak dinner.

We were greeted warmly by the host, who ensured we were seated promptly at a nice table.  
We ordered beers all around, there were five of us.  
Our waiter was a very welcoming older gentleman whom I recognized from a visit a fees years prior.
We all agreed on Ruth's Classic Dinner which was a price fixe menu that included a starter, entrée, side dish, and dessert. 
We all opted for the Caesar salad and ribeye steak.  
We decided we would share various personal size side dishes that included sautéed mushrooms, creamed spinach (2), and mashed potatoes(2). 
Every one of steaks were served as ordered with a generous dollop of their famous herb butter.  They were tender, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. The sides were cooked to perfection and were plenty for the five of us to share.  
We were so full, but since dessert was included we enjoyed a dish of ice cream each and one cheesecake.we all enjoyed brewed coffee and espresso shots that were perfectly prepared with a lovely crema.

Our friends were totally impressed, stuffed, and ready to eat at Ruth's Chris on their next visit.
author: Scott N.

description:
Oh Ruthie, I profess my forbidden love for thee! For I am a San Franciscan, and thou are a chain restaurant! Our love can never ring true, yet my heart would breaketh without you...

Okay, enough of that. After a particularly awful experience with a dentist here in SF (I don't wanna blow up his spot on Yelp, but I URGE you to send me a message if you're planning on having oral surgery) and not eating solid food for almost a month, I wanted to go someplace REALLY special for dinner. As you know, I am a red meat fanatic, so my brain automatically defaults 1st to Espetus and then 2nd to House of Prime Rib for a special evening out here in The City. However, at this point I could barely finish a Peanut Butter Moo'd my stomach had shrank so much, so Espetus was definitely out. I tried to score a reso on Open Table for HoPR, but was about as successful as my Islanders have been this year, so we tried walking in. At 7:30pm. On a Friday night. During Christmas Party season. You already know how this ends...

So we headed south on Van Ness and came upon Ruth's Chris. Now, I can't lie, the wife & I have had some really memorable meals here, even though they are a dreaded "chain". The joint was really empty, plus they had a sign on the window offering Ruth's "Classics" menu for $39.95 per person. Unfortunately, our prior experiences with R.C.'s price-fixe menus had been very negative, and we felt like we were always treated like 2nd class citizens for ordering off the "discount" menu. But, we decided "f*ck it" and decided to throw caution to the wind and walk-in.

We were seated promptly at the bar, which was fine by us as we've ridden more than a few barstools in our day. I ordered the Filet Mignon (note: there is  a $10 upcharge) while wifey went with the 6oz. Petit Filet & Shrimp. Our AWESOME waiter, Jose, didn't even flinch when I asked him if we could replace the dessert on our price-fixe dinner with a 2nd side, saying "Sure, go right ahead!" like we were the 1,000th person to ask. So me & the boss lady both opted for the garlic-mashed potatoes & the brussels sprouts with bacon. Both meals came with a soup or salad starter and a loaf of fresh-baked bread with creamery butter. The  lady opted for the seafood gumbo while I went with the classic steakhouse salad. Both were excellent, and the bartender made a MEAN Manhattan. But you're wondering "Where's the beef?" so I'll skip right on over to dinner.

The filets were perfectly cooked to a medium-rare, with a warm pink center and a slight, crusty char on the outside. My filet was a 10oz cut easy, and so melted in my mouth that my uber-sensitive chompers didn't even have to show up for work. The mashed potatoes were buttery perfection, and the divine Brussels Sprouts were glazed with real Maple Syrup and topped with so much bacon that you would have thought there was an army of pigs tearing up the kitchen. Of course, we ordered the bread pudding with whiskey sauce for dessert, which was absolutely awesome, as always!!!

More than anything else though, Jose made sure we had an awesome time and that we were taken care of as a couple of peasants just as much as the guy trying to impress his date with surf & turf and Duckhorn Merlot was at the bar. For that, we had yet another truly memorable evening at Ruth's Chris. Who cares if they're a chain, they're 'effin awesome!
author: Michael T.

description:
This rating was very tough for me to decide between 3 and 4 stars.  The reasons I decided on 3 stars are as follows:

-The steak was not as good as it probably should have been.  Don't get me wrong, it was a good borderline great steak, however I don't think people come here for a good to borderline steak.  I think people come here expecting an exceptional steak.

-The steak was over-priced.  I didn't feel the steak was far superior to say Outback, Black Angus, Cattlemens, or any other chain steak house.  I am convinced that if any of those aforementioned steak houses laid their steaks on a bed of butter and served on a super hot plate the steaks would be near identical.

-An 8:45 reservation for two, didn't have us seated until after 9:05.  Yes, we were on time, in fact we arrived an hour early and had some drinks at the bar.

-The drinks were overpriced.  $7.50 for a bottled Stella Artois beer is a little much, as was the $10 for a glass of Llai Llai Pinot Noir (basically a 15 dollar bottle of wine at a store).

Some positives:  The steak was cooked as ordered.  This is something that I don't find very reliable in the Outback's of the world.  I prefer my steak Med-Rare.  This is exactly how it came, if I had gone to Outback or the like I always order Medium because the tend to not do Med-rare correctly. 

The staff at all levels (bartenders, hosts, wait staff, bus staff) was very courteous and attentive.

The restaurant was laid out nicely and there was enough space so you weren't on top of another party, or having to listen to anyone else's conversation.

Overall I just feel like the value was not returned for the cost paid.  I would much rather spend either much less by going to Outback or the like, or even better spend $10-15 more (per steak) by going to Alexander's and having an exceptional steak.
author: Kevin K.

description:
I always passed by here but finally tired it recently, it was a great steak that I got to enjoy! I can definitely see why people gave great reviews for this place!

Food:
Rib-eye steak- broiled steak with butter is moist juicy and buttery goodness. A lb of deliciousness!
Creamed Spinach- So GOOD!
Mashed potatoes- Very good 
Chocolate cheesecake- amazing cheesecake!
author: Elliot T.

description:
Get off your butt and treat yourself to this spot!  Finally ate here.  Always heard about this place from friends...and its true, it is pretty daym Gewd :)

make like Nike and Just Do It
author: Kenneth V.

description:
Nice and dark inside, romantic! Almost forgot I was on Van Ness.. 
I got the smallest cut they had and it was just perfect for me. Although I eat alot, I eat meat in small portions and geez, their smallest was still big to me! Anyways. It came out STILL SIZZLING (what they're known for) and of course, I wanted to touch it and eat it right away but I didn't want to burn myself...

Medium rare is the way to go. Who the hell eats their meat well done? Not I! Anyway. It was sooooo tender and juicy. I swear I could've cut my steak with a butter knife. Also ordered a side of mushrooms and a side of spinach, because i've got to have veggies along with my heart attack. I loved the sides! They went real well with the steak. 

Service was okay. I only gave them 4 stars because our server was really pushing for us to try the beef carpaccio. We agreed to try it but he forgot about it. At least he didn't charge me for it....
author: Susy C.

description:
Good food.  Worth going once a year, or whenever you feel like eating that much meat.  Their side dishes are insanely huge too.

Great tableside service.

Enough said...as everyone else has probably said it already.  

The place lives up to its good reputation.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Went to Ruth's Chris for dinner with my girlfriends after we went to see Mama Mia!

We arrived and they seated us promptly - no waiting so that was very nice.  Our waiter went over the menu and our options - oh what to eat - STEAK!

To start we had the barbecued shrimp and the Ahi Tuna.  

- The Ahi Tuna - absolutely fabulous!  The tuna was fresh, seared perfectly on the outside and just a gorgeous cut.  The spiciness on the sear was just right - you got the hit but still tasted the fresh luxurious Tuna.

- The barbecued shrimp - I think they brought us the wrong dish.  It tasted like shrimp in a butter sauce.  Still good - but not what we were expecting - you couldn't call this barbecue and serve this in Texas and walk out alive.  But overall good - the shrimp were fresh - the dish just didn't have the polish or flavor the Ahi Tuna had.

The main event:  STEAK

That's the whole point of going to Ruth's Chris right?  

We each ordered a filet - two medium rare and one butterflied and well done.

OH PERFECTION!!!  

I sliced that baby open and she was soft as butter, the temperature, texture, and flavor all PERFECT.

For sides we had one of those humongous baked potates, the sweet potatoe casserole with pecan crust, and hashed browns.

- baked potatoe - huge - done right.

- the hashed browns - wow they should warn you the servings are about the size you would get at grandma's house.  But it hit the spot.

- THE STAR - sweet potatoe with a pecan crust.  Oh deliciousness personfied.

For dessert we all shared the molten chocolate cake.  Very very nice.

Why not 5 stars?

- first they brought us the wrong shrimp dish.  If it was the right dish there is no way it should be called barbecued shrimp.

- second - they didn't bring a steak knife for my girlfriend - I waved, whistled, waved a towel - got ignored.  It was only when the manager came by to ask how our dinner was that we were able to get a steak knife.

- finally - we couldn't finish everything - as a matter of fact there was a lot to take home.  Before we could say anything the busser came by and just pulled everything off the table and it was gone.  No take home - so sad. so sad.

Overall I recommend for those who love steaks and enjoy really good food.

Definitely a good value for the price.
author: JP O.

description:
Was here Jan 2011 for Dine About Town.  Giving Ruth Chris 3 stars because I'm being objective.  I gave Flemings SD only 4 stars and that place was flawless.

Our meal was good but a couple negative points really hurt the experience:

1)  Tables were way too crowded together.  This is a steakhouse, not a French bistro.  I dont want to know my neighbor.

2)  My rib eye tasted good overall but had sinew running through a portion of it which was near impossible to cut through (with my high end butter knife they use as steak knives) or chew through.  Mentioned it to our somewhat "canned" server but  he passed it off as the type of cut.  Not.

Had a rib eye at Cheesecake Factory in Minne and it was amazing.  Barely any fat and no sinew.  I dont mind a bit of chew in a steak but the rib eye and Ruth Chris was a bit much.  Maybe they save the poor cuts of meat for Dine About Towners..lol.

3)  And whats up with the butter??  I mean I know why they use it but I didnt order a butter steak.  If they have to add fat to a steak to make it taste good is it really a good cut of meat to begin with?  I want to taste the meat and seasoning instead.

Positives:

Rebekah's filet mignon looked amazing, mashed potato sides were great, general atmosphere was good.

** Flemings has a very similar approach to cooking their steaks but no butter lake around the steak, decor is steakhouse but modern, more relaxed?, service is professional but naturally friendly.

Sticking to Flemings......SD.
author: Laine D.

description:
I am not an expert in American stake houses,  but I can tell when a steak is of good quality and has been treated accordingly. The steaks here are really good! My friends and I had dinner here this weekend taking advantage of the Dine About restaurant event in SF, and it was a great call! We had the petit fillet and the rib eye. Everything came cooked as ordered, with a juicy center and perfect grilled outside. The meat tasted delicious and concordant with the cut, served in really hot plates (no kidding! food was sizzling) and a bed of melted butter. So delicious!!
The sides were tasty, somehow heavy, but we were having that kind of food so that was OK. A pretty decent list of wines completed the picture. Also the desserts were chocolaty and well crafted.
In sum a place to come back! One good thing we involuntary did was to reserve at 5:45 (the other available slot was at 8:30). Very early for my habits, but that gave us good hours afterwards to walk around the city, have some drinks at a local bar, and recover before going to bed.
author: Florencia G.

description:
Blue cheese melted on top of your steak is the way to go (that is, if you are a cheese fan)! The ambiance of the place was not as formal as I thought (people dining in jeans and shorts), but the service and tenderness of the meat is right on par. We did a group SF Dine About Town special and it was definitely a reasonable price for a steakhouse. 

Mmm steak...
author: Jasmine G.

description:
That's it! It's over! Stick a fork in me, I AM DONE!

It has been reached. The pinnacle in fine steak house dining achieved. This provided by the fantastic Ruth's Chris Steak House.

The night started off with a quality made cocktail from their classic style bar. The drink, an Old Fashion made with 12 year Jameson and extra bitters. We were led to our table where within minutes of being seated we were greeted by our waiter. He proceeded to inform us about the special "Dine about Town" event menu that was taking place at many upscale San Francisco restaurants. A very knowledgeable fellow indeed, he provided us with all the information about the quality of food and preparation that took place in every meal served at this house. 

During this event, Ruth's Chris offered a 4 course meal for a set price. It started with their house salad, a simple spring mix and cheery tomato combination drizzled with a tasty vinaigrette. Next came the main course. I chose the 8 ounce petite fillet, cooked at 1800° and brought to the table on 500° plates sizzling in butter. That little bit of technical information brought to you by our wonderful server.

Yes the plate was hot, I touched it, and yes the steak was unbelievable, I tasted it! Perfectly cooked, medium well on the outside and medium on the inside due to the thickness of the fillet, I have never had better in that cut. I also chose the creamed spinach as my side, which was great, but I wish I ordered the mashed potatoes as did other at our table, they were amazing.

The dinner concluded with dessert. A selection of fresh seasonal berries in a sweet cream sauce and a chocolate mousse in a dark chocolate shell. Both simply divine. 

Everything here from the decor and ambiance, to the food and service, reeked of refinement. I will definitely be returning for the next Dine About Town, and for any other excuse to celebrate. Thank you Ruth's Chris Steak House for raising the bar!
author: Andrew D.

description:
I really like this place. It has really good steak and I love that their plates have butter on them and then it sizzles as they put the steak on. The waiter we had, I think Daria or something was extremely kind and was very fast at refilling our drink. The porterhouse for two was very good, and the lobster was tasty as well. 

My favourite part was the creme brule. It it perfectly made and tastes delicious. This place is pricey, but it is expected when you walk in because it is Ruth Chris.
author: Christian L.

description:
What I enjoyed: 

1. The steak and the grilled portebella mushrooms were amazing. They actually should get 4 stars for the food. 
2. Restaurant decor. Like much of the rest of San Francisco, this restaurant transported me back in time to a different era. 

What I didn't care for: 

1. The unprofessional, valley girl like hostesses. They were very young and were talking badly about patrons.
2. Our server was not friendly at all.
3. The sides. You pay a lot extra for them and they weren't anything unique. 
4.  Very expensive. If we are paying all this money, I would've wanted a more pleasant experience.

Would I return? Not to this one, but I wouldn't mind trying out one in a different location/city.
author: Miss S.

description:
I have been to several Ruth's Chris locations and I must say that this place is no different than the rest. 

Great quality steaks and seafood, Great ambiance, Great wine selection, Great service, and absolutely great to go with a group. 

There are a lot of steak house out there but this is definitely a solid steak house!
author: An R.

description:
I wanted to give them zero starts, but at the minimum yelp requires me to give 1, so there is, the default 1 star.

I will never dine at Ruth Chris ever again.  It was the most demeaning dining experience.  First, they are definitely ageist; and possibly something more insidious, but I won't rely on that to give them zero stars.  I'll spare you the details and share only the miserable highlights.

My boyfriend and I were dressed nicely for a night on the town.  We were in our early to mid-20s.  We made reservations.  We were not seated until more than 45 minutes after our reservation.  It seemed like some couples walked in and were seated right away ahead of us.

When we were finally seated, no one came by to even acknowledge our presence.  Then they seated an older couple in the booth next to us.  They asked the lady if she would like them to take her jean jacket.  They never asked if I wanted them to take my long trench peacoat.

They asked if they wanted anything to drink.  We only got water and menus because they couldn't ignore me waving after they finished helping the older couple.

We ordered our meal before them, yet we didn't get any food until after them.  To top off the horrible experience, everything tasted like it was drenched in butter.  I love butter, but at some point, enough is enough.

Lesson learned: Go to Morton's same price range, better meat, and much better service, whatever your age!
author: Christina L.

description:
Hmm...first, we had to wait when we had a reservation. Then we had to ask for the DAT menu.
 The waitress was kinda rude, especially at first. I think she might have been a bit busy.

My DAT Order:
Steakhouse Salad:
 The salad was drowning in dressing, and had half, yes, half a cherry tomato in it. Other than that, it was just mixed greens, and kinda boring ones at that. Something you might expect out of a cafiteria. Not something you expect when you order a "steakhouse salad".

Taters:
 The mashed potatoes were drowning in butter. You could almost hear their quiet screams for help and the butter slowly choked them to death. Poor potatoes. 

Meat:
 The filet was tasty, but it's filet. It's supposed to be. I had to push off the tub of butter they had placed on it though to get at the meat. Could have used just a little touch of seasoning to it.

Key Lime Pie:
The key lime pie was like something I could have gotten at a diner, I make much better meself. 

Wine:
The wines are horridly overpriced, especially if you know anything about wine. If you know anything about wine, wait until you get home and have a glass from your own collection. Trust me on this. 

But...
they have shirley temples and they gave me not one, but two cherries. 
Word ta that.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Snap, crackle, pop!  The famous three words that refer to one of my least favorite breakfast cereals, Rice Krispies, but also more than adequately describe the sounds of the sizzling hot butter that your steak is soaked in and served to you on a hot plate at nearly 500 degrees!  Butta', baby! 

I've been here a few times now and always enjoy a tasty, artery-clogging meal here.  My personal favorite cut from here is the filet mignon, but that is only because I'd rather enjoy eating just meat and avoiding any gristle or fat.  The creamed spinach and potatoes au gratin are probably my favorite side dishes to accompany my steak.  Although I seldom have room for dessert after a huge steak with sides, the caramelized banana cream pie and chocolate molten cake (if available) are my favorite desserts here.
author: Erich D.

description:
My friend and I went to Ruth's this past weekend. Had some laughs, drank red wine, ate a petite filet with hollandaise sauce and asparagus. The smell of the butter is just out of this world, it came out to be $60. It was the perfect size, I didn't have a food coma and fall asleep after. There was these two dudes sitting next to us and kept saying weird lines to us like "They like their meat!", "You a soccer coach?" "Are you lesbians?", "You girls from around here?", my mom taught me never to roll my eyes, but sorry mom, it was much needed for this situation. 

One of the two guys was sitting next to my friend and switched places. One of the guys was very social, but the other was being a total jerk and too snooty. We notice they pay and the bartender says: "Oh, he left his card!" As he takes the card out and we see it, it was PINK, and had HELLO KITTY! Bah hahaha, we couldn't stop laughing. We could not believe this super manly guy had that card. Wow...even the bartender laughed and gave us more wine. Great service, great food, you only live once, so treat yourself to an excellent steak once in a while in good company.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
The food is the greatest ever!! I had a fillet and my husband had the lobster. Our friend had a amazing lobster bisque. Salads are great!!! We had bottle service that allowed  us to surprise our group of friends that we were meeting there. The fillet had the greatest natural taste ever. No sauce or anything was needed for it!!! We had great service!!! after dinner we went to the bar and my husband had ordered himself a few lemon drop cocktails that he had seen being served, and enjoyed them greatly!!!
The cheesecake is big great and good!!! This is pricey though great. A high recommendation for couples and get togethers.
author: Timber B.

description: Ok steak house. Pricey. My husband would probably never come back here because of food poisoning. It would be hard to convince him again. Me, I don't know, nothing really special. Just another fancy steak house.
author: J C.

description:
My boyfriend & I had reservations for 5:30pm. We were celebrating our 3 year anniversary. We were seated right away & our server Jack was very attentive and just an all around great server! 

Our table was decorated with rose petals, & other servers as well as other employees would pass us & greet "happy anniversary!" The restaurant does a great job at making any occasion you're celebrating special..

On to the food. We started off with the crab cakes. YUM! & My boyfriend ordered the ribeye cooked medium, and I ordered the petite filet well done. I was afraid it would be dry but not at all! Very juicy, and just delicious! We also had a side baked potato as well as the creamed spinach & two drinks!
author: Jeanette D.

description:
I'm not gonna lie, i'm not that huge on steak. It's good but i don't really like the giant slab of meat as the centerpiece and majority of my meal. feels unbalanced or something.

in any event i have to give it up to them. that was a damn good slab of meat. as large as my ribeye was, (I wasn't sure if i'd be able to finish it when it came out) by the time i got to the end, i was still dtem(down to eat more). Madness.

The sides were great too, damned good baked potato and crazy hashbrown cake as well as the chopped salad.

This joint doesn't dissapoint but it isn't cheap either, 

Bottom line: if you like steak it's totally worth it, If you don't, it's probably still worth it.
author: Misha T.

description:
let me start by saying that the food was delicious.  Its the service and presentation im docking points for.
the waiter  was ehhh throughout.  she wasnt very friendly.
The steak on a plain white plate seems a bit bland.  It was very unattractive.  A prettier plate would be nice.  If im paying $50 for steak, i would like to eat on a prettier plate.  As the saying goes.... we eat with our eyes.
author: Marcia B.

description:
there was so much hype about the steaks at this place that I decided to came here for dine about town to try it out. Lucky for me, the steaks were not disappointing even with all the hype!

Food: 
The dine about town menu was a preset menu that had: 
1) Salad: Steak House Salad with balsamic vinaigrette - this salad was ok, nothing too great about it. The balsamic vinaigrette was a little too thick if you ask me, but overall, a salad is a salad, so nothing too spectacular about it. 
2) 8oz Petite Filet - DELICIOUS!!! The meaty/beefy aroma of the steak preceded its arrival and made me drool a little. And when it actually came out on a sizzling plate, it was AMAZING!! The beef was so tender and just melted in your mouth. The meaty juice was still perfectly infused inside the filet. I'm drooling just thinking about it! 
3) Side: Mashed Potatoes or Creamed Spinach - Mashed potatoes were ok. The creamed spinach was also nothing to rave about. Just some typical sides to go with the AWESOME filet!
4) Pudding with chocolate cupcake: This dessert was interesting. The chocolate cupcake was pretty tasty when you dipped it into the yellow pudding. Great presentation of the dessert!

Service: 
Excellent service! Very professional and tended to your every need. The only thing was the food kinda took a long time to come out, but that's ok, it was worth the wait. 

Ambiance: 
Ritzy, upscale steak house feel to it. I think this would be a great place for an upscale date if you wanna impress them. The room lights are kinda dim and gives a very romantic feel about the place. The noise level is moderate so the date can still stay pretty casual. 

Price: 
If it wasn't the dine about town price, I think I would have had to pay an arm and a leg for this meal. I would say that the steaks are worth chopping an arm off to pay for it, but everything else might be only worth a finger or two. 

Overall: I think the steak was definitely worth it but everything else was ok. Nothing too great about it. The filet really carried the meal into the 4 stars range or else I would have just given this place 3 stars.
author: Amiee H.

description: Very disappointed,  the wine was good so was the potato and asparagus .  But at 9 & 8 $$$ each for the sides not worth it.  $11 per glass of wine was ok as i have no problem spending a couple hundred bucks for a good bottle of wine.  But this is a steak house and I wanted a good steak.  :(. So sad.   Ordered their cowboy,  rare. Came back medium and self cooking. Barely pink in the middle and turning grey fast.  Good beef is good even medium but not this and i sent it back..  $50 for steak should be better then what you get at ponderosa .  They were quick at getting a new one out and cooked properly, but it was still disappointing,  Ate a few bites looking for a delicious bite of steak was so disappointed. Ieft most of it. Which I rarely do even if its breakfast of steak and eggs at a cony island.   Perhaps other cuts will pass but not the cowboy.  I've had much better at places charging 1/2. And much much better places charging as much.  I won't eat here again unless all I want is a good glass of wine and a ok side
author: Robert L.

description:
My spot, ahem! =) Anytime there is a special occasion this is the place to go. They treat you so well. If you love steak and wine this is the spot. They give great recommendations and on Wednesday nights they do half off bottles of wine that are $50 or more. 

My favorite is the fillet Mignon, mashed potatoes, asparagus, and I love almost all of their appetizers. The crab stuffed mushrooms and ahi seared tuna are wonder! 

Reservations are also not always a must. I know people think that you have to call way in advance but I have gotten in the same night or even walked in. And the bar service is great so you can have a drink while you wait. 

LOVE IT!
author: Priya B.

description:
Came here for Christmas Eve dinner with the family.

The hot bread... AWESOME. Lobster bisque... AWESOME. House Salad... AWESOME. Lobster and steak fillet combo... AWESOME. Overall just a great dining experience with good food and company.
author: Charles L.

description:
Yeah it's better than Outback Steakhouse.

 To me the creamed spinach at HOPR is better overall based on creaminess and spinacchy flavor. 

Old world feel steakhouse but not as old school feeling as Harris's across the street. I'm not sure if they age their meat either. 

Not really dying to go back.
author: Earl G.

description:
Yeah I know it's a chain, but you know what?  They make a some damn good steak.  I had my favorite cut, a ribeye, which I will admit is hard to mess up, and it was delicious on the hot plate with butter.  I think the first time I went was for a Dine About Town and it was a great value, but even a normal meal here is a good value too.  

This is a safe bet for some good food, but if you want something very SF-ish, then I guess you should probably go to Harris' or HOPR.  Street parking can be found around here if you are willing to walk a few blocks.
author: Aaron W.

description:
My favorite steakhouse in the city. I just can't get over the butter! Their steak is very different from most other steak houses, mainly because they serve it on a hot plate sizzling with butter. mmMmmm. The rib-eye is my go-to. Great big cut of yummy-ness.

Great date place and potentially small get-togethers. The place is great about getting you in at your reservation time as well. This is my "must go" during DTA. Otherwise, the food is a bit pricy, especially if you add in the wine. 

The service is great as well. Super friendly and attentive. They come by regularly to check in on you and your food. 

Tip: Order your steaks one level more rare as they get a good cooking while on the plate!
author: Yue Z.

description:
Ruth's Chris- the epitome of fine steak. 
First time at this location, parking is easy breezy- the structure is right behind the restaurant, I paid $10 for about 3 hrs, valet is also available for $10. Came here w/ a gf an hour before our reservations for Dine about Town. We had lots of catching up to do so... TO the bar we go!! Black Cherrytini, fabulous. I want to to order this everywhere I go now.   

From the bar area, you can't tell how big this place actually is, as we followed our hostess to our booth, more and more space was revealed. Charming & classy. Food was superb. I had no complaints with my rare ribeye, friend ordered her filet very well done (?!) (uh.. borrring), we're opposites in that dept. The balsamic vinaigrette salad, mashed potatoes and chocolate mousse creme desert were all good and dandy. I had an amazing time here, service is always top notch at any Ruth's. You beat 5A5 and The Cut in Beverly Hills by a long shot.
author: Thuy M.

description:
MMMMM...MEAT.

This review is for the Dine About Town menu of $35 for a 12 oz. ribeye, salad, mashed potatoes and the Chocolate Sin Cake. SUCH a good deal!! The waiter was very attentive and our first bite of meaty goodness shut up our rowdy party of 8 instantly! I'm not sure if I would shell out the usual prices but definitely the right place to be for DAT.

The DAT, a shared bottle of wine (last one recommended on the DAT menu) and tax&tip = $51. 

Imagine: your 500 degree plate coming out...medium rare steak...butter sizzling... DROOOOOOOOOOL.
author: Christina L.

description:
we went tonight to celebrate a birthday and had early  reservations for dinner. I expected to have a leisurely dinner with a cocktail, appetizer the main course and dessert.
once we sat down Edward proceeded to get our drink orders and then was pushing to get our dinner orders. we told him we wanted an appetizer and then ordered dinner. within 1 1/4 hrs we were finished with the whole meal and got the check. I felt like we went to a diner and ate fast food.

I ordered coffee and the first cup was very good and hot. When I asked for refill I got a lukewarm cup and asked Edward for another cup which he begrudgingly brought and served on the wrong side.

Food was good but Harris's is better overall.
author: George F.

description:
My best friend and I are NOT meat lovers, we love SEAFOOD and FISH, but she said I HAD to come and give this restaurant a try. 

She made reservations for four during the June 09 DAT. I told her that i wasn't a huge fan of meat. She made this place sound like heaven and guaranteed that I'd like it here. 

We had reservations at 8pm and got there a little early, we were seated within 10 minutes. 

Lights were dim, with a romantic and classy ambiance. 

We started off with 

RED WINE ( I have no clue what kind), we brought in our own and it was GOOD, not too dry. 

SEARED AHI: PERFECT to my liking! it seriously melted in my mouth! I love the serving size, nice and small and served perfect as an appetizer to start the meal off. 
and 
SCALLOPS: also very GOOD. It was big, plump, juicy and full of flavor!! 

We all ordered from the DAT menu and had 
-4 mixed green salads 
-2 Filet Mignon 
-1 Oscar style Rib-eye Steak 
-1 Rib eye Steak 
-2 Key Lime Pies 
-2 Bread Pudding 

I myself had the Filet, and yes it seriously melted in my mouth. It was nice, warm and buttery! It was served with mashed potatoes on the side which i loved!!! 

I tried some of the Oscar style rib eye steak and it was a little too rich for me. I was very satisfied with our appetizers and my filet. For dessert I had the key lime pie, which I thought was the perfect ending to the meal. It was nice, tart and light.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I love a good steak and had heard good things about this chain.  There are only a few locations in Canada and none in my hometown, so I decided to come here for dinner, especially since they're running one of their Ruth's classics promos currently and there's 3 course menus for $39.95 or $49.95 depending on what entree you choose.

I went with the $39.95 option and had a caesar salad, 6oz filet with shrimp and the symphony selection for dessert with included berries in cream and chocolate mousse in a chocolate shell.  Hubby had the $49.95 version since he wanted the11 oz filet, but he had the same salad and dessert as me.

Service was pretty good.  Their wine list is okay but limited if you only want to order by the glass.

Salad was pretty good with crisp greens and nice parmesan chunks.  The steaks are nicely served on hot plates so your meal stays warm.  But for a steak place, they're not good at differenting the state of doneness!  I had a medium rare that was more well done than my hubby, who ordered a medium-medium well!  The steaks are literally sitting in butter, so it may be a bit greasy for some.  Flavor wasn't bad.  The peppercorn sauce on the side was quite nice (additional $3).

The sides were also okay - no complaints about the mashed potatoes or mushrooms.  Desserts were also okay.

The big thing that bothered me was inconsistency with the medium rare to medium well that shouldn't happen at a place where steak is their claim to fame.

At the price we paid, it was a great deal.  But if I wasn't here on a classic menu, I would have been seriously disappointed.  The CUT chain still reigns in my book!
author: Katie F.

description:
What I should have done was screwed off the top of the salt shaker and poured the entire contents down my throat--I would have had the same experience as eating at Ruth's Chris but at least it wouldn't have cost me an overpriced plate of stringy meat drowned in oil and fat.  If you like steak that is buttered and salted to oblivion, then Ruth's Chris Steak House is the place for you!

The saving grace of my dining experience was the extremely friendly and personable waiter.  Sure the corny jokes and the guffawing were a bit hokey, but I prefer hokey over "mmmyess" service any day.  

I must say though that I gave a few bits of the left-over steak to my dog when I got home and he told me (through his manic attempts to eat my fingers afterward) that he would give it five yelp stars.  I guess that's a win for Ruth's Chris.  But then again, he licks his butt.  So I guess that's a lose for Ruth's Chris.  Also, he had a terrible onslaught of diarrhea the next day.  A double lose for Ruth's Chris and an even bigger lose for me.
author: Gail S.

description:
Ah.  My favorite steak house so far (though I like House of Prime Rib for well, their prime rib).  

I had the luxury of attending Ruth Chris for my brother's birthday.  And lets say, I didn't really go for my brother, I went for the steak.    

And wow, the T-bone steak was amazing.  Flavorful, buttery, goodness.   And to everyone's amazement, I took the bone and sucked on the bone until there was literally nothing on it.  

I've been craving to go again.  If only I had someone to go with.
author: Andy G.

description:
This steak house may be a chain, but for a chain restaurant the food, ambiance and service is impeccable! I'd rather come here in a group versus as a couple. It's obvious, the bigger the group the bigger the tables- but it's also the more space you get between tables too. 

True story, came in with my now fiance, and we were seated so close to the next couple that throughout the meal we ended up trying each others appetizers and conversing through the whole meal! Yes, so close to the other party it was no longer an intimate setting. No complaints tho, I'm just glad the other couple was so nice. 

The appetizers that were shared amongst strangers (haha) was the calamari, tempura onion rings, and the mushrooms stuffed with crab meat. Both quite good, but typical in taste- the calamari had a nice, Asian dipping sauce. 

I had a perfect medium done, petite filet along with a juicy, lobster tail with a side of my favorite here- the Au Gratin; thinly sliced potatoes in a creamy, cheesy flavorful sauce. The asparagus and hollaindaise sauce was perfect- make sure to ask for the sauce on the side, it's better that way. 

I can't remember what my fiance had, I just know he was suckered into choosing hash browns as his side! I forgot their name for it, but the way the waiter described it was as potatoes prepared in a clarified butter and seasoned lightly. He fell for it and what we got was a plate of hash browns fried in clarified butter! The leftovers were great the next morning, with my eggs and "clarified buttered" toast haha! 

For dessert, I absolutely love their Caramelized Banana Cream Pie. Who can't love a nice tart with banana custard, hints of caramel and white chocolate in every bite then topped with caramelized sliced bananas?

Service, like I said is impeccable and the food keeps me quite happy.
author: S Y.

description:
I highly recommend the Ruth's Classic, three course meal.

Ordered the watermelon salad as the first app, for main the 16oz Ribeye with a free side: fingerline potatoes and strawberry shortcake or whatever it was for the 3rd entree. 

Bottom line, the steak was tender and delicious. I would come back for the steak,. However, the sides were overseasoned with salt (fingerling + spinach and mushroom, sampling from friends). 

Service was decent. Nice wine list.
author: Ken C.

description: This was my second time going to Ruth's Chris, and BECAUSE my second visit was for Dine about Town, I'd have to say my first time was better. Skip the Dine about Town here...go for their regular menu. Their Dine about Town menu is just $5 less than their usual Prix Fixe menu, except you can't make any substitutions. My advice would be to go with their usual Prix Fixe which comes with a salad, main dish and dessert, and switch out the salad for the Harvest salad--hands down the BEST salad I've ever had. It has corn, dried cherries, bacon, tomatoes, white balsamic vinaigrette, goat cheese and cajun pecans. Imagine that with a medium rare Filet Mignon, and a to-die-for berries and cream all for $40!
author: Cindy N.

description: I had the pleasure of dining at Ruth Chris for the first time yesterday evening in connection with the Dine About Town promotion. Overall the experience was excellent! The food was delicious, plentiful, appeared quickly, and the service was likewise top notch. We were greeted and seated promptly and soon Jordan appeared table-side to tell us about the details of the promotion and any alternatives we wished to explore. I was fortunate enough to be in the company of three lovely young women including an exalted Yelp Elite so you know I was having a great time! Most of us had the filet mignon which was expertly prepared and melt-in-your-mouth as filet mignon should be. The Dine About Town menu had a variety of entrees so we we're not limited to steak and one of our party enjoyed the poached salmon which looked delicious! This was my first visit to Ruth Chris but it definitely won't be my last!
author: Lou S.

description: Inconsistent service at the bar based on arrogant server with beard
author: Anna M.

description:
We came here for my husband's 28th birthday and I honestly have to say that this was one of the best places we have ever eaten. It was great from start to finish, from the bread & butter to the Ceaser salad, to the entree' & desert. *And the Luxuritas were the best! My husband got the Filet with Lobster Tail and a side of sauteed mushrooms while I got the Stuffed Chicken with mashed potatoes. YUMMY!!!! 

A little pricy but WELL WORTH it!! Hope to come back soon!
author: Jessica B.

description:
Can I just say WOW!!

First let me say the new open table reservation on the iPhone worked great and Ruth's Chris had my reservation when I arrived. I got there early thinking I was going to sit at the bar and have a drink while I waited but instead they seated me right away. The ambiance of the place was elegant in a welcome home sort of way. Our waiter, David, was perfectly energetic without being overwhelming. His excitement for the place and food increased my anticipation for the meal. Being a noob to this steak house David broke down the meat, FDA prime, and how they cook it with mouth watering detail. The Ruth's Chris Classics are by far the best value but I got the cowboy steak and the sweat potato casserole. 

The steak was perfectly cooked just the way I ordered it, medium rare, brought out on their 500 degree plate meant the meat was still sizzling. Mmmmmmm, the smell was steak-tastic. David was right, even though I ate my steak slow, savoring every bite, the plate kept it warm all the way to the end. If I was not in such a nice place I would have picked the bone up with my hands and gnawed the rest of the meat from it since the knife could not get ever last morsel off. Then I tried the sweat potato, let me say this should be on the dessert menu. They were sweat like candy without being oily or overly buttery, absolutely amazing. 

All in all I recommend this place to those of us that love steak for the flavor of the meat itself. All you vegetarians and sauce users just stay away.
author: Eric H.

description:
Was here for the Dine About Town. Even though we made reservations, we still had to wait over half an hour. That's fine as I understand that they are very busy and might be running late. But as all the other people who arrived about the same time or even later got seated, we started to get a little impatient. 

Unless we actually spoke up, they didn't even plan on seating us as if we weren't even there and I somehow felt that it happened because we were 4 guys waiting... homophobic? Maybe. I don't know. When we finally got seated, there were quite a few empty tables. It's a big restaurant also... I would give the matride negative 5-stars if I could! 

Anyways, back to the food. Our server Jasmine was extremely lovely and nice! Knowledgeable about the restaurant and willing to explain the different items on the menu and was very gracious throughout the night. What a huge contrast to the matride! 

Anyways we all ordered off the Dine About Town Menu. The salad was ok. I'd prefer if there was a tad bit more dressing. The Rib Eye was juicy and flavourful while the Fillet was pretty buttery. I think I liked the Rib Eye a bit more just because of the flavor. All steaks were served on a burning hot plate with melted butter. 

Both the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were good, but I'm always partial to potatoes lol 

Desert was either New Orleans Style Bread Pudding or Key Lime Pie. Both were excellent, but I liked the Key Lime Pie more just because after a huge piece of steak, something lighter was more appropriate.
author: JET T.

description:
OK fans Ruth's Chris is a chain and yes I usually steer clear of such nonsense. However, these guys do a great job anywhere you go (San Francisco, Honolulu, Scottsdale, Sacramento, Palm Springs) - you can not go wrong.  

Budget conscious folks - this is not your type of place!

Save your money make a date with your sweetie and you'll have a great time.
author: Bill G.

description:
So we went to Ruth's Chris for the BF's birthday. Hearing about it from friends and here on Yelp about it being "The best steak EVER". So I made reservations, told them it was a birthday, which earns you a free dessert. Confetti on the table, kinda cheesy but sweet.

I got the Filet with Shrimp, BF got the huge Ribeye. We shared a bottle of wine and sides were creamed spinach and baked potato.

Service: Guy was great, but we had to wait a LONG time before food came out. He checked in once a while. 

Food: SUCKED. Steak crumbled, instead of melted, in my mouth. BF was underwhelmed. He said I could cook a better steak, which is SAD. I just marinate my ribeye overnight and pan sear it in butter. Nothing special.
Also, Plate was HOT, steak was not. My center was a little cold and dry. I had to fight with my steak! Not good at all... Sides were bland. I added salt.
I LOVE steak. My dad, who cooked us Wagyu Ribeyes back home would totally freak out if he tasted this and saw the price. 

Price: Meal plus tip cost us about $230. 

Bottom line: Maybe we were there on an off night, or the beef we got was not properly aged. BUT. Totally overpriced and overrated! NEVER again! For Ribeyes, I'll stick to home cooking.
author: Lydia R.

description:
Oh my. 

Saturday night was a full house. Def recommend making reservations. 

We were the youngest peeps in the restaurant forsure...a little awk, but hey if you can afford a 400 dolla dinner (4 people) just like everyone else, then no big deal, right?

This was my second visit to a pricey steakhouse. And this was also my second time not ordering any type of beef from a steakhouse. Whoops.

CALAMARI: Calamari, bell peppers, and a sweet sauce. Tasted sort of asian. Nothing out of this world.

THE CLASSICS (starter, entree, side, dessert)

-Harvest salad, crab cakes, green beans, dessert:
Harvest salad was SO good!! Spinach and lettuce, dried cranberries, goat cheese, with a lemon vinaigrette. Mmmmmmm. Crab cakes (3) were okay. Just okay. Def a lot of crab in those things. But nothing special. Green beans were so delicious too, omg. Crunchy and ahh. Dessert was choco cake with vanilla ice cream. That choco cake....DAMN! I don't even like choco cake!! That stuff was so moist. Def got chocolate wasted that night. 

-Caesar salad, ribeye, garlic mashed tatoes, dessert: Probably one of the best caesar salads I've ever had. Ribeye was standard. Garlic mashed tatoes were delish. And I already raved about the choco cake. 

LAMB CHOPS:
BEST LAMB, EVARRRRRR. Get it medium rare. Nuff said. 

T-BONE:
Holy shit that was so juicy and so tender. Get it rareeee. 


I think the waiter had a thing for my bf....I can't even count the number of times he ran his hand along my bf's back...lol.
author: Nicole G.

description: The best steak I had lately and great customer service as well keep it up with the good work and food !!!!
author: Hermes L.

description: Very good place.  I wouldn't usually choose an expensive place like this one but the dine about town gave a great deal.  We upgraded to the rib-eye and had a bottle of wine.  The sides were so tasty and the steak was unbelievable.  It was a really nice experience overall, the servers name was Jordan and she was really nice, gave us great service.  Only thing i didn't care for much was the dessert, it was still great but not as amazing as the steak, the sides and the salad.  All the other things were so good though so 5 stars.
author: James D.

description:
ruth chris is a national favorite. Excellent selection of wine. Most nice ones are over $15 per glass. Had a Duckhorn merlot ($26)with my petite filet. The beef selections are all good, and come swimming on a sizzling plate of butter. 

I have to mention the crabcakes. It is 99% crab, and big chunks of it. Yum-mo!! I didn't taste any bread crumb at all. Perhaps it was held together by the butter lol

This a nice steakhouse, though a tad on the pricy side. and bring your cholesterol-lowing pill of choice. make sure you block off time to work out the next day to erase the guilt lol
author: joyce l.

description:
Nothin like a good steakhouse =] Ruth's is your classic steakhouse that is dependable for both great service and high-quality food. My dad and I started with the crab-stuffed mushrooms, which were absolutely fabulous and highly recommended if you like crab at all. For the main course, I ordered the filet and my dad got the lambchops, we shared sides of the sweet potato casserole and plain steamed broccoli. My steak filet was cooked perfectly to medium-well, just how I like it and although my dad's lambchops were also good, they were too fatty for my liking. I love sweet potatoes to begin with, but the brown sugar and pecan topping on the casserole really pulled together the side and made it memorable. We finished our meal with the chocolate explosion, which was just a molten chocolate cake, good but nothing extraordinary. 

My only gripe was that everything was swimming in butter. Both the appetizer and my filet were both soaking in a puddle of melted butter, and I could very evidently taste the buttery goodness in the sweet potato casserole as well. Granted, the immense amount of butter probably explains why the dishes were so decadent, but ideally my food wouldn't be drenched in fat. 

It was a very satisfying meal, exactly what I would have expected for the price paid. Our server Jack was great as well, he was very friendly and likeable and always made sure we were doing well. We even stayed for nearly an hour after paying the bill and didn't feel rushed to leave at all!
author: Diana C.

description:
Gosh, it's been so long since I have been here that they have raise their prices $10 since....

The arugula salad was soooo good.  There's something about arugula and vinaigrette... 

The petite filet I has was perfectly cooked sorta, all but a quarter of the steak was medium rare, so I didn't eat that section.  

If you are new to Ruth Chris, the magic is in the pool of butter the steak is served in.  Just dip each bite in the butter, and you'll be hooked.
author: Debbie N.

description:
Came here to celebrate a birthday dinner on Friday, I had made 7:30 reservations but we came here early at 7. They were still able to seat us! Perfect! The had the dine about town menu going - but they also had a set-menu (with a lot more options than the DAT menu). The set-menu came with a starter, the entree w/a side of your choice, and a dessert for $49.95. You can also "upgrade" your side to a full sized side or different side dish for $2 more. This is the same with the dessert - if you didn't like the dessert that it comes with, you can also change it for only $3 more extra a person. 

So we decided to go with the set-menu. They also bring you a warm loaf of bread with butter. We started off with a Cesar salad and a Crab and Corn bisque. Both were really good. We both ordered the 16 oz rib-eye (which would have been $10 more for the DAT menu) and I got the side of sauté mushrooms, and did an upgrade for scalloped potatoes. The steaks were cooked perfectly and had great flavor! Can't go wrong with steak cooked in butter! For dessert we both changed our dessert and got a creme brulee and a chocolate molten cake. The molten cake was not as good as some other places I've tried, but it was not bad. The creme brulee tho, was really good and light! 

Overall, had a fantastic streak experience! Service was great and very attentive. I really like how they have the set menu now, because it makes dining there really fun! Will def. come back!
author: Betty S.

description: I'm not one for many fancy dinners, so I was pleasantly surprised by how amazing the dinner was. I truly felt like a welcomed guest who the waiter, Ryan, took joy in serving. Even when I announced I was a vegetarian, Ryan took it well with a sincere chuckle and was eager to show me my options. The tempura onion rings were the best I've ever had, the green beans were fantastic, and the potatoes au gratin (and my date's mashed potatoes) were to die for. Not to mention the bread, butter and drinks. The atmosphere was so classy, romantic and welcoming. It was one of the best dinners I've ever experienced!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
My husband and I love this place.  We've gone here on multiple occasions and they have yet to disappoint us.

The food is always great.  The service is impeccable.  When making a reservation, make sure you ask for Jordan - she's the best they have.
author: Michelle D.

description:
"I'm not a steak fan."  That's what I tell people.  

In fact I was less than enthused the first time I walked into Ruth's Chris with my (pun intended) meat-craving girlfriends, because I...just...don't...do...steak....

Or do I?

Maybe I am a medium rare filet mignon kind of girl.  With a succulent lobster tail on the side of course.  Maybe I do like baked carmelized mashed sweet potatoes while holding the pecans please, and thank you very much.  So it turns out I'll have steak on special occasions.
