All the other months out of the year where I'm holding the butter, I will spend at Ruth's Chris punishing my lobster tail in that little golden bowl of goodness.

I've been there 3 times this year.  Once in March for a girl's dinner, 2 weeks ago for my cousin's graduation in Anaheim, and tonight for my birthday.  The choco cupcake with the raspberry cheesecake frosting with the vanilla ice cream on the side was DELISH.
author: Meesh K.

description:
Great date place. My bf and I went there on a Friday night for a very early 6pm dinner. Our server was Cyndi. She was great. Totally knows what is great on the menu and is honest. We ordered the Gamba zin from Russian River and it was very good, a little peppery but I loved it. 
We ordered: 
Crab stuffed Mushrooms- Get them, they are screamin 
Fillet- Really great, got the blue cheese crust which was good but next time I will skip it 
Rib Eye- Really really great 
Creamed Spinach, better than the House of Prime Rib 
Potatoes Au Gratin- really cheesy 

All in all, Ruth Chris, I don't love you, but I don't hate you. You are decent. The service is excellent. Nestor and Cyndi took great care of us. Would I go back? Sure. I wish I could have a love affair with Ruth Chris but I don't think I will. But for all of you who want a decent steak, go here, get wine, and have a blast.
author: Mar M.

description:
Hospital food is much better. Our waitress seemed snubby, food was bad for all 5 of us 
what a disappointment
author: Paula T.

description:
Came here with my bf on Saturday night for Dine About Town.  We found free street parking about two blocks from the restaurant.  We arrived at our reservation time and were seated within 2 minutes.  The ambiance was romantic, with dim lighting and a candle lamp on each table.

The complimentary white bread was amazing...warm, soft in the middle, and slightly crisp crust.  It was accompanied by whipped butter.  We usually don't eat much bread, but this bread was heavenly...we both ate four pieces :).

The house salad was good...fresh, but nothing spectacular.  Same with the sides - mashed potatoes and creamed spinach...meh.

Our steaks (8 oz filets) came out on sizzling hot plates each topped with 1 tablespoon of butter.  They were cooked to a perfect medium-rare, as requested.  We had to blow on the first few bites before eating them as to not burn our tongues...it doesn't get any fresher than that.  The steaks melted in our mouths...tender, juicy, buttery...the way steaks should be!

For dessert, we were served vanilla ice cream with raspberry syrup along with chocolate cake with cream cheese frosting.  Both were yummy, but I especially loved the ice cream...it was flavorful and creamy with a touch of iciness.  A perfect way to end the meal :).
author: Christella T.

description:
HANDS DOWN BEST and FAV RESTAURANT EVER!!  

Have eaten here more than 20 times---years ago this was the BF and I's place to eat for a special occasion, now we find our selves needing to eat here at least once every other month or two.  BF always orders the cowboy ribeye which he orders medium rare and I always choose the Ruths Classic Filet or Petite Filet---Medium rare of course!  Sides are all great!  My faves are the Baked Potato and Creamed Spinach. But I have ordered most of their side dishes and all are so yummy!  Recently they have their new orleans mac n cheese---which comes with cheesy jalapeños!    Asparagus, mushrooms, Potatos Au Gratin is yummy!  Creme Brulee is also my fav here.  Customer service is always great.  There was probably about 1-2 x that service and food was not that great and when we said something, they comped our meal and even gave us $25 off the next time we dined again.  I know it is a chain restaurant but i so love that butter steak!!!  Caesar salad here is yummy too!  Things I have ordered as well is the Lobster appetizer and also the calamari is yumms!  They also decorate your table and give a free dessert during anniversary and birthdays!
author: Nicole M.

description:
The SF Ruth's Chris is usually pretty good, though not always. I've ordered the same medium-rare ribeye a million times, and sometimes it's a little too rare, other times it's a little too done. Not a big deal at a place Outback, but Ruth's Chris is certainly not cheap. I'd really like to see a little more consistency in their steaks, being a high-end steakhouse and all.

What IS consistent (or who, rather) is the server in the bar area. Daria is always friendly, helpful, fast and attentive. Whether or not the food is perfect, the service always is.
author: Ziad E.

description:
We came here last night for my official b-day dinner!!

Ruth's Chris came through again, we ordered the fried calamari, lobster bisque, cowboy ribeye steak, hashbrowns, creamed spinach, mushrooms and the incredble banana cream pie.

The bread came out piping hot and was soooo tasty with butter.  The bisque was super creamy, just like Craftsteak in Las Vegas.  The calamari comes prepared with a sweet pepper sauce that is sooooo flavorful.

The steak comes dipped in butter that makes the meat so tender and juicy, and of course the sides were perfectly matched with the meal esp the crispy hash browns.

Finally,the banana cream pie was just outfuckingstanding........the top of the pie is carmelized like creme brulee and is filled with loads of banana creme filling and whipped cream.

During the meal, both the GM and Manager came by my table and re-confirmed to me how wonderful their service is.

A great meal...........so satisfying..........we left and went back home to do the nasty.....the perfect ending after a pefect meal.
author: Raider J.

description:
Of the food ordered, I got the rib eye steak, and my two friends got the filet mignon and my other friend got the salmon (their fish selection of the day).  We got creamed spinach and potatoes as sides.

My medium rare steak was actually done medium rare, which came out delicious.  It was delicious at first, but started to get overly savory with each consecutive bite.  A lot of other steaks I've had doesn't do this...they get better after every bite...not saltier.  And no, salty does not equal good taste.  Although, the texture of the beef was so moist and delicious.  I'll give them that.  My friends that got the medium rare filet mignon actually had theres cooked well done.  I don't mean that the meat was cooked extraordinarily in a 'well done' sense, but that the meat was overcooked.  BOTH OF THEM.  I can understand if it's just one person, but both?  You just messed up twice.  I had a small slice cut of their filet mignon and it was so dry that the meat had this particular bad odor.  And the salt somehow makes it more dry.  Not a fan.

This place has the feel of fine dining without actually really being fine dining.  In the end, it's just an expensive steakhouse.  I've experienced better steak at Black Angus than here...but maybe you're paying for the ambiance...although this place had a few folks with jeans and a t shirt here.  I'm not hating, just letting you know the facts.
author: Dararith L.

description:
The shrimp cocktail was excellent. It went downhill from there. They really pack you into that dining room with your 50 closest friends. The key lime pie came straight from the cooler (not good).
Hillstone is way better, more intimate with no corkage fee.
author: Pete C.

description: Tried it for the first time last week. Best steak I have ever had! Had Ribeye with the blue cheese crust added to it. My god. Delicious! My mouth is watering thinking about it right now. Great service, friendly staff, excellent food.
author: Justin L.

description:
Nice national steakhouse chain.

Stopped by on a weekday night for a business dinner. The steaks and appetizers are quite good. I especially enjoyed the lobster bisque. The steaks were served on super hot plates, which caused the steak to cook a little longer; keep this in mind if you want rare vs medium.  The wine parings were intriguing, I need to try them next time I come by.

As with most fine dining places everything is À la carte. ($$$$)

I personally prefer Izzy's steakhouse with regards to value, however if you're on an expense account or conducting business definitely go to Ruth's Chris!

The ambiance is very nice and the service was excellent, street parking can be tight however.
author: vinh t.

description:
Hubby and I went here to celebrate his employment.  Their steak- OMG!!!  They melt in your mouth--- so delish!!!  Also their service is fantastic!

I can't wait for another trip here
author: Susan M.

description:
I honestly cannot think of any reason to bring this rating down!

My boyfriend and I came here for his birthday, and we ordered from the Dine About Town menu.  First I must say: do not listen to any of the other reviews bashing the service - it was phenomenal!  Our server, Courtney, always seemed to be there right before we needed her, with a smile and helpful advice.  Ryan, Courtney's assistant, was extremely courteous and friendly, and didn't allow our water glasses to get less than half full . . . ever.

Now, to acknowledge the food.  After reading other reviews, I'm wondering if we just happened to order the "hit" items.  But every single item was a hit (I guess, the only thing I could possibly mark the review down on was the salad - it was much smaller than expected and little lack luster.  That doesn't mean that it wasn't good, and who needs a huge salad when a pound of award-winning beef is coming your way?)

I ordered a glass of the Don Miguel Gascon Argentinian Malbec, and he ordered the Mendocino Fog wines.  Although on the low-end of the wine list, both wines were incredibly smooth, and mine brought a smile to my face every time I took a sip.  The bread that accompanied the meal looked as though it was Safeway brand french bread, but after having some you realize that Ruth's Chris isn't messing around.  Even the bread was delicious, we had to have two loaves.

As I already mentioned, the Steak House Salad was the low point of the night. But it still wasn't bad, and it actually was the perfect size and lightness to precede what was to come.  It consisted of some mixed baby greens, a few sliced grape tomatos and garlic croutons, drizzled with vinaigrette dressing.

For the main, I ordered the 8 oz. Petite Filet, au poivre, medium rare, and he ordered the upgrade (+$10) 16 oz. Ribeye, medium rare.  First I must warn you, when you order "medium rare", you will get medium RARE.  I'm sure the masters in the kitchen know what they are doing, but it wasn't what I'm used to.  This all being said, it was probably the tastiest slice of beef I've had in yeaaarrs.  And the au poivre sauce was a delicious addition.  He ate the entire 16 ounces that was served, and even without any additional sauce, the meat still had a great flavor.
We both ordered the garlic mash as a side, which wasn't too garlicy, but was incredibly creamy and buttery, yum yum.

The Ruth's Symphony Duo dessert was nothing less than five stars.  I died every time I took a bite of the chocolate mousse.  And I'm not sure what the custard was in the other bowl, but it paired nicely with the rich chocolate mousse, especially with the amount of fruit that was in the custard.

All in all, a great experience. I highly recommend Ruth's Chris on Van Ness.
author: Emily L.

description:
Second time going there and I still had a great experience.  The minute I walked in, everyone was very attentive.  I ordered the Lamb Chop again and it still tasted superb.  They know how to cook their Lamb Chops well, that's all I can say.  Tried to go to other places for Lamb Chops, but nothing compares to RC.  

Note: I don't eat beef, so my varieties were limited to lamb or fish.
author: C L.

description: This is a great place to go for a special occasion meal. The steaks come out perfectly cooked, piping hot, and soaked in butter. The meat is tender, juicy, and delicious. The sides are also excellent, especially the shoestring fries and the creamed spinach. This isn't a light meal by any stretch of the imagination, but it's a great place to treat yourself once in awhile.
author: Diana G.

description:
My family from the Philippines are big on eating steaks. Anytime they think of a favorite meal, a big hearty steak is what always comes to mind. So when they came to visit SF, I knew I had to take them to Ruth Chris.

After making dinner reservations for 8ppl a few days prior, we arrived promptly at 7pm. Although we were heavily dressed down (3/8 people were teenagers), the wait staff didn't seem bias. They served us promptly with drinks and appetizers. 

Appetizers were: Calamari (crispy with pleasant spices), Stuffed Mushrooms with crab cakes (interesting earthy flavor with seafood but good nonetheless) and Lobster bisque soup (a little too tangy for my taste).

For entrees, we ordered: Lobster with petite fillet Mignon, 4 prime rib (shared between 5 people), butter chicken and halibut. I had ordered the lobster with steak and all I can remember was the steak's buttery heaven that melted into my mouth. The lobster complimented the steak very well, and we had sides of mashed potatoes and asparagus with hollandaise sauce (the sauce was was rated about 3/5; too "buttery-tasting" with not enough flavor). 

The people who ate the prime ribs were satisfied and even my kid-cousin mentioned that the steak was comparable to the best steakhouse where she frequents in the Philippines (Antonio's in Tagaytay). (On a side-note: my family from the Philippines is big on dining and spare no expense; taste and experience are priority). 

For dessert, we ordered two Chocolate Explosions (chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream), pecan pie and cheesecake. The pecan pie was your average pie with vanilla ice cream. The only difference was the caramel that decorated the plate. The lava cake was also OK; cousins mentioned that they've "had better." But the cheesecake was very good. Something about the right combination of buttery sweetness that made it noteworthy (even better than some Cheesecake Factory cakes). 

Our final bill came out to about $550 (including tip). For that price, we were delightfully satisfied (the week prior, we ate at Slanted Door for $700). Overall, we all enjoyed the food and company. The experience was just right... we'll definitely come back!
author: Carloalexi M.

description:
Stuffed to the gills when I left so that even the perfect deserts were partially left at the table.

Went late-ish with some work colleagues and although most of  the service was sluggish, for some reason they forgot two deserts and did not check until I had to flag them down 1/2 way after everyone had eaten theirs. The place was packed and the rib-eye I had was simply one of the very best and rivaled the Smith & Wollensky rib-eye I had in terms of quality and cost.

It took a LONG time to get through dinner. We started at 7:30 and left by almost 10:30 PM because of the rather slow service and big crowd.

The table potato sides were Mashed roasted garlic, Au Gratin, Shoestring and Lyonnaise. All were great except for the Lyonnaise which was more deep-fried and dry. The veggies were Sauted Mushrooms, French Fried Onion Rings [Terrific], Fresh Broccoli Au Gratin, Fresh Spinach, Creamed Spinach [WOW] and Fresh Asparagus With hollandaise.

Overall I was glad I did it, though I'm not sure I would go there again by myself or my wife for dinner for the cost. The a la carte menu has always bothered me since you think you can assemble exactly your own dinner, but the premium that this costs is clearly a play for money rather than really adding quality or value to a meal.

For the money and the fun and great quality meats go to a Churrascaria (see my other reviews).
author: Glenn H.

description: Decided to give Ruth Chris Steak House a try since I was craving steak and my Mom told me how amazing this place is. In all honesty, this is one of my new favorite restaurants. The service was spectacular, good menu choices, and of course, the food was perfect! I ordered the petite fillet with creamy spinach, and when they took out my dish I still heard the sizzling of the sauce on the hot plate. It was amazing! Totally recommend it, and yes I would come back here again.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Even though this is a franchise place...I actually think that Ruth's Chris tastes pretty darn good!

I've tried the pretty much almost every cut on the menu and my favorite gotta be the cowboy rib-eye.  Butter infused steaks!  hahaha...that's their secret i guess.  

Only thing I hate is the high prices they have as they charge you for side dishes as well...and it can run you a arm and a leg at the end of the night.
author: Patrick C.

description:
I usually get the porterhouse for two. you get a ribeye and filet chop. delicious. I want to go 2m! IThe salads we're nothing special and the desserts are standard. The Steak is the MONEY! 

onion rings, spinach, potatoes..all excellent. 

That's it, I'm going tomorrow.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Of course you would expect 5 stars at this phenomenal restaurant, and for the food I think it's definitely justified. The service, the wine, the ambiance... all fantastic. The biggest issue I had when walking through the front doors was the smell... I know it's a steakhouse, but it smelled as if the cows were being butchered right there in the kitchen, and then cooked with the kitchen doors wide open. Call me crazy or oversensitive, but I never get bothered by strong smells, and this was intense. Plus, I went in there on a pretty empty stomach, so maybe that was part of the reason that I couldn't handle the meaty smells. Overall, great experience once I got used to that..!
author: Courtney M.

description:
delectable melty buttery steak, decent sides, and lovely service. I hope you get Gabriella for your server - she is a super sweetheart. 
dessert: meh. whatever, you're already full of savories. 
cocktails: primo.
highlight: employee body language. Seriously. One of our busboys was master and king of big, grand, sweeping gestures, and the waitress who directed me to the ladies' room practically posed like a ballerina as she nobly pointed the way. It's a small thing, but made me feel like a princess. Loved it!!!
author: Jessica W.

description:
i had a great experience at Ruth's Chris as a first time customer.  My reservation was for friday at 8 pm and the restaurant did a very good job with showing us to our table within that time. the food was fantastic. perfectly cooked steak, yummy cheesy potatoes and key lime pie. 

tips: it's A LOT of food. I really recommend sharing the entire course because otherwise you're going to have to take a medium rare steak home, microwave it and you're now eating a medium well..i know it may sound like im cheap, but that's not the case.  a 16 oz new york strip is more than enough for two, especially when you factor in the bread, salad, apppetizer and dessert. I was cocky, saying this is nothing about my bone in rib eye, but no more than six bites later i was ready for a to go box. 
i brought my own imperial moet chandon champagne thank god.. otherwise it would have been 88 bucks for a bottle had i purchased it there. oh yes there is a 15 dollar corkage fee, but still worth it

dress attire ranges from t shirts to suits. i say go comfortably but not shaggy :) 

if it's your anniversary, mention it when you make a reservation cause for us they put rose petals on the table and we got a free dessert.

cork fee, salad, appetizer, ny steak, bone in ribeye , and 2 sides =$159.00
author: Sylvia G.

description: Love there customer service here! I defiantly recommend there stuffed chicken it is amazing!
author: Ashley R.

description:
So let's get the obvious out of the way, I'm a steak fan.

With that being said, I recently went there with my girlfriend for a romantic evening and was blown away with the flavor.  Let it be known that the ambiance and snooty atmosphere was not apparent and the restaurant provided a nice touch to the subtle music and clean presentation that should come with all meals.  

But I'm sure you're not reading this to hear about all of that.  You're wondering how was the food.  

We both ordered the Rib Eye.  Juicy, flavorful and cooked perfect to order.  It was like taking a bite of heaven and having an angel grill it for you and present it on a plate hot enough to singe your eyebrows off.  It was accompanied by a lovely plate of asparagus and potatoes potatoes au grain.  The asparagus was steamed to perfection with no seasoning added, because lets face it, you don't want salty ass veggies.  The potatoes were cooked to a nice soft consistency while still maintaining its shape and texture.

The drink of choice, for those of you who know me, was Jack and Coke... Strong and tasty.  No watered down BS... 

Why yelp this restaurant, because I love steak.. And it is always nice to share a great meal with someone you care about.   So in closing, Food was great, Drinks were great and company was extra great.... 

Oh ya, make reservations, I did.  If you don't you may be waiting a while.  We were seated shortly after arriving.
author: Adam Y.

description:
I recently went here for Dine About Town, and what a steal! Salad, steak, and dessert for $35. Wine by the bottle is decently priced as well. I highly suggest going to try at least once. Their steak is cooked perfect to your liking.

The waiters and manager were all GREAT also. Helpful and funny. 

Even keep your eyes peeled for celebrities. Andres Torres from sfgiants was sitting at the table across from us. 

Great place for a date or if you just want a good steakhouse
author: Michelle T.

description: Yummy for my tummy good. My steak was cooked perfectly, enjoyed all my side dishes and drinks. Granted, it may be a tad pricey to come here often.. I splurge whenever I can. Nice being able to spoil yourself with a well prepared steak. Delish!
author: Danielle A.

description:
arrived on time for the appt, but had to wait 15 mins before we got seated. 

got the cowboy ribeye, it was good but by no means the best steak i've had. For the price I was a bit disappointed.

the cheesecake was really big, and tasty though.
author: Danielle A.

description:
First, I've made a reservation party for 2 at 7:45pm on a Tuesday. Arrived at 7:40pm and still waited for 20min. (maybe busy ?). Once walked in, it is near only 20% of table full. Not sure why still a wait when there are many tables are available.

Ordered the complete set meal Seasonal Classics for $39.99 since it sounds good deal. "Caesar Salad" as starter with butter and bread, not bad at all. Entrée I picked "6 oz. Filet & Shrimp" , order medium for the Filet and it comes out like medium well or well done. It is Dry and no juice !! My waiter disappeared for almost 10min... so what to do  ? wait or eat ? Eat it anyway since I am hungry. The set dessert "A Dessert Duo pairing of Chocolate Cake and Berries & Cream" tasted like leftover from couple nights old. My friend order the exact same set and we both experienced the same and very disappointed.

May be I was making a mistake to order the set dinner... I should have go to Harris' (they also have set dinner) instead since it cost about the same and its way much better taste than this chain store Ms Chris. Btw, the seats are good and good for dating if you don't care the food and that's how it got 2 starts otherwise will be one. Hope that help.
author: Mr. Stone D.

description: Omg my new fave! The petite filet and shrimp was wonderful! Great appetizers! (especially the crab cakes! must have!) Calamari was also yuummy! It was like sweet and sour. Just perfect! Though service was a bit slow, the food was to die for!
author: Verdina P.

description: 2nd time coming. I give the sides and appetizers and ambience of the restaurant 5 stars but the steak itself I say 3.5 stars. Nothing special about the steak or the flavoring on it just a regular good steak! The stuffed chicken is amazing. If you want the best steak in San Francisco try Bobo's right up the street.
author: K H.

description:
Ruth's Chris Steak House has become my standard for steaks. Although the atmosphere may be a scene from Boston Legal's after hours lounge area, Ruth Chris's Steak House knows how to cook a steak. For my birthday, my derpina brought me here to try their cowboy steak. The cowboy ribeye, which comes at a very reasonable price $39, is the best steak I've ever had. Growing up as a steak-eating, potato loving hungry man, I've had more than my fair share of high quality steaks. My father is a steak enthusiast, and as such it was passed on to me. Let me tell you about good steaks. Ruth Chris's Steak House has the best steak in San Francisco and is definitely a place to savor and try over and over again; it is even better than the famed House of Prime Rib. Let me give you a tip on that cowboy ribeye. Get it medium rare, and get it charred. What is charred? charred is where they put a smoky, peppery layer on top of the cowboy ribeye after its been through the 1800 degree oven. In addition to the cowboy ribeye, definitely add a side -be it a type of potato or Ruth Chris' famous creme spinach (10$). I had the creme spinach side and it was plenty for two people. It was buttery in texture and went well with every few ribeye bites. As I waited in anticipation, I absorbed the warm atmosphere within this establishment. I would definitely suggest a Merlot wine to prepare your palette for the flavors to come. The steak came out sizzling on a hot plate. Once it was set, I sliced in. The first bite......PERFECT. It is exactly as I would imagine the perfect steak to taste. It was buttery in texture, crispy all around, tender as you bit in. You could really taste the entree. The char... magnificient (don't eat burned foods, but this exception may be worth it.) The steak was so good. My girlfriend got the Surf and Turf, Filet Mignon 8oz and Lobster. It was about 50$ more or less. The Filet Mignon was very different from the cowboy ribeye; it was much more tender. The Filet cut was much more tender than that of the ribeye, but that is not to say that one is superior to the other in taste. I feel that both were flavorful in their own respect. However if you want a cut of steak that's both buttery in texture AND bite then I would recommend the Filet cut. The lobster was tasty too, but trust me when I say, come here for the steaks. Overall Ruth's Chris Steak House was a pleasant memory for my quarter century full of tasty steaks and friendly waiters. 5 stars.

wifive
author: simon k.

description:
Thank you to Andrea ( our server), Eddie ( manager) and the rest of the staff for taking care of us for my Dad's 63rd Birthday. 

Service is still truly exceptional. Food is out of this world good. Still opted for the Filet and Lobster combo, though the special has ended, it now goes for $49.95.Ceasar is better than I remember, sides ordered were hash browns ( smothered in cheddar) and mushrooms. Try both. 

Almost forgot. for a starter we got the calamari, a dish done so generic at most restaurants, but here it has a sweet and sour sauce that brings out the " Whoa" factor. 

but, the important question...Is the steak here perfect?? 

Without a doubt.
author: Taj A.

description: So this was my second time coming here and the food was excellent , however the service was lacking and mediocre . I ordered the rib eye with gorgonzola topping and had  a side of hash browns.  Our server was Jordan and she was good but our bus boy sucked badly. We had to ask for water and drink refills and waited a long time for it.  We had to ask for more bread and the bread was not even warm the first time it came by.  We did not have the proper utensils (1) no butter knife, 2) no steak knife 30 no spoons for creme brulee,) and had to ask for them three times.....wow! How can I eat my food? Shall I use my hands? WTF? Lucky the food saved it, but I would not recommend this place based in my second visit . I may or may not come back here!
author: Louise T.

description: Steak that comes on a 500 degree plate simmering with melted butter is never a bad idea but I would only give it 3-4 stars. Of all the steakhouse San Francisco has to offer, Ruth's Chris unfortunately doesn't make the top of the list and really isn't that impressive. The steaks were good at most, probably because of all the butter the steaks are sitting on.  For its price, (after wines, appetizers, the main course and sides, and desserts) I would much rather spend that money elsewhere. My first time at this location, I asked for my filet mignon to be medium rare. Note: I typically get my filet medium but wanted to try it medium rare. The steak came out a bit dry and overcooked and I was not impressed. My second time, I returned to the San Diego location on the waterfront and tried the same dish and it was cooked way better. So, I decided to return to this location again a few months later, and made sure to get my steak the way I wanted it to be cooked.
author: Katarina D.

description:
Caveat: this review is being written by a woman who is in an incredibly good mood. I'd like to thank the contributors to my fantastic mood: 

First and foremost, the California Bar exam graders who gave me a passing score, thus allowing me to pass the bar exam. Two weeks later, I get sworn in as an attorney for the state of Ca (dear God save us). Later that evening, I lubricate my throat with The most divine, delectable, smooth, and AMAZING 1996 bottle of Dom Perignon.

 So after I was exposed to all these mood elevating contributors, my wonderful hubby takes me to Ruth's Chris for a succulent piece of meat. Here's the thing, he took me here after he proposed, but I don't remember because I was on cloud nine. Here I am again, on cloud nine, but I remember everything. 

Service was friendly, warm and fun, thank you Jack, you're awesome. Meat was yummy!! First the kitchen cooked my medium rare more like medium. Have no fear, Jack quickly took care of it and brought me my meaty goodness in less than 3 minutes. 

All in all, no complaints. This place rocks!!!
author: Karen B.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here for Valentine's day.  He made reservations over a month in advance and the earliest he could get was 9 pm.  I thought it would be too late, but the timing was actually perfect because we had other to things to do that day.  We got there about 10 minutes to nine and there were still a lot of people coming in.  I think there were about 10 parties/couples waiting for their table (some without reservations but still came hoping to get a table..haha... suckers!)  We still waited about 15 minutes for our table and the bar was full so we just watched people eat and smelled the aroma of freshly grilled steaks that caused my stomach to grumble.... I was ready to eat!

We got seated in a corner booth which was nice, more intimate, and away from the noise.  We shared a Caesar salad and mushroom stuffed with crab meat to start off with.  The caesar salad was good but a little too heavy on the dressing.  The mushroom with crab meat was absolutely delicious and perfect choice for an appetizer.  I ordered the filet medium, and he ordered the New york medium rare with peppercorn sauce both paired with a glass of syrah.   Also ordered mashed potatoes on the side.  The steaks come out still sizzling on the plate.  My steak was a perfect medium, tender, and melt in your mouth MmmM..Mmmm good!  The side of mashed potatoes was creamy and a perfect accompaniment to the steak.  To end the meal we got a nice slice of cheesecake.  I was super full in the end and still had leftovers to take home.

Our waiter was very nice and made very good recommendations.  The only negative I can think of was the bread.  Nothing too special about it and it was cold.  They also have valet parking for $10 if you don't want to hunt for your own spot.
author: Anna Liza P.

description:
I came here for the Dine About Town on the very last day for this restaurant. Got the earliest reservation, so we didn't have to wait long. 
The bread basket was yummy with the soft butter. 
I got the chicken breast, cream spinach and the bread budding. The beau had the steak, mashed potatoes, and key lime pie. 

The croutons of the house salad was the best I had ever had. It was melt in your mouth good. The chicken was good, but I thought it had too much butter and tasted heavy because of whatever they stuff inside the it. I got full off of the grease rather than on the actual food. The cream of spinach was delicious and it balanced well with the entrees and the mashed potatoes. 

The service was great. Very attentive and the waiter was knowledgeable. 
I was glad that they extended their Dine About Town till Feb 1.
author: Mandy D.

description: Best steak ever. My husband and eat here almost every special occasion. Food atmosphere and service are amazing!
author: Candace H.

description:
After a nightmare-ish experience at Morton's (where I paid $50 for a nasty steak) I needed to cleanse out my system with a better piece of meat. I've never been to Ruth's Chris but I just had a feeling it wouldn't disappoint me. And since DAT is happening right now, I couldn't think of a better time to go. 

We had a reservation at 8pm on Thursday night. Parking was a little tricky but all three cars in our party ended up finding a spot. The ambiance was very classy. It didn't look worn down like at House of Prime Rib. 

Our DAT menu started out with a simple salad. I wish they didn't skim on the first course because it was a flat, boring pile of greens. My second course was the 8 oz. Petite Filet and it came out SIZZLING hot on a plate of BUTTER. Need I say more!? It was so satisfyingly delicious. Sometimes you don't need any special sauces to make a steak great. But butter is always a good idea! Paula Deen, you were right. The side of creamed spinach was also very good. You actually taste the spinach in addition to cream. 

Our night ended with a chocolate mousse and a carrot cake. Some people liked the fried strings of carrot on top but I didn't. It tasted like French's Onions which is not a bad thing but I don't prefer it on my cake! The chocolate mousse was nice. I don't think Ruth's Chris can ever topple the king, his majesty, House of Prime Rib but I'd say it could definitely be a lord in his court. 

P.S. This was my first dining experience with Gail N. I love having another yelper at the table while we both compile our yelp reviews out loud haha.
author: Julia T.

description:
Ate here for my dad's 50th birthday last Thursday. Meh. I found myself eating more of the sides than I did the actual steak. A little plus, there were mini portions for my kids, usually they have to split a dinner at a steak house so it was nice they got to get their own entree; my little foodies. 

The food was a little bland to me, I wanted to add some butter to my steak but didn't want to get the whole lecture on how our family has high cholesterol so picked at my side dishes taking little bites of steak here and there. 

The appetizers were pretty yummy, we got the ravioli, stuffed mushrooms and lobster stuffed something (my siblings and kids got to it before I could taste that one). Dessert was good, but my step mom had brought some mini cupcakes she bought at a small bakery in Livermore which I opted for
author: Jenavie T.

description:
They live up to their reputation! The food is always good when we go. The steaks are cooked to perfection a little crispy on the outside from the butter and juicy on the inside. I personally feel the extra butter is not necessary but if you are gonna have a fatty steak, might as well have the whole experience. I have no complaints about the service, they always do a good job.

I suggest: everything!
author: Aimee R.

description: Easy to get to location ( Use Ace Parking nearby). Restaurant is elegant and waiters are friendly and chatty. The food was great. Roasted brussel sprouts was my favorite.
author: Gopi M.

description:
Honestly, do I really need to write a review about Ruth's Chris Steak House? There is absolutely no reason for me to write yet another review for this place other than for me to revive my first and only time there thus far (at any Ruth's Chris for that matter!).

Saturday night. Valentine's day weekend. 9pm reservation on hand. Mrs. G. and I walk in early and get directed to the bar. We order a couple of drinks. They're spot on. 

Table is ready. Aww rose petals across the table and our server wishing us a happy anniversary? Yep, that's what I got for adding a note on the reservation! ;) 

To make a long story short, we ended up ordering about everything on the menu. 

I got the 11oz filet along with the 8oz lobster tail. I got my filet medium rare, and on the 500 degree plate, that thing was hot all the way till the last bite. And man... this is just as good as Kobe/Wagyu! It was soooo tender and juicy... 

Alright, anyway, it was badass and well worth it! Although next time, I think we could cut down on a few items. A 6 oz filet w/ lobster combo is actually a very good value compared to what I've got. There, that's for the money savvy in me!
author: TheGodfather S.

description:
Delicious steak!!!! (i had the filet mignon)

Great servers.   Wonderful date night.  Very accommodating front desk staff. Sides are yum. 

Save room for the dessert---chocolate explosion cake is delicious.  Skip out on the lobster, you can get it better elsewhere.
author: Zen K.

description:
Really excellent experience. Our waiter had impeccable manners. The filet and halibut were cooked to perfection. 

Since Ruth's Chris takes manners seriously, one small suggestion that would have made our experience absolutely perfect:

After our appetizer, the waiter asked if we were ready for the main course. We said yes. He left. Then my date got up to use the restroom. The waiter then came back with the food, saw my companion had gotten up, and proceeded to serve the food. The general rule is that if someone in an intimate party has gotten up, don't serve the main course. I know we had said we were ready, but the principle stands.

It was a wonderful experience, and we'll be back soon!
author: Charles Y.

description:
OMG by far best steak house I have ever been too. No joke. EVERYTHING I have ever had here was amazing. PHENOMENAL! Honestly I don't even know were to start.....

Pros- Great wine list, Appetizers, crab stuffed mushrooms and calamari are so delicious. We always get two orders of mushrooms. The bread is so good. I LOVE the filet mignon. It is the best filet I have ever had MOUTH WATERING! Lobster is good. Porterhouse is mouth watering. Creamed spinach and steak fries are amazing. OMG the cheesecake. Honestly its one of the best cheesecakes I have ever had. I think because its a mini cheesecake so all the flavors are fully balanced. Service is royalty. We walk out of there completely satisfied every time!

Cons- Must make reservations. Expect to spend a lot of money. But to us its worth every penny.
author: Juicy C.

description:
I went to Ruth's Chris last night, and even on a Thursday night, it was packed. We had a reservation for a party of 8 at 9pm (and arrived on time!), but still had to wait 15- 20 minutes for our table. 

I think it's a good steakhouse, but definitely not the best I've ever had. I tried the Lobster Bisque ($10) and it was "so so." I actually didn't like it very much; it tasted as though some sort of baking/ pastry ingredient was in there. The bisque had a little too much starch and wasn't particularly enjoyable. On the upside, it had chunks of lobster in it.
 
The salads were tasty, but pretty standard. 

I don't normally like creamed spinach, and Ruth's Chris's version of the dish didn't change that any (or if anything only confirmed it). If you're into it, you may like it. I don't. The mashed potatoes were too overwhipped and gritty for my taste. I personally (not to toot my own horn) make a mean mash, so maybe I've set my standards too high for a side. 

The steaks came SIZZLING. I had the ribeye, which was really fatty (I did not lke that at all), but it was good nonetheless. Apparently all the steaks come cooked in butter and for good measure, they throw another dollop of butter on there. You can order it without the dollup or with extra dollops. I think in the future, I'll order without- having my steak bathe in butter isn't exactly a preference of mine. 

For desserts, we had the Key Lime Pie and the Bread Pudding made with Jack Daniels. Both were very good/ excellent and our waiter was even nice enough to bring us over some Vanilla Ice Cream :) to accompany our Bread Pudding. It was a very nice touch. :) 

For wine, we ordered the 2005 Paradox, which was a Zin blend; it was actually a pretty good red to accompany our very meaty meals. We also had a 2004 Cabernet from V. Sattui as well. 

Overall, I'd come back to try out a few other dishes and if I had the choice again, I'd probably go with another cut of meat (the ribeye was too fatty-- about half my steak was fat, but it seemed to be only my own?-- I think a filet or lamb would do the trick next time around. Price- wise... it isn't cheap, but I've seen worse. :) Or maybe the Porterhouse for two... (or three)
author: Sau y.

description:
Thanks to a $25 gift card to Ruth's I received in the mail, we were intrigued and beguiled to finally try this restaurant, and we were pleasantly surprised. 

Due to slight economic restraints, we limited ourselves to the steak and lobster/crab combo at $39.99 each serving and shared a chop salad, and we loved it! The steak was cooked perfectly, and I knew we were in the right place at the right time when I took that first bite as the flavoring hit every taste bud in my mouth! Yum-o!! The stuffed lobster tail with crab and chop salad were quite tasty as well, but the steak won out by a long shot -- this is their specialty so my expectations were high, and they were met well! :) 

And to our delight, the manager gave us another $25 gift card to use next month - you know we'll be back for that! Thank you!
author: Maile N.

description:
From my recent experience, Alexander's Steakhouse is better than Ruth's Chris.

We came here for DAT 2010 on Saturday. Service was great, and even though we tried to squeeze ourselves in a little earlier than our 6:30pm reservation, they couldn't get us in until a little after 6:30pm. The place was packed! I felt sorry for people who went into the restaurant hoping to get seated without a reservation because they were all denied. 

Our course breakdown included the following:

House Bread: Goodness gracious, it was absolutely delicious! It comes out nice and warm, and they give you whipped butter to spread all over the goodness. Definitely beats other steakhouses that I've been to. 

Steak House Salad: Although they titled it "Steak House Salad", there is no steak in the salad. ;) It was quite tasty with their balsamic dressing.

Mashed Potatoes: It didn't have the "WOW" factor. It tasted like typical mashed potatoes that I can get anywhere else.

Creamed Spinach: Now this was pretty good. It probably could give you a heart attack from the amount of butter and oil they used to make it, but it was very tasty.

Petit Filet Mignon: I ordered medium rare, and it was slightly overcooked for my liking. But it was so good with the blue cheese crust that I requested (additional $3 charge). Well worth it! And as always, my petit sat on a bunch of butter. :)

Ribeye Upgrade: The husband knew that a 6 oz. Petit was not going to fill him up, so DAT offered a 16 oz. ribeye upgrade for an additional $8. He's eaten a lot of ribeyes in his lifetime, and said that the best ones he's had so far were still at Alexander's Steakhouse in Cupertino and Madonna Inn in San Luis Obispo. Good to know. He also wasn't used to the amount of butter they used on his steak.

Dessert: The chocolate mousse was pretty good, but the carrot cake was a little too carroty for me. 

Service: Our server was great and was attentive. Our salads came out super fast, and then we had to wait a few minutes before our main entrees came out. The slowest course to arrive was our dessert, which we had to wait about 10-15 minutes for.

Overall, we had a good time here. It was fun and relaxing, with a nice ambiance to set the mood. It's a good experience for those who haven't tried the place yet.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
I don't even eat red meat but I LOVE Ruth's Chris!!!! 

Non-steak selections include chicken, huge bbq shrimp over garlic mashed potatoes, lump crabcakes, lobster and daily fresh fish selection. Ask your server for the fish of the day and you will be pleasantly surprised!! Here are some of the fishies I've had in the past:

- Butter Lemon Salmon over Spinach
- Thai Style Salmon with Spicy/Sweet sauce and baby scallops
- Butter Lemon Halibut with vegetables
- Asian Style Miso Sea Bass with Napa cabbage and Bok Choy
- Seared Ahi Tuna

They have an awesome four-course menu for $39.95 or $49.95 (depending on your entree) which includes a starter (soup or salad), entree, side and dessert. The salad is a good size, although the Caesar has a little too much dressing. The bread that comes with the meal is really really good too. Soft and served with whipped butter. OOoOOhh LA LA!~

My steak loving friends and family ALWAYS end up getting the Cowboy Rib Eye here. It's a huge bone-in rib eye that just looks ridiculous! Again, I don't eat red meat but I will admit when that rib eye comes out on a sizzling plate of butter it really smells amazing.

Sides cost extra but they are SOOOOO freaking good. Creamed spinach, mashed potatoes with garlic, potatoes lyonnaise, sauteed mushrooms.. yummmmyy! Don't like the shoestring fries though.. They are a little too thin and crispy.. Like those fake fries that come in the can! 

If you have room for dessert I must recommend the Fresh Berries with Creme. Or the bread pudding. YUM!

Yes its pricey here but its a steakhouse!! The ambiance is nice.. and the service is excellent. Portions are huge and you usually leave with a little red bag of leftovers.
author: Bobbie L.

description:
Came here with Julia Z. and buddies for round one of Dine About Town 2010 and was pretty blown away by the steak and ambiance. Aside from those though...everything else was simply satisfactory. 

===FOOD (DAT Menu)=== $34.95

Overall Presentation: Everything is simply plated. Nothing out of the ordinary.

1st COURSE: Mixed greens with a balsamic dressing. 
- It's good...but definitely nothing special. 

2nd-COURSE: Petite Filet, 8 oz.
- Ohhhh. So incredibly tender and juicy! Served piping hot until the last bite! Maybe it's the butter they sizzle it in? Maybe it's their marinating? Whatever it is...that steak did NOT need any addition touches to be amazing!
- Despite above comment, I ordered it with the Blue Cheese Crust ($3 extra) which aside from the major increase in calories, was nice but not as cool as I thought it would be. I was imaging something like the crust to a seared ahi tuna, or something like that.  But, what it really was was a slab of fried cheese on top. Honestly, the steak is great alone! I ended up sharing all my blue cheese with my fellow diners who enjoyed it. 

Side Dish: Cream of Spinach (other choice was mashed potatos):
- Generous serving. Creamy. Homey. Comforting. 

3rd-COURSE: Chocolate Mousse + Carrot Cake
- As my fellow dinner noted: I'd rather have one really good, fancier, decadent dessert rather than 2 mediocre desserts. With that said...
-The carrot cake was sooooooooooooo sweet. Too sweet to my liking...but I did enjoy the elegant fried, shredded carrot topping.
-I did like the mousse though! Very creamy! 

OTHER DESSERT: Bread Pudding infused with a Whiskey Sauce
- Friend ordered this instead of the above -- the bread pudding part was uber delicious -- warm and comforting! Whiskey Sauce was wayyyyyyyyyyy too strong though. Definitely wasn't reduced enough in my opinion.

===SERVICE===
Very engaging and friendly, but our guy seemed to have forgot our bread though we asked for more. =/ I did enjoy my dirty martini being shaken for me at the table though! That was a lovely, personal touch!

We finished up near closing time, so we had the opportunity to see the waiters begin re-set the tables. Saw them polishing the wine glasses and checking them up in the light for spots -- I certainly appreciate the perfection of cleanliness -- very professional!

===AMBIANCE===
Very elegant and classy. More on the formal-business side rather than romantic. 

===FINALLY===
I would consider coming back here for an upscale steak dinner.
author: Gail N.

description: Very good, but there is something ho-hum about this place.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I'm so hooked!  I've been to this one in SF three times now and it seems to get better every time.  We took a ride over to celebrate this past mothers day and my husbands birthday - yep same day:)

We each ordered a beef dish, and shared the sweet potato casserole and creamed spinach.  I always ask to leave the brown sugar off the top of the sweet potato casserole because it's way too sweet otherwise.  They always get it right with the meat!  Full of butter and it melts in your mouth.  Outstanding.

Waiter service is a hit and miss.  This last time we had a great server and he really took care of us.  The time before that wasn't so great.  The food is always so good that it takes up any slack on the service quality.

They have valet parking at the door which makes is so much easier to enjoy the whole experience.  The cost for parking is $10.00.  

Hope you enjoy it too!
author: Christine M.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here to participate in the Dine About Town promotion.  

Very nice, romantic atmosphere with a sophisticated ambiance, although I wish we had not been seated by the window as it was quite drafty.  The restaurant was quite crowded, and we ended up having to wait about 30 minutes despite having a reservation.  Our waitress was very nice, and seemed quite knowledgeable of the menu.

We started off with the Steak House Salad.  Nothing very special about it.  It looked like those pre-made salad mixes you can buy at Costco.

For the entree I got the the 8 oz. Petite Filet with the Au Poivre Sauce addition.  The filet was quite tasty, but I wish I had not paid the extra $3 for the sauce, since I think it kinda overpowered the dish.  My boyfriend got the 16 oz. Ribeye, which he absolutely LOVED.  He devoured that thing.  We both got the mash potatoes as our side, and it was soooooo good.  Very creamy and buttery and delicious.

We ended our evening with the Duo Dessert Symphony:  chocolate mousse inside a chocolate cup and a petite custard with mixed berries.  We also got the key lime pie to take home.  All three desserts were to die for.

Overall, it was a wonderful experience.  Nice ambiance, great waitstaff, and yummy food.  Just skip the salad.
author: Emily L.

description:
Everyone knows this place rocks for yummy, tender steak. But what it made it even better was coming here for a cheaper Dine-About-Town price. I won't waste time describing it in detail, since plenty of other yelpers have already provided their 2 cents. But I will say that my 6 oz. filet (medium medium rare) was a petite slice of heaven... I only wish it came in a bigger portion. The side of mashed was bigger than my entree, which was kind of a shame since I'm not a huge fan of mashed taters. I definitely recommend the sweet potato side with candied pecans on the top... mmm so good, it tasted like dessert. 

While the DAT price is quite a steal, I prefer coming on other regular nights. While you do have the option of ordering off the DAT menu, its presence in itself seems to constrain your choices. But dieters beware: I felt like every breath and bite I took was infused with butter, which it probably was. I always leave smelling, feeling, and probably looking like a fat piece of steak. But my stomach is happy, so thus I am happy.
author: Natalie W.

description:
We went to Ruths Chris for my bf's 21st birthday last year. Thought it would be a good idea since it's his day and we normally don't eat beef because I don't eat it.

We were seated in our own large booth next to a business dinner with Japanese men which I thought was so fun! Our waiter was the best because he was so friendly, attentive and cracked jokes with us. We both had the 39.95 three course meal i believe. He got the filet or the T-bone & I got the chicken. Everything was awesome. I loved the mash, the chicken, etc. My bf loved his piece of steak. For 39.95, you can't beat that and you'll be stuffed!

This might not be as detailed since I went last year but the food and atmosphere made it such a great experience for us. I would definitely go back or recommend it to people. Not as uptight as most places and the leftovers were delicious too!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Still think steakhouses are overpriced but it's nice to go and get some proper, old school service. Very friendly service. Dimly lit room just missing some cigar smoke. I want to swim in the potatoes au gratin and how can someone make spinach taste so good!?

But, it's definitely a "i got a gift card so i better go type of place."
author: Ramin R.

description:
i have been to ruth's chris steakhouses in hawaii (big island), SLC and SF.  i have eaten at the SF branch twice prior to last night. this is 6th or 7th time i have been to this chain restaurant across these locations. i will never eat at another ruth's chris steakhouse as long as i am alive.

to start i'll list what i expect when i come to one of these restaurants:

- there are stuffy people in suits at the front of the restaurant who do stuff like ask if you have a reservation when the restaurant is clearly empty

- the food is doused in butter to compensate for there being nothing particularly outstanding about the food. "i'll have the butter with a side of lobster..."

- you can wear really cheap or tacky "dress" clothes and be treated better than if you're wearing nice designer clothes. better to wear a $10 collared shirt from Ross than to wear a $125 designer shirt sans collar.

our server was reasonably attentive and polite. we did not order appetizers and it took some time for our entrees to arrive, only a bit longer than i would expect. however, when the entrees arrived it became clear that there were problems: my wife and her friend had their food served properly, everything was hot and fresh from the kitchen, but my lobster tail (1) was lukewarm, as though it had been under a heat lamp (2) did not have drawn butter with it (3) did not have a lemon. one time my wife brought me a lobster tail from this restaurant "take out" and it was substantially warmer than the tail i received on this occasion.

the part i find particularly surprising about all this is that if i receive a bad entree, it is normally a function of my having ordered something different from everyone else. this is the first time i have ever ordered the *same* thing as other people i am dining with and had my food come out substantially worse than theirs.

i made my aggravation with the preparation of the lobster known to the waitress after i ate it, and told her i wanted the check. instead of her bringing it over, another male employee, presumably a manager came over with the check. i was unusually irate since i have never received what i perceived to be such discriminatory service (based on my wife and her friend receiving totally satisfactory lobster at our table) at any restaurant i have patronized. when i gave this male employee my credit card, i tossed it at the check and he took this as an opportunity to tell me "don't throw your credit card at me!" and start an argument. i told him "i just want to pay and leave, this meal was terrible". at that point i paid and left, only after i was told their CC processing was down and they had to take a full swipe of my card. the check was returned by yet another employee.

if you've ever handled customer service interactions, as i had for several years at one of my businesses, you should be very aware that when a customer is irritated you should be prepared for it. apparently the customer service protocol at ruth's chris is

(1) have all the servers huddle around just out of sight gossiping about me being an irate customer, peeking around the corner

(2) send out some jerk manager, who rather than try to understand that i'm very irritated and want to leave, tries to play manners police and argue with me

(3) send yet another person over to play the Indian call center game of transferring the call around until you, as a duly irate customer, just give up

this is no way to deliver quality customer service, i would consider firing people over behavior like this. i hope the staff responsible for my awful meal, the jerk manager in particular, enjoy their dead-end service careers at this overrated chain restaurant.

even before i wrote this review i did not have particularly high expectations for ruth's chris but they managed to fall far short of even those low expectations. if you want real food that is not doused in butter, i recommend you try the house of prime rib a few blocks down the street. the servers and staff are far friendlier and the food much better.
author: Frog L.

description: This was my first time at Ruth Chris and I was treated like a regular. The service was phenomenal. I ordered a 6oz. fillet mignon cooked medium rare and complimented with 5oz. of red lobster tail. Additionally served with a side of steamed broccoli. Since I had gone there just by myself I was able to be quickly served at the bar and the staff was extremely friendly/accommodating. Recently having moved to the area, I have been trying to establish longitudinal relationships with members of the community and have go to places for fine dining, shopping, and other sources of entertainment, etc. I definitely have to say that I will be coming to Ruth Chris at least once if not twice a week to unwind after a day at the office.
author: Jason S.

description: the bone in cowbo eye never disappoints.
author: tiana w.

description:
Well, I had too-high expectations.  I went in unaware that it was a chain restaurant. I didn't order the steak.  So this 2 star review is probably my fault.

 I think that when a business has 167 locations, they develop a process of production. This is mass-produced fine dining, which means its really not as valuable as the hand-made equivalent. I'm not trying to be snotty, but honestly I could see the difference in the details, like our generic salad. The service was very polite - not helpful or engaging, but polite. I think even if this place was $10-20 a plate (the price I deem fair) it would still be far inferior to a lot of other SF eateries.

The food was decent. The salads were tiny, pre-made bag-o-lettuce mixes drizzled with very little generic dressing. No nuts, no fruit, just one tomato. Big minus points for that - a salad is not hard to do well.  C'mon.

We didn't order the steak because it was a non-organic, corn fed sirloin.  Our entrées, salmon and roast chicken, were both pretty good. But at 50+ bucks a plate, you'd better make me crave more... in the biblical sense. 

Dessert was tasty - carrot cupcake and chocolate mousse thingy. Sweet enough so we couldn't finish, but good nonetheless.

Overall, price aside, I'd give em 3.5 stars. But if you're charging like a $$$$ restaurant, you can't have *** food.
author: Mari C.

description:
THIS PLACE IS AMAZING.

I have been to House of Prime Rib and that was on the top of my list UNTIL i tried Ruth Chris. 

I went there for Dine About Town and also for my Boyfriends Birthday.
I had told them that it was his birthday and when we get sat at our table
there are little cute sprinkle "HAPPY BRITHDAY" things scattered all over the table. SO NICE! i loved that they did that. So creative!

Parking is not the best since its downtown on Van Ness, but usually after 6 it should get easier. When we got there, we had to wait a little bit since it was PACKED. The place is kinda small, there is a bar area and then the dining area is on the opposite side. 

We get seated in a corner booth and thankfully my boyfriend knew one of the servers so she kinda hooked us up, (so maybe that reflected on how much i liked this place?) BUT STILL.

They have a great a wine selection and lots of suggestions. the servers know their stuff. 

Since it was Dine About Town, we got lucky. $34 for three course meal!

They bring out complimentary bread with this delicious BUTTER! its creamy and soft and so freaking good i cannot even describe.

Since it was dine about town we got some appetizers and tried the stuffed mushrooms....AMAZINGNESS!!!!!!!! IT COMES OUT SIZZLING AND IT HAS THIS BUTTERY GOODNESS TO IT! MMM. 4 huge stuffed mushrooms so worth $15. haha

My boyfriend got the Ribeye, and i got the petit. I didnt think it would be big enough but it was more than enough! i finished every single bite of that thing!

NEGATIVES.

One thing i didn't like about Ruth Chris was that it doesn't come with the sides, if you wanted sides it would cost you extra.

Another would be the ambiance. its small and crowded and very fast paced..not as personable as i would like.

Lastly, the dessert wasn't the best. We got the creme brulee, and the creme felt like it had been sitting in the freezer waiting to be served.
The creme is supposed to be soft and creamy rather than a cold, thicker consistency. 

IF YOU PUT RUTH CHRIS WITH THE HOUSE OF PRIME RIB AMBIANCE....I WOULD GIVE IT 5 STARS. 

I liked House of prime rib's all around everything because of the whole show you get with the food, the bathrooms, and the place itself.

But if we're just talking about the quality of the food and taste of the food.

RUTH CHRIS WINS BY FAR. 
 You get what you get with Ruth Chris, and it's so damn good. The steak comes alone on the plate and it has a soft tender juicy buttery taste that is UNFORGETTABLE.

WHEN I SAVE UP MORE MONEY, I WILL GO BACK WITHOUT A DOUBT. $$$
author: Jan Q.

description: Sometimes you just get tired being served food sculptures at ridiculous prices, sometimes you just want  food served, not as art, but as really good food.  This is why I always enjoy Ruth's.  Classic American food served in the Classic American way, family style.  Yes, it's expensive, but worth every bite.  I ordered my New York strip medium rare and it was cooked to perfection, my partners filet was was perfect as well.  Even though the sides are large I still have to have my trilogy of sauteed mushroom, creamed spinach and mashed potatoes.  YUM.  My only complaint is that my waistline can't handle me eating this divinely on a regular basis. The service was great as always. I have dined at Ruth's around 7 times and I have not experienced poor service once.  Ruth's Chris Steakhouse is my favorite splurge.
author: Lorna R.

description: Bread was great. We asked for well done meat it was rare, food was greasy, service was slow. Wine was good there. And yeah its pricy. We ordered lamb chops and stuffed chicken with salad. Both the items were disappointing.
author: Astha S.

description:
My buddy got us a gift certificate here for christmas and my girlfriend and I finally got to use it on a random weekend.  This place is as good as it gets, so im not going to waste your time talking about what all these other reviews are talking about.  i do suggest getting some vegetables because the creamed spinach and potatoes with three cheeses gets too rich when coupled with my helluva good ribeye.

anyways, i over hear two 50 plus year old men who are obviously balling out of control because theyre on a first name basis with the staff.
OM #1 - let's go to fusion lounge after this
OM #2 - no man, the women there dont want to talk to us, they want to talk to the 25 year old punks with no money
OM #1 - yeah, youre right
OM #2 - lets go to the mission, thats more my scene nowadays.

no sir, youre scene is Ruth's Chris.
author: JD B.

description:
My first time eating at Ruth Chris Steak House and boy was it good!

RCS was a part of the dine about town,. where they had a prefixed dinner for $35,..

I had the filet (medium rare),.. melt in your mouth meat *drools*,. placed on a hot plate,.. perfect for me to still cook the pink juicy meat on!

Had the side of spinach and mash potatoes,. buttery and creamy,. mmm

The bread was mighty delicious, warm and fluffy,. i normally do not eat bread crust,. but the crust here was soft,. just like the middle section of the bread. 

for dessert,. we had the DAT dessert which was really good.  I like the pudding portion of it? with strawberries,. but didn't like the chocolate mousse,. it was to rich and I wasn't able to eat half of it.  i liked the presentation of the mousse cup,. it came in a form of a reeses pieces chocolate cup,.. 

Had a glass of Riesling on the side,. 

and the bill came out to $62 a person! 

Not bad, not bad,..

I will be back!

I would've gave this place a 5 star,. but the waiters rushed us out in the end and dropped our bill down,. while my friend and I were still engaged in a conversation,.. SMH
author: Chanel L.

description: My gf always raved about the steaks at this place and I finally got a chance to try it out for myself. I must say it lived up to the hype and now im a believer. Everything we ordered was very good and it didn't taste like chain food at all. I'll probably come back for DAT this June since that's the only time I can afford to eat here.
author: Miko L.

description:
service was impeccable, i couldnt even complain it was that good!

had the filet mignon, it was hot, juicy and tender. it felt like it was gonna melt in mouth because it was so good. my sister tried the chicken breast stuffed with herbs and cheese i believe, and she loved it, she said it was so juicy and tender, done just right. and the flavor was amazing.

tried the cream spinach and the sweet potatoes those were the best! perfectly complimented the  filet mignon. also the mashed potatoes that came with the steak, were so good, had just enough milk, butter and flavor added in. 


for dessert had the bread pudding and key lime pie it was amazingingly good.
author: Stella J.

description:
My girlfriend wanted to treat me out and we opted for Ruth's Chris because she hasn't been in a couple of years.  This was my second time at a Ruth's Chris location. The first time was in Hong Kong and I can say the Hong Kong location is way better. I've been wanting to come to the SF location because of what I remember from the HK one...big juicy steak covered in a buttery sauce.

Originally I was planning to order the Dine About Town menu but we saw online that they have their own set menu for a little bit more with bigger portions. Ordered the cesar salad, ribeye with sides of mushrooms and mashed potatoes and some nasty dessert. The cesar salad was just an ordinary salad, the mushrooms and potatoes were somewhat plain. The table next to us kept asking the waiter how they make their steaks and the waiter kept telling him about some special oven they have. He also told the person he would be crazy to try to recreate the oven. No matter how amazing this oven is, it still isn't enough to beat my mom's steaks. I'm not sure if I would say this is even the 3rd best steak I've had because I'm pretty sure there are plenty of competitors for the #3 spot. #1 has to go to my mom, #2 Ruth's Chris in HK, #3 is a toss up. Finally the dessert...I thought I just ordered fresh berries but apparently I ordered fresh berries with sweet creme sauce. The sauce was pretty gross and I just opted to eat the berries by themselves. I wish I could've ended my dinner with something light such as sorbet cause I was pretty stuffed by the end of the meal. 

Overall I'm not sure I would come back here. I can have great steaks at home so why pay the extra $$$$ to eat something thats not as good?
author: Sean W.

description:
I have been to a number of steakhouses around the US on the company tab. However Ruth's rib eye is the best I have had in quite some time. The rib eye and service justify the cost, the sides leave something to be desired, but hey this is a steakhouse. 

For appetizer I started off with the seafood gumbo which turned out to be pretty flavorful with a good amount of shrimp. 

Main course I opted for the 16 oz rib eye steak. It was cooked to medium rare perfection and served on a 500 degree sizzling plate. Each bite was just filled with mouth watering flavor and steak juices. Exactly what a rib eye should be. 

For my side I opted for the cream spinach. The cream spinach was flavorless compared to the steak and I would recommend going with the garlic mashed potatoes or something else. 

To cap the night off, I had some cheesecake with sides of chocolate almond pieces. The cheesecake was very good as I love cheesecake. The dark chocolate almond pieces were alright as I am not a huge fan of dark chocolate. 

Service was very friendly and informative in making sure we do not touch the 500 degree sizzling plates before and when the plates came out. 

I will be back when I want a savory rib eye.
author: Albert L.

description: I like Ruth Chris in general and have been to many locations throughout the US.  This location is great, conveniently located and offers great service.  We go there regularly.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Pricy, but worth it.
We went here last night to celebrate several special occasions. The five of us ate some incredible steaks, some great sides and ridiculous desserts. The creme brulee in particular was amazing. Our waitress Christy was really nice and had great suggestions for food and drinks. If you're looking for a great steak and willing to spend for it, you should definitely come here.
author: Zach B.

description:
Haven't been here for at least 2 yrs...

Nothing has changed much, everything was good
Bread---THAT WAS AWESOME! my husband and I finished two of them...if we didn't have to order, we would just sit there eat the bread all night. 

Steak- I got Veal chop, was nice...I am not a huge steak fan...therefore it didn't WOW...nicely seasoned, just he way i wanted.

Dessert--we always get Cream Burlee....I don't remember being this thick creamy....got tired of the taste, but the fruits saved me.


Minus one start---SLOW SERVICE. 
we were seated 15 min later than our reservation, then we didn't get our server for another 10min, once she got our order, she didn't come around for another 10min...
Just to order our food, we waited 20-30 min...
THE WHORST PART IS, the table seated after us got their drink, bread...when we didn't even know who our server was.
author: Sisi W.

description:
We made reservations and met with a guy named Alex over the phone. I don't know whether it was unintentional or he had a bad day, but when I asked for him to repeat something he said due to the noise, he suddenly had this pretentious tone about him. Although I let it slide, no staff should behave such a way, especially when working and representing a restaurant such as this place.

Aside from that, everything was great. Polite valet, vibrant hostess, etc. Thumbs up! Also, our server was attentive and friendly.

When we got our salads, they were amazing as always. My caesar salad wasn't drenched in dressing, not too cheesy. 4 stars out of 5 in my book, to be quite honest.

When we got our steaks...phenomenal as always.

Overall, service was great. Friendly staff (or at least almost everyone) and delicious food.

I give this place 4/5, only lacking better lighting and having that one guy that gave a little attitude on the phone.
author: Terence H.

description:
Great service, and e x c e l l e n t  food!

Came here for an impromptu birthday dinner and it was the best.

The menu is very extensive, but of course my boyfriend and I had the steak. I had the petite filet and he had the ribeye, we also decided to pay the extra $3 for the bleu cheese crust. This was our first time having cheese with our steak, and it was a great touch. It added a little kick to the taste of the meat. I really recommend it. I got my petit filet grilled to a medium rare, and it was cooked perfectly!

The Pazanella salad was really good.
We also tried the mashed potatoes, potatoes au gratin, and creamed spinach as sides. The mashed potatoes weren't as great as I expected them to be, and the creamed spinach wasn't all that great either. A lot more 'spinachy' than cream. The potatoes au gratin were very good. Very saucy and cheesy.

For dessert we tried the creme brulee, chocolate explosion, and the little chocolate cake with fruits. All were pretty good, I personally liked the creme brulee the best. We also tried some of the dessert wine, and the first one on the list was nice and sweet. I also tried Ruth's Coffee, and it was okay, but not really worth the $11.25 

All in all, a really good steak house. But the sides were a little disappointing. 

**Tip: We had the Ruth's Chris Dinner which, depending on you main entree, cost $40 or $50 a person. It included a soup or salad, main entree, personal sized side, and dessert. The $50 options included the filet and ribeye at regular menu size. This is a great deal, and they'll even let you substitute things or make your sides bigger for only $3 more!
author: Denise P.

description:
Love love love this place! Fantastic service...great wine and the steaks are awesome. Do not judge this place by the front. Once you get in you will be surprised at how big it is. 

You come into a bar area for some drinks to hang out with your friends or your date while waiting for your table to be ready. You will then be greeted by the warm pleasant smile of the server who is always so cheerful and bubbly. I couldn't remember her name but she was the best server ever! Lotsa advice and recommendations if you are a first timer. So much choices...and every single dish tastes fantastic. I highly recommend this place as not only the the steaks and the sides are delicious but the desserts are to die for. 

Sit and relax and have a lovely dinner with a bottle of wine. You will indeed have the most memorable and pleasant evening.
author: Rachel L.

description: My go to place for some good and delicious rib eye steak.  The Ruth Chris classic 3 course with rib eye is $50.  I used to come here once a month :)
author: Kristine A.

description:
Boyfriend took me here for my birthday last year. It was...eh. I expected too much? I'm not sure. 

The food was forgettable (now), but I'm pretty sure I liked it at the time. Everyone there was in jeans and tee shirts. I felt over dressed. I didn't like that it was so casual. 

Not really much to say about this place. There are better places with better ambiances and better steaks. I don't hate it, but I definitely wouldn't say I loved it.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
I wasn't overly impressed on my visit tot Ruth Chris's in San Francisco.  I'd heard alot about the prestigious chain form several friend. I think it's pretty over priced although the ambiance and location are nice.  The steaks were very average. I would definitely prefer to go to House of Prime Rib for the same type of meal.   My steak was good but felt a bit dry and wasn't the mouthwatering , melt in your mouth variety I was expecting.

For those that like to eat Steak! Yes I know the Estiatorio's aren't technically Steakhouses but their signature dish is Lamb so I threw them in this list. 
I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Icecream/Chocolate, Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Bay Area SteakhouseRankings: 
1 House of Prime Rib
2 Evvia Estiatorio 
3 Harris 
4 Espetus
5 Alexanders
6 Kokkari Estiatorio
7 Texas Roadhouse
8 Sundance
9 Pampas
10 5A5 Steak Lounge 
11 Prime 109
12 Scott's Seafood Grill
13 Ruth Chris
14 Outback
15 Horatio's
16 Papillon
author: Rod M.

description:
I had been to Ruth's Chris a couple years back but the experience was far from memorable, but when I saw their restaurant in bright lights on the DAT website I figured why not give it another chance?

We went the last weekend of DAT so obviously reservations were scarce. We squeezed in at 10:00pm on a Saturday night and I'm assuming because of the lack of foot traffic in the restaurant, we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving. 

The service was great. The waiter was nice and promptly handed us DAT menus upon request. Bread and water were brought to us a little delayed, but refills were plentiful. Manager came by a couple times to give us our plates of steak and to check in on our experience. The decor was like any other higher end steakhouse, but a minus for the "art" that was hanging on the walls. The fragile framed blurred pictures of tulips and landscapes looked cheap and out of place.

On to the food, the real reason for this review. THANKFULLY we ordered from the DAT menu. If we had to pay full price for these steaks I would've balked and really made up my mind never to return. What gets me is my opinion that the steaks aren't so wonderful that it would be worth its sticker price of $50. If I had a vat of melted, perhaps even melted herb butter, and a meat injector, I could probably make the same steak in my own home--any steak with butter oozing out of it will taste better for that very reason. The steaks, the mashed potatoes, the creamed spinach, especially the salad and desserts (both the bread pudding and the key lime pie) were unspectacular. 

This experience just confirms my past experience at Ruth's Chris a few years back where I ordered the filet mignon, side of fresh broccoli and fresh spinach. Overall, food subpar, service stellar. Thank goodness for DAT.
author: Ellen C.

description:
I like this place.  Good classy atmosphere.
Great drinks.  Great steak - the Kobe is pretty good.  Interesting how the steaks come out sitting on a hot plate of sizzling butter.  Love or hate really...

Scallops were good.  Great salads.  Good bread.  Superb Buffalo Mozzarella Caprese.  Excellent desserts.

Will frequent often.
author: Jon Y.

description:
I usually avoid reviewing chains unless they do something really amazing or really awful. I see no point in giving an average review for something everyone knows. 

So with 5 stars, you know that Ruths Chris did something realllly good.

Everyone at my table order the DAT menu with the rib eye upgrade. Hubs ordered it rare which was raw IMO. As a meat lover, he couldn't have been happier. My 2 friends ordered their steaks medium rare. One was rarer than the other but they were both delicious. Really delicious.

I had the normal Ruth Chris prix-fixe menu which I believe was around $45 - 50. Being a bit health conscious at a steakhouse (I know, I know) I had the filet mignon. It was also very good. 

We had a variety of sides, all good. A huge pleasant surprise for me...GUMBO in San Francisco and it was good! Yes, finally, at a chain restaurant! Damn it, I'm giving one star just for that which equals, 5 stars!!!

The service was very nice, semi-formal which was unexpected, the kind of service you'd expect at a fine dining establishment.
