Overall, I was pretty impressed. The decor, the food and the service were that of a very nice independant restaurant. Not expected at all. I had a great meal, I'll order the rib eye next time!
author: Kiristen R.

description:
If I could only have one type of food for the rest of my life it would be Ruth Chris's Filet Mignon!

A friend and I dined here last Friday night, and we had such a wonderful time.   Excellent food, excellent cocktails, excellent service, excellent wine suggestions, and fabtabulous dessert.

Ruth Chris is a genious, that you for brnging your food to the world.
author: Kevin W.

description:
It's hard for me to review steakhouses because I always feel like I'm cheating on my favorite one when I go elsewhere.

But they are different places, and Ruth's Chris does well for what they do.  I came here for dine about town.  I think the price was much more reasonable -- I don't think I would come back at full price if I had to pay, but happily for DAT or as a guest =)

Everything here is very buttery and therefore delicious.  I think I would make pretty good food if I put that much butter into everything as well though.  The service was perfect, our waiter was funny and it was a lovely evening.
author: Van W.

description:
Ruth's Chris is our go-to place for a special occasion when we don't care about being adventurous and just want great melt-in-the-mouth steak (and are willing to pay for it).

It's a chain, the SF one has a bit less atmosphere than the one in DC we used to go to, but we've never been disappointed here.  The steak is always good.
author: Robert S.

description:
Not worth it for the price.

For $75 per person with drinks, I expect everything to be cooked perfectly and would like to be amazed. Well, I was amazed at how poorly they met my expectations.

Service was good. When we had a problem with the meal, the server was willing to accommodate us and make it right. So in terms of customer service, I was very pleased.

I had scallops. They were overcooked slightly, but the dish itself was unappetizing. The scallops were placed on a saute of onions, bell peppers and corn...and it just wasn't the flavor I was looking for.

My hubby had the steak and lobster. Steak cooked to perfection and he enjoyed it. The lobster was ok.

Sides were ok. I expected much better for over $10 a pop. We had asparagus with hollandaise, the asparagus did not seem to have any seasonings and the sauce was ok but not amazing. Same with the Potatoes au Gratin...nothing special about them at all.
author: Altaira T.

description:
Consistently delicious! The first time I came was for my anniversary.  We came early in the day, so we most of the place to ourselves.  The table we were seated at had rose petals and candles.  Later we were given a decadent chocolate cake.  

I love that I am guaranteed an amazing steak here.  I have no doubt in my mind when I make the reservation that I will be completely satisfied.  I usually order the tender filet mignon.  My BF typically picks either the ribeye or the new york strip.  We've decided that the next time we'll get the porterhouse for 2.  As for sides, we love the shoestring fries.  

Sometimes we do appetizers/salads.  it mostly depends on our hunger level.  The calamari are perfectly cooked with a sweet and spicy sauce on the side.  The house salad is perfectly dressed.  

Service is always top notch, waiters are friendly and super attentive.  The waiters know exactly when to come back to the table.  Not like other waiters who constantly interrupt conversations.  

I always look forward to coming here, and prepare my tummy by eating very light meals so that I can truly indulge in the awesomeness that is the steak!
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
I've been here three times - twice for Dine-About-Town.  There's a noticeable demographic shift during DAT - mainly, the asians go gang-buster on this restaurant and occupy the entire place!  Hey, we're good at jumping on deals.  

The rib-eye that they served for DAT is pretty damn good, but I don't think this place is worth the price on an ordinary day.  Things get expensive when you have to order all the individual sides, and their cocktails can be pretty pricey as well.
author: Ernest S.

description:
I was quite surprised to have my little brother bring my mother and I here, we love House of Prime Rib......But since I had not been here and was my 1st time, I was pretty excited to try some steak and scallop's!!
But, my dinner was quite a mess and painful.

I ordered soup for starters, when it arrived it was piping hot! I saw the whole thing coming and happening!!!
She places the first soup out, then continues to the middle of the table and low and behold!   the whole cup comes falling down my lap , causing burns on my legs and stomach, and part of my right hand fingers.... 
The pain was unbearable!!     

***The manager was very apologetic.....comped my dinner only.... which I didn't enjoy because I was in so much pain....  

****Service was excellent...they were very concerned (the bus boys were sooo sweet and got ice for me, kept coming back to check if I needed anything else.    I maybe saw the waitress 2-3 after the whole incident... 

***David  (Manager)  maybe showing your staff that when serving soup they should always be extra careful and to start serving from the middle out the table would be a good idea...That could have been my 5 year old niece sitting on the side... 

Offering to pay for my medical care was nice but I have Medical Insurance.

Overall - my family enjoyed their meal, but had to rush me to the emergency, and today I'm sporting  some very nice blisters on my legs and stomach that I hope go away soon and don't leave scars or marks...
author: Claudia E.

description: It's just okay. They cooked my steak medium when I asked for medium rare. Then it came soaked in butter. Usually lots of butter is a good thing, but in this case it was total overkill. For sides I tried the creamed spinach and mashed potatoes. Both were mediocre which is sad because those are two things that should be easy to make.
author: Alice J.

description:
This is my favorite place to take my girl. As a vegetarian I was skeptical of a steak house but you can't beat the asparagus, potatoes augratin and creme brûlée! Not to mention its romantic atmosphere. 
Happy Birthday Angel!
author: Oklahoma G.

description: While on vacation in San Francisco, we decided to have dinner at Ruth's Chris. Our friends told us good things and we were excited to have a nice meal together at a high end steakhouse. We were VERY disappointed and frustrated with our experience. Granted, it was a busy Friday night, but the party of about 15 men we were seated next to were so boisterous that we could not hear ourselves speak across our own table. The waiter had to keep repeating himself because he couldn't hear us and we couldn't hear him. He apologized for the noise but it was frustrating not being able to place our order because of the noise level. Other diners did not look thrilled to be there, either. None of us should have had to sit through a meal while listening to this loud party's conversations ranging from sex acts to Bruce Jenner's gender transformation. Some diners complained and the manager came in and spoke to the large party and asked them to quiet down. The atmosphere felt more like a zoo than a restaurant whose plates cost $40+ per person. The food was great, but due to this experience we will never dine here again.
author: Amanda B.

description:
3.5 stars - I round off ...

Food is very very good but way too pricey. The steaks were cooked exactly the way i liked. The sauces are very tasty. Everything is pretty good until the check comes. I really want to come here more often but my wallet doesnt allow it. Time to make that money i guess!
author: Frankie L.

description:
Simply great anytime I go there I really enjoy there 
Creamy spinach is fantastic and of course one of the best steaks 
So if u like to eat good steak cook well without taking any risk here is the place for you
author: Dave D.

description:
I hardly ever complain in restaurants. I'm a waiter; complaining just makes me seem like a little brat. However, I will complain about one thing and one thing only. This might seem petty to most of you, but I cant stand it when a place overcooks my steak. And thats exactly what happened here. I've eaten here a few times in the past and its pretty good. I had the filet both times. They were always perfectly medium rare-red throughout. Fork tender also! Thats the way all steak should be eaten. But last time I came I tried the New York strip. It was clearly medium, almost medium well. This is NOT OK! If I'm paying $30 for a steak make sure it comes out right. You know a steak is perfect when you cut into it and the blood comes rushing out onto the plate. Sounds "gross" to you? Then you clearly don't know good steak.

Biggest food lie ever told- "It's not done well until it's well done!"
author: David D.

description:
Enjoyed a wonderful dine about town with some lovely friends. The staff was extremely nice and helpful...not to mention great photographers. :-)

The food was wonderful as expected. My petite filet was cooked perfectly and the mashed potatoes are to die for.

The salad and dessert that come with the pre set dining menu had some lack luster. It would have been nice if there were choices to the starter and desserts like the main portion and side dish.

I also enjoyed the fact that you can bring your own wine. They charge a 15 dollar corkage fee per bottle but its well worth it!
author: Kalifornia S.

description:
I was super excited to try out this place since I heard all the hype about it for ages.

Bread was awesome! I love warm and refillable bread! Yums!

Besides the DAT menu we also ordered the fried calamari and it had the best sweet and sour sauce to go with it. We also ordered the scallop and it was super good too!

As for the DAT menu, we had the following:

First Course - Steak House Salad - Iceberg, Arugula and baby lettuces with cherry tomatoes, garlic croutons and red onions.

It's a salad.. how good can it be. It was ok though...

Second Course - 12 oz. Ribeye - An outstanding example of USDA Prime at its best. Well marbled for peak flavor, deliciously juicy.

We both got the 12 oz. Ribeye and it was HUGE. I couldn't eat it after all of our appetizers. Also I realized I can't really eat a fatty steak without some kind of sauce or at least A1... I was biting my tongue the whole time. I figured a "Can I get A1 sauce?" would be insulting in a place like where steaks cost $46 a slab. :p

Accompaniments
Mashed Potatoes - This was super yummy! Nice and creamy
Creamed Spinach - This was also yummy. Creamy and fatty!

Third Course
Key Lime Pie - this tasted super refreshing and like a cheesecake!
Bread Pudding - this felt like a heart attack waiting to happen. haha! It was so thick that I couldn't finish it. I was stuffed.

For the price an the taste of the steak... I probably wouldn't come back here unless I had the urge to chew on a fatty piece of steak with no sauce and emptying my wallet. :)
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Good food, good service -- a little pricey for what you get and the amount you get.

Valet parking total chaos. Why is the drop off and pick off right on Van Ness? Lots of honking and cursing from traffic. plus super dangerous for elderly, seniors, tourist getting in and out. The valet, drop off/getting in -- should be on the California Street side. Also right next to the restaurant. This would prevent accidents and stop the honking, traffic jams on the Van Ness side. Would make the dinner experience better.
author: John G.

description: Good food, good atmosphere, great server Courtney! I would definitely come back.
author: Karma B.

description: WOW!  The smell of a sizzling hot plate of steak at Ruth"s Chris just makes my mouth waters. The steak comes out sizzling hot topped with melting garlic butter. It's tasty on the outside and soft and tender in the inside. Soooo Goooood ! They usually have a $39.99 special which includes a steak, side and dessert. Great deal. Definitely will recommend others here.
author: Dee L.

description: Everyone knows that you get what you pay for at Ruth's Chris.  Great service, great steak, full belly.  Perfect!
author: Dana G.

description:
Got there 8 minutes late, waited 15 minutes to get seated.  No problem.  It was very busy and the waiting area was quite crowded.  Once we were seated, things started off well.  The waiter was there fairly quickly and took our drink order and then our dinner orders.  He never mentioned the "Dine About Town" meal options and it wasn't clear on the menu.  Oh well.  We ordered, got our drinks, and then waited.  Our crab cakes came - they were okay, just okay.  Then we waited at least 35-40 minutes for our dinner to arrive.  We didn't get any explanation why it was so late or why our glasses of wine took so long to arrive.  Our meals finally showed but by then I had eaten a lot of bread and wasn't that hungry.  The mashed potatoes are good but covered in butter.  The spinach was very cheesy and rich.  My husband had the petit filet and it was quite good.  I had the Rib Eye steak and it was also good.  But isn't everything better with butter?  Butter on the steak, butter on the potatoes, cheese and butter on the spinach.  Yikes, my cholesterol is spiking.

It was an okay meal but it took too long, way too long to arrive.  The place is very crowded.  The waiter was nice, but an acknowledgement of the delay in the food arriving would have helped.  For the cost, it was not worth it.  I am not planning on returning.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Whenever I have a craving for a great steak, Ruth's Chris is the place to go. I just recently went to celebrate a friends bday and the meal was just as good as ever. I let the Maitre D' know it was her bday, and there was Happy Birthday confetti spread all over the table (nice touch). 

My favorite cut is the Rib-eye (cooked medium). I LOVE LOVE LOVE the fact that the plates come out at 400 degrees and stay hot until the last bite. The meal wouldn't be complete without the sweet potato casserole with pecan crust and the creamed spinach. For drinks you can't go wrong with the house Merlot and the martini's:) 

Parking can be tricky on a weekend night, but they do offer $10 valet - a little on the high end but worth it on a cold night.
author: Krystal C.

description:
I had received some great news from work so I decided to take the beautiful wife out on the town to enjoy some high end steaks.  Besides, anytime I can get my wife into a nice dress and her sexy stiletto slingbacks I am definitely up for.

Being an SF native, I have never gone to Ruth's due to (a) other places like Harris or House of Prime Rib up the street and (b) pricey - you have to buy your sides.  Quite frankly, I can see why this will probably be my one and only time.

Don't get me wrong, the food was good and of good quantity.  Our steaks were made to our liking and they were quite good.  The caeser salad and lobster bisque were ok.  With our entrees, we shared some mushrooms and shoestring potatoes which were equally quite good.  The order of potatoes is quite large and can be shared with more than two people if you have a large party.

Ok, why the 3 stars you say?  Well, while the service during dinner was very good I was not happy that we did not get seated until a half hour after my reservation.  Mind you, we were slightly early even for our reservation.  What I suspect is that they accept a lot of walk in parties or were not managing their reservations very well.  Groups with reservations must have priority, not the walk-ins, ok?  Ruth's Chris, if you want to really be a bigtime steakhouse player, you can't do this.  I understand a lot of people perhaps make reservations and bail on you, so what you can do is simply charge them for missed reservations.  Require that guests leave their credit card numbers at reservation time and if they don't show up charge them a fee.  People have shows or things to go to after dinner and, again, you ain't some cheap hole-in-the-wall place.  Our dinner was easily over two bills and we ain't big drinkers at that.

The second thing that upset me was that while the valet parking was ok at $10 for the area I expect you to park my sweet Mercedes in some secure lot, away from the street.  Turns out that when we left and I went to get my car, it was parked in a regular metered parking spot between other cars.  Great, luckily my baby didn't receive any bumper rash from other cars.   

Let's be honest, this would not be happening at Harris or House of Prime Rib up the street.  They cater to a more older, upscale crowd.  In Ruth's, you see a lot of touristy types and people in jeans.  For the prices that Ruth's Chris is charging, I have every right to have expected more and I simply did not get it.  Honestly, your food and dinner time service bailed you out from a much more lower rating.
author: V C.

description:
Chain restaurants (chain anything) start with warning flags. Is it just a cookie-cutter operation using procedural manuals from Upon High? In the case of Ruth's Chris (still a somewhat strange name) we were cautious, coming in with a 'show me' attitude.
Well, they showed us. We were visiting for the first time in the special San Francisco Dine Out program, but even with a somewhat narrower choice on the Prix Fixe than is offered with the main menu we were entirely satisfied. Everything was right, from the greeting to the service to the steaks. Nothing wrong here.  Example: the wine special, a cabernet sauvignon from Joel Gott, famous for his zinfandels. His cab was outstanding (we'd sample a couple of excellent pinot noirs in the bar before we were seated).
Remember the classis definition of a customer? "Someone who comes back." We'll be back.
author: John J.

description: I love Ruth Chris and especially love theft that web you walk in smells like butter! Their steaks literally melt in your mouth and its like the doors to heaven just opened. Had it twice in one week and I just didn't know what to do with myself!
author: Elisa M.

description:
My first Ruth's Chris experience was taking out the team from work at the end of a long quarter, and the launch of one of our games, and it was an experience that would set off many repeat visits. 

I can honestly say this is the best steak in the U.S. I have had, and I am a really picky steak eater

Trip 1. I ordered, asparagus, mushroom, mashed potatoes, shrimp cocktail, crab cakes, filets, ribeyes, a few bottles of wine and more. 

Trip 2. I ordered the filet mignon again.

Trip 3. Filet, wine, mushrooms, asparagus, crab cake, and mashed potatoes.

Ok, so really - I haven't explored their whole menu, but the three times the filet mignons have been delicious.
author: Roxy G.

description:
I came here during Dine About Town 2011 and we all couldn't have  been more pleased. 

Menu--
 8oz petite filet, tender and velvety. Perfectly seasoned. It didn't need any extra seasoning at all! I enjoyed every bite!
 Mashed potatoes were creamy... lots of butter and very delicious. 
 Cheesecake and dark chocolate bark with pecans both divine! 

Service-- 
 Our waitress was friendly and attentive, she made sure we had everything that we needed to enjoy our meal. 

Atmosphere--
 Quiet and tranquil. We went on a Wednesday evening around 6:30. We were seated immediately and conversations were all kept quiet despite a rather full dining room. It was a very enjoyable experience. 

Value--
 The Dine About Town menu was great! It highlighted some of the best parts of Ruth's Chris. You really can't beat salad, steak, potatoes, and dessert for 34.95. It's a bit pricey without DAT but well worth it for special occasions. 

*Parking is tough on Van Ness however they do offer valet service for 10 dollars. Be sure to have cash on hand to pre pay for it.
author: Megan S.

description:
Dined here with my wife for the Dine About Town special, and was terribly disappointed. Not my cup of tea, so it would seem. My salad looked haphazardly thrown together, while my wife's salad was dressed and presented nicely. I had even upgraded my meal to the 16oz Ribeye with Creamed Spinach because the Dine About Town offerings didn't have appealing cuts of meat. My wife had the Petite Filet Mignon and Mashed Potatoes. My ribeye was terribly dry, and required lots of chewing. The creamed spinach wasn't bad, but wasn't spectacular either. My wife's assessment of the petite filet was that it was too chewy, the meat not tender, and was a bit dry as well. Additionally, the thick and creamy mashed potatoes were a bit too thick, and didn't come with gravy, so it ended up just sitting there and crusting over.

Food Summary: Like dry corn fed beef from the Midwest? Come here!
Service: Though the food was lacking in appeal, the service was amazing!
author: Gerald B.

description: Damn good...Bone-In Rib-Eye!
author: Raymond C.

description:
I must say it has been a few years since I'd visited Ruth's Chris for a steak and my return on Saturday night was a bit of a disappointment.  The overall quality of the food has taken a big dive.  Thank God I was fortunate enough to be seated in the back at a table against the wall.

Let's start with the question of whether or not you are ordering, receiving and paying for prime beef - yes, no - I'm not so sure.  I've always ordered the large filet there in the past but I was told by wait staff that the filets they were getting were not Prime - hmmmm...should I have questioned the authenticity of the other steaks and their level of quality?  I started with the chopped salad (when i asked if the salad had meat in it, I was told "no" - I decided to open the menu and read the ingredients only to see that it had bacon in it, which is what I recalled.  Okay, I love bacon as much as anyone but I didn't want the taste of it in my salad after my cocktail and before the steak (I remember the days of the revolting filet with bacon wrapped around it and it was not a taste I want to remember).  I ended up with the Caesar.  Really - the plate had two sliced cherry tomatoes on it - where does a tomato mix with a Caesar, and where was the anchovy?  Croutons out of a box.  Oh, yes, and the bread that was placed on the table could have been bought at the Safeway baker in one of the bins.  That's fine if you are at Safeway.

Next came the Ribeye - ordered medium rare and it was cooked very well.  However, the abundance of fat that I left on the table should not have been there.  Side of asparagus - beautifully cooked with nice light hollandaise.  Shoestring Potatoes - artfully presented in a large tower - those on the top were warm and fairly crispy but as you ate down they became more and more limp and tasteless.  

Had a dirty martini before dinner and a glass of Franciscan Cab with dinner - all fine.

Nice Waiter.


Everyone has their own experience and I'm sure many have been over the top at Ruth's Chris - this one was not for me.
author: Billy D.

description:
Good meat, overpriced.  Not bad, but you can do better in San Francisco.  Ruth's Chris is a chain restaurant, with all the good and bad associated with that status.  And I find the butter sizzle to be both a silly gimmick and a source of unnecessary fat.  A real steak sizzles only on the grill.  

In my book, Alfred's (the one and only, not a chain) has the best steak in San Francisco.  Ruth's Chris is a decent backup if they're closed.

By the way, I question Tim P's comment that "the steaks are seared to perfection at 1800 degrees".  That's higher than the melting point of many metals, and beyond the normal temperature for forging steel.  Seems unlikely to me.  See: http://www.processassociates.com/process/heat/metcolor.htm
author: Paul S.

description: We went during SF restaurant week and we it was terribly disappointing. First course: Chef Salad it was like dumping greens from a bag with store bought vinaigrette, second course was a petite stake that was good but nothing impressive and third course was dessert which was the lowest point of the night: chocolate muffin.. it was a chocolate muffin bought at walmart. Service was low and food was below average. Definitely not worth the money with so many great restaurants in San Francisco don't waste your time here.
author: Gabriela C.

description: I heart RC! Been coming here since high school as a normal go-to spot for a great steak, and this location has been very consistent through the years. We always get the porterhouse(s) to share across the table so people can have some new york and filet mignon pieces. The steak comes out on a sizzling hot butter plate (DEELISH) and they cut the porterhouse into petite pieces so it's grab and go! Nothing beats it. It's up there as my fave steak, ever! The chopped salad is also staple we usually get - super yum. All the sides I've tried are great as well.
author: Erica L.

description:
Having heard so much of this steak house from my gf, I let her know that I wanted to give it a try sometime and unbeknownst to me, she set up a birthday dinner for me there =)

Firstly, you'll want to dress up a bit (at least business casual) in order to fit in and not feel like a misfit while eating at this restaurant.  I don't think the establishment would mind either way, but to make your dining more comfortable it is suggested.

Deciding to splurge I ordered myself the special Australian Wagyu that ran about $130.  My gf ordered the petite filet and we both agreed on a side of shoestring fries and the mushrooms sautéed with butter.  While we were waiting for our food there was always a server near to cater to our every need.  I never once had to ask for anything to be refilled which was great! The atmosphere was alive and buzzing, but it wasn't so loud that you couldn't hear the person across from you.  We couldn't keep our eyes off of the servers coming and going carrying sizzling platters of beef out - it smelled SO DELICIOUS! 

The shoestring fries came out first and they were thin, but not to the point where they were all crunch like pik niks, they still maintained a potato-E texture inside which surprised me.  We almost finished the darn things off before I had to force us to stop so we could have some with our entrées.  The rest of our meal came out in no time flat and we found ourselves drooling over hot plates of beautifully cooked meat sizzling in BUTTER! I feel bad for not having chatted it up much during this time with my gf, but the melting meat I was ingesting was so spellbinding that it put me in another dimension *queue the twilight zone music* If either of us had taken any photos while we were eating you might have seen both of us with our "O" faces on =) 

Previously the best piece of meat I had ever eaten was all the way in Houston, TX ... Ruth's Chris' special Australian Wagyu blew it out of the water! My gf was also impressed with her petite filet which had disappeared by the time I looked up from my own empty plate.  Somewhere in-between, the rest of the fries and the mushrooms had also disappeared =~_^=  We always sautée our mushrooms with butter now when eating it with any meat ... mmm, DEE-LISH!

We finished up with the chocolate sin cake of which my gf had the pleasure of having the restaurant put a candle in, thanks honey! *waves* I was embarrassed but felt loved.  There's no better way into a man's heart than through his stomach with a fine meal!
author: Mike T.

description:
Since I just wrote an average review for Morton's, I felt it appropriate to write a review for a better steakhouse to balance out my review writing.

LOVE this place.  The service was exquisite.  The drinks were perfectly made.  We started our meal with the shrimp cocktail, no complaints there.  Can't really screw up shrimp and cocktail sauce, although I guess I have tasted pretty raunchy sauce before, but this wasn't the case here.

My steak, the one thing NO ONE messes with or else I am forced to shoot them, was melting in my mouth.  In fact, I started salivating the moment I saw it walking towards me.  I'm a rib eye kinda person and this rib eye was close to heaven.  The flavors, texture, temperature (medium-rare), and ultimate taste were all in sync.

We ended our dinner with bread pudding.....ohhhh lordy, lord, lord....that was some good bread pudding.  We paired it with a dessert wine, but I can't recall the name.  Granted by the end of dinner we had several cocktails, a bottle of Champagne, and then the dessert wine.

Overall, a very nice experience.
author: Marty L.

description: I love Ruth Chris.  The 6 oz. Petit Filet is the perfect steak for me.  Au gratin potatoes are fantastic.   The service, especially Arturo at the bar is impeccable.
author: Jeanne B.

description: Loved it so much, the food was so good.  The calamari was to die for.   I must say I made a reservation and i didn't really like being put next to the bar with a reservation.  Otherwise everything was good.
author: Shenille M.

description:
Came here for Dine About Town as well but I ended up not even ordering off that menu because they had a special going on where for $5 more I would receive the same thing and get shrimp added to my meal too...

My friend got the steak salad which was basically just salad nothing special at all about it. It was just vegetables thrown in basically Annie's Goddess Dressing (if you've never tried that you can find it at your local safeway store) and I got the jambalya which was nothing to really brag about either

Then came the main course. I had the filet which was topped off with shrimp and when my plate came it was still sizzling (literally) butter. I was afraid to eat it because it was literally a whole plate full of melted butter but I couldnt resist because who can resist the yummy smell of melted butter. I tried a piece of shrimp first definetely nothing special, it was just shrimp sprinkled in seasoning. But then I poked my fork into the big serving of mashed potatoes and OMGGGG it was the most delicious mashed potatoes I've ever had and I did not even need gravy or sauce. Then came time for the steak and I was in heaven. It was cooked perfectly and so juicey and tasteful. Please believe there was not one drop of food left over when I was done.

I was too full from my food to even really touch or enjoy my dessert. It was okay.

Definetely recommend coming here again...but not on a regular basis as it is pretty pricey.
author: Annie L.

description:
Came here on father's day!

I have to give it a four star since the steak was the only thing good here. I chose the 16oz Ribeye and that thing was delicious. The steak nearly melted in my mouth. I was impressed but its not good enough to earn five stars. 

The appetizers were way to pricey and weren't that great. I ate the crab cakes and the string fries, but they didn't live up to what i expected. Being this big name "Ruth Chris steakhouse" I expected a lot more. 

The overall ambience and steak was great but the price/quality of the appetizers didn't sell me. I expected a lot more Still a fan!
author: Anthony V.

description:
Who is Ruth? And why does she have a Chris? What I can tell you is that they make a great combination of steak and ambiance.

My cousin lends his name to a VERY premium and hard to acquire pinot noir.  But since I'm family, I have several bottles at home. Yes, I am bragging.  I brought a bottle to the restaurant, and the waiter saw it and said,"oh, you drink the good stuff!" Yes, yes, I do. That he recognized the wine reassured me of his knowledgeability. Had he popped the cork unable to distinguish it from Two Buck Chuck, I would have been worried about the quality of the meal to come.

The filet was awesome, and the key lime pie was spectacular.

In addition to his his ability to spot good wine, the waiter was very friendly, and attentive without being disruptive.
author: Brian T.

description:
WOW, looks like everyone took advantage of the Dine About Town business. Smart move yelpers.

And.. another birthday dinner; this time for my look-a-like sister! I'll do you guys a favor by skipping the bull and go straight to the food.

The Dine About Town Menu:

+Steak House Salad, nothing out of the ordinary. Not that salads can be mind-blowingly delicious, but i expected a bit more from Ruth esp. since we're paying a little bit more for their name.

+8oz Rib Eye/ 16 oz, really tasty! Cooked in a 1800 degree oven and slathered with butter and parsley! UGH, died and gone to heaven! My parents got theirs prepared well-done which was a HUGE mistake because their fillet came out slightly burnt and not-so-tender..disappointment there.

+Mash Potatoes, too damn mashed! Their mash potatoes are literally creamed potatoes. Not the way I like it prepared. I like mine with a bit more texture. Not to mention, it tasted really bland too... disappointment again.

we also ordered creamed spinach, but i didn't try it because i never liked it to begin with. sorry.

+bread pudding topped with whisky, SO TASTY! The soft, semi-chewy texture of the bread putting, seasoned properly with the slight hint of whiskey is the perfect combination! ugh, i would go back just for this!

Here is a taste of their Fall/Winter Special:

+Louisiana Seafood Jambalaya, was too salty. The tiny scoop of rice that topped the jambalaya helped offset the salty-ness, but that was only temporary. I much rather have the mediocre 'Steak House Salad'

+Salmon, perfectly cooked and seasoned. It was served on top of a bed of spinach which was a little bit too salty. The salmon was just...perfect.

+Cornbread Pudding, best side dish! Cornbread baked with bits of corn in it was perfect. A little bit of crunch, a slight mush, YUMM! and who doesn't like cornbread? come on!

+Dessert Duo with Chocolate moose and carrot cake. Can you say sweet tooth? Both the desserts were super sweet, but the minute slice of carrot cake was really good. It was topped with small fried strands of carrots which gave it the perfect balance of crunchy, soft and savory sweet. Chocolate moose? meh, i pass.

The service here was great, the waiter was extremely attentive along with the bus boys. He knew the menu like the back of his hand and didn't cramp us with a gajillion questions, which should be expected from a restaurant of this caliber. 

Love the steak and fish, but mash potatoes could be better. I will definitely be back!
author: Alex C.

description: The space is dark and clubby, with plush leather booths and thick carpet. They make a real mean Manhattan, the beef is always perfect, and the service is impeccable-- something that's almost impossible to find in this city these days.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I am a carnivore. I fully admit it. I'm also a carbaholic. I also love butter. This place fulfills all of my loves.

However, it really sucks because everything is mega salty. Portions are incredibly good. The food is wonderful. Beef is always tasty. The shrimp is never dry, but everything is really salty. I'm still guzzling water down and retaining it. I think I'm on my 7th Nalgene and it's been a little over 24 hours. Not what I like.

Made reservations on opentable.com. We were seated close to our reservation time, even though we arrived about 20 minutes earlier.

Server was enthusiastic and nice. I don't have any complaints aside from the drafty waiting area that reeks of smoke thanks to the smokers that stand outside and puff away.

I will come back, but will stipulate - go easy on the salt, ok?
author: Carina M.

description:
I've went to the Ruth Chris near Disneyland in LA. I would have to say, the one in LA is much better. This place has a nice setting but taste wise isn't even close to the one in LA. I guess my expectation was just way too high, but the staffs were really nice! Everything here is well, just the tasting.

Well, parking sort of sucks, but they have valet.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
I have been here many times and the food is wonderful and the staff is even better!!  Gabbie was my waitperson the last two times I have been there and she was awesome.

It was my birthday and they also gave us a free dessert!  That was great.  My steak was cooked to perfection and the side dishes were wonderful. 

They have valet parking which is nice in the city.   They have a lobster bisque that is very very good.  If your looking for a good steak with good customer service then this is a great place to go!
author: H C.

description: Amazing in every way! Steak was perfect! Mashed potatoes yummy! Dinner salad so good (ranch was the most delicious I've ever had!), baked potato very good and ALL our desserts were great! Such a great bday dinner! Will be going back!
author: Mollie C.

description:
It's places like this that make me really appreciate cows.  What would we do without them?!  I mean, yeah, we would probably be less obese, but dude would we be miserable.  And it's not just the nice big fatty piece of steak you get from the wonderful cows, but DANG it's the butter.  What does not taste good with butter?  Ruth's Chris knows what's up and it seems like everything they serve is butter-fied.  The steaks come out sizzling in butter.  The typical sides -- mashed potatoes, creamed spinach...with LOTS of butter.

Came here for Dine About Town and got the petite filet (choice of chicken, fish or shrimp) which came with the house salad, a side of mashed potatoes or creamed spinach, and the classic dessert chocolate cake with berries.  The salad was whatever, seemed like the generic salad you'd get anywhere (it IS a steak house, anyway).  The sides were what you would expect -- nothing to die for -- but the filet was sublime.  I actually had my wisdom teeth pulled out two days prior and I had no problem whatsoever eating it.  It was tender, juicy and seemed to melt in your mouth...ahhh bliss.  The dessert was whatever, came out a little dry.  Also tried the sweet potato casserole which was good, but a little too sweet for my taste buds.  Seemed like I was eating candy.  The portions were good too.  My dining friend had to unbutton her pants after the meal.  I think that's a good sign.

They also have a regular prix fixe menu offering almost the same thing all year round for $40, compared to the $35 DAT offering.

Oh yeah, btw, the bread is amaazing. Comes out warm and toasty with a side of whipped butter.  Man, is whipped butter the best!
author: Jen N.

description:
We arrived at the restaurant a little earlier than our dinner reservations were, so we started the night off with some drinks at the bar as we waited to be seated. I tried the pomegranite martini... and I would have to say, that was one of THE best martini's i've ever had. (to all the ladies.. i totally recommend that specialty drink!) As 8pm approached, we were seated promptly. They gave us some fresh out of the oven bread, served it with butter. We ate that sucker up with the quickness! The outside of the bread was perfectly crispy (not too crispy) the butter just melted as you put it on since the inside was just sooooo warm and soft! 

*Appetizer - Seared Ahi Tuna
WOW! this was so delicious!!! i loved it, and i felt like i never wanted that platter to end. The flavor was quite satisfying, and their sauce made it all the better. (The boyfriend wasn't a HUGE fan of it...  since he doesn't like wasabi, you can taste a hint of that in the sauce they serve it with)

*Steak - Filet (butterfly cut)
The plate comes out sizzling, so beware... it's hot! I ordered mine medium well, and it seemed to be a little more cooked than i expected it to be. The steak was still very tender though, with an abundance of flavor. Very well seasoned, and i enjoyed every bite... (couldn't finish the entire thing, so i had to doggy bag the rest... yes i bring home leftovers!) ha... they had this really cute doggy bag too =P

* Side Dish - Mashed potatoes
Side dishes are served somewhat a la carte, so one order, will be enough for 2 people.  Nothing spectacular about this dish... we got it just for something to eat with the steak. If i could do a do-over... i would so go for the au gratin potatoes... 

* Side Dish - Asparagus w/ hollandaise sauce
VERY good... but just as i felt about the potatoes... nothing spectacular...  My boyfriend scarfed the whole thing up... i think he left me a few just to be curteous... lol.

Overall this place was above my expectations... one of the best steak houses I've ever ate at... the service was great, ambiance was great, and the food... oh my goodness the steak?! was delicious... loved it. 

when i saw the bill... i understood why my dining experience went so well... because THEY BETTER BE GOOD.. after spendin that much dough there... lol.
author: Megan M.

description:
I eat at this particular location at least once a year for the past 8 years. The service is superb and can not be beat. 

The steaks are cooked perfect and served on 100+ degree plates with melted butter. The wine selection is wonderful. The sides are generous and can be shared between two people. Their desserts are sinful. The whole experience makes you feel like a rock star. 

I will say beware on trying to dine her on Valentine's Day if it falls on a weekend. It was a nightmare and we did not get seated till well over an hour past our reservation time. That night (2009) they had overbooked. Big mistake yet nobody walked away that night. They are that good.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I absolutely love Ruth's Chris! I came here last night with two of my girl friends for DAT (Dine About Town 2011). The three course meal consisted of: 

* house salad with vinagrette dressing: pretty standard.

* 8 oz. filet mignon (medium rare) with mashed potatoes on the side: The steak was cooked JUST right. You can SMELL the butter sizzling on the plate when they bring out the steak. Nothing beats that smell! Very tender and juicy. The mashed potatoes are also extremely rich and high in butter! (aka. DELICIOUS). 

* chocolate cake / fruit dessert: This was actually my least favorite. The chocolate cake was really rich (but in a bitter kind of way instead of the typical sweet chocolate taste). I wasn't a huge fan. The little mini tart with the fruit was good though :) 

We also had a glass of wine with the meal. All in, I think we each spent about ~$60/person including wine / tax / gratuity. Definitely NOT bad for a full meal! I was completely stuffed and had major food coma...

I will definitely come back here for DAT (or for a normal occasion too!)
author: Sarah C.

description:
We came two weeks ago to celebrate our engagement and had a great time. We have been to Ruth's Chris in Toronto and Seattle and have always had good experiences. 

We both ordered from the prix fixe menu- filet mignons medium rare (delicious, melt in your mouth), French green beans (ohhh so buttery and garlicy), mashed potatoes (smooth and perfect compliment to the steak) and dessert (needs improvement big time).

The ambiance was usual for the chain- dimly lit, cozy booths, bar area in front. My bf ( now fiancée!!) called ahead of time and said we were celebrating so they were extra kind and everyone kept congratulating us. Our table was covered in rose petals which was really romantic and cute. 

I am a fan and look forward to spending many anniversaries there in the future.
author: Seema M.

description:
They have really great deals - pre-fixed dinner menu etc. 

I thought their filet mignon is good. Granted, I don't eat much steak personally. They have good sides dishes - mashed potatoes (hard to screw that up), spinach and buttered/sauted mushrooms (4 different kinds of mushrooms!) Their lobster bisque was so creamy! 

Decent wine selection and great service.
author: Catherine T.

description: Great experience at Ruth's Chris. The food came very fast and was delicious. The staff and service  was classy without being stuffy!
author: Mark S.

description:
Josh was great. Amazing service. He explained all the menu items and options as this was our first time here. We ordered from the Dine About Town (DAT) Menu $36.95: Salad, 6oz Petite Filet and Chef's choice dessert and the everyday prix fixe menu "Ruth's Classic" $42.95: Choice of Salad or Soup, I got the 6oz Filet and Shrimp and for dessert a triple play of peanut butter/choco cake, custard and mixed berries and vanilla ice cream. The DAT salad was just mixed greens w/ balsamic vinaigrette. We got the ceasar salad, which was quite tasty with the other meal. Now the steaks. Goodness Gracious! It comes sizzling out on a super hot plate of melted butter. Cooked to perfection! Could have cut it with the butter knife. I will definitely try it with the optional outer crust options..YUM! I was at first disappointed at the size. A 6oz filet looks tiny...but it was more than enough to fill me up. Plus I had the shrimp - they were good. Nothing spectacular, just bbq-d shrimps. Desserts were ho-hum. DAT dessert was a choco cupcake. I had the trio: peanut butter/choco cake, custard and mixed berries and vanilla ice cream - surprisingly, the custard and berries were the best of the 3. The regular menu is pretty pricey, but a really great deal with the dine about town menu. I may have to dig deep into my pockets next time cuz I really want to try the rib-eye! Maybe during the next DAT they will have that on the menu.

I noted on my open-table reservation it was our anniversary and they sprinkled rose petals on our table. Nice touch. Had a reservation and was seated upon arrival. AND...the waiter's assistant chased me down to return my iPhone I left on the seat. How wonderful is that?
author: Karen B.

description:
I kicked off my birth week celebration with a DAT dinner here.  My friends, JL and AY, wanted to take me out, so what better way to celebrate than with a ribeye slathered in BUTTER!

The appetizer was a Steak House Salad( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MMRFl9DYLDGhK4vVBQ20Ew/l ).  The croutons were so yummy.  I wish they put more than 3 on there.  I chose the 12oz ribeye steak for my entree( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/QVFoogeLC8pJ4gqNTi0ehg/l ).  It looks so plain after I saw everyone else's.  JL got hers Oscar Style( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/AiCNao7abqSyFN4HVNX49Q/l ), and AY got his with an 8oz Caribbean lobster tail( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/uqcN_vlFuDEM1mdXaIeZsg/l ).  I got creamed spinach( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/d8pN1hLxFLGwHiQYM9SVaQ/l ) for my side, and JL & AY both got the mashed taters( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/pvUflMmcZQoUCoENWSnbIg/l ).  JL and I got New Orleans Style Bread Pudding( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/p3blYAg2gy0oVTKAtbQ2jA/l ) for dessert, and AL got the Key Lime Pie( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/9Uvf-2JtcH8WziVzB2i-Ow/l ).  

All of the food was excellent!  My steak was cooked just right, and the butter was MMmmMM...MMmmmMM...GOOOOOD!  I had a bite of JL's steak...Oscar style is YUM-O!  The Bearnaise sauce gave the steak an extra burst of flavor.  And that crab cake....OMG....*DROOOOL*.  I was so full after the main course, but I just had to eat some of my dessert.  The bread pudding was super good.  It was warm, sweet and moist....perfecto!  I only had room to eat half, but I was completely satisfied.

We had great service.  Our waiter recommended a very good wine for us.  Too bad I was a bit hungover and couldn't drink much of it.  The rest of the wait staff was very attentive.  Our water glasses were always full, and our dishes were always cleared promptly.

DAT is definitely worth it!
author: Patra I.

description:
I don't know how anyone could give this place less than 5 stars.

My father in-law took my husband, sister and brother in-law out to dinner after my wedding. We all ordered the special which was basically surf and turf.

The steak is served with butter and chives, on the top. The best steak I have ever had!
No room for dessert.

My wedding pictures captured this perfect meal.
author: Sara G.

description:
This is a review of their seafood only - I don't eat meat. I was previously sworn off steakhouses, because of one awful experience at a different restaurant where the only non-meat entrée was shrimp, which, besides being expensive, tasted like chemicals - a total throw away. Ruth's Chris prepares their seafood very well and offers many options which is refreshing (crab cakes, tuna, salmon, shrimp, scallops, lobster and a catch of the day). They have a vegetarian entree, "personalized potato & vegetable selection"- not very imaginative, but points for at least offering it.

I've visited three times and have been more than satisfied each time. The food and service are great. Their waitstaff are very friendly, observant and knowledgeable. My last visit, I chose an entrée and side that were offered on the prix fixe "Classic" menu, but I wanted a salad appetizer that was not. Once the waiter took my order, he offered the prix fixe pricing, without me having to ask, and gave me the appetizer I wanted. So then I was able to get dessert included in that price too! Sweet! I had the Ruth's Chop salad as my appetizer (very tasty with the perfect amount of dressing) with sea scallops as my entrée. The scallops were served over fried polenta which was very good. The green beans w/garlic were terrific. I shared some broccoli au gratin and this new hash brown item, which was way too much food (although delicious), as everything is extremely heavy. Their entire menu involves some kind of sauce, butter, cheese or cream. I mean, I guess this comes with the territory at a steakhouse, but it would be nice to have a few lighter options. Key Lime pie was my dessert - also very good, with a delicious crumbly base, and a huge slice to boot, which I had to take home along with the other stuff I couldn't finish. Luckily I have to walk up a big hill to get home, which helps kick start my metabolism. Next time, I will order with my stomach, not my eyes! Nice for a fancier dinner - the higher price for what you get food and service-wise, is a good value.
author: Barbara K.

description: The food is good but not really excellent for its price. I asked medium cooked fillet and it came well done. I see that they over cook everything. The service is ok...
author: Ali E.

description:
I love steak so therefore I love steakhouses. Any steakhouse that can give me a hearty serving of steak and potatoes and make it well I will love dearly. The three courses I chose from the Dine About Town fixed menu included a salad, petite filet with side and a chocolate cake with berries and cream. We did order an additional dessert though. For steak, it was possible to pay an additional $10 to upgrade from the petite filet to a ribeye.

House salad. I usually love salads but this was nothing special. Though I did love the bread that came with dinner.

Petite filet cooked to medium rare perfection. LOVEEE!!! It was SO tender and delicious, there is definitely a reason why Ruth's Chris is known for their steaks.

Garlic mashed potatoes. My chosen side for my filet because I'm a meat and potatoes kind of girl.

Ruth's Chris "Symphony" dessert. This was a hit AND a miss all on one plate. The chocolate cake was a definite miss, none of us finished it. The berries and cream (reminds me of the Skittles commercial song sung by the leprechaun) was GREAT. It tasted a little like a mini panna cotta which I love. The berries were really refreshing after such a hearty meal.

"Chocolate Explosion." That's what the menu called it.. I thought it was hilarious. It was pretty good though, definitely better than the chocolate cake that came with the fixed menu. But I've also had my share of chocolate lava cakes and this was not the best though acceptable. The best one I've ever had was in Hong Kong.
author: Constance C.

description: Let me start this review by saying that I love Ruth's Chris, like is simply not a strong enough word to describe them. However my review has 2 stars as I experienced the worst Ruth's Chris experience of my life at this location. And for me that's no little thing as I have dinned at no less than 20 locations from east coast to west coast since the early 90's. Me and my girlfriend made the 60 plus mile trek from Santa Cruz to Ruth's Chris to celebrate our anniversary. The food was great but that where the great ended and the bad began. During our appetizer a party of 8 of teenagers where seated next to us. They began ordering drinks as if they where in a bar during prohibition. Within 15 minutes they where drunk as skunks and loud as ever. I felt as if I was transported from a 5 star restaurant into a college frat house in an instant. And did anyone say anything to these people? Nope they just kept feeding them alcohol and letting things progress from loud to louder and rowdy to crazy. During a cake fight fight they decided to have at their table one of the girls actually leaped into my lap and ending up smearing cake all over my pants and my shirt. I mean come on! For the waiter and the management to let this go on in an establishment like that this is just disgusting. It ruined our dinner and our anniversary. 120 miles I drove to eat at a frat house and have my clothes ruined by stupidity and bad behavior. I can't imagine what Ruth Fertel would think if she could have watched what went on that night.
author: Todd H.

description:
Always excellent!
I come here almost with any important occasion. So of course new year eve I came here to celebrate the fabulous year of 2011!

Ordered 3 course meal with upgrad to Ribye steak.

Ruth Chris never ruin my steak. It's always pink with no blood.  
So tasty and the plate is always hot until the last bite.

I m blessed that I have this place around for my craving in steak. 

So two 3 meal courses plus a glass of red wine plus bottle sparkling water plus two coffee plus extra appetizer n dessert total bill around $140+ tips.
author: Cola C.

description: Whether it's for a date, a catch up session with a friend, or a group dinner, you can never go wrong with Ruth's Chris. I've liked every type of steak I've tried here so far, and the lobster tail is also extremely good. Ruth's Chris is definitely one of the better steakhouses in the Bay Area. If you haven't been here yet, you're missing out!
author: Sarah T.

description:
I have mixed feeling about Ruth's Chris. My friends took me here last week for a celebration dinner. We had an awesome time, but I think it was mainly because of the good company, I wasn't very impressed with the food. 

Mind me, the meat was definitely good quality, but like where their meat came from, everything about Ruth's Chris was a little 'in the old days'. I really wish they could have introduced some 'surprise' element to their menu, creative sides, etc. 

I had the $49.95 Ruth classics, with harvest salad (good, but too much dressing), Filet Mignon (medium rare, very good), creamed spinach (I love creamed spinach, and this was no exception, tasty), dessert (carrot cake was alright, the other one was better, but just eh desserts). 

Perhaps it has to do with the fact that I am not big meat eater? I just had a high expectation coming to Ruth's Chris. Hopefully I will see something new in future visits. 

O, the dessert wine was fantastic, chocolaty!
author: J W.

description:
We decided to eat  here last week for my fiance's birthday. 

I had the petite filet mingion & he had the steak. Both perfectly cooked medium rare. Ahi appetizer was delicious. Generous portions which we both ended up packing half for home. Food was really good and that is the only good thing about this restaurant.

One star for poor service. I believe service goes hand in hand with great food. The servers were not  rude or anything but extrememly SLOW. We were seated immediately at 8:20pm.  Though there was plently of room throughout the restaurant, they decided to seat us in the back where there was a large party of 15+ and in between two other tables. It totally took away from the dining experience! It was very loud and was they did not think to sit us else where. 

For 40 mins we watched servers and assistant servers tend to other tables. The back room was obviously more busy than the rest of the restaurant with the big party in the same section but they did not care to check in to see if we were ready to order or at least have some kind of courtesy to say that our server will be with us shortly. 

We'd probably eat here again if the service wasn't so slow and completely unattentive. I regret that I was generous enough to tip them. Will be taking our $$$ elsewhere!!
author: Angela G.

description:
5 stars for the quality of the food; 2 stars for service.

I have been to Ruth Chris before with my fiance for a special dinner and fell in love with it. The night of my bachelorette party I thought it would be fun to go there with about 11 girls because most hadn't been there and the food was amazing last time I went. 

We had reservations at 8:30 but we got there early at about 8:15; it was packed. We were told that our table was still occupied but we would be seated shortly. At 8:30 we were still waiting for our table which was fine, but then 8:40, then 8:50, then 9:00 came around and we were STILL waiting. The hostess, Brianna, was soooo rude. We asked about our reservations and she said the party before ours was still at our table. She was talking to another hostess, right in front of us mind you, and saying that we were early and that getting us seated at our time wasn't important and that we could wait. No apology was offered, no "thank you for waiting;" especially since there were 11 of us and we had plans to go out doing bachelorette things. Brianna, kept saying rude comments about our party right in front of us. I was appalled. I talked to the manager who offered to give us appetizers on the house, which was a nice gesture but honestly, something should have been done said and done sooner. By the time we sat down to eat it was 9:15... we didn't end up leaving until about 10:30/10:45.

As always the food was amazing; but the service and reservation situation was horrible. Luckily the 2 waiters we had were awesome. Everyone beware of the rude hostess Brianna.
author: Tiffany F.

description:
Ribeye is especially good. I wanted medium rare and it came out medium well -- maybe it was sitting to long? 

I will say that the service is a mixed bag. Getting seated wasn't a big deal, but our server must have been swamped as it was hard to rounds of drinks. 

I'd go back if I felt like a standard steak dinner without too much fanfare.
author: Selective S.

description:
I am all for innovation and trend.  But as I get older, I really appreciate great food and great service at a place where you don't have to shout to your dining companions.  

We went here for my partner's birthday and could not have been more pleased.  I indicated on Open Table we were celebrating a birthday and there was "happy birthday" confetti on our table which was a much-appreciated and festive touch. 

Food was great.  They have a fixed price menu which was very nice and you can upgrade sides and dessert for a few dollars more.  They have a nice selection of wines for $45 to celebrate their 45th birthday.  The wine our waitress suggested was excellent.  Filet was cooked perfectly.  Bread pudding was excellent.  Chocolate explosion was ok.  A little dry in my opinion.  My chocolate cupcakes would put it to shame, quite frankly.  

Overall, a great place for a celebration.  The manager came over to make sure everything was alright and that we were happy.  We will be back.
author: Baby J.

description:
I got all this hype about this place and blah blah $60 steaks it wasnt even that much.  We came here last night for our anniversary and i must say it was a fun experince.  We made reservations for 6pm and was able to park out at the meters since it was free after 6pm or you can do valet for $10 bucks.  We waited a couple minutes before we were seated.  Since they knew from the reservation is was our anniversary the person at the front greeted us.  It was nice becuz they sat us near the window in a quiet room so we could enjoy out nice dinner.  I think we were a little over dressed though.  There were ppl up in there were in jeans and some lady in sweat pants.  I guess you pay for the atmosphere really.  It was nice also cuz after a couple minutes some chick came over and put rose petals on our table. 

They handed us a HUGE wine menu and the reg menu.  Since we dont drink we went straight to the food menu.  its pretty good menu! i went for 3 course $49.95 menu.  I got a ceaser salad and it was huge! i was so full already from it but it was lighty tossed with cheese crutons and it was yummy! i am glad the dressing wasnt overpowering.  For the main course I ordered the filet and had it butterflyed at medium well.  However I wasnt too pleased with the outcome becuz i wished our server had told us about the 500 degree hot plate thing.  My steak was well done by the time i started cutting into it.  The steak just has salt pepper parsley and butter.  Which wasnt too flavorful.  It came with a side order so i choosed mashed potatoes.  It was on the cold side like it was the first to get prep b4 being served.  It had a nice hint of garlic and it tasted like it was made from scratch.  However since it was a little cold i wasnt satified.  My husband got french fries with his steak and i must say they are the best french fries we ever had.  It was season was salt and pepper and it was nice and crisp on the outside and soft in the inside.  They were to die for! As for dessert that came with my meal.  It was nice for them to put Happy Anniversary on the plate.  It was i think some type of chocolate cake or maybe german chocolate cake and berries with cream sauce.  I MUST SAY you must try the fresh berries and cream sauce when you go to RC it was soo fresh but creamy at the same time.   I wish i ordered another berries and cream to take home but we didnt have time since we had to leave for a play.  The service was really good and the atmosphere was very nice.  The place was nice and clean and all the tables were nicely and neatly set.

Overall I would come here again but it wasnt something I am crazy about.  My fav steakhouse is still Sterlings in Reno.
author: Thuyvi M.

description:
What's the point of making reservations and then still waiting for 45 minutes?

We then were showed "our table" which was a small two seater tucked away in the corner of a larger dinning room (looked like this is were they would have large parties) in fact there was two large parties surrounding us giving us no ability to speak to each other with out the loud ass Italians looking over (yes bc we were jammed in that tight) once our waiter came by and the prices of this place had sunk in... I went for the petite and lobster tail, filet was cooked well lobster way over done and rubbery  my GF who order the filet medium rare, got a cold piece of beef sent out to her, they could have left the fucking cow bell on it.  Way too gross for her to eat. i would think a pricey steak house can get temps right but whatevs 

we paid and left.

wont go back ever.

we are now officially Harris's only people.
author: C. M.

description:
I don't entirely see what the fuss is of a high-end steakhouse, but then again, I don't eat alot of steak.

With that being said, let's talk about the food.

The calamari, that's a must have, it had so much flavor, just make a plate around that and I'm set. But of course this is a steakhouse and you just gotta have the steak, right?

I got the $39.95 Ruth Chris Classic, Corn Chowder, 6 oz. Filet with sauteed mushrooms.

The soup was great, came out hot on a warm plate, it wasn't some nerfed soup of volcano steamed, temperature was good.

The 6 oz ( O_o ), yes 6 oz filet looked small, but it was a proper size with everything else as a part of the Classic.

The sauteed mushrooms? errr. sauteed? Was a bit non-existent. Should had just been called, "Cook mushrooms drowned in sauce"

The dessert, a egg custard with fruit, that was good.

So there's some ups and downs with my dinner, but overall, it was a decent experience.

Oh, and I had to sit at the bar because I wasn't going to wait minimum 45 minutes for a table in the dining area.
author: Alen K.

description: excellent as usual. had the 16oz. rib eye n my better half had the 12oz. med rare of course!. With sides of potatos lyonnaise, asparagus and cream spinach. Our server Christine was excellent . she ask b4 we ordered if it was a special occasion? my girlfriend said, "yes its his bday"! so at the end of our dinner she brought out a dessert sample plate with happy bday writing on it. pretty sure they do that for everyone, but it sure made the dinner that much more memorable.
author: Ray E.

description:
When it comes to steak in SF, I think of H-----, B---'s, and H---- of P-- R--.  That being said, you can't pass up Ruth's Chris during Dine About Town.  $35.00 for a steak, side, and dessert is a boon in this economic climate.  

Running 15 minutes late because B couldn't get off his PS3.  I called and the hostess thanked me on the phone AND when we arrived, for letting her know.  Very nice way to begin the evening.  Crowded, but we got a nice table to the side.  Server offered both the regular and DAT menu.  In case you miss DAT you can opt for their summer prix fixe selection for $39.99.

Appetizer - Salad for both.  I requested blue cheese dressing on the side and B ended up sharing that with me, since he wasn't so keen on the vinaigrette.  Nice mix of dark greens and iceberg.

Entree - Filet mignon for me and I added (+$15) a crab cake and asparagus with a creamy hollandaise sauce.  WOW!  The jumbo lump blue crab cake was amazing and really added to the steak.  Huge chunks of meat, no filler.  Sauce was on the heavy side, but I just pushed what I didn't want aside.  Asparagus was good.  My filet was tender and cooked perfectly.  B had the rib eye and it was cooked nicely.  Good marbling and just enough fat.  

Sides - mashed potatoes and creamed spinach weren't unique, but they were more than edible and complimented the meal.

Dessert - Bread pudding was delish and the key lime pie had a nice taste, but was a bit soft for my liking.

Topped it off with a bottle of pinot noir.  All in all, it was a nice meal with good service.  Ruth's isn't the holy grail for me when it comes to steak, but this was one of the best DAT experiences I've had.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
One my favorite steak house. Tender steak w/ nice wine: pure culinary nirvana.  Great singular service and prompt with any request. Compared with Lawry's, Chris Steak House hands down.  Very pleasing ambiance with dim lighting where the show is the food itself.  

ps.  Come early, traffic in Van Ness can be horrible..
author: Izzy H.

description:
I came here for the first time with my roomie and our mutual friend to celebrate my birthday and my roomie's birthday (we have the same one)...and I loved my dinner here!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves a good steak, a good deal and good service.

Our server was extremely friendly and helpful in explaining the specials - I suppose it's because it was 3 ladies ordering!  ;P  Nonetheless, he provided excellent service, and didn't pressure us to leave the restaurant as we were taking our time.  It can take a while for 3 girls to get through dinner while making much-needed girl talk!

We ordered from the prix-fixe menu, which had very good selections.  For $49.95, I was entitled to a salad, choice of meat, side and dessert.  I chose the Harvest Salad, which was delicious, ribeye medium and french fries (for an additional $2).  In addition to that, my companions shared their sides - which were creamed spinach and green beans.  The bread was warm and tasty.  Because our server knew two of us had birthdays, he hooked each of us birthday girls up with a dessert from the regular menu, so I had the bread pudding, which was delicious and my roomie had the cheesecake, which was also great to nibble on.  Our friend had dessert from the prix-fixe menu, which was a piece of carrot cake and chocolate mousse.  Our server brought the birthday desserts out each with a candle.  :)  We brought a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon, which required a $25 or $35 corkage fee.

For the three of us, the bill was roughly $170.  Not bad for yummy steak and pretty nice portions.  We went on a Monday night, so it was pretty dead (times are rough).  I recommend this to anyone!
author: Christine E.

description:
I hate reviewing franchise type establishments but we came here for my friends birthday so why the hell not yelp it. What bugs me is the Ala carte menu. You are charging 40+ dollars on steaks and you are going to charge side dishes as well? The steaks are good not great. Butter and steak..............you really can't go wrong with that if you want to experience sharp pain in the chest, shortness of breath, and paralysis on either side of the body. 

The sides can use a little help. The broccoli Au gratin was a little too cheesy(I know Au gratin........cheese), the shoe string fries tasted like those canned french fries I had when I was a kid. The asparagus, spinach, and mushrooms were the stars of the night. Actually the stuffed mushroom appetizers were awesome. The drinks are pretty stiff here so you will get your bang for the buck. The bartenders are always nice and friendly. 

The total bill for 6 ppl came out to around 540 including tax and tip so it was reasonable. Something about everything being ala carte just bugs me.  This restaurant should be a solid 3.5 to 4 if it wasn't for my pet peeve with the ala carte style.
author: jason g.

description: Delicious food from appetizer to desert! Steaks are the best we've ever eaten. Nice atmosphere, music and professional knowledgable waiter, thanks Robin.
author: Charity H.

description:
I can't believe how disappointed I was eating a steak dinner here. Ruth's Chris is the McDonald's of steakhouses. That said, I would pick McDonald's over this place any day.

First of all, they don't serve sourdough bread at the table because every Ruth's Chris across the country follows the exact same ingredients. So... we were served some pretty lame bread that probably came from thousands of miles away. Then, a pre-made salad that obviously came from a bag. The steak itself was average at best for an expensive steakhouse. The key lime pie also tasted like it was from a far away factory. Do they make anything in-house here? Granted, I was here for a $35 fixed price menu but I don't see how that justifies being served salad out of a bag. The entire meal was like a bad joke.

This location is only five blocks from Harris' -- I don't understand how they stay in business with such a great alternative nearby. Hopefully they won't much longer.
author: Aaron V.

description:
We went to Ruth's Chris for the first time with some friends for Dine About Town. The men ordered the ribeye upgrade for $8 extra, while the ladies ordered the filet for the regular prix-fixed price. I must say, I LOVED my filet. It was incredibly flavorful and did not need any type of blue-cheese crust, etc. add on that you can get. It wasn't as tender as some filets I've had in the passed, but the flavor was pretty blow-your-mind good. The ribeye, which I snagged a bite of (you would too), was good, but a little more fatty than I like. The dudes in our group enjoyed the fattiness though, so I guess it's good, if you're into that stuff. The sides, mashed potatoes and creamed spinach, while good, were forgettable, but whatever. They're sides. You're there for the main course, aren't you? 

Dessert-wise, the unanimous favorite was the bread pudding. I read somewhere that someone thought the whiskey flavor was too overpowering. To this I call bullshit (no offense). I am sensitive to alcholic flavors and there was only a hint of it at most. 

We brought our own two bottles of wine and corkage fee is only $15 a bottle. Not bad and a pretty significant savings to buying bottles there.
author: Angie Y.

description: Dine about town recently brought me here.  It's been good 5+ yrs since I last came here. We always have a great dining experience here. From service, atmosphere, to the food. Enjoyed the rib eye and jumbo shrimp which both were great. Steaks come on a hot plate so if you get medium it may turn to a well in 5 mins. Creamed spinach was superb or maybe i just haven't eaten it for awhile. Definitely recommend and will be in the future.
author: Larry L.

description: Was there celebrating our friend's birthday, had been to this (San Francisco) restaurant once before for Valentine's but last night's dinning was outstanding. To begin, we had reservations for 6 and there were no issues sitting us and there was plenty of room. Our drinks were fab! Starting with a Mojito which was delicious and big enough it could have easily been two cocktails at other places :) I ordered the crab cakes ( I am not much of a steak person so it was nice to have plenty of other choices).  Our table ordered fresh broccoli, spinach, mushrooms, mashed potatoes, asparagus & sweet potatoes ( I would have this for dessert next time, delicious)... they were all great choices! My crab cakes were huge... I only was able to finish 1 1/2 crab cakes.  It was all fabulous from our drinks to our food to our service!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
So I've heard wonderful things about this place but to be honest with you, it didn't really live up to the hype. 

I mean, ok, the bread was phenomenal. The butter was creamy and delish. Just the right amount of salty. So that experience earned some stars right there. But when my ribeye came out, I was expecting major meatgazms. No such luck. It was a bit tough and stringy. A bit fatty. 

I really was disappointed that the piece de resistance failed to deliver. I love a good steak, and I have had fantastic meat in the past. I guess it was just an off night, but I'm still on the fence about giving this place a high rating. 

Based on the steak, 3 stars. But the service was on point and the bread and butter.... Oh the bread and butter.. that  just earned half a star. So all in all, for the experience: 3.5 stars.
author: Angelo B.

description:
On our first visit to Ruth's Chris. Or, "Would you like some steak with your butter?"

There wasn't anything wrong with the meal. I had the petite filet Oscar style. He had the petite filet. We shared the mashed potatoes and mushrooms. The waitress was attentive, and the atmosphere was nice, but it seemed a bit hollow.

I think the food was good, not amazing. I've had better steaks and the sides were unimpressive. Everything was drowning in butter, including the mashed potatoes. If you want to spend more than $100 on a meal for two, you can probably do much better in SF.
author: Karen C.

description: Love this place. For a straight forward steak, Ruth's Chris is always a great stand-by. The quality is never a concern for me. Plus it's a place that works well for a guy's night or for a date night. Also, they typically have great prix fix menus (we call them Recession Specials!) so you can save a lot of money on a great meal.
author: Jigar C.

description: I will try and make this brief. I really enjoyed going to this restaurant. The food was delicious and the service was even better. Only little thing I didn't like is that you have to order sides for your meal/meat. lol The full course meals they offered didn't have the main entrée I wanted. Anyway I ordered BBQ Shrimp that didn't taste anything like BBQ but was to die for. The sauce was the bomb. It was suppose to come with mash potatoes. Ummm I couldn't locate them under the shrimp. Maybe a teaspoon which was disappointing being this place is pricey. So I nibbles on veggies we ordered on the side. I have to agree with another person here. This is no place for KIDS. Its kind of low key, mellow kind of feel. I most definitely don't want kids next to me while I enjoy my expensive meal with my girlfriends. BTW I love kids, just not during a expensive meal. I would like to enjoy it. So parents, order pizza for the kids and get a sitter. Thanks
author: Ronnesha L.

description:
When you boil everything down, Ruth's Chris is really just a pretty standard steakhouse with a few bonuses: all the steaks are USDA prime quality, the plates are heated to 500 degrees to keep your steak hot, the service is great, and the ambiance makes you feel like you're on a romantic getaway.  Hmm.. I guess that's all you can ask for in a steakhouse, because come on you don't really have to be Thomas Keller to make a USDA Prime rib-eye taste good.  

One thing about those 500 degree plates.. they make it impossible for any type of garnish to go on the plate without getting singed, which kind of makes the presentation of the steak a little lacking.  Seriously it's just a steak on a plate.  Covered in butter.  No presentation points here.  But man it smells good.  Also I ordered my steak medium rare and by the time I was half-way through my steak it was probably at about a medium well because that plate was so hot.  If you're like me and like your meat bloody, get it rare or even blue.  Oh and I kept burning myself on it because I kept reaching for Grace's mashed potatoes.  i guess that's more than one thing.   

Other than that, RC is definitely worth a try, and their mashed potatoes are bomb, but for me I think I'm gonna stick with HoPR.  Sorry Ruth.
author: William S.

description:
A very top notch, classy steakhouse in San Francisco.  Love the food and service.  Definitely worth visiting for a great steak.

Ordered a medium rare (closer to rare) Filet Mignon and served a great steak on a hot platter that kept my meal fresh up until the last mouth watering bite.  I also had their hash browns and my only problem was that it was far too much for any normal person to eat.  They should consider cutting the price and portion in half.  The shoestrings were awesome! Those tasty potato fries are thinner than BJ's and that's pretty impressive.  Their garlic mash potatoes are not that great...a tad on the dry side and not much flavor.  I also felt the EXTREMELY large fried onion rings with the asian dipping sauce were delicious as an appetizer.

The service was excellent.  I never had an empty glass and I had no trouble asking waiters for anything I needed.  I was happy they carried Tobasco sauce to go along with the ketchup and hash browns.  =)

The restaurant is kept dimly lit for a more calm/romantic ambiance.  I think it's too dark since I actually want to notice if something is dirty or not right.
author: B F.

description:
First off, I'm a steak snob; and shamelessly admit it. 

Came here with some friends after the Monday Night Niners-Bears Game at Candlestick (GO NINERS!). We called from the road, and they were able to accommodate us, which was great, as we were running a bit late. So far, so good. 

We arrived, and were greeted and seated promptly by a friendly hostess.

Shortly after being seated, the waiter came by, dropped off some bread, and took our drink orders. I was cajoled by my buddy into ordering some sort of citrus mojito. Drinks came out rather promptly (Didn't hurt that there were only three other small parties in our section). I'm not a mojito fan, but the drink was good.
