The waiter took our order, and I ordered the Petite Filet (Medium), and ordered a side of onion rings. The food took a bit of time (to be expected), and the conversation flowed. The food came out, and I was starving after the hike from Candlestick to our vehicle. I cut into my filet, and it cut with very little resistance. Upon looking at it, the filet ended up being cooked closer to well-done. I'm not one to pitch a fit, so I dealt with it. I bit into the filet, expecting something amazing. I was sorely mistaken. It was bland, and not very impressive at all. I've had filet before at other restaurants in Southern CA (Paul Martin's was excellent).  My buddy ordered the chicken, and Gratin Potatoes. The potatoes were slightly undercooked, which led me to believe that there is a bit of QC issues with the kitchen. 

I find it doubtful that I will ever go back to a Ruth's Chris based on the quality of my meal for the price.
author: Sam K.

description: Ruth's Chris definitely puts the flavor in its' food. A truly enjoyable place to dine and wine.
author: James M.

description:
I went to Ruth Chris for the first time with my boyfriend for NYE dinner and I was pleasantly surprised. The service was splendid and fast even for a busy night like that! The decor was fitting but the only downside was the fact that they had a tight spot for their entry. I felt like as we were waiting to be seated, we were sitting on top of other people. 

The food was good to great. 

We ordered two of the barbeque shrimp appetizers to make sure we had enough between the two of us and YUM. Those shrimps were amazing with the sauce and little bread that comes with it.

The soup (gumbo) was okay. It needed some tabasco but it was good. 

For entree, I had the stuffed chicken breast which was presented well but it wasn't amazing. The lobster tail I ordered to go with the meal was very good. I am not a big lobster fan so I was happy with the order for sure. My carrot cake that came with the prix fix dinner menu was yummy and the chocolate mousse that came with it was just the right amount of sweetness and texture.

My boyfriend ordered the filet/lobster combo which was their advertised special. He says the filet was pretty good and was perfectly cooked! He also enjoyed the side of au gratin potatoes which he says were excellent.

We did order a side of hash browns which came out as a side that we shared, it was umm, well, lets just say, you hear the hype but they are really just regular ol hash browns.

If you order steak and lobster this is your place. Valet parking is cheap, 10 bucks and the booths are cozy. I recommend the bbq shrimp and steer clear of the chicken dish and the hash browns.
author: Gina H.

description:
So.. I just went here for the second time ever and thought I'd write a review about it.

My friend and I were planning on going to dinner and I was thinking something not too fancy and simple, I owed him for his birthday. NOPE. He decided lets do Ruth Chris.. Okay so maybe like 200$ later the wallets a little emptier but let me tell you.. FABULOUS dinner.. and my friend (ok ex boyfriend) paid for the whole thing.

This new set price meal? fantastic.. so basically for $50 you get your choice of cut with a salad or soup and whatever side you'd like. I had a filet with the cesar salad and we split both garlic mashed potatoes and green beans, and my friend had the t-bone. PLUS a big bottle of fancy red wine and dessert after.

I didn't exactly dress for the occasion but I wasn't feeling stupid for it, nor did the staff come across as snooty or patronizing cuz I didn't know much about the cuts.. or wine for that matter. Our waiter was a great guy who constantly came to check on us but wasn't overbearing. Always had the water filled, knew just when to come back so we could order and gave us great service.

Of course my food was AMAAAZING and delicious and now that I'm older, I can definitely say I appreciated all the great folks who work here and the cooks in the back than when I was 20 years old and first came here.

I will FOR SURE come back once I can afford it.. hahaa I'll be sure not to eat for a few hours beforehand too so that I can make sure not to leave TOO much food over. :) 

YUM YUM YUM!!! nothing makes me happier than a nice medium well side of cow. =D
author: Diana R.

description: Wonderful steakhouse in San Francisco. I love the rib-eye, the creamed spinach as well as the potatoes au gratin. It's classy and better than most other steakhouses in the city. If you want a first class meal to impress your friends, this may be the place to go. I'd go back in a Heartbeat.
author: George C.

description: I came here last night. I ordered the Ruth's Chris Classic Meal. It comes with your choice of a starter, an entree, a side, and dessert. For my started I was able to substitute for lobster bisque soup... WOW! soooooo grub. As for my entree, I chose the filet butterfly style. Butterfly style is basically where the chef slices the filet in half and opens it up like a butterfly. It somehow makes it juicier. Ask the waiter, he forms the description to make you drool... actually, writing about my meal is making my fat ass hungry. I can't finish this review. This place is just way too NOM NOM NOM and one final NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOM!
author: Michael L.

description:
4.5 Stars

Happy 1 year anniversary to me and my boyfriend! So anyways, I made the reservation through open table and wrote in the note that it was our anniversary just for the heck of it. Turns out they really pay attention to those details because when we got sat, they put rose petals on the tables and the server greeted us and wished us a happy anniversary! Our server was Jesse and he was AWESOME! His attitude and knowledge of the food was top notched. The food here is actually really good compared to what some people say. I got the Rib eye steak and my boyfriend got the same but bone-in. We also added in sides of steamed broccoli and shoestring French fries. The steak came out sizzling hot on the plate, like literally still cooking! The steaks were cooked just perfectly as ordered and the fat was marbleized throughout the entire piece. When you bite into it, it just felt like it melted in your mouth, mmmm, so tender! The dishes were nothing fancy, just basic plates you would find at a diner. That's what I kind of liked about this place also was because it wasn't too fancy in terms of their presentation. They're very straight to the point as you can tell from looking at their menu. Everything is very basic and classic. They did not have Foie gras though which I was a little disappointed. What disappointed me even more was that they ran out of sorbet dessert that night! That was the only reason why they got minus a half star, plus the fact that their menu selection is a tad bit on the small side. Just note before you come here, everything is a la carte. Other than that, this is a nice little date spot to add to the list. Great service, Great food, and Nice décor! Dining in here made me feel like I was in a classier version of McLarens in How I Met Your Mother lol.
author: Marissa C.

description: Came here with my gf. We ordered the crab cakes (delicious) and a porter house steak for two. Service was good..servers were attentive and even the manager stopped by to check in with us. Steak was cooked to perfection and pretty good but definitely not the best steak I've had. Price was alright. steak + crab cake + 1 glass wine + tip =$150.
author: Solomon Y.

description: What can I say.  This place is gangter, food is great, service is great, don't like dressing up for places like this and they don't make me feel like a outcast for it
author: Johnson W.

description:
Yeah, I know, I'm supposed to have a steak here, but give me a break, I was in the middle of failing to get back on my elimination diet and I thought, "well I can have lamb so I'm not really being bad" but of course when the yummy, yummy lamb came out I chose to ignore that it was cooked in an insane amount of butter!

I LOVE BUTTER!  If I could be Paula Dean for one week....  Oh the thoughts....  Oh my Gaah!!!  It would be as if I had gone to a world where all the goodness from butter I could eat and eat and eat and then just go back to my body and having no harm done.  Wow, it's too much for me to keep thinking about that.

So anyway, the lamb was cooked in butter and garlic so I loved the hint of gaminess with those flavors, and enjoyed devouring the meat.  The sides were just average, and I could see my brother and cousin really enjoying the steaks they were eating.  And we all thought the service was very up to par.
author: Susan C.

description: I had the ribeye,  it was the saltiest steak I've ever had.  The waiter informed me that the meat would be cooked in a little butter... not an entire skillet of SALTED butter I like the creamed spinach and the warm bread.  I prefer Harris.
author: Mrs. X.

description:
The steaks here are very good.  This is a wonderful place to sit down and have a great, peaceful meal. Their wine selection is very good.  There's  a waitress there who served us last week. She is very kind and was helpful with answering our questions. 

The whole facility is very elegant and the bar is beautiful. Friendly people and good times can be found here. Very good restaraunt, they have my respect.
author: Diana W.

description: Came here for Dine About Town two years in a row. They had a nice variety of entrees on the DAT menu this year and we just about sampled them all - petite filet, ribeye, grilled salmon and the bbq shrimp. We also ordered the crab cake appetizer off the regular menu and I'm not a fan of seafood but they were the best tasting crab cakes I've ever had. By the time dessert arrived, Chocolate Mousse and Carrot Cake, we could barely put a dent in them. Overall, solid food and service.
author: Queena T.

description:
Came here last year for Valentines Day. There is a long wait to get on the list if you don't make a reservation weeks in advance (for Valentines Day). We both went with the fixed menu and got:

-Steak house salad
-Petite filet mignon
-Fresh Seasonal Berries with Sweet Cream Sauce

Overall, it was good and filling; but I would try other steakhouses in the city before coming back here again.
author: Nancy L.

description: Great food, great drinks!  It had been years since we had dined at RC, the last time we came we were not impressed at all.  But last night was a whole different experience.  We had the set menu for $49 pp, which had some good choices too, I had the petite filet and lobster tail and the hubby had the ribeye.  My starter was the almond, strawberry salad, which was really yummy.  I accompanied my surf and turf with the garlic green beans which were cooked crisp, so good!  My husband upgraded to the sweet potato side and that was outstanding, it was topped with pecans and brown sugar.  They only negative was the set dessert, it was a mini key lime pie which was super tart and more like a cheesecake than anything else.  We had great service from the bar and wait staff.  We will definitely add this restaurant back to the rotation for date night.
author: La C.

description:
i've only been here once & was impressed with the service & our entire order:

calamari (best i've ever had) 
lobster bisque (best i've ever had)
garlic crusted halibut (best i've ever had)
melt in your mouth ribeye perfectly cooked med-rare (SOOOOO good)
creamed spinach (i don't ever like this, wasn't my order)
green beans (OK)
creme brulee (yummmmy)

i can't wait to go back
author: Jenina S.

description:
First of all, I wanna be honest with you, I am not reviewing their cuisine, manners or cocktail stiffness. This is a pure atmosphere review. 
The moment I entered Ruth's Chris location on Van Ness Blvd, I came across a very unpleasant, non-welcome, very crowded but dead atmosphere that I have never experienced before. Potential costumers and parties were waiting for their timing to be seated, but that crowded place was filled with numness, some morbid atmosphere of a local funeral home.
I had a chance to dine at Ruth's Chris locations in Lahaina, Hawaii and Pasadena, California and never ever felt that way.
I appopogize to chef, prep cooks and probably wonderful waiters and waitresses but something needs to be done with that morbid atmoshere.
Would highly recommend a short walk to House of Prime Rib or jazzy atmospere of Harris Steakhouse.
author: Milan V.

description:
I don't know why people would say this place is AMAZING cause it's not. And especially when there are soooooo many fan-fuckin-tastic places in the bay to get a damn good steak.

Filet... medium rare. Cooked well. Meat needed salt and pepper. Butter wasn't overwhelming for me cause I heart butter but the steak just needed help. 

Crab stuffed mushrooms: TO DIE FOR. My favorite part of the meal and part of the reason for the 3 star rating. This alone was a 5. Crab, cheese, mushroom, drool.

Steakhouse salad: Whatevs. It was definitely no HOPR salad. Now THAT is a good salad!

Mashed potatoes: Meh. I can make better at home. It was too mushy. Had the texture of instant potatoes.

Creamed spinach: HOPR's is better.

Bread pudding: SOOOOO GOOD. I love bread pudding but hate raisins and they make theirs without raisins! Yipppeee!~

Key lime pie: I liked how it was more sour/tart than other places. 

Sidenote: The meat didn't taste especially high quality. =P Morton's, Alexander's, HOPR's & Harris's are all WAY better.
author: Beverly T.

description: I absolutely love their filet mignon and their bread pudding! Service is great too.
author: Brianna M.

description: The San Francisco treat! Petite filet mignon, creamed spinach, sweet potato casserole, and a raspberry sorbet.
author: A R.

description: I went here for Christmas dinner with my boyfriend and friends. Our server Megan is excellent and she's very attentive and always comes around to check up on us. The food is very good as well, we ordered 3 ribeye steaks and my boyfriend ordered the chicken. We also had salad and calamari, it was super yummy. Will definitely come back again!
author: Katherine C.

description:
I absolutely love this place! I've eaten here a few times and am never disappointed. So when dine about town came this year, I decided to take advantage of the discount :) On my last visit I had their salmon dish that came on a bed of spinach with assorted string beans. the fish was amazing...so buttery and savory...it just parted itself every time i sunk my fork into it. Of course I always get garlic mash potatoes every time I come here, it is just the perfect ratio of potatoes and garlic--not too overwhelming or lacking in garlic.
Another recommendation is their petite filet. it's sooooo tender and juicy. They actually age there meat and they do it so well. and they keep their seasoning and flavor simple...just salt and pepper w/ fresh melted butter. Watch out though...the plate come to your table sizzling hot!
author: Ivy L.

description: This place isn't even worth 4 stars. Came here for a birthday dinner and it wasn't all that great. Desserts were good but everything else was just "so-so". Definetly not going here again, I rather go across the street and eat at house of prime rib. The steak was kind of tough and come on, steaks are supposed be enjoyable and mouth watering! NO, NO, NO. On top of that , waitress seemed to have attitude issues.
author: Colette P.

description: My son and daughter treated us to a celebratory dinner. The food was amazing and our server attentive and friendly. Unfortunately this excellence was offset by the actions of the manager, Ben. Early in the evening my son opened his napkin to find a live roach crawling out onto the table. He called the waitress over who began freaking  out and would not assist in killing or removing the bug. My son killed it and handed it over to another waiter. Ben stepped to our table apologized and moved us. That was the last we heard from him. We stayed to dine knowing that bugs can get into the best of establishments. However, this was an extremely unpleasant way to start our evening and we felt that Ben should have made some gesture to compensate the incident.  Possibly a comped dessert or appetizer? Nothing! My son still tipped our waiter 20% of the bill and complimented his service . I have been years  in mgmt.and was appalled at this omission! I would not think that Ruth Chris would support this poor customer service!!
author: Kathy H.

description:
I generally like the food here. I came here for the first time two years ago on my first "fancy" date. Since then I have only gone back twice. I would come here more often but this place brings out the memories of a relationship long gone. 
The drinks here are good. The potatoes are great!! The steaks are good too.  This is somewhere that is pretty pricey but it is a nice place to go with family.
author: Wes P.

description:
We went to Ruth's Chris last night for Dine About Town (it was our second visit here). The DAT menu was pretty much the same with last time's, so I already knew what to have. The four of us all chose the rib eye. The steaks here are so rich and flavorful and the house cocktails are great, too. Honestly, there are no complaints about the food; good meat and booze make a great meal.

I had to ding a star because the waitress was cold and unfriendly. Every time she stopped by the table (which wasn't all that often), it was like the mortician had arrived. Looking around, it seemed like all of the servers were suffering from the same depression. The mood was so bleak. Maybe they all got pink slips before they started their shift. 

Luckily, the company out our table was good, the food was good and the drinks were good. 4 Stars this time, but would've given 5 for our last visit.
author: Cory R.

description:
Best steak I've ever eaten! I went here for my 40th, thank you baby and I grew up in Colorado, so I know what a good steak is supposed to taste like...excellent, that's all I have to say about the food.

Customer service was excellent, they do valet and even my table was sprinkled with happy birthday confetti. 

Great experience all the way around.
author: Anthony J.

description:
Supposedly this is a tourist spot that heavily advertises in airplane catalogues. The interior can be called date-centric for the family. The is a lot of rich wood and large paintings. Rich while still retaining a casual vibe.

All of us ordered what I call "value meals". These meals come with a gumbo or salad, choice of meat, and a duo dessert. There are two choices of meals, one with a smaller cut of meat while the other is a standard size of meat that you would get if you ordered it alone. This meal is worth it because it only costs like ten dollars more.

*=served with meal
____

Appetizer
Barbecued Shrimp - Average stuff. I would avoid this. It's not horribly done but I was expecting something more memorable.
Mushrooms stuffed with crabmeat - Good.
Fresh bread - Served all meal long. I was eating a lot of this soft stuff.
*Caesar Salad - A little heavy on the dressing but still good.
*Gumbo - Average yet I would still stick to the gumbo because the salad is too big for one person.
___

Entree
Everyone had a ribeye except me. I had the filet. The ribeye is more juicy and has its own distinct flavor. I prefer the filet because it is more tender and melts in your mouth. Each plate is piping hot out of the oven while the meat is drenched in melted butter.

I was satisfied with the meat. It's easily the best part of the dinner.

Hash Browns - This is huge! But it should be for $10! It's like a small land mine. But they're not great hash browns, more like average. They taste a lot like mashed potatoes with a crisp shell.
____

Dessert
*A duo of chocolate mousse in a chocolate cup along with carrot cake - To me the chocolate mousse is way too rich. The carrot cake has an interesting texture to it but too much frosting. Overall dessert was average.
_____

Mucho dinero. The meat was good but everything else felt mediocre. I'd advise to order the meat alone and stick to the bread. Afterward go to a nice coffee shop. Your stomach and wallet will thank you.
author: Michael H.

description:
A good friend took me here for my birthday, which was much appreciated since this place is definitely pricey. We did get a great tip from one of the workers... Cowboy Ribeye, Center Cut. Apparently it has less fat than the other cuts. My 22 oz. steak came out a perfect medium rare, sizzling with butter on the hot plate. 

We tried 3 sides, garlic mashed potatoes, potatoes lyonnaise, and onion rings. I liked the garlic mashed potatoes the best, and the onion rings were good as a textural contrast. 

They let us sample a few wines but not liking any of them in particular, I settled on the cheapest Cab by the glass. Their wines are on the pricey side too.

I'd come back on an expense account.
author: Derrick V.

description: Pretty good food! =) Im not a big steak fan so I can't say I was totally excited by this place. The service was excellent and their desserts were delicious so it's a 4 star for me!
author: Claire Y.

description: My medium-rare filet mignon was peeerfect! The butter on the bottom of the plate was artery clogging, but oh so gooood!
author: Sharon H.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday. With the nightmare experience I had at House of Prime Rib, I had vowed to NEVER eat at a strictly steakhouse again however for my friend, I figured I'll just go and order seafood. 

I had the Ruth's Special priced at $39.95 which began with a plate of Ceasar Salad (awesome), followed by three large lumps of CrabCakes (meaty) and ended with their Chocolate Cake dessert (too sweet). The dinner was satisfying though I found crab cake on the salty end. I had leftovers for lunch. Overall, I did enjoy the meal. 

The service was great! Very accommodating. May go back again.
author: Dee T.

description: We had good service and the food was very good.  I cannot give it 5 stars when I have eaten at Gordon Ramsay Steak but its a 4 and 1/2 for me.  We would eat there again.
author: Jim B.

description:
The steaks here are simply the best I've ever had...Every carnivore should come by here once in their lives.  I ordered the ribeye and the sig o' ordered the filet mignon and lobster.

The ribeye was perfect, just the way every ribeye should be.  Very moist, juicy, and flavorful.  The filet was OK.  It came out a little dry and didn't have much flavor to it.  We also ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms which are absolutely to-die-for.  I just wish there were more than 4 mushrooms per order.  =]

A great night overall.  Great dinner, great service!
author: Chai S.

description:
Wish I could give this place two reviews, one for the bar (5-stars), one for the restaurant (1-star). I split the difference. But what follows will detail why the one star and why the five between the two.

I normally don't go in for national chain restaurants, but Ruth's Chris has very good steaks. I love the way they're prepared and served. Extremely flavorful. I've never been let down by the food. However, the restaurant experience is a different matter.

THE RESTAURANT (1-Star)

(Note: be sure to read the second half of the review about the bar)

I'd been to Ruth's Chris in other cities and wanted to try it out for an anniversary with my wife. First I was a bit disappointed in the dining rooms, it just didn't look quite as upscale as the pricing would lead you to believe. I know it's a steak house. I don't expect the decor to be show stopping. The booths and tables will be standard. The wall art, wall-arty. But there's something about the atmosphere in the dining rooms I find really kind of awful. Way too middle of the road, this could be anywhere indoorsy. Way too corporate and boring. And the lighting's a bit bright. And if you're there on a weekend night, there will be at least three crying babies as this seems to be one of the hottest, bring the babies to the expensive steakhouse for the once a year family celebration place in SF. 

So we arrive. The dining rooms aren't full yet. There's only one big family in the main room, and we are seated in a booth right next to the big party. There were tons of tables and booths available in the main room, away from them, and in the side rooms as well. Why sit a dressed-up couple (obviously going out for a romantic dinner) next to a loud family with TWO crying babies and a few rambunctious kids? It was too loud to talk to eachother and after a few minutes waiting for the server,  I decided "no" we can't sit here. So I asked our server to switch tables when she arrived. I normally don't do this, but seriously, I really think they could have thought more about where to seat us instead of just sitting us in the order required by management or something. 

We get reseated in a different dining room. And the rush begins. I suppose our table was earmarked for someone coming in a half hour later, because, I'm not kidding, they put our steaks on the table while we were half-way through our salads.  Here's your twenty minute $150 dollar meal.

I will NEVER eat in the dining rooms again.

THE BAR (5-stars!!!)

The bar, on the other hand, is always a five-star experience. There's a romantic little table for two in the corner along the window that's usually empty. You don't need a reservation, just walk into the bar and sit at an empty table if it's set. Or just ask one of the friendly bartenders and they'll direct you to an open spot. There's even a few booths in the back of the bar that are available. I love that I never need a rez and I usually get that nice little table in the front corner. If not, the bar is a great place to eat. 

Arturo, Jose and Dan are some of the best bartender/servers in SF. They always treat me right. Make great drinks and offer much better service than the busy waitstaff in my experience. The bar itself is nice, wood paneled and lit much nicer than the rest of the place. 

Forget the hostess or the line, just walk right in the bar and grab a table, you'll probably have a much better experience than in the dining rooms. It's like a totally different restaurant. I try to come here at least once a month.
author: Jason G.

description:
This place is definitely one of my favorite steak places! 
The food here is delicious! I love how they drench foods in butter! It is so good!! The last time I came here, they had a "summer classic" special menu in which you get a full three course meal for only $39.95!! This is by-far the best deal ever! For the starter I got the Mixed Greens & Asparagus Salad. I was not a big-fan of it... my boyfriend had the Roasted Tomato & Crab Soup, but that tasted like pizza sauce... and last time I came here I had the Steak House Salad, which was really good. For the entree I got the Filet.  It came out on a hot plate and you could still hear and see the Filet sizzling in the butter. The rib eye here is also reallllly good! Everything is perfectly cooked and the steak melts in your mouth. Finally, for dessert  I got fresh berries with sweet cream (the cream was delicious!!) & raspberry sorbet in a cute chocolate cup.
Overall, the steak is great. The service is great. And the atmosphere is wonderful. I see a lot of people come here on special occasion like anniversaries, birthdays, etc because the restaurant is really nice and classy. My boyfriend and I drive an hour to San Francisco whenever we crave the buttery-sizzling yummy steak. =)
author: Lynn T.

description:
We invaded Ruth's Chris with a party of 15 for my birthday - 2 more than I had made the reservation for, but they handled adjusting the table for us with much grace though it was no fault of their own! 

Some of our group had been to Ruth's Chris several times in San Diego but most of us hadn't gone to one in a few years since we all live down on the peninsula. Thankfully, this trip reminded me why we used to go for so many special occasions! The food was fantastic and the service excellent and appropriate - we can be a bit silly, especially once the drinks start coming, and having wait staff who are both humorous and friendly, while keeping it classy, is a huge plus to us!

When making the reservation I was asked if there was an event being celebrated, and I did admit to it being my birthday dinner. When we arrived it seemed everyone on the staff knew which reservation we were and why we were there, and the table was decorated with cute happy-birthday-confetti.

I know I heard a lot of praise for the food from around the table but as far as what I ordered:

I tried their seared ahi tuna appetizer for the first time and it was exactly what I wanted - super nice quality tuna, just enough sear/texture on the edges and soft in the middle. I loved the sauce they serve it in, sort of a gingery, rice vinegary, tart-tangy thin sauce. For me it paired with the tuna really well without being your standard 'soy based dipping sauce'.

I always end up getting a filet, medium rare, and this time I had them add the blue cheese crust. It's like a layer of creamy and crunchy cheese on just the top of the steak, enough to get a little bit with each bite but not have it overwhelm the meat flavor. Perfectly cut filet, the edges had that hint of salty slight-char to them and tender inside. 

For sides I tried some sweet potato casserole and creamed spinach. The spinach is always excellent but I'd never gotten the sweet potato casserole before - personally I found it amazing, almost like a dessert, with a light fluffy potato texture instead of being thick. It's definitely sweet, so be aware if you don't like sweet tastes alongside your savory course. 

When it came time to order dessert they actually brought out a 'happy birthday' dessert plate with a piece of chocolate cheesecake (not too chocolatey, which can make it bitter - yay!), a small scoop of ice cream with berry sauce, and some berries in cream on the side. So good! I was even asked if I wanted something else instead since one of the staff overheard me talking about creme brulee. No worries, the birthday dessert was great!

This was also my first time bringing my own wine to a restaurant and RC handled it as if they do it every night - which they probably do. Very reasonable corkage and no fuss. 

Overall: I have nothing but praise for the entire Ruth's Chris staff - floor, front desk, kitchen, all of them - for being instrumental to an excellent night. The food was just right, the service fantastic, and we'll definitely be back... though maybe in smaller groups next time! :) End to end dinner and dessert took about 3 hours for our large group and it never felt 'slow', we just had a lot of people to organize/get ordered/served.  It's the kind of place that encourages taking your time, anyway. 

With RC I think a lot of it is what you make of it - be aware of the food and drink costs set your expectations accordingly. You don't have to be on a dine-to-impress date to enjoy this place, I've been on intimate dinners and fun group occasions both and they always handle it superbly. It's more expensive than [insert italian-chain-restaurant-here] but I have a hard time saying it's expensive for what it is.
author: Ama F.

description: I had a $100 gift certificate for Ruth's Chris, so my bf and I decided to come during Dine About Town for our second time. It's definitely the best time to come. We both ordered off the DAT menu. My bf upgraded to a ribeye with the bleu cheese crust. He seemed to enjoy his dish, but my filet was too salty. We also ordered mushrooms stuffed with crabmeat off their regular menu. The stuffing was good, but some of the mushrooms could have been cooked for longer. They were still a little raw. There are definitely better steakhouses out there. Ruth's Chris just doesn't have that WOW factor for me.
author: Sophia B.

description: Went there for Dine About Town last nite and we had to wait 30min over our reservation time + another 30minute for the food to arrive.there were not many choices at all for appetizer & dessert. Salad was very bitter, dessert was ok. Entrees are limited with petite filet, chicken, shrimp & fish. Petite filet was totally bland. my dinner partner luckily opted the $8 upgrade for ribeye which was really good or maybe the only thing that is good.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Delicious!  We decided to go here last minute after we got rejected for a table at HOPR.  The sides are all very good, especially the sweet potato casserole!  The creamed spinach is one of their specialties and deservingly so.  All of the meat comes out on a sizzling hot plate and stays pretty warm throughout the meal...so they mean it when they say "hot plate"!  I had to touch...learned my lesson!  I got the Ruth's classic which is the prix fixe menue...well worth it and you can upgrade to other sides or desserts for a little more.  The bread pudding was also one of the best I've ever had.  

The service and ambiance were welcoming...I can't wait to go back!
author: Vaishali S.

description:
I LOVE Ruth Chris!  This continues to be my favorite steakhouse out of all the ones in the city and the reviewers are correct - this continues to be my favorite steakhouse probably because everything is covered in butter!

We were here for a birthday dinner and p/s they are having a 3 course set dinner at either $39.95 or $49.95.  Better hurry!  You only have today and tomorrow left before the special goes away!

Ribeye Steak!  Creamed Spinach!  Sauteed Mushrooms!  Filet Mignon!  Perfect Mashed Potatoes!  (and don't forget the delicious Wines!  YUM!
author: Elaine L.

description: What more can you expect from a steakhouse? Great steaks great wine dim lights and dark wood. One of the best cuts of bone-in rib eyes i have had in a while that was a plus, I asked for a piece with a lot of deckle and that is what I received! Only complaint I have is that our side of mushrooms coast $10 and there were only 10 mushrooms on the plate. Other than that it was a great meal.
author: Jay M.

description:
I came to Ruth's Chris years ago and thought it was fantastic.  I had the filet mignon and lobster.  I remember it being delicious and wanting to come back again.  

I finally returned with my girlfriends on a Friday night for Dine About Town.  We had 9pm reservations and were not seated until about 30 minutes later.   We had to wait in the bar area where there was a ton of customers packed in there like sardines.   It was definitely not a relaxing experience.  The drinks were okay, but they cost upwards of $15/drink.   Due to the wait, a server came around with a platter of garlic shrimp which was nice...but at 9:30 at night, a piece of shrimp isn't going to quell my appetite or make me forget that our reservation was actually 30 minutes ago.  

We chose the $34.95 fixed menu.  I got the salad, petite filet mignon, mashed potatoes, and key lime pie.   My friends ordered the filet too, but got creamed spinach and bread pudding.  We also shared a bottle of red that we brought and they had a corking fee of $15.  

The salad was unimpressive.   Filet was really good...you can tell it was cooked in butter.  Hey, I love butter.  It's probably pretty close to my love for bacon.  I asked for it medium and it was perfectly cooked.  Sides were very disappointing.  Mashed potatoes tasted like that boxed Potato Buds stuff and the creamed spinach had a weird "dirty" flavor?  Dessert was okay.  I was told the bread pudding wasn't very good either.  Luckily, we got our own desserts.  I saw on some reviews that other Dine About Town diners were forced to share desserts.  booooo.

I probably would not come again unless someone else was paying.  haha.  I think that is why I liked it the first time.   Our boss had taken us there for dinner and I didn't even have to look at the bill.  :)  I rather go to other steakhouses over Ruth's Chris.  I really want to try Harris' in SF...hopefully that won't disappoint!!!
author: Vivian W.

description:
Probably one of the best Dine About Town experiences I've ever had!  

Went here with a party of 4 on a Friday night, but had no trouble getting seated since we booked reservations on Opentable.  It was very nice that they seated half of our party though some of us were running late, it gave the early birds a chance to order some drinks and peruse the menu while waiting for the latecomers...so many restaurants don't do that anymore and force people to wait until everyone gets there.  The ambiance was nice, not too formal but plush and comfortable.

Both the bread and the salad to start were very good, but who am I kidding, it's all about the STEAK.  3/4 of us ordered the 12-oz ribeye (to get the most steak for the $$) and it was both huge and tasty.  I still preferred the 8-oz filet that I ordered, it was much tastier though it wasn't as fatty (all the butter they slathered on provided enough of the fat anyway).  It actually seemed much larger than an 8-oz, so it was still a killer deal.  Probably one of the best steaks I've had in the bay area.  

The DAT menu included the side dishes so I got the creamed spinach and the hubby got mashed potatoes, we had enough to share both.   Oh, and did I mention they let you get a lobster tail for an additional $17?   I didn't indulge but thought that seemed like a good deal if you're into lobster.  For dessert, I had the bread pudding which was awesome, hubby ordered the key lime pie (which I'm not really into) but he liked it too.  I pretty much liked everything they served me from start to finish (unlike Alexander's where we spent way more $$$ and the dessert was crap).  The portions for pretty much everything was very generous, so it seems like it would be a good deal even at regular prices (and a monster deal at $35).

I gotta say, for a foursome ordering $35 dinners and bringing their own wine for $15 corkage (hey, it's dining out in recession season) they treated us very well and the service was excellent.  The server didn't even bat an eyelash when we asked him to open not one but 2 bottles of wine that we brought with us.  He was also just very friendly the whole time and we had no trouble finding him when we needed something, definitely deserved a good tip.

For DAT, I don't think there are any values better than this one.  Most restaurants totally skimp on both their food and service during DAT, which just violates the whole purpose of trying to let new people get to know your restaurant.  I usually don't like chain restaurants, but Ruth's Chris has convinced me that this is a place worth coming back to (especially if someone else is paying).
author: Arlene M.

description: We have gone to this steakhouse for several years and have always enjoyed their steaks.  However, in the past couple of times, the quality appears to decrease.  don't get me wrong - it is still good but for the price I am not sure it is worth it.  The services is good but there are times they appeared to be really busy.  Besides the steaks, their mash potatoes are still wonderful.  Generally, we usually full so we have not tried their dessert.
author: Stephanie S.

description: I made reservations same day on open table.  Service was great.  They sat us on time.  The ice cream was free because it was my birthday.  Now the food, I got the steak and it was good after i ate half of it, the rest was was dry.  Having a great steak means, juicy and lots of flavor.  I give the steak a 7 out of 10.  If I'm going to pay this much for a steak, I rather go to Harris or Morton's.
author: Judy M.

description:
Nothing can compare. The way you order your steak is exactly how it comes out. Never a miss. Everything is top quality and exceptional.

It's worth the $$ but not all the time. Gorgeous fancy restaurant and well worth a dress-up night.

Just allow yourself some time to find parking. The area that it is located in has little to no parking... It's just hard to find parking.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
This is a very nice place to celebrate for personal events. 

I brought my whole family for my elder son's birthday.  We ordered ribeye and filet for all of us. Because my sons are still little (7 and 10), 
two set of dinner entree is good enough for us.  The size is OK. (11 Oz for the steak).  The salad is very good and the dessert is very delicious. 

We are happy to have this place to celebrate my son's birthday.  We may visit this place some other time.
author: Eric C.

description:
"Stop shooting at my bloody crab-cakes, you mental baboons! They are rather delicious and you are acting uncivilized!" Bullets ricocheted, sending glass and shrapnel flying through what must normally be a fairly nice atmosphere to celebrate steak. I had taken cover behind my table and didn't appreciate these chavvy oiks opening fire, recklessly endangering my meal. I was yelling at them over the sound of gunshots and screams to leave the food out of this scuffle. I mean, from what I tasted before they opened fire, the crab-cakes were a delightful appetizer. A bullet hit the Hunnicutt bottle of cabernet sauvignon and a splash of wine hit my lips in the resulting explosion of glass. A nice hint of cinnamon and black cherry implied a great collaboration with the accompanying T-Bone. I sat there behind cover: smacking my lips, trying to embrace the taste of the wine, reloading my service revolver, wondering how I ended up in this pickle. 

Cut to an hour ago:  There I was, stepping into the night air disguised as a grizzled mountain man, trailing two suspects to find a lead in my case (please see the Thirsty Bear case file). Just another puzzle piece in the Case of the Missing Papaya Diamond, I suppose, and I followed at a safe distance. On the few occasions they turned around to see if they were being followed, I would simply just pretend to be a local whistling mountain man nonchalantly window shopping for... elegant brassieres apparently. Everyone bloody dares underestimate my disguise skillset. The fake beard was getting itchy a few blocks out, though, so I did the logical thing and changed appearances. The industrial strength glue made it awkwardly challenging: the final tug of the fake beard made this gentleman wince. A manly, muffled wince, mind you. This isn't amateur hour. Through my teary eyes I saw the two chaps sneak into Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. Steak? I was highly motivated all of a sudden to follow this stake-out through to the end. Or should I say, steak-out.  See what I did there? Award winning British humour. 

Somehow in the course of ordering food and chatting with my waiter Jose, the two suspects realized I was the world famous Detective Honeybutter and that they were about to become BFFs with justice. They weren't too keen on this idea, apparently, because they flipped their table over and opened fire. My finely-tuned, genetically hard-coded, honorably mentioned survival instincts kicked in after about the seventh gunshot and second slug to the shoulder (I was in the middle of trying a crab-cake, you see). So here I was, demanding that they leave my food alone and signaling to Jose that I needed a refill on my water.

Every stray bullet from the thugs would allow pieces of my meal to fly through the air and make their journey to the intended participant: moi. I used this to my advantage by recommending to them that they shoot at various corners of my table. If I wanted to try the lyonnaise potatoes on the left on the table, for example, I would insult their mothers and say I'm hiding out to the left. The resulting shot would then guarantee a tasting of these delicious little reminders that potatoes deserve medals for being so customizable. Thin crunchiness enveloped a soft potato center. Jose, much to my satisfaction, reluctantly continued to bring out dishes, dodging bullets along the way. "Sir, you are bleeding" I recalled him saying. I also recall tasting the seared tuna and promising myself I would go back to get the actual dish. By the time the T-Bone showed up on my plate I was fairly annoyed with all of this horsing around with the gunshots and me bleeding and whatnot. Tip: get the T-Bone medium rare and take your sweet time enjoying it. The ongoing gunfight was drowned out as I chewed an excellent cut of steak; a kind of steak that makes you want to salute a flag, empower you to find your childhood bully on Facebook and call his kids ugly, a kind of steak where nothing else matters. Only the bone was left and, since I wanted to enjoy my chocolate cake in silence, decided to take care of the situation at hand. Gripping the bone in my fist with the sharp end protruding through my fingers like a talon, I leapt over the table and (CENSORED DUE TO SLAPSTICK VIOLENCE) and that's why you let me eat in peace.

In hindsight, the chief will have a fit when he finds out that we have two less suspects, and, more importantly, that I didn't recommend the Derby Peach Tea Cocktail sooner.
author: Brevin P.

description: I came here three times with my ex and considering im not a huge steak fan, this place was pretty good.  I remember the first time we went my filet was a bit too raw, but the waitress came over and offered to fix it without me really having to say anything.  The steak being raw was really the only "negative" experience I had there because the servers were all very attentive and the food was really good.  The two items on the menu that stood out for me were the mashed potatoes and the chocolate lava cake!  And now that I think about it, the ceasar salad was really good too.  If it weren't so expensive I would totally go there again, but I dont go to places like that on a regular basis.
author: Steph L.

description: I'll give four stars because of the mess our server spilled wine twice while pouring in glass.   Other than that we had an amazing dinner.  We had crab cakes for appetizer complimented with Riesling.  And our main entrees were cowboy ribeye and petite filet mignon with shrimps seasoned and cooked perfectly, with creamed spinach and garlic mashed  as sides. Had a bottle of Malbec.  Ended our meal with creme brulee.  Service was excellent.  We were very happy and satisfied.
author: Angel S.

description: Love this place great customer service very good.. Foods was awesome!!
author: John D.

description:
Came here on the first day of DAT 2010 but forget that! They had a $39.95 Fall/Winter 3-course meal that gave me more options.

Course 1: Louisiana Seafood Gumbo | Steakhouse Salad | Caesar Salad | Harvest Salad
Course 2: 6 oz petite filet w/ 3 shrimps | Stuffed Chicken | Braised Short Ribs | Chef's Fresh Salmon Selection
- Sides: Baked Corn Pudding | Creamed Spinach | Mashed Potatoes | Sauteed Mushrooms | Green Beans with Roasted Garlic
Course 3: Dessert duo pairing with Carrot Cake & Chocolate Mousse 

I had the petit filet w/ shrimp, mashed potatoes, and unlike my friends who ordered from the DAT menu, I was able to upgrade by dessert to the "Chocolate Explosion" (chocolate molten lava cake topped with vanilla ice cream) for $3. Everything was delicious, as usual. The steak was piping hot when it came out, still sizzling in butter and cooked to perfection as "medium." It was so good, I felt literally felt like my arteries were clogging up as I was eating my steak and sauteed mushrooms. Oh and when the "Chocolate Explosion" came out? My fiance was ALL over it. When he laid eyes on my dessert, he pushed his carrot cake / chocolate mousse (which BTW wasn't very impressive) out of the way with his fork and didn't even look back at it. He ate more of my dessert than I did!

This year, the DAT menu ($34.95) didn't have ribeye as an option BUT you can upgrade to a 16 oz ribeye for $8. For steak option, they had the 8 oz petit filet. Also for entrees, stuffed chicken, BBQ shrimp, fish special. For sides, creamed spinach or mashed potatoes, and for dessert, only duo of carrot cake / chocolate mousse.

I've been to Ruths' Chris several times already and I've never been disappointed with their steak. When soaked in butter, it's always good! If you're a chocolate fan, you must get the Chocolate Explosion!
author: Tina T.

description: I've been here many times since ive lived in SF, and it never disappoints, I don't have enough space for all this restaurants praises. Everything is good here! And always ask about the specials.
author: Timothy H.

description:
BF took me here last year for my birthday. Now if you read my reviews, I am a simple person who likes kind of lower priced value restaurants but I am no stranger to fine dining..and Ruth Chris wasn't. But I'll name the good first.

We got a nice booth, because I called ahead and said I have a service dog so we need a booth, and they were very accommodating. Table was ready at the reserved time.

Very, very nice server, who "hovered" just enough.

Lovely wine selection.

Salads were innovative and delicious.

The chocolate cake for dessert was wonderful although there was no candle or acknowledgement of it being a birthday. Hmmph.

Now the rest of it.

I was asked if I wanted plain or bubbly water. I opted for bubbly and got a huge, unexpected and very expensive bottle of Pellegrino.

Potatoes "Lyonnaise" were greasy, soggy fries. The fries at Belly Burger are so much tastier.

The STEAK sucked!  I asked for medium rare and BF asked for medium well. Not like we haven't placed steak orders before, but there was a looong discussion with the server about these choices.

Why even bother?? We both had to send our steaks back. BF finally asked for a whole new steak because his was so overcooked and tough it was inedible while my steak was almost raw. The funny thing was, neither of us wanted to say anything because we just wanted to relax and have a nice time but the center of my steak was still cold and I was like "for this kind of money, I am saying something" and only then did he say "well yeah, I can barely eat this it's so overcooked".

Being a steak house and all you would think there would be an emphasis on excellent steak. But no. Well the steak was a beautiful piece of meat but by the time the chef finished with it, it had died twice.
We finally did get our steaks the way we wanted them but really they should have been served that way the first time.

We loved the ambiance and certain aspects of their menu but overall it was not a wonderful experience. You want a great steak the first time you order it at an expensive steakhouse and they just did not deliver that.

Actually as it comes back to me, this is the chronological order of the steak saga.

A. 2 steaks too raw to eat.
B. Send them back
C.Got one edible one, mine, and one inedible one, his.
D. He sends his steak back a second time
E. The cook brings out a whole new steak for him which was, blessedly, cooked properly this time.

Much saga for a little steak.

I also wonder about all of the good reviews on Yelp because if you go to a number of other San Francisco restaurant review sites, you'll see many reviews with the same complaints about badly cooked steak.
author: Sharon J.

description: We came here form our bday celebration. We all ordered the set menu and I had the watermelon salad, rib eye, and creamed spinach.  I finished everything other than the steak bc it was super big. The steak was cooked just like how I ordered it. Very juicy n delicious!
author: Helen L.

description: During "Dine About Town" friends & I went for the pre fixe dinner menu and it was very very good. For $35 total I had a petite filet (cooked to perfection) w/the usual creamed spinach/mashed potogsalso included dessert and  oh came with a salad. All in all it was a fabulous time.  I didn't know what I was missing!
author: Googie G.

description:
So upset I posted my first yelp review ever.

I've been to this location several times in the past with my boyfriend, and we have usually had okay service. Every time, we had a reservation for the two of us, but still had to wait 10-15 minutes at the bar before being seated. We enjoy the food though, and thus decided to come back with a group of our friends on a Saturday night before going out on Polk. 

We had a reservation for 10 people at 8:15, and were then told to wait at the bar for 15 minutes. The bartenders were nice enough and served us our drinks quickly, but after 15 minutes, we were told to wait an additional 30 minutes. Our group of 10 was starving at this point, and after having waited all afternoon for our buttery steak dinner (which we had talked up to our friends), we were all understandably upset. Especially so since the staff kept stringing us along, and wasn't very sympathetic or helpful about the timeline. After over an hour, they still didn't know when it would be possible to seat us and then proceeded to kick us out. Guess reservations don't mean anything anymore. Ruth's Chris lost over $1k in revenue that night from our table, and countless dollars from our repeat business or any of our friends'. There are plenty of other steakhouses in the city with better service. Don't go here if you have a large party, unless you're prepared to wait with a reservation. 

Luckily, we managed to salvage our night at Mayes, which kept their kitchen open for us. Yay for Santacon!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: OH my god!! Took my bf there on Sat and I  must say we eat really well, I had the lamp chops and he had the steak. The service and food is great! And if you like key lime pie, it's for 2 people to share. We will definatley be coming back more often.
author: Adrienne L.

description:
I've always heard how great (and expensive)  Ruth's Chris was, and always wanted to check it out.  

I'm sure glad that I finally got that chance.  You just can't explain to another how great their steaks really are.  I mean really great, makes me want to use a bunch of swear words on yelp.  I ordered the lamb chops, which tasted soooo good.  He ordered the T-bone, which was absolutely amazing as well...  On the side, we tried to stay some what healthy and ordered sauteed spinach and sauteed mushrooms.  Seared Ahi appetizer was just okay.  

I'd highly recommend this place for a really special occassions, or after a tax return, inheritance, lottery jackpot.  We paid $220 for 2 entrees, 2 sides and a bottle of the cheapest wine.
author: Marisa N.

description:
I Love Dine About Town! 

I made reservations to dine here with my boyfriend and his family. There were a total of 8 adults and 1 baby. Myself and my boyfriend's sister arrived 30 mins early, so we headed into the bar. 

We sat down at the end of the bar and watched what we could have of the Lakers vs. Magic game. I ordered an iced tea while she had a Fresh Berry Martini. I tasted her martini and it was DELICIOUS! 

Soon, our party arrived and we were seated promptly. We were giving regular menus and had to ask for the Dine About Town Menu. (I didn't like how it was a "secret" and not offered to each party) They seemed a little surprised/annoyed that we asked for the Dine About Town menu. 

I ordered the Salad, 12 oz. Rib-eye, Mashed Potatoes, and Key Lime Pie. 

The salad was a nice fresh mixed green salad with vinaigrette dressing. 

Our dinner came out on 500 degree sizzling plates with butter melted over the steak. Some of our orders were mixed up; they gave some people the wrong order. The mashed potatoes were perfect!(temperature, texture, and flavor) My boyfriend ordered creamed spinach and it was OK. (I'm biased as I don't prefer creamed spinach) 

After dinner, we ordered some tea and coffee. It took a while for that to be served. I think that they were giving us time to digest what we just had and wanted to bring out each dessert at the same time. 

I ordered a Pomegranate Oolong tea that was delicious! My boyfriend, a Green/Black kiwi strawberry tea. Both were great! 

Dessert was pretty and tasted good! I was so full from dinner though, I wasn't able to finish it. I tasted the bread pudding that my boyfriend ordered. It was so sweet; tasted really good! 

I had a great time!
author: J-nine I.

description:
Just returned from a special birthday hosted for 13, 9 adults & 4 children. Servers Clark and Lena served 13 perfectly prepared memorable dinners. With our large group we ordered every type of steak and one 2 1/2 lbs. lobster tail each one cooked to each of our requests. 
Each side is served in its separate dish, ideal for our large group to share.
The salads were fresh flavorful & a fairly large portion. 
The bread, very fresh, soft & a welcome change from traditional  SF sour dough.
The servers took the children orders soon after being seated which allowed all ages to enjoy our 2 hour party. 
Speaking of party, upon making the reservation were told this was a special event, so our table had the table covered 
with birthday confetti, and our birthday tech
guest an impressive special dessert.
For the excellent meal and service received by all ages the total bill including gratuity was very justifiable!
author: Nick D.

description:
After a legendary birthday dinner for my pops two years ago, my family and I came back here for my mother's birthday in hopes of replicating the experience. The evening, sadly, did NOT live up to expectations. 

We arrived a bit before our 6 PM reservation and their tiny entryway and seating area are not conducive to waiting. Once we were seated, we found ourselves in a dimly lit room which could be romantic to some or just difficult to see for others. Our server, a nice young man, was very pleasant but did not seem to add much value in our food and drink selection. He also got distracted easily - he would ask what drinks we wanted, and if someone asked him a side question, he would go off to find the answer and leave half the table without drinks. He also asked us if we'd been there before (which we had) and then told us how to order. Um, we just told you we'd been here.

We all opted for the current special: a $49/person for starter (steak salad, ceasar salad or gumbo), appetizer (mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, sauteed mushrooms, and a couple others), entree (choice of 11 oz filet, 16 oz sirloin, or two others), and dessert. There is also a $39 special which has smaller portions of the filets, the chicken, and a couple other choices.

Three of us went for the 11 oz. filet and one person went for the 16 oz. sirloin, and together we split sauteed mushrooms, mashed potatoes, two orders of creamed spinach, and a side of shoestring potatoes. FYI the side appetizers in the special are NOT the same size as regular sides...but still more than enough to eat. 

The bread was soft and warm and tasted delicious. Like a white bread roll with a slight twist to it. The salad was really cheesy with heavy dressing. Don't get me wrong. It was good. But I felt really guilty afterward. There are four crucial components to a salad: lettuce, croutons, dressing, and assorted add-ons. Lettuce was crisp, croutons flavorful, dressing a tad heavy, and the cherry tomatoes and cheese tasted great. 

The meat was juicy, but lacked any kind of substantial wow factor. The sauteed mushrooms were fabulous, but the creamed spinach and potatoes just tasted like cream was dumped into it. The shoestring potatoes were cold and over peppered.

The wine my pops and I drank was uninspired, and really not a good reflection on the wine list. He had the house merlot, I had a pinot and both just were lame. No flavor, and tasted cheap. 

At the end, Mom and SIs opted to upgrade their desserts from the combo chocolate mousse and berry/pudding medley to the chocolate explosion and creme brulee, respectively, for $3 each. The desserts were all good...but by then I was stuffed!

The hostess and staff also seemed very uninterested in serving us or making our experience better. For the prices here, we expected a *little* ass kissing and got nothing.

I would come back here but it will probably be awhile...
author: Aaron F.

description:
We had reservations & had to wait a few minutes, but it was no big deal because the two of us were able to be seated in a nice, cozy booth! We went for Dine About Town, but had to ask for the DAT menu. 

I had my fillet mignon cooked medium-rare with au poivre sauce on the side. It arrived more rare than I expected, but shiet, I'm not going to act like I'm a steak expert. All I know is that it was damn good! There was lots of melted butter, but not so much that the steak was swimming in it. The sauce is really flavorful (of course), but it was a little thick for my preferences. My boyfriend ordered both the au poivre sauce & the bleu cheese crust (because he is an expert in gluttony) & his steak was, to my horror, even better than mine. Nonetheless, the meat was super tender & omg, nom nom nom. It was fantastic! I think we liked this place even better than Harris'...

I would LOVE to come back!
author: Ruby H.

description:
My husband took me here for my birthday, he was encouraged by his co-worker.

The best steakhouse ever. It is expensive but every bite, every slice, every piece of the steak is ssssoooo good. Expensive because I'm paying for a very good steak. Way, way, way better than house of prime rib.
author: Dunnet G.

description:
Ate here a few weeks ago for the 4th time. I really enjoyed it. 
Dinner and service were excellent. I had arranged in advance for custom menus for a birthday. They were printed & waiting on our table. 
I just wish they would bring the twice baked potato instead of regular baked potato. Also the sautéd mushrooms were not as good as in the past. 
But overall still excellent
author: Julie P.

description: Awesome tasting. Had the porterhouse for two (Not all for myself!).  The plate was covered in butter and the steak was sizzling with fat.  Felt like I was going to have a heart attack when I was finished eating.  Good services, clean restaurant, parking isn't easy (there is valet parking). B/B+
author: Eric Y.

description:
2009 Dine About Town

Appetizer: 
* Salad - Nothing special, basic mixed greens and vinaigrette

Entree: 
* Petite Filet - medium rare, flavorful, tender, juicy, just enough butter to add the little touch of grease to make you go "mmmmmhhhh"

Dessert: 
* Bread Pudding - okay/not that great

Drinks: 
* Orange Mojito was pretty good and their wine selection is decent and not too overwhelming.

Got to catch up with my fellow foodie over good food, great service, nice atmosphere, and parking was thankfully NOT a nightmare!
author: Linda C.

description:
I FUX WITH RUTH CHRIS !! 
i loved my rib eye it was extremely on point ..
my girlfriend had the filet ...its was aiite 
 but althogether a phenominal meal!
and it was only 110 bucks! very reasonable !
server was jesse : very nice however got distracted by an other table and didnt really  serve well after that ! i still gave him 17 bux tho n i tipped the rest to the Busboy who was very good and helped us wen jesse was cupcaking with the other tables !
author: Alex G.

description:
Date:  December 26, 2008

Occasion: Boyfriend's Birthday Dinner @ 7:45 PM

Decor:   Classy. Dark wood. 

Ambiance: Casual Fine Dining

Social Scene:  Young casually dressed people at the bar but I noticed they only had drinks.
More mature crowd, couples on a date, families at the main dining.

Service:  Efficient and friendly. Knowledgeable staff.


Salud!:  
Citrus Ginger Refresher and Diet Coke at the Bar
Starlite Zinfandel during dinner which was recommended by server. Very nice glass of red.

Taste:
Prawn Cocktail
BF:Cowboy Ribeye Steak 
Me:  Ribeye
Sauce Au Poivre
Spinach Au Gratin
Mashed Potatoes

Sweets:  Lava Cake compliment of the house for BF's bday

Tab:  $187.54 (including tax and tip)+ 19.00 (at the bar)= $206.54 
             

Overall Dining Experience:
a) The prawns were gigantic.  Cocktail sauce had a good kick which complimented the prawns.
b)  Sides of Spinach Au Gratin and mashed potatoes tasted good but I had better such as the sides I had at Striphouse Steakhouse in New York.
c) The steaks were Ruth's Chris' Piece De Resistance!  The outside crusts were perfect while the inside was very tender. There was consistency of texture and flavors in every bite.   They were perfectly cooked medium rare. 
d)  I ordered the Sauce Au Poivre but with superb piece of meat you don't need to mask the flavors with sauce.
e)  What a nice dining experience!!!!  Ruth's Chris is expensive and will be on our "Special Occasions Dining List."  It was worth every dollar we spent.

Skip: The Ginger Citrus drink!!I had 2 sips and left it alone!  GROSS!

Boyfriend was happy and felt special on his birthday.  
HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABE!!!!!!!!!
author: Leah E.

description: Service can make or break a meal and I want to thank Jose at the bar tables, for making our experience here wonderful. we were not dressed up like everyone else, and still treated as valued patrons. the food was excellent as well. i had the tuna steak, very very good!
author: Dana S.

description:
This place is amazing!  I have found my NEW favorite Steak House!  The staff is amazing and absolutely thoughtful and polite.  You do find this type of service at any fine dinning BUT they always went the extra mile!  

The food is GREAT!  It is a steak house so I recommend the STEAK!  While they do put an emphasis on the cooking technique (broiled at 1800 degrees and served on 500 degree platters), I actually believe that it really does make the meat very tender and sweet!  It seems to melt in your mouth as you eat which is fantastic.  

HIGHLY Recommend going here with a few friends or small party!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Ruth's Chris is my favorite steak house. Whenever my dad (who lives San Diego) and I see each other, we try and hit up at least one steak house. So far, Ruth's still reigns supreme. Even though, it's pricey, it is absolutely worth every single penny from the delish food to the great service.

My last visit to RC was on Black Friday, (as if I wasn't already sick of eating from Thanksgiving). I didn't care as I was going to fast until my beloved RC dinner. Of course, my dad and I started with a nice glass of the Parducci, Pinot Noir, "Ruth's Chris Exclusive Blend." As we waited for our Lobster bisque soup, we munched on the warm and toasty bread.  
The bisque never disappoints me, with real chunks of lobster, and isn't too heavy nor salty. My petite filet was definitely sizzling upon arrival to the table, and every bite just melted in my mouth (as you can taste the buttery goodness). Of course, I savored every bite. We only ordered one side, the shoestring french fries, which was ginormous. We had to take the leftovers home (and BTW, it keeps pretty well). The creamed spinach, which we didn't order this time around, is an awesome side.
For dessert, we opted to share the creme brulee. I consider myself a creme brulee conneisseur, and this is one of my favorites. The brulee is perfect, and the creme is light and not dense. I like the variety of fruit, which was an excellent complement to a perfect brulee. 
Even after a few cups of the 'brave' coffee, I was still in a massive food coma. Good thing, I wore my stretchy pants!!

Yet another fabulous dining experience. Until next time, Ruth's!!
author: Gill C.

description:
Steak House is what this is, so when you come...order steak! :)

My friends and I came during Dine About Week. What a great deal! I got the filet mignon. Oh baby!! When I asked for medium rare it came out just as it should! Red, tender, juicy, melts in your mouth. I chewed slowly and made sure all the juices reached all my tastebuds. YUMMY!

For the sides I tasted the whipped mashed potatoes which were creamy and buttery. I also tasted the creamed spinach which was lightly creamy and really delicious. Usually I don't like creamed spinach because it just is gross, usually mushy and too creamy. But this stuff was really good, like and fresh.

The start was a mixed green salad which was fine. Nothing special. But we had to ask for extra dressing because they only put a dollop on. 

Dessert was a chocolate mini cake with a raspberry frosting and a creme de pot with fresh berries. I ate everything!

It was alot of food in small portions but all in all it was the perfect amount of everything! We were all stuffed! And service was excellent!!
author: Juju F.

description: Ribeye was great and dessert was delicious. A little dark in there but it's suppose to be romantic. Did i mention the butter!?!?
author: Nate B.

description:
I took my mom here for Mother's Day a couple of years back, and it was very good. The decor is nice and the service is great.

The special thing about this place is that the dishes come out like 24143231 degrees and the meat is seriously still cooking in front of you. We got the Filet Mignon and it was delicious. 

The one complaint I had is that the entrees don't come w/ sides. If I am paying $60+ an entree, I expect to have the sides covered with that price. And when we ordered sides, I wasn't even impressed by them. (We got mased potatoes and another side I cannot remember)

Overall, the place is good but I prefer house of prime rib across the street if I'm in the steak mood.
author: Stephen N.

description:
I took my beloved girlfirend here for her birthday. They made it very special for her...they had cute happy birthday confeitti on the table.

We had champaynre, and t-bone, cowboy ribeye (Get this), and a few sides with a free birthday carrot cake.

I dont understand why people say this place is expensive. its a bargain! Steaks are HUGE!!!! and damn good! why would you go out to a restaurant and pay $30 bucks for a 12oz steak and you can get what looked like 36oz sizzling on the table.

I dont eat alot of red meat but I was hunger to steak for a week after this place.

Cheers!!
author: Andy N.

description:
I absolutely love Ruth Chris.........

We come her often because its usually where my brother chooses to eat when we go on our monthly dinner with our dad. The steaks are so tender and juicy they always cook it just right I love how its cooked in butter it gives it just the right taste. Their garlic mashed potatoes are yummy as well... I forget what it was called but I got this like steak wrapped prawn thing and that was sooooo good. Their desserts are pretty good too the chocolate cake was a little bit too  chocolatey for me but the key lime pie was perfect!!!!
author: Nette A.

description:
Everything in here was SO EXFENSIVE (I use the fancier letter "f" coz "p" is too poor)--no wonder they don't publish their prices on their online menu (I was able to make my reservations online too, very USEFUL).  Thanks Luis and Bernadette for not being EXFLICIT with me about how this place is just too rich for my blood.  Once I opened their menu, beads of sweat literally started forming on my temples.  My hands started to get sweaty as I perused through their $40-$80 entrees that come "ala carte" (so the effin sides, which averaged $10 each, came separately).  The waitress asked us if we wanted some drinks.  Without revealing my faltering confidence, I exclaimed, "Give me the cheapest Cab you have"... very FUNNY.   They gave us warm loaves of french bread with tubs of SEXY whipped butter.  This butter is so good I wanted to eat it with everything.  I slopped on butter on my bread, on every bite of my sumptious medium-rare ribeye steak, before every sip of my wine and water, and before every syllable of my speech.  I would fuck this butter if I could.  And you know it's going to be hella good, Butter.
After we were all done with our meals, our gracious server told me that I get dessert on the house since it was my "Birthday" (which you can indicate in the online reservation)... very COOL.  She recommended the banana creme pie, Cindy and Bernz got cawfee, and Luis got the tawny.  The creme pie came with a candle, decked with perfectly caramelized, thinly sliced bananas, on top of this plate that was speckled with torched brown sugar.  It was DELICIOUS!  My party and I scarfed it down so fast that I forgot to invite my Butter to do a threeway with me and the Creme Pie.

(tips to squeeze every value to your meal here at Ruth's: 1) Ask for more bread and more butter; 2) coffee refills are free, so ask for more coffee; 3) jack a handful of matchbooks on the way out to stock up your bathroom at home; 4) Say you're from Oracle and tell them to put it on the company card)

Watch out for the eavesdropping Ewok.
author: Grace M.

description: My husband and i came here for a spontaneous night out. spent a lot for some decent steak. tried the one in sacramento and loved it but i wasn't so crazy about this one here though i still liked it. as for him, he'd say otherwise. he had the ribeye which i really liked and preferred over my filet. the cheesecake was ok and the potatoes au gratin was very cheesy which i liked. the steaks come out on a super hot plate, keeping the steak hot and sizzling in loads of butter. the smell of it is absolutely divine. ruth's chris is one of the best steaks i've ever had

author: RJ A.

description:
YUM YUM YUM! Just got back from going here for Dine About Town and had the filet mignon with au poive sauce. I'm not super picky about my meats but that might change now that i've had the tender, slighty crisp, perfectly cooked steak from this place. 

Its a pricey place so I probably won't be coming back until the next dine about town or if I have a handsome date that loves to foot the bill. hey don't judge, i'm a student! 

Besides the food it has a romantic ambiance. So romantic in fact that my friends and I got to watch a couple make out for 30min and feed each other steak at the booth behind us. yeah...you know you would stare too.
author: Minh-Chi T.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant for DAT. I think I'll make it an annual trip, since it's such a great deal. The steak comes on a sizzling platter oozing with butter. How can you not love butter?!

The bread is warm and delicious, the salad is nothing special, but the steak...ohhh the steak. Well seasoned, tender and tasty, soaked in butter....no complaints. This might be my favorite steak house! 

Also, the carrot cake is AMAZING. I don't have a crazy sweet tooth, but i was licking the plate after. The dessert also comes with a chocolate mousse cup, but that's forgettable.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I'm a bonafide cheap ass. It makes me all tingly when I go to Safeway and, upon check out, see that I saved more money with my Rewards card and coupons than I spent. 

That having been said, take advantage of the Dine About Town offer at Ruth's Chris while you still have time. You'll spend $31.95 on your three course meal (1. salad, 2a. choice of petite filet, petite ribeye, or chicken, 2b. choice of creamed spinach or mashed potatoes, and 3. choice of key lime pie or bread pudding) and you'll be saving about $30 per person than if you ordered everything a la carte. And the fact that they give you free refills on a $1.95 soda is just the cherry on top.

Oh, don't be too overwhelmed when you walk in and the clientele is all of the Asian persuasion. That's only because we're all very good at math and we know a good deal when we see one.
author: .elin f.

description:
I'd eaten here once before many years ago and remembered it being much better.  Perhaps it was because we went on a Thursday night (instead of a weekend day) but the service and food was pretty lousy and disappointing especially considering how much you are paying.

We had a reservation but they were behind schedule so we were delayed 10-15 minutes before we could sit down.  Our waiter seemed like he was new on the job, but not only new on this job, but a new waiter in general.  I've had better waiter service at Denny's!  

I love bisque soup, and have had much better lobster bisque soup from a cafeteria across from work.  This bisque was only luke warm and had a bitter strange after taste.

We ordered onion rings (I think they called them tempura rings and they were plain cold when they got to the table.

I was really disappointed as I'd had high thoughts of this place before both on quality of food and service. I was actually quite appalled and in disbelief and probably won't bother going here ever again.
author: DR M.

description:
If you're coming here for Dine About Town, good for you! It's totally worth it! Without Dine About Town, this place is really $$$. 

The petite filet (8oz) is so incredibly tender its insane. Order it medium rare! There's like a tablespoon of delicious butter melted over the thick tender steak. The ribeye (12oz) is not as tender, but oh the flavor! Butter, again, melted over the juicy steak. The dessert here is also surprisingly good. Key Lime pie was good, as was the bread pudding. Overall, A+++. I look back at the pics of the steak, and want to eat it again. I can't wait until the next DAT. ohhh droool...
author: Carol L.

description:
Riiight...so I went back to Ruth's yesterday for DAT with my friend Vikram M...here's my take:
 
Apps: 
Salad..seriously? A salad. I'll implement my usual 'F*ck rabbit food' response for this one. 
  
Entree: 
Rib Eye with Blue Cheese crust. The Blue Cheese crust was heaven, if they had given me a plate of that instead I would have happily eaten it, unfortunately they had to add meat to it. That's right, you heard me. The cut of meat, if you can call it that, they gave me was so fatty that I actually started a pile of fat collections on a separate plate. Very..VERY disappointing and, frankly, absolutely unacceptable for a steakhouse. 
 
Sides: 
Mashed potatoes - ok, but who goes wrong with mashed potatoes? 
Creamed Spinach - Gross. Way too creamy and bland.
Shoe string fries - All string, no fry. I think the thin cut of the fries were meant to accomplish a crunchy fry, instead they were soggy and oily. I never thought I'd see the day where I actually ate oil but somehow Ruth's managed to make that possible. 
 
Dessert:
Bread Pudding - At least they ended on a high note. The bread pudding was amazing, and that's coming from someone who's not even that big a fan of bread pudding. This is one of those desserts that's so good that the guilt sets in while you're eating it. You know..the whole 'This so good, it must be really unhealthy' thought. But it's worth it. 
 
Overall I'd say I was pretty disappointed with this place. The service was excellent, though we did have to wait for our table initially and the hostess didn't ask to take my coat. So..let me rephrase, the hostess kind of sucked but our waiter was excellent. 

As for food, I hope you get a better cut than I did. If you go, I would order the Lyonnaise fries, the blue cheese crust, and the bread pudding. Still, overall, this place has definitely dropped ranks in my book.
author: Shreya C.

description: Went for lobster ...told only 2 lift and I took the 2.8 lb.   It was mushy....claw meat was mushy like mashed potato ... asked for all in the shell and the real stuff lobster connoisseur like was scooped out but parsley flakes on the tail meat ...makes one wonder.... Service people were nice but not together and place was only 1/4 full.  .. As I do corporate dinners always go first alone to check out a location. and am glad I did.  If you order lobster be sure to see it alive first before cooked... Have my questions but didn't want to battle. !
author: warren s.

description:
Let me start off by saying that all the old Asian Oracle employees should bring their hot *escorts* to dinner here.  it just adds depth to the saying *HO GOTTA EAT!*
