Given this is San Francisco, and competition is tough, it isn't surprising that there are better places than Ruth's Chris. That being said, it holds its own, and makes for a memorable meal.
author: Boris C.

description:
BOMB SHIZZ.

Went January 2nd, I got to say that I enjoyed my rib eye medium rare with just a sliver of butter.  I wish I had the opportunity to try other sides than the mash and crisps, but it was all good.

Compared to Alexander's in Cupertino, I'd rate Ruth's Chris just a bit lower, because of the smaller menu selection.

Compared to House of Prime Rib down the street, I'd go to HOPR, because of that damn metal meat cart.  That shizz is genius!
author: Xian Pao T.

description: You'd really have to be a serious food critic if you do not appreciate the hot plate steak from Ruth's Chris.  This is one of those restaurants that will always cook your steak the way you like it to say the least.  the wine list has an excellent selection, and the service is just how great restaurants service should be, during every visit, in every location from SF, Sac to LA.
author: Brian J.

description: Ruth's Chris signature sizzle set itself apart from the stuffy, traditional steakhouses.  When I walked in, the sound and whiff of a mouthwatering steak sizzling seductively in butter woke me up and left my tummy with great anticipation.  For a small appetite, stick with the filet.  I recommend the ribeye or porterhouse for carnivores. I've almost found the "perfect steak" broiled in butter, just the way I like it.
author: Jenny L.

description: We were seated WAY too close to the 2 tables on either side of us.  The service was great but my medium well steak was completely over done.  The garlic mashed potatoes were delicious though and my mojito wasn't bad either.
author: Emi N.

description: I recently dined at Ruth Chris' Steak house for a friend's birthday. The service was OKAY. The food was pretty good. I'm not a huge lobster lover because my previous lobster experiences were dry and dull, but decided to try Ruth's lobster since its a nice restaurant. It was the best lobster I've ever had. I sampled my friend's steak and lamb. The steak was very good, the lamb was good if you dont mind that slight taste. The food was good, the price is a little steep, but I think it was worth it. One thing I will remember, when you first take your seats, they will ask if you would prefer still or sparkling water, choose regular tap water. we had a party of 8 and went through 3 bottles of still water for a total of $30. the service could have been better seeing we were at a "classy" restaurant.
author: Serena L.

description:
great steak that hits the spot. they have a signature touch of putting butter on the top and letting it melt all over the savory piece of meat. their sides are okay but the main event is the steak.

service is mediocre and it is very pricey. you won't feel like you got what you paid for, but if you've never tried it before, you might want to stop in just to see what the hype is all about.
author: Charmaine L.

description: The food was great and the service was awesome. Thanks Maureen for the best and attentive service. You were spot on for everything being very attentive to my dietary restrictive concerns.
author: Marck N.

description:
4.5
i got the steak and shrimp combo meal. it started off with gumbo which was a little better than cambells canned gumbo. the steak was cooked to near perfection and the shrimp was above average. Small portions though. the sides were mostly average. the one exception were the mushrooms, which were very juicy and tasty. the string beans, mash potatoes, scalloped cheesy potatoes, and creamy spinach were average at best. The desert consisted of carrot cake and a "chocolate shelled cupcake with chocolate pudding" (dont know the proper name) that was decent. I would recommend this place to others who are looking for a good steak. the price is a little high but the atmosphere and service were excellent.

bottomline: highly recommend trying this place at least once especially during dine on the town promotion to save on money. Kinda pricey but a new favorite place to go for special occasions. good date place although parking may be a hassle.
author: Robert Y.

description:
After the reservations were made, I scoured yelp for ideas and inspiration on what to order.  I got the gist from those 300+ reviews that what I would be consuming would be 
1. delicious 
and
2. half butter  
I wasn't afraid--I like butter. and steak.  I was armed with my $100 gift card and new knowledge and ready.

Getting There:
Come night of (Thursday night, 10:00pm res),we arrived 30 minutes early, found easy street parking right in front of the restaurant and were seated immediately.  Our server, Chris, was super charming and really excited about his steak.  After his schpeal on their million degree ovens and molten hot plates (or something like that), he mentioned a special of hash browns (no thanks...I reserve those for McDonald's or Denny's), opened up the wine bottle we brought in and let us decide on what to order.  


Food:
We started out with the BBQ shrimp and caesar salad, then I ordered the Filet medium rare and my fiance ordered his cowboy rib-eye oscar style and medium rare. We also ordered the creamed spinach au gratin. 

The shrimp was pretty good.  Next time I'll try the crabtini or the crab stuffed mushrooms. The sauce was good but didn't knock my socks off. I will say that the shrimp was cooked perfectly, not rubbery at all.

My Fiance's rib-eye was huge.  The sides were falling off the plate and it was topped with three asparagus spears, a crab cake and bernaise sauce.  The steak by itself was basically perfect. So tender and yummy.  The sauce and crab cake added another dimension.  The crab cake itself was delicious, mostly crab, not a lot of filler. His was cooked a tad more to the rare side, but it was only bleeding, not mooing, so it was all good.  My favorite part was this sexy seared crust that covered the entire outer part of his steak.

The star of the evening was my filet (sorry, fiance) which made love to me the whole time I was eating it.  No feakin' joke. With the first cut into the crust that revealed the yummy, buttery perfect medium rare-ness of it all to the moment I put it in my mouth (ha), my eyes were rolling into the back of my head and I was enamored. Perfection.  The thing is huge and I probably could have gone for the petit filet, but that would have meant no succulent left overs to devour the next day.

One note: I could taste the butter in the air at this place, but my filet didn't come swimming in a pool of it, neither did Fiance's rib-eye.  It was there, but wasn't drowning the meat.  I don't know...maybe the chef decided to spare our cardiac health, or maybe these two cuts don't come with as much butter as others do...hmm...

The spinach was yummy.  You can au gratin anything and have yummy results: potatoes, corn, tater tots...but I digress... it was a good side.

See...we came here with a plan, which was to eat steak and have dessert (well, that was my plan), so that's why we didn't order any potato dishes.  For dessert I had the creme brulee with a double espresso and Fiance had the cheesecake with a coffee.  

The creme brulee was like a small pot of creamy heaven with a granulated sugar crust.  The crust didn't have that fun "snap" when you break into it, but it lay atop the most delicious vanilla bean creme that I'd ever tasted.  Sooo worth all the calories. Do it.

Fiance's Cheese cake was the size of...of... it was huge.  We could have shared, but I don't like to share.  I like to steal bites of other people's desserts while devouring my own.  it was also delicious. I loved the sour cream sauce on top and the crust was perfect!

$$$$:
Everything came out to about $180 without tip.  We had that $100 gift card which made the evening pretty affordable, but the food is so damn plentiful and good that I know we'll be back here without one.  You truly get what you pay for folks.
author: Dima A.

description:
I have been to Ruth's Chris Steak House's in New Orleans, Pittsburgh, PA, Sacramento, CA, Roseville, CA, Walnut Creek, CA, Indianapolis, IN, Minneapolis, MN, Atlanta, GA, Orlando, FL, Nashville, TN, Dallas, TX, and Chicago, IL. Last night we took my in-laws from England to the Ruth's Chris in San Francisco thinking it would be the pinnacle to their fantastic time in California. Unfortunately, the service was average and 2 out of the 5 steaks were not cooked as ordered. The waiter was not very attentive, and they forgot to mention the special ocassion "bon voyage" that I specifically noted in our reservation. I have come to trust that when I bring family or client's to Ruth's Chris the experience and food will be phenomenal. I was very disappointed that the food and service were a 2 out of 5 in this exeperience with Ruth's Chris, San Francisco. 
Dear Ruth's Chris SF team: please raise your standards so they compare with your Southern and East Coast counterparts.
author: Shicara S.

description:
Atmosphere: Definitely a more upscale steakhouse.

Service: Friendly, but of course you would expect that.

Food: DAT! Ribeye, awesome! Butterly, hot, medium-rare! Double awesome!

Overall: When's the next DAT? Haha...
author: Jimmy N.

description: The best steak I've had. It was covered with butter, and the meat was just as buttery. Cooked to perfection. Definitely come here to eat the steak. I tried a shrimp dish, a chicken dish, and a fish dish; they were good, but not excellent. The atmosphere was nice, although the booths were a little cramped. Definitely making a trip back here sometime.
author: Danny F.

description:
My husband and I went there last night for a pre-valentine dinner.  I had no expectations and I had never been there before.  I was hankering for prime rib and Harris's and House of Prime rib were both completely booked the night before Valentine's day. I actually thought Ruth's Chris was like an Outback Steakhouse.
Well much to my surprise, it's actually an excellent steak house.  They didn't serve prime rib but I was OK with getting a substitude. We both ordered one of their pre-fixed classic dinners which included a pre dinner item, your entree with one side dish and a dessert for like $53 bucks.  
My hubby got  a salad which he enjoyed very much and I got the soup of the day which was also delicious.  
For our entrees, he chose a filet done medium rare and I chose a 12oz rib eye done medium rare.  Both pieces of meat came out sizzling hot on heated 500 degree plates, done just perfectly with I think butter and herbs sizzling with the steak on the plate.  It was absolutely delicious.  Both meats were generous and thick. I don't think I have had such a yummy piece of meat in a long time.  We don't usually eat steak but maybe a couple times a year if even that.  Our sides of mashed potatoes and saute brussel sprouts with bacon were also super scrumptious. I ate up all the brussel sprouts and had a big chunk of meat to doggie bag home.
The dessert that night was just fair in my opinion.  It was a duo dessert combo of chocolate peanut butter cake with whipped cream and caramel sauce and a mixed berry combo topped with cream.  I chose a different dessert not part of the pre-fix of creme brule with berries on top for $4 extra.  It was worth the extra.
The service was excellent as well.  This meal was an absoulute delight and a real treat. We would definitely come back again
author: J Y.

description: I absolutely love this place. The best porterhouse steak I've had period. Better than Morton's, better than Peter Lugar's, better than Bobo's, better than Izzy's, and better than Harris'. Shit even better than the Striphouse Steakhouse in Texas! If anyone knows of another spot let me know. Cause I have not found it. The porterhouse for two comes out partially cooked and you get a nuclear hot plate for yourself. Which then you can pick from either side of the cut. Another great thing about Ruth's is the option to eat at the bar or the dining area. If you want casual go to the bar and stuff your face and watch the game on the flat screen. If you want more formal then choose the dining area. I also recommend the Potatoes au gratin, the creamed spinach, and the Cesar salad.
author: Ethan S.

description:
Hello, redemaniacs.
         My next review, on Ruth's Chris Steak House-is pretty much a good one. I had the crab cakes, and although they were delishous, they were zested a little bit much with the sun-dried tomatos. But either than that, it's a great place to eat. The matridees are great (and really suck up to the kids) and so are the waiters. Kidos to Micheal the server. The food was top-notch!
author: Beatrice A. P.

description:
This place is for meat eaters. I've been here before so I know the drill. Don't touch the plate, it's over 500 degrees and it will burn you. 

I came here for dining about town or whatever it was called. 3 course for $35. Great deal. I had the Filet and the gf had the rib eye. I actually like the rib eye a little more. Really juicy. The other time I was here I had the $80+ porterhouse, it feeds 2 people. The cut is great because it has a rib eye and filet in it, so you get the best of both worlds. Anyways they bring your meat and also another plate, the plate has butter and salt and pepper on it. The plate it 500 degree and can still cook your meat. Its a really nice experience. Not that expensive for steak. Go try it, don't touch the plate.
author: alfred k.

description: Woohoo they're consistent!  I'm still on a food high from my juicy ribeye.  Why did I wait soooo long to try this place????
author: Tammie C.

description: This is the second or third Ruth's Chris I'd ever been to and it was just as amazing as all the other experiences.  My venison was just...omg.  There was this blackberry sauce and it just made it orgasmic.  Actually, every course was great.  Definitely try the chop salad.
author: Paige W.

description: would you like some steak with your butter? Or some potatoes with your butter? OR some spinach with your cream?  Yuck...  Really didn't expect to not like this place either as you really can't go wrong with a great steak.  Until you drown it in three sticks of butter that is.
author: Trista L.

description:
For my money, there's no better steak in the Bay Area than steak at Morton's or Ruth's Chris.  I usually prefer Morton's to Ruth's Chris, although yesterday's dinner may have made me change my mind.

I took my sister to Ruth's Chris, and we were not disappointed.  Everything about our dinner was absolutely perfect.  The busboy and the waiter were phenomenal: fast, respectful and efficient.

We ordered chopped salads, which were perfectly prepared and had just the right amount of everything.  The chopped salad includes eggs and bacon, so it's quite filling, too.  If you're a light eater, you might want to consider a lighter salad or no salad at all.  The bread they give you is very tasty as well, so . . . pace yourself.

I ordered the New York strip, medium rare, just like I always do, and my sister tried the ribeye, also medium rare.  Both steaks were prepared perfectly.  They had as much flavor as they did butter, which is a LOT.

Our waiter recommended the New Orleans style hash browns as one of the sides.  It was a giant plate of hash browns, which tasted like mashed potatoes sauteed in a skillet.  It was a bit bland for my taste, but complemented the steak perfectly.  We also order some asparagus with hollandaise sauce, which tasted like, well, asparagus.  It's pretty hard to ruin a boiled vegetable.

As for prices, they're pretty high, but reasonable for a steakhouse of this caliber ($40-50 steaks, $7-10 sides, $8-12 salads).  Our bill with tip but without alcohol was $170.

I wanted to try the banana cream pie for dessert, but my sister wisely talked me out of it.  I am sure it would have been delicious.
author: Yan G.

description:
So the checklist of things I expected before I tried it for the first time:
- lot of butter and...
- maybe high prices?


Checklist of things I found out after trying it for the first time:
- service was very good;  server was entertaining and pleasant enough.  Prompt and didn't annoy us in any way.
- appetizers and sides were okay (cream spinach, brocolli) to good (steak fries, calamari)
- entree was very good (Petite Filet and Shrimp).  Cooked exactly how I wanted it and flavored very well.  Yes, lots of butter.
- dessert was off the menu and described well enough for me to try.  Large and very tasty.
- price?  It's decent.  I enjoyed my time with friends and had a very good dinner.  
- there will be probably be a next time.
author: Don B.

description:
I was treated to a great evening out here and I have to say that the quality of food was really good, but not great. Dare I say that? I think a lot of people equate spending cash with greatness and don't discern between some really quality ingredients. I had their filet, creamed spinach, and scalloped potatoes. 

The sides were gnarled up in heavy cream with a ton of salt. I'm not salt sensitive, but what was going on here was like a tv dinner side. Why do many spots load their dishes with salt? It's a masking of cheap creams, cheeses, overcooked items, etc. 

The filet was very tender and I do not recommend that anyone order it rare because they're fearful of it becoming medium or suggestions that you go medium if you want your well to not be overcooked. Both of our plates were hot, but did not cook the meat up a whole notch of wellness. The meat quality was not incredibly impressive in comparison to other moderately priced restaurants. 

The atmosphere was nice, but nothing to rave about and honestly I'd say that you'd have better service, food, and overall dining experience at the House of Prime Rib.
author: M M.

description:
3.5 stars. Excellent steaks, good service... But...

the dining room is a bit too cramped for my comfort level.  every time another table's steaks came out, it felt like i was getting served again because of the waiters proximity and all that butter splattering everywhere.
author: shaun l.

description:
If you want good steak, you should go to Harris a few blocks down the street.  Ruth's Chris steak is good, but not great.  And not to mention that all sides are a la carte, so all you get is meat.  The service is just ok, but nothing memorable.  Knowing that I can get good quality steak, service and sides for a reasonable price at Harris, I definitely would not come back.

*************************
UPDATE on 3/11/2008
Ok, so had to go there again for a family birthday dinner, and I really do try to like this place, but it just doesn't impress.  The salads are nothing exciting, and very standard.  The fried calamari was really greasy and way too much batter.  Definitely not my favorite.  I had the new york strip medium rare.  It was cooked just fine, but it really didn't have enough flavor to it.  And can they please provide steak knives that actually cut???  Seriously, you can barely cut with their knives... maybe they think you don't need super sharp knives b/c their meat is supposed to be tender.  But that definitely wasn't the case.  I had to work hard to cut my meat!  The sides are not memorable at all and ridiculously expensive.

I must say the service was really good, and our server was super nice and very accomodating.  Since we were celebrating a birthday, they gave us one free dessert!  First off, their desserts are monstrous, so plan on sharing!  So we had the cheesecake and the molten chocolate cake to share with 6 people.  The cheesecake was fabulous!!  I would seriously considering just trying to order the cheesecake from there.  So delicious!  The molten chocolate cake was ordinary, but good.

As I've said before, I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.  Not bad, but there's way better elsewhere.
author: Mai S.

description:
It averaged somewhere between a 3 and 3.5... So, I'm going harsh and drawing the line at 3.
Did the DAT and got the ribeye, and enjoyed my steak well enough, but I was bothered by the fact that it came out as a little overcooked and progressively became more overcooked during the dinner.
Would probably only come again for DAT and not for any other occasion. Feel like I've had better steaks, but service was great, sides weren't too bad... dessert was okay. Friend had the filet, said it was really good but really, really small. He was starved after, poor thing.
author: Jessica L.

description:
"They" say........Ruth's Chris is one of the best steakhouses in town. (even if they're a chain). So I FINALLY dined at Ruth's Chris last night to celebrate our post-Valentine's day dinner and also to see what all the hype was about.

I was suprised to see alot of people dressed so casual...like t-shirts, shorts, and sneakers? I'm thinking.....these folks must've been tourists. We waited 15-20 min. for our table even though we had an 8pm res. That seemed to be the obvious case, since there were alot of people in our same situation standing around. That didn't bother me so much cuz we happened to run into one of my best friends there. What a co-in-ki-dink. ;)

Moving on.....we got seated in a comfy booth in what seemed to be the main dining area. Our helpful server (Cyndi) comes to tell us all about their specials and their famous USDA steaks etc. Yumm!! We start off with their complimentary bread & butter, which I have to mention, cuz they were sooo warm and crispy outside with the soft goodness inside. Ughh, I'm such a bread lover. It's a love/hate thing, I tell you. 

Next came our calamari, which was sooooo good. The roasted red peppers gave just the right hint of sweetness in the background. I must say, probably the best calamari I've had so far. (wow...that's a pretty bold statement) For our sides....we had the sauteed spinach and the potatoes au gratin. The spinach was horribly salty, bathing in a boat of butter juice. It might as well have been salty spinach soup! The potatoes au gratin was rich and cheesy, but good. 

We both had the Rib Eye which were cooked perfectly to our liking. Very tender and soft, but to be honest, not tasty enough to be worth $42 each. Even though we were STUFFED, we couldn't leave without having dessert. Now that put us over the top! The Banana Cream Pie tasted so sinful. We couldn't help but smile at eachother while eating it....it was so bad but so good. 

As usual, we had a great time and will come back to have the Petite Filet instead, but probably no time soon. There are far better steakhouses in SF and too many more to try!!
author: Anne E.

description:
My fiance and I had a great date here.. we ordered the porter house steak and it was really good.  Yummy potatoes!  I like that the waiter knew what he was talking about.  

It's pricey, but I thought it was worth it.  You get what you pay for.
author: Doreen M.

description: We had a wonderful experience at Ruth's Chris in San Francisco.  The service and staff were wonderful the moment we walked in. Our table was lovely, as was the atmosphere in the restaurant. Everything we ordered was spectacular! The tuna tartare appetizer was delicious, my rib eye steak was perfection, and my husbands sea bass special made him very happy.   We have to thank our great waitress, Courtney for that. She was happy to give us suggestions that were all perfect. And her wine suggestions were spectacular. Courtney truly made our dinner a 'fine dining experience'. She knows her stuff. Everything was delicious. We will definitely be back the next time we are in SF and will ask for Courtney!
author: Debbie J.

description:
Did not understand why I just discovered this place around 2 years ago! The bread is SO GOOD with the spread that we keep asking for more. The reason this place makes it to 5 stars is the hot sizzling butter plate the steak comes out in. Getting our food warm is a must, but getting it sizzling hot was definitely my first time. The sides are really big in proportions. The only downside I would say is that the steak is so good sizzling hot that when it cools down..the steak won't be as good anymore. =( 

Still, I would come back again and again =D
author: Serena L.

description:
I am a rib eye kind-of-girl but when I had dinner with my friend there during DAT, I have to say, I couldn't stop eyeing her petite filet.  My steak was just a tad bit too greasy and I found out later on that I could've requested them to lay off the butter on the beef.  Now I like butter too, but this time there was just way too much of it!  
Anyway, our food was a bit on the medium-rare side when it came to the table but the plates are hot.  So, the heating continues and we did end up with our steaks on medium which was what we wanted.  The flavors are really simple -- there is no cajun seasoning or glopping on the A1 at this establishment.  Just pure and simple.
I would definitely come back for DAT or if OpenTable  has another event similar to their Appetite Stimulus thing.  Perhaps I'll have the petite filet then.
author: Rhea S.

description:
My friends and I decided to participate in the Dine about town. It was a great deal, but honestly the food really wasn't worth more than what we paid for it. It was about $50 each and we all decided on the petite filet, it was the perfect size. We had the option of filet, rib eye, chicken or shrimp. With a side of spinach or mashed potatoes, a dinner salad and desert ( bread puding or key lime pie). 

We had a 9 PM reservation and were kinda irked to check in and find out they were running 30 min behind. So we went into the bar which is tiny. There were a lot of people in there so it was hard to find a location to stand where we weren't in someone's way. We ordered drinks which were really good but super pricey. 4 drinks - $58 OUCH. At least it was a good martini. 

Once we were seated the service was good and the atmosphere was nice. Dim which is always nice for dinner. It was a packed house, so obviously the place is popular. I ordere the filet cooked medium. The girls and i decided to split the sides so we could try each. The steak was very good, awesome flavor and cooked perfectly. Dinner salad was good, mashed potatoes good, the spinach NOT very good at all. It had a gamey flavor which was weird...I'm not a fan. The Key lime pie was REALLY good. 

Over all it was a good experience but I don't feel it was worth anymore than we paid. I'd try it again, but I think there are so many places in the city I'd rather give a new place a shot before I go back. It was average to maybe slightly above. Its a nice date place and if you're into steak I'd say give it a shot, the steak was tasty, but not the best I've had.
author: Leza B.

description:
I haven't been here in a while, so was excited about the butter, the steak and the baked potato. The food was good and fine; though I felt the one in Dallas was better back in the days. The wait was pretty atrocious: we had reservations for 8pm and were seated at 9:10pm.  Maybe it was because DAT was going on, but that's still ridiculous.  Also, I don't remember tables existing right by the bar area, but that's where we sat...tables near the bar, kitchen and restroom are pet-peeves of mine.  Overall this Ruth Chris isn't that good in decor and service.

Food's still solid though. Get a steak, baked potato and creamed spinach. If you've got cajones and disregard for human life, go for the extra butter on that steak.  Overall, for comparison's sake, I prefer their steak over Morton's.  If you want a better overall experience, try Joe Dimaggio's.

Parking can be a pain at peak hours in this area, so plan accordingly.
author: Tsubasa O.

description: Their crab cake is awesome!  Steak, pretty darn good and service is excellent.  They don't offer tap beer - boo, but that's the only thing that isn't great.  Although, its a steak house - they're all about the wine.  Another negative is, they don't validate the garage parking.
author: Elaine N.

description: always good, this is our go-to place for special treat for hubby and whenever dine-about-town hits! you cant go wrong.
author: Teresa T.

description:
$250 for 3 people included: 1 martini, 1 glass of white wine, 1 bottle of red, 3 salads, a petit filet, a petit filet paired with a crab stuffed lobster tail, mixed grill (filet, chicken, crab cake), 2 sides, and bread pudding for dessert. 

The pear martini got the palet going. The caesar salad was yummy. The filet, med-rare, was divine. The bread pudding was enough for all of us to share. 

I was surprised how packed it was on a Sunday night...our reservation was at 545pm, and by 7 all the tables were full. 

This is a good place if someone else is paying!
author: Misha F.

description:
Hooray for Dine About Town, because I'd probably never come here otherwise!

I ordered the 12oz rib eye as my main course and I was unpleasantly surprised to see it sizzling in a pool of melted butter.  I feel like the chef used a whole stick!  After you get past that (or don't), the meat is cooked very well.  It is very tender and juicy!  They purposefully bring out your order a little less cooked than what you ordered (ie. I ordered my steak medium and it came out more on the medium rare side) because they anticipate the "500 degree" plate to cook the meat a little more.

Dessert was probably my favorite part.  I got the chocolate cake which was eating like a slice of fudge.  I was THIS close to asking for a glass of milk!  All in all, a delicious meal, but for the regular price, I'd rather eat at House of Prime Rib.
author: Amanda Y.

description:
Went there during December for Boy's night out.  Steak and wine were to be the food du jour.

What a disappointment.  Ruth Chris SF is focused mainly on tourists.  My rib-eye got quite rough for what was supposed to be USDA choice.  The room was your standard old school SF.  Much better choices in the City for the price.

Not recommended.
author: Laurence H.

description:
The month of January is the month to try new places in SF for DINE ABOUT TOWN.  

The first place we tried was RUTH CHRIS.  
The menu consisted of a dinner salad, 16 oz rib eye and some kind of pudding dessert.

The salad was the run of the mill salad.  Good but not great

The steak was delicious.  They serve it on a plate that is warmed at 300 degrees.  When you cut your steak you press it against the plate and see the butter sizzle into the steak.  It was tasty and very tender at the same time.

We also ordered some calamari.  Their Calamari is a little different. It had a kind of sweet kick to it.  Not bad.  It's definetly worth trying.

The Bread Pudding was not worth having.  Pass on this.

Overall it was worth my 31 dollars.  GO DINE ABOUT TOWN!
author: Allen T.

description:
Absolutely love the steaks here! Who else use butter for their steaks??

I am a tasty steak person than the boring prime rib person, so anything tasty is good to me, and Ruth's Chris' got it.

I think even if you don't like steaks that much or you prefer prime ribs more, you should still try Ruth's out. I even like its side dishes!!

A tip for you though, all the side dishes are extra charge b/c it's like family style that you share everything but your steaks. You really don't want too many side dishes either cuz the portion is not small at all.

The service is normal, nothing beyond the norm.  

I don't give 5-star only b/c, you know, it's just steaks... if you pick out the right part of meat, cook the right amount of time, and give it the right amount of seasoning, you'll get some awesome steaks. ;)

Parking is 1/2 1/2. If you are lucky, there is a lot of street parking, but valet is available. I personally think it's a casual dining b/c I've seen many people wearing just jeans, but I still put "dressy" cuz I dressed up when I went there.
author: HsuMeow L.

description:
Another year, another birthday dinner.  For some reason, I had never been to Ruth's Chris - and after all the in-flight magazine ads, I finally caved in.  I'll make this quick and simple:  

- Great wine list (reasonable prices compared to many steakhouses in the city).
- Great apps (I could make a meal out of their stuffed mushrooms)
- Exquisite Rib-Eye (even though they were out of the "bone-in")

My only advice is to order your steak one shade lighter than normal...the 12,000 degree plate tends to keep cooking the steak as you eat it.  My medium rare was cooked perfectly when it came out but by the time I was done, it had cooked to medium.  No biggie though - I will return again and get a "rare".
author: Ari G.

description:
Yet another dinner out. Tonight being a half holiday and my friend and I were getting off work earlier we decide to come back here to Ruth Chris after maybe 5 years.

I had the crabtini appetizer. Good but not outstanding. Our entrees were the Rib-eye and a Veal chop. Both were cook as we requested with mild seasoning as per explained by Josh, our server. Since the meat is ala carte, our sides were the hash browns (huge, about7-8 inches in diameter and about an 1 1/2 thick and the brocolli au gratin. I've had better veal I've grilled myself from Draegers and Whole Foods. I did like the sweet and hot pepper topping on the veal though.

So, summing it up, excellent and professional service with good but not neccessarily great food.
author: Ed L.

description:
I've been a lurker for quite sometime and felt that it's about time to contribute to this awesome community.  With the Dine About Town promotion in full swing at many fine restaurants, it's a great time to start.

When searching for a good steakhouse in the city, this name frequently pops up as a recommendation.  With the fixed price menu of Dine About Town at $32 per person, it's a great way way to give this restaurant a try at price that won't totally bust your wallet (or at least at a lesser magnitude).

I ordered the Rib-eye steak which was delicious.  The first thing that you'll notice about your steak when it comes to you is that it's drenched with butter and it's piping hot.  The fact that it's drenched in butter makes it very delicious, but you can't help but think that this masks the overall flavor of the actual cut of meat.  Of course it tastes good, because there's so much butter!  The temperature of the meat is the best part.  It's served on a super hot plate, which will burn you if you're not careful, which makes it an awesome experience as each bite tastes like it just came off the grill.  The sides were good but nothing that differentiates itself from any other steakhouse side you'll order anywhere else (the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach).

The service was attentive for most of the night (although I won't deduct a point for our server forgetting about as towards the end).  The atmosphere is the same you'll see at other premium steakhouses like Alfred's and House of Prime Rib.

Although this place was enjoyable, for my money I would much rather go to House of Prime Rib.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
I was disappointed at the Ribeye on the DAT menu.  Maybe I had extremely high expectations to this place because all my friends rave about it.  Honestly, the steak was nothing special.  I guess I have to give it a second try and order from the non-DAT menu next time before I can make a conclusion about this place.

However, the service was exceptional!  Every person who served us was friendly and genuine, and I have never had service liked this before.  Bravo!
author: Karina L.

description:
There is only one thing to say about this place......
The best steak I have ever had is at Ruth's Chris Steak House. And the scalloped potatos aren't too bad either......

A Definate MUST!
author: CarlaFornia W.

description:
I'm a big time beef eater, and when I came to Ruth's Chris I already knew what I wanted. The sides were decent but the steak was better than I imagined. The filet mignon I got was served with a side of butter so that made the steak juicer than it was, I appreciated the side as well as the baked potato I received. 

Tips and Pointers:
-Service is fast
-Steak was cooked to my liking, and served with a nice side of butter
-Baked potato was awesome
-Restuarant was clean and not too loud
-Bathrooms were clean
-Overall a decent steak eating experience

[APPROVED]
author: Eric T.

description: My family came here the day after Mother's Day.  It's always hard to lock in everyones schedules, that by the time we finally decided on a restaurant, Ruth's was already fully booked.  My mom really enjoys their $39/$49 pre-fix 4-course menus.  I had the salad (which was drenched in dressing), filet , baked potato ($2 extra) & dessert.  The portion sizes are always meaty so I'll always leave with portions of my steak to go.  This time around they seemed to under cook my husbands steak.  He ordered it medium and it came out just between rare and medium rare.  As he cut through the center you could see the red blood juices surfacing.
author: Stacey L.

description:
We went here to take advantage of "DINE ABOUT TOWN". 

Do they serve meat of same quality for their regular menu and "DINE ABOUT TOWN" menu? Does anyone know? I really wish I had asked this question to the very nice server that we had ... 

If they do serve meat of same quality on both menues, this restaurant's meat quality is not good at all, I don't think. It didn't give me "WOW" at all. Was it because I said "NO" to butter??? 

Anyway, I was very disappointed with their meat and side dishes for DINE ABOUT TOWN. I would go back here one more time only if they are serving better quality meat for their regular menu to try that out.
author: Wakaknee J.

description: I come here almost every year for Dine About Town.  Its just that good.  From appetizer, entree to dessert.  It might just be me but I didnt like the bread pudding as much since I was able to taste the strong Jack Daniels.  Dont get me wrong...I still gobbled it up since it was good but I woudnt get it again.  The only thing stopping me from giving it 5stars is the wait.  Even with reservations I found that you still have to wait awhile.  Last time we waited for half an hour so they gave us some free appetizers.
author: she q.

description: Still best fillet to this day and I have tried more steakhouses than you can imagine!  If you like your meat tender, buttery, and just melt-in-your-mouth good, (who doesn't?) then this is the place for you!  Worth the 45 min drive and possible difficulty to park since it's located right on Van Ness.
author: Cat C.

description: Although I was extremely disappointed in the lack of steak flavor in my filet, I am still giving them four stars because their rib-eyes are extremely juicy and packed with so much goodness. It was my fault anyways for straying away from my favorite cut. Lesson learned!
author: Tracy N.

description:
Ruth's Chris is a high-end chain restaurant that doesn't feel like one.  The steaks we got were very flavorful, but its lathered in butter so...

The decor is nice, tho the very dim lighting gives me concern. How do I know if there isn't a hair or bug on my plate? The prices are high-- and despite the good quality of food,  i'm not entirely convinced its worth it. Everything is a la carte... i wouldnt be surprised if we were charged for the salt and pepper as well.
author: Ikeb I.

description:
If you've decided on a steakhouse, clearly you've already decided to take a couple weeks off the tapioca-eating, diaper-wearing end of your life with some red meat and you probably made the right choice. Ruth's Chris Filet Oskar (lump crab meat) with hollandaise sauce is a weeee bit better than "an essentially flavourless starchy ingredient, or fecula, produced from treated and dried cassava (manioc) root and used in cooking" (Wikipedia).

Some like Morton's, some like House of Prime Rib. But if your cut of meat is the fillet, this is the place to go. The meat is cooked using what must be at least a half to full stick of butter, which crackles and pops (but doesn't snap) when they bring the plates to your table. The meat is excellent, the sides are awesome (esp. shoestring and/ or au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach) all rock, and the wine selection is (apparently) great. Which it should be since you will pay for the experience. But don't worry it's well worth it. And just think of your dinner here as a hedge against having to spend on the tapioca and Depends in a few decades.
author: Ahsan M.

description:
I went to Ruth Chris during Dine About Town, and I would have to say it was worth the $32.

My gf and I tried the Ribeye and the Filet, Creamed Spinach and Mashed Potatoes, and Bread Pudding & Ice Cream (they ran out of the key lime pie).

We both agreed that the food was good, BUT we both felt there was overkill in terms of butter usage.  Personally, I felt a lil 'sick' (good kind of too much fat) afterward.  

I ususally order Ribeyes when I go to steak houses, so I've had my fair share.  I would rate their's a 4 out of 5, thus the stars.
author: Johnny C.

description:
Came here for the DAT menu. Like the other reviewers, saw that Ruth's Chris was the best deal for DAT. And indeed it was! The steak wasn't memorable, but I must applaud them on their service! The hostess and our server was quite attentive and professional. I liked how throughout the meal, they used my name to greet me, as though i was a regular. They sure make you feel welcomed. The sides were yum (cream spinach and mash potatoes) and the dessert portions were sure generous. While the rest of my party enjoyed the bread pudding, I was content with the key lime pie -- tart as it should be. They did mix up my friend's dessert order and gave him the pie rather than the bread pudding as requested. However, they made it up by bringing an extra bread pudding out! How nice. The only thing I can complain about is the strawberry mojito.. it just didn't have that "punch". Oh well. 

But yes, I think this is a rather quaint place to take some older folks like my parentals. Love love love their service!
author: J T.

description:
Let me preface this by saying that of the three people I went with, two had been there before and found the food to be exceptional. Not this time....

2 Stars for one thing and one thing only
Chocolate Sin Cake... It was amazing.

As for my filet mignon, I expected this 40$ a la carte filet to be amazing as my friends had told me that it would be well worth the price. I ordered it medium and when I cut into it, my plate filled with blood. Don't get me wrong, I will eat carpaccio and am not easily fazed by pink steak, but I asked for it medium. I actually had to trade with my friend who asked for medium rare as his was way more cooked than mine. The flavor was mediocre. Let's put it this way- my dad's George Foreman cooks a better steak than this. As for my friend with my former steak, his stomache hurt him way into the next day.

I think Ruth or Chris or whoever was having a bad, bad night that night, because that was one gigantic waste of $300 for four people....

#7
author: Tasha R.

description:
Wonderful steak. I had the Ribeye and shared it with my Fiance. It is filling even for a larger man (6'3" 220) because the steak is drenched, soaked and seared in butter (I may be exagerating a bit). 

Its darn good, but could quite nearly give you a heart attack.

Pricey, but worth it. I would come again.
author: Mark H.

description:
This is where I had my first venison and I FELL IN LOVE.  It was AMAZING.  The meat was soooo tender and juicy and better than the best steak I've had.  The ambiance was great, customer service was great too.  There was only two of us and we got seated in a cute little booth, our waiter was this cute old man who explained everything well and was very friendly.  My water cup was always filled (that's really important to me) and the manager came up personally and asked how everything was.  

Overall, a little pricey but definitely worth it to treat yourself to Ruth Chris once in a while.
author: Hanna H.

description:
I love this location of Ruth's Chris Steak House...to me it is everything a nice steak house is suppose to be...servers dressed to perfection, everyone greets you, they are friendly to the point of spooky...

I have spent the last four birthdays here...not just for the free desert but because I love this place.  I have gone to other Ruth's Chris and the experience fell flat but I will yelp about that later...

The meat is so soft and feels like velvet on the tongue...I get mine medium...I also ordered the crabtini...the crab salad in a martini cup with big chunks of crab meat (not just flakes), also had the chopped salad...I HATE blue cheese but I will eat it in this chopped salad because its that good (BUT NOWHERE ELSE!! EVER!!)

the Sweet potato is to die for...and with all the sugar and butter and meat this meal could kill you...and for me its worth every clogging artery...
author: Angela A.

description:
Rich, buttery, ribeye on a sizzling 500 degree plate!  I was in heaven!

Tonight was my 4th time eating at Ruth's Chris and I was not disappointed.  My bf and I took advantage of the 7th Annual Dine About Town event and treated ourselves to a 3 course meal for $31.95 each.  I had the house salad w/ balsamic vinaigrette, ribeye, creamed spinach, and key lime pie.  While my bf had the same except with mashed potatoes instead of the spinach.  And we didn't hesitate taking home our leftovers for a nice midnight snack!  He-he, I don't think we really had a choice especially after we each ate a loaf of the warm sweet bread at the beginning of the meal.  =)

Overall, a fantastic meal with great service that'll keep me coming back, especially when they are participating in the Dine About Town event!
author: A W.

description:
So wonderful of RC to extend the Dine About Town promotion a week, my husband and I came here for an early dinner.   

Their bread was quite good, served nice and warm. The service was very attentive returning with a full basket before we can ask for more.  

We had the Thai spiced fried calamari which was quite good.  It was well portioned and quite tasty with the sweet and sour sauce and the roasted red peppers.  

I had the 6 oz filet and my husband had the 12oz ribeye.  They cook it perfectly to what you request and it is served on plates that are heated to 500F so the meat is sizzling and remains heated your plate... or at least there is never a congealing factor before you finish.   We estimated for slow eaters maybe by 90 minutes the oils might congeal.     We shared the spinach which was a little too creamy and the mashed potatoes that was butterlicious.    

I loved the bread pudding especially the liquor'd up sauce.  The key lime pie was good too.  We made it a point of eating the pie first 2' tartness before the sweet pudding.... yum yum yum....   

I would go again for Dine about Town, I think for regular prices it is a little more expensive than it is worth.    I think Texas Roadhouse is still the best for quality and price.
author: Regi K.

description:
I came here with my little brother after his visit to the dentist for a DAT dinner.  I like the idea of chemistry behind the steaks.  Well, they do not pour chemicals onto the steak (except butter), but cooking the meat at a really high temperature...I guess it sounds impressive.

If you do not mind all the butter, then I say try this place!  The filet mignon was EXCELLENT!! I have never had a filet mignon like that (or maybe I'm just a butter lover), or I was a bit tipsy from all the wine.  My brother's rib-eye was so-so, according to him.  Ruth Chris also has really good wine selection.

Aside from the ultra good filet, the salad was average.  It seems like they used over the counter dressing.  My dessert (bread pudding) was way too sweet.  I was not able to finish it, and I can eat a cinnabon with extra frosting!!!  My brother's Key Lime Pie was average too.  But yes, their filet mignon alone earned them four stars from me!  I will definitely come back if I ever want filet mignon.  I mean, it's a steak house, if the steak is good, then it's good....
author: Carrie-C N.

description:
First off, I haven't tried the steak at this place but from what I've heard from others - it's great. I ordered the portobello mushroom dish that came with mashed potatoes, asparagus, and something else. However, it was delicious. The dish itself was very affordable - around $20.00 in comparison to the price of steak which was around $40.00. The portions are huge. I was only able to eat a third of the dish and took the rest of it home and that lasted for another 2 meals.

The atmosphere is nice - a comfortable kind of more upscale restaurant. Service was good. I probably will come here again just for the portobello mushroom dish.
author: Donna T.

description:
This was my first time here and I loved it. I ordered the rib eye and my friend ordered the filet. My rib eye was very flavorful and tasty. I didn't get a chance to try the filet, but my friend loved the rest of my rib eye. We ordered the mashed potato seasoned with garlic and asparagus. Both side dishes were yummy!
I would probably go here if I've got the extra moola...yes...CHA-CHING!!! Although quite pricey, it's not stuffy. We were able to wear our 'fancy jeans'
author: Michelle C.

description: This place is a standardized chain that produces quite high-quality steaks.  The cuts of meat are very, very good, but you REALLY pay for it.  Basically, they're good, but so expensive that it takes away from the rating.
author: Patrick Z.

description: Second time eating at a Ruth's Chris. First time was in Hawaii and it was decent. I came here for a date night with my boyfriend and although we had a reservation, we had to wait at the bar. The whole place was packed. I figured we would have to just stand around and never get a place at the bar, but we were able to easily slide right in. Maybe it was the timing. Drinks were delicious and made to your liking, bartenders were friendly. When we sat down to eat, the food was delicious! We both had the filet with sides of au gratin potatoes and creamed corn maybe? i cant remember but I do remember how amazing this shrimp appetizer was we got! I think it may have been a special that day. Anyway, steaks were cooked to perfection and it was a great meal with a good atmosphere.
author: Marla G.

description: There's close to 1,000 reviews for this place already so I'll keep mine short and simple. Fantastic steaks, great wines, tasty cocktails, and excellent service. You will not be disappointed. Please book your reservation now and get your stomach ready for a fantastic meal!
author: Chau H.

description: I fell asleep at the table. Nuff said.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Never fails. Ahi tuna, calamari, and the ribeye are my favs. Creme brulee, I must admit I had better. But you can't go wrong with their steaks. Appetizer and entree portions are good. VERY worth it. Consider getting valet parking since it's in SF.
author: Melanie A.

description:
i thought i left a review for this place already, but guess not. 

Well, i came here for the DAT for my mom's bday in Jan and wow was i impressed! It was the BEST STEAK i have ever tasted! It is kinda expensive, but the quality you're getting is great + service. 

I made reservations prior and i was glad i did because upon our arrival there, i saw people waiting prob taking advantage of the DAT. 

My sister and i ordered the filet mignon, while mom did the filet+shrimps, and dad upgraded to the 16oz ribeye. We also ordered calamari for appetizers and those were delish...mashed potatoes and spinach for sides.  Since we did the DAT, we had a 3 course meal...salad,steak,& dessert! Everything that night was scrumptious so my tummy and i left =) lol  

I think the bill came out to $150-175, i will def come back again! FORGET PRIME RIB!
author: Rose P.

description: Now this is the premium steakhouse I like.  The food's great, the prices are reasonable (although much increased over the past few years) and the service is really good.  Ruth's Chris is much better than Morton's.  Great food and no complaints.  I've been a regular for about ten years.
author: Barry S.

description: Went to Ruth Chris on Friday evening, Nov 16, in a group of 6. Street parking difficult but we lucked out and found a parking spot right on Van Ness within 20 yards of the front door. Score !  Never had been here before. We had a dinner bet and the winner got the free dinner after having selected the Giants in preseason to win the World Series. The restaurant seems a bit small upon first entering. We were immediately seated on that rainy night. I selected the Classic special which included dinner course, I chose a ribeye, soup or caeser salad or my pick, the apple-walnut-blue cheese salad, a side dish, I selected the  button mushrooms(6) on the side and a chocolate desert($52? without tax and tip)  The steak was medium sized, about .75" thick and comes with butter on top(not necessary imo) and it was super tender. Salad good, dessert was a chocolate cake with peanut butter mousse and whipped cream on top, a winner.. We had the crab stuffed mushrooms appetizer which were tasty. Bread was a sweet french on the smaller loaf side and I must admit I expected sourdough being in the City. Service was excellent throughout the meal, but when we hung a bit after paying the bill it would have been nice to get some add'l water re-fills but no one returned for that service. My buddy wanted french fries with his steak which was not a choice on the sides and that was $3 extra. I thought the mushroom side, which was drenched in butter, just OK. One guy ordered potatoes au gratin and it was SALT city.  The key lime pie was really good, and not a wedge, you got your own little pie.  Another winner.  Brought along two bottles of Cabernet which they allow with corkage fee.(Didnt catch the cost for that) Bathroom was really nice. Overall a nice dinner but I am just not that into steak houses which overall are good not great imo and seem way  too pricey when I have bought  and cooked at home something just as good if not better for far far less. I guess at this point when I go out to dinner I want to eat something that I cant easily make at home. Oh the total bill was $525 for 6 without any bar drinks. I guess if you are a steak person you will like it.
author: Jeff R.

description:
The gf seems to be a fan of this place.  Probably because it's right down the block from where she lives.  It's very old school.   It's one of those steakhouses on van ness that look like they've been there since 1910 . the place probably isn't that old but it has the rich dark leather and the brass and the wood that give it the old-world restaurant feel.  

I can also see where the fixation came from because the 40 dollar fixed price meal is well worth it.  A nice appetizer.  She chose the corn/crab soup and I chose the Italian bread+green salad.  both were nicely presented and prepared but perhaps a little salty.  The whole meal was basically butter and salt but you don't go here for a healthy meal.  We both chose the same entrée: the 6 ounce filet with shrimp . the waiters will warn you that the plates come out of the kitchen around 500 degrees so don't touch them.  The filet and shrimp come still sizzling on the plate, that's how hot the plates are.  The shrimp is spicy and tastey.  The filet is buttery, soft and smooth.  The dessert is a combo of berries and an unusual chocolate cake selection.  Not my favorite chocolate cake since it's not very chocolatey... seems a little coffee-flavored actually.  The wine list seemed pretty nice as well.  I chose the special wine (not on the list) by the glass and it was more than adequate although not a stand-out.  Which is to be expected, I guess, for a wine by the glass. 

Overall, a definite must-try place if you like steakhouses, especially those located in the pac heights and van ness corridor.  it's an adequate addition to harris', bobo's, and house of prime rib.
author: dan h.

description:
If you're a big meat eater and LOOOOOVE steak, then I highly recommend eating at Ruth's Chris! 

I came here to celebrate a birthday with my family. We came here on a Friday night, about 6pm.  It wasn't too crowded and we were seated right away, since we had a reservation.  The employees were really friendly, which didn't make me feel intimidated since the restaurant was pretty fancy.  

Since it was our first time at Ruth's Chris, our server explained to us how they cook their steaks and how it is served (on a hot plate to keep the steak sizzlin' when it reaches the table).  I ordered the prix fixe menu that came with a starter, meal, a side, and dessert. For starter, I had the corn chowder soup and it was delicious! It was really creamy and thick, just the way I like it.  For my side dish, I chose the mashed potatoes.  The mashed potatoes were also delicious.  It had the right amount of butter and herb. I tasted a hint of garlic in it too, but the flavor was just right for my taste.  And for my main course, I had the petite filet cooked medium.  The steak was literally mouth-watering. As cliche as it sounds, but it was really cooked to perfection.  I loved that the outside seemed well-done, but when you cut open your steak, you can see the pink color and the juice of the meat.  (I'm getting hungry just describing the steak!) The meat is very very tender and really really good. 

I don't remember how the dessert tasted, because I was so satisfied after eating my steak. But I do remember leaving happy from Ruth's Chris, so I'm guessing it was also yummy.

They also have a bar here. I tried their citrus mojito and it was refreshing. I heard happy hour at the bar was really good too... I think I'll try that the next time I go here :)

I highly recommend this place, if you just want to unwind and enjoy some really good steak.  And go here if and only if you swear to order steak!
author: Liezel D.

description:
Elegant and dark at dinner time. 

Over glorified SF steak house. The pricing is not proportional to cut, size or quality. 
I guess everyone has to go here at least once, just to say they gone here. 

Did anyone else get a finger, hand or arm burn from the oven roasted plates? 
The plate was so hot that when the meat was placed on it and brought to me it was still sizzling and spraying juices everywhere, like on my nice clean shirt. When I mentioned this to the waiter, he said, "sir, I told you the plate was hot..". (Nice comeback Einstein)
It felt like the waiters were rushing us, seems like they are tip motivated.
author: madass d.

description:
Love the steak with the popping butter.  Their drinks are good (best grey goose martini in town).  If you love butter and meat, this is the place for you. The sides are yummy (creamy, buttery goodness).  I like Ruth over Harris', House of Prime Rib, Bobo's, 5A5, & Mortons.  

Other highlights:  Pahlmeyer by the glass. 
Their stuffed chicken is my hubby and kid's favorite. The tuna appetizer is sooooo good.  Consistent and great. Service always perfect and friendly. Extremely well managed.

This is the ONLY Chain restaurant I like.
author: S. C.

description:
Update: 

Since last I've been dining at Ruth Chris at least once a month.

And last Friday, after working from 7 AM to 7:30 PM no lunch or breaks taken due to my new Director wanting to complete a project. I was famished and exhausted. 

Drove straight to the city, got in at 8:30. Mr took one long at me and said "Babe we deserve a great dinner for working our butts off this week". Walked over to one of our fav's restaurant Ruth Chris.

With no reservation at 9 PM, decided to go to the bar but alas one extra table. Service is AWESOME as always. 

We decided to have our Lobster Bisque, Lettuce Wedge with Blue Cheese Dressing and we tried their Special of the night KOBE Steak, medium rare YUMMY!!!.

As far as drinks I had Hemingway Daiquiri (delish) and Mr just dad anchor Beer.

Ruth Chris never disappoints from Service to food, we had now become regulars at this place. Price is good compare to other steakhouses.


New Years Eve dinner! as always...excellent service, yummy food & smooth wine....we ordered the 2004 Titus Syrah...try it!

***********************
Celebrated moving in to a new neighborhood Pac Heights ^_^

Our bodies sore from moving and since Ruth Chris is just down 2 blocks we decided we deserve a yummy steak dinner & wine.

Mr ( regular) & I (my first time).

Service was awesome, from our server Katia (w/c by the way recommended for us to try their Petite Syrah) and the rest of the staff.

Ruth Chris have an elegant casual feel to it.

We had 
Lobster Bisque - I didn't care for that much
Sizzlin Blue Crab Cakes - love it
Petite Filet - cooked Medium rare - yummy!
Potatoes Au Gratin - creamy, like it!

Bottle of 2004 Titus Petite Syrah ($80) - smooth, full taste & bit fruity - love & finished it!
author: jubi l.

description:
I don't see the hype on this restaurant.  I'm not a fan of restaurants with over-priced steaks and charges so much for sides.
Granted I can't make the steak the same way since I don't have the equipment but I don't think I will return back.  Just not worth the money for me.
author: Will I A m.

description:
The thing I love about Ruth's Chris is that even though its $$$, you always know what you're going to get.  I've been to Ruth's in HI and Seattle, but this was my first time to the SF one.  We had reservations but still ended up having to wait 15-20 minutes for our table, which was a little annoying.  The other thing that I didn't particularly like was that the tables are so close together, you might as well be dining with the people next to you.  For example, I felt bad for the couple sitting next to our party of 7 (and fairly loud party) who were obviously trying to have a romantic dinner.  

Now, on to the food, all I have to say is that Ruth's definitely knows steak!  I have never had an unpleasant meal at Ruth's, and this time was no different.  If you like steak, this is the place to go.
author: Shannon E.

description:
Holy crap.  Yes, it's expensive.  But can you REALLY put a price tag on the greatest filet mignon you've ever had?  No, you cannot.  

I think what made the steak for me - and may break it for some - was the union of steak + butter.  Your plate has a thin layer of butter that coats every bite.  By the end of your steak, it's gone and you're left with just the meat.  But's still a perfectly cooked steak, so it's really not a problem.

I enjoyed how nicely dressed the other patrons were.  I hate getting dressed up and seeing some ass-clown in Levi's and a polo.  Everyone here was the upper crust.  Just like me.
author: Anthony D.

description:
I highly recommend reservations: there was a long wait at the door when we had finished our meal.

The ambiance of the dining room at the front of the building is much nicer than the main dining room.  It is more intimate and has a cozier feeling and is less noisy, so you can actually hear your dinner conversation.

We started with the Seared Ahi Tuna starter, which was divine.  The Tune was better than the sahimi grade Tuna at our favorite Sushi restaurant.  I had the filet mignon, which was very good.  I did enjoy the butter (and was not surprised by it because I had read about the way the steaks are prepare on their website.)  My boyfriend had the Kobe Rib Eye: it was very good, but the fat marbling was more than I was in the mood for.  The side of creamed spinach was delicious, but the potatoes au gratin had a tad too much cheese for our tastes.

The food was very good and worth the money, since you are paying for the ambiance as well.  Our server was very good and attentive.  We eneded our dinner with the lemon sorbet and was very surprised at how huge the serving was.

Would definitely go back as a treat.
author: Cindy L.

description:
There are better steak houses in town such as House of Prime Rib, Morton's, or even Houston's--maybe that's why you almost never need a reservation or long wait here.  Ruth's is a good backup when all else fails.  The place was not busy on prime time Saturday night...maybe an omen of things to come or does lowered expectations make for a better experience?

Atmosphere
Same as any other steak house.  I did not like the assembly line seating of the two person tables though.

Food
Since I've only been here once, I can't speak of the food in its entirety.  From what I had, the steaks were good--not great, but good.  The sides weren't too fatty or buttery.  Ironically, I can make better sides at home (except maybe their sauces).
The wine list--hmm, the wine list leaves much to be desired.  It's a rather large wine list but sometimes quantity isn't so nice as quality in a restaurant of this supposed caliber.  They have my favorite--Jordan's, but overpriced and not the year I like, which is indicative of my overall experience with the wine and restaurant in general.
Their warm chocolate fudge pound cake is perfect and I really do mean perfect--not too sweet, just the right amount of chocolate, fudge, moisture, etc. 

Staff
The waitress was exceptional but I would expect no less in a fine dining restaurant such as this.

For $45+ steaks, I would prefer better steak knives and plating.
author: Billy C.

description:
Eh. Can I say disappointing? I heard a lot of good reviews from my friends about this place so I was really excited to try the steak. Needless to say I was very disappointed.  They burned my steak, the meat was TOUGH, DRY and chewy (even with the butterfly cut)   I've had better steaks for way less money.   The side dishes were "so-so", nothing spectacular about them. I ordered the calamari for an appetizer and it was....well, odd. It was drowned in a sweet and sour sauce and reminiscent of the orange chicken from panda express.  We ordered an appetizer, two sides, and two fillet mignon which came out to $130. If you ask me, it was NOT worth it.
I do have to say the service was excellent! Too bad the food was not.
author: Abby A.

description:
I had the best Fillet Mignon I've ever eaten!  It was so juicy and tender and perfectly cooked (med/rare).  Just for sh!ts and giggles I tried cutting the steak with only my fork... It worked!  The steak was so soft and tender I didn't even need a knife.
Only down side is that the food is a la carte.  I ordered some au gratin potatoes that were terrific.  Also some creamed spinach that was equally wonderful.  For dessert, some yummy creme brulee with fresh berries on top.  Soooo good!
This place is expensive, but worth it.  Expect to pay at least $150 for 2 people.
author: Lil B.

description:
Had a great evening with friends here! I had the Ruth's Chris Classic, which is a whole meal with salad, side, and dessert, for 39.99 or more depending what entree you choose. I got the stuffed chicken which had flavorful crispy skin and the creamy stuffing part kept everything on the inside juicyyy. Great salad, side of creamed spinach, plus a bottle of Malbec :) Only complaint really is that the dessert that came with the meal was pretty ordinary. 

It was too much food for me so I took home half the chicken and creamed spinach; it tasted just as delicious the next day, which is a plus!
author: Ann T.

description:
As boring as they can be, I enjoy chain steakhouses.  Since Morton's doesn't begin serving dinner until 5:30 pm and I needed to be finished by 6:30, I suggested Ruth's Chris instead.

Reservations are definitely not needed at 5:00 pm on a Monday night... and you can expect to be showered with attention as the dinner crowd has yet to pile in.

Obviously this place is expensive, but if you find someone with an expense account, then it's a perfect choice for a little (or a lot) of steak, side dishes, and delectable desserts.

Their wine list was awesome... everything was Napa/Sonoma (some Williamette pinot noirs) or Russian River Valley.  We didn't order wine, but they had practically all of my favorite bottles.

I went with the 3-course special for $39.95.  I began with the caesar salad.  It had a little too much dressing, but it was delicious.  For my main course, I chose the 6 oz. filet (medium well) with shrimp.  Both were so tender/flavorful, I wish I could just go back and recreate the experience.  For side dishes, I had the mashed potatoes (sinfully buttery, with a hint of garlic) and creamed spinach.  Both were of course, fantastic.  Dessert was a small chocolate mousse cup with two blueberries on top, and a small square of ginger-carrot cake.  We were pressed for time, so they were kind enough to box them up to take home.

Everything about this meal was superb and I'd enthusiastically recommend this place to anyone willing to spend big on dinner.  Don't burn yourself on the 500 degree plates!
author: Lindsay M.

description:
The steak was adequate. The meat itself was of decent quality and the cooking done with skillful execution. But I think to a certain degree the buttery pond that swaddled my meat ultimately distracted and masqued any of the subtler flavors. Same goes for my cream of spinach.

Service was cheerful and diligent. Ambiance and decor fit the bill of a nice steakhouse establishment (and it's better lit than house of prime rib).

A good meal with friends, but I wouldn't call it an epiphany
author: R L.

description: Yuck!  So many better places to get steak in this town - that don't need to hide the delicate flavor of steak under a soup of greasy sauce.
author: Melaina E.

description: This restaurant is just dang fine! It is a hospitable retreat, especially when chilly outside, and your steak comes sizzling on a 400 degree plate. Service was attentive here. Both myself and my partner ordered the Cowboy ribeye and we were not disappointed. The steaks are more than enough for 2 people in themselves. This is just plain good steak and the flavor is awesome. Ordered the sweet potato caserole, which had brown sugar and pecans on top, maybe some vanilla hidden inside the sweet potato...it was just awesome. The plate was still sizzlin halfway into meal. This restaurant is pricey...paid $130 for 2 steak dinners with one side and no fancy drinks. But you can't compain...the steak is worth it! They do have price fixed menus for the more budget conscious.
author: Tara C.

description: Definitely good food, and the service was good also.  The crab cakes were the best I have had! Will be going back soon !
author: Marie K.

description: Sat at the bar on a dead Monday night.. First time at a Ruth's Chris and I wasn't expecting much... Got their 3 course deal for $40. Pretty sure the bread was bought at the supermarket up the street. Onion soup was decent, steak was very tasty, cooked very rare like I like it.. Scotch on the rocks $18!!!! Come on, really...?  Overall decent steakhouse, definitely would not rush back.
author: Mike J.

description:
another belated bday dinner :D we went to ruth chris and also went for the dine about town menu

we had the:
2 house salad- balsamic vinegarette
ribeye-  the meat wasn't as nice as i thought it'd be. a lil dry
grilled chicken cordon blue-he loved it.. loved all the sauces
creamed spinach-bland
mash potatoes-blah
2 deserts-pots de creme and chocolate mousse with berries

overall it can all be better. for the price i can compare it to other steak joints and have had better... would go to alexanders again.. but not ruth chris
author: KK M.

description: I went here to have a nice dinner with my husband. I made reservations for 6:15, but got there about 15 minutes earlier. They seated us immediately. Our server, Courtney was very courteous and friendly.  As usual, the food was perfect. Their creme brulee and cream with berries is to die for and relatively affordable when compared to the prices for everything else. This place is great for an intimate dinner or a first date (if you really want to impress), but it is expensive. Be prepared to shell out about $50 a person.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I was pretty skeptical about this place, and was fully prepared to feel unsatisfied. Everyone I know rants and raves about this place, which left me thinking, come on, how good can it be?! The service was EXCELLENT. They use your names the whole meal, are very patient, and help in your selection without upselling everything. I had the petit filet with prawns and it was hands down the best piece of beef I've ever put in my mouth. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the fact that everything comes a la carte is ridiculous. Just charge an extra $5-10 for the steak and have it include a side. 

Yeah, it's pricey, but I knew that going into it so I didn't go into sticker shock. Besides, I think the best way to go into this experience is with the pedal to the metal. It's delicious food and it's going to be expensive no matter what, so stop worrying about it and just enjoy it!

I will definitely be returning for that delicious delicious beef...
author: Jessica B.

description:
As a veggie, this place is awesome.  My bf orders whatever slab-o-meat he wants, I order whatever sides I want and we both go home stuffed and full of leftovers.  

We showed up 45 minutes late for our reservation but since we had called ahead and told them we would be late, they held it for us and were seated within 5 minutes on a Saturday night.  C'mon, they deserve a star just for that!  

However, you do have to be careful about ordering water cause they will hit you for that expensive stuff.  But c'mon, I go there expecting to spend $$$ anyways, so why change it at that point?
author: Lauren R.

description:
This is one of the places I wish I could choose 10 stars

Cowboy ribeye! 
appetizers and wine and sides and desserts are all excellent but when I go here I only think one thing

when am I getting my cowboy ribeye?

You see, I'm one of those guys that like their steaks rare with a sprinkle of salt and a waterfall of butter

actually, not so much on the butter, but you know what? It's freakin butter, I mean come on! Who am I to refuse butter to the party in my mouth? He's on my VIP list, red carpet treatment, hand-in-hand with the ribeye looking all classy.  Everytime I hear ruth's chris I get that dreamy look on my face, and I reminisce to those beautiful nights of blissful fullness. Ahh...

which by the way, get the banana cream pie dessert, DAMN
author: Kevin C.

description:
Goddamn the bill was expensive...  
Yes it was quite divine...  another very tasty cowboy ribeye.  Ruth's Chris doesn't fail me when it comes to steaks and my first visit to the SF location was no exception.  
I just wish it wasn't so freakin' expensive...  I don't like to think of my wallet when looking at the menu and deciding on what to order, but damn, maybe next time I should skip the starters, drink from a flask on the cab ride over, and bring a bottle of wine (of course pay corkage) and maybe, just maybe my share of the bill will be under 3 digits.  Still though, it was a great meal, in a very nice setting, with awesome service.  I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't so darn pricey.
author: Dan G.

description:
It never ceases to amaze me how freaking good the food is here.  This chain has got the art of cooking meat down to a science.  Maybe I've been spending too much time in Las Vegas, but I have to say that the price isn't all that bad, and definitely worth what you pay.  

On this visit I was celebrating my anniversary.  Apparently the wait staff had all been informed, and made pleasant reference to it throughout the night.

Don't forget to polish off a couple of my FAVORITE Key Lime martinis on your next visit.
author: Morgan T.

description:
The place to go when you're in the mood for a good steak. Went on Valentine's day. Made reservations a few weeks in advance and still had to wait about 30 minutes, but c'mon, it's one of the busiest restaurant days of the year. It was nice that we could go and grab a drink in the bar while looking over the menu to get an idea of what to order. The host was even good enough to walk around calling out names so you didn't have to lurk by the front door.
Went with the lobster bisque, scallops, ribeye, potatoes au gratin, creamed spinach and cheesecake. All were solid choices which I'd get again. The steak was delicious, really the only thing I was looking forward to that night. Overall a pleasant experience!
author: Bobby M.

description:
I bet you cant finish their Cowboy Ribeye steak...
It's as big as the hot plate its sitting on! Warning- it's very high scale, so act like you been outside before! Oh by the way, the last time I went there the Oakland Raiders were all eating in the banquet room. So if you like them and want their autographs, you might catch them there...OR if you wanna go there to kick their ass...you might catch them there too...but dont tell them I tipped y'all off. I'm not trying to get involved with none of that ;0)
Service is very good and the food is definately worth the price. So if you want to impress someone or just go out for a celebration dinner, this is a good choice.
author: Claire S.

description:
This was a great birthday dinner. That was back in March and I still compare steaks to what I had then. The ambiance was nice and generally had a better feel than House of Prime Rib. The service here was excellent!

My medium rare filet was cooked perfectly....mmmmm, I can still remember my first bites. True, a lot of butter is used, but one must expect that many restaurants use a lot of butter in their cooking. For my sides I had the sweet potato casserole and broiled tomatoes. Both were just as wonderful and memorable as my filet. The finale was my creme brulee...and the fact that bf took me here for my birthday!
author: Cynthia D.

description:
My boyfriend took me here a few weeks ago.  We had made reservations prior, so we were seated immediately.  They sat us right next to the kitchen; it was very loud and took away from the ambiance.  My BF spoke with the host and requested to be re-seated.  They were very prompt and gave us a booth in a different area.  

Our server was very knowledgeable and had a lot of recommendations.  In the end, I ordered the filet and the BF had the cowboy ribeye.  They were both cooked perfectly (medium to medium rare).  They came out sizzling on hot plates (kinda cool) to apparently keep the meat warm as you eat throughout the whole meal.  

I thought my filet was good, til I tried his cut.  Rib-eye's just naturally have a lot more marbling, so it was very juicy and tender.   They were both very good, the filet being on the leaner side.  It was a little bland for my BF, so he had some steak sauce with his meat.

We ordered the sauteed mushrooms and the hashbrown as our sides.  The mushrooms were bland, and tasteless.  The hashbrown was good- crispy on the outside, with a perfectly cooked inside.  

We both had a glass of merlot to complement the dinner.  When we were deciding, we had 2 wines that we were torn between.  Our server was very helpful and gave us tastes of both to decide.  I can't remember the name of the wine, but it was $20/glass.  Very tasy, perfect with our dinner.  

Overall, nice place for dinner/date.  Service is impeccable.  Food, pretty good.  Ambiance, nice.
author: Jenny K.

description: my soup was good, i had tomato basil. my friends has lobster soup, hash brown, and salad. they liked there appetizers.
