What was worth extra money however, was the pecan crusted sweet potatoes - what a fabulous side.  I've never had such yummy sweet potatoes, though some might say its a tad too sweet, with the brown sugar pecan topping.  Though my tongue was singed after having my first burning mouthful (cause it was HOT from the oven), all I could say was 'Omigod! this is good!"

For dessert, I got the key lime pie - wow! wow! wow!  The best key lime pie I've ever had and the whole table wholeheartedly agreed with me.  They gave a GENEROUS slice of pie and it was a slice of heaven.  Foodgasm right then and there.  We were underwhelmed by the bread pudding though, but it couldn't help but be overshadowed by the kick-ass key lime.

Service was a little off (water and bread basket not being re-filled, despite requests; our leftover desserts being smashed together in a takeout box) but our waiter was nice.  Overall, a great place to eat and treat the folks out.  I'm not sure that I could have afforded this place without the DAT menu, but I'd certainly try to come back here and at least get more of the sweet potatoes and key lime pie.
author: Angela H.

description: Too much butter on their steaks.  A steak doesn't need that much butter to be dripping soaked.  I rather go to House of Prime Rib across the street for a good piece of meat.
author: Van N.

description: let me just start by saying this, i am not a steak eater, something i dont crave, most likely because am semi like a chef and have yet to taste something that can convert me into a steak eater, and i must say BOY THIS STEAK IS GOOOD!!! ofcouse any professional chef would tell you, a good steak is left pure, no salt, no butter, nada! you let the marbelization of the fat of steak do the talking , however, these people even though they might cheat a little, they acentuate the flavor of the steak, its like having a great piece of salmon, you add just a tad bit of lemon, or smoke it over a soaked wood and cook, the great piece of salmon would be more prominent taste, yet the other ingridients will harmonize to create an esquistie exprience and thats exactly what Ruth Chris did! soo worth the money. Hey you only live ounce! so why not
author: cristina s.

description: Honestly, I don't get it.  Why so much love for this "mediocre at best"  chain steakhouse?  Well, the food was mediocre, the initial service was appalling!  So much so, that we had to ask for a new server.  Actually, I will add a star for the sweet girl who took over for us.  It was a one star review.  Do yourself a favor and head over to Harris' or Alexanders for an overall better experience.
author: Lauren I.

description: Hands down, best steakhouse in the city!! I've had several occasions here, Special occasions,  this restaurant had dim light setting which gave that romantic kinda feel for you and your significant other. The food was absolutely delicious, well worth the 4  $$$$ that the restaurant is rated for when it comes to price ranges, The food portion was fair, where it would not leave you asking " where's the rest of my food?"  The waiters are trained to ask if you have ever been here, if your answer is no.. they'll give you a full break down of how they cook and prepare their meats that brings out the best in each dish that they serve their customers. You can really tell the quality of a restaurant by the amount of knowledge that a waiter knows about how their food is made. GREAT FOOD, GOOD SERVICE, Must go here if you're looking to try steaks the way that it should be prepared. Not to mention that when I called to make reservations, they've asked me if it was for a special occasion, if you told them yes, they would make special arrangement of rose pedals at your table and a complimentary brownie with the words happy anniversary !
author: Jeff C.

description: Love Ruth's Chris.  I've come for DAT a few times and have enjoyed it every time.  The salad was a little wimpy but that's fine considering it wasn't the highlight of the evening by any means.  The petite filet was the perfect size and tenderness, and the mashed potatoes had some butteryness to it that was just magical.  And service, as always, was impeccable.  This is the case study for why and how restaurants should participate in DAT - when craving steak, I would totally come back to Ruth's even under non-DAT circumstances.
author: Melinda C.

description:
Went here with my family. Good steaks and i must say a side of mash potatoes in not what you would think! Its like a whole bowl of it, love it. Very classy place and i guess expensive but better than Alexanders in San Jose. Very good service and not a long wait, should reserve though!

Do it classy right and come here!
author: Francis J.

description:
Just thought I'd add this for all you Ruth's Chris lovers, or people who wanted to give this place a try.  I got an email about a Summer special $89 3-course meal dinner for two.  I actually prefer Morton's over Ruth Chris, but this is a great deal that we'll probably get.  One more thing, I'd recommend the sweet potato casserole as a side dish...I almost like it more then the steak.

"Summer Celebration for Two: $89

Start your summer off right by joining us for the Summer Celebration at Ruth's Chris. You and a guest can enjoy 2 three- course meals for $89. Begin with a soup or salad, followed by an entre and a side dish. Choose from five entre courses, including our signature filet, our fresh fish selection or our delicious chicken. End your evening sharing one of our homemade desserts. There's cause for celebration this summer at Ruth's Chris. Available for a limited time. "



FIRST COURSE - Choice of one per guest
Caesar Salad Steak House Salad
Louisiana Seafood Gumbo
Ceaser Salad

ENTREE - Choice of one per guest
Fresh Fish Selection
Petite Filet
Chicken
Sizzling Blue Crab Cakes
4 oz. filet, chicken, 1 crab cake

SIDES - Choose two to share
Steamed Broccoli
Sauted Mushrooms
Broiled Tomatoes
Creamed Spinach
Potatoes au Gratin
Garlic Mashed Potatoes
Julienne Potatoes


DESSERT - Choose one to share
Bread Pudding
Berries & Cream
Cheesecake
Ice Cream
Sorbet
Apple Crumb Tart
author: Cal H.

description: Love the ribeye. Served sizzling and drizzled with butter. yum yum yum!
author: Helen L.

description:
I had very mixed feelings about Ruth's Chris steakhouse.  It started off bad.  25 minute wait when I had reservations.  While waiting we got to hear the hostest and a waitress gossiping instead of working.  They happened to be talking shit about other customers, while in ear shot of customers.  Not the best way to give a good impression of the staff.

Once we were finally seated the waitress we had at our table was great.  The food was really delicious and rest of the evening was quite enjoyable.  For the steaks and food I would recommend the place but hope some of the staff will be replaced with more professional employees fitting a high end restaurant.
author: Jimbi J.

description: if u like buttered steaks this is the spot to go, not my cup of tea, eaten here twice once for dine about town and another with group of friends, dine bout town was maybe a 8 oz steak with app and dessert included for $30 you cant go wrong, steak a little tough not as tender I would expect it to be, I always order med-rare, second time around i ordered the porterhouse for two, same as last time med-rare steak was tough not tender at all butter sitting on bottom of plate, dont know wut the craze is all about, again not my cup of tea I guess.
author: Clarence A.

description:
sizzling butter...blue cheese crusted steak cooked to medium rare.. GAHHH it was a melt in your mouth experience. i swear i said "MMMMM" after every bite i took. and my other favorite part? the bread and oh so soft and salty butter!!! 

my boyfriend and i just hit up ruth's chris this past week for our anniversary, which so conveniently landed on the first day of Dine About Town. i would say this restaurant has the best deal for their pre fixe menu. where else can you get a salad, steak (or choice of 3 other entrees), a side and dessert to share for $34.50? 

the only thing that we were irked about was that we had reservations for 8:15 but weren't seated until 9pm. but all good, we squeezed a drink or two in between the wait. i was surprised at how large the restaurant was. and it was crowded, so understandable to that it would be a wait i guess? the ambiance was nice, felt like how a fine dining steak house should be. we got a booth and it totally felt romantic.  our server was nice and funny too and he even acknowledged our anniversary. (he told us that we could have both desserts instead of just sharing one...if we could even handle it. and of course we couldn't because we were STUFFED, we even had a doggy bag to bring home. but he did bring out a dessert with candles and all. it was cute) 

loved loved loved this place. if you're going for DAT, order the 8oz petite filet with a blue cheese crust cooked medium rare, trussst me you won't be disappointed
author: Anh P.

description: Expected Ritz Carlton class but the service was mediocre and the food was too buttery. Everything ordered was drowing in butter.  A 3 person meal with 1 bottle of wine came out to almost $300.00 but I felt it wasn't too worth it. Also, it's so dark in there that you can't tell whether the food's getting into your nose or your mouth let alone be able to fully see the person's face on the other end of the table...
author: Mashimaro M.

description: Awful, crappy, chain, tourist-trap restaurant. The service was the worst service I think I've ever had.  Ours waiter's name was Jack and it took him 20 minutes to bring 2 glasses of wine to the table. Are you kidding me? My friend compared his steak (filet) to plywood. All 3 of us ended up sending our steaks back.  We ordered filets (2 were supposed to be in between med rare and medium and one was upposed to be medium).  As the menu states, medium rare is a WARM RED CENTER.  Our steaks arrive and ALL THREE are COLD RED CENTERS. They come back and they are all overcooked. So I  did some bitching and got one of the steaks and desserts for free. That was the only good part of the meal.  Skip this place and go to HARRIS'S on Van Ness and Pacific.
author: Jenny W.

description: I stopped in for a steak. Sat at the Bar. My knife was dull, either that or My Steak Was Tough!  I think both. Was not impressed with San Francisco's atmosphere. I used to dine in Beverly Hills Ruth Chris. Had a better experience there. I did not like the tough steak. Filet Mignon it was, and I have never had one that tough, and could hardly cut it with their steak knife. Did not like the atmosphere there. I really Prefer HARRIS STEAK HOUSE , on Van Ness. I like that better
author: Marie M.

description: The filets are fantastic and flavorful.  The Key Lime pie is the best I have ever had. The only mystery to me is why I have gotten the exact same table the past 3 times I was there.
author: Dick L.

description: Would not go back. Service was lacking in many ways.  To start with the end, we were presented with bill while still waiting at least 15 min for "dessert".  explain soon. Went for the special San Francisco Dine about Town.  My friend and I have been trying restaurants for the special, and find it is a nice draw in, but we always end up ordering from main menu.Had to ask for the special menu, and was strongly discouraged to order from it. Was a weird exchange...Overall, not worth  the price, and you must enjoy  ALL of your food slathered in butter.  That was all I tasted from every dish.   Oh, and because I did decide to try the DAT menu, my house salad was visibly less than 1/2 size of others around me with gross , boxed croutons, and not even tossed. Just a huge glob of dressing in middle of salad. Could not eat. Only good part of the dinner was the spicy lobster appetizer. Made for a great opening only to  go downhill from there.  To end with a plain chocolate cupcake was almost embarrassing. And to wait 20 min for a cocktail and glass of wine is just wrong. Oh, and they were out of the bottle of wine ordered, which was not the least expensive one either!!  The more I think about it, the less happy I am with my dining experience.
author: M N.

description:
I'm not sure I even need to write a review scince it has 700+ already. 

Anyways, I've been here a couple of times now with some friends. I must say, they are consistent. I would suggest getting the Rib Eye instead of the sirloin. The sirloin is just too dry and tough here. The Rib Eye has enough fat in it to keep it juicy, and the butter just adds to it! 

Corking fee is $15, which is pretty standard these days. The desserts are just meh, I could have gone without it. The cream spinach is good, but house of prime rib is better. The mashed taters were okay, and so were the mushrooms. 

What surprised me was the Chilean sea bass they have on the menu. It was surprisingly good!
author: Josh M.

description:
Went for our anniversary dinner! Made reservations for 730pm sunday night and when we got there, we went right to our table which had rose petals all over it.
We started off with the calamari appetizer which was to die for!!!
We then were going to get the DAT special but hubby wanted the rib eye and I also wanted a regular petite. So for 50 dollars a piece, we ended up getting the classic menu. We ordered a yummy bottle of cab also. Each meal came with a starter- He got the cesar salad and I got the lobster bisque, which was amazing! As I mentioned he got the rib eye and I got the filet and for sides he got the potatos au graitin and I ordered the satueed mushrooms. Everyone was delicious. The meal also included a chocolate cake which tasted like fudge, with sauce and fersh fruit. YUMMY!! 
The steaks were very yummy and the filete melted in my mouth. Very Very delicious!!! Bill was pretty high 195, but it was our first anniversary..
author: Corrina S.

description: For DAT, its a must to try out, doesn't get better than a ~$50 3 course meal.  Sure you might die of a heart attack after that buttered steak but man at least you felt like u died and went to heaven.  Although the appettizer salad was bleh, the 12 oz rib eye made up for it.  Mucho buttery goodness mMmMmMmMmMmMm.  For dessert I had a key lime pie that tasted like a key lime pie not a key lemon pie!  A must go for DAT if you can get the reservations.
author: Clifford C.

description: I ate here with a large group of people from work.  My fillet Mignon was nicely prepared medium rare and the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were quite good, but it seems as though it is restaurant policy to put butter in everything except for the drinks.  Don't get me wrong, I love butter, but sometimes there is too much of a good thing.  Even though I did not pay for my meal, I did look at the prices on the menu and I truly believe that you could get the same caliber of food at a more moderately priced restaurant.  The ambiance and the neighborhood do match its price range, though.
author: Rick E.

description: Customer service was superb. Steak was one of the best I have tasted. I would love to come back but the price is kind of a killer.
author: Amy C.

description: Took my wife here for Mother's Day and was a little disappointed.  Her stuffed chicken was very good  but my Ribeye was just ok. Should have gone with the New York.   Service was not great either. We had to keep reminding for water and bread refills.  Will think twice before dropping the bucks at this place again.
author: Robert B.

description: Wassup Ruth?  My filet mignon wasn't much better than I'd imagine getting at an outback steakhouse (never been to one of those).  I've been to Ruth's in other cities that were awesome.  Great baked potato but also not the best I've ever had.  Maybe I just got a sad cow.  Maybe I'll try visiting here again someday in my lifelong quest for the ultimate filet mignon...
author: P H I L H.

description: Dine about town 2008 - I loved this place.  This was my first time there.  I went w/2 other friends whose been to Ruth Chris before but at different locations.  We were all very pleased.  I had the 12oz Rib eye, creamed spinach and the key lime pie.  I asked for my meat to be medium well w/little to no pink and was so surprised when it came out it was EXACTLY the way I wanted it.  MMM MMM good!!!!  The creamy spinach could have used a little more salt for my taste but that was ok because I just sprinkled some one.  I was not a fan of the key lime pie as I never am.  My friend had the bread pudding and we traded.  It was great because it was nice and warm.  I could have used less whiskey (or whatever alcohol they use).  GREAT!!!
author: Sandra S.

description: I took my boyfriend here for his 27th b-day.  He is a big meat lover so I knew he'd appreciate.  He ordered the special, which was the Kobe steak and $60 (yikes!) and I had the usual filet mignon.  I swear, when he received his steak, he didn't talk to me for at least 2 minutes.  He was so enamored, so tantalized, so caught up in the rapture that was the Kobe steak that he could barely tear himself away from it.  He drooled that it was  the best steak he ever had.  I nodded back knowingly.  He also raved about their potatoes and broccoli.  After that he highly agreed that we should go back.  And go back we did...
author: Andrea B.

description:
A carnivore's paradise!
Great steak and side dishes that come with an array of choices for wine lovers. Impeccable service too. I would say that this place is at par or maybe even better than Morton's. We came here for Dine About Town and THIS place is a deal if you can make it around this time of the year.
author: Vincent L.

description: One of the best steak houses in the San Francisco area.  I've been here twice and the food was excellent.  There are a few athletes and celebrities that go there once in a while. When i went there i ordered the rib eye and garlic mashed potatoes. The steak came out the way i liked it. The food is a bit pricey but it's well worth paying for quality steak. Though the downside was parking. Parking was hard to find. You can either park on the side street or you can have it Vallet'd.  When i was there yesterday the Quarterback, Jamarcus Russel, had his car (S550) towed for parking in the loading zone.
author: Ray P.

description: The best seats surround the bar as far as i'm concerned, the Bartenders are jovial and social (Jose is my favorite).If you have to take a table ask for Elyse or Daria they are hilarious and lovely. As far as dinning is concerned they understand black and blue better than  most steakhouses, the lamb chops are fantastic and don't forget to get  the sweet potato casserole.
author: ani g.

description: The NY steak I ordered was mostly tender but marbled with very tough white veins of tissue, difficult to cut even with a steak knife. Even cutting around them left me with a steak that was floating in butter. I don't like the subtle flavors of my steak drowned out by the strong flavor of butter. I much prefer steaks at Harris'.
author: Hamid M.

description: HEAVEN!!.. thats what I was thinking after chewing a piece of my 1 inch thick cut t-bone steak. Who cares if it was pricey.. Who cares if it was drenched in a stick of butter. Who cares if its unhealthy.. But damn this was a good piece of meat. The tasty creamed spinach will also keep you floating in heaven. I ate everything on my plate along with the sides and even all the extra butter on my plate from my steak.  I even used my fingers on my bone. Oops! But I didnt care. It was too good to pass up. Im definitely going back here sooner than later!
author: jay d.

description: Ruth's chris' had to have been the best steakhouse I've ever been to. The restaurant was elegant and their waiters and waitresses, even the bus men were very sophisticated and their service was incomparable.  Not only that, their steaks were unrivaled to any other steakhouse I've had the chance to dine on.  If you want a recommendation I would say to have the fillet because it is exquisite, although the new York was fantastic as well. You definitely cannot go wrong by choosing either. If you are ever in the bay area and are in need of quality and first-class sustenance be sure to check out Ruth's chris steak house. You will not be disappointed!
author: Danny T.

description:
I've been here a few times and can honestly say that Ruth's Chris Steak House serves the best steak. Believe it or not, you don't even have to use A-1!

ATMOSPHERE:
On VanNess, it is certainly hard to find parking. My recommendation is to bite the bullet and pay the $10 for valet. The restaurant's interior is dark and formal. It has a bit of a stuffy feel to it. I expected to see the place populated with old white couples, but instead, there was quite a mix. (Oldies were probably at Sizzlers).

SERVICE:
Service was very good. They were very understanding that I got lost and was 40 minutes late. They kept our drinks full and did not judge us (on the outside) when filling up our bread baskets 3 times. Our waiter was very nice and polite and described in detail how each meat is cooked (rare vs. medium rare) and brought out our food quite promptly.

MENU:
I've been here for a regular dinner before (and the menu was chockful of great cuts of meat and other stuff), but this time, I went for Dine About Town. We were allowed to choose from 4 entrees (rib-eye, filet, chicken or lobster), 2 sides (mashed potatoes or creamed spinach) and 2 desserts (key lime pie and bread pudding). The salad was fixed.

FOOD:
Really good! The bread was great and they served it with moussed butter (as opposed to block of ice butter). We also ordered the fried calamari and scallops for appetizers. The calamari was very good even though it didn't have a dip. The scallops were disappointing as they had no taste. The salad was iceberg, arugula and baby lettuces with cherry tomatoes, garlic croutons and red onions. It was just OK - nothing special. The steak was great and exactly how the waiter described it. I was bummed I wasn't able to finish it. Darn bread!! For a side dish, I got the mashed potatoes which looked boring but were really creamy and savory. The creamed spinach was very good as well. I would recommend the mashed potatoes but only by a hair. The dessert was excellent! (as they always are). The bread pudding would have been 10x better with vanilla ice cream. The key lime pie was fantastic. It was very tart and creamy. My mouth is watering as I type.

VALUE:
Had we skipped out on the 2 appetizers, it would have only been $31.95 which is incredible being that a filet alone would easily cost that amount. I love Dine About Town. Rumor has it they are having another one in the Summer. Keep your eyes peeled.

OVERALL:
Great!! I felt fat and gross afterwards, but when do I not?? I had been craving meat for a long time and with everyone on their New Years diets, I'd been frantic looking for someone to go with. What luck that a friend asked me. It has completely satisfied my craving. Yay Ruth's Chris!! Ruth rocks at making steak and owning a Chris!
author: Alice H.

description: The service and decor were what you expect from a restaurant of this caliber.  For the most bang for your buck, go during Dine About Town.  My palate isn't refined enough to justify spending this much on a steak during any other time.
author: Rochelle F.

description: Juicy piece of filet mignon covered in sizzling butter? Who could say no to that?! I just took advantage of Dine About Town and indulged in Ruthies for the first time. Petit Filet, Mashed Potatoes and Bread Pudding. Pure Heaven. If you love your food swimming in butter, come here! Even my co-worker who hates EVERYTHING, couldn't stop raving about how great this place is. I concur.
author: Karla G.

description: Been coming to this place for years and usually everything is great, so I decided to go here for valentines day. Called in made my reservation a month in advance, guess what they some how cancelled it and had the nerve to tell me that it was I who cancelled??? WTF? Seriously? After talking to the manager I got seated even though they were really packed. So far so good, when the food arrived my order was wrong so I sent it back. When I got my food back they added what was missing and returned me a well done steak instead of a medium rare steak. I sent back the food again being very polite, the waiter took my plate with the steak and sides that I placed on the plate along with all of my utensils for what ever reason. Now I didn't have my food done right twice and couldn't eat anything while my fiancée food wad getting cold. Finally 15 minutes later I got my steak back, but the plate once full of sides was now empty and no utensils to eat the food with. I decided to not make a fuss about it and tried to enjoy rest of my diner. Seriously I've been coming to this place for over ten years and this experience will probably make me reconsider coming to this place ever again.
author: Vlad M.

description:
I had a good experience here overall.  I ordered the filet mignon, medium rare.  It came out on a very hot plate which I accidentally touched (OUCH!  Make sure you don't touch the plates right when they come out!).  The filet had a huge piece of melting butter on top of it, which made it realllllllllly good.  However, if you eat as slow as I do, by the time you are half way done with the meal the butter would start to re-solidify on your plate, which is not too appetizing.  Our table ordered the shoestrings and spinach au gratin sides to share.  The spinach was good, but nothing spectacular.  The shoestrings were very addictive, it was like eating bits of (expensive!) potato chips.

A few of my friends ordered the rib eye, and they were disappointed with it.  It came drenched in some kind of sauce that was pretty salty.  

For dessert we ordered the chocolate molten cake, which was delicious!  Even the people who said they didn't want dessert were picking at it as fast as they could.  We ate the whole thing in a few minutes.
author: Mary L.

description: I just went for my birthday!! And boy was it great! It was a cute place for a date for just one on one.... Granted I could have done without them calling me Mrs. (insert my boyfriend's last name here). I steak was perfect and my boyfriends lamb was great too!!! The only reason I am giving them a 4 is because it was a little pricy on a college kid budget.... granted my boyfriend paid and for that I am sooooooo greatfull! He's such a great guy. A la carte---- does that mean over priced haha just kidding!!!
author: Shadae H.

description: The steaks were great! I my companion and I both got Petite Filets, which was just the right amount of food. The dinner for two was very filling, supplying an appetizer, second, side and dessert. I felt like the service was real and not pretentious at all. The wait staff was helpful and friendly, and there was absolutely no wait to be seated. I would recommend this place to my friends!
author: Benjamin M.

description:
Had a dinner there on Saturday night.   Arrived early (about 530 -- an hour or so before the reservation).   No problems, were seated right away.  

The overall service was fine, although the waitress seemed to be wearing the same uniform she had for the past several shifts, as her apron looked like she'd been working as a line cook at Denny's.  It was filthy.    I would think that they could afford to give the employee's clean clothes on a daily basis.

The salad and appetizers were quite good.   Fresh arugula and stuff mushrooms.

The steaks were extremely disappointing.   While cooked to the desired temperature, they were extremely tough...  Not what you would expect, and not what I have gotten in the past at other Ruth's Chris or competitors such as Del Friscos, etc.   The steaks were so tough, we actually asked, and were given, a sharper knife....

The side dishes, sauteed mushrooms and spinach were lackluster to say the best.   It seemed like the point of the spinach as to see how much overcooked spinach they could pack into the serving bowl.  The mushrooms were soggy and flavorless.

Didn't have desert.

I get the feeling Ruth's Chris has turned into a big tourist trap chain and has not retained it's tradition of excellence.

I would find a better steak place.

Overall expensive and underwhelming!!!!
author: Jack K.

description: After seeing the infamous steak in airplane magazines for years I finally got to try Ruth's a few years ago. I have not forgotten the the steak in all this time though. The first time I went I got the infamous fillet and enjoyed it. But after that I found out that my cut is the ribeye medium rare. Everyone has a favorite and for me the ribeye is it. I went back and got the ribeye which was also deliciously juicy and tasty. The side dishes are big. I like the creamed spinach myself. Expect to pay for a good meal but it's worth it.
author: Johnny J.

description: Came during the Dine About Town deal...well worth it! I got the petite filet, which was cooked to perfection. I think they purposely undercook to what you asked for b/c they serve it on a hotttt dish. So, your meat will still be cooking somewhat when it reaches your table. And the key lime pie was gooood. The only complaint I have is their staff is very inconsistent. Your server changes with every dish you get, so they easily mess up on who ordered what...inexcusable mistakes at a high quality restaurant. But overall...I would go back!
author: Wendy L.

description: Someone needs to call them and tell them BUTTER IS NOT THE MAIN INGREDIENT!!!! I have to admit that everything was very good, but the steak sizzling in butter was a bit tooo much (BUTTER). Dinner for two was just under $200...with no wine... a bit pricey...I would return...but ask them to go light on the BUTTER!!!
author: Jamie K.

description: wowwwwwww this place pisses me off!!! Went here last week for my first time and it was fine, left all dandy and all, but then I check my card bill and noticed my total was different from what I put down and remembered. I had to call my bank and the steak house, and realized that my server added another $10 to his tip on my bill!!! Wtf!!!!!! Such bad hospitality and service, especially because my tip was split among 3 friends, and mine was on the low end to equal it out among the other tips. Makes me very angry that they are deceiving, and when I spoke to the manager, she seemed like she was speaking to me in a very condescending manner, just because I wanted to willfully correct the mistake. Her tone was unappreciated, and needless to say, food is only decent in my opinion. Got the berry cocktail drink which wasn't good, and steak was overly chewy. I prefer house of prime rib, and heard Alexander's steak house is a place to try as well.
author: Liz L.

description:
seriously this place is awesome. AMAZING STEAKS wonderful sides, prob the best service i've ever had and very filling. you can easily share one steak cause is soooo flavorful. worth going worth going worth going 

BOOM!
author: Puwett V.

description: Love the steak here....although a chain, the SF location is much better than the one I had in DC. Steak cooked to your preference and not overdone....
author: Yan M.

description: Wow. I'm not sure what happened, but tonight's dinner was like a low-budget remake of a favorite flick. We were greeted by the nice hostess, waiter seemed nice enough--but everything was like in slow motion, or at least slow delivery. I don't like to be rushed, but this was just a bit off. And the food--I'm telling you, I have had dreams about the steaks at Ruth's Chris but tonight's was barely average. I mean, it was okay but it certainly did not live up to expectations. Did my previous visits set the bar too high? Are they victims of the recession and buying less expensive product? Whatever, no salacious dreams tonight about a nice piece of meat! Disclaimer: it was the DAT menu, but I've done it before and was quite impressed.
author: Robert M.

description: This location is the exact opposite of the one in Fresno. If you show up here without a reservation you wont be treated like a leper. No snotty hostesses here or slacker waitstaff. Here you get great service and even better food.  This is one of the few places that gets my rare steaks just right and they melt in my  mouth. Yum! It's a bit on the pricey side but it's a nice treat now and then when we're in the area.
author: Meika M.

description: Definetely a streak house to try. The steak is very tender and tasty. They have a wide variety of appetizers and a decent selection on the menu. The atmosphere is more upscale than House of Prime Rib or other steak houses. It's a little bit pricey, but not a bad experience. I've actually heard that there are some steakhouses in the area that are better, but I have not had the time to try them. Overall, it's another great restaurant for a birthday, anniversary, or special event. I enjoyed my dinner there and loved the steak..
author: Rochelle F.

description: Number 3 on the history of great steak places for me. Big sides that everyone can borrow, and a fine cut of meat. Very good service, does it seem like all the best meat eater meccas are on Van Ness?  They are.  And  reasonable.
author: dave d.

description: Mouth-watering delish!  I had been to a few Ruth's Chris' before, but never in San Francisco until about 3 weeks ago.  So of course, thinking of a nice place to go for a celebration- I think Ruth's Chris again... because it was just so damn good.  Expensive for just a Tuesday night, but GOOD!  And I don't even get a steak... their Stuffed Chicken (herb cheese stuffed) is just absolutely delicious.  The Lobster Bisque is divine & it's nice to have a bowl that doesn't skimp on the lobster.   (a little rich 1/2 way through, but yummy).  Ziti & Cheese with Creamed Spinach on the side and I am in heaven.  Top it off with a Ruth's Chris Coffee (Baileys, Frangelico, Brandy, Coffee with some Whip & Choclate Drizzle) and the BEST Banana Cream Pie you've ever tasted... You will leave a very happy, pleased & full patron.  Best part for me - I get to walk to home.  :)
author: Natalie P.

description: I've been there 6 times. Loved it every time. I usually get the same dishes. I stick to my favorites. Best calamari I have ever had. I do not recomend the porterhouse for two, both of you will end up fighting for the last few pieces of the filet, which is my fav. And last but certainly not least the Fresh Berries and sweet cream. Ahhhh... My favorite dessert EVER!  Honestly, it is so simple yet so good, very light and refreshing after stuffing my face with as food that would fit.  Service has been excellent about 4 out of 6 times. Great romantic decor. I go back every chance I get!!! Thinking about going? Why not bring me???
author: Amanda T.

description:
My husband and I frequently dine at this Ruth's Chris.  However, last week, we had made a big party reservation for 10 adults and 2 children to celebrate our grandmother's birthday.  The location of the table where they sat us was so close to other tables that some of our family members had a hard time getting out of their seats to use the restroom.  Disappointingly, when we ordered drinks for our 3 and 8-year olds, the waiter said they had run out of kid cups...we had made the reservation a week in advance, specifying that we had children with us, so this was very disappointing.  Furthermore, when our 3 year old started playing with his Thomas-the train, one of the waiters came and asked us to stow away the toy as it was making too much noise and was distracting other customers.  The toy was not even loud and our 2 waitresses did not even care, until this one snubby waiter came to have us take it from our child.  After stowing the toy away (which was the only thing that made our boy stay in his seats, our boy started to go around the table to the other family members.  We then saw the same snubby male waiter  giving our boy and our table a very unprofessional and rude look as he followed our boy with his gaze while shaking his head.  We were waiting for him to approach our table again so we can confront him, but luckily he didn't because we had just enough of him.  They didn't even have coloring books or anything for children that you would expect.  Totally not a kid-friendly restaurant at all!

The service was poor and very slow, even having been assigned 2 waitresses.  A couple of times, we even had to wave at them because the service was just taking such a long time.  The waitresses/waiters were not friendly at all that night.  Again, my family and I dine at different Ruth's Chris locations, even those from out of state and even as far as the Aruba's restaurant, but this location just has very bad service overall.  My family and I will not return to this steakhouse and will explore other ones in the bay area.  We'll also spread the word to people we know.
author: Jenn A.

description:
Visited three times over the last three years. First  two times were pretty good, but my visit tonight was eh. Did the Dine about Town. I ordered the Blue Cheese Topping and they forgot to put it on my ribeye, which was ok with me and just made sure it was taken off the bill. But then I cut into my medium rare steak and it was medium. There was barely any pink and it was obvious when compared to the other medium rare steaks at the table that mine was not cooked right. Even the other medium rares leaned toward medium. The ribeye did smell good though (probably due to the butter) and the spinach side was creamy and enjoyable. 

They also changed the dine about town so that instead of giving each person a dessert, it was a dessert to share between two people. I guess that was a good compromise in this economy, but why not just give smaller portions of dessert instead to everyone? The chocolate cake had wonderful hints of coffee and loved the kick in the bread pudding sauce. 

Too bad the ribeye sucked, which I think is the whole point of going to a steak house.
author: Alice M.

description: MMmmmm you CAN ask for extra butter with your prime rib!
author: Michael B.

description: If you enjoy a nice cut of steak in an upscale environment then come to Ruth Chris.  Otherwise I would swing by Cattlemen's restaurant for a comparable steak meal for a fraction of the cost.
author: Cathy L.

description: I had a pretty disappointing experience at this restauarant. First of all, our table was 45 minutes late! Next, they served my bf his salad, while I sat there with nothing in front of me! They forgot my appetizer!! Despite the horrible service, the food was good. The ribeye came hot and sizzling with butter. The fries were crispy and hot. The potatoes au gratin was okay. Dessert was fabulous.. the apple bread pudding with whiskey sauce was amazing.. warm and crispy.. so good... In the end, the maitre d did make up for the bad service by giving our steaks for free. That was awesome! Bottom line though.. I'd rather go to Harris for a good steak...
author: Denise L.

description: I love good old Ruth's. How can you go wrong with a filet mignon cooked a true medium rare and that's served sizzling hot with butter on top?! Yes, I know my arteries are getting clogged up but this is not an everyday meal. I love the lyonnaise potatoes, the sweet potatoes and the creamed spinach. I like Ruth more than Morton's even though some of my friends prefer Morton's. I will have to say that I prefer eating at the Walnut Creek location because it isn't as busy and we had a bad time when we ate at the SF location one time (they didn't cook my husband's porterhouse right and instead of starting over, they put it back on the grill and it came out like leather... I actually had to complain to get it for free)
author: Pamela M.

description: Can you say I love Dine about SF!!!  For a measly price we dined here and my oh my was I pleasantly satisfied.  Steak was cooked to perfection and the butter sauce on top sealed the deal.  The meal included a baked potato, salad, steak and desert.  Can't beat that.  Defiantely going back this January!!!
author: Darren I.

description: I am not a big fan of steak but my bf is. He loves this place. So for his birthday we went there.  It was okay, I wish they had more choices like salmon.  Their side dishes like mash potato and spinach was okay but the spinach is quite buttery.  The steak had extra butter on it which i did not like and a bit too salty.  The string shoe fries are yummy! Over all I think the experience was fun but the food was alright.
author: Ann L.

description:
I came here many times as the girl I dated at the time went to  UC Hastings Law School a mile or so down from Ruths.

IT was our dinner place of choice. (okay..HER choice and my wallet), whenever we wanted to eat.

She kinda turned some heads that day because she showed up in knee high boots a tight skirt, and silk top.  Let's just say the valet staff were doing double takes.

Anyhow..we were seated in a very dimly lit room w/hardwood furnishings and a cozy booth w/white table cloth.  

Our server gave us very good individual attention and we were treated very well.

We ordered one NY steak, one Filet Mignon some wine, and creamed spinach and garlic mashed potatos

The steaks are finely aged and range from 20-80s PER steak.

Yes..this is a VERY rich steak and you also have to be VERY RICH to eat here regularly =)

I think Grace K mentioned that their steaks are so tender and seemed to be dipped in butter.  That's because they actually ARE basted in butted =)   That's their signature cooking style and it gives the meat that rich flavor.

The scarey part is I'm told (by our server) that they use almost a full bar of butter PER steak to cook.   

The only places where I feel bogged down by food is House of Prime Rib and Ruth's Chris steakhouse.

There is no light salad alternative here.  There is salad..but why would you come here just for that?

This is definitely a date place and a great place for small close family get togethers.   Make sure you bring a wealthy family member to flip the bill.

If you have a gold digger gf...she'll probably want you to take her here QUITE often.

Better look at your wallet and HER a little more carefully there!
author: Michael L.

description: Absolutely... FABULOUS.  I adore Ruth's Chris. I've dined at every, single steak house in SF. Seriously. (the reviews will come, I don't have time to sit and type them all at once) I found it a little disappointing that one of the more classic SF steakhouses couldn't blow me away the way this place has. It is nice inside, but generic. When I go to a steakhouse, I want that old school glamour. But what it does have is the most delectable steak I've ever had grace my taste buds. Cowboy Ribeye. With NOTHING extra. If you put anything else on it, other than the way it comes delivered to your table (screw the add ons on their menu), well you've just fucked up the best steak EVER. The side dishes here though, are crap. I don't even like their bread. But I won't let that affect my star rating because I come here for 2 things. The Cowboy Ribeye (medium rare) and the Caramelized Banana Cream Pie.
author: Miss Jessica S.

description: "butter-butter-butter!"  this place is really good though.  meat is tender and i love their creamy spinach and corn.  however, it's a bit overpriced!  i've had better steak... "wagyu" at that and close to their price range... but then again, that was in PI so do the math haha
author: Kae B.

description: The bone in ribeye was very delicious, tender, and very well cooked (perfectly medium rare) and seasoned.  All steaks are cooked in butter.  There is an extra charge for sides.  My husband and I had the white truffle macaroni and cheese which was incredible and the  spinach was good, but average.  The atmosphere was nice and good for a romantic evening out.  The Price range can be high.  The bone in ribeye is was over $50 per person and the sides were about $10 each.  If you are in the mood for a delicious steak, this is where to go.  If you get the ribeye, get the bone-in because it is definitely juicier and much more tender.
author: CHERRYL H.

description: Awsome service ! Great food here . I will be back!!!! Waiter was very profesional.
author: Jack O.

description: I was a little skeptical of a "chain" steakhouse, but this place was across our hotel and my BF really wanted steak. Now, I'm not much for meat, but this was out of this world steak! The fillet was perfectly cooked, the sides were plentiful, and dessert was so yummy! This place is pricey, but a local we sat next to the bar as we waited told us about a very cool deal that I guess only "regulars" know about..... a 3-course dinner for $32!!!! The fillet alone is like $40! The food was so good, that I would pay the full amount, but I can't lie.... the deal was awesome!
author: Cristina M.

description:
I've been talked into going to Ruths' Chris again this coming Friday.
We shall see what happens -- been avoiding this since July.

Booking the reservation online was easy.  

Didn't think we'd get a table on a Friday with this short a span - the place seems busy when I drive by so I didn't expect to get a table with short lead time.
author: D Z.

description:
Ruth'$ Chri$ $teak Hou$e.

Okay the $teak was good.
for $44 for a T-Bone with zero other than the plate it better be!
$2.50 extra for Au Poivre sauce ..Give me a break!
Want some baked potato or asparagus with that piece of meat?
$8.50   EACH !!!
Will NEVER GO BACK!   Total Overpriced rip.   
Want some water to go with that "meal"    Sorry no tap water/ice water, but we do have this nice bottled water $10 bucks a bottle.
Service was mediocre at best (and for these prices it should be over the top kiss my behind great!)
The one star I gave it was for good food, can't deny it (but then it's a STEAKHOUSE where you would come for, I don't know, good STEAKS!?).  
Have to give the devil their due but SATAN must be in charge of pricing, they should be embarrassed  to charge this obscene amount.  Do the math, A steak with baked potato and a vege and a salad (Not an unreasonable combination of food to order for a meal) will set you back $72 !!  Before water, wine, coffee, dessert (which would add $35 plus to your tab!)  


Hello Ruth, The DOT COM BOOM is over and you don't need to continue to ream customers like this.  

So many other resturants here in SF for 1/2 the price!

G
author: Glen B.

description: Unreal.  I would love to go on and on about how amazing this place is but I could never do it justice.  The sweet potatoes are tremendous as a side and everything down to the bread is top notch.
author: Jake B.

description: Steak and butter. How can you go wrong. The hash browns and the lobster are also great.
author: Christopher L.

description: I gave this restaurant 5 stars based only on their rib eye steak.  I've been to a good amount of steak houses and I would say that Ruths Chris rib eye is top notch.  They flavor is always full and the texture melts in your mouth most of the time.  I've been satisfied with my rib eye 99% of the time I've eaten here(there was only one time where the rib eye was chewy for some reason).  However, yes like all the other reviews say, the restaurant does drown the steaks with butter, so before you order you should request that they use little or no butter when cooking your steak.  Also, I don't understand why people complain about the prices... at any high end steak restaurant you should expect to pay the same prices.  If you want save a few bucks and still try a lot of dishes, then go with a group of 4 or more.  The reason is because many of the appetizers and side dishes can be tried and shared by 4 people(creamed spinach, au gratin potatoes, sauteed mushrooms, etc.).  And you can get one or two bottles of wine instead of buying by the glass which is expensive.  If you are cheap and really don't want to pay the high prices then I suggest going to Ruths Chris in January during the Dine-About-Town(if they have it in your area).  That way you can get a complete meal for less than $30.  That's about half the price of what you would normally pay.  And you can't complain about the Dine-About-Town menu because you get your choice of their two best steaks, a rib eye or filet mignon, along with your choice of appetizer, sides and choice of dessert.  I'm getting hungry just thinking about it...
author: Dean S.

description: It's sooo good.  Really pricey but totally worth it.  If you want to save a little they have a 2 person menu that is $89 and you can get a sampling of a little bit of everything.  When I was here, I got a mid-sized cut steak and I have to say, I love how they cook it.  They said that they cook all their steaks in butter and thats the difference between them and other steak houses.  I loved it, I ate it all (including my sides AND dessert) and was a happy fatty for the rest of the night.  Favorite dessert was the creme brulee -- I don't think I've had better, seriously.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Sonya T.

description:
This USED to be my husband and my favorite steakhouse until we had the worst service this past New Year's.  We went with another couple and couldn't wait for our fantastic meal!  Well, my husband ordered his NY strip medium well with NO butter.  Our friend ordered the filet with shrimp, medium rare, and i ordered the petit filet medium.  We also ordered a $30 bottle of wine off the wine list.  When our food arrived, my husband's steak was medium so he sent it back.  When they brought it back it was cOoked to perfection but DROWNED in butter.  He refused to eat it or send it back again. My steak arrived RARE and my friend's steak was medium.  Mine was so red it was almost purple!  We traded steaks since they were both filets and she was ok with rare.  When our bill arrived they had taken my husband's steak off since he didn't touch it, but they charged us for  a $60 bottle of wine!  The waitress insisted that was the one we ordered.  They adjusted the bill and I demanded a $50 gift card from the manager for the terrible service.  
We decided to go back one last time in the hopes that it was just a new server or an off night.  The service was just as bad.  We are now in search of a new steakhouse.  Any suggestions?
author: anne m.

description: I decided to conclude my mediocre 2008 Dine about Town experience here.  I mean it's Ruth's Chris, you can't really go wrong.  The steak was good.  I've been to Ruth's Chris in other cities and I gotta say it's my favorite steak house.  I know it's a chain, don't judge me.  For some strange reason, I kinda felt dinner tonite wasn't as great as usual.  It's my first time at the San Francisco location.  Still great but not exceptional.  Maybe it's one of my off nites.  So four stars, usually five in other cities.
author: jenn c.

description: Filet (medium) Spinach Au Gratin, Asparigus and the Duckhorn Merlot from Napa ... Expensive, but well worth it! Setting is very nice, busy but still very personal.
author: Mack M.

description: Damn good steak.  Damn expensive steak.  It was very good, but I'm content with just grilling my own meat at home.  Plus when all the sides are extra it just adds up.  I would like to go back for something special, but 9 times out of 10 I'll go to Whole Foods by my house, buy a dry aged ribeye and do it myself for a lot less money.
author: Brad K.

description: I must say that their steak is the best I've ever had.  I love that it comes out on that sizzling plate so your steak stays hot.  Every bite is like heaven, it's so tender and drenched in butter. I was very sad when it was gone.  Their bread is also awesome! It's super soft and warm and comes with the soft butter.  I could eat basketfuls of this stuff.  I must say that the a la carte thing kinda stinks because your bill totally adds up. Man, this place is pricey!! Good thing I came during DAT.  Their sides were just average.  I mean, how wrong can you go with mashed potatoes?  I would definitely skip dessert here.  I think the only choice on DAT was key lim pie, which I really did not care for.  Super sweet and icky.  Only finished about 1/2 of it before giving up.  My advice is stock up on the bread and spend your dessert money on your steak.
author: Jenny C.

description: Went on a weekday and it was not packed. Ordered a medium rare filet mignon. It was over cooked and dry. Tried a friends filet mignon ordered medium well and it was the same. Another friend had a T-bone ordered rare and that was still over cooked. Perhaps it doesn't matter how you order, it just comes out as its. Food was not worth the price, but gets an extra star for good service. Spent over $300+ for 5 people not including tip.
author: joe H.

description:
i enjoyed my experience at ruth's chris a lot. great service, excellent crabcake appetizer, and hardly anything beats a 500-degree plate with your food still sizzling on it when it gets to your table. the steak medium-ness was a little variable, but they'll fix it for you if you didn't get what you expected.

the bread was amazing.  amazing amazing.
author: Catherine H.

description: Expensive place with tasty food. It's a good thing I didn't pay! The fries were a little on the oily/buttery side but still really good and the filet was the most tender, most delicious filet I've had. EVER. Oh yeah, everything is ala carte. Good place for a date.
author: Jen Y.

description:
my friends scored us a reservation here for d.a.t, so i put away my anti-chain-restaurants snobbery temporarily.  31.95 for a 3 course steak dinner...what more can you ask for?  well, read on.

i should have ran when i saw a glass of kendall jackson for $13.  seriously, what decent restaurant serves kj?  "i'd like a boone farms with my steak please" unfortunately, i stayed long enough to find the worst thing to happen at a steakhouse:1/3 of my filet came well done and the rest came rare, when the order was medium.  everything else (the salad, the potatoes and the key lime pie) was just as other reviews, not steakhouse quality.

the service was also seriously slow and bad.  the waiter didn't even bother to find out who ordered the pie or the pudding and just slabbed the dishes in front of us.  the entire experience took 3 hrs.

other people gave 3 stars for the same experience.  i'm gonna go ahead and give a 1 star.  definitely NOT worth the 2 miles i ran before hand to prepare myself for the gallons of garlic butter i was about to ingest.
author: Rose J.

description: My friend took me to dinner here once since I have never been and I thought it was just ok.  The steak was alright nothing to rave about the sides and salad were eh ok.  The wine wasn't bad but I will definitely come back for the delicious creme brulee.  That definitely deserved a 5 star.
author: Allison T.

description: Best steak, pricey, but definitely worth it.  I've been to Ruth Chris at least a dozen times, and once my steak was over cooked.  I learned that you should not worry about sending it back, they will take good care of you, they even took my sides back and gave me a fresh batch so my food would all be hot at the same time.  Most of the people I go with tend to order the Rib Eyes, I think cause it looks like a bigger piece, and it's less expensive, but personally I love the Filet mignon, it melts in your mouth, it's so buttery and tender, worth the extra bucks!!
author: Charla M.

description: I've been here many times over the last several years, and it never disappoints, I don't have enough space for all this restaurants praises. Everything is good here! And always ask about the specials.
author: timothy h.

description: Ok so this review is really not on the food! The food is always amazing when I go to Ruth Chris no matter in what area I'm in. The problem I had was with the service. One must remember that this is a high end restaurant so naturally I expect some things to be up to expectation. When we first walked in the hostess looked like she had just rolled out of bed. She had no makeup and her hair was a literal mess. It was in a messy pony tail. She looked like she just didn't care. We were finally seated and the bus boy asked us what we wanted to drink. When we told him what he wanted he apologized and said he could only take water orders. (regular water or sparkling) He was embarrassed about this. I felt so bad that Ruth Chris cant even allow their bus boys to take a drink order. The thing that bothered me the most was that the most annoying was that the waitresses were gossiping on the floor. There must have been some kind of issue either in house or with the customer because the ladies were talking about it and rolling their eyes when they would walk past each other. This was annoying! I have dined at many Ruth Chris' and this is the first time that I was just annoyed the entire time. I have no issue paying the high price dinner but I have an issue with it when the service is just not up to standards.
author: Edwina M.

description: I'm not a big fan of going out for steak b/c to me, fried steak seasoned with salt and pepper - very simple so you can just taste the meat is just as good, if not better than restaurant steak.  But Ruth's Chris is always an enjoyable experience. The ambiance - dark and old-school. Kinda cozy. Drinks are served nice and stiff.  And the best part of my meal is the warm chocolate cake - yummmmm....  Plus the ribeye and even the filet provide enough for a second meal to go.
author: Lola Z.

description: I have only been once and I must say that this place did not live up to the hype. The steak was decent and the sides we so so, the service did make this meal somewhat desirable. I was at the time fairly heart set on Bobo's, that phase has passed, so I might give this place another shot.
author: Tabor, S.

description: Do love the steak and side dishes here.  I didn't think their desserts were as good.  We had horrible service the first time we came though, so I'm not all that excited to go back.  It was a fantastic value for dine about town month though ($30 for a petite filet mignon dinner with appetizer and dessert), so we'll make it a point to come during that month.
author: Grace C.

description: wait service is supurb... food is excellent... definately going back.
author: E F.

description: My best friends took me to Ruth Chris for my B'day. Robert was our wait person and asked who's B'day it was since the reservation made said we're celebrating b'days. It was one of my best friend's partner's and my b'day so he wished us a Happy B'day and took our drink orders. When he gave us our drinks, he left and did not return for another 6-7 mins. We really appreciate that because since only 1 out of the 4 of us has ever been here, we had wanted to look at all the stuff they had to offer and I really don't like to be rushed. When he came back, we ordered 2 Cowboy Ribeyes, 1 160z Ribeye and 1 12oz Ribeye, an order of crab stuffed mushrooms, creamed spinach, mash potato and steamed broccoli. The steaks arrived on hot plates and smelled delicious. I ordered my Ribeye rare which is the only way I eat meat and it was perfect. The creamed spinach was just as delicious as the ones that House of Prime rib is known for. The mash potato was creamy and yummy. They were even able to make the steam broccoli appetizing. The crab stuffed mushroom was worth every penny, crabmeat was spilling over the mushroom caps. All conversation ended as we devoured our steaks and sides and it was like a Thanksgiving or Christmas dinner you make at home when you want everything to be just perfect, this dinner was perfect. As if that wasn't enough, Robert came by with a plate w/ a mini chocolate mousse cake, ice cream w/ drizzle and a fruit cup w/ sweet cream sauce and a candle to wish us a Happy B'day. It was a wonderful surprise and very classy of Ruth Chris. Mike(the manager) came by to check on us and we assured him the food and service was top rated. Yes, it is very pricey to eat here but the quality of the food and the service is really second to none. When i told my son what a great time I had, he went online and purchase a $250.00 gift card so I can come back again. Thank you to Dan for bringing us here for our b'days.
author: Theresa W.

description: One of the better steak restaurants around, but not the best. How can you go wrong with a sizzling plate full of butter and beef?? Their sides are big sharing portions. I got the rib eye which was cooked perfectly. My bf got the cowboy rib-eye and yes, it was a cowboy size. Is it worth the price? I would say yes for a once and a while indulgence for good steak.
author: Annie D.

description: We dropped in here and ordered Filet and Veal. They were ok, steak was done right but nothing special. The side disk was mediocre. The service was ok.
author: Will G.

description:
I've had one great experience and one OK experience here.  The first time everything was just about perfect; we were not scolded for dressing a bit casual for the atmosphere, the food was plentiful and delicious(especially that whipped butter, even the ketchup looked like it was whipped!), and the service was right on.

The second time, my steak was overcooked(I should have said something immediately).  The prices here are definitely over $60 per person.  The staff were very kind and accommodating to my friend who was in a wheelchair.  I am not sure if the prices are worth the food and experience, but there are a slew of choices in this neighborhood if this place doesn't live up to your personal taste.
author: Stephen N.

description:
Best steak I've ever had.  I'm a filet fan, and that's their specialty.  Cooked at 1600 degrees, drenched in butter.  It gets no better in my opinion.

The Good: Best steak ever!

The Bad: Expensive.  Damn Expensive. (This is probably good because otherwise I would eat here all the time.)

The Ugly: Ruth's Chris is a chain (not a bad thing), but the San Francisco restaurant is the most inconsistent Ruth's Chris I've ever been to (hence the 4 stars, not 5).  I've had the best steak of my life here (not exaggerating, I've been to a lot of Ruth's and I eat a lot of steak), one of the worst steaks, and everything in between.  When I show up at the SF restaurant, I don't know if I'm going to get Outback, Ruth's Chris, or pure ecstasy.
author: Scott L.

description: Lobster Bisque was horrible but they took it off the bill..  The bone-in rib-eye was so-so.  Expected more for the price but the service was good.
author: Mike K.

description: Very good Fillet! A little pricey but i did not finish my meal and had left overs for lunch the next day. The potatoes rocked my world and the Crab stuffed mushrooms were the most amazing thing my taste buds have ever come across. I wouldn't want to come here on a romantic date. The atmosphere is loud for a steak house and the tables are close (i heard everyone's conversations around me). The Service was amazing and the waiter was very helpful. Make sure to grab the mints on your way out, they melt in your mouth!
author: Ashley M.

description:
This is a horrible excuse for a high-end steakhouse.

Drinks = overpriced...$15 for a Maker's Mark Manhattan, $12 for an Absolut Martini.  But fine....we can deal.

Salads - standard food-service fare, WAY over-dressed, and a Caesar with no flavor at all.  We had a half-bottle of white with salads, which was served too warm.

On to dinner - we ordered a bottle of red.  They don't have it.  We order another bottle of red - they don't have THAT one either.  Finally, we get to a third bottle that they DO have, of course at a higher price point! Predictably, the entrees arrived well before we got our wine.

So we asked them re-fire the entrees - and all that they did was take the steaks back into the kitchen and put the plates under the broiler.  Our sides just sat on the table getting cold! 

Wine service finally took place after our steaks arrived back the second time from the kitchen.  They don't have a wine steward or sommelier, and it shows.

The place is FULL of crass tourists, too.

What a disappointment.  Should have gone to the House of Prime Rib, Morton's, Harris' or Alfred's.  Never again.
author: bill f.

description:
i had the filet mignon, spinach and 2 or 4 vodka tonics.  everything was delicious.  i wasn't paying so even more so.

the filet was buttery, perfectly cooked and melted in my mouth.  the sides must be meant for sharing because there was too much spinach.  the vodka tonics were strong and necessary because of the company i was keeping.  

also, there was someone famous there that night but i don't really remember who.  of course i would go back.
author: Seong P.

description: Heard a great review of the place so we decided to go.  Reservations for 8 was easy enough and also accommodated our last minute time change.  A+ Customer Service. Yummy yummy cocktails, try the ginger martini.  Our party ordered a variety of appetizers and sides.  Creamy Spinach, Mac and Cheese, Sweet Potatoes, Mushrooms, Green Beans all excellent.  The Fries, though, The yummy fries had an 8" hair in it.  Ugh...But we decided to tough it out and have our Entrees.  Filets mignons were excellent, but the porterhouse for two that I ordered medium rare was overcooked and a little tough.  I couldn't eat it but I didn't want to complain because we already complained about the hair.  You know what they say about too many complaints--you never know what goes on in the kitchen to the rest of your order...Anyway, dessert was gratis for all of us, which was quite gracious, we all thought.  3 Stars for food, 5 Stars for service!
author: g m.

description:
Good stuff, but someone better be getting married (or divorced) or celebrating a golden or silver anniversary.  In short, the price tag for a dinner here is only worthy of super special occasions.

Once you get over the prices, you'll be enjoying the some of the best food you've ever had.  I had the New York strip medium and it was really, really good.  I tend to like my steak in small bits, as an ingredient of other dishes, but this is one of the few places where I can enjoy a huge chunk of steak as the main part of the meal.  I also had the portobello mushrooms here and they were super good.  In short, this is one of those places where the food stayed on my mind for 2 or 3 weeks afterward.  I kept thinking about going back, but then I kept telling myself to 'wait til next year', as if my team didn't make the playoffs, but only in fact because of the price tag.

If you're trying to do a survey of steak houses in the city, I'd definitely recommend including this place on your list of steakhouses to visit.  However, if you're just looking for a new place to try for a special occasion, I'd recommend Harris'  Restaurant down the street a couple of blocks past House of Prime Rib.  Harris' will include the sides as part of your steak order (instead of charging extra) and they also have better ambiance with nice live jazz piano for a non-intrusive soundtrack to your evening.
author: Anx R.

description:
I'm gonna go ahead and give the 5 star approval for Ruths Chris. Yes its a chain restaurant, which sort of takes away from the fun of going there, but I had great food and service.   I was there to celebrate my GFs bday.

As you can see from my reviews, I am a sucker for these types of places. But I enjoy going to a nice restaurant and getting drinks and having a great meal. 

My Manhattan was very good to start out with. The fillet Mignon was excellent and the sides were very good as well.  We had a crembrule for desert and there way happy bday confetti on the table, so I didnt even know that was going to happen.
author: Richard C.

description: We have been to Ruth's Chris many times and enjoyed it.  One of our favorites is their chopped salad.  This time the salad was just "okay" nothing special.  I had a NY steak with sauteed mushrooms and creamed spinach.  I think the mushrooms were canned and they were just okay.  Literally the creamed spinach was inedible...and we are not fussy eaters.  It had a really bad aftertaste.  So they brought us asparagus instead, maybe it's jus not asparagus season any longer but they just didn't taste good.  My steak was ok.  It was a kind of tough which and not quite cooked inside (I like medium rare but it was purple inside).  To be fair when I heated the steak up the next day in the microwave it was yummy.  So for two people: two steaks, two chopped salads, sauteed mushrooms, and creamed spinach = $138 plus tip.  Kind of high considering the quality.  We have been long time patrons but sadly we will not be returning.
author: Cheryl S.

description: I'm not a lover of chains but this one I like.  None of the other Ruth's Chris around the world compare to the one in SF.  To me this is the height of big meat and potatoes.  I love their buffalo steak but when it's not available I also chow down on the ribeye.  The lyonnaise potatoes rock and the bread comes out warm.
author: Amber L.

description:
we came out of ruth's chris hurting. we were so full.

i've heard that this place was good but i didn't expect it to be this goooood. we met our waitress and she warned us that the meat is a little undercooked but our plates come out at a whopping 500 degrees. we heard the specials... buffalo ribeye and... err... forgot the rest. 

we were sucked in. so the buffalo ribeye we got, as well as the cowboy ribeye. as for sides... too bad they all came a la carte. we did get the lyonnaise potatoes and creamed spinach. the cream spinach is NOT recommended. 

even before our plates reached our table, we heard it sizzling and smelled the sweet warm aroma of steaks! as soon as she set it down we were... well, just amazed. we cut into our steaks and slowly placed a piece in our mouths... and it melted, melted like chocolate in your warm palms. the steaks were both tender and juicy and YUMMY! at times we forgot about the high temperature of the plates and left a piece of steak on it... the plates were so hot that it immediately cooked out steaks. my ribeye (i ordered it medium rare) quickly became well done. 

my medium-rare was more like a rare (but i like it this way) and my SO's medium was more medium-rare. so guys enjoy ur steaks and don't let your plate overcook your steaks. enjoy and make sure you wear your fat pants cuz you're gonna need it. my boyfriend, usually abig eater, couldn't even finish his 16oz buffalo steak and i barely even touched my ribeye and i was stuffed! 

oh to top it off... we had the bread pudding for desert. the waitress was nice enjoy to give it to us for free.... and it was good too. just moist enough and warm. it hit the spot. 

be prepared for a night of hurting after your leave this place. but just keep in mind that it's a good hurt.
author: Mei N.

description:
argh, i love this place.  it's around the corner from me but they do have valet when i have to wear my beloved heels.  i go about twice a month but i have to warn you it ain't cheap.  

i don't recommend the kobe - not good enough for the price and it's domestic kobe beef.  the wine selection is decent and i do spend quite a bit of time at the bar since even though you may have reservations, doesn't mean they take you at the reservation time.  i once waited well over an hour with resevations!  so they lose a star over that.

apps: the scallops were mediocre - cooked perfectly but needed some seasoning.  the osso buco ravioli was tasty but....the lobster bisque is thick and savory - not a traditional one but it's stellar!!!

i recommend the filet mignon - sizzling hot and drenched in butter.  the petite serving is too small - for just a few more bucks, i'd go for the regular size and take the leftovers home to make a yummy sandwich or cut it up for a soup.

the sides are big and heavy so open your belt a notch.  i like the potatoes au gratin and the creamed spinach.

open another notch for the banana cream pie.  argh, i'm getting hungry again.

they have different rooms so if the group of shirts is too drunk and loud, they are really nice to move you somewhere quieter if needed.  i'm also a booth person so i recommend asking for a booth if possible.  my short stubby legs aren't as comfortable on the chairs.
author: Anh V.

description: Incredible food, excellent service.  This is a chain so they are consistant, and their food does not disappoint. I have never had a bad experience at a Ruth's Chris.
author: Catherine K.

description: Tried Ruth's Chris for the first time last month during DAT.  Our server was nice but messed up twice with one person's order, and he was slightly less than attentive.  Still, he seemed apologetic at his errors (at least). Now to the food - the salad was average, the petite fillet was good but I didn't like the melted butter that was poured on top (if I were to return, I'd ask for it without that), and the bread pudding was good, but not particularly memorable.  Oh, I do think I liked their creamed spinach more than at the House of Prime Rib...overall, glad I tried it during DAT, but likely won't be rushing back.
author: Joyce L.

description: Great Petite Filet but pricey.  Waiter & other support staff were friendly and provided good service.  The sweet potato side is almost like a creme brulee so you could also have it as a dessert.  You must specifically request tap water otherwise, they will serve you pricey bottled water.
author: Atif Q.

description:
came for DAT (yea just like everyone else, except for the second year in a row) and it was exactly like last year. 

the food was greaaat! really good value. i got the filet, which i hear is the best thing to get on the menu. the salad was nothing special to speak of, but the bread pudding and key lime pie dessert were actually pretty freaking good. at it the next day as leftovers, since we were stuffed from the main course. i also got the french onion soup which was better than average. minus one star cuz even though we made reservations, we still had to wait 20-25 minutes. 

would i come here if it weren't for DAT? hell no, way too expensive for what it is. i noticed that 80% of the diners there were asian, and you know that we don't pass up a great deal... bet that percentage drops significantly once DAT is over... ;) you have 2 days left to get in on the bargain...
author: Jessica W.

description:
So, the lady and I went here last night for Dine About Town for the 3 course meal which went for about $30 per person. It started with a mediocre salad which was a bit plain for my taste but whatever. Then, came the 12 oz ribeye along with the mash potatoes. I ordered it to be cooked medium and it came out just right. I think I would ask for it medium rare next time as they did such a good job. The mash potatoes were money. Very fluffy and smooth. I tried some of the cream spinach that the girlfriend ordered. It was good but left this somewhat dry taste in my mouth. Maybe cuz it was spinach and it always does that for me. Otherwise, I liked it. For dessert, we shared a chocolate cake which was very rich and not bitter for a dark chocolate. I personally didn't care for the cherry sauce but the chocolate did complement the strawberries very well. The ambiance was very nice and dim lit. It was a bit loud for my taste plus there was a crying baby sitting two booths behind us. Our waitress was very friendly and we were more than happy to share a bit of our wine with her. 

Overall, I can't really complain about the food. It was pretty good especially for the price we paid.The steak didn't wow me but that's probably because I ordered medium instead of medium rare. I'd come here again but would try something different or at least cook it rarer. Make reservations if you come on the weekend! =]
author: Jonathan L.

description: Ruth's Chris (don't get me started on this name...) is fine and the quality is good but I'm just not getting the hype. First, I'll admit that I really don't eat steak but with that said, what is with the butter flavor on the meat? I mean, butter is great on some things, sometimes I want some butter with my butter but this wasn't one of those times. I really went back and forth between 3 and 4 stars on this because in all honesty, there is nothing wrong exactly with RC but I just think there are other restaurants that warrent a $200+ bill. Oh and these other restaurants don't give you butter with a side of "whatever" for the most part so that is a plus.
author: Anita B.

description: Well I came here for my sixteenth birthday dinner(: My friends wanted me to try out this place because they had really good steaks. Our waiter was really nice and appreciative, always checked up on us to see if our experience was good. The ribeye was reallllly good. Filled with thickness and butter! :D the mashed potatoes and the appetizers were really good. If I find the time and money I would come back again(: Also the desserts were awesome too! :D
author: Didi L.

description:
i LOVE Ruth's Chris Steakhouse!  During my latest visit, I did the inevitable and ordered the chicken stuffed breast and onion rings.  I know, who orders chicken at a steakhouse?  Anyway, I was hesitant at first b/c i'm not much of a chicken lover and this place is known for its steak, but  I did and I must tell you, it taste as good as their steak.  It was moist and very tender.  I'm not sure what they stuffed it with, but it was excellent.  I didn't leave the place without eating thier steak though because everyone else in my party had steak and shared it with me.  Chicken and steak complimented each other, it made the meal much more desirable.
Service is great and and attentive as always.  I didn't really care too much about the onion rings (it was hard eating it with a knife and fork, i really wanted to use my fingers, but not quite the place for it).  
I can't wait till my next visit!  Make sure you make a reservation in advance because it fills up quick!
author: Erika C.

description: Sweet jesus, is this place freakin great. I don't eat red meat. I hate steak. So needless to say I was a bit reluctant to try this place, but I heard it was the best damn red meat in town so I gave it a whirl. My girlfriend and I went for the dine about town event...she ordered the rib eye and I had the filet. This was the BEST piece of meat I have EVER had. This paired with the creamed spinach was absolutely amazing. The meat melted in my mouth. Oh and the best part was when it was brought out....it was sizzling in butter. Hot, delicious BUTTER. mmmmmmm. I highly recommend this fine red meat serving establishment!!
author: Rachel G.

description: When we need to celebrate, and I'm in charge of selecting the spot, this is where we go.  The meat is terrific, the service is excellent, and the sides are satisfying and rich.  I love the chopped salad, which we tried to duplicate at home:  what a HUGE amount of work that was, and of course it wasn't as good.  We always have a great meal here.  Sure it's pricy but this is a splurge meal in many ways.  About five years ago we took a group of old friends here, and they're still talking about it, even the woman who is mostly a vegetarian.  Ruth' Chris is really, really good at what they do.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
