it was haloween last year. i didn't want to buy an elaborate costume so i went to Longs of all places and bought a little 12 yr old boy skeleton costume (quite befitting considering i'm an xray tech). it barely fit and i had to wear black leggings underneath so that nobody would notice the crotch hole i made to give myself some space. my friend dressed as Lucille Ball from I Love Lucy and merrily we went to Ruth's Chris to spend the gift card i'd received. there really isn't a reason i should have typed all of that. it has nothing to do with the review, but it was a good memory of mine going into a nice restaurant dressed as a little boy skeleton. 

anyway the ribeye was craaaaazy good. i don't even think i chewed it. i pretty much just let it melt in it's buttery goodness within the confines of my mouth. the service was spectacular too as much as i can recall. 

however, the side dishes were mediocore as heck. nothing special about any of those. especially the sweet potatoes. it was more like sweet with a hint of potato. the desserts were not so spectacular either. i've had better in much cheaper restaurants. 

oh but i do love those buttery dinner mints they have sitting at the doorway. i stole a good handful of those! judge me all you want!
author: Regina C.

description: Many of my friends were raving about this place so a bunch of us decided to go there for someone's birthday. I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the Petite Filet Mignon with scalloped potatoes. I was just not impressed. The filet was a bit dry and the scalloped potatoes was not as good as I expected. I make their scalloped potatoes from a cook book I got and love the taste, so I thought if I ate it at the restaurant, it would be even better, but it was not. Quite disappointed about that. Since then, I have never been back.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
The steak is excellent but the establishment as a whole is very boring and not worth the price.  For $150 dinner for two, I feel it should be special somehow.  This place has no personality.

The place itself is very big and yet the tables are jammed in so much that you don't really have privacy.  It's just a very bland, low lit room where you are close enough to your neighbor that you may as well be dining with them.
author: kristen v.

description:
Had a fabulous time here during Dine About Town (http://www.onlyinsanfrancisco.com/dineabouttown/)!

THE SPIFFY:
- Devoured a great 12 oz rib eye steak.  Almost got the 8 oz filet but 12 is bigger than 8 (though both steaks are plenty big).  The rib eye was awesome and not super chewy as rib eyes can sometimes be, probably the best one I've ever had.  Deliciously buttery.  I almost ate all the fat too (eww).  Be careful of the 500 degree plate they serve it on.
- Wonderful, memorable, fresh-baked bread.  Our table of six got two full loafs and they refilled the baskets 2 more times without our asking.  Came with perfect butter that wasn't solid, but wasn't super whipped either... just the right texture.
- Creamy mashed potatoes on the side.
- Very affordable.  Was a very filling 3-course meal including wine for $50.  Shockingly cheap for such a good steak.
- It's a small thing, but I really liked their mints.  They're those kinds that just melt in your mouth.  Everyone in our party grabbed multiples on the way in and the way out.

LESS SPIFFY:
- Neither the ambiance nor the service blew me away.  I liked the fancy silverware and it was a step above Outback, but wasn't near what I've experienced from other high-end steakhouses.
- I alluded to it earlier, but there's a LOT of butter on everything.  You can really feel it a few hours later.
- Wasn't as big a fan of the creamed spinach side.  It just tasted like plain spinach.
- Dessert was surprisingly unimpressive.  I tasted both key lime pie and the bread pudding and neither was bad but neither was that great either.  I'd prefer a trip to Marie Callendar's over these desserts.

I don't know that I'd pay $100 for a normal trip, but for that amazing steak, it's a steal during Dine About Town.
author: Wayne K.

description: I've been coming here for years ever since they opened. I've always enjoyed their filet mignon. Some of their sides are great, too, like the mashed potatoes. Service is adequate and they have valet parking. The atmosphere is fancy but not decadent. I believe there may be a dress code, and would suggest calling ahead if that might be an issue for you. If your party is small, I would recommend sitting in the area near the corner of California and Van Ness (there is a window there and it tends to be quieter). Remember that when the waiter says the plates are hot, they be hot!
author: Al B.

description:
To me three stars is okay but not great. Okay, here's what's great ... the food is rich and most dishes are wonderful and flavorful, all but the chopped salad that was kind of greasy and lacked pizzazz.

What else was good? The staff accommodated my request to turn down the music so I could hear my guests. They advised us well when we ordered. And they seemed friendly and knowledgeable.

But this is a place of contrasts. Here's what wasn't so good. I think they're understaffed, they could train staff better, and they're disorganized. It took a long time for them to take our order and we had to wait many times so the meal took well over four hours. After they take your order, staff disappears and like too many places, they don't make eye contact with other customers when they're in the room so you can't get their attention. It took way too long to order between courses. Some items arrived without the stuff that needed to go with them, like getting dessert without them taking a coffee order for the full table, or coffee arriving without a spoon or cream and sugar. When I eat out, too often staff doesn't realize that customers are helpless to help themselves because we don't have access to the kitchen or supplies, utensils and such, and it's a drag to wait for this stuff when you want to enjoy your meal.

My other gripe is we had a party of 10 and the table seating wasn't conducive to visiting with each other. It was a long table instead of a round one. I would never have thought that a problem until I realized I had to take breaks and wander around rather than visit with everyone next to and across from me. I guess they have long tables, butting several small ones together because it gives them flexibility for seating and probably maximizes capacity, but that's just not the best for a party where you want to visit as well as eat.
author: Gary S.

description:
i admit it. i eat meat. i like meat. no, scratch that. i love meat. but not in a san francisco kind of way (not that there's anything wrong with that).

i've been to this joint and other locations across the usa a few times on plumbing conventions and i'll just focus on this one.

filet mignon. not bad.

rib eye steak. the best freakin' cut o' mooo. these guys do a pretty decent job.

but, i gotta say this. nothing beats a few buds chillin' by the grill and making sweet love to the meat. yeah, grillin' meat is erotic. even for a plumber.

rating: 3 bbq grates (i gotta expand beyond the bathroom here)
author: dave tastic fantasmo x.

description: HOLY STEAK!!  I first have to say there are many other great steak houses out there for a better price.  But luckily Ruth Chris for many years in a row is a participating restaurant for "dine about town"  From January 15 - 31 you get to enjoy a greatttt steak (and more) for just $35.99.  If you are going, my choice: RIB EYE all the way.  This is something I only enjoy once a year during dine about town cause if I had it any more often, I would have a heartattack.  The meat is drenched with butter and fat. The service and atmosphere is great too.
author: Key C.

description: This place really sells the "Sizzle".  Don't get me wrong...  I love the food.  But the real reason I go is because the service is fantastic.  On our last visit, our server was Cynthia.  She made sure that our experience at the restaurant was perfect.  She even helped with a wine recommendation.  Another excellent choice.    My favorite main course has got to be the Fillet Mignon topped with blue cheese.  I'm not much of a dessert man, but I always leave just enough room for cheese cake.   I have to give a shout out to the bar staff. Jose, Daria, Dan & Arturo helped both in our pre-meal & post-meal enjoyment.
author: Russ M.

description:
Ordered the filet and lobster special for $40, sauteed spinach side, pinot noir house wine, and creme brulee.

filet - 0 stars. it was better than average, but not good enough. I was expecting better from ruth's chris.

stuffed lobster - 1 star. we were so awed by how they manage to get the whole lobster tail out and serve it on top of the shell. amazing!

pinot noir - 1 star. it was yummy, and they served a good amount i was happy and buzzed by the time we were done with dinner.

creme brulee - 1 star. MMMM... So good that I embarrassed him with my moans of satisfaction x.x

price - 1 star.

Not bad, not bad. Wish the steak I had was better it was too bland, but everything else was good, I would try it again.
author: Jamie N.

description: Really pricey chain steakhouse but the food is wonderful. The restaurant literally smells like butter when you walk it because all their steaks/filets are cooked in butter. I love their sides [you have to order seperately], especially their oh-so-good sweet potatoes!
author: kristin e.

description: I went here during Dine About Town and I must say I had one of the best steaks I ever had in my life.....Great place to go for a nice classy dinner.  Gets a bit packed but the service here was great.  I just wish I could afford to go here more often.  Definitely worth a try if it fits your budget its a great  experience.
author: Christopher C.

description: I have been coming here for years and have yet to be disappointed.  It is a steak house in the most traditional sense, so don't expect too much culinary experimentation.  That said, they cook up some of the finest steaks that you can get anywhere.  Sides are a little large on the portion size, but are all perfectly prepared and tasty.  If you are craving a juicy steak, go to ruth's chris.
author: Robert R.

description: best steak I've had in SF - hot buttered goodness. Good for big groups too.
author: Don H.

description: I am as big as a cow so Ive eaten my share of steaks and this was just ok.  Compared to other Ruth Chris's  in Irvine, CA this location wasn't even close.  I had a much better T-bone at Harris' down the street.  But Ruth Chris still has the best Creme Brulee that I had ever eaten.  I also eat alot of creme  because I am a  fatty.
author: Fatty A.

description: On Our Anniversary My Husband And I Dined At Ruth's Chris....The Food Was Amazing :0)
author: Veronica T.

description: People might hate on Ruth's for being a chain operation, but I'd eat here any night over Harris' or Morton's.
author: Philip M.

description: I said I wouldn't do it; but I will review a chain restaurant.   I think the food is okay-- service fair and the wine list :( -- this is California--it is a no brainer to put togethe a decent wine list.  I cannot see myself going back.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
it was....ok...
the steak was good and cooked to perfection. 
the potatoes were deliciously buttery.

my friend got the creme brulee and it was heavenly!  but for a price!

the servers were friendly and nice.  
i would go back again but without DAT, it's gonna have to be a special occasion.
author: Dana L.

description: Just went for Dine about Town.  I had the rib eye medium rare, creamed spinach and bread pudding.  The steak was perfect.  Someone in our party go the petite filet rare.  This was really good but definitely almost rare.  It kinda reminded me of ahi tuna.  The sides were decent.  The mashed potatoes definitely have a lot of butter.  When the potatoes first came to the table, it nice a smooth.  After twenty minutes or so, the potatoes were more solid.  The bread pudding was ok but the only other comparison I have is from New Orleans.  Another table next to us order off the normal menu and it looked delicious.  I think the dine about town menu is a limited but the full menu is worth another try.
author: Ginny M.

description: I liked, but I did not LOVE. The server was very kind and we made our selections. The petite filet was perfect, the sides were as good as they're gonna get (not over the top, just as good as they should be), but the AMBIANCE KILLED IT. They sat us in the back and it felt stuffy. This one lady was wearing the freaking blue diamond from Titanic, I swear! People there seemed all gussied up and full of themselves, like they thought this place was oh my god over the top fancy. It is very nice, but maybe not my thing? I've had better food for cheaper in a nicer atmosphere. I think that this place is EXCELLENT if you just go to the bar for a couple of drinks. but sticking us in the back with the boring old folk? not cool. The luxorita or whatever.. the drink with patron and remy I think... whatever it was... was great....
author: Marcy F.

description: Solid steaks, great sides, good wine menu and a heavy pour on other drinks. My wife and I have enjoyed every visit to Ruth's Chris and I'd definitely go back again. As far as a hoity-toity date night, it's located on Van Ness in an area that's deteriorated to having about as much charm as being trapped in a fart suit, but once inside it's pretty easy to forget about that.
author: Drew H.

description:
Once again the fiancee came up big and took me here for a "no reason special occasion" dinner. We are both huge fans of steak and had been wanting to come here for a while. First off, let me say, the service here is impeccable, everyone is really friendly without being pretentious. That being said, there is a bit of a uniformity to it that kind of shows that this is a chain restaurant where everyone has been trained strictly in the same fashion. However, the courtesy is much appreciated. 
I started with the Caesar salad which I found very tasty. I did find that the salad was a little heavily dressed but it does come with two large undressed leaves that when cut up and mixed in with the salad evened everything out. Next we got our steak, potatoes (mashed and baked) and creamed spinach. The steaks are definitely tasty but here's the deal, they douse these suckers in butter, I'm pretty sure you could cook almost anything and add a stick of butter and it would be pretty tasty. The mashed potatoes were great but I made the mistake of getting cheese on my potato and the cheese formed an almost impenetrable crust on the top which definitely deterred from my enjoyment of the fixins. For dessert we got the chocolate "duo" which sadly hit the wrong note, there was something off about the cake, almost like it was still raw batter, while the pot de creme was reminiscent of boxed mousse mix. However, Ruth's Chris is not known for their desserts and when it comes to what they are known for, their steaks are nothing to sneeze at. However, in my quest to find the best steak in San Francisco, I'm going to have to tip my hat to Harris' for the time being.
author: Cathy T.

description:
We had dinner at Ruth's Chris Steak House on Thursday night.  We found plenty of street parking in the surrounding streets so we did not have have to valet park the car.  We make reservations via Opentable.com and did not have an issues.  The restaurant was offering a special menu for two however, the courses did not include steak so, we chose to order off the regular menu.  We ordered the surf & turf (carribean lobster & petite steak) about $58, steak & shrimp dish (don't recall $$), 2 appetizers - scallops & mushrooms stuffed with crab meat, and the sweet potato side.  The appetizers were good however, a little bit too buttery for me.  The main course & the sweet potatos were excellent.  There was so much food we ended up bringing half of it home with us.

Our Servers, Cyndi and her Assistant, were excellent.  They were very attentive to our needs and made sure to put the butter on the side for the main course (like I asked).  I def enjoyed the food  and would return again.  I received a thank you note from the restaurant via the mail today which was a nice personal touch.  I would recommend this restaurant for those looking for a  very good steak in a friendly environment.
author: c v.

description: selection was good and service from jack and julie was awesome.  i should have gotten a smaller size steak tho.  the steak came out tasty and tender and not too well done.  i would have like the baked potato instead but i did the "dine about town" so no substitution.  it was a great place to have my birthday dinner with great friends.  definitely recommend it but make sure to make reservations in advance.
author: Ben L.

description: Just love this place.. Food is great, best steaks I have ever had. I have only been a handful of times to this location but I would definitely recommend it. Ambiance is great, nice and dim and the waid staff is great. I recommend their mashed potatoes!
author: Mrs P.

description: yum yum yum. cream of spinach. bread pudding. don't get your steak medium well if you want it charboiled. my meat was way overcooked, i asked for not bloody- doesn't mean i want it burnt either...oh well. overall, delicious!
author: N T.

description: over rated i mean the lamb chops was good other than that, i rather drive across the bridge
author: Nate K.

description: You cannot beat eating here for $34.95 with Dine about Town's price.  The place was sold out and no wonder.  A great three course meal and wait staff who bend over backwards helping you.  We'll be back!
author: Steve K.

description: I had one of the best steaks in my life at the Ruth's Chris in Dallas and was excited to try this place after I landed in SF.  Talk about a let down!  The meat was average, the service abysmal.  I might have to try it again though, based on the other reviews.
author: Max C.

description: The one time I have been here is that I spent more money on it then I would at 3 weekly poker games. 50 dollar buy ins a night. But it was well, well, well worth it! The steak was great and they did it just the way I like it the way I asked it. I was happy, that's all that mattered, but this place IS for special occasions, unless you bank in a lot of dough.
author: Michael C.

description: This place is totally overrated.  I have to admit, the meat is good but I'd rather go across the street to HOPR.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Filet mignon and creamed spinach doesn't get any better than at Ruth's Chris.
author: Alex A.

description: YUMM-O! This place is pricey, but the steaks are freakin' worth it!  I ordered the petit filet--VERRRRY TENDER, and VEERRRRRY tasty! Even my brother's girlfriend, who is a vegetarian, enjoyed her huge grilled shiitake mushroom plate.  The place is pretty casual, but not casual enough to get super loud.  I was even able to bring my 5 year old son.  I will totally come back to this place--when i'm not broke! =)
author: Andee A.

description: petit filet is awesome, ahi tuna was delicious.  I thought the meat was small and round but I was wrong, it's fulfilling.  the bad side is the meal doesn't come with any side dish, you have to order a quite pricey side dish.  I'll go back there
author: Albert W.

description: I've heard the bad and the good about Ruth's Chris so I figured I had to try it out myself eventually and honestly, it was an enjoyable night. As always,  my bf and I didn't hold back, so we started with crab cakes and lobster bisque. I've had better crab cakes, but the lobster bisque was pretty nice. For our steak, we had the porterhouse for two, which was SO GOOD. They brought it out with the sizzling butter plate and the steak just melted in my mouth. For sides we ordered the shoestring potatoes and baked potato. They were good, but unless you're really hungry, just go with one side to share if theres two of you. We barely made dents in either sides. For dessert we had the bread pudding, which was pretty good, as well. Add in a couple of cocktails and it ended up being a pretty pricey dinner for two. I wouldn't say it was completely worth the price, but I had no complaints.
author: Kim C.

description: We spent so much money here! LOL The steak is great but I think  the sides dishes are better! We went into a side dish frenzy! I think we ordered 3 potato dishes alone. It was a birthday what can I say. I still crave the sides there.
author: Asinia A.

description:
Went here w/ the bf yesterday night for the dine about town special. He had the ribeye (12 oz.) and I had the petite filet mignon (6 oz.). Yes, they were both were drenched in butter. I looked at my filet mignon and thought to myself, how the hell am I going to get full of this tiny piece of meat. I guess with a lot of bread and mash as fillers. My fault for ordering the filet. I ordered the filet medium rare, but it turned out more medium than rare. The filet was kind of chewy with the first bite, but as I carved into the middle of the filet, it was much more tender. BTW: The middle only took 3 bites to finish, then it got hard again as I approached the end. The ribeye on the first bite tasted better than the filet, but towards the end of the ribeye it got dry and the juiciness of the meat fadded. Overall, we got our money's worth, but I don't know about paying full price. 
The service was fantastic; the staff kept checking up on us too frequently I would say. Our waitress folded my napkin when I went to the restroom. 
Free refills on soda, which was a plus.
author: Andrenaline R.

description: Expensive but really good steak and BP big portions. the new orleans style shrimp was great but not enough. the side dishes were not that great.  the service is what was expected for that price. would come again for special occassions
author: Mark F.

description: Birthday dinner for my sweetie pie. Too bad I made a reservation on a Friday night. We had to sit in the bar for almost an hour after our reservation time. Once seated they were very apologetic. I know I got the Filet Mignon but what stands out in my memory is the sweet potato with pecan crusty heaven on top side dish. It was awesome! So good in fact it seems it was more memorable than the steak. They comped the apps and cake ($35 off) but it's been over 2 years and I haven't gone back since.
author: Mel H.

description:
I rarely consume butter in such mass quantities as I do at Ruth's Chris, but it makes for the perfect petit filet. I've been to most steakhouses across the city and Ruth's Chris is the only one that has me coming back for more. The meat is so tender you can cut it with your fork and as long as you don't burn yourself the 500 degree plate, you should have a most enjoyable meal. The sides were pretty standard - nothing special about the mashed potatoes or the creamed spinach. Dessert portions were large and we shared the key lime pie which was very good, maybe a little too rich, but we still ate the whole thing.  The bartender was a cutie and looked like a brunette Jessica Biel. 

It's great coming here during Dine About Town because you the salad, side, entree and dessert for less than the normal cost of an entree. Just a word of warning though, there are so many patrons this time of year that the service is slower than usual, so plan on staying there a little longer than you initially anticipated.
author: Cher E.

description: The Dine About Town special was great. 6oz filet, 12oz ribeye, creamed spinach, and key lime pie. And four Anchors. :-) Damn good steaks. Hint: the best table (for two) in the restaurant is the one in front by the window to the right of the entrance, facing the street.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Just had a 12oz RibEye during Dine About Town.  Probably the one of the best steaks I have had.  Perfectly seasoned and grilled to perfection!  I was impressed.  No wonder that place was packed on a Thursday night.  Heading back real soon!
author: Caesar C.

description: I ate here once with a huge group and it was yummy. But.....I thought the portions were kinda small for what you're paying. The employees were real nice and helpful when some of the guests were unsure of what to order. Parking is a pain but they have valet so that's good. I have to go back here again soon. My daughter's teacher works here so that's cool.

Yummy steak house, great deal with dine-about-town menu. Stuffed chicken was actually very good too. Liked break pudding dessert. Steak was a lil undercooked to my request but it was still delicious. Salad was plain. Friendly server.
author: Royce L.

description: For a chain steak house, THIS IS THE BEST steakhouse I have even been to. I had the Kobe style steak, it was mouth-watering. I went over 2 months ago and I am still thinking about it at my desk today. It was the most expensive piece of steak on the menu, but it was well worth it. I didn't even touch the sides. We let our server have a taste of our nice selection, and he waived the corkage fee on two of the three bottles!There were 6 of us, the bill wasa little over $600. Average price for a steak house. Great food, great service, no wait time on a busy Friday nite. Went home satisfied. Overall, a great experience.
author: Kim D.

description: We ate here during Dine about Town. For $31 per person, we got a salad, main course, and dessert. It was a great deal. The house salad was nothing special. For the entree, we got a filet mignon and a ribeye. If you like your steak medium rare, I suggest getting it rare because the smoking hot plate cooks your steak as you're eating it. The butteryness (is that a word?) is to die for. Yum. So fattening, but so good. As for the dessert, that's nothing special. We had key lime pie and bread pudding. Also, the service was terrific. Definately make reservations. It gets crowded.
author: Stacey L.

description: My ex-gf took me out here for my birthday once.  For $100 a steak, it was pretty underwhelming.  Maybe I don't have a sensitive palette, but it was just really boring meat.  If you want meat, just go to House of Prime Rib across the street.  Save yourself some cash,
author: Chris D.

description: The BEST STEAK EVER!!!! Their steaks are delicious and perfectly cooked!  Servers are very attentive!  Bread is excellent - I could care less for their sides, just because I want to savor every bite of the steak.  Sides are family sizes, so it's great for sharing.  One side is great for 2, and maybe even 3 people.  Too bad they can't be voted #1 Best Steakhouse every year!
author: Kathleen M.

description: I have been going to Ruth's Chris for about 10 years for special occasions. One of the best steak around town. Staff is courteous and nice. I usually get their Fillet  Mignon and on special occasion get their Kobe steak. The only down side was last time I was there the Kobe steak was not up to par. I will continue going there for their Fillet Mignon...
author: Bob F.

description: The best steak I have had in a while!!!! I wasn't sure about the whole idea of my steak cooked with butter, however it works and tastes perfect! I loved loved loved the crab stuffed mushrooms and have never had a combination that perfect. I will definitely go back as soon as possible!!! I might recommend taking your own bottle of wine that would compliment your perfect steak, although they had a pretty decent selection.
author: Marissa R.

description: We've been to Forbes Steakhouse in Los Gatos, Smith and Wollensky in Miami, Flemings and Vic Stewarts in Walnut Creek and I must say that nothing can really compare to a Ruth Chris meal. I am an extreme fan of their Medium Ribeye and/or Bone-In... this place is by far our favorite steak place! We've been to Ruth Chris in SF, Oahu and Maui.
author: Joy G.

description: Who can pass up a steak cooked in so much butter? This place has excellent service and the food is literally to die for. I had a large dinner party at this restaurant and they were amazingly accomodating and helpful the entire time. If I could afford it I would eat here all the time.
author: Jessica K.

description: I've been to this steak house twice now, and both times I've had phenomenal steaks.  In my mind, what really sets Ruth Chris apart is the way they cook their steaks. They cook their steaks at 1800 degrees in custom broilers and then drown them in butter. It's so good it makes me wish my own broiler got 3x hotter than it does!  Last time I was there I got a filet Oscar style (topped with crab, asparagus and bearnaise sauce), and it was cooked perfectly to medium rare. I don't think I'll ever order anything else.   The only reason I won't give Ruth Chris 5 stars is because their sides dishes didn't impress me. In my opinion, they overcharge for mediocre fries and over-cooked vegetables. But really, who goes to a steak house to eat the side dishes?
author: Evan K.

description: Exquisite prime beef in nice surroundings, yes that's true. But we went there last night and had the same exact experience as Kevin S. After a nice discussion with the waiter over the nuances and differences between the ribeye and the "cowbow" ribeye, two of us opted for the "cowboy" which is slightly larger and is on the bone. By now you know what's coming, two servings of the regular ribeye. Of course they offered to bring a new one, but it'd take 20 minutes and the others in our party were already served. How big a deal is this? Not so big, but they only have like six things on the menu so how hard can it be? And at $25 per entree or so, aren't you paying for and expecting really impeccable service? Maybe if it were the Palace at Geneva and Mission, you might expect mistakes but not really here.
author: jim b.

description: I think Morton's is a much better steak house than Ruth's Chris. The portion here is hummmongous here  and you always have to either toss the leftover or doggie bag it. the service is a tad above average. the potatoe is the best part of the meal. id go for the potatoes. yum.
author: Bren L.

description:
If you want steak at Ruth's Chris go before Dine about Town is over. It is worth it. 

We finally checked out this place.  The beef is good and ...buttery.   I actually took my filet mignon out of the butter sizzle plate just to save some calories. 

I am not a good beef eater, but I must say the beef is good. 

What I did not like about Ruth's Chris was how our meal was rushed!  Before we were done with out salads our beef came out.  The waitress came by and apologized and said that the kitchen has been serving food super fast all night. (if we wanted we could send those steaks back and get a new one when we were ready..) Well, I guess she was trying to be nice...But while we were eating, the busboy kept coming by and asking us if we were done..even when were not. 

We basically got our drinks, salads and steak done in about 30  minutes.
author: vernice l.

description: We did dine about town, $31.95 for house salad, 12oz rib eye, w/ a side and bread pudding. Totally worth it! Should get the deal before it ends!
author: Jean L.

description: I only gave it 2 stars because of the price. For what you pay not worth it. You can go to some places in the city for half the price get a steak just as good. The service was excellent but if not for DineAbout Town deal I don't think I will be going back anytime soon.
author: Hyung L.

description: SOOO GOOODDD!!! I just found it a little odd that the beef is swimming in its own fatty by-product...the butter content was so 'diculous its ridiculous...but if youre gonna splurge for a meal, what better way to go out right???
author: Calvinn W.

description: This was an awesome second date place. It says I have class and I want my woman to have good things in life. Food was extraordinary. I don't know how they do it, but their crab cakes are out of this world. Definately found food that makes me smile. The filet mignon was super tender and the garlic mash potatoes were heavenly. Service lady super friendly. Can't complain. Price matches taste.
author: Van N.

description: A group of us went for Dine About Town, which at this restaurant is a great deal.  Unfortunately, the service was sub-par.  I felt rushed and unappreciated as a guest.  Great-tasting filet and prime rib.  I think it's a combination of the hot plate which keeps the meat warmer longer, the crispy exterior and juicy interior, and all that butter.  And they'd do better with a plain flour-less chocolate cake instead of the one with the hint of espresso.
author: Manit L.

description: Simply amazing! I use to have dinner here about once every two weeks. The service is fabulous & the food is delicious! I only had a little problem with my stake once & it was resolved within seconds! It's just heaven!
author: Jessica O.

description:
Ordered from the $34.95 DAT menu. Took the salad, petite filet - medium rare, creamed spinach, and bread pudding.

The filet was really tender and juicy. The melted butter on the plate made it all the more better. The creamed spinach wasn't all that to rave about. The mashed potatoes were nice a creamy. The bread pudding was awesome. 

Bottom line.... you can't beat the quality and price of the DAT menu....
author: Emma N.

description: My fiance and I came here on Friday to celebrate Valentine's Day.  I had an overall really pleasant experience.  The noise level was a bit more than I prefer in a place like this, but was mostly due to one raucous guest sitting near us.  We got seated in the middle of the room which also took away from it feeling like an intimate dinner.  Those are my really picky negatives which should be taken with a grain of salt.  The food itself was most all excellent.  The hashbrowns were a bit too greasy and crunchy for my liking, and the cheese that came with them congealed pretty quickly which made them difficult to work with.  Aside from that, both of our salads (Caesar and apple / walnut) were really good.  Perfectly dressed and a great portion.  My fiance said he had never tasted better brussel sprouts in his life.  The peanut butter chocolate dessert was crazy delicious (if you like peanut butter).  My fiance found the peanut butter to be a bit much.  The real star, as you would expect, were the steaks we had.  We both thought they were the best steaks we had ever had in our lives (which is saying something since we're both from Nebraska), but I imagine it's hard to go wrong when the meat is drenched in butter.  Tasted delicious, but most definitely isn't a health food!  My fiance got the filet and I got the ribeye.  His was easily the superior of the two steaks, but mine was still sooooo good.  We ordered both of them medium rare, which was perfect.  If I could give 12 stars to the steaks alone, I would.
author: Crystal Z.

description: Hands down, the best steak I've ever had! I'm typically not a steak fan, but Ruth Chris really sets the bar.  I've been here about three times, each ordering the prifixe menu.  The plates are sizzling hot with such a delicious marinade.  The service is great and I always leave with a full stomach!
author: Areeyla L.

description: I went there tonight and it was good. The Prime Rib Eye steak was up to my expectation, very nice piece of meat and was cook to perfection. It melted in my mouth. I also tried the ahi tuna, it was "aite" not as good as some other reviews said. Over all it's a good steak house, kool service and good food.
author: Wes Z.

description:
I had high expectations for this place before i tried it and let me tell u that it blow me away. the ambiance and service was wonderful. me and some of my friends had dinner here for the dine about town. the bread was fresh, crispy and warm. definitely stood out from the other places. i could have eaten this for dinner alone. there was really nothing special for the appetizer. the main course was unbelievable! i had the ribeye steak in medium. it was perfectly cooked and the beef was super tender! truthfully, i had never had a piece of steak taste like that before. the best part is the side of mashed potato i had. i know there was super amount of butter and oil in it but i didn't care cuz it was super fluffy. the bread pudding was good but after a couple of bites, i just had enough.
i highly recommend coming here when they do dine about town. it is super worth it because the amount i paid for dinner cost just as much as the steak alone. crazy huh?
author: Lynn P.

description:
two people in our party ordered the DAT menu, the other two did not.

first off, i was slightly annoyed for having to wait 20 minutes after making 615 reservations.  black mark +1

secondly, the busboy (guy who brings bread and refills your water) didnt do either.

thirdly, the wait between our courses was rather long.  

and lastly, the food, other than the buffalo ribeye was mediocre at best.

let me just note that our server was very friendly/helpful.  she just seemed quite overworked.

we ordered the following:
seafood gumbo  (it was not spicy at all; the soup was quite runny)
crabcakes (kinda small; i liked that they used quite a bit of crab meat but it was not tasty; the texture was kinda gooey)
salad that came w/ DAT meal was nothing to write home back; one person in our party couldn't finish theirs b/c it was soaked in dressing
ribeye - we ordered rare but it came out to be more medium/rare to medium
tbone - it was ok
buffalo ribeye - was a special and the standout dish of the evening

So overall, we did not like our appetizers, nor did we like any of our side orders (creamed spinach, potato au gratin, or mashed potatoes).  I thought my ribeye was overcooked.  I didn't like the tbone either.  Both desserts were left uneaten - the key lime pie and the bread pudding.  It was hard to stomach.  

If I'd go back, I'd only order the buffalo ribeye - that is how steak should taste!!

The overall damage for four was $250 with two of us ordering off the DAT menu.  I would not recommend this place b/c you are not getting value for your $$.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Better than Harris's, Morton's or Izzy's.  Go with the filet mignon...it's done perfectly...thick, buttery and juicy.  Everything here is a la carte, but I think the portion of the side dishes is adequate for two.
author: Aila L.

description:
steak amazing
the bar and bartender are great
management  oustanding really bravo!!!!
tom the best waiter 
amazing place
author: germain m.

description:
Why is this restaurant so expensive?  Because I would argue that you really can't refer to the steak here as "steak."  It would be like calling a Bentley or a Ferrari a "car."  It is that good.

I eat steaks at least once or twice a week at different restaurants, and every time I do, I compare it to Ruth's Chris.  Every other place falls short in comparison.

The steaks are perfectly cooked exactly the way they are ordered, they are extremely flavorful, and they are heavenly when ordered "Oscar style."  I don't know who Oscar is, but he had a damn good idea when he decided to put a jumbo crab cake, some asparagus, and a bernaise sauce on top of my filet; he is almost as smart as the first guy that put a fried egg on his burger.

The sides here and the appetizers are all fantastic; I especially recommend the creamed spinach, the crab stuffed mushrooms, and the one pound baked potatoes.

Is this place ridiculously expensive? Yes.  Expect to pay at least three times the normal cost of any bottle of wine on the menu.  However, is it worth the expense?  Every penny.  You are paying for the experience, and for the food.  Expect to pay upwards of $300 for 2-3 people.
author: Jason B.

description: I dined at Ruth Chris twice; I still cannot understand why it is necessary to have that much butter with my steak? If you are not asking for the steak without butter, they bring you a plate of steak floating in the sizzling butter and because the palate and the butter is so hot and SIZZLING, it is obvious that your medium rare filet mignon easily become medium done. This is my only complain. The meet is taste really good and tender by itself. I think butter do not add any thing extra to steak. Other than that, sides ware delicious, wine list was extensive, service was good and staff was nice and attentive enough. Food is on the pricey side, but hey, this is a steakhouse. Compare to the other steakhouses in San Francisco, I like Harris's the best.
author: Rahi Y.

description: I hold this place dear to my heart cause my bf took me here on our first date! How'd he know bringing me to a steak house would win over my little heart=) Well I love this place!! Of course cause i LOVE steak!! Ordered the Rib-Eye Med Rare and the lobster tail...cooked to perfection w/ lots of butter!!  I came here again for dine about town and everything was just as perfect.  But this time the Rib-Eye was covered with even more butter...so i sent it back. Just kidding, i ate the entire thing!  This is a great steak house, u gotta try it!!
author: Steph S.

description: Just ate here last night and like usual I love ruth's chris!!!! The food was fantastic as always. I took off the star only because I prefer the Walnut Creek location better (has free available parking, spread out tables for comfortability). More food recommendations: sweet potatoes for sure!
author: Lily N.

description: This was the first time me and my gf went to this restaurant and we completely llove this place. Its almost as if we're not having steak because it was soooooo good... it's true the steak melts in your mouth. I like my steak well done, and whenever I get my steak from different steak house, the steak comes out dry and bland, But not in this restaurant... it is soo good it's worth the money you'll spend in this place.
author: Emcy G.

description: I've been to many steak places and from all the hype this place has received I was expecting an out of this world experience.  Needless to say it was not what I expected.  The drinks and sides were delicious but the main entrée left more to be desired.  The steak although not bad, was not great either.  It's a steak which I've tasted at much cheaper places.  The environment was nice, not too noisy but not too loud either.  The waiter knew the menu very well and was very friendly.  Overall it was a good experience but not a place I would go out of my way to dine at again.
author: Anthony T.

description: I love this steak house. This was my 3rd visit. Second time for the S.F. location and once in Las Vegas. It's a solid as it gets for steak. There are lots of steak houses to choose from these days, but I have been to a few and keep coming back here. The decor is great, what a steak house should look like. Dark, wood, clubby feel. The waitstaff has never disappointed with a helpful but nice slow pace. My only real criticism is with the wine list. I would have liked to see more choices from Chile and Argentina. They make wonderful wines that are a great value. Sonoma and Napa wines are just so overpriced in places like this. Next time I may bring my own bottle and just deal with the corkage fee.
author: D D.

description: I ate here a few months back and i have to agree with a previous commenter that this is one of the most overated chain steakhouse restaurants out there.   The steak is ok nothing great.  Maybe its because i ate here during dine about town. And also while i was eating i overheard one of the servers complaining to a "regular guest" who apparently eats here every week that she hates dine about town and the massive numbers of guests who come in during that 2 week span. She said all this right next to me while i was about to order from the dine about town menu.
author: Stephen C.

description: Wow - I can safely say that this was the best steak I have ever eaten.  The baked potato was also excellent.  Service very good, food, pricey.  But seriously - the filet steak was absolutely heavenly.
author: Mary N.

description: One of my many favorite restaurants. There steak tends to be just cook right no matter how you want it made. It has so much flavor to every bite that you cant stop wanting more. They have a great selection of wines and also have a very educated staff informing you of your selection. The Chef greets customer every now and then and thats a good thing to see. Definitely one of my fav steak house.
author: Bobbes O.

description:
Went here for a special night - our anniversary. Have been hearing about this place for years. Finally decided to give it a try.
Wow - never again. I don't care where it is, what's the occasion, will not give them my money.
First off, the service was slow. It took us FOREVER to take our order. Then again FOREVER to get our first course, again FOREVER second course and so on. We did not even have a chance to enjoy our drinks much, because they would not stop by to ask us if we needed a refill. I mean, if the kitchen is slow, the wait staff should at least try to get us drinking, but nope, they would not come by to check on us.
Second - my husband ordered medium streak and it came back still breathing on his plate. Seriously, it was beyond rare. Unbelievable, a steak house does not make the right temperature of a steak?!
Third, I ordered lobster. It was so chewey, I think a rubber ball would have been tastier.
Bottom line - Ruth's Chris on Van Ness SUCKS big time. Don't go there.
author: a b.

description: One of the best steaks I've ever eaten.  I'm very picky about how I like my steak cooked and this place got it right.  I ordered the ribeye which was cooked perfectly.  As for the seasoning there wasn't too much unnecessary flavors which was great because steak should taste like steak and not herbs and other stuff.  I also ordered the Au Gratin which was the potato and cheese sauce side dish.  Most people might not like this because of the cheese but I thought that this side complimented the steak really well (I LOVE MY CHEESE).
author: andrew w.

description: For a franchise steakhouse, you cannot go wrong going here for steak.  However, it is not what I would say the most worthwhile place to go if you really want a piece of really good steak.  Everything about this place is so played out and sometimes unnecessary (such as the steak over sizzling butter).  For the same amount of money, you definitely can get something better elsewhere.
author: Charles C.

description:
My wife & I wre there  last night and my wife said it was the best steak she's had since we moved back from Brazil. We had the giant Porterhose for 2, which is a bit pricey but worth it. We ate are fill and took the rest home for tonight.  Only down side is, the wine selection is too pricey, if the prices were a bit lower I'd come back more often.

We had a baby sitter for the night, and tickets to Diana Krall afterward so it was a great night.
author: Michael R.

description: It's a chain.  And it has a chain-like feeling to it.  ketchup on the tables, "RUTH CHRIS" plastered everywhere.  I like the set-up of the meal, meaning that you order your steak al la carte and the sides were all good.  Nothing was great, nothing was bad.
author: Jessica T.

description: First off let me say that the other reviews saying this place was like eating a stick of butter was correct.  I seriously felt ill for the next few days.  They should serve hot tea to wash down all the fat and grease you just consumed.  The steak was decent (not cooked the way I wanted), over priced if you ask me, and the service was nothing special.  At least my brother which I took out for his birthday said it was one of the best steaks he had, so the hit on my wallet didn't seem as bad.  Happy birthday big bro!
author: Mike S.

description: My fiancee and I happened to stumble across this restaurant while we were staying at the Holiday Inn on Van Ness one weekend. I walked in and from there we were treated with outstanding customer service.  The prices of the steaks were more than I was used to paying, but I just jumped in head first and ordered a  Rib Eye steak.  When they brought the plate out it was sizzling from being broiled to 300 degrees!!! At first I looked at the steak and I still felt like I have overspent myself just for a dang steak. I took my first bite and then I took a sip of my perfectly mixed Mojito and I was in pure heaven.  Nice place with a romantic atmosphere, somewhere to go on a very special occasion if you want to pay 28 dollars and up for a piece of meat .  Not as good as The House Of Prime Rib, but still very satisfying.
author: Mecca H.

description:
Service can be VERY slow sometimes.  On two occasions, we waited over 1 hr after we ordered before our food arrived.  By that time, we already lost some of our appetite from the appetizer

The food can also be inconsistent.  Not sure what's going on.  Maybe they have inconsistent cooks or something.  First time I came in... I had a very good steak.  Unfortunately, that first experience seems to have been the peak.  The steaks on returning trips were just average and always never as good as my first experience.  Don't get me wrong, I love the steaks, just that with the price, I would expect them to be more than "average".
author: Joe W.

description: Been there a few times, once with friends and family and once with my girlfriend for her birthday. Both times, I was pretty impressed. The food was cooked well and service solid
author: James K.

description: Their steaks are good, but it definitely not the best. I like their sauteed mushrooms, its really good.
author: Nancy L.

description: This place is fabulas if your into steaks, and I mean top of the line ,mid western, corn fed beef.  The restraunt is very busy on the weekends and reservations are highly recommended.  I've been there about four to five time and not once have I ever been dissapointed.  The steaks with butter just melts in your mouth and brings you back for more.  The service is always 5 star and the drinks are very good. The menu is pricey but the atmospere is from busines to casual.  A good place for a high quailiity meal.
author: Tony C.

description: Not worth the wait for all the hype about their steaks when there are so many other places that serve better quality food.
author: Jenny A.

description:
Very good.  Pricey. 
Filet Mignon, Sauteed Mushrooms, Creamed Spinach
& mashed potatoes is all you need.........forget the salad.
We enjoyed the meal.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description:
Best place for a Filet in the SF.  Nicely buttered to perfection.

Don't mess around, order the Filet, A nice cab, Creamed Spinach, and end it with the Creme Brulee.

Great ambiance with the dark smoky woods, and the classic atmosphere.
author: Aditya P.

description:
This place gets a solid four in my book for a couple of reasons.  Most of the food was just excellent.  The service was fantastic, and the ambiance was similarly enjoyable.  

We started off with the scallops and shrimp.  Both were very tasty, and I would gladly order them again.

We had two porterhouses.  Mine was a hair overcooked, but still delicious.  I ordered the blue cheese crust on top, which was out of this world.

I also had a lobster tail with dinner, which was well cooked, lightly seasoned, and came with a bucket of butter.  It was awesome. 

The sides were mediocre at best.  We had the potatoes au grain and creamed spinach.  Both were of middling quality, and I would not order either again.

Desert was the bread pudding and some Irish coffee.  Both were outstanding, and usually I don't like bread pudding.  

I wanted to give it a 5, but the sides really were not very good.  I will go here again, but they will have to knock my socks off to change my mind.
author: Matt B.

description:
We went this past Friday night. (January 25, 2008). It is a beautiful restaurant, elegant and understated. We had the DAT, ordered three different entrees, we all thought everything was wonderful.  (Except, perhaps for the dessert, one of us had Key Lime pie which could not compare to the more traditional, less gelatin-like, original). 
The service is impeccable.  I had read somewhere that they charge $8 for water, but they didn't (simply say regular water which the waiter will offer amongst the other pricier choices). 
We had studied the DAT menus and felt that Ruth Chris and Asia de Cuba were by far the most forthright (they include items that you would choose if they were not DAT prices).  So we went to both and were very pleased, but we all liked Ruth Chris the best which is why I am writing this review. Also, we miraculously found street parking perhaps 50 ft up Van Ness from the restaurant. 
I think Ruth Chis would be a wonderful choice for regular dining if you can afford it, or if not, then for special occasions. The elegance of the rooms is wonderful. The steaks were terrific, the butter was fantastic. I thought the creamed spinach was to die for. We ordered a baked potato (not on the DAT) and it was excellent. (I wish I could buy potatoes like that, I have never found one that had that taste and texture, I wonder what grade they are, A++?)  The non-DAT prices were, I thought, very if not reasonable, then fair. Yes the Kobe steak is $70, but there are many other lower priced menu choices. The entire experience was memorable. I enthusiastically recommend this restaurant.
author: Jo G.

description:
Have been here a number of times with the boyfriend and friends for birthdays and just because. 

I love it.....delicious steak.....great service....and comfortable booths.....so bring lots of wine!
author: aislinn m.

description: Very good steak, but by no means the best in the city (personally, I like Bobos).  But it's a chain, chain, chain.....  No chain can possibly get over 3 stars in my book, so consider this one highly rated.
author: Nick A.

description: This place is so expensive, but oh so good.  My husband and I ordered the porter house for two and it was soooooooo goooooodd.  It was cooked med and was perfect!  We also order the shrimp cocktail(excellent), the creamed spinach, garlic mashed potatoes and 2 desserts for my greedy self.  Everything we ordered and the service was perfect for an anniversary.
author: Susan W.

description:
I had the 12oz ribeye, mashed potatoes, and key lime pie for $32. The steak was quite good for the price, but somewhat thin.  Even the ribeye from costco is thicker.  In any case, you can't beat the Dine About Town special for this quality steak and fine dining ambiance.
I recommend an early reservation or one during the week as the Dine About Town special draws in large crowds.
author: Eric C.

description:
DAT is a great deal.  But let me tell you about my first experience at Ruth's Chris.....I was there last night and ordered the rib eye.  The menu read, "An outstanding example of USDA Prime at its best. Well marbled for peak flavor, deliciously juicy".  Oh baby, my mouth was watering.  I forgot to read the fine print that said,  "and sprinkled with the waiter's GIANT PUBE".  That's right I ate about half my steak when I discovered a 3 inch long PUBE on my rib eye.  Someone needs to get out of the '70s and start trimming their PUBES.  

Needless to say I didn't enjoy the rest of my dinner.  They gave me a free rib eye to try and make up for it.   Despite this nasty discovery, I really don't understand what all the fuss is about.  Buy yourself a nice cut of meat from your local butcher, cook it and drench it in butter.   Way cheaper than the $40+ they ask for at this place.  Salad and desert tasted like the crap you get at a cheap wedding.  San Francisco is known for it's fine dinning and Ruth's Chris shouldn't be part of that list.  

If you want a good deal for rib eye go to Maykadeh located in SF's North Beach.  $27 for some of the best steak you'll find in the city.  It's served with fries but I prefer to get it served with their rice.
author: J C.

description: The place to go in San Francisco...cooked on some metal pan with tasty butter. Truly brings out the flavor of the beef. Service is EXCELLENT with valet parking. GO GO GO GO!!!
author: jacqueline c.

description:
Good place great food but no fifth star due to it being way overpriced.
I had the ribeye and potato au gratin with cheesecake. Will recommend but will go only on a special occassion
author: Matthew M.

description:
I consider myself a tough critic but I always give each restaurant a fair chance to impress. If I go to a normal restaurant I do not expect high standards and I mark it accordingly. I knew that Ruth Chris was not of lower standards so I was expecting big things. Having been to this establishment across Asia, I was looking forward to the American style. When We arrived, the front of house failed to engage with us and told us to sit down and wait for our table. We were not asked if we would like a drink at the bar nor were our coats taken. We were then escorted 15 minutes later to a table that had not been properly prepared e.g there were still decorations from a birthday party left on the table. Their were three of us and the server removed the setting where my guest was seated and expected him to move over or move the setting to his place. The server was very friendly but it ended there. We got our menus and ordered the wine. As she poured the wine she spilt some on my guests side plate and instead of changing the plate, she wiped it off with a napkin from her pocket. That shocked us all. The wine was exceptional but overpriced. (Da Vinci, Chianti, Tuscany, Italy 2004).  

The appetizers were good. Two soups and the palm salads. Tasty and not too filling. We were interrupted many times by staff . Three or four times during the course is fine but that amount in the space of thirty minutes is excessive and annoying. We all ordered the prime filet. The food was placed on a tray beside our table and it waited for three servers to place the entrees on our table. It was a confusion on who's role it was to place the food on the table! The atmosphere was fair but for such a place, to see guys in tracksuits and hoodies was very off putting. In fine dining establishments their should be a dress code of at least a shirt and slacks. The steaks were very tender and the 500 degree Celsius plates were over the top. I do not like to burn myself on the plates after I have finished my meal by 10 minutes. (it slips the mind not to handle to plates). My plate was removed while my guests were eating. A big NO NO in my book. 

Their were smaller service mistakes but at this stage of the meal I felt to put them to the side as my expectations had been defeated. So I Went with the flow.  We had one dessert and 2 coffees . My guest recommended the creme brulee. The coffees were placed on the table while myself and guest went for a cigarette. The server told us that she would reheat them when we got back but she should never have served them while we were not at the table. The bill came to $250 and I left feeling unsatisfied. Good food, mediocre service, bad ambience.
author: Mark B.

description: The smell of butter fills the air as you her the sizzle throughout the dinning room. Service was great, cocktails good. Can't beat the steak. The kobe ribeye was outstanding as well as the filet. The mushrooms and potatoes were very good. Asparagus was a little overdone. Creme brulee was very good. I thought the chocolate cake dessert was just ok.
author: Phill and Molly O.

description:
Food: Certainly not up to my expectation. I asked for a medium, and they gave me a medium rare. So, they took it back to cook longer. I don't know if it's because of this or if that's really their quality they were serving us. 
Bev: I had some red wine, which wasn't good at all. I don't  even remember the name of it.
Service: Not excellent but fine. At least she was nice to take my steak back.
Ambiance: The whole atmosphere felt very relaxed and laid back. You'd definitely see a mix of 20s-70s. And, we got a corner seat! ha! they actually listened to what we asked. =)
author: Jessica W.

description: Expensive, yet I felt I got my monies worth.  Probably the best chain run expensive steak house out there.  Their steaks are huge and I mean huge.  Meats are cooked exactly how they are ordered so their cooks know how to gauge properly between well done and rare.  They use premium grades of beef for sure.  I would have to say that the seasoned parchment butter they plop on top of their steaks gives it the added kick of flavor that does indeed compliment nicely.  Service was good as to be expected in finer dining establishments  Parking on the other hand wasn't so great unless you decide to valet.  I will come back a second time when I find another $65.00 lying around in my pocket burning a hole.
author: Adam G.

description:
B: Although our friends raved about this place, I left with a less than stellar experience.  It started with the service, which I expected to be second-to-none for a steakhouse of this caliber.  I asked Marc to describe the difference between the cowboy rib eye and the standard rib eye.  I got a less than satisfactory "the cowboy is a little bigger, and more marbled" response.  Not exactly enough to sell me on paying $3 extra for the "bone-in" version, but my manhood dictated that I take the larger slab of meat so I would not lose face in front of S and my friends.  "Medium-rare" I state with confidence, knowing that a good steak cooked anymore is just having the flavor cooked out.  A couple of minutes after we submit our order, I hear someone from the next table over ask their waiter the difference between the two rib eyes.  I am dumbfounded as their waiter responds, "The standard rib eye is a 16 ounce cut, and the cowboy rib eye is 22 oz, but about 4 oz are bone, so you are really only getting two more ounces of meat."  I sulk for a little more until our food arrives, and I get a very large cut, with puddles of butter hiding in all of the crevices.  The meat itself was quite tasty until I get to the middle where I'm greeted by meat resembling the color of sashimi ahi.  Too proud to send back the undercooked meat I continue through my rib eye.  Overall a decent but not great steak.  The "mashed" side dish is nothing to write home about, and will not be ordered again.  The yam casserole side dish is fantastic and a must have.  Overall 3/5.

S: Best. Steak. Ever. You can cut this rib-eye with a spoon. The sweet potatoes delicious. I have to agree with B on the wait service and mashed potatoes, but overall this was great for me. I said afterwards that is was one the best meals ever, but I don't frequent steakhouses and realize that I don't have much to compare to.  BTW, B paid which is may be why I liked it so much more.
author: BandS ..

description: Once while reading an in-flight magazine article, I learned the story behind this restaurant's odd name. I'll impart said worthless trivia, since that's what I do best. Many years ago, some broad named Ruth bought an existing joint called Chris Steak House and promptly changed its name to Ruth's. The people stopped coming. She wisely re-incorporated the brand recognition factor by changing it again -- keeping the vain, possessive 'Ruth's,' since, after all, she spent a lot of dough on it, but tacked on the familiar 'Chris Steak House.' The customers not only came back ... it became even more popular. So there you have it. I had a hot date here last night and we enjoyed Dine About Town's prix fixe menu and were both rather impressed. It has an old school atmosphere, but a surprisingly un-stodgy vibe. Me thinks I am STILL full, which might explain why I was moo'ing in my sleep and dreaming about those desserts.
author: Gregor G.

description:
my friends and i decided to eat here for the first time. dine about town menu.. everyone was served a mixed green salad which was actually not that bad. way better than broadway prime's house salad. we also ordered the sizzling blue crab cakes which came out just as promised.. sizzling in butter. i though it was pretty good especially the fact that it was all chunks of crab meat. i ordered the 8 oz petite filet butterflied medium well and came out completely cooked and dry on the edges. i tried to slice everyone at my table a slice to taste and they all agreed it was way over cooked even for ordering well cooked. i decided to ask them for just medium since it  was too difficult to have it medium well since everyone has different expectations and most wouldve been okay with the cooked one is what our waiter said to us. my girlfriend thought it was a bit much with his story. yes it may have been our first time there but not our first time having steak or in some foreign country which they would probably say oh certain people dont even have steak to eat. i wouldnt have given that steak to my dog! but after replacing my steak with a medium cooked butterflied cut filet i was totally satisfied. it was just right and still sizzling hot that the butter on the plate attacked my girlfriend's arm haha. i enjoyed my steak with mashed potatoes nothing really special oh and i forgot to mention i had added a lobster tail to my meal :] mmm.. no complaints. ended with the choice of bread pudding or key lime pie. we all chosed bread pudding except one. so we all dug our forks into our guy friend's pie since he wasnt such a sweetheart to begin with and whoaaaa. good but wayyyyyyy tooooooo sweet. and for the bread pudding? our first time for that too but it was okay.. the sauce around the bread had a heavy alcohol taste.. i would assume rum but maybe whiskey? well overall it was A-Okay.

2009 dine about town dinner price $35
adding on a lobster tail $17
appetizer - sizzling blue crab cakes $5 per person [shared]
tax & tips = about $73 just for my meal
author: melanie t.

description: very goood! the place is very expensive and the steaks come solo, but they had this great special going on 39.99$ for a salad, steak and shrimp and desert!!! very goooood, but i still like Bob's steak house better... service was great!
author: Shauna P.

description: OMG! I have no idea why the bf and i waited so long to eat here. I had the fillet Mignon and let me tell you....that steak literally melted in my mouth. It was delicious. It was served on plate of sizzling butter. The steak was juice and there was absolutely no need for steak sauce because it was done right. But before the steaks we had the crab stiffed mushrooms for an appetizer and they were Delicious and buttery. For our sides we had the green beans, which we felt were a little salty but the sweet potato cassarole....OMG the best sweet potato casserole i had ever had. Normally I'm not a fan of sweet potato casserole because it's too sweet for me (which says a lot because I'm a sugar addict) but this one was perfect....it had a pecan crust which was fantastic. Next we come we decided to order two orders of the sweet potato casserole - one as a side and another as a dessert with ice cream.
author: Julie F.

description: The service alone gets 5 stars and that is not an understatement. Call me uncultured but I was dressed like a bum and they still treated me like a star. The steak had more butter than I am used to, even though I've been here numerous times (three times a week on my birthday). Still a solid steak that beats some of the more notable steakhouses in the City (I decline to mention names but I'm sure you can figure out which).
author: Ken L.

description: Had the Dine About Town dinner here on Saturday night, a steal at $31.95, considering that this place runs about $56. This place is bustling, with tourists and locals. First course was a choice of a steak house salad or caesar salad. I had the caesar, and my friend had the steak house. Service is amazingly polished. My friend left for the bathroom when they came by with the ground pepper, so when he returned, they appeared right then with the ground pepper for his salad. My caesar was very good. Main course was a choice of the 12 oz. ribeye, the 8 oz. petite filet, the stuffed chicken breast, or the market fish, which was sea bass. This being a steakhouse, why get anything else?! The regular ribeye on the full menu is 16 oz., and there is a larger filet on the full menu. If you compare prices and do the math to calculate the dollars per ounce, the petite filet is a better deal, as it is a more expensive cut of meat. It's also healthier, as it doesn't have the "well-marbled" tasty fat of the ribeye. I had the petite filet, which was oh so good. They marinate in salt and pepper and serve the steaks on 500 degree plates. You are offered a choice of no butter, regular amount of butter, or extra butter. I had no butter on mine. And you get a choice of sides: potato au gratin, or julienne fries, or baked potato. I had the baked potato, and you can have it topped with sour cream with chives, bacon, or butter. I asked and received a little container of just chives. For dessert there were 2 choices: key lime pie or bread pudding. The key lime pie was nice, but sweet, and too sweet for my friend, so if you don't like your desserts too sweet, the bread pudding would be a better choice. I would say that I still like Harris' better, but a good steak is a good steak.
author: Hao L.

description: i always love going to ruth chris however this time my only complaint was that my ribeye was more on the rough side and my string beans where very very salty.  other than that every else was fine and tasty.
author: Derrick l.

description: five stars for the service!!!!  as soon as I walked in, I was  greated and helped by really nice people...I dont know what it was about the service there, but it was sooooooooo great!!!....love the food too!
author: emma s.

description: I love Ruth Chris Steaks, The only steak house I like better than my own bbq steaks. Service is good, bar is good. I normally don't scruntinze the service too much as it's the food I care about, but the manager at this location comes across as a jerk.
author: David A.

description: So I took my date here last night, Valentine's Day. Well we were an hour late for our reservation but they were very nice about it and got us a table after a 30 minute wait. I've read several reviews about this place already so all I was thinking about was STEAK STEAK STEAK!!! Both me and my date was anxious for the main course because we are carnivores. When we were seated, Scott, came to serve us. Scott had to be one of the TOP DAWG servers there because he was very very helpful. He asked if it was out first time and did the whole explaining. Food came out really fast after we ordered. She had the special, which included salad, 11 oz filet, a side (mushrooms), and desert. I ordered the ahi-tuna (which was incredible) and the recommended Cowboy Ribeye... when it came out... it was like heaven! I'm not going to make this too long so if you want steak! this is the place... wine, champagne, and a warm apple crush tart... PERFECT! good service and good food, just what I expected from a 5* restaurant.
author: Stanley W.

description: Wow, looks like almost everyone and their mother have gone here for dine about town. Of course, I'm not an exception to that. So glad I opted for the 12 oz. instead of the petite filet because I was starrrrrrving! And the mashed potatoes? Oh my goodness, they literally melted in my mouth. The dessert is the only part that kept me from giving this a 5 star review. It said online that it was chocolate sin cake, but the actual menu at the restaurant had two different items. Turns out it was only offered at the beginning of DAT, and they didn't know there was going to be an extension. I was really looking forward to having my chocolate fix after dinner. But the key lime pie was pretty good, not too tart like others I've tried in the past. The wine I had prior to being seated was excellent, but I must get the mojito next time. You can't even tell there's alcohol in it, even though my friend and I watched the bartender make it. Yes, it's THAT good.
author: Rhia R.

description: definitely pricy, but definitely worthwhile. great drinks (try the big easy) and of course the steaks!! yum! the garlic mashed potatoes were a nice side, and the different coffees afterwards are great too. definitely awesome, even though it's a chain and i hate chains!
author: Irene F.

description: I expected more from such a renowned place.  Food was pretty good but service was not on point.  If I am going to spend $300 on dinner I expect excellent service.  Forgot food, could not get water to save my life.  Did not know much about wine when we asked.  Salad was fine.  Calamari was terrible.  Steak was cooked well, could have been seasoned better.  Their method is  butter on everything.  potatoes au gratin was excellent.  bread pudding was phenomenal.  cheesecake was good.  Overall it was not worth the money.
author: John B.

description: excellent steaks.  who doesn't like stuff broiled in butter?!  good sides.  free dessert for bdays.  (chocolate tort was one of the best i have ever had and i am a HUGE chocolate fan)
author: Bonnie K.

description: I know that dousing anything in butter makes it taste good, but I don't know if I want that much butter in my life.  In one sitting.  Unless I'm eating popcorn.   I went with a large party.  Made the rezzies two weeks in advance for a dozen people.  Didn't change it so they knew how many people we would be.  But still, we were placed in the middle of the room in the middle of the way constantly getting bummed into.  The waitress must have been a spurn, forgotten lover of one of the people at the table; no other way to explain the instant distain she showered us with.  She stood at one end of the table and ran over the specials in a voice loud enough to carry two people in, at the speed of a well rehearsed  auctioneer.  When we asked if she could repeat it for the other side of the table we were showered with yet more distain and given a quicker version.  The steak was HUGE and a good cut.  It had obviously been double  dipped in a vat of butter.  The sides were expensive, huge and boring.  At some point a younger, hotter, more friendly waitress started helping Hateful Helga, and the cocktails kicked in, so we all relaxed and had a good, if not bumped into meal. It still had a bit of a "Get In, Get It In, Get Out" feel though.  When we ordered after dinner cocktails they were practically thrown at us as they made it clear that our hours rent on their little piece of paradise was up and we should take our doggie bags of butter and go home. I've been several times, this was just the most recent, and obviously the last.  The food is always good and huge, but you can get better steaks ESPECIALLY at this price at several places in San Francisco without feeling like you're a walking wallet.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description: This Ruth's Chris location is not worth it.  I went to the one in New York ages ago, and I remember the food to be delicious and the service- classy and professional.  The San Francisco location is not the same.  Although we had reservations for 8pm on a Tuesday, we weren't seated until about 8:30pm.  The hostess would repeatedly ask people "D'you wanna wait over there?" Instead of something like "Would you like to have a drink in our bar while you wait?"  I guess I'm being a little too picky, but for over $100 per person for a meal, I'd like to be treated as I would at an upscale restaurant, not a taco stand.  Our server was ok and the food was good, but not great.  The pasta w/cheese was too salty to eat.  And the most annoying thing was that I called to confirm that I was coming to celebrate a birthday (after already checking the "Birthday Celebration" box on the online reservation form), and they kindly confirmed on the phone.  I have no idea why they even ask because they didn't bring us a birthday dessert, or even offer to put a candle on the dessert we ordered.  I would've asked, but at that point, I just wanted to doggy-bag-it outta there.  Not worth the $200 for 2 people.
author: Jules P.

description: Very, very, very good steak!  The service was wonderful and the ambience was great.  You just can't be watching your wallet here.  You need to accept that the prices are going to be ridiculously high and then just sit back and enjoy your dinner.  I recommend sharing the side dishes with someone because the portions for the sides are quite large and meant to be shared.
author: Helen V.

description: I was looking forward to a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner and instead was completely disappointed.  I had large filet (cooked medium) and what I was served  was a over-charred petit file.  It was the worst filet I have ever had in my life, that thing should have never made it out of the kitchen.  I could have used it for a hockey puck.  The side of asparagus was also over-steamed and limp and the hollandaise sauce had the consistency of syrup.  Just  an absolute waste of time and $100.00.  I will never go here again.  This place shouldn't be allowed to be called a steakhouse.  I have had a better filet at Outback - go there and save $60.00 on your dinner.  I have eaten at many steakhouses for more and less money than this place; this is the all time worst for me.  They should be ashamed for what they serve.
author: James R.

description: The food are very delicious but expensive, so I always choose to go when there is a promotion of the 3-course dinner for $34.99. The salad is ok but the filet is excellent and I like the shrimp with garlic mash potato so much. the key lime pie is not that sour and not that sweet just about the right taste.
author: angel w.

description: Delicious food and excellent service. I took my bf here for his bday and it was both our 1st time to dine here. They close at 10p and I was running 15 minutes late for a 9:30p reservation-I called ahead of time and Alex said "not a problem-we'll wait for you!"-thanks Alex. Jasmine was our server and she was just so great-she let us know everything about the menu, her honest opinions about certain appetizers, dishes & desserts. I'm a ribeye steak girl so I got the clasic ribeye-oh mi god..it was a good size...about 16 oz and I couldn't finish it.....I also got the potatoes w/ cheese thingy (I can't pronounce it's fancy schmancy name) and it was to-die-for. Our dessert was the banana caramelized pudding and it was great-not to heavy-it was perfect. My boyfriend and I enjoyed his bday there....we were one of the last to leave and everyone was so nice-I didn't feel as though staff wanted us to leave!
author: Dessa R.

description: Get this!  I have eaten their food many times but never in their restaurant.  I order it to go!  Here is the drill:  I call my wife at home and have her cook a couple baked potato's and make a salad. Then I call and order the Ribeye steak to go from Ruth Chris, it costs about $30.  You  have to secure it with a credit card.  I leave work and park in there passenger loading zone, I run in and pick up the steak!  Lickety split I am home, cut the steak in half and both my wife and I pig out!!  Only $30.
author: Roby R.
