description: if my doctor told me that eating steak every week would be healthy...id move over to pacific heights & make it a ritual to eat here hahaha....again i said a milion times & one...pricing is not an issue when i feel its worth it~$45 to $50 a steak not includin the sidesters....ive had the new yorker & t bone here....i think the reason why this steak is soooo lovely is due to the butter & marination....the shroom/asparagus sides are a must...this review is for the ruth chris in walnut creek & down in irvine also.....
author: elmer d.

description: This is the third time I've gone here and I have to say this play has gone down hill in my opinion. Went here on a Friday night. .. our appetizer plates sat on the table as if I was at Chilis, so did the salad plates....but that wasn't the worst thing, that would have been fine if the food was edible. When I say edilbe I mean served at an edible temperature...I scalded my lip on the first bite...hot oil (butter) from the steak dripped on my lip! Then I let the meat sit for a few minutes then scalded my tongue on the meat????? Have you ever heard of such a thing??? When I say scalding, I mean scalding.  .. . the creamed spinach was luke warm and the au gratin potatoes were mostly cheese with a few potatoes?? WTH, this is inexcusable for a steak house of this perceived caliber. Closing the book on this chapter. . .. would rather try Town in San Carlos that people are raving about. Ruth Chris. .. . your reputation is undeserved.
author: Colleen H.

description:
Went to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse last night for Dine-About-Town.   I made reservation and arrived a few minutes early.   We were greeted with a friendly smile by the host and were seated within seconds.
Our waitress was welcoming and polite.  She offered the Dine-About-Town menu right away.   My boyfriend, PP, ordered from that menu while I got the Summer Classics for $39.95.  I had the tomato & crap soup as appetizer and it was just delicious and tasty.   PP had the salad and it was like any salad.  For Entrée, I had the 6-ounce medallion filet topped with jumbo shrimp.  My filet was tender and cooked just right.   The shrimp, however, was not all that.  PP had the 12 oz. Ribeye with au poivre sauce & the bleu cheese crust on the side.   He thought it was fantastic.   The ribeye itself was already yummy, but with the au poivre sauce, it was much better.   We didn't care too much for the bleu cheese crust with the steak though.  It was actually good pairing with the red wine though.  
The food was superior and our waitress was lovely.  She was attentive and delightful.   Dinner was just great and we had a wonderful time.
author: Maggie L.

description: Food was good, but not memorable. As fellow yelper said, my poor steak was drowning in the butter. The service was memorable in a bad way. I arrive at 7:00 and the hostess informed me that my group will be seated once everyone arrives. Totally understandable since my reservation was at 7:30. By 7:30 my group was ready to be seated, the hostess informed us that in a moment we would be seated. At 8:00 we still were not seated. We asked again and they finally seated us at 8:15, in the middle of the dining room, when we specifically requested in our reservation for  a booth seat. We noticed a booth next to us which was empty and requested to be seated in that booth. The hostess said sure just give us a second to clean up and you can have that booth, we waited out at the front only to discover that they gave the booth to another group and we didn't get seated until 8:30. The minute our waiter saw we were ordering from the Dine About Town Menu became distant and gave us the bare minimum service. We saw the table next to us who ordered from the "regular menu" got way better service.
author: Erica B.

description: I'm a fan of Ruth's Chris, but who wants butter on their steak?  That's like a double cow.
author: Rick R.

description: i ordered the cowboy steak medium rare and what do you know, it came out medium rare.  and surprisingly stayed medium rare even though the plate was apparently 1000F+ degrees.  i couldn't finish the last 5 bites or so but i had already consumed all the marbled fat around the edges so i don't have any regrets.  garlic mashed and the broc au gratin were a perfect complement to the meaty meatness.  we shared a bottle of cab off the recommended list...it was delicious and tasty and perfect with our meat.  we ended our meal with a molten chocolate cake with gooey chocolate mousse and caramel.  yeah.  i left happy and stupid full...or is it stupid happy and full...
author: Adela K.

description: Came here with my bf for the DAT menu and did not need to wait long to get seated. We both ordered the exact same thing except for the sides. I didn't want to get the 8oz petit filet because I like a lot of food lol. We both ordered the 12oz rib eye with the mashed potato and creamed spinach sides. The salad that we got was pretty good but  nothing special. The star of the night was the buttery steak! The plate was hot and sizzling with butter! I love butter so much! The rib eye was medium rare and not overcooked just the way I like it. I finished the whole thing and I wasn't even that hungry to begin with. The sides were just ok in my opinion. The mashed potatoes were better than the creamed spinach. The creamed spinach was just lacking in flavor and I probably won't order that next time. We both ordered the bread pudding for dessert. It was REALLY good... the whiskey sauce went so well with the bread. Oh and we didn't even have to share the dessert. I saw in some earlier reviews about how two people had to share a dessert. I will come again but probably not in a while. Great for fans of butter!
author: Shu L.

description: There was absolutely no parking anywhere near here, thank goodness for the valet parking. I came here with my bf for Dine About Town during this past February. It was a good deal, about $32 per person for a 3 course prixe fix menu (appetizer,  main course, and dessert). We made reservations through the Dine About Town web site and waited about 10 minutes before we got seated. Despite the crowd that was already there, everyone was brought to their tables relatively quickly. We both had the house salad for the appetizer, nothing special here. We both chose filets with mashed potatoes and creamed spinach for our main course. The portions of filet seemed pretty small, maybe b/c it was for dine about town (half the price, half the portion?). The meat was really tender and delicious, but I wished I had some A1 sauce (which I dared not to ask unless i wanted to be laughed at for this superb piece steak that is originally $60) I'm a saucey kinda girl, surprisingly this steak did not need any extra flavor. I loved the creamed spinach and the mash b/c they were very flavorful. The key lime pie and bread pudding were good as well, but I felt too full to finish everything. Service was wonderful, I think the manager stopped by our table to ask us how everything was. It's okay, maybe I'll come by again IF there is another Dine About Town deal!
author: Tracy T.

description: Sorry--can't give it 5 stars. In a place this big, with a nationwide presence and very high reputation, when you order a ribeye, you should get a ribeye--not a NY Strip.  That's what happened to me in December when I took the BF there for his birthday.  I love the quality of the steaks but their overall attention to our visit was pretty low. I told them ahead of time it was a birthday and we had show tickets, so seating and serving had to be prompt--but they stuck with their normal stately pace, and they screwed up in the most basic way--brought me the wrong menu item.  We didn't have time to wait for a new steak, so I had to eat my least favorite cut of steak at a premium price. To me a NY Strip is like a big loaf of dense brown bread. I didn't feel like putting a cloud over the birthday celebration by going all Krakatoa on them, so it was kind of a bummer.  We left feeling like we'd have been happier somewhere else, but I still have to recognize my overall Ruth's Chris experience with 4 stars.
author: Kevin S.

description: There are not many down points to a meal at Ruth's Chris.  Valet parking is on the spot.  We made a reservation, drove up and handed off our car to total young strangers, walked in and announced our presence, waited in the bar area for 15 minutes and went to dine.  Staff was friendly and knowledgable about the food and beverage.  The average patron is about 40 and either wears khakis with a blue blazer or an anassuming coordinates set with mature accessories.  The food is fantastic.  The steaks are nicely cut and cooked to order, the sides are good - I suggest the pecan sweet potato casserole, creme brulee dessert and have your steak Oscar Style (topped with a crabcake, 3 asparagus and hollandaise sauce).  Wine list is nice - we went with a white, Evolution No. 9 blend.  It wasn't right for our steak, but who cares?  If you can afford to eat here, you don't really have to follow the rules.
author: Jessica M.

description: Very much a more traditional restaurant with the decor and dress of employees. That said the food was fantastic. Known for its steaks, I ate the rib eye whilst my other half had a Filet. All on the Dine about town menu. The Rib Eye was good but really the Filet was fantastic. Melt in the mouth steak full of flavour. Good service but the wine list is a little prohibitive for those on a tighter budget.
author: Alexander W.

description: The steak is heavenly amazing, it was perfectly cooked. I had the 12oz Ribeye and finished it in couple minutes... that was how good the steak was. I asked for Medium Rare, usually the outer area of the meat are overcook but not at Ruth's!! it was medium rare throughout the whole piece...speechless. The parking was hard to find but it's SF so I didn't expect much. The service was good, felt like VIP. I would definitely come back!!
author: chris c.

description: i thought i was at foot locker, the fillet tasted like timberland boots, sides are good service good.... but i like nike's better....
author: Alex C.

description: went here because friends wanted an old school steak place.  i guess there are other places that would've fit the bill but it was the closest one at the time!  their secret is BUTTER.  the steaks are swimming in butter but you can have the extra butter on the side on the already drenched in butter steak.  it does taste good.  they also have a deal on some plate that had a steak, some chicken, and a crab cake and this is what my friends got.   like most steak places -the servings are huge.  even petite is XXL!  service was quick.
author: X X.

description: We went here for our 3rd wedding anniversary.  Most of what we had at this steak house was great  - from the bread and butter to the steak fillet to the dessert.  The diner salad was great with mixed greens with just the right amount of dressing.  The appetizer we had was New orleans style shrimp which I would gladly get again.  My steak fillet was cooked perfectly medium and was very juicy and delicious.  My side dish was a creamed spinach and my husband enjyed the side of braised mushrooms.  The only think I wasn't a complete fan of was one of the desserts.  The fruit with cream was really good, but the chocolate mousse wasn't great.  I'm usually a big chocolate fan but this dessert was kind of off.  Overall this place is expensive but I think it's worth going for a special occasion.
author: Ziva A.

description: I went here for Dine About Town.  First time at SF location.  They seated us at the only window view table for two, too bad there's no view =).  We had the house salad for appetizer, it was ok.  We both ordered the ribeye and found the quality of the meat to be very good and prepared well, the hot plates kept the meat hot throughout the meal.  The sides - creamed spinach and mashed potatoes - we didn't like so much.  For dessert, I had the key lime pie, and my bf had the NO bread pudding, both ok, nothing special.  Wine was good, got a half bottle of pinor noir, priced second from the bottom.  Good service.  Good experience overall.
author: Susan Y.

description: We made a reservation for two and it wasn't a busy night. We got there and the table we had were set for 4 people, the server took the other 2 and I thought it was very impolite. The ambience is good for family dining, cozy and warm but its not a good place for lovers who want a more romantic setting, I suggest if you want to really impress somebody on a first date bring her to El Paseo or Chez Spencer.  The steaks are served a la carte on a sizzling plate but the flavor  is a big build up to a boring finish, nothing special. We ordered the seared ahi tuna to start with and we thought it was great, the sauce has wasabi that enhanced the flavor. I was really craving for steak that night and my friend suggested this place since its really popular for "great steaks" so for my main course I ordered the Ribeye and my friend had the filet mignon but when I finally took a bite I was very let down, it was the first time I had such a boring steak, I asked for med-rare but it was too rare, it was late and we were the last customer to arrive so I didn't feel like complaining, I took it home and fed it to my dog. On the brighter side, they have good wine selection and they have a generous serving for desserts. I recommend the creme brule
author: Mimosa B.

description: Had the fillet, it was good....not perfect...but good, and the small size was still pretty generous, actually other people in the party got the larger size fillets and I don't think there was a big difference.  Had the french onion soup...it was pretty thick I like mine more light (all the onions and the cheese and the bread add to the bulk, I don't need a bulky broth as well!)  I have been to numerous Ruth's Chris (Seattle, Hong Kong, Cancun, etc) it is always a place where you can count on a decent steak and friendly service.  I in general try to stay away from the chain steak houses....for better meat go across the street to Harris or HOPR!  The chocolate volcano was great and the server was terrific! it was also way way to bright for a steahouse...set the mood a little and dim the lights.  Also when I am paying a lot for steak, I do not want to see anyone in shorts or jeans....even in san francisco, step it up a little please.
author: Jessica G.

description: Happy Birthday to me! haha, I had this place on my birthday.. yes it was GREAT! I had a reservation for 10 and they had me seated once I had gotten to the place. The service was great, the waitress that we had was super nice as well. Stupid me... I had the Chicken instead of having steak like what everyone else got. The chicken was so tender and juicy so it was all good. I loved the sides that they offered as well, I got the mashed potatoes and the mushrooms, man were they delicious! When dessert came around, I had the Cheesecake, melts in your mouth! The waitress brought the Cheesecake out with a candle for me since it was my birthday... haha and it was free suprisingly. Overall I would come back to enjoy steak again. The parking was not so great, it had valet, but sadly, I really don't trust valets so I had to look for parking on Van Ness and was it an adventure looking for. Took me about 45+ minutes. So it was not good! But overall GREAT PLACE. GREAT ATMOSTPHERE as well.
author: Johnny T.

description: tender, juicy steak....food was delicious and service was okay. for appetizer we had the crab cakes, it was delicious but small portion and pricey. i definitely would love to come back for their steak!
author: Ruchell F.

description: Ruth's Chris did not hit the mark. I ordered the porter house for two, and it was prepared incorrectly. due to the untimely fashion that my steak arrived I did not send it back. There were 2 servers, one who we had originally, and the other who decided to help out, this added great confusion to our orders. I do not know if this was on purpose or if it was accidental, but for $100 just for the steak, I would expect someone to get an order right. Our bill was close to $250, for that price I would have rather gone to Harris' and have $100 left over.
author: Dave W.

description: For the price I feel a bit cheated.  I do like the meat but they are trying to pass of good meat as great meat by drowning it in butter.  The waiter described the meat as buttery. DUH! it swims in butter.  The sides were ok but I really liked their bread pudding for dessert!  The service was good and I liked my waiter.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go here but I wouldn't complain if someone else suggests going.
author: Jae L.

description: I have to say that I usually hate chain restaurants but the steak here is excellent, the service is good and wine list is extensive.  Definitely check it out for dine about town - it is well worth the $32.  Something about a sizzling piece of meat, smothered in butter that will make you want to come back for more...mmm..mmm   Although, outside of dine about town, I prefer the steak at Harris' over Ruth's Chris.
author: L V.

description: Very mediocre steak. They add flavor to the steak by putting a lot of butter on the steak. When the steak arrived drenched in butter, I wanted to take a napkin and pat down the steak to remove all the butter. The waitress even asked if we wanted more butter. The potato side was good but steak was what I went there for. The best steak I have ever had is still Peter Luger's in Brooklyn. Ruth's Chris is not really worth the money.
author: mark s.

description: with a gift certificate in tow, me and the bf ventured in to exactly what we were expecting.  a typical steakhouse in grave need of a remodel, not to mention new carpeting.  asthetics aside, we were greated and seated right on time, great service throughout.  While waiting and starving in the bar, we had the pleasure of watching a few signature dishes walk by.  oh were we in trouble.  a chopped salad (fab), scalloped potatoes (mediocre), and the porterhouse for two (incredible!), we rolled out of there quite pleased.  sure you're gonna get the tourists/kids on their way to prom mix in there, but who doesn't love a slab of beef swimming in sizzling hot butter!
author: e w.

description: My boyfriend and I had heard some pretty good reviews on this place so we decided to check it out during their promotional "Summer Celebration for 2 at $89 per couple".  Right when we walked in, I was engulfed with the smell of butter.  It immediately made me wonder how much butter they use on all their dishes.  I ordered the fish special which was pretty good, but was drenched in butter (surprise!).  My bf had the rib eye, which he was very happy with.  The service was mediocre.  Probably won't go back.
author: Monique C.

description: Once again, another example of great steaks, but the question of value is the issue. Hands down, a top-notched steak provider. Wonderful sides and service. Does this justify a price tag of about $75 per person? This is the ONLY reason that Ruth Chris' (and other top restaurants) receive less than 5 stars.
author: Michael S.

description: We went here on the Dine about Town menu and thought it was great, especially for the value.  The service was great - our waitress was very knowledgable about the wine list, food was excellent and we were seated quickly.  Overall great experience!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I love the ribeye and the filet mignon.  It just melts in your mouth.  I once was on a health kick, and told them no butter on my filet...still good, but the sizzling butter would have been heaven.  When they have Dine-about-town, I go here because it is such a good deal!
author: Ian L.

description:
parking - street tough,  valet it

atmosphere- clean, traditional wood and leather, nice

food - steak with too much butter, most were very good in our group but I had a bunch of gristle,  side orders(one tomato, some asparagus, a bunch of mushrooms) all were small amounts and  were a joke,   good food but not worth it

best thing was the cheese cake dessert

service - very good
author: daniel s.

description: Don't go to steak houses often but when I do it's Ruth's.  I've tried all of the cuts my friends have ordered and they are great. Still, I always take the veal chop. BYOB!
author: Jeff B.

description: i'm so happy i went yesterday!  this was definitely a great deal!  i've been here before but their dine about town menu is something to talk about.  i wouldn't recommend it if i haven't gone yesterday because they are pretty pricey.  the menu featured a simple salad, dressing of your choice, second course offered a 12 oz rib eye or a 6 oz petite filet, or chicken, and the third course offered key lime pie or bread pudding.  after we placed our order and began munching on our greens, the other server was explaining the dine about town menu to the table next to us and we heard her say that the portions are 1/3 of their regular portions...my sister and i looked at eachother and was surprised...anyways, nothing to worry about.  next thing you know...2 sizzling hot plates come up from behind...the portions were perfect!  the best part was that the meal included one side...either spinach or mashed potato.  i recall that all the sides are separate.  we couldn't believe that we both finished our meats.  it was really yummy.  and we almost forgot that we still had dessert.  we both had the bread pudding and it was yummy yummy.  perfect sweetness and flavor.  our server was real nice and polite.  actually everyone in the restaurant were.  the total bill:  $70ish.  i hope they keep the menu for next years dine about town cuz i would go again!    the only thing that i didn't like was how everything smelled like butter...they used butter for everything.  it was a little scary.  by the end f the night my sister and i couldn't take the butter smell anymore.
author: D W.

description:
ive heard rave reviews abt this place.  my cousin loves it.  my brother says when its DAT, he and his gf eat here once a week.  so when we saw their summer special, bf and i had to try it out.  it did not live up to expectations.  at.  all.

again, we had the summer special.  $89 for choice of soup or salad each, choice of entree from select few each, choice of 2 sides to share, and 1 dessert to share.  bf had seafood gumbo, he liked it a lot.  i though it was ok.  i had the caesar.  overdressed and too creamy for me.  for entree, i had the petite filet 9 oz.  bf had the mixed grill which included a 4 oz fillet, piece of chicken and 1 crabcake.  for the sides we chose steamed broccoli and potatoes au gratin.  when the food got to the table, all we could smell was BUTTER.  everything was soaked in butter.  the filet was not cooked well.  there was no carmelized coating.  it seemed to just have been baked in the oven.  i asked for medium rare, it came out medium, pink all the way thru.  i was so truly disappointed.  i thought this place was known for their steak.  the chicken was the best out of all the entrees.  it was crispy and moist.  the crabcake was very fishy.  i dunno what they put in there to make it so fishy.  the broccoli was steamed so long it was mushy.  nothing worse than mushy broccoli.  and the potatoes au gratin were in a bath of butter and cream with melted cheese on top.  i dunno how people can eat like this very often, i could feel my arteries clogging.  for a good meal, i could pack on a few pounds no problem.  but for a most unsatisfying meal, it was not worth the calories.  at.  all.  dessert was bread pudding.  it had little chunks of apples, raisins and you could taste the whiskey.  it was pretty good, it's the only thing we finished.  

for the food, we would definitely not come here again.  you would have to drag me kicking and screaming.  and that is saying A LOT.
author: brie alyson s.

description: this is by far the best steak house i have been to. the service was great. the filet is my favorite but if you like a little fat on your meat then the ribeye is the way to go.
author: cuong l.

description: service is great and the filet mignon melts in your mouth! and the calamari is tangy and spectacular!
author: Chelsey L.

description: The steaks, sides, key lime dessert, and the service are excellent. My hubby loves this steakhouse so for his birthday we made the reservations 3 weeks prior.  I would have given 4 stars but the rude host was a sure disappointment. He told everyone with reservations that it would be 15 minutes but in reality it was really 45 minutes to an hour wait. Why lie to the customers? Then on top of it, why be rude to the customers? At one point, someone asked him to provide a more realistic number, he said rudely and loudly, "Would 30 minutes be better for you, lady?" Another party mentioned that they had already waited for 45 minutes, so obviously 30 minutes was still a lie. Regardless of the shady host, the service and the food were excellent. But that didn't stop my hubby from saying, "We'll go to Harris next time." Apparently Harris is just as good and down the street from Ruth's Chris. Note for R.C.: Reservations did our party no good. It will be a wait. Hopefully Harris treats their customers better.
author: Seymour S.

description: i love me some buttered steak, i mean how can you ever not praise peter luegers, but ruth's chris sf left much to be desired. the meat wasn't all too tendered, and the rest of the meal was average which falls way short of the expectations of the price.
author: John L.

description: Made the mistake of taking my carnivore hubby to this place for his b-day a few months ago as it was okay years ago (last visit was probably over 10 years ago).   Ordered the calamari as a starter.  It was okay.  Lightly battered on the outside, but a bit slimy on the inside.  My petite filet was undercooked slightly as I wanted it well done since I was still nursing our baby, and it was more like medium so I ended up only eating the outside of it.  My husband's steak was extremely  undercooked inside and burnt all over the outside.  He ordered medium and he got rare.  You would think that a steak house would be able to cook a steak perfectly, made to order after serving mainly nothing but steaks, but I guess not this place.   The sides were also nothing to rave about.  We had scalloped potatoes which were a bit too cheesy and soggy and the wedges which were huge greasy suckers.  Nothing looked elegant in terms of the food or presentation.  The food was very poor in my opinion as I've eaten at way better steak houses over the years.  This one is at the very bottom sitting side by side with Outback Steakhouse (crap).  Top prices for poor meat and cooking techniques.  My husband actually threw up after we left the restaurant since all he could taste was a burnt flavor in his mouth.  The dinner cost slightly over $200 for the two of us which included probably five beers.  The waiter was friendly and attentive so no complaints there, but the food is really not up to par at all.  The only reason my husband didn't send his steak back is due to his fear that they mite pull a road trip (chef throws the french toast down his pants and re-serves to customer).  Go elsewhere if u really like steak.  Harris down the street is way better then this if you're going to spend the money.  I can't believe they're still in business serving food this way.  The one star is for the service.  Never going back....ever!
author: Kiki W.

description: time and time again i've been impressed with them and they have never let me down.  what more can be said when your steak comes out sizzling on a plate full of melted butter!  i also one of the best customer service experiences at this restaurant.  i had gotten the filet and ordered it medium rare (how else would you order it??).  when i got it it came out medium well but i didn't say anything cuz i didn't want to make a scene so i ate about half of it.  when my friends i was with noticed it and asked how i ordered it.  i said in a really low voice that it was overcooked but that it's fine and then as if out of nowhere a waiter shows up and was like i hear a steak is overcooked!  i was like "yeah mine is but it's ok i've eaten half of it already".  the waiter said no we're giving you another one no matter what and then took away my plate and brought out an incredibly juicy and succulent filet that was cooked perfectly!  i know steakhouses should do this but it's always nice to know that they will actually do it.
author: Swarup B.

description: We came here last night for dinner for Valentine's Day. We made reservations for 7:15 three months ago, but unfortunately it was SOOO packed that we had to wait about an hour even with our reservations. I'm guessing its because it was Valentine's Day that they were so busy. When we were finally seated, I ordered a filet mignon and Jan ordered a t-bone steak and for our sides we ordered creamed spinach and potatoes au gratin. They serve their steaks sizzling ass hot and when we took our first bite, it literally melted in our mouths. Our steaks were super juicy and tender while our sides were very tasty. Mm... everything was SOOO good. The service here is good because our waiter kept checking up on us and our waters would always be refilled when it went half full just as it should. This place would've been given 5 stars if it weren't for the wait. We'll definitely be coming back again for dinner.
author: Jan And Daph S.

description: on friday i had my birthday dinner here with my family. i have always wanted to try it and excited to come here. i have heard my great things about the steak and boy were people right. i had the petite fillet and shrimp oscar style(comes with a crab cake and asparagus). It was so yummy!! i ate everything on my plate. i also ordered the potatoes au gratin. couldn't have done without it though since i had so much food on my plate already and also trying everyone else's steak. The steak was nice and tender and with just enough flavor. The shrimp was cooked cajun style. it had a little bit of spice which was perfect. the crab cake was sooo good. i took a bite of the rib eye , t- bone, and cowboy steak. they were all so good. nice time i come here, i wanna have the rib-eye. great place for tasty steak. OMG, almost forgot to mention dessert. even though we were all so full, we had to try the dessert and it was so worth it. we had the creme brulee and banana creme pie. the banana creme pie was so good. i tried the creme brulee and it was pretty good and i don't even like creme brulee. It didn't taste too eggy. we also had the cheese cake and it was nice of them to give it compimentary for my birthday.  in the beginning i though it was kinda weird because it was sour but once you get to the inside it is very good.
author: Connie C.

description: mhmmm.. i had the cowboy ribeye, but the only thing i remember is the caramelized banana cream pie.. it was very very good. very pricey place though.
author: Michael N.

description: I have always loved this restaurant, one of my favorite.  I even took my team here and spent thousands of dollars for a celebration party.  So what happened recently really pissed me off that I have to leave them a bad review.  During recent months the seating of people who made reservations has been terrible.  The wait is at least 30 minutes if you have a reservation.  The worse part was during my last visit, I was told it would be "just a minute" when I first got there.  I asked the host how long exactly would that be, he said it was more like 10 minutes.  We ended waiting for 50 minutes.  WTF?  Alright, to be fair, the food was good even when my lobster wasn't cooked all the way through, I like sashimi so that didn't bother me.  This is the part that pushed me off the edge.. i got home, saw that I was charged for an additional bottle of San Pellegrino, the dollar was minor but since I don't get free bottle of Pelligrino from Ruth's Chris, why should I pay for what I didn't get, right?  Wrote them and email explaining the mistake they made on my check, two weeks later, still no response!  WTF?!  Additional charge on my check was a mistake; ignoring the mistake is plain criminal, stealing from a customer!  Shame on you.  This is how a corporation starts failing by ignoring their customers and stealing from their customers.  I hope we all as consumers or investors are smarter to not engage business with a corporation who commits crime.
author: Hawk E.

description: This was my 2nd trip to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and my first on Dine About Town.  The first experience was better because we were gifted with a $50 card thanks to a friend; it was nice because it cushioned the blow, but I still didn't like the overpriced drinks and having to pay extra for every little thing.  We spent quite a bit and didn't even have any appetizers nor dessert/coffee.    But the steaks were good as I recall and I even left with some goodies and bones from the cowboy ribeye.  But, this most recent visit, I didn't come away feeling like I had a great meal, even for the price.  Even though the DAT was $32/pp, for that money you'd expect a pretty good meal and experience considering this is a "high end" and special occasion restaurant.   We arrived early at 5:30 in advance of our reservations; bar was nearly full so we opted to go ahead and eat earlier.  We were escorted to a table which was in the middle of a seating of 4-5 tables-for-2 very close to one another.   I wasn't happy with this so I asked if we could be moved to an available booth which was accommodated (once I asked).  I didn't get a good vibe from our server (lady) shortly thereafter and esp. after I had to ask for the DAT menu.  I also requested that the wine list for examination.  Their wine list is extremely overpriced!  A glass costs at least 4x the cost of a retail bottle of the wine.   The cabernet sauvignon by the glass I ordered I later found out is about $10/bottle and that's retail.  Outrageous markup!  I ordered a petite filet, side of spinach and the dessert, which was bread pudding.  My hubby ordered the same, but with key lime pie for dessert.  The starter was an unimpressive mixed green salad with balsamic vineagrette.  I can do this at home for like less than a dollar.  I liked the warm bread and butter, though.   The filet mignons, at 6 ozs., were decent.  We both ordered ours medium rare and seems like mine was more medium in parts.  I like butter alot but I agree they over-saturate theirs to the point that it's maybe too much. Hubby liked it though so I gave  him with the remainder of mine which was probably 1/3 which I didn't want to eat anymore of.  It was OK but definitely not as juicy and tender as I expected.  Sides were decent (spinach),  but I have to say I make a better creamed spinach using my own recipe and they give you less in terms of quantity on this special DAT menu.   For the money, I could probably replicate the meal for far less $$$ at home.  For dessert, the waitress then accidentally spilled the contents of my water glass on my dessert and all over the table and into my lap.  Not a huge problem since it's just water, but it was a blight on my experience and while she apologized a few times and replaced the dessert, she could've done more and shown better professionalism.  I didn't think she exuded genuine friendliness...more like perfunctory service, although the busboys/other service staff were good.  It got almost too intrusive at times with servers interrupting your dinner conversation by removing plates and clearing the table.  I guess your experience has much to do with the service you receive.  A manager came around towards the end asking if we were all happy but it seemed somewhat impersonal and we were too polite to say otherwise .  For my money, I'd much rather go to the House of Prime RIb for a special occasion.  Have never been disappointed there and at least I feel I get my money's worth considering their dinners include a huge (great) salad and all the sides, with an extra helping if you're up to it.  And the overall atmosphere just seems more casual and friendly.  At Ruth's Chris, it seems to be all about the $$$.
author: Mimi L.
